hebrew_text: מתני׳ שמאי אומר כל הנשים דיין שעתן הלל אומר מפקידה לפקידה ואפילו לימים הרבה
human_translation: says: all women their time is sufficient. Hillel says: From examination [ mipekida ] to examination, and even several days
llm_translation: Mishnah: Shammai says, "All women are fit for judgment." Hillel says, "From one appointed time to another appointed time, and even for many days."

hebrew_text: וחכ"א לא כדברי זה ולא כדברי זה אלא מעת לעת ממעטת על יד מפקידה לפקידה ומפקידה לפקידה ממעטת על יד מעת לעת
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: neither in accordance with the statement of this nor in accordance with the statement of that rather, period reduces from examination to examination. And from examination to examination reduces from period.
llm_translation: And the sages of blessed memory did not agree with this one or with that one, but rather, from time to time, she diminishes from one trustee to another trustee, and from one trustee to another trustee she diminishes from time to time.

hebrew_text: כל אשה שיש לה וסת דיה שעתה והמשמשת בעדים הרי זו כפקידה וממעטת על יד מעת לעת ועל יד מפקידה לפקידה
human_translation: any woman who has a fixed cycle [ veset ], her time is sufficient, And who engages in intercourse while examination cloths [ be’edim ] is like that of an examination, and it reduces from period, and from examination to examination.
llm_translation: Every woman who has a veset (menstrual cycle) at this time, and she who examines witnesses, behold, she is like a supervisor, and she diminishes from time to time, and from supervisor to supervisor.

hebrew_text: כיצד דיה שעתה היתה יושבת במטה ועסוקה בטהרות ופרשה וראתה היא טמאה והן טהורות
human_translation: Her time is sufficient, how so? was sitting in the bed and engaged in ritually pure items, and she left and saw she is ritually impure and are ritually pure.
llm_translation: How is it? Diah now she was sitting on a bed and occupied with purity and a Torah portion, and she saw herself as impure, yet they are pure.

hebrew_text: אע"פ שאמרו מטמאה מעת לעת אינה מונה אלא משעה שראתה
human_translation: Although said transmits ritual impurity for period, counts only from the moment that she saw
llm_translation: Although they said "it renders impure from time to time," it only counts from the moment she saw.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי טעמיה דשמאי קסבר העמד אשה על חזקתה ואשה בחזקת טהורה עומדת והלל כי אמר העמד דבר על חזקתו היכא דלית ליה ריעותא מגופיה אבל איתתא
human_translation: What is the reason of Shammai? holds Establish woman in her presumptive status, and a woman remains with the presumptive status of ritually pure. And Hillel? when states Establish an item in its presumptive status, where there is no weakening of itself. But a woman,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for Shammai? He holds that if a woman stands on her presumption, and a woman stands on the presumption of purity. And Hillel, when he said, "If he stands on his presumption," where he has no support from his own body, but a woman...

hebrew_text: כיון דמגופה קחזיא לא אמרינן אוקמה אחזקתה
human_translation: since to see from her body we do not say: Establish her in her presumptive status
llm_translation: Since her body is seen, we do not say, "Let her claim be established."

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא ממקוה דתנן מקוה שנמדד ונמצא חסר כל טהרות שנעשו על גביו למפרע בין בר"ה בין ברה"י טמאות
human_translation: And what is different from a ritual bath? As we learned a ritual bath which was measured and found lacking all pure items that had been rendered in it, retroactive whether in the private domain or in the public domain, are impure.
llm_translation: And what is different about a mikveh? As we learned in a Mishnah: A mikveh that was measured and found lacking in any of the purities that were performed upon it, whether on Rosh Hashanah or on the eve of Yom Kippur, they are impure.

hebrew_text: לשמאי קשיא למפרע
human_translation: According to Shammai, a difficulty from retroactive
llm_translation: To Shammai is difficult to reconcile with Mafraya.

hebrew_text: להלל קשיא ודאי דאילו מעת לעת שבנדה תולין לא אוכלין ולא שורפין ואילו הכא טומאה ודאי
human_translation: According to Hillel, a difficulty certainty, whereas period of a menstruating woman, suspended, neither eat nor burn Whereas here, definitely impure.
llm_translation: Hillel difficult indeed for if from time to time in a state of impurity they hang, not eat and not burn, but here impurity indeed.

hebrew_text: התם משום דאיכא למימר העמד טמא על חזקתו ואימא לא טבל אדרבה העמד מקוה על חזקתו ואימא לא חסר הרי חסר לפניך
human_translation: There, since it can be said: Establish impure in its presumptive status and say it was not immersed. On the contrary, establish the ritual bath in its presumptive state and say that was not lacking is lacking before you,
llm_translation: There, because there is to say, "He stood impure on his presumption," and say, "He did not immerse." On the contrary, "He stood the ritual bath on his presumption," and say, "He did not lack." Behold, he did not lack before you.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי הרי דם לפניך השתא הוא דחזאי הכא נמי השתא הוא דחסר
human_translation: Here too, blood before you, it is now that she saw Here too, it is now that became lacking
llm_translation: Here too, behold, blood before you now, it is the one that is seen. Here too, now, it is the one that is lacking.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם איכא למימר חסר ואתא חסר ואתא הכא מי איכא למימר חזאי ואתא חזאי ואתא ומאי קושיא דלמא הגס הגס חזיתיה
human_translation: How can be compared? There, it can be said continuously diminishing. here, can it be said continuously seeing And what is the difficulty? perhaps she saw bit [ hagas ] by bit.
llm_translation: So now, there it can be said: lacking, and he came lacking, and he came. But here, can it be said: seeing, and he came seeing, and he came. And what is the difficulty? Perhaps he saw it coarsely.

hebrew_text: התם איכא תרתי לריעותא הכא איכא חדא לריעותא
human_translation: There, there are two that weaken Here, there is one that weakens
llm_translation: There, there are two for the neighbors; here, there is one for the neighbors.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא מחבית דתנן היה בודק את החבית להיות מפריש עליה תרומה והולך ואח"כ נמצא חומץ כל ג' ימים (הראשונים) ודאי
human_translation: And what is different of a barrel? As it is taught would inspect a barrel to continually separate teruma from it, and afterward were found vinegar, all of the first three days definitely
llm_translation: And what is different about a barrel? As we learned in a Mishnah: If one was inspecting a barrel to separate terumah upon it, and afterwards vinegar was found in it every three (initial) days, certainly.

hebrew_text: מכאן ואילך ספק קשיא לשמאי
human_translation: From that forward, uncertain a difficulty for Shammai,
llm_translation: From here and onwards, it is a difficult question for Shammai.

hebrew_text: התם משום דאיכא למימר העמד טבל על חזקתו ואימר לא נתקן אדרבה העמד יין על חזקתו ואימר לא החמיץ
human_translation: There, since it can be said: Establish the untithed produce in its presumptive status, and say not amended, On the contrary, establish the wine in its presumptive status, and say not turned to vinegar.
llm_translation: There, because there is to say, "He stood the tevel on its strength," and he said, "It is not fixed." On the contrary, "He stood the wine on its strength," and he said, "It did not ferment."

hebrew_text: הרי החמיץ לפניך הכא נמי הרי דם לפניך השתא הוא דחזאי התם נמי השתא הוא דהחמיץ
human_translation: it is turned to vinegar before you, Here too, blood before you, it is now that she saw There too, it is now that it turned to vinegar,
llm_translation: Behold, he has leavened before you. Here too, behold, blood before you. Now, just as there it is also now that he has leavened.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם איכא למימר החמיץ ואתא החמיץ ואתא הכא מי איכא למימר חזאי ואתא חזאי ואתא ומאי קושיא דלמא הגס הגס חזיתיה
human_translation: How can be compared? There, it can be said continuously turning to vinegar. can it be said continuously seeing And what is the difficulty? perhaps she saw bit by bit.
llm_translation: So now, there it can be said: he leavened, and he came leavened, and he came. But here, can it be said: he saw, and he came, and he came. And what is the difficulty? Perhaps he saw it coarse, coarse.

hebrew_text: התם איכא תרתי לריעותא הכא איכא חדא לריעותא
human_translation: There, two that weaken Here, there is one that weakens
llm_translation: There, there are two for the neighbors; here, there is one for the neighbors.

hebrew_text: ורמי חבית אמקוה מאי שנא הכא ודאי ומ"ש הכא ספק
human_translation: And raises a contradiction between barrel of ritual bath: What is different here, definitely and what is different there, uncertain
llm_translation: And Rami bar Hama asked: What is the difference here? Certainly! And why does it say here "safek"?

hebrew_text: א"ר חנינא מסורא מאן תנא חבית ר"ש היא דלגבי מקוה נמי ספקא משוי ליה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina of Sura says: Who taught barrel? It is Rabbi Shimon, who, with regard to a ritual bath also considers it uncertainty,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina of Sepphoris said: Who is the Tanna that taught the ruling of a barrel? It is Rabbi Shimon, for in the case of a mikveh as well, it is a doubtful matter that he has established.

hebrew_text: דתנן מקוה שנמדד ונמצא חסר כל הטהרות שנעשו על גביו למפרע בין בר"ה בין ברה"י טמאות
human_translation: As we learned a ritual bath which was measured and found lacking all pure items that had been rendered in it, retroactive whether in the private domain or in the public domain, are impure.
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: A ritual bath (mikveh) that was measured and found lacking, all the purifications that were performed in it, whether on Rosh Hashanah or on the eve of Yom Kippur, are deemed impure.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר בר"ה טהורות ברה"י תולין
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: in the public domain, pure. in a private domain, suspended,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "On Rosh Hashanah, the daughters of Israel are suspended."

hebrew_text: ושניהם לא למדוה אלא מסוטה
human_translation: And both derived only from a woman suspected by her husband of having been unfaithful [ sota ],
llm_translation: And both of them did not learn it except from Sotah.

hebrew_text: רבנן סברי כי סוטה מה סוטה ספק היא ועשאוה כודאי הכא נמי ספק ועשאוה כודאי
human_translation: The Rabbis hold: like a sota . Just as a sota uncertain she and rendered her like definitely here too, uncertain and rendered it as definitely
llm_translation: The sages hold: Just as in the case of a Sotah, where there is uncertainty and yet she is made to drink, so too here, there is uncertainty and yet it is done properly.

hebrew_text: אי מסוטה אימא כי סוטה מה סוטה ברה"ר טהור הכא נמי ברה"ר טהור
human_translation: If from a sota , say like sota Just as a sota in a public domain pure, here too, in a public domain pure.
llm_translation: If from a Sotah, say: Just as a Sotah in a public domain is pure, here too in a public domain is pure.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם משום סתירה הוא וסתירה ברה"ר ליכא הכא משום חסר הוא מה לי חסר ברה"ר מה לי חסר ברה"י
human_translation: How can be compared? There, due to seclusion And seclusion in the public domain is not here, is due to lack what to me lacking in a public domain lacking in a private domain?
llm_translation: So now there, because of contradiction it is, and contradiction in a public domain is not, here, because of deficiency it is. What do I need deficiency in a public domain? What do I need deficiency in a private domain?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא הא כל ספק טומאה ברה"ר טהור כיון דאיכא תרתי לריעותא כודאי טומאה דמי
human_translation: And if you would say any uncertainty impurity in a public domain ritually pure, Since there are two that weaken considered as definite impurity.
llm_translation: And if you will say, "Is it that every doubt of impurity in a public domain is pure, since there are two reasons for leniency, it is considered like impurity."

hebrew_text: ורבי שמעון סבר כי סוטה מה סוטה ברה"ר טהור הכא נמי ברה"ר טהור
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon holds: like a sota . Just as a sota in a public domain pure, here too, in a public domain pure.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon holds: Just as a Sotah in a public place is pure, so too here in a public place is pure.

hebrew_text: אי מסוטה אימא כי סוטה מה סוטה ברה"י טמאה ודאי הכא נמי ברה"י טמאה ודאי
human_translation: If from a sota , say like sota Just as a sota in a private domain definitely impure, here too, in a private domain definitely impure.
llm_translation: If from a Sotah, say: Just as a Sotah from the Torah is definitely impure, here too, from the Torah, she is definitely impure.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם יש רגלים לדבר שהרי קינא לה ונסתרה הכא מאי רגלים לדבר איכא
human_translation: How can be compared? There, there is a basis for the matter. as issued a warning to her and she secluded here, what basis for the matter is there?
llm_translation: So now, there, there are legs to the matter, for behold, it is jealous of her, and it is hidden. Here, what are legs to the matter? There are.

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא היינו טעמא דרבי שמעון גמר סוף טומאה מתחלת טומאה
human_translation: And if you wish, say this is reason of Rabbi Shimon: derives the end of impurity from the beginning of impurity,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This is the reason of Rabbi Shimon: The end of impurity is from the beginning of impurity.

hebrew_text: מה תחלת טומאה ספק נגע ספק לא נגע ברה"ר טהור אף סוף טומאה ספק טבל ספק לא טבל ברה"ר טהור
human_translation: Just as beginning of impurity, uncertainty whether or not came into contact in the public domain pure; so too end of impurity, uncertainty whether or not immersed in the public domain, pure.
llm_translation: What is the beginning of impurity? Uncertain if touched, uncertain if not touched, in a public domain - pure. So too, the end of impurity? Uncertain if immersed, uncertain if not immersed, in a public domain - pure.

hebrew_text: ורבנן הכי השתא התם גברא בחזקת טהרה קאי מספקא לא מחתינן ליה לטומאה הכא גברא בחזקת טומאה קאי מספקא לא מפקינן ליה מטומאתו
human_translation: And the Rabbis How can be compared? There, the man remains with the presumptive status ritual purity. we do not lower his ritual impurity due to uncertainty. Here, the man has the presumptive status ritual impurity. we do not remove him his of ritual impurity due to uncertainty.
llm_translation: The Rabbis thus said: Now there, a man stands in a presumption of purity, we do not push him towards impurity. Here, a man stands in a presumption of impurity, we do not remove him from his impurity.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא ממבוי דתנן השרץ שנמצא במבוי מטמא למפרע עד שיאמר בדקתי את המבוי הזה ולא היה בו שרץ או עד שעת הכיבוד
human_translation: what is different from an alleyway? As we learned a creeping animal that is found in an alleyway, renders ritually impure retroactively to that say: I examined this alleyway and there was no a creeping animal in it, or until the time of the sweeping
llm_translation: And what is different about a mavoi? For we learned: The sheretz that is found in a mavoi renders it impure retroactively until one says, "I have checked this mavoi and there was no sheretz in it," or until the time of inspection.

hebrew_text: התם נמי כיון דאיכא שרצים דגופיה ושרצים דאתו מעלמא כתרתי לריעותא דמי

llm_translation: And there are stains, let us say, we learned: Stains that are not like Shammai. Abaye said: Shammai concedes regarding stains, what is the reason? The bird did not engage in the marketplace of butchers, so this blood, from where did it come?

hebrew_text: אי בעית אימא היינו טעמיה דשמאי דאם איתא דהוה דם מעיקרא הוה אתי והלל כותלי בית הרחם העמידוהו ושמאי כותלי בית הרחם לא מוקמי דם
human_translation: Or if you wish, say this is the reason of Shammai: as, if it is so that there was blood it would have come at the outset, And Hillel, walls of the womb, held back And Shammai walls of the womb do not hold back blood.

There is no difference between them regarding these ritual baths. There is a difference between them regarding these alleyways.

human_translation: According to Rava, there is packed cloth,

human_translation: taught in accordance with this version, that if it is so, that there was blood it would have come at the outset: Hillel said to Shammai: Don’t you concede of a basket was used ritually pure in corner, and a creeping animal was found in a different corner that the initially ritually pure impure? Shammai said to him: Indeed,

hebrew_text: רבא אמר טעמא דשמאי משום בטול פריה ורביה תניא נמי הכי אמר לו שמאי להלל א"כ בטלת בנות ישראל מפריה ורביה
human_translation: Rava says: reason for Shammai due to the dereliction of be fruitful and multiply. that this is also taught Shammai said to Hillel: If so, you have caused the Jewish women to be derelict in be fruitful and multiply.
llm_translation: Rava said: The reason of Shammai is because of the nullification of its fruit and offspring. It was also taught in a Baraita likewise: Shammai said to Hillel, "If so, you have nullified the daughters of Israel from their fruit and offspring."

hebrew_text: ומאן דתני האי לישנא הא תניא כי האיך לישנא דאם איתא דהוה דם מעיקרא הוה אתי התם הלל הוא דקטעי הוא סבר טעמא דשמאי דאם איתא דהוה דם מעיקרא הוה אתי וקא מקשי ליה קופה
human_translation: But the one who taught this version, Isn’t it taught in in accordance with that version, that if it is so, that there was blood it would have come at the outset? it is Hillel who erred. He thought reason Shammai that if it is so, that there was blood it would have come at the outset. And he raises a difficulty basket.
llm_translation: And who taught this? This was taught: When it comes to this matter, if it is so that it was blood from the outset, Hillel came there and he is the one who cut it off. He holds the reasoning of Shammai, that if it is so that it was blood from the outset, it would have come. And he raises an objection against him.

hebrew_text: ואמר ליה שמאי טעמא דידי משום בטול פריה ורביה ולמאי דקטעית נמי דקמקשית קופה לזו יש לה שולים ולזו אין לה שולים
human_translation: And Shammai said to My reasoning due to the dereliction of be fruitful and multiply. But even according to your erroneous that you to raise a difficulty basket, This has a base, but that has no base.
llm_translation: And Shammai said to him, "The reason for my opinion is because of the loss of its fruit and offspring. And for what reason did you cut it? Also, because it is similar to a basket. For this one has handles, and for this one does not have handles."

hebrew_text: ולמאן דתני האי לישנא הא תניא כי האיך לישנא משום בטול פריה ורביה
human_translation: And according to the one teaches this version, isn’t it taught in accordance with that version, due to the dereliction of be fruitful and multiply?
llm_translation: And according to the one who teaches this, it was taught in a Baraita: "For how can one be negligent in the matter of 'be fruitful and multiply'?"

hebrew_text: הכי קאמר ליה הלל לשמאי אין טעמא קאמרת דאם איתא דהוה דם מעיקרא הוה אתי ומיהו עשה סייג לדבריך דמאי שנא מכל התורה כולה דעבדינן סייג
human_translation: this Hillel is saying to Shammai: Yes, reason you say that if it is so, that there was blood it would have come at the outset. Nevertheless, enact a safeguard for your statement as what is different from the rest of the entire Torah, where enact safeguards?
llm_translation: So said Hillel to Shammai: "The reason you stated is that if it were so that blood was initially permitted, it would come. Nevertheless, make a fence for your words. Why is it different from all the Torah, where we make a fence?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה א"כ בטלת בנות ישראל מפריה ורביה והלל מפריה ורביה מי קאמינא לטהרות הוא דקאמינא
human_translation: said to If so, you have caused the Jewish women to be derelict in be fruitful and multiply. And Hillel did I say from be fruitful and multiply? I said that ritually pure
llm_translation: He said to him, "If so, you are annulling the commandment of 'Be fruitful and multiply' for the daughters of Israel, and Hillel annulls the commandment of 'Be fruitful and multiply.' Is this what I am saying for purification?"

hebrew_text: ושמאי לטהרות נמי לא דאם כן לבו נוקפו ופורש
human_translation: And Shammai even ritually pure not that if so, heart strike him and he separate
llm_translation: Shammai for purifications also not for if so his heart were pierced and he withdrew

hebrew_text: (שולי"ם בדוקי"ן מכוסי"ן בזוי"ת סימ"ן) איתמר קופה שנשתמשו בה טהרות בזוית זו ונמצא שרץ בזוית אחרת חזקיה אמר טהרות הראשונות טהורות רבי יוחנן אמר טהרות הראשונות טמאות והא (בית) שמאי והלל מודו בקופה דטהרות הראשונות טמאות
human_translation: a mnemonic A base; examined; covered; in a corner. was stated: a basket was used ritually pure in corner and a creeping animal was found in a different corner Ḥizkiyya says: initially ritually pure pure. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: initially ritually pure impure. But Shammai and Hillel agree in basket that initially pure impure?
llm_translation: The edges are checked, the hidden things are covered with disgrace. It was stated: A basket that pure items were used in one corner and a creeping creature was found in another corner. Hezekiah said: The initial pure items are pure. Rabbi Yohanan said: The initial pure items are impure. And Beit Shammai and Hillel agree that in a basket where the initial pure items are impure.

hebrew_text: כי מודו שמאי והלל בקופה שיש לה שולים כי פליגי חזקיה ורבי יוחנן בקופה שאין לה שולים
human_translation: When Shammai and Hillel agree With regard to a basket that has a base. When Ḥizkiyya and Rabbi Yoḥanan disagree, with regard to a basket that has no base,
llm_translation: For Shammai and Hillel agree regarding a basket that has handles, for they dispute Hezekiah and Rabbi Yochanan regarding a basket that does not have handles.

hebrew_text: אין לה שולים מ"ט דר' יוחנן אין לה שולים ויש לה אוגנים
human_translation: has no base, what is the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan has no base but it have rim.
llm_translation: There are no teeth for her. What is the reason for Rabbi Yochanan? She has no teeth, but she has gums.

hebrew_text: והתניא המדלה עשרה דליים מים בזה אחר זה ונמצא שרץ באחד מהן הוא טמא וכולן טהורין ואמר ריש לקיש משום רבי ינאי לא שנו אלא שאין לה אוגנים אבל יש לה אוגנים כולן טמאין
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one who draws ten pails of water one after another, and a creeping animal is found in one of them, that is ritually impure but all of them pure. And Reish Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Yannai: taught only where has no rim. But has a rim, all of impure,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One who pours water from one vessel to another, ten times, and a creeping creature is found in one of them, it is impure, while all of them are pure. And Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: They only taught this when it does not have rims, but if it has rims, all of them are impure.

hebrew_text: לימא חזקיה לית ליה דר' ינאי מיא שרקי פירי לא שרקי
human_translation: Shall we say Ḥizkiyya, not agree of Rabbi Yannai? Water is slippery, produce is not slippery.
llm_translation: Let Hezekiah say: "Rabbi Yannai does not have water, only fruits."

hebrew_text: אי נמי מיא לא קפיד עלייהו פירי קפיד עלייהו
human_translation: water, one is not particular about it, produce one is particular about it,
llm_translation: If also water not care for them, fruit care for them.

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא כי מודו שמאי והלל בקופה שאינה בדוקה
human_translation: And if you wish, say: When Shammai and Hillel agree? In a basket that was not examined.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "For Shammai and Hillel concede regarding a barrel that is not checked."

hebrew_text: כי פליגי חזקיה ור' יוחנן בקופה בדוקה מר סבר הא בדקה ומר סבר אימור עם סילוק ידו נפל
human_translation: When Ḥizkiyya and Rabbi Yoḥanan disagree, with regard to a basket examined. Sage, holds since was examined And Sage, holds say when he removed his hand fell
llm_translation: When Hezekiah and Rabbi Yochanan disputed regarding a fine sieve, Master holds that it is considered a sieve, and Master holds that it is considered a utensil when his hand is removed.

hebrew_text: והא דומיא דאשה קתני ואשה בדוקה היא כיון דשכיחי בה דמים כשאינה בדוקה דמיא
human_translation: But isn’t taught similar to woman? And a woman is examined, Since blood is commonly found her, considered as not examined.
llm_translation: And this that it is similar to a woman, it teaches, and a scrutinizing woman it is, since it is common in her blood, when she is not scrutinizing, it is similar.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא כי מודו שמאי והלל בקופה שאינה מכוסה כי פליגי חזקיה ורבי יוחנן בקופה מכוסה מכוסה היכי נפל כגון שתשמישה ע"י כסוי
human_translation: And if you wish, say: When Shammai and Hillel agree, with regard to a basket that is not covered. When Ḥizkiyya and Rabbi Yoḥanan disagree? With regard to a basket covered. is covered, how did fall For example, if is used by lid.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that Shammai and Hillel agree regarding an uncovered basket, for they argue as Hezekiah and Rabbi Yochanan regarding a covered basket - how did it fall? Such as when its use is through covering.

hebrew_text: והא דומיא דאשה קתני ואשה מכוסה היא כיון דשכיחי בה דמים כשאין מכוסה דמיא
human_translation: isn’t taught similar to woman? And is considered covered, Since blood is commonly found her, considered as not covered.
llm_translation: And this that it is similar to a woman, it teaches, and a woman who is covered, since it is common in her blood when she is not covered, it is similar.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא כי מודו שמאי והלל בזוית קופה כי פליגי חזקיה ורבי יוחנן בזוית בית והא קופה קאמר
human_translation: And if you wish, say: When Shammai and Hillel agree? in corner a basket. when Ḥizkiyya and Rabbi Yoḥanan disagree, in corner a house. But states a basket.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that Shammai and Hillel agree in the case of a corner of a roof, for they dispute in the case of a corner of a house, and the term "corner" refers to a roof.

hebrew_text: ה"ק קופה שנשתמשו בה טהרות בזוית בית זו וטלטלוה בזוית אחרת ונמצא שרץ בזוית אחרת חזקיה סבר לא מחזקינן טומאה ממקום למקום ורבי יוחנן סבר מחזקינן
human_translation: this is saying: a basket that was used ritually pure in this corner house, and it was carried to another corner, and a creeping animal was found in other corner, Ḥizkiyya holds: we do not presume ritual impurity from place to place. And Rabbi Yoḥanan holds: we presume
llm_translation: The Sage said: A box that was used for pure items in one corner of a house, and they moved it to another corner, and a creeping creature was found in the other corner. Hezekiah holds the opinion that we do not establish impurity from one place to another, and Rabbi Yochanan holds the opinion that we do establish impurity.

hebrew_text: ומי מחזקינן והתנן נגע באחד בלילה ואינו יודע אם חי אם מת ולמחר השכים ומצאו מת ר"מ מטהר
human_translation: And do we presume But didn’t we learn touched one at night, and he does not know whether alive or dead, and on the following day he arose and found him dead, Rabbi Meir deems him pure.
llm_translation: And who do we strengthen? And we learned in a Mishnah: If one touched someone at night and does not know if he is alive or dead, and the next day he wakes up and finds him dead, Rabbi Meir declares him pure.

hebrew_text: וחכמים מטמאין שכל הטמאות כשעת מציאתן
human_translation: And the Rabbis deem him impure, as all impure at the time they were discovered.
llm_translation: And the sages render impure all impurities as at the time of their discovery.

hebrew_text: ותני עלה כשעת מציאתן ובמקום מציאתן
human_translation: And it is taught with regard to at the time they were discovered, but in the place they were discovered.
llm_translation: And it was taught: "It is as the time of their finding, and in the place of their finding."

hebrew_text: וכי תימא הני מילי לשרוף אבל לתלות תלינן ומי תלינן
human_translation: And if you would say This statement, to burn but to suspend we suspend Do we suspend
llm_translation: And if you say, these matters are for burning, but for hanging we require hanging, do we indeed require hanging?

hebrew_text: והתנן מחט שנמצאת מלאה חלודה או שבורה טהורה שכל הטמאות כשעת מציאתן ואמאי לימא האי מעיקרא מחט מעלייתא היא והשתא הוא דהעלה חלודה
human_translation: But didn’t we learn needle that is found full of rust or broken, pure, as all impurity, at the time they were discovered? But why Let us say initially, this needle was a proper, needle, and it is now that rust formed
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: A needle that is found full of rust or broken is pure, as all impurities are like their time of discovery. And why should one say that this is from the outset a needle? And now it is that it has become rusted.

hebrew_text: ועוד תנן מצא שרץ שרוף על גבי הזיתים וכן מטלית המהומהם טהור שכל הטמאות כשעת מציאתן
human_translation: And furthermore, we learned found a burned creeping animal on top of olives, and similarly a tattered rag pure. that all impurity, at the time they were discovered.
llm_translation: And furthermore, we learned in a Mishnah: If one found a creeping creature burnt on top of olives, and similarly, a cloth of Samaritans, it is pure, as all impure items are like their time of discovery.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא כשעת מציאתן בין לקולא בין לחומרא ובמקום מציאתן אבל שלא במקום מציאתן משרף לא שרפינן מתלא תלינן
human_translation: And if you would say at the time they were discovered, whether to a leniency, and whether to a stringency, but place they were discovered, But not the place they were discovered, we do not burn we hold it in suspension.
llm_translation: And if you will say, at the time of their discovery, whether for leniency or for stringency, and in the place of their discovery. But if not in the place of their discovery, we do not burn, we suspend.

hebrew_text: והתנן ככר ע"ג הדף ומדף טמא מונח תחתיו אע"פ שאם נפלה א"א אלא א"כ נגעה טהורה שאני אומר אדם טהור נכנס לשם ונטלה
human_translation: But didn’t we learn a loaf on top a shelf, and an item of light impurity, lying underneath it, Even though that if fell impossible other than touch pure. that I say a ritually pure man entered there and took it
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah on the top of the page: "And if a clean loaf is placed on top of a contaminated one, even though if it falls, it cannot become contaminated, unless a clean one touches it. For I say, a clean person enters there and takes it."

hebrew_text: עד שיאמר ברי לי שלא נכנס אדם שם וא"ר אלעזר לא נצרכה אלא למקום מדרון
human_translation: unless someone says: It is clear to me that no person entered And Rabbi Elazar says: necessary only when an inclined surface.
llm_translation: Until he says "it is clear to me that no one entered there." And Rabbi Elazar said, it was only necessary for a place of residence.

hebrew_text: התם כדקתני טעמא
human_translation: there, as teaches reason
llm_translation: There, as it was taught: the reason.

hebrew_text: שאני אומר אדם טהור נכנס לשם ונטלה
human_translation: that I say a ritually pure man entered there and took it
llm_translation: I say, a person pure enters there and takes it.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי נימא עורב אתא ושדא אדם דבכונה אמרינן עורב דשלא בכונה לא אמרינן
human_translation: Here, too, let us say a raven, came and threw a person, who with intent, we say a raven, which not with intent, we not say
llm_translation: Here too, it was stated: A raven came and brought a human hand. With regard to a raven, when it comes to unintentional actions, we do not say it is impure.

hebrew_text: מכדי האי ככר ספק טומאה ברה"י הוא וכל ספק טומאה ברה"י ספקה טמא משום דהוי דבר שאין בו דעת לישאל וכל דבר שאין בו דעת לישאל בין ברה"ר בין ברשות היחיד ספקו טהור
human_translation: Now this loaf is uncertain impurity in a private domain, and any uncertainty impurity in a private domain uncertain impure. as is an entity that lacks consciousness to be asked, and any entity that lacks consciousness to be asked, whether in a public domain or in a private domain, uncertain pure.
llm_translation: From this case of a loaf, where there is doubt regarding ritual impurity, it is a doubt in a public domain, and any doubt in a public domain, its doubt is impure because it is a matter that does not have the capacity to be inquired about. And any matter that does not have the capacity to be inquired about, whether in a public domain or in a private domain, its doubt is pure.

hebrew_text: ואב"א הכא בטומאה דרבנן דיקא נמי דקתני מדף כדכתיב (ויקרא כו:לו) עלה נדף
human_translation: And if you wish, say here with ritual impurity by rabbinic law. is also precise, as it teaches: madaf which is written: “A driven leaf [ niddaf ]”
llm_translation: And Abaye here in ritual impurity of Rabbinic origin, it is also precise as it was taught on the page as it is written (Leviticus 26:36) "And those of you who are left will waste away in their iniquity in your enemies' lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers shall they waste away with them."

hebrew_text: וחכ"א לא כדברי זה כו' ת"ר וחכ"א לא כדברי זה ולא כדברי זה לא כדברי שמאי שלא עשה סייג לדבריו ולא כדברי הלל שהפריז על מדותיו
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: neither in accordance with the statement of this The Sages taught And the Rabbis say: neither in accordance with the statement of this nor in accordance with that not accordance with the statement of Shammai, as he did not enact safeguard for his statement. And not in accordance with the statement of Hillel, as went beyond [ hifriz ] his bounds
llm_translation: And the sages of the academy of Hillel do not agree with this, etc. The Sages taught: And the sages of the academy of Hillel do not agree with this, and not with this, not like the words of Shammai who did not make a fence for his words, and not like the words of Hillel who was lenient with his measures.

hebrew_text: אלא מעת לעת ממעטת על יד מפקידה לפקידה ומפקידה לפקידה ממעטת על יד מעת לעת
human_translation: Rather, period reduces from examination to examination, And from examination to examination reduces from period,
llm_translation: Rather, from time to time she diminishes from one deposit to another deposit, and from one deposit to another deposit she diminishes from time to time.

hebrew_text: מעת לעת ממעטת על יד מפקידה לפקידה כיצד בדקה עצמה באחד בשבת ומצאת טהורה וישבה שני ושלישי ולא בדקה ולרביעי בדקה ומצאה טמאה אין אומרים תטמא מפקידה לפקידה אלא מעת לעת
human_translation: period reduces from examination to examination, how so? examined herself on Sunday and found ritually pure, and she sat Monday and Tuesday and did not examine And on Wednesday she examined herself and found impure. we do not say she should be impure from examination until examination. Rather, for period.
llm_translation: From time to time, she diminishes from one inspection to another inspection. How so? If she examined herself on the first day of the week and found herself pure, and she sat on the second and third days, and did not examine herself, and on the fourth day she examined herself and found herself impure, we do not say, "Become impure from one inspection to another inspection," but rather "from time to time."

hebrew_text: ומפקידה לפקידה ממעטת על יד מעת לעת כיצד בדקה עצמה בשעה ראשונה ומצאת טהורה וישבה לה שניה ושלישית ולא בדקה ולרביעית בדקה ומצאה טמאה אין אומרים תטמא מעת לעת אלא מפקידה לפקידה
human_translation: from examination to examination reduces from period, how so? examined herself the first hour and found ritually pure, and she sat second and third and did not examine And at the fourth she examined herself and found impure. we do not say she should be impure for period. Rather, from examination until examination,
llm_translation: And from deposit to deposit she diminishes gradually, from time to time. How so? She examined herself in the first hour and found herself pure, and she sat for the second and third hours without examining, and in the fourth hour she examined and found herself impure. We do not say, "Become impure from time to time," but rather from deposit to deposit.

hebrew_text: פשיטא כיון דבדקה עצמה בשעה ראשונה ומצאת טהורה לא מטמינן לה מעת לעת איידי דתנא מעל"ע ממעטת על יד מפקידה לפקידה תנא נמי מפקידה לפקידה ממעטת על יד מעת לעת
human_translation: obvious. Since she examined herself at the first hour and found pure, no to render her impure for period. period reduces from examination to examination, also taught from examination to examination reduces from period,
llm_translation: It is obvious, since she examined herself in the first hour and found herself pure, we do not hide from her from time to time, because the Mishnah teaches: "From the time of the onset of the period, she diminishes from one inspection to another." The Tanna also teaches: "She diminishes from one inspection to another from time to time."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה מאי טעמייהו דרבנן אשה מרגשת בעצמה א"ל אביי אם כן תהא דיה שעתה ורבה לחדודי לאביי הוא דבעי אלא מאי טעמייהו דרבנן
human_translation: Rabba says: What reason of the Rabbis? A woman sense within herself Abaye said to If so, her time should be sufficient, And Rabba wanted to hone Abaye. But what reason of the Rabbis?
llm_translation: Rabba said: What is the reason of the Rabbis? A woman arouses herself. Abaye said to him: If so, let her be at this moment. And Rabba needed to explain to Abaye. Rather, what is the reason of the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: כי הא דאמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל חכמים תקנו להן לבנות ישראל שיהו בודקות עצמן שחרית וערבית שחרית להכשיר טהרות של לילה וערבית להכשיר טהרות של יום
human_translation: in accordance with that which Rav Yehuda said Shmuel says: The Sages instituted that the Jewish women should examine themselves morning and evening. morning to render fit ritually pure of the night, And evening to render fit pure during the day.
llm_translation: This is what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The Sages instituted for the daughters of Israel that they should examine themselves in the morning and evening, the morning to validate nighttime purities, and the evening to validate daytime purities.

hebrew_text: וזו הואיל ולא בדקה הפסידה עונה מאי עונה עונה יתירה

llm_translation: Rava said, and it is logical, a fortiori: Just as an earthenware vessel that is surrounded by a thread of flax that is saved in the tent of the deceased is not saved from time to time, so too, beds and seats that are not saved in the tent of the deceased are not saved from time to time.

human_translation: Come hear an incident involving the maidservant of Rabban Gamliel, who was baking loaves of teruma And in between each and every one she wash her hand in water and examine After last examined and found impure and she came and asked Rabban Gamliel And he said to her: They are all impure, She said to him: My teacher, didn’t I perform an examination in between each and every one? said to her: If so, this impure and all pure,
llm_translation: Come and hear. There was an incident with the maidservant of Rabban Gamliel who was baking loaves of terumah. And between each one, she would wash her hands with water and inspect the last one meticulously. And she found it to be impure. She came and asked Rabban Gamliel, and he said to her, "All of them are impure." She said to him, "My master, did I not inspect between each one?" He said to her, "If so, then that one is impure, but all the others are pure."

human_translation: Come hear another incident involving the maidservant of Rabban Gamliel who was sealing barrels of wine. She said to him: didn’t I perform an examination in between each and every one? said to her: If so, this impure and all pure.
llm_translation: Come and hear: There was once an incident with the maidservant of Rabban Gamliel, whose hand was between barrels of wine, and between each one she would wash her hand in water and inspect it, and in the end she inspected it and found it to be impure. She came and asked Rabban Gamliel, and he said to her, "All of them are impure." She said to him, "But did I not inspect between each one?" He said to her, "If so, then it is impure, and all of them are pure."

llm_translation: We learned there (in a Mishnah): If a doubt of impurity arose regarding her before she gave birth, she should act in impurity. Once she gave birth, she should act in purity.

hebrew_text: עד שלא גלגלה תעשה בטומאה חולין נינהו ומותר לגרום טומאה לחולין שבארץ ישראל משגלגלה תעשה בטהרה חולין הטבולין לחלה כחלה דמו ואסור לגרום טומאה לחלה
human_translation: Before it was kneaded it may be prepared in impurity it is non-sacred and permitted to cause impurity to non-sacred food in Eretz Yisrael. After it was kneaded it be prepared in purity, non-sacred that is untithed with regard to ḥalla , is considered like ḥalla , and prohibited to cause impurity to ḥalla .
llm_translation: Until it has not rolled, it is considered as ordinary food in a state of impurity, and it is permitted to cause impurity to ordinary food in the Land of Israel. Once it has rolled, it is considered as pure food, and ordinary food that is immersed in a mikveh is like its blood, and it is forbidden to cause impurity to it.

hebrew_text: וחולין הטבולין לחלה כחלה דמו והתניא אשה שהיא טבולת יום לשה את העיסה וקוצה הימנה חלתה ומניחתה בכפישה או באנחותא ומקפת וקורא לה שם

llm_translation: "And Chulin that are Tevulim for Chalah are like Chalah itself. And it was taught: A woman who is a Tevulah for a day may knead the dough and remove a piece from it, bake it, and place it in a basket or on a reed mat, and she forms a rim around it and gives it a name."

hebrew_text: מפני שהוא שלישי ושלישי טהור בחולין ואי אמרת חולין הטבולין לחלה כחלה דמו הא טמיתנהו

llm_translation: Because it is a third generation animal, and a third generation animal is pure in mundane matters. And if you say that mundane animals that are immersed in a mikveh for the sake of an ill person are considered like an ill person, then its blood is impure.

llm_translation: Abbaye said: Any Shudai that renders Chulin impure, a decree was enacted regarding it due to the doubt of Chulin that are Tevul Yom for Chalah. And this Tevul Yom, since it does not render definite Chulin impure, a decree was not enacted regarding it due to Chulin that are Tevul Yom for Chalah.

hebrew_text: והא מעת לעת שבנדה דודאי מטמא חולין ולא גזרו על ספקה משום חולין הטבולין לחלה

human_translation: As the Master said: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak received to non-sacred that were prepared according to purity of sacrificial but not to non-sacred that were prepared purity of teruma .
llm_translation: The Master said: "Rav Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak received a tradition that in the case of ordinary non-sacred animals that were designated for ritual purity sacrificial use, they are considered as if they were sanctified sacrificial animals, whereas in the case of ordinary non-sacred animals that were designated for the purity of terumah priestly gifts, they are not considered as if they were sanctified sacrificial animals."

llm_translation: But the halakha follows Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: איזו היא בתולה כל שלא ראתה דם מימיה אע"פ שנשואה מעוברת משיודע עוברה מניקה עד שתגמול את בנה נתנה בנה למניקה גמלתו או מת ר"מ אומר מטמאה מעת לעת וחכ"א דיה שעתה
human_translation: Who is a virgin any who has not seen blood in all her days, even if she was married a pregnant woman from her fetus is known a nursing woman until she weans her child she gave her child to a wet nurse, weaned him or died, Rabbi Meir says: She transmits impurity for period And the Rabbis say: her time is sufficient.
llm_translation: Virginity - any that not saw blood from her days even she married pregnant from known her pregnancy suckles until she weans her son gives her son to the nurse weaned him or died Rabbi Meir says defiles from time to time and the sages say her time now.

hebrew_text: איזוהי זקנה כל שעברו עליה שלש עונות סמוך לזקנתה רבי אליעזר אומר כל אשה שעברו עליה שלש עונות דיה שעתה רבי יוסי אומר מעוברת ומניקה שעברו עליהן שלש עונות דיין שעתן
human_translation: Who is an elderly woman any whom three cycles passed close to her old age. Rabbi Eliezer says: any woman whom three cycles passed her time is sufficient. Rabbi Yosei says: a pregnant woman and a nursing woman whom three cycles passed their time is sufficient.
llm_translation: Elderly woman - any that passed upon her three sins near her old age. Rabbi Eliezer says: any woman that passed upon her three sins, her judgment is now. Rabbi Yossi says: pregnant and nursing women, upon them three sins, their judgment is now.

hebrew_text: ובמה אמר דיה שעתה בראייה ראשונה אבל בשניה מטמאה מעת לעת ואם ראתה הראשונה מאונס אף השניה דיה שעתה
human_translation: And with regard to what did her time is sufficient? with regard to the first sighting but with regard to the second sighting, she transmits impurity for period And if she saw the first unnatural circumstances, even the second her time is sufficient.
llm_translation: And in what did he say? The first sighting is pure, but in the second, she becomes impure from time to time. And if the first one saw through coercion, the second one is also pure.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תניא אמר לו רבי אליעזר לרבי יהושע אתה לא שמעת אני שמעתי אתה לא שמעת אלא אחת ואני שמעתי הרבה
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Eliezer said to Rabbi Yehoshua: You did not hear, I did hear you heard only one and I heard many
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer said to Rabbi Yehoshua, "You did not hear, but I heard. You did not hear except for one, but I heard many."

hebrew_text: אין אומרים למי שלא ראה את החדש יבא ויעיד אלא למי שראהו כל ימיו של רבי אליעזר היו עושין כרבי יהושע לאחר פטירתו של רבי אליעזר החזיר רבי יהושע את הדבר ליושנו
human_translation: We do not say to one who had not seen the new moon come and testify. Rather to he who saw it. All the days of Rabbi Eliezer, they would practice in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, After Rabbi Eliezer’s passing, Rabbi Yehoshua returned the matter to its former
llm_translation: One does not say to one who did not see the new moon, "Come and testify," except to one who saw it. Throughout all the days of Rabbi Eliezer, they would follow the practice of Rabbi Joshua. After the passing of Rabbi Eliezer, Rabbi Joshua reverted the matter to its original state.

hebrew_text: כרבי אליעזר בחייו מ"ט לא משום דרבי אליעזר שמותי הוא וסבר אי עבדינן כוותיה בחדא עבדינן כוותיה באחרנייתא

human_translation: And due to the honor of Rabbi Eliezer, we not be able to protest them. after Rabbi Eliezer’s passing, when we are able to protest those returned the matter to its former
llm_translation: And because of the honor of Rabbi Akiva, we do not find that we protest against them after the passing of Rabbi Akiva, for we find that he returned the matter to its original state.

hebrew_text: ואידך הזב והזבה שבדקו עצמן יום ראשון ומצאו טהור יום שביעי ומצאו טהור ושאר הימים לא בדקו רבי אליעזר אומר הרי אלו בחזקת טהרה רבי יהושע אומר אין להן אלא יום הראשון ויום השביעי בלבד
human_translation: And another a zav or a zava who examined themselves first day and found pure, seventh day and found pure, but rest of the days they did not examine Rabbi Eliezer says: The presumptive status of ritual purity. Rabbi Yehoshua says: have only the first day and the seventh day,
llm_translation: And the other case is regarding a male zav and a female zavah who examined themselves on the first day and found themselves pure, then on the seventh day and found themselves pure, and on the rest of the days they did not examine. Rabbi Eliezer says: "These are in a presumption of purity." Rabbi Joshua says: "They only have the presumption of purity on the first day and the seventh day alone."

hebrew_text: רבי עקיבא אומר אין להם אלא יום שביעי בלבד ותניא ר"ש ורבי יוסי אומרים נראין דברי רבי אליעזר מדברי רבי יהושע ודברי ר"ע מדברי כולן אבל הלכה כר' אליעזר

llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says they have only the seventh day alone, and it was taught: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Yosei say, the words of Rabbi Eliezer appear like the words of Rabbi Joshua, and the words of Rabbi Akiva like the words of all of them, but the halacha is according to Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: ורבי אליעזר אחורי כלים דרבנן וטבול יום דאורייתא ורבנן מדאורייתא לא עבדינן קל וחומר דמדאורייתא אין אוכל מטמא כלי ואין משקה מטמא כלי

human_translation: But what is different exterior of vessels, that cited due to that lenient As we learned a vessel whose exterior was rendered impure by liquids, exterior is impure, its interior, its ear, its rim, its handles, are pure. interior was rendered impure, it is all impure.
llm_translation: And what is the difference with regards to the backs of vessels that it was specifically mentioned? Because it is easy, as we learned in a Mishnah: A vessel that became impure from its back in liquids, its back is impure, its inside, its handle, and its rim are pure; if its inside became impure, its entire inside is impure.

llm_translation: And so it is logical, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Even one who plucks and places grapes into a basket, the basket joins them to the dough." And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.

And if you say, "When did Rabbi Elazar say the halacha is like Rabbi Eliezer? Only in the order of purities, but in other orders, is there a dispute?" But is there a dispute?

hebrew_text: והתנן הורד והכופר והלטום והקטף יש להן שביעית ולדמיהן שביעית יש להן ביעור ולדמיהן ביעור וא"ר פדת מאן תנא קטפא פירא ר"א
human_translation: But didn’t we learn The rose, the henna, the rockrose, and the balsam, they have Sabbatical and money them has Sabbatical they have eradication and money them has eradication. And Rabbi Pedat said: Who taught that balsam a fruit, Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: One who descends (to gather produce), one who denies (the produce), one who conceals (it), and one who picks (it) - they have the laws of Shemittah (the Sabbatical year) for themselves and the laws of Shemittah for their produce, they have the laws of Biur (removal of produce) for themselves and the laws of Biur for their produce. And Rabbi Pedat said: Who is the Tanna (sage) who taught that picking (produce) is like fruit? It is Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: וא"ר זירא חזי דמינך ומאבוך קשריתו קטפא לעלמא את אמרת מאן תנא קטפא פירא ר"א ואבוך אמר הלכה כר"א בד'
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said to see that from you and from your father, you have permitted balsam to the world, you said: Who taught that balsam a fruit? Rabbi Eliezer. And your father, said halakha in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer in four
