human_translation: But much older than Rather, because Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel held in accordance with his
llm_translation: And this is difficult from it much, rather because Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel stands in his own opinion.

hebrew_text: ומי קאי והתניא אור יוה"כ מתפלל שבע ומתודה שחרית מתפלל שבע ומתודה מוסף מתפלל שבע ומתודה מנחה מתפלל שבע ומתודה בנעילה מתפלל שבע ומתודה בערבית מתפלל שבע מעין שמנה עשרה
human_translation: And does hold But isn’t it taught the night of Yom Kippur, one prays seven and confesses; morning prayer, one prays seven and confesses; additional prayer, one prays seven and confesses; afternoon prayer, one prays seven and confesses; in ne’ila prayer, one prays seven and confesses. For the evening prayer one prays seven an abridged eighteen
llm_translation: And who is it that stands? And it was taught: On Yom Kippur, one prays seven prayers and confesses sins in the morning, one prays seven prayers and confesses sins in the additional service, one prays seven prayers and confesses sins in the afternoon, one prays seven prayers and confesses sins at the closing of the day, one prays seven prayers and confesses sins in the evening, one prays seven prayers - similar to eighteen.

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא בן גמליאל משום אבותיו אומר מתפלל שמנה עשרה מפני שצ"ל הבדלה בחונן הדעת אמר ר"נ בר יצחק איהו אמר משום אבותיו וליה לא ס"ל
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says in the name of his forefathers: One recites eighteen due to required to recite havdala in Who graciously grants knowledge. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says said in the name of his forefathers, but himself does not hold accordingly.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel says in the name of his forefathers: One should pray eighteen blessings because it includes the Havdalah prayer. Chanun HaDa'at said: R' Nachman bar Yitzchak said: He himself said it in the name of his forefathers, and why not agree with him?

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' ירמיה לר' זירא ואת לא תסברא דמאן תנא קטפא פירא ר"א הוא והתנן ר"א אומר המעמיד בשרף ערלה אסור
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: And you? Do you not hold who taught balsam fruit is Rabbi Eliezer? As, didn’t we learn Rabbi Eliezer says: one who curdles in the sap of orla , prohibited,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said to Rabbi Zeira, "And you do not agree? Who is the Tanna who taught the first clause? It is Rabbi Eliezer." And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says, "One who sets up a burnt offering of uncircumcised flesh is forbidden."

hebrew_text: אפילו תימא רבנן ע"כ לא פליגי רבנן עליה דר"א אלא בקטפא דגווזא אבל בקטפא דפירא מודו ליה דתנן א"ר יהושע שמעתי בפירוש שהמעמיד בשרף העלין בשרף העיקרין מותר בשרף הפגין אסור מפני שהוא פרי
human_translation: You even say the Rabbis. the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer only with regard to sap of the tree, but in sap of the fruit they agree with him. As we learned Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard explicitly that one who curdles in the sap of the leaves the sap of the roots permitted. in the sap of unripe figs it is prohibited, because is fruit.
llm_translation: Even if you say, "the Rabbis agree with this," the Rabbis do not disagree with Rabbi Akiva on this matter, except in the case of the stalk of a carob tree. But in the case of the stalk of a pear tree, they agree with him, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehoshua said, "I heard in explanation that one who sets up meat on a carob stalk, it is permitted; on a pear stalk, it is forbidden, because it is considered a fruit."

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא כי פליגי רבנן עליה דר"א באילן העושה פירות אבל באילן שאינו עושה פירות מודו דקטפו זהו פריו דתנן ר"ש אומר אין לקטף שביעית וחכ"א יש לקטף שביעית מפני שקטפו זהו פריו
human_translation: And if you wish, say When the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer, with regard to a tree that bears fruit. But in a tree that does not bear fruit, they agree that its sap is its fruit. As we learned Rabbi Shimon says: Sabbatical does not to sap. And the Rabbis say: Sabbatical does to sap, because its sap is its fruit.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that when the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Akiva regarding a tree that produces fruit, but with a tree that does not produce fruit, they agree that its picking is its fruit. As we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon says, "One may not pick the produce of the Sabbatical year," and the sages say, "One may pick the produce of the Sabbatical year because its picking is its fruit."

hebrew_text: מאן חכמים לאו רבנן דפליגי עליה דר"א א"ל ההוא סבא הכי א"ר יוחנן מאן חכמים ר"א דאמר קטפו זהו פריו
human_translation: Who Rabbis? not the Rabbis who disagree with Rabbi Eliezer? A certain elder said to this is what Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Who the Rabbis Rabbi Eliezer, who said its sap is its fruit.
llm_translation: The sages, are they not the Rabbis who disagree with Rabbi Akiva? He said to that elder thus: Rabbi Yochanan said, "The sages are Rabbi Akiva, who said, 'They plucked it, this is its fruit.'"

hebrew_text: אי ר"א מאי איריא אילן שאינו עושה פרי אפילו אילן העושה פרי קטפו זהו פריו לדבריהם דרבנן קאמר להו לדידי אפי' אילן העושה פירות נמי קטפו זהו פריו לדידכו אודו לי מיהת באילן שאינו עושה פירות דקטפו זהו פריו ורבנן אמרי ליה לא שנא
human_translation: If it is Rabbi Eliezer, why specifically a tree that does not bear fruit? Even a tree that bear fruit, its sap is its fruit. stated to them in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis According to my even a tree that bears fruit, its sap also its fruit. according to your at least agree with me in a tree that does not bear fruit, its sap is its fruit. And the Rabbis said to It is no different.
llm_translation: If Rabbi Eliezer, what is the difference? A tree that does not produce fruit, even a tree that produces fruit, its branches are its fruit according to their words of the Rabbis. According to my opinion, even a tree that produces fruit, its branches are its fruit according to your words. They responded to him: Come and see from a tree that does not produce fruit, if its branches are its fruit. And the Rabbis said to him: It is no different.

hebrew_text: איזו היא בתולה כל שלא ראתה כו' ת"ר נשאת וראתה דם מחמת נישואין ילדה וראתה דם מחמת לידה עדיין אני קורא לה בתולה שהרי בתולה שאמרו בתולת דמים ולא בתולת בתולים
human_translation: Who is a virgin any who did not see The Sages taught: married and she saw blood due to her marriage, she gave birth and saw blood due to the birth, I still call her a virgin that when they said: Virgin blood virgin, and not a hymen- virgin,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Which is a virgin? All who did not see, etc. The Rabbis taught: If she married and saw blood due to the marriage, or she gave birth and saw blood due to childbirth, I still call her a virgin. For indeed, a virgin is one who they said is a virgin of blood, and not a virgin of hymen.

hebrew_text: איני והאמר רב כהנא תנא ג' בתולות הן בתולת אדם בתולת קרקע בתולת שקמה בתולת אדם כל זמן שלא נבעלה נפקא מינה לכ"ג א"נ לכתובתה מאתים
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Kahana say taught: There are three virgins: A virgin human, virgin ground, and a virgin sycamore. A virgin human as long as she has not engaged in intercourse. The relevance to a High Priest Alternatively, that her marriage contract is two hundred dinars,
llm_translation: I am, but didn't Rav Kahana say: A Mishna teaches: There are three types of virginity: the virginity of a person, the virginity of the ground, and the virginity of a date palm. The virginity of a person - as long as she has not engaged in sexual intercourse, she is considered a virgin. Alternatively, the Mishna can be understood as saying that for her marriage contract she is worth two hundred silver coins.

hebrew_text: בתולת קרקע כ"ז שלא נעבדה נפקא מינה לנחל איתן א"נ למקח וממכר
human_translation: Virgin ground as long as it has not been worked. The relevance with regard to rough stream Alternatively, with regard to buying and selling.
llm_translation: Virgin soil twenty-seven that not worked outcome to inherit Ethan alternatively to purchase and to sell.

hebrew_text: בתולת שקמה כ"ז שלא נקצצה נפקא מינה למקח וממכר אי נמי למקצצה בשביעית כדתנן אין קוצצין בתולת שקמה בשביעית מפני שהיא עבודה ואם איתא ליתני נמי הא
human_translation: a virgin sycamore as long as it has not been felled, The relevance with regard to buying and selling. Alternatively, with regard to felling it in the Sabbatical as we learned One may not fell a virgin sycamore in the Sabbatical because it is work, And if it is so, let also teach this
llm_translation: Virgin olive oil that was not pruned, twenty-seven, that was not pruned, it is derived for purchase and sale, or for pruning in the seventh year, as we learned: One does not prune virgin olive oil in the seventh year because it is considered work. And if it is necessary, let it also teach this.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"נ בר יצחק כי קתני מידי דלית ליה שם לווי אבל מידי דאית ליה שם לווי לא קתני רב ששת בריה דרב אידי אמר כי קתני מידי דתלי במעשה מידי דלא תלי במעשה לא קתני
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: When teaches an item that does not have a modifier, but he does not teach an item that has a modifier. Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, says: When teaches an item that is dependent upon action, he does not teach an item that is not dependent upon action,
llm_translation: Said Rav Nahman bar Yitzhak: When it teaches something that does not have a name attached to it, it does not teach. But when it has a name attached to it, it does teach. Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: When it teaches something that is dependent on action, if it is not dependent on action, it does not teach.

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא בריה דרב איקא אמר כי קתני מידי דלא הדר לברייתו מידי דהדר לברייתו לא קתני רבינא אמר כי קתני מידי דקפיד עליה זבינא מידי דלא קפיד עליה זבינא לא קתני
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rav Ika says: When teaches an item that will not revert to its state. he does not teach an item revert to its state, Ravina says: When teaches an item about which a buyer is particular, he does not teach an item about which a buyer is not particular,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina, son of Rav Ika, said: When he teaches something that he does not return to his original teaching, he does not teach. Ravina said: When he teaches something that he is particular about, he teaches; when he is not particular, he does not teach.

hebrew_text: ולא קפדי והתניא רבי חייא אומר כשם שהשאור יפה לעיסה כך דמים יפין לאשה ותניא משום ר"מ כל אשה שדמיה מרובין בניה מרובין אלא כי קתני מידי דקפיץ עליה זבינא מידי דלא קפיץ עליה זבינא לא קתני
human_translation: And not particular But isn’t it taught Rabbi Ḥiyya says: Just as leaven is fortuitous for dough, so blood is fortuitous for a woman; and it is taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: Any woman whose blood is plentiful, her children are plentiful? Rather, when teaches an item that buyers are eager he does not teach an item that buyers are not eager
llm_translation: And not exacting. And it was taught: Rabbi Chiya says, just as leaven is good for dough, so too blood is good for a woman. And it was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: any woman whose blood is abundant, her children are abundant. But when it is taught, it means in a case where her husband is intimate with her frequently, her children are abundant; in a case where her husband is not intimate with her frequently, her children are not abundant.

hebrew_text: ת"ר איזוהי בתולת קרקע כל שמעלה רשושין ואין עפרה תיחוח נמצא בה חרס בידוע שנעבדה צונמא הרי זו בתולת קרקע
human_translation: The Sages taught What is virgin ground? any that raises up hard clumps earth and whose dirt is not loose. finds earthenware in it is known that it was worked rock, it is virgin ground.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: What is the definition of a virgin of the ground? Any woman whose pubic hairs have grown, and her hymen has not been broken, and it is known that she has been subjected to rape – behold, she is a virgin of the ground.

hebrew_text: מעוברת משיודע עוברה וכמה הכרת העובר סומכוס אומר משום רבי מאיר שלשה חדשים ואע"פ שאין ראיה לדבר זכר לדבר שנאמר (בראשית לח, כד) ויהי כמשלש חדשים וגומר
human_translation: a pregnant woman from her fetus is known And how much the fetus to be known? Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: Three months. And although there is no proof for the matter, an allusion to the matter, as it is stated: “And it came to pass about three months
llm_translation: Pregnant from when known her pregnancy and how recognition the fetus Sumchus says in the name of Rabbi Meir three months and even though there is no proof to this matter a male to a male as it is stated (Genesis 38:24) "And it came to pass after three months and it was told."

hebrew_text: זכר לדבר קרא כתיב וראיה גדולה היא משום דאיכא דילדה לט' ואיכא דילדה לשבעה
human_translation: allusion to the matter? verse is written, and that is a significant proof. because there are who give birth after nine and there are who give birth after seven
llm_translation: "Male for a matter Scripture wrote and a great proof it is because there are those who give birth to nine and there are those who give birth to seven."

hebrew_text: ת"ר הרי שהיתה בחזקת מעוברת וראתה דם ואח"כ הפילה רוח או כל דבר שאינו של קיימא הרי היא בחזקתה ודיה שעתה
human_translation: The Sages taught had a presumptive status that pregnant and she saw blood, and afterward miscarried air, or anything that is not a viable she her presumptive status, and her time is sufficient
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a woman was in the presumption of being pregnant and she saw blood, and afterwards she miscarried a spirit or anything that is not viable, she remains in her presumption and is considered ritually impure at this time.

hebrew_text: ואע"ג שאין ראיה לדבר זכר לדבר שנאמר (ישעיהו כו, יח) הרינו חלנו כמו ילדנו רוח מאי זכר לדבר הרי ראיה גדולה היא כי כתיב האי קרא בזכרים כתיב
human_translation: And even though there is no proof for matter, an allusion to the matter, as it is stated: “We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind” What allusion to the matter? is a significant proof. When that verse was written, written with regard to males
llm_translation: "And even though there is no proof for this matter, it is compared to another matter, as it is stated (Isaiah 26:18), 'We were pregnant, we writhed, as it were, we have given birth to wind.' What is the comparison to another matter? Behold, this is a great proof, for it is written, 'This verse is written with males.'"

hebrew_text: ורמינהי קשתה שנים ולשלישי הפילה רוח או כל דבר שאינו של קיימא הרי זו יולדת בזוב ואי אמרת לידה מעלייתא היא
human_translation: And raises a contradiction labor two and on the third she miscarried air or anything that is not a viable that gives birth as a zava , And if you say is a proper birth,
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: if it was bent twice, and for the third time it fell due to wind or anything that is not permanent, behold, this renders it susceptible to impurity through zav. And if you say it is considered a birth, it is an elevation.

hebrew_text: קושי סמוך ללידה רחמנא טהריה אמר רב פפי הנח מעת לעת דרבנן
human_translation: labor close to birth, the Merciful One deems it pure, Rav Pappi says: leave for period, by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: Difficulties near childbirth, may the Merciful One purify her. Rav Pappi said: Leave it from time to time of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר מידי הוא טעמא אלא משום דראשה כבד עליה ואבריה כבדין עליה הכא נמי ראשה ואבריה כבדין עליה
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: That reason only because her head and limbs heavy to her. Here, too, her head and limbs heavy to her
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "It is due to something, rather, because its head is heavy upon it, and its limbs are heavy upon it. Here too, its head and its limbs are heavy upon it."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי ירמיה מרבי זירא ראתה ואח"כ הוכר עוברה מהו כיון דבעידנא דחזאי לא הוכר עוברה מטמיא או דלמא כיון דסמוך לה חזאי לא מטמיא
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya asked Rabbi Zeira: she saw and afterward her fetus became known what is since at the time when she saw her fetus was not known, becomes impure; or perhaps, since she saw in close to not become impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked Rabbi Zeira: If a woman saw blood and then recognized her pregnancy, what is the law? Since at the time she saw, she did not recognize her pregnancy, is she impure, or perhaps since it is close to her recognition, she is not impure.

hebrew_text: א"ל מידי הוא טעמא אלא משום דראשה כבד עליה ואבריה כבדין עליה בעידנא דחזאי אין ראשה כבד עליה ואין אבריה כבדין עליה
human_translation: said to him: That reason only because her head and limbs heavy to her. at the time when she saw neither her head nor her limbs heavy to her.
llm_translation: He said to him: "It is due to something else, but because its head is heavy upon it, and its limbs are heavy upon it. At the time when it is seen, its head is not heavy upon it, and its limbs are not heavy upon it."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה ההוא סבא מר' יוחנן הגיע עת וסתה בימי עבורה ולא בדקה מהו קא מיבעיא לי אליבא דמ"ד וסתות דאורייתא מאי כיון דוסתות דאורייתא בעיא בדיקה או דלמא כיון דדמיה מסולקין לא בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: A certain elder asked Rabbi Yoḥanan: time cycle arrived during her pregnancy and she did not perform an examination, what is I raise dilemma according to of the one who said cycle by Torah law. What since cycle by Torah law, required an examination Or perhaps, since her blood has stopped, not required an examination.
llm_translation: A certain elder asked Rabbi Yochanan: "If a woman reaches the age of menopause during her menstrual period and did not examine it, what is the law?" He inquired according to the opinion of the one who says that biblical menstrual periods require examination. What is the law when biblical menstrual periods require examination? Does it require examination, or perhaps since they are rare, it does not require examination.

hebrew_text: א"ל תניתוה רבי מאיר אומר אם היתה במחבא והגיע שעת וסתה ולא בדקה טהורה שחרדה מסלקת את הדמים טעמא דאיכא חרדה הא ליכא חרדה והגיע וסתה ולא בדקה טמאה
human_translation: said to him: You learned Rabbi Meir says: If was in hiding and the time of her cycle came and she did not examine ritually pure, as fear dispels blood. reason that there is fear, there is no fear and the time of her cycle arrived and she did not examine impure.
llm_translation: He said to them: Rabbi Meir taught: If it was in a hiding place and the time of its inspection arrived, and she did not inspect it, a pure one who became frightened removes the blood. The reason is that there is fear. But if there is no fear, and the time of its inspection arrived, and she did not inspect it, it is impure.

hebrew_text: אלמא וסתות דאורייתא וכיון דאיכא חרדה דמיה מסולקין ולא בעיא בדיקה הכא נמי דמיה מסולקין ולא בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: Evidently, cycle by Torah law. And, since there is fear, her blood has stopped and not required an examination. Here, too, her blood has stopped and not required an examination.
llm_translation: It is evident that concealed documents are from the Torah, and since there is fear, they are removed, and there is no need for examination. Here too, they are removed due to fear, and there is no need for examination.

hebrew_text: מניקה עד שתגמול וכו' ת"ר מניקה שמת בנה בתוך עשרים וארבע חדש הרי היא ככל הנשים ומטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה לפיכך אם היתה מניקתו והולכת ארבע או חמש שנים דיה שעתה דברי ר"מ
human_translation: a nursing woman until she weans The Sages taught a nursing woman whose child dies within twenty-four months she is like all women and she transmits ritual impurity for period or from examination to examination. Therefore, if continued to nurse for four or five years, her time is sufficient the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Nursing until she weans, etc. The Rabbis taught: If a woman nurses her son for twenty-four months, she is like all other women, and she becomes ritually impure intermittently and regularly. Therefore, if his nursemaid was with him for four or five years, it is her own doing. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה ורבי יוסי ורבי שמעון אומרים דיין שעתן כל עשרים וארבע חדש לפיכך אם היתה מניקתו ארבע וחמש שנים מטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: their time is sufficient an entire twenty-four months. Therefore, if she nursed him for four or five years, she transmits ritual impurity for period or from examination to examination.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah, Rabbi Yosi, and Rabbi Shimon say: Their judgment lasts for twenty-four months. Therefore, if his nursing period was four or five years, she becomes impure from time to time and from deposit to deposit.

hebrew_text: כשתמצא לומר לדברי ר"מ דם נעכר ונעשה חלב לדברי רבי יוסי ורבי יהודה ורבי שמעון אבריה מתפרקין ואין נפשה חוזרת עד עשרים וארבע חדש
human_translation: When you will find say that according to the statement of Rabbi Meir blood spoils and becomes milk. according to the statement of Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, her limbs become dislocated and her spirit, does not return until twenty-four months
llm_translation: When you find to say according to the words of Rabbi Meir, blood congeals and becomes milk; according to the words of Rabbi Yosi, Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Shimon, her fetus disintegrates, and her soul does not return until twenty-four months.

hebrew_text: לפיכך דר"מ למה לי משום לפיכך דרבי יוסי
human_translation: Why do I of Rabbi Meir: Therefore, due to Therefore, of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Therefore, why do I need Rabbi Meir? Because of this, Rabbi Yossi.

hebrew_text: ולפיכך דרבי יוסי למה לי מהו דתימא רבי יוסי תרתי אית ליה קמ"ל
human_translation: And why do I Therefore, of Rabbi Yosei? lest you say Rabbi Yosei holds two teaches us
llm_translation: Therefore, regarding Rabbi Yosei, why do I need it? What if you say, "Rabbi Yosei has two reasons" - this teaches us.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי דם נעכר ונעשה חלב דברי ר"מ רבי יוסי אומר אבריה מתפרקין ואין נפשה חוזרת עליה עד עשרים וארבע חדש א"ר אלעאי מאי טעמא דר"מ דכתיב (איוב יד, ד) מי יתן טהור מטמא לא אחד
human_translation: That is also taught blood spoils and becomes milk; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: Her limbs become dislocated and her spirit does not return to her until twenty-four months Rabbi Ilai says: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? as it is written: “Who can bring a pure thing out of an impure? not the One?”
llm_translation: It is also taught: blood becomes spoiled and turns into milk. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosi says: its limbs decompose, and its soul does not return to it until twenty-four months. Rabbi Elai said: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? Because it is written (Job 14:4): "Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean?"

hebrew_text: ורבנן א"ר יוחנן זו שכבת זרע שהוא טמא ואדם הנוצר ממנו טהור
human_translation: And the Sages, Rabbi Yoḥanan says this semen, which is impure, and the person that is formed from it is pure.
llm_translation: And the Rabbis said: Rabbi Yochanan said, "This is the emission of semen which is impure, and the person who emerges from it is pure."

hebrew_text: ור"א אומר אלו מי הנדה שהמזה ומזין עליו טהור ונוגע טמא ומזה טהור והכתיב (במדבר יט, כא) ומזה מי הנדה יכבס בגדיו מאי מזה נוגע
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: the water of sprinkling, As sprinkles upon whom sprinkled pure, and touches impure. Is one who sprinkles pure? But isn’t it written: “He who sprinkles the water of sprinkling will wash his clothes, What “He who sprinkles”? He who touches.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: These are the waters of the niddah, upon which he sprinkles and sprinkles, pure; and one who touches it is impure. And he sprinkles, he is pure. And it is written (Numbers 19:21): "And he who sprinkles the waters of the niddah shall wash his clothes." What is meant by "sprinkles"?

hebrew_text: והכתיב מזה והכתיב נוגע ועוד מזה בעי כבוס נוגע לא בעי כבוס אלא מאי מזה נושא
human_translation: But it is written: “He who sprinkles,” and it is written he who touches.” And furthermore, one who sprinkles requires washing clothes, one who touches does not require washing clothes. Rather, What “He who sprinkles”? one who carries
llm_translation: And the scripture says from this and the scripture says touches and furthermore from this inquires washes touches not inquires washes rather what from this carries.

hebrew_text: וליכתוב נושא קמ"ל דעד דדרי כשיעור הזאה הניחא למ"ד הזאה צריכה שיעור אלא למ"ד אין צריכה שיעור מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: But let write One who carries. teaches us only by carrying measure sprinkling. This works out well according to the one who said sprinkling requires measure But according to the one who said sprinkling does not require measure what can be said?
llm_translation: And to write the subject - teaches that until the size of a hazelnut is suitable. According to the one who says it needs to be the size of a hazelnut, what does the one who says it does not need to be the size of a hazelnut have to say?

hebrew_text: אפילו למ"ד אינה צריכה שיעור ה"מ אגבא דגברא אבל במנא בעינא שיעור כדתנן כמה יהיו במים ויהא בהן כדי הזאה כדי שיטבול ראשי גבעולין ויזה
human_translation: Even according to the one who said sprinkling does not require measure that statement onto the back, of man. But with regard to the vessel requires measure As we learned How much be in will be enough for sprinkling? enough to dip the tops of the stems and sprinkle
llm_translation: Even according to the opinion that it does not require a specific measure, we say this in the case of a man. But with regard to a utensil, I require a measure, as we learned: "How much water must there be in them so that it is enough for sprinkling and enough for immersing the tops of the stalks, and it will flow."

hebrew_text: והיינו דאמר שלמה (קהלת ז, כג) אמרתי אחכמה והיא רחוקה ממני
human_translation: And that is which Solomon said: “I said I would become wise, but it eludes me”
llm_translation: And this is what Solomon said (Ecclesiastes 7:23), "I said, 'I will become wise,' but it is far from me."

hebrew_text: איזו היא זקנה כל שעברו עליה שלש עונות [סמוך לזקנתה] היכי דמי סמוך לזקנתה אמר רב יהודה כל שחברותיה אומרות עליה זקנה היא ורבי שמעון אומר
human_translation: Who is an elderly woman any whom three cycles passed close to her old age, What is considered close to old age? Rav Yehuda says: Any about whom her friends say she is an elderly woman. And Rabbi Shimon says:
llm_translation: Elderly woman - all that passed upon her three transgressions near her old age how is considered near her old age? Rav Yehudah said: all her companions say about her that she is old, and Rabbi Shimon says...

hebrew_text: כל שקורין לה אמא אמא ואינה בושה ר' זירא ור' שמואל בר רב יצחק חד אמר כל שאינה מקפדת וחד אמר כל שאינה בושה מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו בושה ואינה מקפדת
human_translation: any that call her: Mother [ Imma ], Mother, and she is not embarrassed. Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak One says any who does not take offense And one says any who is not embarrassed What is the difference between between embarrassed but she does not take offense
llm_translation: All who call her "mother, mother" and she is not embarrassed - Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak: one said, "All who is not meticulous," and one said, "All who is not embarrassed." What is the practical difference between them? There is a difference between being embarrassed and not being meticulous.

hebrew_text: וכמה עונה אמר ריש לקיש משום רבי יהודה נשיאה עונה בינונית שלשים יום ורבא אמר רב חסדא עשרים יום ולא פליגי מר קחשיב ימי טומאה וימי טהרה ומר לא חשיב ימי טומאה
human_translation: And how long cycle? Reish Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda Nesia: average cycle thirty days And Rava says Rav Ḥisda twenty days. And do not disagree. Sage, counts days of impurity and days of purity. And Sage, does not count days of impurity,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how long does a woman answer? Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda Nasi: she answers for thirty days. And Rava said: for twenty days. And the Master did not disagree, one considers the days of impurity and the days of purity, and the other does not consider the days of impurity."

hebrew_text: ת"ר זקנה שעברו עליה שלש עונות וראתה דיה שעתה ועוד עברו עליה שלש עונות וראתה דיה שעתה ועוד עברו עליה שלש עונות וראתה הרי היא ככל הנשים ומטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה
human_translation: The Sages taught an elderly woman whom three cycles passed and she saw her time is sufficient. And a further three cycles passed for her and she saw her time is sufficient. And a further three cycles passed for her and she saw she is like all women, transmits impurity for period or from examination to examination.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If an elderly woman had three periods pass over her and she saw blood each time, and then three more periods passed over her and she saw blood each time, and then three more periods passed over her and she saw blood, behold, she is like all other women, becoming impure from time to time and requiring examination from time to time.

hebrew_text: ולא (מיבעיא) שכוונה אלא אפי' פיחתה (ואפילו) והותירה
human_translation: And it is not necessary where she even Rather, even if she decreased, or even if she increased
llm_translation: And not (it is asked) intention only but even a little bit (and even) she left.

hebrew_text: אפי' פיחתה ולא מבעיא כוונה אדרבה כי כוונה קבעה לה וסתה ודיה שעתה
human_translation: Even if she decreased, it is not necessary even on the contrary, if she even fixes her cycle and her time is sufficient.
llm_translation: Even a mere utterance, and intention is not required. On the contrary, when intention is established for it, it is valid, and it is considered as if it were done at that moment.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא רבנן היא דפליגי עליה דרבי דוסא דאמרי אשה שיש לה וסת מטמאה מעת לעת איפכא מבעי ליה ולימא ולא שפיחתה והותירה אלא אפי' כוונה
human_translation: And if you would say is the Rabbis, who disagree with Rabbi Dosa, as they say a woman who has cycle transmits impurity for period, should have opposite Let say: And not she decreased or increased, but even even
llm_translation: And if you will say, the Rabbis, it is that they argue upon it of Rabbi Dosa, for they say, a woman who has a veset, she becomes impure from time to time, the opposite, he requires of it and should say, "And not her spittle, and she left it, rather even unintentionally."

hebrew_text: תני לא שפיחתה והותירה אלא אפי' כוונה ואיבעית אימא ה"ק ולא שכוונה אלא שפיחתה והותירה אבל כוונה קבעה לה וסת ודיה שעתה ומני רבי דוסא היא
human_translation: Teach And not she decreased or increased, but even even And if you wish say this is saying: not even Rather, she decreased or increased, But even fixes cycle And whose It is Rabbi Dosa.
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught: Not her speech and she remained, but even intention. And if you ask: Is this not what was said? Not intention, but her speech and she remained. However, if her intention was established, and the time and place were set, then according to Rabbi Dosa, it is considered valid."

hebrew_text: ר"א אומר כל אשה שעברו עליה וכו' תניא אמר להם רבי אליעזר לחכמים מעשה בריבה אחת בהיתלו שהפסיקה שלש עונות ובא מעשה לפני חכמים ואמרו דיה שעתה
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: any woman whom passed is taught an incident involving a certain girl in Hitlo who stopped for three cycles, And the matter came before the Sages, and they said her time is sufficient
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Any woman upon whom they have transgressed, etc." It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer said to the sages, "There was an incident with a certain woman in Hitlul who interrupted three sins, and the matter came before the sages, and they said, 'She is now worthy.'"

hebrew_text: אמרו לו אין שעת הדחק ראיה מאי שעת הדחק איכא דאמרי שני בצורת הוו איכא דאמרי טהרות אפיש לעבידא וחשו רבנן להפסד דטהרות
human_translation: said to in exigent circumstances are no proof. What exigent circumstances? Some say it was years of famine, some say handled many ritually pure and the Sages were concerned for the loss pure
llm_translation: They said to him: "The time of urgency is not proof." What is the time of urgency? Some say it is when two are in the form. Some say it is to make impure things abundant, and the Rabbis were concerned about the loss of purity.

hebrew_text: ת"ר מעשה ועשה רבי כר' אליעזר לאחר שנזכר אמר כדי הוא ר' אליעזר לסמוך עליו בשעת הדחק מאי לאחר שנזכר אילימא לאחר שנזכר דאין הלכה כר' אליעזר אלא כרבנן בשעת הדחק היכי עביד כוותיה
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident Rabbi acted is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. After he remembered he said: Rabbi Eliezer is worthy to rely upon in exigent circumstances. What After he remembered? If we say after he remembered halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, but in accordance with the Rabbis, how could he act in accordance with in exigent circumstances,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident where Rabbi acted in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. After he remembered, he said, "It is enough for Rabbi Eliezer to rely on him in a time of distress." What does it mean "after he remembered"? If you say it means after he remembered that the halacha does not follow Rabbi Eliezer but rather the Rabbis, then in a time of distress, what should one do?

hebrew_text: אלא דלא איתמר הילכתא לא כמר ולא כמר ומאי לאחר שנזכר לאחר שנזכר דלאו יחיד פליג עליה אלא רבים פליגי עליה אמר כדי הוא ר' אליעזר לסמוך עליו בשעת הדחק
human_translation: Rather, that halakha not been stated neither in accordance with Sage, nor in accordance with that Sage, And what After he remembered? After remembered that it was not a lone disagrees with but disagreed with him, said: Rabbi Eliezer is worthy to rely upon in exigent circumstances.
llm_translation: Rather, it was not stated definitively, neither like this one nor like that one. And what is meant by "to another" after it was mentioned? It is because it is not an individual who disputes it, but many dispute it. Rabbi Eliezer said, "It is sufficient to rely on him in a time of distress."

hebrew_text: ת"ר תנוקת שלא הגיע זמנה לראות וראתה פעם ראשונה דיה שעתה שניה דיה שעתה שלישית הרי היא ככל הנשים ומטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה
human_translation: The Sages taught a young girl, whose time to see has not arrived and she saw first time her time is sufficient. second time, her time is sufficient. third time, she is like all women, and she transmits impurity for - period or from examination to examination.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A young girl who has not reached the age to see, and she saw once, the first time she is pure, the second time she is pure, the third time she is like all women, and she becomes impure from time to time and is entrusted from one trustee to another.

hebrew_text: עברו עליה שלש עונות וראתה דיה שעתה ועוד עברו עליה שלש עונות וראתה דיה שעתה ועוד עברו עליה שלש עונות וראתה הרי היא ככל הנשים ומטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה
human_translation: passed three cycles and she saw her time is sufficient. And further passed three cycles and she saw blood, her time is sufficient. And passed three further cycles she saw blood, she is like all women. And she transmits impurity for period or from examination to examination.
llm_translation: They transgressed upon it three sins and she saw her period now, and furthermore they transgressed upon it three sins and she saw her period now, and furthermore they transgressed upon it three sins and she saw, behold, she is like all women, and she becomes impure from time to time and is entrusted from one period to another.

hebrew_text: וכשהגיע זמנה לראות פעם ראשונה דיה שעתה שניה מטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה עברו עליה שלש עונות וראתה דיה שעתה
human_translation: And whose time to see has arrived, first time, her time is sufficient. second she transmits impurity for period or from examination to examination. three cycles passed and she saw blood, her time is sufficient.
llm_translation: And when its time arrived to see for the first time, its blood is now a second time, it defiles from time to time, and from deposit to deposit, three sins passed over it, and it saw its blood now.

hebrew_text: אמר מר עברו עליה שלש עונות דיה שעתה
human_translation: The Master said passed three cycles her time is sufficient.
llm_translation: Master said: "Three sins have passed over it, the debt is now due."

hebrew_text: הדר קחזיא בעונות מאי אמר רב גידל אמר רב פעם ראשונה ושניה דיה שעתה שלישית מטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה
human_translation: What then sees at cycles? Rav Giddel says Rav says: first time and second her time is sufficient. third she transmits impurity for period or from examination to examination.
llm_translation: "Return and see with regard to sins, what did Rav Giddel say? Rav said: The first and second time, it is her responsibility; now, the third time, it defiles her from time to time and from deposit to deposit."

hebrew_text: ועוד עברו עליה ג' עונות וראתה דיה שעתה הדר קחזיא בעונות מאי
human_translation: and three further cycles passed and she saw blood, her time is sufficient. What then sees at cycles?
llm_translation: And furthermore, three sins passed over it, and she saw a deer. Now, what is the meaning of "Kachazya" in sins?

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא אמר רב גידל אמר רב פעם ראשונה דיה שעתה שניה מטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה
human_translation: Rav Kahana says Rav Giddel says Rav says: first time her time is sufficient. second she transmits impurity for period or from examination to examination.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said, Rav Gidel said, Rav Pa'am said: The first time, she is pure; the second time, she becomes impure from time to time, and is entrusted from one entrustment to another.

hebrew_text: מני רבי היא דאמר בתרי זימני הוי חזקה
human_translation: Who is Rabbi who said presumption is by two occasions.
llm_translation: From Rabbi Hia who said two times it is a presumption.

hebrew_text: אימא סיפא עברו עליה ג' עונות וראתה דיה שעתה אתאן לר"א
human_translation: Say the latter clause: passed three cycles and she saw her time is sufficient. we come to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: Say the latter part: three transgressions were committed against her, and she saw her blood at that time, they came to Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא רבי היא ובעונות סבר לה כר"א ומי סבר לה והא לאחר שנזכר קאמר אלא ר"א היא ובוסתות סבר לה כרבי
human_translation: And if you would say is Rabbi and in cycles holds in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, but does he hold this state after remembered Rather, is Rabbi Eliezer, and with regard to cycles holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi,
llm_translation: And if you say, "It is Rabbi," and regarding sins he holds like Rabbi Eliezer. And who holds like him? But after it was mentioned, he said, "Rather, it is Rabbi Eliezer," and regarding linen garments he holds like Rabbi.

hebrew_text: כתם שבין ראשונה ושניה טהור שבין שניה ושלישית חזקיה אמר טמא רבי יוחנן אמר טהור חזקיה אמר טמא כיון דאילו חזיא מטמאה כתמה נמי טמא ורבי יוחנן אמר טהור כיון דלא אתחזקה בדם כתמה נמי לא מטמינן לה
human_translation: stain between first second pure. between second and third Ḥizkiyya says: impure; Rabbi Yoḥanan says: pure. Ḥizkiyya says: impure, since if she had seen render her impure. stain is also impure. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: pure, since she has not presumptive status of blood. we also do not render her impure her stain.
llm_translation: Stain between first and second pure, between second and third Hazakiah said impure, Rabbi Yohanan said pure, Hazakiah said impure, since if it is seen to be impure, its stain is also impure, and Rabbi Yohanan said pure, since if it did not establish itself with the blood, its stain is also not made impure.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה ר' אלעאי וכי מה בין זו לבתולה שדמיה טהורין א"ל ר' זירא זו שירפה מצוי וזו אין שירפה מצוי
human_translation: Rabbi Ilai objects to this And what between this and virgin whose as her blood is pure, Rabbi Zeira said this her secretion [ sirfah ] is common, But this her secretion is not common.
llm_translation: Challenges him Rabbi Elai: "And what difference is there between this one and a virgin whose blood is pure?" Rabbi Zeira said to him: "This one whose burning is common, and that one whose burning is not common."

hebrew_text: אמר עולא א"ר יוחנן משום ר"ש בן יהוצדק תינוקת שלא הגיע זמנה לראות וראתה פעם ראשונה ושניה רוקה ומדרסה בשוק טהור כתמה נמי טהור ולא ידענא אם דידיה אם דרביה
human_translation: Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: a young girl whose time to see has not arrived and she saw one time and a second her saliva and her treads in the marketplace pure her stain also pure. And I do not know if or of his teacher.
llm_translation: Ula said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: A young girl who has not yet reached the age to see, and she saw once and twice, if she spat and trampled in the marketplace, if her spit is pure, she is also pure, and I do not know if it is hers or her teacher's.

hebrew_text: למאי נפקא מינה למיהוי דבריו של אחד במקום שנים
human_translation: What difference is for it to be statement of one in the place of two
llm_translation: To what is this relevant? To establish the words of one in the place of two.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין וכל נחותי ימא אמרוה כר"ש בן יהוצדק
human_translation: When Ravin came all the seafarers [ naḥotei yamma ], they stated as Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak.
llm_translation: When Rabbin and all the elders of the sea came, they said it in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חלקיה בר טובי תינוקת שלא הגיע זמנה לראות אפילו שופעת כל ז' אינה אלא ראיה אחת אפילו שופעת ולא מבעיא פוסקת אדרבה פוסקת הויא לה כשתי ראיות
human_translation: Rav Ḥilkiya bar Tovi says: a young girl whose time to see has not arrived, even continuously discharges for all seven only one sighting Even continuously discharges it is not necessary stops On the contrary, stops it is as two sightings
llm_translation: Rav Chelkiah son of Tovi said: A young girl who has not reached the age to see, even if she experiences a flow for seven days, it is considered only one sighting. Even if she experiences a flow continuously, it does not require her to stop. On the contrary, if she stops, it is considered as if she had two sightings.

hebrew_text: אלא תינוקת שלא הגיע זמנה לראות ושופעת כל ז' אינה אלא ראיה אחת
human_translation: Rather, a young girl whose time to see has not arrived, and continuously discharges for all seven only one sighting
llm_translation: Rather, a young girl who has not reached the age to see and she has a discharge for seven days, it is only considered one sighting.

hebrew_text: אמר רב שימי בר חייא מדלפת אינה כרואה והא קחזיא אימא אינה כשופעת אלא כפוסקת
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya says: drips not like sighting But saw Say not like continuously discharges rather like stops
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya from Dalfat said: A leaking vessel is not like a pouring vessel. But isn't it visible? Say: It is not like a gushing vessel, but like a dripping vessel.

hebrew_text: מכלל דשופעת (נמי) כי נהרא אלא אימא אינה אלא כשופעת
