llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: Text: "She requires immersion three times, etc." Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this regarding purification, but for her husband, she is permitted. It is obvious! We learned in the Mishnah of the morning.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אתמר אסיפא אתמר ובשעה שהיא עוברת לשמש את ביתה א"ר יהודה אמר שמואל לא שנו אלא באשה עסוקה בטהרות דמגו דבעיא בדיקה לטהרות בעיא נמי בדיקה לבעלה אבל אינה עסוקה בטהרות לא בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, was stated with regard to the latter clause And at a time that she is about to engage in intercourse with her husband. Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: taught only with regard to a woman who is engaged in pure that since required an examination for pure also requires an examination for her husband. But is not engaged in pure not required an examination
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, the conclusion was stated. And at the time when she is approaching sunset, within her house, Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this regarding a woman engaged in ritual purity, for she requires examination for ritual purity, and she also requires examination for her husband. But if she is not engaged in ritual purity, she does not require examination.

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל תנינא כל הנשים בחזקת טהרה לבעליהן אי ממתני' הוה אמינא הני מילי באשה שיש לה וסת אבל אשה שאין לה וסת בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learn All women have the presumptive status of purity to their husbands, If from the mishna I would say this statement to a woman who has cycle. But a woman who does not have cycle, required an examination
llm_translation: What is the reason that we learned: "All women are presumed ritually pure for their husbands"? If it is from the Mishnah, I would say that these words apply to a woman who has a menstrual cycle, but a woman who does not have a menstrual cycle requires examination.

hebrew_text: והא מתני' באשה שיש לה וסת עסקינן מתני' בין שיש לה וסת בין אין לה וסת והא קמ"ל דאע"ג דיש לה וסת מגו דבעיא בדיקה לטהרות בעיא נמי בדיקה לבעלה
human_translation: But aren’t we are dealing the mishna with of a woman who has cycle? is dealing both where she has cycle she does not have cycle. And this teaches us: That even though she has cycle, since required an examination for pure also required an examination for her husband.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: regarding a woman who has a veset, we are dealing with. The Mishnah teaches: whether she has a veset or she does not have a veset. And this teaches us that even though she has a veset, just as there is a need for examination for her purity, there is also a need for examination for her husband.

hebrew_text: והא אמרה שמואל חדא זימנא דאמר רבי זירא אמר רבי אבא בר ירמיה אמר שמואל אשה שאין לה וסת אסורה לשמש עד שתבדוק ואוקימנא בעסוקה בטהרות חדא מכלל חברתה אתמר
human_translation: But didn’t Shmuel state another occasion? As Rabbi Zeira said Rabbi Abba bar Yirmeya says Shmuel says: a woman who does not have cycle, forbidden until she examines And we interpreted where she is engaged in pure one was stated by inference from the other.
llm_translation: And behold, Shmuel said once the time that Rabbi Zeira said Rabbi Abba bar Yirmiya said Shmuel a woman who does not have a cloth is forbidden to engage in marital relations until she inspects and establishes herself in purity. This was said in the context of her being occupied with matters of ritual purity, as a deduction from her association with her companions.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי בד"א לטהרות אבל לבעלה מותרת בד"א שהניחה בחזקת טהורה אבל הניחה בחזקת טמאה לעולם היא בטומאתה עד שתאמר לו טהורה אני
human_translation: This is also taught In what is this statement, said? for pure But with her husband, she is permitted in what is this statement, said? when left her with the presumptive status of ritual purity. But left her with the presumptive status of ritual impurity, forever in her status of impurity, until she says to him: I am ritually pure.
llm_translation: It was also taught in a Baraita: In a case of doubt regarding purity, the wife is permitted. In a case of doubt regarding her husband, she is permitted, for she is left in a state of assumed purity. However, if she was left in a state of assumed impurity, she remains in her impurity until she declares to him, "I am pure."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי זירא מרב יהודה אשה מהו שתבדוק עצמה לבעלה אמר ליה לא תבדוק ותבדוק ומה בכך אם כן לבו נוקפו ופורש
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raised a dilemma before Rav Yehuda: What is a woman should examine herself with her husband? said to him: She should not examine And let her examine what with that? If so, heart strike him and he separate
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Zeira from Rav Yehuda: What is the law regarding a woman examining herself for her husband? He said to him: She should not examine, and if she does examine, what harm is there in that? If so, his heart will be pained and he will separate.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי אבא מרב הונא אשה מהו שתבדוק עצמה כשיעור וסת כדי לחייב בעלה חטאת
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raised dilemma before Rav Huna: What is a woman should examine herself period of time menstruation, in order to render her husband liable to a sin offering
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Abba from Rav Huna: What is the ruling regarding a woman who examines herself for impurity in the amount of a barley grain and finds a hair's breadth of blood in order to obligate her husband in a sin offering?

hebrew_text: א"ל מי משכחת לה לבדיקה כשיעור וסת והתניא איזהו שיעור וסת משל לשמש ועד שעומדים בצד המשקוף ביציאות השמש נכנס עד
human_translation: said to him: you find where period of time menstruation? But isn’t it taught What is period of time menstruation? comparable to organ and an examination cloth that are standing alongside the doorpost, upon the exit of organ examination cloth enters.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Who remembers her for inspection as the size of a barley grain?" And it was taught: What is the size of a barley grain? It is like the sun, from when they stand at the edge of the window until the sun sets.

hebrew_text: הוי וסת שאמרו לקנוח ולא לבדיקה אלא מהו שתקנח
human_translation: It is the period of time that they stated for wipe, and not examination. Rather, What is should wipe
llm_translation: Be and prickly pear that they said to prickly pear and not to inspection but what that you prickly pear

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי הכי בעא מיניה אשה מהו שתבדוק עצמה כדי לחייב בעלה אשם תלוי אמר לו לא תבדוק ותבדוק ומה בכך א"כ לבו נוקפו ופורש
human_translation: Some say this raised before What is a woman should examine herself in order to render her husband liable to a provisional guilt offering said to him: She should not examine And her examine what with that? If so, heart strike him and he separate
llm_translation: There are those who say thus: A woman asked him, "What is the law if she examines herself in order to incriminate her husband?" He said to her, "Do not examine." And she examined. What is the outcome? If so, his heart is pained and he divorces.

hebrew_text: ובשעה שהיא עוברת וכו' אמר ר' אמי אמר רבי ינאי וזהו עדן של צנועות א"ל רבי אבא בר ממל לר' אמי תנא תני צריכות ואת תני צנועות אמר ליה שאני אומר כל המקיים דברי חכמים נקרא צנוע
human_translation: And at a time that she is about to Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Yannai says: And this examination cloth of virtuous women, Rabbi Abba bar Memel said to Rabbi Ami: are required and you teach virtuous women said to him: as I say anyone who fulfills the statements of the Sages is called virtuous.
llm_translation: And at the time when she is passing, etc. Rabbi Ami said, Rabbi Yannai said, "And this is the adornment of modesty." Rabbi Abba bar Memel said to Rabbi Ami, "Teach, teach modesty." And you teach modesty. He said to him, "I say, anyone who upholds the words of the sages is called modest."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ושאינו מקיים דברי חכמים צנוע הוא דלא מקרי הא רשע לא מקרי אלא אמר רבא צנועות עד שבדקו בו עצמן לפני תשמיש זה אין בודקות בו לפני תשמיש אחר ושאינן צנועות בודקות ולא איכפת להן
human_translation: Rava says: And who does not fulfill the statements of the Sages, he is not called virtuous. But he is not called wicked Rather, Rava said: Virtuous women the examination cloth that they used to examine themselves before this intercourse. they do not examine themselves with it prior to another intercourse, And those who are not virtuous women examine and they are not particular
llm_translation: Rava said: And one who does not fulfill the words of the sages is modest, as it is not called wickedness. Rather, Rava said: Modesty is that they examine themselves before this engagement, they do not examine themselves before another engagement. And those who are not modest examine, and they do not care.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רבי זירא אמר רבי אבא בר ירמיה אמר שמואל אשה שאין לה וסת אסורה לשמש עד שתבדוק אמר ליה ר' זירא לרבי אבא בר ירמיה אין לה וסת בעיא בדיקה יש לה וסת לא בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: the itself: Rabbi Zeira says Rabbi Abba bar Yirmeya says Shmuel says: a woman who does not have cycle, forbidden to engage in intercourse until she examines Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abba bar Yirmeya: she does not have cycle required an examination, she has cycle not required an examination?
llm_translation: The text: "Gufa, Rabbi Zeira said, Rabbi Abba bar Yirmeya said, Shmuel said: A woman who does not have a cloth is forbidden to engage in marital relations until she inspects. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abba bar Yirmeya: If she does not have a cloth, she needs inspection; if she has a cloth, she does not need inspection."

hebrew_text: א"ל יש לה וסת ערה בעיא בדיקה ישנה לא בעיא בדיקה אין לה וסת בין ערה בין ישנה בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: said to him: she has cycle awake, required an examination; sleeping not required an examination she does not have cycle, whether awake or sleeping, required an examination.
llm_translation: He said to him: If it has a covering, it requires examination; if it does not require examination. If it has a covering, whether new or old, it requires examination.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ולימא ליה יש לה וסת לטהרות בעיא בדיקה לבעלה לא בעיא בדיקה אין לה וסת אפילו לבעלה נמי בעיא בדיקה ומדלא א"ל הכי ש"מ קסבר שמואל כל לבעלה לא בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: Rava says: And let say to she has cycle, in pure required an examination for her husband not required an examination. does not have cycle, required an examination even for her husband. And from that did not say this learn from Shmuel holds any for her husband, not required an examination.
llm_translation: Rava said: And let us say, if she has a veset for purity, she requires examination for her husband; if she does not have a veset, even for her husband she also requires examination. And since he did not say so to him, thus we learn: Shmuel holds that for any woman, examination is not required for her husband.

hebrew_text: ת"ר חמרין ופועלין והבאין מבית האבל ומבית המשתה נשיהם להם בחזקת טהרה ובאין ושוהין עמהם בין ישנות בין ערות בד"א שהניחן בחזקת טהרה אבל הניחן בחזקת טומאה לעולם היא טמאה עד שתאמר לו טהורה אני
human_translation: The Sages taught donkey drivers and laborers and those who come from the house of mourning or from the house of feasting their wives in a presumptive status of purity. And they may come and remain with them, whether they are sleeping or awake. In what is this statement said? When left in a presumptive state of purity. But left them in a presumptive state of impurity, she forever impurity, until she says to him: I am ritually pure.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Wine merchants, laborers, and those who come from a house of mourning or a house of feasting, their wives are assumed to be in a state of purity. They come and sit with them whether they are old or young, whether they are dressed or undressed. This applies only if they left them in a state of purity. But if they left them in a state of impurity, she remains impure forever until she declares herself pure.

hebrew_text: והא שמואל במאי מוקי לה אי בשיש לה וסת קשיא ערה ואי בשאין לה וסת קשיא בין ערה בין ישנה
human_translation: But with regard to what Shmuel interpret this with who has cycle, difficult, awake And if to who does not have cycle, difficult, whether awake or sleeping.
llm_translation: And Shmuel, with what is she acquired? If with six, it is difficult: nakedness. And if with seven, it is difficult: whether nakedness or sleep.

hebrew_text: לעולם בשיש לה וסת וכיון שתבעה אין לך בדיקה גדולה מזו אמר ליה רב פפא לרבא מהו למעבד כי הא מתניתא
human_translation: Actually, where she has cycle, and since requested of her there is no greater examination than this. Rav Pappa said to Rava: What is to acting in accordance with this baraita ?
llm_translation: Forever in six to her and six and once she demanded you do not have a great investigation from this said to him Rav Papa to Rava what to do when this Mishnah

hebrew_text: א"ל סודני לא דמגניא באפיה אמר רב כהנא שאלתינהו לאינשי ביתיה דרב פפא ודרב הונא בריה דרב יהושע כי אתו רבנן מבי רב מצרכי לכו בדיקה ואמרו לי לא ולישיילינהו לדידהו דילמא אינהו קא מחמירי אנפשייהו
human_translation: said to Wise one [ sudani ]! No, won’t she be demeaned before him? Rav Kahana says: I asked the members of the households, of Rav Pappa and of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: When the Sages, came from study hall, require you an examination prior And they said to me: No. But ask themselves? Perhaps acting stringently with themselves.
llm_translation: He said to me: "The secret is not that he is angry with her." Rav Kahana said: I asked the people of the house of Rav Papa and Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua when the Rabbis came from the house of Rav for their needs, they examined them and said to me, "No." And they should have asked them for themselves, perhaps they are being strict on themselves.

hebrew_text: ת"ר אשה שאין לה וסת אסורה לשמש ואין לה לא כתובה ולא פירות ולא מזונות ולא בלאות ויוציא ולא מחזיר עולמית דברי ר"מ
human_translation: The Sages taught a woman who does not have cycle, forbidden to engage in intercourse, and she does not have marriage contract nor produce nor sustenance nor worn clothes must divorce and he may never remarry the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A woman who does not have a marriage contract is forbidden to engage in marital relations, and she does not have a marriage contract, nor does she have any benefits, nor sustenance, nor clothing, and he may divorce her without giving her the marriage settlement, and he does not need to return it. This is the eternal ruling of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא בן אנטיגנוס אומר משמשת בשני עדים הן עותוה הן תקנוה משום אבא חנן אמרו אוי לו לבעלה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: engage in intercourse with two examination cloths, They her detriment they her betterment, They said in the name of Abba Ḥanan: Woe to her husband!
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says, "She serves with two witnesses, whether they are her witnesses or his witnesses, in the name of Abba Hanan they said, 'Woe to her husband.'"

hebrew_text: אסורה לשמש דילמא מקלקלת ליה ואין לה כתובה כיון דלא חזיא לביאה לית לה כתובה
human_translation: forbidden to engage in intercourse, perhaps she will ruin And she does not have marriage contract, since not fit for intercourse, she is not marriage contract.
llm_translation: It is forbidden to engage in sexual intercourse, perhaps she will cause him harm, and she does not have a marriage contract, since she is not fit for intercourse, she does not have a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: ולא פירות ולא מזונות ולא בלאות תנאי כתובה ככתובה דמו
human_translation: And not produce nor sustenance nor worn clothes. stipulations in the marriage contract are considered like the marriage contract
llm_translation: And not fruits and not sustenance and not without conditions, a marriage contract is like a document of their own.

hebrew_text: ויוציא ולא יחזיר עולמית פשיטא לא צריכא דהדרה ואתקנה מהו דתימא ליהדרה קמ"ל דזימנין דאזלא ומנסבא ומתקנא
human_translation: must divorce and he may never remarry obvious? No, necessary where was subsequently amended, Lest you say may remarry her, teaches us as sometimes go and marry and subsequently amended.
llm_translation: He took out and did not return - it is obvious, not necessary to say, as he will return. What is the law if one might say he will return? It teaches that sometimes he goes, marries, and establishes himself.

hebrew_text: ואמר אילו הייתי יודע שכך היה אפילו הייתם נותנין לי מאה מנה לא הייתי מגרשה ונמצא גט בטל ובניה ממזרין
human_translation: And say: If I would have known that it is like this, even if you would have given me one hundred one hundred dinars I would not have divorced her. And bill of divorce found void, and her children mamzerim .
llm_translation: And he said, "If I had known that this was the case, even if you were to give me a hundred minas, I would not have divorced her, and it would be found that the divorce document is nullified, and her children would be considered illegitimate."

hebrew_text: משום אבא חנן אמרו אוי לו לבעלה איכא דאמרי לר"מ אמר ליה דבעי לאגבויה כתובתה איכא דאמרי לרבי חנינא בן אנטיגנוס קא"ל דמקלקלת ליה
human_translation: They said in the name of Abba Ḥanan: Woe to her husband! Some say he said this to Rabbi Meir, as required to settle her marriage contract some say he said this to Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus, as she will ruin him
llm_translation: Due to Abba Hanan they said: Woe to her husband. Some say it was said to Rabbi Meir: He said to him, "She requires her marriage settlement." Some say it was said to Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus: He said to him, "You are causing him distress."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל הלכה כר' חנינא בן אנטיגנוס ובמאי אי בעסוקה בטהרות הא אמרה שמואל חדא זימנא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus. And with regard to what If is engaged in pure didn’t Shmuel say another occasion
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus. And with what? If it is in matters of ritual purity, then Shmuel said once.

hebrew_text: ואי בשאינה עסוקה בטהרות הא אמר כל לבעלה לא בעיא בדיקה דא"ר זירא א"ר אבא בר ירמיה אמר שמואל אשה שאין לה וסת אסורה לשמש עד שתבדוק ואוקימנא לה בעסוקה בטהרות מאן דמתני הא לא מתני הא
human_translation: And if who is not engaged in pure doesn’t say any for her husband, not required an examination? As Rabbi Zeira said Rabbi Abba bar Yirmeya says Shmuel says: A woman who does not have cycle is forbidden to engage in intercourse until she examines and we interpreted this where she is engaged in pure He who teaches this does not teach that,
llm_translation: And if she is not engaged in matters of ritual purity, if so, he said, "Every woman to her husband does not require inspection," as Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Abba bar Yirmiyah said Shmuel, "A woman who does not have a cloth is forbidden to engage in marital relations until she inspects and establishes it for herself in matters of ritual purity. Who taught this? This one did not teach this."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך שמאי אומר
llm_translation: We shall return to you, Shammai says:

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל היד המרבה לבדוק בנשים משובחת ובאנשים תקצץ
human_translation: any hand that is diligent to examine among women is praiseworthy. But among men should be severed,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Any hand that is diligent in inspecting women is praiseworthy, and in men it should be cut off.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מ"ש נשים ומאי שנא אנשים נשים לאו בנות הרגשה נינהו משובחות אנשים דבני הרגשה נינהו תקצץ
human_translation: What is different women and what is different men, Women are not susceptible to arousal praiseworthy; men, who are susceptible to arousal should be severed.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is the difference between women and men? Women, are they not daughters of intuition, and men, are they not sons of intuition?

hebrew_text: אי הכי מאי איריא מרבה כי לא מרבה נמי כי קתני מרבה אנשים
human_translation: If so, why specifically diligent when is not diligent also When teaches: diligent with regard to women,
llm_translation: If so, what is the difference? If he does not increase, also if he increases, as it teaches: he increases people.

hebrew_text: תנא בד"א לענין שכבת זרע אבל לענין זוב אף הוא משובח כנשים
human_translation: taught In what is this statement, said? with regard to semen. But with regard to discharge [ zov ], he too is praiseworthy as women
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: In the case of seminal emission, a mourner is exempt, but in the case of abnormal genital discharge, he is also praised like women.

hebrew_text: ואפי' לענין שכבת זרע אם בא לבדוק בצרור או בחרס בודק
human_translation: And even with regard to semen, if one wants to examine with a rock or with earthenware, he may examine
llm_translation: And even regarding the matter of seminal emission, if one comes to check in a bundle or in a pot, he checks.

hebrew_text: ובמטלית לא והתניא בודק עצמו במטלית ובכל דבר שרוצה כדאמר אביי במטלית עבה הכא נמי במטלית עבה
human_translation: And not with cloth? But isn’t it taught may examine himself with a cloth, or with any item that he wants? as Abaye said, to a coarse cloth, here too, to a coarse cloth,
llm_translation: And in a cloth, no. And it was taught: One examines himself with a cloth, and with anything he desires, as Abaye said: With a thick cloth. Here too, with a thick cloth.

hebrew_text: והיכא איתמר דאביי אהא דתנן היה אוכל בתרומה והרגיש שנזדעזעו איבריו אוחז באמתו ובולע את התרומה
human_translation: And where was of Abaye stated? with regard to that which we learned was eating teruma and he sensed that his limbs quaked, hold his penis and swallow the teruma
llm_translation: And where was it stated that Abaye said: "Behold, as we learned in a Mishnah: If one was eating terumah and felt that his limbs were trembling, he should grasp his cloak and swallow the terumah."

hebrew_text: אוחז והתניא רבי אליעזר אומר כל האוחז באמתו ומשתין כאילו מביא מבול לעולם אמר אביי במטלית עבה
human_translation: hold But isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: anyone who holds his penis and urinates, as though he is bringing a flood to the world, Abaye says with a coarse cloth.
llm_translation: He holds, and it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Anyone who holds his private member and urinates, it is as though he brings a flood to the world." Abaye said: with a thick cloth.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אפילו תימא במטלית רכה כיון דעקר עקר ואביי חייש דלמא אתי לאוסופי ורבא לא חייש דלמא אתי לאוסופי
human_translation: Rava says You even say with a soft cloth, once has uprooted uprooted, And Abaye concerned perhaps come to increase But Rava is not concerned perhaps come to increase
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you say with a soft cloth, since it is uprooted, and Abbaye is concerned lest it may come to be added, and Rava is not concerned lest it may come to be added.

hebrew_text: ולא והתניא הא למה זה דומה לנותן אצבע בעין שכל זמן שאצבע בעין עין מדמעת וחוזרת ומדמעת
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught To what is this comparable? To places a finger in eye, for as long as finger in the eye, eye will tear and continue to tear.
llm_translation: And not and it was taught: What is this comparable to? To one who puts a finger in the eye, for as long as the finger is in the eye, the eye tears and tears again.

hebrew_text: ורבא כל אחמומי והדר אחמומי בשעתיה לא שכיח
human_translation: And Rava any warming and then warming at the time uncommon
llm_translation: And Rava, all "Achmumei" and then "Achmumei" in his time, is not common.

hebrew_text: גופא ר"א אומר כל האוחז באמה ומשתין כאילו מביא מבול לעולם אמרו לו לרבי אליעזר והלא נצוצות נתזין על רגליו ונראה ככרות שפכה ונמצא מוציא לעז על בניו שהן ממזרים
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi Eliezer says: anyone who holds penis and urinates, as though he is bringing a flood to the world. said to Rabbi Eliezer: But small drops are sprayed on his legs, and he appears as one whose penis has been severed. and as a result cast aspersions about his children that they are children born from a forbidden relationship [ mamzerim ].
llm_translation: The text: "Gufa, Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who holds his private part and urinates, it is as if he brings a flood to the world. They said to Rabbi Eliezer: But don't sparks fly off his feet and it appears as if he is sowing seed, and it turns out he brings disgrace upon his children who are mamzerim."

hebrew_text: אמר להן מוטב שיוציא לעז על בניו שהן ממזרים ואל יעשה עצמו רשע שעה אחת לפני המקום
human_translation: said to them: It is preferable that cast aspersions about his children that they are mamzerim , and he should not render himself wicked one moment before the Omnipresent.
llm_translation: He said to them, "It is better to attribute illegitimacy to his sons, who are mamzerim, than for him to make himself wicked for one moment before the Omnipresent."

hebrew_text: תניא אידך אמר להן רבי אליעזר לחכמים אפשר יעמוד אדם במקום גבוה וישתין או ישתין בעפר תיחוח ואל יעשה עצמו רשע שעה אחת לפני המקום
human_translation: is taught another Rabbi Eliezer said to Rabbis possible Let a person stand on an elevated place and urinate or urinate into loose soil, and he should not render himself wicked one moment before the Omnipresent.
llm_translation: It was taught: Another opinion Rabbi Eliezer said to the sages, "Is it possible for a person to stand in a high place and urinate, or to urinate in the dust in a concealed manner, and not make himself wicked for even one moment before the Omnipresent?"

hebrew_text: הי אמר להו ברישא אילימא קמייתא אמר להו ברישא בתר דאמר להו איסורא הדר אמר להו תקנתא
human_translation: Which did say to first? If we say first said to first, after saying to them a prohibition, would he then say to them remedy?
llm_translation: He said to them at first, "If you say in the beginning," he said to them at first, after he said to them the prohibition, he said to them the remedy.

hebrew_text: אלא הא אמר להו ברישא ואמרו ליה אין לו מקום גבוה ועפר תיחוח מאי אמר להן מוטב שיוציא לעז על בניו ואל יעשה עצמו רשע שעה אחת לפני המקום
human_translation: Rather, he said this to first, and they said to him: one does not have an elevated place or loose earth what he said to them: It is preferable cast aspersions about his children that they are mamzerim , and he should not render himself wicked one moment before the Omnipresent.
llm_translation: Rather, he said to them initially, and they said to him, "He has no high place, and dust is his resting place." What did he say to them? "It is better that he should bear disgrace upon his children and not make himself wicked for one moment before the Omnipresent."

hebrew_text: וכל כך למה מפני שמוציא שכבת זרע לבטלה דא"ר יוחנן כל המוציא שכבת זרע לבטלה חייב מיתה שנאמר (בראשית לח, י) וירע בעיני ה' (את) אשר עשה וימת גם אותו
human_translation: And to that extent Because he emit semen for naught. As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Anyone who emits semen for naught is liable death as it is stated And the thing that he did was evil in the eyes of the Lord, and He slew him also”
llm_translation: And all this, why? Because he emits seed in vain. As Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who emits seed in vain is liable to death, as it is stated (Genesis 38:10), "And it was evil in the eyes of the Lord what he did, and He caused him also to die."

hebrew_text: רבי יצחק ורבי אמי אמרי כאילו שופך דמים שנאמר (ישעיהו נז, ה) הנחמים באלים תחת כל עץ רענן שוחטי הילדים בנחלים תחת סעיפי הסלעים אל תקרי שוחטי אלא סוחטי
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak and Rabbi Ami say: as though he sheds blood, as it is stated: you that inflame yourselves among the terebinths, under every leafy tree, that slay [ shoḥatei ] the children in the valleys, under the clefts of the rocks?” Do not read shoḥatei ; rather, soḥatei ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak and Rabbi Ami said: It is as if one spills blood, as it is stated (Isaiah 57:5), "Who inflame yourselves among the terebinths, under every leafy tree, who slaughter the children in the valleys, under the clefts of the rocks." Do not read "shochtei" (slaughterers), but rather "sochtei" (crushers).

hebrew_text: רב אסי אמר כאילו עובד עבודת כוכבים כתיב הכא תחת כל עץ רענן וכתיב התם (דברים יב, ב) על ההרים הרמים ותחת כל עץ רענן
human_translation: Rav Asi says: as though he worships idols, it is written here: “Under every leafy tree,” and it is written there, upon the high mountains, and under every leafy tree”
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: It is as if one worships idols. It is written here, "Under every lush tree," and it is written there (Deuteronomy 12:2), "On the high mountains and under every lush tree."

hebrew_text: רב יהודה ושמואל הוו קיימי אאיגרא דבי כנישתא דשף ויתיב בנהרדעא אמר ליה רב יהודה לשמואל צריך אני להשתין א"ל שיננא אחוז באמתך והשתן לחוץ
human_translation: Rav Yehuda and Shmuel were standing on the roof of the synagogue that was destroyed and rebuilt in Neharde’a. Rav Yehuda said to Shmuel: I need to urinate. said to him: Shinnana , hold your penis, and urinate outward,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah and Shmuel were sitting in the upper chamber of the synagogue of Shaf, and they were sitting in Nehardea. Rav Yehudah said to Shmuel, "I need to urinate." He said to him, "Hold onto your cloak and urinate outside."

hebrew_text: היכי עביד הכי והתניא ר"א אומר כל האוחז באמתו ומשתין כאילו מביא מבול לעולם
human_translation: How could do so? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: anyone who holds his penis and urinates, as though he is bringing a flood to the world?
llm_translation: How does one do so? And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Anyone who holds back his urine, it is as though he brings a flood upon the world."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי עשאו כבולשת דתנן בולשת שנכנס לעיר בשעת שלום חביות פתוחות אסורות סתומות מותרות בשעת מלחמה אלו ואלו מותרות לפי שאין להן פנאי לנסך אלמא דכיון דבעיתי לא אתי לנסוכי הכא נמי כיון דבעיתי לא אתי להרהורי
human_translation: Abaye says: rendered like a troop of marauders, as we learned a troop of marauders that entered a town, in a time of peace, open casks are forbidden, sealed are permitted. In a time of war, these and those are permitted, because do not have leisure to pour libations. Evidently, since are afraid, they will not come to pour libations. Here too, since he is afraid he will not come to have thoughts.
llm_translation: Abaye said: He made it like a "bulshat," as we learned in a Mishnah: A "bulshat" that enters a city during a time of peace, open barrels are prohibited, closed barrels are permitted. During a time of war, both open and closed barrels are permitted, because they do not have time to pour. This implies that since you did not come to pour, you also did not come to think.

hebrew_text: והכא מאי ביעתותא איכא איבעית אימא ביעתותא דליליא ודאיגרא ואיבעית אימא ביעתותא דרביה ואב"א ביעתותא דשכינה ואיבעית אימא אימתא דמריה עליה דקרי שמואל עליה אין זה ילוד אשה
human_translation: And what fear is there here, If you wish, say the fear of the night and of the roof, And if you wish, say the awe of his teacher, And if you wish, say the awe of the Divine Presence And if you wish, say the awe of his Master, as Shmuel declared about This one is not born of a woman,
llm_translation: And here, what is the meaning of "bi'atuta"? If you wish, say it is the "bi'atuta" of night and of the day. And if you wish, say it is the "bi'atuta" of his master. And some say, the "bi'atuta" of the Divine Presence. And if you wish, say it is the time of her husband's arrival, as it is written about her, "this is not the offspring of a woman."

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא נשוי הוה דאמר רב נחמן אם היה נשוי מותר
human_translation: And if you wish, say was married; as Rav Naḥman said: If one is married, permitted
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that he was married, for Rav Nachman said: If he was married, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא כי הא אורי ליה דתני אבא בריה דרבי בנימין בר חייא אבל מסייע בביצים מלמטה ואיבעית אימא כי הא אורי ליה דאמר רבי אבהו אמר רבי יוחנן גבול יש לו מעטרה ולמטה מותר
human_translation: And if you wish, say ruled for in accordance with this which Abba, son of Rabbi Binyamin bar Ḥiyya, teaches: but may assist by testicles from below. And if you wish, say Shmuel ruled in accordance with that which Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan says: There is demarcation From the corona and below, permitted
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: because this is illuminated to him, as Abba, son of Rabbi Benjamin, son of Chiyah, taught. But one who assists with eggs from below. And if you wish, say: because this is illuminated to him, as Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: he has a boundary above and below is permitted.

hebrew_text: מעטרה ולמעלה אסור
human_translation: From the corona and above, prohibited.
llm_translation: Crown and above - forbidden.

hebrew_text: אמר רב המקשה עצמו לדעת יהא בנדוי ולימא אסור דקמגרי יצה"ר אנפשיה ורבי אמי אמר נקרא עבריין שכך אומנתו של יצר הרע היום אומר לו עשה כך ולמחר אומר לו עשה כך ולמחר אומר לו לך עבוד עבודת כוכבים והולך ועובד
human_translation: Rav says: One who intentionally causes himself an erection shall be ostracized. And let say prohibited. as he arouses the evil inclination upon himself. And Rabbi Ami says: He is called transgressor, as this is the craft of the evil inclination. Today he says to Do this and on the following day says to him: Do that and on the following day he says to him: Go worship idols, and he goes and worships
llm_translation: Rav said: One who wishes to tempt himself to sin should be excommunicated, and he should say, "It is forbidden, for the evil inclination deceives itself." And Rabbi Ami said: He is called a Hebrew, for this is the craft of the evil inclination. Today it says to him, "Do this," and tomorrow it says to him, "Do that," and the next day it says to him, "Go worship idols," and he goes and worships.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אמר רבי אמי כל המביא עצמו לידי הרהור אין מכניסין אותו במחיצתו של הקב"ה כתיב הכא (בראשית לח, י) וירע בעיני ה' וכתיב התם (תהלים ה, ה) כי לא אל חפץ רשע אתה לא יגורך רע
human_translation: Some say Rabbi Ami says: anyone who brings himself into arousal, do not bring him within the boundary of the Holy One, Blessed be He. it is written here, “And the thing that he did was evil in the eyes of the Lord, and it is written there: “For You are not a God who has pleasure in wickedness; evil shall not sojourn with You.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rabbi Ami said: Anyone who brings himself to thoughts of sin, he is not brought into the partition of the Holy One, blessed be He. It is written here (Genesis 38:10), "And it was evil in the eyes of the Lord," and it is written there (Psalms 5:5), "For You are not a God who desires wickedness; evil does not abide with You."

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' אלעזר מאי דכתיב (ישעיהו א, טו) ידיכם דמים מלאו אלו המנאפים ביד תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל (שמות כ, יג) לא תנאף לא תהא בך ניאוף בין ביד בין ברגל
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says, What which is written: your hands are full of blood” These are who commit adultery with the hand, the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “You shall not commit adultery” there shall not be adultery among you, whether by hand whether with foot.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: What is the meaning of what is written (Isaiah 1:15), "Your hands are full of blood"? These are the adulterers. This is the teaching of the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Exodus 20:13), "You shall not commit adultery; there shall be no adultery in you, whether by hand or by foot."

hebrew_text: ת"ר הגרים והמשחקין בתינוקות מעכבין את המשיח בשלמא גרים כדר' חלבו דא"ר חלבו קשין גרים לישראל כספחת אלא משחקין בתנוקות מאי היא
human_translation: The Sages taught Converts and those who play with children delay the Messiah. Granted converts, in accordance with of Rabbi Ḥelbo, as Rabbi Ḥelbo says: Converts are as harmful to the Jewish people as a leprous scab But those who play with children, what is it
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Converts and those who play with young children delay the arrival of the Messiah. Granted, converts, as Rabbi Ḥelbo said in the name of Rabbi Ḥelbo, "Converts are as difficult for Israel as a scab." But what is meant by "those who play with young children"?

hebrew_text: אילימא משכב זכור בני סקילה נינהו אלא דרך אברים בני מבול נינהו
human_translation: If we say homosexuality, are liable to stoning, Rather, by way of limbs, they are liable to a flood.
llm_translation: If we were to say that "lying with a male" refers to stoning, then the sons of Noah were stoned. Rather, "way of women" refers to the sons of the Flood.

hebrew_text: אלא דנסיבי קטנות דלאו בנות אולודי נינהו דא"ר יוסי אין בן דוד בא עד שיכלו כל הנשמות שבגוף שנאמר (ישעיהו נז, טז) כי רוח מלפני יעטוף ונשמות אני עשיתי
human_translation: Rather, that they marry minor girls who are not capable of bearing children, As Rabbi Yosei said: The son of David, will not come until all the souls of the body have been finished, As it is stated: “For the spirit that enwraps itself is from Me, and the souls that I have made”
llm_translation: Rather, they are minor marriages, not daughters of childbirth, as Rabbi Yosei said: The son of David will not come until all the souls in the body are finished, as it is stated (Isaiah 57:16): "For I will not contend forever, nor will I always be angry, for the spirit would grow faint before Me, and the souls which I have made."

hebrew_text: באנשים תקצץ איבעיא להו דינא תנן או לטותא תנן דינא תנן כי הא דרב הונא קץ ידא או לטותא תנן
human_translation: among men, should be severed. A dilemma was raised before Do we learn halakha , or do we learn curse, Do we learn halakha like that Rav Huna severed the hand Or do we learn curse?
llm_translation: In men shall you cut off - It was asked: Is the law as we learned in the Mishnah, or as we learned in the Tosefta? The law is as we learned in the Mishnah, for this is what Rav Huna said: "Cut off the hand."

hebrew_text: ת"ש דתניא רבי טרפון אומר יד לאמה תקצץ ידו על טבורו אמרו לו ישב לו קוץ בכריסו לא יטלנו א"ל לא אמר להן מוטב תבקע כריסו ואל ירד לבאר שחת
human_translation: Come hear, as it is taught Rabbi Tarfon says: hand to penis, his hand should be severed upon his navel. said to him: a thorn was stuck in belly, should he not remove it? said to them: not But won’t his belly be split open? said to them: It is preferable that the belly of should be split open, and he should not descend into the pit of destruction.
llm_translation: Come and hear: as it was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Tarfon says, "A hand to an Amah shall be cut off; his hand upon his navel." They said to him, "If a thorn is sitting in his skin, should he not remove it?" He said to them, "No. It is better that he should tear his skin and not descend into the pit of destruction."

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא דינא תנן היינו דאמרי והלא כריסו נבקעת אלא אי אמרת לטותא תנן מאי כריסו נבקעת אלא מאי דינא תנן לא סגי דלאו על טבורו
human_translation: Granted, if you say we learn halakha , this is which said: But won’t his belly be split open? But if you say we learn curse, what his belly be split open? Rather, what we learn halakha ? not sufficient that not upon his navel?
llm_translation: If you say, "In terms of the law, we learned that," that is what they say. But isn't it that the curtain was torn? Rather, if you say, "In terms of the thread, we learned," what is meant by "the curtain was torn"? Rather, what we learned in terms of the law is not sufficient, as it is not in its proper place.

hebrew_text: אלא ה"ק רבי טרפון כל המכניס ידו למטה מטבורו תקצץ אמרו לו לרבי טרפון ישב לו קוץ בכריסו לא יטלנו אמר להן לא והלא כריסו נבקעת אמר להן מוטב תבקע כריסו ואל ירד לבאר שחת
human_translation: Rather, this Rabbi Tarfon is saying: anyone who inserts his hand below his navel, should be severed. said to Rabbi Tarfon: a thorn was stuck in belly, should he not remove it? said to them: not. But won’t his belly be split open said to them: It is preferable that his belly be split open, and he should not descend into the pit of destruction.
llm_translation: Rather, the Holy One, blessed be He, said: Rabbi Tarfon, anyone who inserts his hand below his navel, his hand shall be cut off. They said to Rabbi Tarfon: If a thorn is stuck in his belly, should he not remove it? He said to them: No. But isn't his belly going to burst? He said to them: It is better that his belly burst than he descend into the pit of destruction.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ החרשת והשוטה והסומא ושנטרפה דעתה אם יש להן פקחות מתקנות אותן והן אוכלות בתרומה
human_translation: who is deaf [ haḥereshet ], or an imbecile, or blind, or who went insane, if have competent prepare them And may partake of teruma
llm_translation: Mishnah: The deaf, the imbecile, the blind, and one whose mind is deranged, if they have understanding, they may rectify their status, and they may eat terumah.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ חרשת איהי תבדוק לנפשה דתניא אמר רבי חרשת היתה בשכונתינו לא דיה שבודקת לעצמה אלא שחברותיה רואות ומראות לה
human_translation: a deaf woman. Let her examine herself; as it is taught Rabbi said: There was a deaf woman in our neighborhood not only did she examine herself, but her friends would see and show her
llm_translation: Gemara: Charashet was examined for itself as it was taught: Rabbi said, "Charashet was in our neighborhood, not that it examines itself, but its companions see and show it."

hebrew_text: התם במדברת ואינה שומעת הכא בשאינה מדברת ואינה שומעת כדתנן חרש שדברו חכמים בכל מקום אינו שומע ואינו מדבר
human_translation: There, to can speak but cannot hear. here, with who can neither speak nor hear, As we learned deaf person whom the Sages spoke everywhere who can neither hear nor speak,
llm_translation: There, in a case of a mute person who cannot hear; here, in a case of a person who is not speaking and cannot hear. As we have learned in the Mishnah: A deaf-mute, in any place where the Sages speak, he cannot hear and he cannot speak.

hebrew_text: הסומא איהי תבדוק לנפשה ותיחזי לחבירתה א"ר יוסי ברבי חנינא סומא אינה משנה
human_translation: a blind Let her examine herself and show to her friend. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: mishna not a blind
llm_translation: The blind person should examine for themselves and see for their friend. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: A blind person does not change.

hebrew_text: ושנטרפה דעתה היינו שוטה שנטרפה דעתה מחמת חולי
human_translation: a woman who went insane. isn’t this an imbecile, who went insane due to illness,
llm_translation: And if her mind was impaired - that is, she is considered a fool if her mind was impaired due to illness.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן כהן שוטה מטבילין אותו ומאכילין אותו תרומה לערב ומשמרין אותו שלא יישן ישן טמא לא ישן טהור
human_translation: The Sages taught an imbecile priest They immerse him, and enable him to partake of teruma in the evening, And watch over him that he does not sleep he slept, impure, did not sleep pure.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A foolish priest, we immerse him and feed him terumah on the eve, and we guard him so that he does not fall asleep. If he falls asleep, if he is impure, he should not sleep; if he is pure, he may sleep.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר ברבי צדוק אומר עושין לו כיס של עור אמרו לו כל שכן שמביא לידי חימום אמר להן לדבריכם שוטה אין לו תקנה
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says One prepares for him a leather pouch, said to him: all the more so warms him said to them: According to your statement, an imbecile has no remedy
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: They make for him a leather pouch. They said to him: All the more so that it leads to heating. He said to them: According to your words, a fool has no remedy.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לדברינו ישן טמא לא ישן טהור לדבריך שמא יראה טפה כחרדל ותבלע בכיס
human_translation: They said to him: According to our statement he slept, impure; did not sleep pure. according to your statement, perhaps he will see, a drop as a mustard and it will be absorbed in the pouch
llm_translation: They said to him: "For our words, one who is asleep is impure, one who is awake is pure." According to your words, perhaps a drop will appear like a mustard seed and be swallowed in a pocket.

hebrew_text: תנא משום רבי אלעזר אמרו עושין לו כיס של מתכת
human_translation: taught said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: One prepares for him a metal pouch,
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Elazar: they make for him a purse of metal.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ושל נחשת כדתניא רבי יהודה אומר רואין אותן גבעולין של אזוב כאילו הן של נחשת
human_translation: Abaye says: And of copper, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: One considers those hyssop stems, as though they are of copper,
llm_translation: Abbaye said, and of copper, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One sees the stalks of hyssop as though they were of copper."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא שמע מינה מכנסים אסורים והכתיב (שמות כח, מב) ועשה להם מכנסי בד לכסות בשר ערוה
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: learn from trousers are prohibited But isn’t it written “And you shall make them linen trousers to cover the flesh of their nakedness,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Learn from this, that tight pants are forbidden, and it is written (Exodus 28:42), "And you shall make for them linen pants to cover their nakedness."

hebrew_text: ההוא כדתניא מכנסי כהנים למה הן דומין כמין פמלניא של פרשים למעלה עד מתנים למטה עד ירכים ויש להם שנצים ואין להם לא בית הנקב ולא בית הערוה
human_translation: That as it is taught The trousers of priests, to what are they comparable? similar to riding trousers [ pamalanya ] of horsemen, Above, up to loins; below, down to thighs, and they have straps, and they have no opening, at the back nor at the front.
llm_translation: That one, as it was taught in a Baraita: The priestly tunics, why are they likened to the coats of the Persians? From above to the waist, down to the ankles, and they have sleeves, but they do not have neither a split nor a hem.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי
human_translation: Abaye says:
llm_translation: Said Abaye

hebrew_text: רוכבי גמלים אסורין לאכול בתרומה תניא נמי הכי רוכבי גמלים כולם רשעים הספנים כולם צדיקים
human_translation: It is prohibited for camel riders to partake of teruma , This is also taught Camel riders are all wicked, Sailors are all righteous,
llm_translation: Riders of camels forbidden to eat of the heave-offering. It was also taught likewise: Riders of camels, all of them are wicked; sailors, all of them are righteous.

hebrew_text: החמרים מהן רשעים מהן צדיקים איכא דאמרי הא דמכף הא דלא מכף ואיכא דאמרי הא דמטרטין הא דלא מטרטין
human_translation: donkey drivers, of them are wicked of them are righteous. there are who say this as is saddled, that as is not saddled, And there are who say: This as he spreads [ demittartein ] that as he does not spread
llm_translation: The donkeys from them wicked from them righteous there are some who say this one who kicks this one who does not kick and there are some who say this one who brays this one who does not bray

hebrew_text: ריב"ל לייט אמאן דגני אפרקיד איני והאמר רב יוסף פרקדן לא יקרא קרית שמע קרית שמע הוא דלא יקרא הא מגנא שפיר דמי
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi would curse one who sleeps lying on his back [ aparkeid ], Is that so? But doesn’t Rav Yosef say: lying on his back may not recite Shema ? it is only Shema that one may not recite but lying permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: Who is the one who will teach me? I am a disciple. But didn't Rav Yosef say: A disciple should not recite the Shema? The recitation of the Shema is not considered recitation.

hebrew_text: לענין מגנא כי מצלי שפיר דמי לענין ק"ש כי מצלי אסור והא ר' יוחנן מצלי וקרי ק"ש שאני רבי יוחנן דבעל בשר הוה
human_translation: With regard to sleeping when one leans slightly permitted. with regard to reciting Shema when one leans slightly prohibited. But wouldn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan leaning slightly and recite Shema Rabbi Yoḥanan is different, as he was corpulent,
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of a shield, when one recites it well, it is permitted. Regarding the matter of Shema, when one recites it well, it is forbidden. But isn't it so that Rabbi Yochanan recites it and reads Shema? Rabbi Yochanan is different, for he was a man of flesh.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ דרך בנות ישראל משמשות בשני עדים אחד לו ואחד לה והצנועות מתקנות שלישי לתקן את הבית
human_translation: the custom of Jewish women they engage in intercourse while two examination cloths, one for and one for her, And the modest prepare a third to prepare area
llm_translation: Mishnah: The way of Jewish women is to require two witnesses, one for him and one for her, and the modest ones arrange a third to repair the house.

hebrew_text: נמצא על שלו טמאין וחייבין קרבן נמצא על שלה אותיום טמאין וחייבין בקרבן נמצא על שלה לאחר זמן טמאין מספק ופטורים מן הקרבן
human_translation: was found on his ritually impure and are liable to offering was found on her immediately [ otyom ] ritually impure and are liable to offering. was found on her after time ritually impure due to uncertainty, and they are exempt from the offering.
llm_translation: Found on its own - impure and obligated in offering. Found on hers - impure and obligated in offering. Found on hers after some time - impure in doubt and exempt from the offering.

hebrew_text: איזהו אחר זמן כדי שתרד מן המטה ותדיח פניה ואח"כ מטמאה מעת לעת ואינה מטמאה את בועלה ר"ע אומר אף מטמאה את בועלה
human_translation: What is After time equivalent to for her to descend from the bed and rinse her face, And afterward, she transmits impurity for period, but she does not transmit impurity to the man with whom she engaged in intercourse. Rabbi Akiva says: she even transmits impurity to the man with whom she engaged in intercourse.
llm_translation: Which is the time after which she descends from the bed and washes her face, and afterwards she becomes impure from time to time, and she does not render impure her husband? Rabbi Akiva says, she even renders her husband impure.

hebrew_text: מודים חכמים לרבי עקיבא ברואה כתם שמטמאה את בועלה
human_translation: The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Akiva in sees stain that she transmits impurity to the man with whom she engaged in intercourse,
llm_translation: The sages concede to Rabbi Akiva regarding a woman who sees a stain that renders her husband impure.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ וניחוש דלמא דם מאכולת הוא אמר רבי זירא אותו מקום בדוק הוא אצל מאכולת ואיכא דאמרי דחוק הוא אצל מאכולת
human_translation: But let us be concerned perhaps it is the blood of a louse, Rabbi Zeira says: that place, is examined [ baduk ] with regard to a louse, And some say That place is narrow [ daḥuk ] for a louse
llm_translation: Gemara: And we suspect that perhaps it is blood of food. Rabbi Zeira said: That place is examined near food. And there are those who say: It is tight near food.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו דאשתכח מאכולת רצופה להך לישנא דאמר בדוק הוא הא מעלמא אתאי להך לישנא דאמר דחוק הוא אימא שמש רצפה
human_translation: What is between between them where a squashed louse was found According to this version, which states examined with regard to a louse, this came from elsewhere, according to that version, which states is narrow for a louse say organ squashed it
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them regarding a continuous eating. That one said it is pure, while the other said it is impure. Say it is a sunken floor.

hebrew_text: אתמר בדקה בעד הבדוק לה וטחתו בירכה ולמחר מצאה עליה דם אמר רב טמאה נדה א"ל רב שימי בר חייא והא חוששת אמרת לן
human_translation: was stated: examined with a cloth that was examined by her and she pressed it against her thigh, and on the following day she found blood on Rav says: impure a menstruating woman. Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya said to But didn’t you say to us she concerned
llm_translation: It was stated: If a woman was examined in a checked place and they found blood on her thigh, and the next day they found blood on her, Rav said: She is impure due to menstruation. Rav Shimei bar Ḥiyya said to him: But didn't you say that we are concerned?

hebrew_text: איתמר נמי אמר שמואל טמאה נדה וכן מורין בי מדרשא טמאה נדה
human_translation: was also stated Shmuel says: She impure a menstruating woman. And they likewise rule the study hall impure a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: It was also stated: Shmuel said: "Tamei Niddah," and so do they teach in the study hall: "Tamei Niddah."

hebrew_text: אתמר בדקה בעד שאינו בדוק לה והניחתו בקופסא ולמחר מצאה עליו דם א"ר יוסף כל ימיו של ר' חייא טימא ולעת זקנתו טיהר
human_translation: was stated: examined with a cloth that was not examined by her and she placed it in a box and on the following day she found blood on Rav Yosef says: All the days of Rabbi Ḥiyya he would deem impure, but in his old age he would deem pure.
llm_translation: It was stated: If a woman was examined and found to be unexamined, and she placed it in a box, and the next day blood was found on it, Rabbi Yosef said: Throughout the lifetime of Rabbi Chiya he was impure, but in his old age he became pure.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו היכי קאמר כל ימיו טימא משום נדה ולעת זקנתו טיהר משום נדה וטימא משום כתם
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before what is he speaking? all his days would deem impure as a menstruating woman, and in his old age he would deem pure a menstruating woman, but would deem impure as a stain,
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: How does one interpret "all his days he shall remain impure because of a discharge, and when his flesh emits a discharge, he shall be impure because of his discharge"?

hebrew_text: או דלמא כל ימיו טימא משום כתם ולעת זקנתו טיהר מולא כלום
human_translation: Or perhaps all his days would deem impure due to stain, and in his old age he would deem pure from any
llm_translation: Or perhaps all his days he was impure due to a blemish, and at the time of his old age he became pure, is it as if nothing had been done?

hebrew_text: תא שמע דתניא בדקה בעד שאינו בדוק לה והניחתו בקופסא ולמחר מצאה עליו דם רבי אומר טמאה משום נדה ורבי חייא אמר טמאה משום כתם
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught examined with a cloth that was not examined by her and she placed it in a box, and on the following day she found blood on Rabbi says: She is impure as a menstruating woman, and Rabbi Ḥiyya says: She is impure due to stain.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: If a woman checked herself and found her examination to be clear, and then placed it in a box, and the next day found blood on it, Rabbi says it is impure due to menstruation, and Rabbi Chiya says it is impure due to a stain.

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' חייא אי אתה מודה שצריכה כגריס ועוד א"ל אבל אמר לו א"כ (אתה) אף אתה עשיתו כתם
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Do you not concede that she requires more than a split bean? said to him: Indeed [ aval ], said to him: If so, you too render a stain,
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Chiya: If you admit that she needs like a barley grain, and furthermore he said to him: But if so, you also did it as a blemish.

hebrew_text: ורבי סבר בעינן כגריס ועוד לאפוקי מדם מאכולת וכיון דנפק לה מדם מאכולת ודאי מגופה אתא
human_translation: And Rabbi maintains we require more than a split bean, to exclude the blood of a louse; and since the blood of a louse has been excluded, it certainly came from her body,
llm_translation: Rabbi holds: We require like a piece and furthermore to exclude from the blood of food. And once it emerges from the blood of food, certainly it comes from her body.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו בזקנותו קאי הא בילדותו טימא משום נדה שמע מינה
human_translation: What, is it not was in his old age in his youth he would deem impure as a menstruating woman. conclude from
llm_translation: What does "lo b'ziknuto" refer to? This refers to his childhood. It is impure due to menstruation. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: משתבח ליה רבי לרבי ישמעאל ברבי יוסי ברבי חמא בר ביסא דאדם גדול הוא אמר לו לכשיבא לידך הביאהו לידי
human_translation: Rabbi praise Rabbi Ḥama bar Bisa to Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, that he is a great man. said to When he comes to you, bring him to me.
llm_translation: Rabbi praised Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chama, son of Bisa, saying to him, "When he comes to you, bring him to me."

hebrew_text: כי אתא א"ל בעי מינאי מילתא בעא מיניה בדקה בעד שאינו בדוק לה והניחתו בקופסא ולמחר מצאה עליו דם מהו
human_translation: When came said to him: Ask me matter. asked him: examined with a cloth that was not examined by her and she placed it in a box, and on the following day she found blood on what is
llm_translation: When he came, he said to him, he asked him a matter, he asked of him, he checked, in a case where he did not check for it, and he left it in a box, and the next day he found blood on it, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אמר לו כדברי אבא אימא לך או כדברי רבי אימא לך א"ל כדברי רבי אימא לי
human_translation: said to him: Shall I say to you in accordance with the statement of father, or shall I say to you in accordance with the statement of Rabbi said to him: Say to me in accordance with the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: He said to him: According to the words of Abba, I will say to you. Or according to the words of Rabbi, I will say to you. He said to him: According to the words of Rabbi, say to me.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי ישמעאל זהו שאומרין עליו דאדם גדול הוא היאך מניחין דברי הרב ושומעין דברי התלמיד
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said: this that says about him that he is a great man? How can he neglect the statement of the teacher, and listen to the statement of the student,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yishmael: This is what they say about him, "He is a great man; how do we place the words of the master and hear the words of the disciple?"

hebrew_text: ור' חמא בר ביסא סבר רבי ריש מתיבתא הוא ושכיחי רבנן קמיה ומחדדי שמעתתיה
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥama bar Bisa maintains Rabbi he is the head of the yeshiva, and the Sages are frequently in his presence, and his statements are sharper
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ḥama bar Bisa holds that Rabbi is the head of the academy, and the Rabbis are often before him and sharpen his teachings.

hebrew_text: מאי רבי ומאי רבי יוסי אמר רב אדא בר מתנא תנא רבי מטמא ורבי יוסי מטהר
human_translation: What Rabbi and what Rabbi Yosei, Rav Adda bar Mattana says taught Rabbi deems impure and Rabbi Yosei deems pure.
llm_translation: What is the ruling of Rabbi and what is the ruling of Rabbi Yosi? Rav Adda bar Matna said: Rabbi taught that it is impure, and Rabbi Yosi taught that it is pure.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי זירא כשטימא רבי כר"מ וכשטיהר רבי יוסי לעצמו טיהר
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira says, When Rabbi deemed impure, in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and when Rabbi Yosei deemed pure, he deemed pure in accordance with his own
llm_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said: When Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi became ritually impure, Rabbi Meir would become impure with him, and when he became ritually pure, Rabbi Yosei would purify himself.

hebrew_text: דתניא האשה שהיתה עושה צרכיה וראתה דם ר"מ אומר אם עומדת טמאה אם יושבת טהורה
human_translation: As it is taught a woman who was urinating and saw blood Rabbi Meir says: If standing, impure, If sitting, pure,
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: "A woman who was engaged in her needs and saw blood - Rabbi Meir says: If she is standing, she is impure; if she is sitting, she is pure."

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי אומר בין כך ובין כך טהורה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Whether this or whether that pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Whether this way or that way, she is pure."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי והא א"ר יוסי בר' חנינא כשטימא ר"מ לא טימא אלא משום כתם ואילו רבי משום נדה קאמר א"ל אנן הכי קאמרינן כי איתמר ההיא משום נדה איתמר
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: But doesn’t Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, say when Rabbi Meir deemed impure he merely deemed her impure due to stain, whereas Rabbi said as a menstruating woman? said to This is what we are saying: When that was stated, it was stated as a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, to Rav Ashi, but didn't Rabbi Yosei, son of Chanina, say, "When he becomes impure, Rabbi Meir did not become impure, except due to a stain, while Rabbi said it was due to menstruation"? He said to him, "We say this when it was stated regarding menstruation, it was stated."

hebrew_text: נמצא על שלה אותיום טמאין וכו' ת"ר איזהו שיעור וסת משל לשמש ועד שעומדין בצד המשקוף ביציאת שמש נכנס עד
human_translation: was found on her immediately ritually impure The Sages taught What is period of time menstruation, comparable to organ and a cloth that are standing alongside the doorpost, at the exit of organ cloth enters.
llm_translation: It is found on its peak on the day impure, etc. The Rabbis taught: What is the measurement of the shadow? A parable to the sun, from when it stands at the edge of the window until sunset it enters.

hebrew_text: הוי וסת שאמרו לקינוח אבל לא לבדיקה
human_translation: This is the period of time which said: to wipe But not with regard to examination.
llm_translation: Be and sat that they said to kinnuch but not to bedikah.

hebrew_text: נמצא על שלה לאחר זמן וכו' תנא וחייבין אשם תלוי ותנא דידן מ"ט
human_translation: was found on her after time taught But they are liable to a provisional guilt offering And the tanna of our what is the reason
llm_translation: Found on Shela after time etc. It was taught: And they are liable for a hanging guilt-offering. And our Tanna teaches: What is the reason?

hebrew_text: בעינן חתיכה משתי חתיכות
human_translation: we require piece from two pieces,
llm_translation: We require a piece from two pieces.

hebrew_text: איזהו אחר זמן וכו' ורמינהי איזהו אחר זמן פירש ר' אליעזר ברבי צדוק כדי שתושיט ידה תחת הכר או תחת הכסת ותטול עד ותבדוק בו
human_translation: What is after time raises a contradiction What is after time Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, explained: equivalent which she may extend her hand under the cushion or under the blanket and take a cloth and examine with it.
llm_translation: Which is after a time, etc. And they raised a contradiction: Which is after a time? Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok explained: In order that she may extend her hand beneath the floor or beneath the pillow, and take a witness and examine with it.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא מאי אחר אחר אחר
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: What After, After, after.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: What is "achar achar achar"?

hebrew_text: והא קתני עלה נמצא על שלה לאחר זמן טמאין מספק ופטורין מן הקרבן איזהו אחר זמן כדי שתרד מן המטה ותדיח פניה
human_translation: But isn’t it taught with regard to was found on her after time ritually impure due to uncertainty, and they are exempt from the offering. What is after time equivalent to for her to descend from the bed and rinse her face,
llm_translation: And behold, it was taught: If a fetus is found on a Shelah after some time, they are deemed impure with uncertainty and exempt from the offering. What is considered "after some time"? The time it takes for it to descend from the bed and turn its face.

hebrew_text: ה"ק איזהו אחר זמן כדי שתושיט ידה לתחת הכר או לתחת הכסת ותטול עד ותבדוק בו וכדי שתרד מן המטה ותדיח את פניה מחלוקת ר"ע וחכמים
human_translation: this is saying: What is after time equivalent which she may extend her hand under the cushion or under the blanket and take a cloth and examine with it, And equivalent to for her to descend from the bed and rinse her face, a dispute between Rabbi Akiva and the Rabbis
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is considered a sufficient amount of time for a woman to extend her hand beneath the pillow or beneath the blanket, take a linen cloth, examine it, and then descend from the bed and turn her face away? This is a dispute between Rabbi Akiva and the Sages.

hebrew_text: והא אח"כ קתני ה"ק וזהו אח"כ שנחלקו ר"ע וחכמים
human_translation: But doesn’t teach: Afterward, this is saying: And this is Afterward, which Rabbi Akiva and the Rabbis disagree.
llm_translation: And this, afterwards, it is taught: "And this is afterwards when Rabbi Akiva and the Sages disagreed."

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר אידי ואידי חד שיעורא הוא עד בידה כדי שתרד מן המטה ותדיח את פניה אין עד בידה כדי שתושיט ידה לתחת הכר או לתחת הכסת ותטול עד ותבדוק בו
human_translation: Rav Ashi says this and that are one period, cloth in her hand, Equivalent to for her to descend from the bed and rinse her face. cloth is not in her hand, equivalent which she may extend her hand under the cushion or under the blanket and take a cloth and examine with it,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Both this and that is one measure, until it is in her hand, enough for her to descend from the bed and wash her face. It is not considered in her hand if it is enough for her to extend her hand below the pillow or below the blanket, and take a thread and examine with it.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי איזהו אחר זמן דבר זה שאל רבי אלעזר ברבי צדוק לפני חכמים באושא ואמר להם
human_translation: raises an objection What is after time this matter Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, asked the Sages in Usha, and he said to them:
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: The Tannaite scholars raised an objection: What is considered "after some time"? This matter was asked by Rabbi Elazar, the son of Rabbi Tzadok, before the sages in Usha, and he said to them:

hebrew_text: שמא כרבי עקיבא אתם אומרים שמטמאה את בועלה אמרו לו לא שמענו

llm_translation: Perhaps like Rabbi Akiva, they say she defiles him. They said to him, "We did not hear."

hebrew_text: אמר להם כך פרשו חכמים ביבנה לא שהתה כדי שתרד מן המטה ותדיח את פניה תוך זמן הוא זה וטמאין מספק ופטורין מקרבן וחייבין באשם תלוי
human_translation: said to them: This the Sages of Yavne explained did not wait equivalent to which she may descend from the bed and rinse her face, this is within time And impure due to uncertainty, and they are exempt from offering, But they are obligated to a provisional guilt offering.
llm_translation: He said to them: "Thus the sages explained in Yavneh: If she did not reach the age of descending from the bed and turning her face within a certain time, this is it, and they are impure with uncertainty, exempt from offering, and obligated in a hanging guilt-offering."

hebrew_text: שהתה כדי שתרד מן המטה ותדיח את פניה אחר הזמן הוא זה
human_translation: she waited equivalent to which she may descend from the bed and rinse her face, this is After time,
llm_translation: She was waiting to descend from the bed and turn her face after the time is this.

hebrew_text: וכן כששהתה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה בועלה מטמא משום מגע ואינו מטמא משום בועל רבי עקיבא אומר אף מטמא משום בועל רבי יהודה בנו של רבן יוחנן בן זכאי אומר בעלה נכנס להיכל ומקטיר קטורת
human_translation: and likewise when she waited for period or from examination to examination, the man with whom she engaged in intercourse becomes impure due to contact but he does not become impure as one who engaged in intercourse Rabbi Akiva says: He even becomes impure as one who engaged in intercourse Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, says: her husband he may enter the Sanctuary and burn incense.
llm_translation: And so when she pauses from time to time and from appointment to appointment, her husband renders her impure due to contact, but he does not render her impure due to intercourse. Rabbi Akiva says: He even renders her impure due to intercourse. Rabbi Yehuda, the son of Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, says: Her husband enters the sanctuary and burns incense.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרב חסדא היינו דמטהרי רבנן
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav Ḥisda, this is that the Rabbis deem pure
llm_translation: In accordance with Rav Ḥisda, that is why the Sages are purified.

hebrew_text: אלא לרב אשי אמאי מטהרי רבנן
human_translation: But according to Rav Ashi, why do the Rabbis deem pure
llm_translation: Rather, to Rav Ashi, why do the Rabbis purify?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא דאין עד בידה האי עד בידה ואין עד בידה מיבעי ליה קשיא

llm_translation: And if you say that there is no witness in her hand, this witness is in her hand, and if there is no witness in her hand, it is difficult for him.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה בנו של רבן יוחנן בן זכאי אומר בעלה נכנס להיכל ומקטיר קטורת ותיפוק ליה דהוה נוגע במעת לעת שבנדה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, says: her husband may enter the Sanctuary and burn incense. And let him derive that he is one who touched a menstruating woman during period
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah, son of Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, says: "Her husband enters the sanctuary and burns incense, and she becomes impure at the time of her menstrual period."

hebrew_text: הוא דאמר כשמאי דאמר כל הנשים דיין שעתן
human_translation: who said like Shammai, who said all women, their time is sufficient,
llm_translation: He who said like Shammai who said all the women their judgment time

hebrew_text: ותיפוק ליה דהוה בעל קרי בשלא גמר ביאתו
human_translation: And let him derive because he is one who experienced a seminal emission. to did not complete his intercourse.
llm_translation: And it emerged for him that he was a ba'al keri when he did not complete his entry.

hebrew_text: ומודים חכמים לרבי עקיבא ברואה כתם אמר רב למפרע ורבי מאיר היא
human_translation: And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Akiva in sees stain, Rav says retroactively, and is Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: And the Sages concede to Rabbi Akiva regarding one who sees a stain. Rav said: "It is for the purpose of distinction," and Rabbi Meir said: "It is."

hebrew_text: ושמואל אמר מכאן ולהבא ורבנן היא מכאן ולהבא פשיטא
human_translation: And Shmuel says from now and onward, and is the Rabbis, from now and onward? obvious?
llm_translation: And Samuel said, "From here and onwards," and the Rabbis said, "From here and onwards," it is obvious.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא הואיל ומעת לעת דרבנן וכתמים דרבנן מה מעת לעת לא מטמאה את בועלה אף כתמים לא מטמאה את בועלה קא משמע לן

llm_translation: What is the reasoning? Since from time to time the Rabbis and the impurities of the Rabbis, just as from time to time it does not render her who has intercourse with it impure, so too the impurities do not render her who has intercourse with them impure. This is what it teaches us.

hebrew_text: ואימא הכי נמי התם אין שור שחוט לפניך הכא יש שור שחוט לפניך
human_translation: But say indeed, There, not slaughtered ox is before you, here, is slaughtered ox is before you,
llm_translation: And say also there, "There is no ox slaughtered before you." Here, there is an ox slaughtered before you.

hebrew_text: וכן אמר ריש לקיש למפרע ורבי מאיר היא רבי יוחנן אמר מכאן ולהבא ורבנן היא
human_translation: And Reish Lakish similarly says, retroactively, and is Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yoḥanan says, from now and onward, and is the Rabbis.
llm_translation: And so said Reish Lakish to Mafraya, and Rabbi Meir, it is Rabbi Yochanan said, from here and onwards, and the Rabbis said.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הנשים בחזקת טהרה לבעליהן הבאין מן הדרך נשיהן להן בחזקת טהרה
human_translation: All women have the presumptive status of purity for their husbands, returning from a journey, their wives have the presumptive status of purity for them.
llm_translation: Mishnah: All women in a presumptive state of purity for their husbands who come from the road, their wives are presumed pure for them.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ למה ליה למתני הבאין מן הדרך סד"א הני מילי היכא דאיתיה במתא דרמיא אנפשה ובדקה אבל היכא דליתא במתא דלא רמיא אנפשה לא קא משמע לן
human_translation: Why to teach returning from a journey? enter your mind to say: This statement, where is in the city as takes upon herself and she examines But where is not in the city, since she does not take upon herself not teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: Why did the Mishnah teach "those who come from the road"? This matter applies where there is a place in the city of Ramya itself, and he checked. But where there is no place in a city that is not Ramya itself, it does not teach us.

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש משום רבי יהודה נשיאה והוא שבא ומצאה בתוך ימי עונתה
human_translation: Reish Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda Nesia: And is where came and found within the days of her period,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yeshaya said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda the Prince: "And he found her within her designated time."

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא ל"ש אלא שאין לה וסת אבל יש לה וסת אסור לשמש
human_translation: Rav Huna says: taught only who does not have cycle. But who does have cycle, it is prohibited to engage in intercourse
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to Shmuel, "Rather, if it does not have a covering, but if it does have a covering, it is forbidden to use."

hebrew_text: כלפי לייא אדרבה איפכא מסתברא אין לה וסת אימא חזאי יש לה וסת וסת קביע לה
human_translation: Isn’t it the opposite? On the contrary; reverse stands to reason: does not have cycle, say she saw she has cycle, her cycle is fixed for her
llm_translation: Towards Leah, on the contrary, it is logical that she does not have a letter. Rather, say: "Behold, she does have a letter." A fixed letter she has.

hebrew_text: אלא אי איתמר הכי איתמר אמר רב הונא ל"ש אלא שלא הגיע שעת וסתה אבל הגיע שעת וסתה אסורה קסבר וסתות דאורייתא
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, was stated like this: Rav Huna says: taught only when the time of period had not arrived But the time of her period had arrived, she is forbidden maintains periods by Torah law,
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rav Huna said: "This is only permissible if the time of concealment has not arrived. But if the time of concealment has arrived, it is forbidden." He holds that menstrual periods are prohibited by Torah law.

hebrew_text: רבה בר בר חנה אמר אפילו הגיע שעת וסתה נמי מותרת קסבר וסתות דרבנן
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: Even the time of her period had arrived, she is permitted maintains periods by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: Even if the time of concealment has arrived, it is also permitted. He holds that the concealments are of Rabbinic origin.

hebrew_text: רב אשי מתני הכי אמר רב הונא
human_translation: Rav Ashi teaches like this: Rav Huna says:
llm_translation: Rav Ashi teaches: Rav Huna said thus:

hebrew_text: לא שנו אלא שאין לה וסת לימים אלא יש לה וסת לימים ולקפיצות כיון דבמעשה תליא מילתא אימא לא קפיץ ולא חזאי אבל יש לה וסת לימים אסורה לשמש
human_translation: taught only where she does not have cycle of days but has cycle by days and by jumps. since matter is dependent on action, say she did not jump and she did not see But has cycle of days it is prohibited for her to engage in intercourse
llm_translation: They only taught that it does not have a covering for days, but it does have a covering for days and for leaps. Since the matter depends on action, say: it did not leap and it did not see. But if it has a covering for days, it is forbidden to use.

hebrew_text: קסבר וסתות דאורייתא
human_translation: maintains periods by Torah law.
llm_translation: He holds: and the linen garments of the Torah.

hebrew_text: רבה בר בר חנה אמר אפילו יש לה וסת לימים מותרת קסבר וסתות דרבנן
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: Even she has cycle of days she is permitted maintains periods by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: Even if she has a veset for days, she is permitted. He holds that the vesetot are Rabbinic.

hebrew_text: אמר רב שמואל משמיה דרבי יוחנן אשה שיש לה וסת בעלה מחשב ימי וסתה ובא עליה
human_translation: Rav Shmuel says in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: a woman who has cycle, her husband calculates the days of her cycle; and he may engage in intercourse with her
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A woman who has a fixed menstrual cycle, her husband should calculate her days of menstruation and come upon her.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב שמואל בר ייבא לרבי אבא אמר רבי יוחנן אפילו ילדה דבזיזא למטבל
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yeiva said to Rabbi Abba: Rabbi Yoḥanan state even a young girl, who is embarrassed to immerse
llm_translation: Said to him Rav Shmuel bar Yeyva to Rabbi Abba: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Even a Zizah's child can immerse.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אטו ודאי ראתה מי אמר רבי יוחנן אימר דאמר רבי יוחנן ספק ראתה ספק לא ראתה ואם תמצא לומר ראתה אימא טבלה
human_translation: said to Is that to say Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say definitely saw say that Rabbi Yoḥanan said it is uncertain saw it is uncertain she did not see and If you say she saw say she immersed.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Did you definitely see?" Who said Rabbi Yochanan said, "Say that Rabbi Yochanan said: If there is doubt whether you saw or did not see, and if you find to say you saw, say 'tevul yom'."

hebrew_text: אבל ודאי ראתה מי יימר דטבלה הוה ליה ספק וודאי ואין ספק מוציא מידי ודאי
human_translation: But she definitely saw Who is to say that she immersed? It is an uncertainty and a certainty and an uncertainty does not override a certainty.
llm_translation: But certainly, if she saw, who would say that the immersion was a doubtful one? And certainly, a doubt does not remove certainty.

hebrew_text: ולא והתניא חבר שמת והניח מגורה מלאה פירות אפילו הן בני יומן הרי הן בחזקת מתוקנין והא הכא ודאי טבל ספק מעושר ספק אינו מעושר וקאתי ספק ומוציא מידי ודאי
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught a ḥaver who died and left a storehouse filled with produce, even that day, presumptive status prepared, And here, definitely untithed uncertainty tithed it, uncertainty he did not tithe it. And the uncertainty comes and overrides the certainty
llm_translation: And not and it was taught: A friend who died and left a full granary of fruits, even if they are still within the period of a day, they are considered as properly arranged. But here, it is certain that he tithed a doubtful case of whether it is tithed or not tithed, and he comes and takes out something certain.

hebrew_text: התם ודאי וודאי הוא כדרב חנינא חוזאה דאמר רב חנינא חוזאה חזקה על חבר שאינו מוציא מתחת ידו דבר שאינו מתוקן
human_translation: There, is certainty and certainty, in accordance with of Rav Ḥanina Ḥoza’a; as Rav Ḥanina Ḥoza’a said: a presumption with regard to a ḥaver that he does not release an item from his possession that is not prepared.
llm_translation: There, certainly, it is as Rav Hanina Chozah said, for Rav Hanina Chozah said: A presumption is established against a fellow who does not remove from beneath his hand an item that is not fixed.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא ספק וספק הוא וכדרבי אושעיא דא"ר אושעיא מערים אדם על תבואתו ומכניסה במוץ שלה כדי שתהא בהמתו אוכלת ופטורה מן המעשר
human_translation: And if you wish, say is uncertainty and uncertainty, in accordance with of Rabbi Oshaya. As Rabbi Oshaya said: A person can employ artifice with his grain, and bring it into in its chaff, so that his animal may eat and is exempt from tithe.
llm_translation: If you will ask, say: it is a doubt, and it is a doubt. And like Rabbi Oshaya said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: A person can declare ownership over his produce and place it in its straw, so that his animal may eat from it, and he is exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: ואכתי אין ספק מוציא מידי ודאי והתניא מעשה בשפחתו של מסיק אחד ברימון שהטילה נפל לבור ובא כהן והציץ בו לידע אם זכר אם נקבה
human_translation: And still, an uncertainty does not override a certainty? But isn’t it taught an incident involving the maidservant of a certain olive gatherer [ massik ] in Rimon, who cast a non-viable newborn into a pit, and a priest came and looked to ascertain whether male whether female,
llm_translation: And thus, there is no doubt that one who definitely removes an item is liable.
