And it was taught in a Baraita: There was an incident with the maidservant of a certain person who threw a pomegranate into a pit, and a priest came and peered into it to know whether it the pomegranate was male or female.

hebrew_text: ובא מעשה לפני חכמים וטהרוהו מפני שחולדה וברדלס מצויים שם
human_translation: And incident came before the Sages and they deemed him ritually pure. Due to that martens and hyenas are common there,
llm_translation: And came the incident before the sages, and they purified it because it was found to have a membrane and a spot of mold there.

hebrew_text: והא הכא דודאי הטילה נפל ספק גררוהו ספק לא גררוהו וקאתי ספק ומוציא מידי ודאי
human_translation: And here, where it is certain cast non-viable newborn uncertain dragged it uncertain no dragged it an uncertainty comes and overrides a certainty.
llm_translation: And here, indeed, Doday cast it, uncertain whether he dragged it or did not drag it, and it came out uncertainly and he is liable.

hebrew_text: לא תימא הטילה נפל לבור אלא אימא
human_translation: Do not say that cast a non-viable newborn into a pit; rather, say
llm_translation: Do not say "he cast her into the pit," rather say:

hebrew_text: כמין נפל
human_translation: similar to a non-viable newborn
llm_translation: Like a fallen species.

hebrew_text: והא לידע אם זכר אם נקבה קתני
human_translation: But isn’t it taught to ascertain whether male whether female?
llm_translation: And this, to know if male or female, it teaches.

hebrew_text: ה"ק ובא כהן והציץ בו לידע אם נפל הפילה אם רוח הפילה ואת"ל נפל הפילה לידע אם זכר אם נקבה
human_translation: this is saying: And a priest came and glanced at to ascertain whether discharged a non-viable newborn, whether she discharged an amorphous mass. And if you say she discharged a non-viable newborn, to ascertain whether male whether female.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "It was taught in a Baraita: And the priest shall come and look, to see whether the afterbirth has fallen or the afterbirth's spirit has fallen. And some say: The afterbirth has fallen, to determine whether it is male or female."

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא כיון דחולדה וברדלס מצויים שם ודאי גררוהו
human_translation: And if you wish, say Since martens and hyenas are common there, they certainly dragged it
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Since Chuldah and Bardelas are present there, surely they dragged him.

hebrew_text: בעו מיניה מרב נחמן וסתות דאורייתא או דרבנן
human_translation: asked Rav Naḥman: periods, by Torah law? Or by rabbinic law?
llm_translation: They asked from Mar bar Nachman: Are sotah cases of biblical or rabbinic origin?

hebrew_text: אמר להו מדאמר הונא חברין משמיה דרב אשה שיש לה וסת והגיע שעת וסתה ולא בדקה ולבסוף ראתה חוששת לוסתה וחוששת לראייתה אלמא וסתות דאורייתא
human_translation: said to them: from that which Huna our colleague said in the name of Rav: a woman who has cycle, and the time of her period arrived and she did not examine herself, and ultimately, she saw she must be concerned for her period And she must be concerned to her seeing Evidently, periods by Torah law,
llm_translation: He said to them: From when Huna said in the name of Rav, a woman who has a menstrual cycle, and the time of her cycle arrived, and she did not check, and in the end she saw, she is concerned about her cycle and concerned about seeing. This implies that menstrual cycles are biblical.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי הכי קא"ל טעמא דראתה הא לא ראתה אין חוששין אלמא וסתות דרבנן
human_translation: There are who say this is what said to reason that saw she did not see not concerned Evidently, periods by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: There are those who say thus: "The reason for this is that if she saw, she saw; if she did not see, we are not concerned." This implies that it is a Rabbinic decree.

hebrew_text: איתמר אשה שיש לה וסת והגיע שעת וסתה ולא בדקה ולבסוף בדקה אמר רב בדקה ומצאת טמאה טמאה טהורה טהורה ושמואל אמר אפילו בדקה ומצאת טהורה נמי טמאה מפני שאורח בזמנו בא
human_translation: was stated a woman who has cycle, and the time of her period arrived and she did not examine herself, and ultimately she examined Rav says: she examined and found ritually impure, she is impure; pure, she is pure. And Shmuel says: Even she examined and found pure, she is impure. because manner comes at its time.
llm_translation: It was stated: A woman who has a menstrual flow, and the time of her menstrual flow arrived, and she did not inspect herself, and ultimately she inspected herself. Rav said: If she inspected herself and found herself impure, she is impure; if she found herself pure, she is pure. And Shmuel said: Even if she inspected herself and found herself pure, she is also impure, because the norm in its time has arrived.

hebrew_text: לימא בוסתות קמיפלגי דמ"ס דאורייתא ומ"ס דרבנן
human_translation: Shall we say disagree with regard to periods? As Sage, holds by Torah law, and Sage, holds by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Let us say, the sages dispute regarding the "Bustot" of the Mishnah, whether it is of biblical origin or of rabbinic origin.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' זירא דכ"ע וסתות דאורייתא כאן שבדקה עצמה כשיעור וסת כאן שלא בדקה עצמה כשיעור וסת
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: that everyone, periods by Torah law, here where she examined herself within the period of time menstruation, there, she did not examine herself within the period of time menstruation.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: "Regarding a 'k'ah' and a 'setat' of the Torah, here where it examined itself as a proper measure, and a 'setat' here where it did not examine itself as a proper measure, and a 'setat.'"

hebrew_text: ר"נ בר יצחק אמר בוסתות גופייהו קמיפלגי דמ"ס וסתות דאורייתא ומר סבר וסתות דרבנן
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: disagree with regard to periods itself, as Sage, holds periods by Torah law, and Sage, holds periods by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The disputes are regarding the "bustot" themselves, as Rabbi Meir holds that the "bustot" are of biblical origin, while the Master holds that the "bustot" are of rabbinic origin.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת כתנאי ר' אליעזר אומר טמאה נדה
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: parallel to tanna’im : Rabbi Eliezer says is ritually impure as a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: as it was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Eliezer says, "Impure, menstruating woman."

hebrew_text: ורבי יהושע אומר תבדק והני תנאי כי הני תנאי דתניא רבי מאיר אומר טמאה נדה וחכ"א תבדק
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua says she should be examined And these tanna’im is parallel to those tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Meir says: She is ritually impure as a menstruating woman, and the Rabbis say: She should be examined
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "Examine, and these teachings are like these teachings, as it was taught: Rabbi Meir says 'Impure, menstruating woman,' and the sages say 'Examine.'"

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אף אנן נמי תנינא דתנן ר"מ אומר אם היתה במחבא והגיע שעת וסתה ולא בדקה טהורה שחרדה מסלקת את הדמים טעמא דאיכא חרדה הא ליכא חרדה טמאה אלמא וסתות דאורייתא
human_translation: Abaye said: We, too, learn as we learned Rabbi Meir says: If was in hiding and the time of her period arrived and she did not examine ritually pure, as fear dispels blood, the reason that there is fear but there is no fear she is impure. Evidently, periods by Torah law.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: We also learned in a Mishnah, as Rabbi Meir says: If it was in a hiding place and the time of its inspection arrived, and she did not inspect it, if she is anxious, she removes the blood. The reason is that if there is anxiety, there is no impurity. This implies that biblical inspections are necessary.

hebrew_text: לימא הני תנאי בהא נמי פליגי דתניא הרואה דם מחמת מכה אפילו בתוך ימי נדתה טהורה דברי רשב"ג
human_translation: Shall we say these tanna’im also disagree with regard to this As it is taught who sees blood due to a wound even during the days of her menstruation, she is pure, the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Let us say, these Tannaim also argue in this matter, as it was taught: One who sees blood due to a wound, even within her days of menstruation, she is pure. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: רבי אומר אם יש לה וסת חוששת לוסתה
human_translation: Rabbi says if she has cycle, she must be concerned that her period
llm_translation: Rabbi says: If she has a veset, she is concerned for her veset.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו בהא קמיפלגי דמר סבר וסתות דאורייתא ומר סבר וסתות דרבנן
human_translation: What, is it not disagree with regard to this that Sage, holds periods by Torah law, and Sage, holds periods by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: What is the disagreement here? One Master holds that the "hairs" mentioned in the Torah are of biblical origin, while the other Master holds that they are of rabbinic origin.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא לא דכ"ע וסתות דרבנן והכא במקור מקומו טמא קמיפלגי
human_translation: Ravina says: No; that everyone, periods by rabbinic law, and here they disagree to the location of source, is impure,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Not like the opinion of the Sages, and the Rabbinic decrees, and here they are arguing about a primary source that is impure.

hebrew_text: רשב"ג סבר אשה טהורה ודם טמא דקאתי דרך מקור
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds woman is pure but blood is impure, as it came through source,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel holds: A woman is pure, and the blood is impure that comes in the manner of a source.

hebrew_text: ואמר ליה רבי אי חיישת לוסת אשה נמי טמאה ואי לא חיישת לוסת מקור מקומו טהור הוא
human_translation: And Rabbi said to If you are concerned to period, woman also impure And if you are not concerned to period, source its location, is pure.
llm_translation: And he said to him, Rabbi, if you are concerned about the loss of a woman, she is also impure, and if you are not concerned about the loss of a woman, the source of its place is pure.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בית שמאי אומרים צריכה ב' עדים על כל תשמיש ותשמיש או תשמש לאור הנר בית הלל אומרים דיה בשני עדים כל הלילה:
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: required two cloths, each and every intercourse or engage in intercourse by the light of a lamp Beit Hillel say: sufficient with two cloths throughout the night,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Beit Shammai say, "She requires two witnesses for each act of marital relations." Beit Hillel say, "She requires two witnesses for the entire night."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר אע"פ שאמרו המשמש מטתו לאור הנר הרי זה מגונה בש"א צריכה שני עדים על כל תשמיש או תשמש לאור הנר ובה"א דיה בשני עדים כל הלילה
human_translation: the Sages taught Even though said one who engages in intercourse by the light of a lamp, this is disgraceful, Beit Shammai say: A woman is required two cloths, each intercourse, or engage in intercourse by the light of a lamp. And Beit Hillel say: sufficient with two cloths throughout the night,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: Even though they said one who uses his bed for the light of a lamp is despicable, in the first case, she requires two witnesses for each act of intercourse, or she may engage in intercourse for the light of a lamp, and in the latter case, her status is established with two witnesses for the entire night.

hebrew_text: תניא אמרו להם ב"ש לב"ה לדבריכם ליחוש שמא תראה טיפת דם כחרדל בביאה ראשונה ותחפנה שכבת זרע בביאה שניה
human_translation: is taught Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: According to your statement let us be concerned lest she will see, a drop of blood the size of a mustard during the first intercourse, and semen from the second intercourse will cover it.
llm_translation: It was taught: Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel, "According to your words, one should be concerned lest she see a drop of blood the size of a mustard seed during the first intercourse and become repulsed by the emission during the second intercourse."

hebrew_text: א"ל ב"ה אף לדבריכם ליחוש עד שהרוק בתוך הפה שמא נימוק והולך לו
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to them Even according to your statement, let us be concerned while the saliva in the mouth, perhaps it was squashed and disappeared.
llm_translation: He said to them, "Even according to your words, one should be cautious until the spittle is in the mouth, lest it be swallowed and cause harm."

hebrew_text: אמרו להם לפי שאינו דומה נימוק פעם אחת לנימוק שתי פעמים
human_translation: said to as a squashed once is not similar to a squashed twice,
llm_translation: They said to them, "Because it is not similar, a blemish once to a blemish twice."

hebrew_text: תניא א"ר יהושע רואה אני את דברי ב"ש אמרו לו תלמידיו רבי כמה הארכת עלינו אמר להם מוטב שאאריך עליכם בעוה"ז כדי שיאריכו ימיכם לעוה"ב
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Yehoshua said: I see the statement of Beit Shammai His students said to him: teacher, how you have weighed [ he’erakhta ] us down said to them: It is preferable that I weigh you down in this world, so that your days in the World-to-Come will be lengthened [ sheya’arikhu ].
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua said, "I see the words of Beit Shammai. His students said to him, 'Rabbi, how much have you prolonged upon us?' He said to them, 'It is better that I prolong upon you in this world so that your days will be prolonged in the World to Come.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ר' זירא מדברי כולם נלמד בעל נפש לא יבעול וישנה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: From the statements of all of them, we can learn a pious person [ ba’al nefesh ] should not engage in intercourse and repeat
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: From the words of all, it was learned - a Baal Nefesh should not cohabit and sleep.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר בועל ושונה כי תניא ההיא לטהרות
human_translation: Rava says: may engage in intercourse and repeat when that is taught, to pure items.
llm_translation: Rava said: "One who has intercourse and repeats, for it has been taught: 'That one is for purifications.'"

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי בד"א לטהרות אבל לבעלה מותרת ובד"א שהניחה בחזקת טהרה אבל הניחה בחזקת טמאה לעולם היא בחזקתה עד שתאמר לו טהורה אני
human_translation: This is also taught In what is this statement said, with regard to pure items; but is permitted to her husband But in what is this statement said? When left her with the presumptive status of ritual purity. But left her with the presumptive status of ritual impurity, forever in her presumptive status until she says to him: I am pure.
llm_translation: It was also taught in a Baraita: In a case of doubt regarding purity, she is permitted to her husband. And in a case of doubt where she established a presumption of purity, but if she established a presumption of impurity, she remains in her presumption forever until she says to him, "I am pure."

hebrew_text: א"ר אבא א"ר חייא בר אשי אמר רב בדקה בעד ואבד אסורה לשמש עד שתבדוק מתקיף לה ר' אילא אילו איתא מי לא משמשה ואע"ג דלא ידעה השתא נמי תשמש
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: examined with a cloth, and was lost, it is prohibited for her to engage in intercourse until she examines Rabbi Ila objects to this: If were intact, couldn’t engage in intercourse and even though she does not know Now too, let her engage in intercourse
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rabbi Chiya bar Ashi, Rav said: If a woman was examined and then lost the cloth, she is forbidden to engage in marital relations until she is examined again. Rabbi Ila objected to him: If she was examined, does that mean she is not engaging in marital relations? Even though she does not know if she is ritually impure, she should still engage in marital relations.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא זו מוכיחה קיים וזו אין מוכיחה קיים
human_translation: Rava said to him: this proof exists, But that her proof does not exist,
llm_translation: Rava said: This one is a proof, and this one is not a proof.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן אסור לאדם שישמש מטתו ביום אמר רב המנונא מאי קרא שנאמר (איוב ג, ג) יאבד יום אולד בו והלילה אמר הורה גבר לילה ניתן להריון ויום לא ניתן להריון ריש לקיש אמר מהכא (משלי יט, טז) בוזה דרכיו ימות
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It is prohibited for a person to engage in intercourse by day. Rav Hamnuna says: What is the verse As it is stated: “Let the day perish on which I was born, and the night on which it was said: Conceived is a man-child” nighttime is meant for conception, but daytime is not meant for conception. Reish Lakish says from here: “But he who despises his ways shall die”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: It is forbidden for a person to engage in marital relations during the day. Rav Hamnuna said: What is the verse? As it is stated (Job 3:3), "Let the day perish on which I was born, and the night." Resh Lakish said: From here (Proverbs 19:16), "He who despises his ways will die."

hebrew_text: ור"ל האי קרא דר' יוחנן מאי דריש ביה מבעי ליה לכדדריש רבי חנינא בר פפא דדריש ר' חנינא בר פפא אותו מלאך הממונה על ההריון לילה שמו ונוטל טפה ומעמידה לפני הקב"ה ואומר לפניו רבש"ע טפה זו מה תהא עליה גבור או חלש חכם או טיפש עשיר או עני
human_translation: And how does Reish Lakish interpret this verse by Rabbi Yoḥanan? he requires for that which Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa taught. As Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa interpreted That angel that is appointed over conception is called: Night. And takes drop and presents it before the Holy One, Blessed be He, and says before Him: Master of the Universe, what will be of this drop? mighty or weak? clever or stupid? wealthy or poor?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi this verse of Rabbi Yochanan what he expounds in it requires him to expound Rabbi Chanina bar Papa expounded Rabbi Chanina bar Papa that angel appointed over pregnancy his name is Night and takes a drop and presents it before the Holy One, blessed be He, and says before Him, "Master of the Universe, should this drop be strong or weak, wise or foolish, rich or poor."

hebrew_text: ואילו רשע או צדיק לא קאמר כדר' חנינא דא"ר חנינא הכל בידי שמים חוץ מיראת שמים שנאמר (דברים י, יב) ועתה ישראל מה ה' אלהיך שואל מעמך כי אם ליראה וגו'
human_translation: But does not say: wicked or righteous? in accordance with of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Ḥanina said: Everything is in the hand of Heaven, except for fear of Heaven. as it is stated: “And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you other than to fear
llm_translation: And as for the wicked or righteous, it is not as Rabbi Chanina said, as Rabbi Chanina said: Everything is in the hands of Heaven except for the fear of Heaven, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 10:12), "And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you but to fear..."

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן א"כ נכתוב קרא גבר הורה מאי הורה גבר לילה ניתן להריון ויום לא ניתן להריון
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan If so, let the verse write: A man-child is conceived. What “Conceived is a man-child”? nighttime is meant for conception but daytime is not meant for conception.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: If so, let the verse be written, "A man impregnates." What does it mean, "a man impregnates"? At night it is possible to impregnate, but during the day it is not possible to impregnate.

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן האי קרא דר"ל מאי דריש ביה מבעי לי' לכדכתיב בספר בן סירא שלשה שנאתי וארבעה לא אהבתי שר הנרגל בבית המשתאות ואמרי לה שר הנרגן ואמרי לה שר הנרגז
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, how does he interpret that verse by Reish Lakish? requires to that which is written in the book of ben Sira: Three I have hated, and a fourth I have not loved: A minister who frequents [ hanirgal ] drinking houses, and some say A minister who chats [ hanirgan ] and some say A minister who is short-tempered [ hanirgaz ]
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan this verse of Rabbi Eliezer, what does he seek in it? For it is written in the Book of Ben Sira: "Three things I have hated, and four I have not loved: a prince among the gluttons." And some say: "a prince among the drunkards." And some say: "a prince among the angry."

hebrew_text: והמושיב שבת במרומי קרת והאוחז באמה ומשתין מים והנכנס לבית חבירו פתאום אמר רבי יוחנן ואפילו לביתו
human_translation: And one who dwells at the highest point of the city, and one who holds penis and urinates. And one who enters the house of another suddenly, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And even into his house
llm_translation: And one who sits on Shabbat in the heights of the city and holds his garment and urinates water, and one who enters his friend's house suddenly, Rabbi Yochanan said: Even to his own house.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי שמעון בן יוחאי ארבעה דברים הקב"ה שונאן ואני איני אוהבן הנכנס לביתו פתאום ואצ"ל לבית חבירו והאוחז באמה ומשתין מים
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: Four matters the Holy One, Blessed be He, hates, and I do not love them, One who enters his house suddenly, and needless to say the house of another; and one who holds penis and urinates;
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai said: Four things the Holy One, blessed be He, hates, and I do not love them: One who enters his house suddenly and even more so one who enters his neighbor's house, one who holds onto his garment and urinates water.

hebrew_text: ומשתין מים ערום לפני מטתו והמשמש מטתו בפני כל חי אמר ליה רב יהודה לשמואל ואפי' לפני עכברים א"ל שיננא לא אלא כגון של בית פלוני שמשמשין מטותיהן בפני עבדיהם ושפחותיהם
human_translation: and urinates naked next to his bed; and one who engages in intercourse in the presence of any living being. Rav Yehuda said to Shmuel: even in the presence of mice? said to him: Shinnana , not Rather, such as in so-and-so’s house, where they engage in intercourse in the presence of their slaves and maidservants.
llm_translation: And one urinates water naked before his bed, and one who has relations with his bed in the presence of any living being. Rav Yehudah said to Shmuel, "Even before mice?" He said to him, "We do not say this, but rather such as the bed of so-and-so, that they have relations with their beds in the presence of their slaves and maidservants."

hebrew_text: ואינהו מאי דרוש (בראשית כב, ה) שבו לכם פה עם החמור עם הדומה לחמור
human_translation: And those what do they interpret “Remain here with [ im ] the donkey” a nation [ am ] comparable to a donkey.
llm_translation: And they what is the interpretation (Genesis 22:5) "Stay here with the donkey while I and the boy go over there."

hebrew_text: רבה בר רב הונא מקרקש זגי דכילתא אביי באלי דידבי רבא באלי פרוחי
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna sound the bells [ zagei ] of the canopy Abaye drive away flies [ didevei ] Rava drive away gnats [ peruḥei ].
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Rav Huna of Meqarqesh, the dyers of blue wool, Abaye in the house of Rava, the flower-growers.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש בן יוחי ה' דברים הן שהעושה אותן מתחייב בנפשו ודמו בראשו האוכל שום קלוף ובצל קלוף וביצה קלופה והשותה משקין מזוגין שעבר עליהן הלילה והלן בבית הקברות והנוטל צפרניו וזורקן לרה"ר והמקיז דם ומשמש מטתו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: five which one who performs them liable for his life, and his blood is upon his head, One who eats peeled garlic or a peeled onion or a peeled egg, and one who drinks diluted drinks; when they were left overnight. And one who sleeps in a cemetery, and one who removes his nails and throws them into a public area, and one who lets blood and engages in intercourse.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: "Five things, one who does them is liable with his soul and his blood: One who eats peeled garlic, and peeled onion, and peeled egg; and one who drinks mixed beverages that have passed over them the night; and one who sleeps in a cemetery; and one who removes his fingernails and throws them in a public domain; and one who spits blood and uses his bed."

hebrew_text: האוכל שום קלוף כו' ואע"ג דמנחי בסילתא ומציירי וחתימי רוח רעה שורה עליהן ולא אמרן אלא דלא שייר בהן עיקרן או קליפתן אבל שייר בהן עיקרן או קליפתן לית לן בה
human_translation: one who eats peeled garlic, And even if they are placed in a basket and they are tied and sealed an evil spirit rests upon them. And we said only if one did not leave on them their roots or their shells. But one left on them their roots or their shells, we have no with it.
llm_translation: The one who eats raw garlic, etc. And even though they place it in a basket, draw and seal it, an evil spirit rests upon them. And we only said that if they did not leave their essence or peel, but if they left their essence or peel, we do not have a concern.

hebrew_text: והשותה משקין מזוגין שעבר עליהן הלילה אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל והוא שלנו בכלי מתכות אמר רב פפא וכלי נתר ככלי מתכות דמו וכן אמר רבי יוחנן והוא שלנו בכלי מתכות וכלי נתר ככלי מתכות דמו
human_translation: one who drinks diluted drinks that were left overnight. Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: And is when they were left overnight in metal vessels. Rav Pappa says: And natron vessels are considered like metal vessels And Rabbi Yoḥanan likewise says: And is when they were left overnight in metal vessels, and natron vessels are considered like metal vessels
llm_translation: The one who drinks mixed beverages that have been left overnight, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "And it is ours in metal vessels." Rav Papa said: "And earthenware vessels are like metal vessels." Similarly, Rabbi Yochanan said: "And it is ours in metal vessels, and earthenware vessels are like metal vessels."

hebrew_text: והלן בבית הקברות כדי שתשרה עליו רוח טומאה זימנין דמסכנין ליה
human_translation: And one who sleeps in a cemetery in order that a spirit of impurity will rest upon him, sometimes endanger
llm_translation: And he sleeps in the cemetery so that the spirit of impurity may rest upon him, at times when they are in need of him.

hebrew_text: והנוטל צפרניו וזורקן לרשות הרבים מפני שאשה מעוברת עוברת עליהן ומפלת ולא אמרן אלא דשקיל בגנוסטרי ולא אמרן אלא דשקיל דידיה ודכרעיה ולא אמרן אלא דלא גז מידי בתרייהו אבל גז מידי בתרייהו לית לן בה ולא היא לכולה מילתא חיישינן
human_translation: one who removes his nails and throws them into a public area. because a pregnant woman pass over them, and miscarry. And we said only when one removes with scissors [ bigenosteri ]. And we said only when one removes of his hand and his foot And we said only when he did not cut anything after but he cut something after them, we have no with it. And is not so; we are concerned with regard to the entire matter,
llm_translation: And one who removes his fingernails and throws them into the public domain, because a pregnant woman might stumble over them and miscarry. And we only said this when he throws them stealthily, but we only said this when he throws them with his left hand and his feet. And we only said this when he does not take anything after them, but if he takes something after them, we are not concerned about the matter in its entirety.

hebrew_text: ת"ר ג' דברים נאמרו בצפרנים שורפן חסיד קוברן צדיק זורקן רשע
human_translation: the Sages taught: Three matters were stated with regard to nails: burns them pious, buries them a righteous throws them wicked.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three things were said about the hornets - a pious person burns them, a righteous person buries them, and a wicked person throws them away.

hebrew_text: והמקיז דם ומשמש מטתו דאמר מר מקיז דם ומשמש מטתו הויין לו בנים ויתקין הקיזו שניהם ושמשו הויין לו בנים בעלי ראתן אמר רב ולא אמרן אלא דלא טעים מידי אבל טעים מידי לית לן בה
human_translation: And one who lets blood and engages in intercourse. as the Master said: lets blood and engages in intercourse, he will have weak [ vittakin ] children both of them, let blood and engaged in intercourse, he will have children afflicted with ra’atan . Rav says: And we said only when he did not taste anything but he tasted something we have no with it.
llm_translation: The one who sprinkles blood and engages in marital relations, for the Master said: "One who sprinkles blood and engages in marital relations will have sons." And the one who sprinkles blood and engages in marital relations, will have sons who are masters of vision. Rav said: "And we only said this when he does not taste anything, but if he tastes something, we do not have this benefit."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא אסור לו לאדם שישמש מטתו ביום שנאמר (ויקרא יט, יח) ואהבת לרעך כמוך מאי משמע אמר אביי שמא יראה בה דבר מגונה ותתגנה עליו אמר רב הונא ישראל קדושים הם ואין משמשין מטותיהן ביום
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: prohibited for a person to engage in intercourse by day, as it is stated: “And you shall love your fellow as yourself” From where inferred? Abaye says: perhaps will see some repulsive matter in and she will become repugnant to him, Rav Huna says: Jews are holy, and they do not engage in intercourse by day.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: It is forbidden for a person to engage in marital relations during the day, as it is stated (Leviticus 19:18), "Love your neighbor as yourself." What does this imply? Abaye said: Perhaps he will notice something repulsive in her, and she will become repulsive to him. Rav Huna said: The Jewish people are holy, and they do not engage in marital relations during the day.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ואם היה בית אפל מותר ות"ח מאפיל בכסותו ומשמש
human_translation: Rava says: And if house is dark, permitted And a Torah scholar, he may cause darkness with his garment and engage in intercourse
llm_translation: Rava said: "And if it was a dark house, it is permitted, and the Torah scholar darkens with his garment and serves."

hebrew_text: תנן או תשמש לאור הנר אימא תבדוק לאור הנר
human_translation: We learned Or engage in intercourse by the light of a lamp. Say She must examine by the light of a lamp,
llm_translation: We have learned: If one said, "Or serve as a light for the lamp," say, "Examine for the light of the lamp."

hebrew_text: ת"ש אע"פ שאמרו המשמש מטתו לאור הנר הרי זה מגונה אימא הבודק מטתו לאור הנר הרי זה מגונה
human_translation: Come hear Even though said one who engages in intercourse by the light of a lamp is repulsive, Say One who examines intercourse by the light of a lamp is repulsive,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Even though they said one who uses his bed for the light of a lamp is despicable, I might say one who inspects his bed by the light of a lamp is despicable.

hebrew_text: תא שמע ושל בית מונבז המלך היו עושין ג' דברים ומזכירין אותן לשבח היו משמשין מטותיהם ביום ובודקין מטותיהם במילא פרהבא ונוהגין טומאה וטהרה בשלגים קתני מיהא משמשין מטותיהן ביום
human_translation: Come hear And the household of King Munbaz would perform three matters, and would mention them favorably They would engage in intercourse by day; and they examine intercourse with wool [ bemeila ] of Parhava, and they practice ritual impurity and purity with regard to snow. in any event teaches engage in intercourse by day,
llm_translation: Come and hear: The house of Monbaz the king would do three things and mention them for praise: They would use their beds by day and check their beds by the light of a lamp, and they would practice ritual impurity and purity with snow. It was taught: They would use their beds by day.

hebrew_text: אימא בודקין מטותיהם ביום הכי נמי מסתברא דאי ס"ד משמשין מזכירין אותן לשבח אין ה"נ דאגב דאיכא אונס שינה מגניא באפיה
human_translation: Say examine their beds, by day. So too, it is reasonable as if enter your mind engage in intercourse mentioned them favorably Yes, is indeed so. as there is overcome by sleep, consequently be repulsive to him.
llm_translation: Say, they check their staffs on the day. Indeed, it is also logical that if you think they serve, they mention them for praise. So too, regarding that there is an unavoidable circumstance, sleep protects with its wings.

hebrew_text: ובודקין מטותיהן במילא פרהבא מסייע ליה לשמואל דאמר שמואל אין בודקין את המטה אלא בפקולין או בצמר נקי ורך אמר רב היינו דכי הואי התם בערבי שבתות הוו אמרי מאן בעי פקולי בנהמא ולא ידענא מאי קאמרי
human_translation: And examine intercourse, with wool of Parhava. supports of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: One may examine a bed, only with linen [ befakolin ], or with clean and soft wool. Rav says: This is that when I was there, on Shabbat evenings, would say: Who needs linen for bread [ benahama ], And I did not know what they were saying
llm_translation: And they examine their rods with a woolen cloth. Raba assists Samuel, for Samuel said: We only examine the rod with a fleece or with clean and soft wool. Rav said: That is because it was on the eve of Shabbat. They would say, "Who wants to fleece with us?" and we did not know what they meant.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הני שחקי דכיתנא מעלי לבדיקה איני והא תנא דבי מנשה אין בודקין את המטה לא בעד אדום ולא בעד שחור ולא בפשתן אלא בפקולין או בצמר נקי ורך
human_translation: Rava says: Those worn-out flax good for examination. Is that so? But didn’t the school of Menashe teach: One may not examine a bed with a red cloth, nor with a black cloth, nor with flax, but with linen, or with clean and soft wool?
llm_translation: Rava said: "These skachim that we spread for inspection, I am not sure about them. But didn't the school of Menashe teach: One does not inspect the bed neither with red material nor with black material nor with linen, but with fine twigs or clean and soft wool."

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא בכיתנא הא במאני דכיתנא ואיבעית אימא הא והא במאני דכיתנא הא בחדתי הא בשחקי
human_translation: not difficult, this to flax that to flax garments. And if you wish, say this and that to flax garments, this to new that to worn-out
llm_translation: Not difficult. This, in the case of a Tanna, and this, in the case of a dispute of a Tanna. And if you wish, say this and this, in the case of a Tanna, this in the case of a new teaching, this in the case of a joke.

hebrew_text: נוהגין טומאה וטהרה בשלגין תנן התם שלג אינו לא אוכל ולא משקה חישב עליו לאכילה אינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין למשקה מטמא טומאת משקין
human_translation: practice ritual impurity and purity with regard to snow. We learned there Snow is neither food nor drink one designated it for consumption, it does not impart the ritual impurity of food. a drink, it imparts the ritual impurity of liquid.
llm_translation: We are accustomed to impurity and purity with snow. We learned there: snow is neither food nor drink. If one intended it for eating, it does not impart impurity of food; for drinking, it imparts impurity of liquids.

hebrew_text: נטמא מקצתו לא נטמא כולו נטהר מקצתו נטהר כולו
human_translation: part of became impure, it does not all become impure, part of is purified, all of it is purified.
llm_translation: He became impure, part of it did not become impure, all of it did not become impure, he became purified, part of it became purified, all of it became purified.

hebrew_text: הא גופא קשיא אמרת נטמא מקצתו לא נטמא כולו והדר תני נטהר מקצתו נטהר כולו למימרא דנטמא כולו
human_translation: This itself difficult. You said part of became impure, it does not all become impure, and then teaches part of is purified, all of it is purified, to say that all of it became impure.
llm_translation: This itself is difficult: you said, "If part of it became impure, the entire thing does not become impure." And then you taught, "If part of it became pure, the entire thing becomes pure." This is to say that if the entire thing became impure.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי כגון שהעבירו על אויר תנור דהתורה העידה על כלי חרס
human_translation: Abaye says: where one passed within the airspace of an oven, as the Torah testifies with regard to an earthenware vessel
llm_translation: Abbaye said: For example, if one passed it over the opening of an oven, the Torah testified regarding earthenware vessels.

hebrew_text: אפילו מלא חרדל
human_translation: even full mustard
llm_translation: Even the size of a mustard seed.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ משל משלו חכמים באשה החדר והפרוזדור והעלייה
human_translation: The Sages stated a parable with regard to a woman, The room and the corridor [ perozdor ] and the upper story
llm_translation: Mishnah: The sages taught a parable regarding a woman, the inner chamber, the balcony, and the upper room.

hebrew_text: דם החדר טמא דם העלייה טהור נמצא בפרוזדור ספקו טמא לפי שחזקתו מן המקור
human_translation: Blood the room is ritually impure. Blood the upper story is ritually pure. was found in the corridor, its uncertainty, impure, due to that its presumptive status from the source,
llm_translation: The blood of the inner chamber is impure, the blood of the ascent is pure. If it is found in the vestibule, its status is uncertain, impure due to its presumption from the source.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ רמי בר שמואל ורב יצחק בריה דרב יהודה תנו נדה בי רב הונא אשכחינהו רבה בר רב הונא דיתבי וקאמרי החדר מבפנים והפרוזדור מבחוץ ועלייה בנויה על שתיהן ולול פתוח בין עלייה לפרוזדור
human_translation: Rami bar Shmuel and Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, were learning Nidda the study hall of Rav Huna. Rabba bar Rav Huna found them sitting and saying The room, inner and the corridor outer And the upper story, is built, above them both. And an open vestibule between upper story and the corridor.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rami bar Shmuel and Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehuda, taught in the study hall of Rav Huna. Rabba, son of Rav Huna, found them sitting and saying, "The chamber is on the inside, and the balcony is on the outside, with a staircase built between them and a hanging basket open between the balcony and the chamber."

hebrew_text: נמצא מן הלול ולפנים ספקו טמא מן הלול ולחוץ ספקו טהור
human_translation: found from vestibule and inward its uncertainty impure. from the vestibule and outward, its uncertainty pure.
llm_translation: It is found from the inside of the cavity, and its doubt is impure; from the outside of the cavity, and its doubt is pure.

hebrew_text: אתא ואמר ליה לאבוה ספקו טמא אמרת לן מר והא אנן שחזקתו מן המקור תנן
human_translation: came and said to his father, did the Master say to us its uncertainty impure, But didn’t we learn due to that its presumptive status from the source,
llm_translation: He came and said to his father: "His doubt is impure." You said to us, Master, but we have established him from the source, as we learned.

hebrew_text: א"ל אנא הכי קאמינא מן הלול ולפנים ודאי טמא מן הלול ולחוץ ספקו טמא
human_translation: said to This is what I said: from the vestibule inward definitely impure, from the vestibule outward its uncertainty impure.
llm_translation: He said to me thus: "From inside and previously, certainly impure; from inside and outside, its doubt is impure."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מאי שנא מן הלול ולחוץ דספקו טמא דדלמא שחתה ומחדר אתא מן הלול ולפנים נמי אימא אזדקרה ומעלייה אתא
human_translation: Abaye says: What is different from the vestibule outward, where its uncertainty impure? that perhaps bent over and came from the room, from the vestibule inward, also say staggered and came from upper story
llm_translation: Abbaye said: What is the difference between from the inside and from the outside, that they are uncertainly impure? For perhaps it has rotted and decayed from the inside, and from the outside as well, one might say that it has become moldy and decayed.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אביי אי בתר חששא אזלת אידי ואידי ספק הוא ואי בתר חזקה אזלת מן הלול ולפנים ודאי טמא מן הלול ולחוץ ודאי טהור
human_translation: Rather, Abaye says: If you follow the concern, this and that, is uncertain. And if you follow presumption from the vestibule inward is definitely impure, from the vestibule outward is definitely pure.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: If after a doubt you went, both this and that is uncertain. And if after a certainty you went from inside the cavity and inside, certainly impure; from inside the cavity and outside, certainly pure.

hebrew_text: תני רבי חייא דם הנמצא בפרוזדור חייבין עליו על ביאת מקדש ושורפין עליו את התרומה ורב קטינא אמר אין חייבין עליו על ביאת מקדש ואין שורפין עליו את התרומה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: Blood that is found in the corridor liable as a result of for entering the Temple And one burns teruma due to it, And Rav Ketina says: is not obligated, due to for entering the Temple and one does not burn teruma on its account.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Chiya taught: Blood found in a privy - one is liable for it regarding the entry into the Temple, and they burn the Terumah because of it. And Rav Ketina said: One is not liable for it regarding the entry into the Temple, and they do not burn the Terumah because of it.

hebrew_text: להך לישנא דאמר אביי אי בתר חששא אזלת מסייע ליה לרב קטינא ופליגא דרבי חייא
human_translation: According to this formulation, that Abaye stated: If you follow the concern supports of Rav Ketina, And contradicts of Rabbi Ḥiyya,
llm_translation: Regarding that which Abaye said: If after the suspicion she went, she assists for him to Rav Katina, and it is disputed by Rabbi Chiya.

hebrew_text: להך לישנא דאמרת אי בתר חזקה אזלת מסייע ליה לרבי חייא
human_translation: According to that formulation that Abaye stated: If you follow presumption supports Rabbi Ḥiyya,
llm_translation: To that which you said, if after a strong ruling you go, you assist Rabbi Chiya.

hebrew_text: ופליגא דרב קטינא
human_translation: And contradicts of Rav Ketina,
llm_translation: And there is a dispute of Rav Katina.

hebrew_text: לרב הונא לא פליגי כאן מן הלול ולפנים כאן מן הלול ולחוץ
human_translation: And according to Rav Huna, do not disagree, Here, from the vestibule and inward, there, from the vestibule and outward.
llm_translation: To Rav Huna they do not argue here from the inside, and here from the inside, and from the outside.

hebrew_text: אלא לרמי בר שמואל ולרב יצחק בריה דרב יהודה דאמרי מן הלול ולחוץ ספקו טהור מן הלול ולפנים ספקו טמא הני במאי מתוקמא מן הלול ולפנים
human_translation: But according to Rami bar Shmuel and Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, who say from the vestibule and outward, its uncertainty pure, from the vestibule and inward, its uncertainty impure, with regard to what these interpreted? from the vestibule and inward,
llm_translation: Rather, to Rami bar Shmuel and to Rav Yitzchak son of Rav Yehudah, who say: From the inside and from the outside, its doubt is pure; from the inside and in front of it, its doubt is impure. What are these established from the inside and in front of it?

hebrew_text: לימא פליגא דרבי חייא
human_translation: shall we say disagree of Rabbi Ḥiyya,
llm_translation: Let us say the dispute of Rabbi Chiya.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא כאן כשנמצא בקרקע פרוזדור וכאן שנמצא בגג פרוזדור
human_translation: not difficult. Here, where it is found on the floor of corridor, And there, that is found on the roof of corridor,
llm_translation: Not difficult here when found in the ground Prozdor and here when found on the roof Prozdor.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן בשלשה מקומות הלכו בו חכמים אחר הרוב ועשאום כודאי מקור שליא חתיכה מקור הא דאמרן
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: In three places the Sages followed the majority, and they established as a certainty. source, afterbirth [ shilya ], a shaped source that which we said,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In three places, the Sages followed the majority and made them like a valid source - the spring of Shilo, a piece of the spring, and the spring that we mentioned.

hebrew_text: שליא דתנן שליא בבית הבית טמא ולא שהשליא ולד אלא שאין שליא בלא ולד ר"ש אומר נמוק הולד עד שלא יצא
human_translation: afterbirth as we learned the afterbirth in the house, the house is ritually impure, And not that the afterbirth an offspring; rather, that there is no afterbirth without an offspring. Rabbi Shimon says: offspring was squashed before it emerged
llm_translation: The placenta of a fetus, the placenta in the innermost chamber is impure, but not the placenta itself, rather, only when there is no fetus. Rabbi Shimon says: the fetus is considered as if it has emerged until it actually emerges.

hebrew_text: חתיכה דתנן המפלת יד חתוכה ורגל חתוכה אמו טמאה לידה ואין חוששין שמא מגוף אטום באת
human_translation: a shaped as we learned who miscarries a shaped hand, or a shaped foot, its mother is impure childbirth, and we are not concerned perhaps it came from a sealed, body,
llm_translation: A piece as we learned: one who falls, a hand severed, and a foot severed, its mother is impure for giving birth, and we are not concerned lest it came from a sealed body.

hebrew_text: ותו ליכא והאיכא תשע חנויות
human_translation: And are there no more But isn’t there nine stores?
llm_translation: And there is no "and there is," but there are nine stores.

hebrew_text: דתניא תשע חנויות כולן מוכרות בשר שחוטה ואחת מוכרת בשר נבלה ולקח מאחת מהן ואינו יודע מאיזה מהן לקח ספקו אסור
human_translation: As it is taught nine stores all of which sell meat slaughtered and one sells meat animal carcasses, and bought from one of and he does not know from which he bought uncertainty, is prohibited.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: Nine stalls, all of them sell kosher meat, and one sells non-kosher meat. If one buys from one of them and does not know from which one he bought, his purchase is forbidden.

hebrew_text: ובנמצא הלך אחר הרוב
human_translation: And in the found follow the majority
llm_translation: And in a case where it is found, one follows the majority.

hebrew_text: טומאה קאמרינן איסור לא קאמרינן
human_translation: We say ritual impurity, we do not say prohibitions,
llm_translation: Impurity we are speaking of, prohibition we are not speaking of.

hebrew_text: והאיכא תשע צפרדעין ושרץ אחד ביניהם ונגע באחד מהן ואינו יודע באיזה מהן נגע ברה"י ספקו טמא ברה"ר ספקו טהור
human_translation: But isn’t there nine frogs, and one creeping animal among them, and touched one of and he does not know which of them he touched? in the private domain uncertain impure, in the public domain, uncertainty pure.
llm_translation: And there are nine frogs and one creeping creature among them, and it touched one of them, and he does not know which of them it touched. Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi: his doubt is impure in a public domain, his doubt is pure.

hebrew_text: ובנמצא הלך אחר הרוב
human_translation: And in was found follow the majority.
llm_translation: And in a case where it is found, one follows the majority.

hebrew_text: טומאה דאשה קאמרינן טומאה בעלמא לא קאמרינן
human_translation: We say ritual impurity of a woman, we do not say ritual impurity in general.
llm_translation: Impurity of a woman we are speaking, impurity in general not we are speaking.

hebrew_text: והאיכא הא דאמר רבי יהושע בן לוי עברה בנהר
human_translation: But isn’t there that which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: passed across a river
llm_translation: And there is this one that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: "A crossing in the river."

hebrew_text: והפילה מביאה קרבן ונאכל
human_translation: and she miscarried she brings offering And is eaten
llm_translation: And the wife of a fallen soldier brings a sacrifice and it is eaten.

hebrew_text: הלך אחר רוב נשים ורוב נשים ולד מעליא ילדן
human_translation: follow the majority of women, and most women give birth to full-fledged offspring.
llm_translation: Went after majority of women and majority of women and child of superior birth will bear.

hebrew_text: מתניתין קאמרינן שמעתתא לא קאמרינן
human_translation: We say the Mishna we do not say halakhic statement,
llm_translation: We say: "We do not say 'Shema Yisrael' in the Mishnah."

hebrew_text: והא כי אתא רבין אמר מתיב רבי יוסי בר רבי חנינא טועה ולא ידענא מאי תיובתיה
human_translation: But when Ravin came he said Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥanina raises an objection an unsure woman, And I do not know what his objection
llm_translation: And this, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yosei the son of Rabbi Chanina said: "He is mistaken, and we do not know what his argument is."

hebrew_text: מאי לאו לא תיובתא אלא סייעתא
human_translation: What, is it not not a refutation but support
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "לאו לא תיובתא" (not a refutation)? Rather, it is a support.

hebrew_text: לא דלמא לא תיובתא ולא סייעתא
human_translation: not perhaps neither a refutation nor a support
llm_translation: Not perhaps not refutation and not assistance

hebrew_text: למעוטי מאי
human_translation: to exclude what?
llm_translation: To exclude what?

hebrew_text: אילימא למעוטי רובא דאיכא חזקה בהדיה דלא שרפינן עליה את התרומה והא אמרה ר' יוחנן חדא זימנא
human_translation: If we say to exclude a majority that there is a presumptive status along with it which one does not burn teruma due to said it another occasion,
llm_translation: If you say to exclude the majority where there is a strong presumption in its favor that we do not burn the terumah upon it, but didn't Rabbi Yochanan say once:

hebrew_text: דתנן תינוק הנמצא בצד העיסה ובצק בידו רבי מאיר מטהר וחכמים מטמאין שדרכו של תינוק לטפח
human_translation: As we learned child is found alongside started dough and risen dough in his hand Rabbi Meir deems pure, And the Rabbis deem it impure, because it is the norm of a child to handle
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: "If a child is found beside the dough with dough in his hand, Rabbi Meir declares him pure, while the Sages declare him impure, for it is the way of a child to touch."

hebrew_text: ואמרינן מאי טעמא דר"מ קסבר רוב תינוקות מטפחין ומיעוט אין מטפחין ועיסה זו בחזקת טהורה עומדת סמוך מיעוטא לחזקה ואיתרע ליה רובא
human_translation: And we say What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? He holds a majority of children handle and a minority do not handle and this dough retains a presumptive status of purity, append minority to the presumptive status and majority is weakened.
llm_translation: And we say, what is the reason for Rabbi Meir? He holds that the majority of infants clap, and the minority do not clap, and this dough is standing with the presumption of purity adjacent to the minority, and the majority invalidates it.

hebrew_text: ורבנן מיעוטא כמאן דליתיה דמי ורובא וחזקה רובא עדיף
human_translation: And the Rabbis the minority is considered like it does not exist. And the majority and the presumptive status the majority takes precedence.
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: A minority is like one who does not exist, and the majority and presumption, the majority is preferable.

hebrew_text: ואמר ריש לקיש משום רבי אושעיא זו היא חזקה ששורפין עליה את התרומה ורבי יוחנן אמר אין זו חזקה ששורפין עליה את התרומה
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: This is a presumption, over which teruma is burned, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is not a presumption over which teruma is burned.
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: This is the principle that one may burn terumah on it. And Rabbi Yochanan said: This is not the principle that one may burn terumah on it.

hebrew_text: אלא למעוטי רובא דרבי יהודה דתנן המפלת חתיכה אם יש עמה דם טמאה ואם לאו טהורה רבי יהודה אומר בין כך ובין כך טמאה
human_translation: Rather, to exclude a majority, as Rabbi Yehuda. As we learned who miscarries piece if there is blood with it, is ritually impure And if not, she is pure, Rabbi Yehuda says: both this and that is impure
llm_translation: Rather, to exclude the majority of Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned in a Mishnah: "If one drops a piece of meat, if there is blood with it, it is impure; and if not, it is pure. Rabbi Yehuda says: In either case, it is impure."

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל לא טימא רבי יהודה אלא בחתיכה של ארבע מיני דמים אבל שאר מיני דמים טהורה ורבי יוחנן אמר של ארבע מיני דמים דברי הכל טמאה ושל שאר דמים דברי הכל טהורה לא נחלקו אלא כשהפילה
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Rabbi Yehuda deemed impure, only in a piece of four types of blood, But of other types of blood, pure. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: of four types of blood, all, agree is impure. And of other types of blood, all agree she is pure. disagree only where miscarried
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Rabbi Yehudah did not render impure except for a piece of the four types of blood, but other types of blood are pure. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Regarding the four types of blood, everyone agrees it is impure, and regarding other blood, everyone agrees it is pure. They only disagreed when it was spilled.

hebrew_text: ואינה יודעת מה הפילה רבי יהודה סבר זיל בתר רוב חתיכות ורוב חתיכות של ארבע מיני דמים הויין ורבנן סברי זיל בתר רוב חתיכות לא אמרינן
human_translation: and she does not know what she miscarried Rabbi Yehuda holds: Follow the majority of pieces and the majority of pieces of four types of blood. And the Rabbis hold: We do not say: Follow the majority of pieces
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And she does not know what she miscarried. Rabbi Yehuda holds: Go after the majority of pieces, and the majority of pieces of the four types of blood are considered. And the Rabbis hold: Go after the majority of pieces, we do not say."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חמשה דמים טמאים באשה האדום והשחור וכקרן כרכום וכמימי אדמה וכמזוג בש"א אף כמימי תלתן וכמימי בשר צלי וב"ה מטהרים הירוק עקביא בן מהללאל מטמא וחכמים מטהרין
human_translation: five ritually impure blood in a woman: Red, and black, and like the bright crocus [ karkom ] and like water earth, and like diluted Beit Shammai say: Even like the water a fenugreek and like the liquid roast meat, and Beit Hillel deem ritually pure. green, Akavya ben Mahalalel deems impure and the Rabbis deem pure.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Five bloods are impure in a woman - the red, the black, like the horn of a wild ox, like turmeric, and like the waters of the earth, and like the mixture in the firstborn animal. Also, like the waters of a lizard, and like the waters of roasted meat. Beit Hillel purify, while Akavya ben Mahalalel declares impure, and the sages purify.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי מאיר אם אינו מטמא משום כתם מטמא משום משקה רבי יוסי אומר לא כך ולא כך
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: if does not transmit impurity due to stain it renders ritual impurity due to liquids Rabbi Yosei says: Neither this nor that
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Meir: If it does not render impure due to a stain, it renders impure due to liquid. Rabbi Yosei says: Not like this and not like that.

hebrew_text: איזהו אדום כדם המכה שחור כחרת עמוק מכן טמא דיהה מכן טהור וכקרן כרכום כברור שבו
human_translation: What is red as the blood a wound. black as ḥeret . deeper than that, ritually impure; lighter than that, ritually pure. And like the bright crocus like the brightest in
llm_translation: Which is like Edom? "Like the blood of one who strikes, black like a potsherd, deep like a dye, from there impure; from there pure. And like a horn, like saffron, clear in it."

hebrew_text: וכמימי אדמה מבקעת בית כרם ומיצף מים וכמזוג שני חלקים מים ואחד יין מן היין השרוני
human_translation: And like water earth from the Beit Kerem Valley and one inundates water And like diluted two parts water and one wine, from the wine of the Sharon
llm_translation: And like the days of the earth from the valley of Beit Kerem and from the pouring of water, and like the mixing of two parts of water and one of wine from the wine of Sharon.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנלן דאיכא דם טהור באשה דלמא כל דם דאתי מינה טמא
human_translation: From where do we that there is pure blood in a woman? Perhaps any blood that emerges from is impure?
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive that there is pure blood in a woman? Perhaps all blood that comes from her is impure.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חמא בר יוסף אמר רבי אושעיא אמר קרא (דברים יז, ח) כי יפלא ממך דבר למשפט בין דם לדם בין דם טהור לדם טמא
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Yosef says Rabbi Oshaya says: verse states “If there arise a matter too hard for you in judgment, between blood and blood, between pure blood and impure blood,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ḥama bar Yosef said Rabbi Oshaya said Scripture (Deuteronomy 17:8) "If a matter is too difficult for you in judgment, between blood and blood, between ruling and ruling, and between plague and plague."

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה בין נגע לנגע הכי נמי בין נגע טמא לנגע טהור וכי תימא ה"נ נגע טהור מי איכא וכי תימא (ויקרא יג, יג) כולו הפך לבן טהור הוא ההוא בוהק מקרי
human_translation: If that is so, “Between leprous mark and leprous mark,” also Between a pure leprous mark and an impure leprous mark? And if you would say indeed, is there pure leprous mark? And if you would say it is all turned white: He is pure” that is called a paleness,
llm_translation: Rather now between plague to plague so too between plague impure to plague pure and if you say likewise plague pure who is there and if you say (Leviticus 13:13) all of it turned white pure it is that shining is called

hebrew_text: אלא בין נגעי אדם לנגעי בתים ולנגעי בגדים וכולן טמאין הכא נמי בין דם נדה לדם זיבה וכולן טמאין
human_translation: Rather, Between the leprous marks man and the leprous marks of houses and the leprous marks of garments and they are all ritually impure. here too, Between the blood of a menstruating woman and the blood of a discharge [ ziva ], and they are all ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rather, between the afflictions of a person, the afflictions of houses, and the afflictions of garments, all are impure. Here too, between the blood of menstruation and the blood of a seminal emission, all are impure.

hebrew_text: האי מאי בשלמא התם איכא לאפלוגי בנגעי אדם ובפלוגתא דרבי יהושע ורבנן
human_translation: What is this Granted, there, one can disagree with regard to the leprous marks man, and with regard to the dispute of Rabbi Yehoshua and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: This, what? Granted, there, there is room for distinction in the case of afflictions of humans and in the dispute of Rabbi Yehoshua and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דתנן אם בהרת קודם לשער לבן טמא ואם שער לבן קודם לבהרת טהור ספק טמא ורבי יהושע אומר כהה ואמר רבה כהה וטהור
human_translation: As we learned If snow-white leprous mark [ baheret ], preceded white hair, ritually impure, And if white hair preceded baheret pure, uncertainty impure. And Rabbi Yehoshua says: dull [ keha ]. And Rabba says, a dull ritually pure.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If leprosy appeared before white hair, it is unclean, and if white hair appeared before leprosy, it is clean. In a case of doubt, it is unclean. And Rabbi Yehoshua says: It is faint. And Rabbah said: It is faint and clean.

hebrew_text: בנגעי בתים כי הא פלוגתא דרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון ורבנן דתנן ר"א בר"ש אומר לעולם אין הבית טמא עד שיראה כשני גריסין על שני אבנים בשני כותלים בקרן זוית ארכו כשני גריסין ורחבו כגריס
human_translation: with regard to the leprous marks of houses as that dispute between Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and the Rabbis. As we learned Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: A house is never impure unless will be seen of two split beans, on two stones on two walls in a corner The length of is two split beans, and its width is split bean.
llm_translation: In the matter of house afflictions, for here is the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis, as we learned: Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon says, "The house is never deemed impure until it shows like two bean seeds on two stones in two walls, in a corner, its length like two bean seeds and its width like a bean seed."

hebrew_text: מ"ט דר"א בר"ש כתיב (ויקרא יד) קיר וכתיב קירות איזהו קיר שהוא כשני קירות הוי אומר זה קרן זוית
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? “wall” is written and “walls” is written Which is wall that is like two walls? You must say: This is a corner
llm_translation: Reasoning of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: It is written "wall" and it is written "walls." Which wall is like two walls? You would say this is a corner wall.

hebrew_text: בנגעי בגדים בפלוגתא דר' יונתן בן אבטולמוס ורבנן דתניא ר' יונתן בן אבטולמוס אומר מנין לפריחת בגדים שהיא טהורה
human_translation: with regard to the leprous marks on garments, with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtolemos and the Rabbis. As it is taught Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtolemos says: From where with regard to a spread in garments that is pure,
llm_translation: In cases of garments, in the dispute of Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtulmos and the Rabbis, as it was taught: Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtulmos says, "How do we know that the blooming of garments is pure?"

hebrew_text: נאמר (ויקרא י״ג:ל״ט) קרחת וגבחת בבגדים ונאמר קרחת וגבחת באדם
human_translation: A bareness within [ karaḥat ] and a bareness without [ gabbaḥat ] stated with regard to garments: and a bald head [ karaḥat ] and a bald forehead [ gabbaḥat ] stated with regard to a person:
llm_translation: It is stated (Leviticus 13:39), "a mark and a scab in garments," and it is stated "a mark and a scab in a person."

hebrew_text: מה להלן פרח בכולו טהור אף כאן נמי פרח בכולו טהור
human_translation: Just as there, spread to his entire pure, so too here, spread to entire pure.
llm_translation: What is there, below, a flower in its entirety is pure, so too here, also, a flower in its entirety is pure.

hebrew_text: אלא הכא אי דם טהור ליכא במאי פליגי
human_translation: But here, if there is no pure blood with regard to what disagree
llm_translation: Rather here, if blood pure not is, with what they argue?

hebrew_text: וממאי דהני טהורין והני טמאין אמר רבי אבהו דאמר קרא (מלכים ב ג:כב) ויראו מואב את המים אדומים כדם למימרא דדם אדום הוא אימא אדום ותו לא
human_translation: And from where that those pure, and these impure? Rabbi Abbahu said that the verse states: and the Moabites saw the water as red as blood” Is this to say that blood is red? say red and no more
llm_translation: From where do these waters come, pure and those waters impure? Rabbi Abbahu said, as it is stated (2 Kings 3:22), "And Moab saw the waters as red as blood," to say that it is blood of Edom. Say it is Edom, and nothing else.

hebrew_text: א"ר אבהו אמר קרא (ויקרא יב, ז) דמיה (ויקרא כ, יח) דמיה הרי כאן ארבעה
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said The verse states, her blood [ dameha ]” her blood [ dameha ]; there are four here.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Scripture says, "its blood" (Leviticus 12:7), "its blood" (Leviticus 20:18), here we have four.

hebrew_text: והא אנן חמשה תנן אמר רבי חנינא שחור אדום הוא אלא שלקה
human_translation: But didn’t we learn five Rabbi Ḥanina says: black is red, but has faded,
llm_translation: And behold, we have learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Chanina said, "It is black, but it appears red."

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי שחור כחרת עמוק מכן טמא דיהה אפי' ככחול טהור ושחור זה לא מתחלתו הוא משחיר אלא כשנעקר הוא משחיר משל לדם מכה לכשנעקר הוא משחיר
human_translation: This is also taught black as ḥeret . deeper than that, ritually impure; lighter even as blue, ritually pure. And this black does not blacken from its outset, rather, it blackens when it is removed comparable to the blood of a wound, when it is removed it blackens.
llm_translation: It was taught: Also thus, black as a pot, deep from there impure, for even as blue pure. And black this not from its beginning, it is black, but when it is uprooted, it is black. A parable: to the blood of a wound, when it is uprooted, it is black.

hebrew_text: בש"א אף כמימי תלתן ולית להו לב"ש דמיה דמיה הרי כאן ארבעה
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: Even like the water a fenugreek But do Beit Shammai not accept “ Dameha ” “ Dameha ” there are four here?
llm_translation: In the first year of the sabbatical cycle, even as the days of Tishrei, and they do not have the status of the firstborn son. The status of the firstborn son is similar to it. Here we have four.

hebrew_text: אב"א לית להו ואב"א אית להו מי לא א"ר חנינא שחור אדום הוא אלא שלקה ה"נ מלקא הוא דלקי
human_translation: If you wish, say do not accept And if you wish, say do accept Didn’t Rabbi Ḥanina say black is red but has faded? So too, faded.
llm_translation: Abba does not have, and Abba does have, who not? Rabbi Chanina said: it is black, red it is, but it was scorched.

hebrew_text: וב"ה מטהרין היינו תנא קמא
human_translation: And Beit Hillel deem ritually pure. Isn’t this the first tanna ?
llm_translation: And in the Temple, they purify. This is the opinion of the first Tanna.

hebrew_text: איכא בינייהו
human_translation: There is between them
llm_translation: There is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: לתלות
human_translation: to leave in abeyance,
llm_translation: To hang.

hebrew_text: הירוק עקביא בן מהללאל מטמא ולית ליה לעקביא דמיה דמיה הרי כאן ארבעה
human_translation: green, Akavya ben Mahalalel deems impure. But does Akavya not accept “ Dameha ” “ Dameha ” there are four here?
llm_translation: The spit of Akavya ben Mahalalel is impure, and Akavya has no halachic significance. His significance is like that of his ancestor Akavya; here we have four cases.

hebrew_text: אב"א לית ליה ואב"א אית ליה מי לא א"ר חנינא שחור אדום הוא אלא שלקה הכא נמי מלקא הוא דלקי
human_translation: If you wish, say does not accept And if you wish, say accepts Didn’t Rabbi Ḥanina say, black is red but has faded? Here too, faded
llm_translation: Abba does not have it, and Abba does have it. Who does not say? Rabbi Chanina said: It is red, but here it is also black, as it is black.

hebrew_text: וחכמים מטהרין היינו ת"ק איכא בינייהו לתלות
human_translation: And the Rabbis deem pure. Isn’t this the first tanna ? There is between them to leave in abeyance
llm_translation: And the sages purify, that is, there is a dispute between Tanna Kamma and Tanna Kamma.

hebrew_text: א"ר מאיר אם אינו מטמא משום כתם כו'
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: if does not transmit impurity due to stain
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: If it does not render impure due to a blemish, etc.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן ירד ר"מ לשיטת עקביא בן מהללאל וטימא וה"ק להו לרבנן נהי דהיכא דקא משכחת כתם ירוק אמנא לא מטמאיתו היכא דקחזיא דם ירוק מגופה תטמא
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Meir accepted the opinion of Akavya ben Mahalalel and deemed impure And this was saying to the Rabbis: Granted that where finds a green stain on clothing you do not deem ritually impure, where she sees green blood from her body, she shall be impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, Rabbi Meir followed the opinion of Akavya ben Mahalalel and ruled impure. And this is what he said to the sages: "Wherever you find greenish-yellow color, you do not render it impure. Wherever you see greenish-yellow blood detached from the body, it renders impure."

hebrew_text: אי הכי אם אינו מטמא משום כתם מטמא משום משקה משום רואה מבעיא ליה
human_translation: If so, if it does not transmit impurity due to stain, it renders ritual impurity due to a liquid? should have saw as
llm_translation: If so, if it does not render impure due to a blemish, it renders impure due to liquid; due to seeing, it renders impure. It requires clarification.

hebrew_text: אלא ה"ק להו נהי היכא דקא חזיא דם ירוק מעיקרא לא מטמאיתו היכא דחזיא דם אדום והדר חזיא דם ירוק תטמא מידי דהוה אמשקה זב וזבה
human_translation: Rather, this was saying to Granted where sees green blood from the outset you do not deem ritually impure, where she sees red blood and then sees green blood, she shall be impure. just as it is with regard to the fluids of a man who experiences a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ] and a woman who experiences a discharge of uterine blood after her menstrual period [ zava ].
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to them: "In a case where one sees green blood initially, you do not render it impure. In a case where one sees red blood, and then sees green blood, it becomes impure immediately, as it is the blood of a male or female who has an abnormal discharge."

hebrew_text: ורבנן דומיא דרוק מה רוק שמתעגל ויוצא אף כל שמתעגל ויוצא לאפוקי האי דאין מתעגל ויוצא אי הכי שפיר קאמרי ליה רבנן לר' מאיר
human_translation: And the Rabbis similar to saliva: Just as saliva is gathered and expelled so too, all gathered and expelled. to exclude this which is not gathered and expelled. If so, the Rabbis spoke well to Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: The sages similar to a spit, what spit that turns and comes out, so too, any that turns and comes out, except for this one that does not turn and come out. If so, the sages are saying well to Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אלא ה"ק להו להוי כמשקה להכשיר את הזרעים ורבנן בעי (במדבר כג:כד) דם חללים וליכא אי הכי שפיר קאמרי ליה רבנן לר' מאיר
human_translation: Rather, this was saying to Let be like liquids that render seeds susceptible And the Rabbis require the blood of the slain” and not If so, the Rabbis spoke well to Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rather, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to them: Let it be like liquid to render the seeds fit. And the Rabbis ask: "There is no blood of the slain" (Numbers 23:24), so is it not good what the Rabbis say to Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אלא הכי קאמר להו אלפוה בג"ש כתיב הכא (שיר השירים ד׳:י״ג) שלחיך פרדס רמונים וכתיב התם (איוב ה, י) ושולח מים על פני חוצות
human_translation: Rather, this was saying to Learn from verbal analogy: It is written here, “Your shoots [ shelaḥayikh ] are an orchard of pomegranates” and it is written there: and sends [ veshole’aḥ ] waters upon the fields”
llm_translation: Rather, this is what he said to them: "In the Garden of Eden, it is written here (Song of Songs 4:13), 'Your shoots are an orchard of pomegranates,' and it is written there (Job 5:10), 'And sends water upon the streets.'

hebrew_text: ורבנן אדם דן ק"ו מעצמו ואין אדם דן ג"ש מעצמו
human_translation: And the Rabbis a person may derive an a fortiori on his own, a person may not derive a verbal analogy on his own,
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: A person judges a matter of monetary law from his own perspective, but a person does not judge a matter of capital law from his own perspective.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי אומר לא כך וכו' היינו ת"ק הא קמ"ל מאן ת"ק רבי יוסי וכל האומר דבר בשם אומרו מביא גאולה לעולם
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Neither this Isn’t this the first tanna ? this is teaching us: Who is the first tanna ? Rabbi Yosei. And anyone who reports a statement in the name of the one who said it brings redemption to the world.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yossi says, "Not like this, etc." This is the opinion of the Tanna Kamma. This teaches us: Who is the Tanna Kamma? Rabbi Yossi. And anyone who says something in the name of the one who said it brings redemption to the world.

hebrew_text: איזהו אדום כדם המכה מאי כדם המכה אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל כדם שור שחוט
human_translation: What is red as the blood a wound. What As the blood a wound? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Like the blood of a slaughtered ox.
llm_translation: Which is Edom? "Like the blood of one who strikes." What is 'like the blood of one who strikes'? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "Like the blood of a slaughtered ox."

hebrew_text: ולימא כדם שחיטה אי אמר כדם שחיטה הוה אמינא ככולה שחיטה קמ"ל כדם המכה כתחילת הכאה של סכין
human_translation: But let say as the blood of slaughter. If said as the blood of slaughter, I would say as the entire slaughter, teaches us as the blood a wound, as the beginning of the slitting with knife.
llm_translation: And let us say, like the blood of slaughter. If he said like the blood of slaughter, I would say like the entirety of slaughter. It teaches us that it is like the blood of one who strikes at the initial strike of the knife.

hebrew_text: עולא אמר כדם צפור חיה איבעיא להו חיה לאפוקי שחוט או דלמא לאפוקי כחוש תיקו
human_translation: Ulla says: like the blood a living bird A dilemma was raised before living, to exclude a slaughtered Or perhaps to exclude a weak shall stand
llm_translation: Ula said: Like the blood of a bird, a living creature. The question was raised before them: Is a living creature excluded from ritual slaughter, or perhaps it is excluded like a bird? This remains undecided.

hebrew_text: זעירי אמר רבי חנינא כדם מאכולת של ראש מיתיבי הרגה מאכולת הרי זה תולה בה מאי לאו דכוליה גופה לא דראשה
human_translation: Ze’eiri Rabbi Ḥanina says: like the blood head louse. raises an objection killed a louse this may attribute to What, is it not from all her body, No; on her head.
llm_translation: Za'iri said, Rabbi Chanina: Like the blood of the head. The rebuttal: If one killed it, the animal is considered as if it were eaten. What is it? Is it not that its entire body is not like its head.

hebrew_text: אמי ורדינאה א"ר אבהו כדם אצבע קטנה של יד שנגפה וחייתה וחזרה ונגפה ולא של כל אדם אלא של בחור שלא נשא אשה ועד כמה עד בן עשרים
human_translation: Ami of Vardina Rabbi Abbahu says: as blood smallest finger of hand, which was wounded and healed and was wounded again. And not of any person, but of a young man who has not married a woman. And until what Until twenty old.
llm_translation: Ami and Ridina said, Rabbi Abahu: Like the blood of the little finger of the hand that was wounded and healed, and was wounded again, but not of every person, rather of a young man who has not married a woman. And until when? Until the age of twenty.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי תולה בבנה ובבעלה בשלמא בבנה משכחת לה אלא בעלה היכי משכחת לה
human_translation: raises an objection she may attribute to her son or to her husband, Granted, with regard to her son, you can find But her husband, how can you find
llm_translation: Challenged: hangs in her son and in her husband. Granted, in her son she finds comfort, but in her husband how does she find comfort?

hebrew_text: אמר ר"נ בר יצחק כגון שנכנסה לחופה ולא נבעלה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: where entered the canopy but has not engaged in intercourse
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "For example, if she entered the wedding canopy but did not consummate the marriage."

hebrew_text: ר"נ אמר כדם הקזה מיתיבי מעשה ותלה ר"מ
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: like the blood of bloodletting. raises an objection An incident and Rabbi Meir attributed
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah said: Like the blood of sprinkling. The scholars raised an objection: A case occurred, and Rabbi Meir suspended his judgment.

hebrew_text: בקילור ורבי תלה בשרף שקמה מאי לאו אאדום
human_translation: to an eye salve [ bekilor ], And Rabbi attributed to the sap of a sycamore What, is it not to red,
llm_translation: In Kilor and Rabbi hung on a sraf, what is it, is it not Edom?

hebrew_text: לא אשאר דמים
human_translation: No; to other blood
llm_translation: I will not remain blood.

hebrew_text: אמימר ומר זוטרא ורב אשי הוו יתבי קמיה אומנא שקלי ליה קרנא קמייתא לאמימר חזייה אמר להו אדום דתנן כי האי שקלי ליה אחריתי אמר להו אשתני אמר רב אשי כגון אנא דלא ידענא בין האי להאי לא מבעי לי למחזי דמא
human_translation: Ameimar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashi were sitting before a bloodletter, removed horn from Ameimar first saw said to red that we learned like this removed another said to them: has changed Rav Ashi, said: such as myself, as I do not know between this and that should not see, blood
llm_translation: Ammar, Mar Zutra, and Rav Ashi were sitting in front of a craftsman. They took a horn before Ammar. He saw it and said to them, "Edom, as we learned, 'If this horn is taken, another one is brought.' " He said to them, "It is different." Rav Ashi said, "I, for example, who do not know the difference between this one and that one, do not need to see blood."

hebrew_text: שחור כחרת אמר רבה בר רב הונא חרת שאמרו דיו תניא נמי הכי שחור כחרת ושחור שאמרו דיו ולימא דיו אי אמר דיו הוה אמינא כי פכחותא דדיותא קמ"ל כי חרותא דדיותא
human_translation: black as ḥeret . Rabba bar Rav Huna says: ḥeret of which spoke ink. this is also taught black like ḥeret , and black of which spoke ink. But Let him say Ink. If said Ink, I would say like the clear part of the ink, teaches us like the blackness [ ḥaruta ] of the ink,
llm_translation: Black like a potsherd, Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: A potsherd, as they said, ink. It was also taught likewise: black like a potsherd, and black as they said, ink. And let him say ink! If he said ink, I would say, like the opening of the inkwells. This teaches us, like the smoothness of the inkwells.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו בלחה או ביבשתא תא שמע דרבי אמי פלי קורטא דדיותא ובדיק בה
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before to moist or dry Come hear as Rabbi Ami break up pieces of ink and examine with it.
llm_translation: The question was asked: with a wet or dry rag? Come and hear what Rabbi Ami said: fold a strip of cloth and check with it.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל כקיר כדיו וכענב טמאה וזוהי ששנינו עמוק מכן טמאה אמר רבי אלעזר כזית כזפת וכעורב טהור וזוהי ששנינו דיהה מכן טהור
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: like wax [ kekir ] like ink or like grape, she is ritually impure. And this is that which we learned deeper than that, ritually impure. Rabbi Elazar says: like olive, like tar, or like raven, pure. And this is which we learned lighter than that, ritually pure.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Like a wall, like ink, and like a grape are impure. And this is what we learned: Deep from there is impure. Rabbi Elazar said: Like an olive, like pitch, and like a raven are pure. And this is what we learned: From there is pure.

hebrew_text: עולא אמר כלבושא סיואה עולא אקלע לפומבדיתא חזייה לההוא טייעא דלבוש לבושא אוכמא אמר להו שחור דתנן כי האי מרטו מיניה פורתא פורתא יהבו ביה ארבע מאה זוזי
human_translation: Ulla says: like Siva’a, Ulla happened to Pumbedita, he saw a certain Arab [ tayya’a ] who was dressed in a black garment. said to black that we learned like this they tore from him bit by bit, they gave him four hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Ula said: "A black garment is a sign of mourning." Ula happened to come to the marketplace and saw a certain tailor wearing a black garment. He said to them: "Black, as we have learned, for this master they gave four hundred zuz piece by piece."

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר אלו כלים האוליירין הבאים ממדינת הים למימרא דאוכמי נינהו והאמר להו רבי ינאי לבניו בני אל תקברוני לא בכלים שחורים ולא בכלים לבנים שחורים שמא אזכה ואהיה כאבל בין החתנים לבנים שמא לא אזכה ואהיה כחתן בין האבלים אלא בכלים האוליירין הבאים ממדינת הים
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: these cloths of the bath attendants [ haolyarin ] who come from overseas. Is that to say that these are black But didn’t Rabbi Yannai say to his sons: My sons, do not bury me in black cloths nor in white cloths. black, lest I be acquitted and I will be like a mourner among the grooms. white, lest I not be acquitted and I will be like a groom among the mourners. Rather, in the cloths of the bath attendants who come from overseas, Apparently, are not black.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: These utensils that come from the country of the sea, one may say that they are clean. And Rabbi Yannai said to his sons: "My sons, do not bury me neither in black vessels nor in white vessels, for perhaps I will merit and be like a mourner among the groomsmen, or perhaps I will not merit and be like a groom among the mourners. Rather, in utensils that come from the country of the sea."

hebrew_text: אלמא לאו אוכמי נינהו לא קשיא הא בגלימא הא בפתורא
human_translation: not difficult, that to garment, that to a table
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma lav ukmei ninhu, lo kashya ha b'glima ha b'patura."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל וכולם אין בודקין אלא על גבי מטלית לבנה אמר רב יצחק בר אבודימי ושחור על גבי אדום
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: And all of them, one examines them only on a white cloth, Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi says: And black on a red
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, and all of them only examine on top of a white cloth. Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi said, "And black on top of red."

hebrew_text: אמר רב ירמיה מדפתי ולא פליגי הא בשחור הא בשאר דמים מתקיף לה רב אשי אי הכי לימא שמואל חוץ משחור אלא אמר רב אשי בשחור גופיה קמיפלגי
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya of Difti says: And do not disagree, this to black that to other blood Rav Ashi objects to this If so, let Shmuel say: except for black, Rather, Rav Ashi says: disagree with regard to black itself,
