llm_translation: Rav Yirmiya said: From the fact that they are spread out and do not argue, this one regarding black and that one regarding other blood, Rav Ashi objects: If so, let him say it is Shmuel, except for black. Rather, Rav Ashi said: They are arguing about black itself.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא כולן עמוק מכן טמא דיהה מכן טהור כשחור
human_translation: Ulla says: all of deeper than ritually impure; lighter than it, ritually pure, as black.
llm_translation: Ula said: All of them are deep; from there impure, from there pure, like a black.

hebrew_text: ואלא מאי שנא שחור דנקט סד"א הואיל ואמר רבי חנינא שחור אדום הוא אלא שלקה הילכך אפילו דיהה מכן נמי ליטמא קמשמע לן
human_translation: But what is different black, that mentions enter your mind to say since Rabbi Ḥanina says: black is red but has faded, therefore, even lighter than it should also be impure. teaches us
llm_translation: And rather what is different about black that it is taken by the Sanhedrin? Since Rabbi Chanina said black is red. Rather, it is because it is licked. Therefore, even if it is from there, it also becomes impure.

hebrew_text: רבי אמי בר אבא אמר וכולן עמוק מכן טמא דיהה מכן נמי טמא חוץ משחור אלא מאי אהני שיעוריה דרבנן לאפוקי דיהה דדיהה
human_translation: Rabbi Ami bar Abba says: And all of deeper than ritually impure; lighter than ritually impure, except for black, But what purpose do the measures by the Sages serve? to the exclusion of lighter than lighter,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ami bar Abba said, "And all of them are deep. From here it is impure, from here it is also impure, except for black. Rather, what is the benefit of the Rabbinic measurement? To exclude the impurity of impurity."

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי רמי בר אבא אמר וכולן עמוק מכן טהור דיהה מכן טהור חוץ משחור ולהכי מהני שיעוריה דרבנן
human_translation: And there are who say Rami bar Abba says: And all of deeper than that ritually pure; lighter than that, ritually pure, except for black, And for this the measures, of the Sages are effective,
llm_translation: And there are those who say: Rami bar Abba said, "And all of them are deep; from there, pure; from there, pure, except for black. And therefore, the Rabbinic measurement is effective."

hebrew_text: בר קפרא אמר וכולן עמוק מכן טמא דיהה מכן טהור חוץ ממזג שעמוק מכן טהור דיהה מכן טהור בר קפרא אדיהו ליה ודכי אעמיקו ליה ודכי אמר רבי חנינא כמה נפיש גברא דלביה כמשמעתיה
human_translation: Bar Kappara says: And all of them, deeper than that, impure; lighter than that, pure, except diluted which deeper than that, pure, lighter than that, pure. bar Kappara, they lightened it, and deemed it pure. they deepened and deemed it pure. Rabbi Ḥanina says How great man whose heart, is in accordance with his halakha .
llm_translation: Son of Kapara said: And all of them deep from there impure, from there pure, except for a mixture that is deep from there pure, from there pure. Son of Kapara until now and when they deepen it for him and when he says Rabbi Chanina: How great is a person whose heart is like his understanding.

hebrew_text: וכקרן כרכום תנא לח ולא יבש
human_translation: And like the bright crocus taught: moist and not dry
llm_translation: "And like the horn of turmeric, it was taught: 'To him, and it did not wither.'"

hebrew_text: תני חדא כתחתון ולא כעליון ותניא אידך כעליון ולא כתחתון ותניא אידך כעליון וכל שכן כתחתון ותניא אידך כתחתון וכל שכן כעליון
human_translation: is taught one like lower not like upper and is taught another like upper and not like lower and is taught another like upper and all the more so like lower and is taught another like lower and all the more so like upper
llm_translation: One taught: like the lower part and not like the upper part. And it was taught in another source: like the upper part and not like the lower part. And it was taught in another source: like the upper part, and all the more so the lower part. And it was taught in another source: like the lower part, and all the more so the upper part.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי תלתא דרי ותלתא טרפן הויין
human_translation: Abaye says three layers and there are three leaves,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "Three are valid and three are invalid."

hebrew_text: נקוט דרא מציעאה וטרפא מציעתא בידך
human_translation: grasp middle leaf middle layer in your hand
llm_translation: Take a piece of cloth from the storehouse, and a torn piece of cloth from your hand.

hebrew_text: כי אתו לקמיה דרבי אבהו אמר להו בגושייהו שנינו
human_translation: When would come before Rabbi Abbahu he say to them: We learned in their clumps
llm_translation: When they came before Rabbi Abahu, he said to them: "In their regions we learned."

hebrew_text: וכמימי אדמה תנו רבנן כמימי אדמה מביא אדמה שמנה מבקעת בית כרם ומציף עליה מים דברי רבי מאיר רבי עקיבא אומר מבקעת יודפת רבי יוסי אומר מבקעת סכני רבי שמעון אומר אף מבקעת גנוסר וכיוצא בהן
human_translation: And like water earth the Sages taught like water earth, one brings fertile earth from the Beit Kerem Valley and one inundates water the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Akiva says: from the Yodfat Valley. Rabbi Yosei says: From the Sikhnei Valley. Rabbi Shimon says: even from the Genosar Valley or similar
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And like the days of the earth, the Rabbis taught: Like the days of the earth, one brings earth from a valley of Beit Kerem and pours water on it. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Akiva says: from the valley of Yodfat. Rabbi Yosei says: from the valley of Sakni. Rabbi Shimon says: even from the valley of Genosar, and the like."

hebrew_text: תניא אידך וכמימי אדמה מביא אדמה שמנה מבקעת בית כרם ומציף עליה מים כקליפת השום ואין שיעור למים משום דאין שיעור לעפר ואין בודקין אותן צלולין אלא עכורין צללו חוזר ועוכרן וכשהוא עוכרן אין עוכרן ביד אלא בכלי
human_translation: is taught another And like water earth, one brings fertile earth from the Beit Kerem Valley and one inundates water of the husk of garlic. And there is no measure for the water, because there is no measure for earth And one does not examine it clear, rather muddy became clear one must muddy it again. And when one muddies it he does not muddy it by hand rather with a vessel.
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: "And like the days of the earth, one brings earth from a valley of Beit Kerem and pours water upon it like the peel of garlic. There is no measure for the water because there is no measure for the earth. And one does not examine them if they are clear, but rather if they are clotted. If they are clear, one returns and clots them. And when one clots them, one does not clot them by hand, but with a vessel."

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו אין עוכרין אותן ביד אלא בכלי דלא לרמיה בידיה ולעכרינהו אבל במנא כי עכר ליה בידיה שפיר דמי או דלמא דלא לעכרינהו בידיה אלא במנא
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one does not muddy it by hand rather with a vessel that one should not put into his hand and muddy but in a vessel, when one muddies it with his hand well Or perhaps that one should not muddy with his hand, rather with a vessel?
llm_translation: The question was asked: Do we not grind them by hand, except with a utensil that is not fit for its purpose in one's hand, and grind it? But with a utensil, when he grinds it by hand, it is considered proper, or perhaps not to grind it by hand, except with a utensil.

hebrew_text: ת"ש כשהוא בודקן אין בודקן אלא בכוס ועדיין תבעי לך בדיקה בכוס עכירה במאי תיקו
human_translation: Come hear When one examines he examines it only with a cup. But you still have a dilemma. examination in a cup, with what muddying shall stand
llm_translation: Come and hear: When one inspects them, one inspects them only with a cup. And yet, it is necessary for you to inspect with a flawed cup. What is the resolution?

hebrew_text: כי אתו לקמיה דרבה בר אבוה אמר להו במקומה שנינו רבי חנינא פלי קורטא דגרגשתא ובדיק ביה לייט עליה רבי ישמעאל ברבי יוסי באסכרה
human_translation: When come before Rabba bar Avuh he say to them: We learned in its place, Rabbi Ḥanina break up a clump of earth and examine with it, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, curse with diphtheria.
llm_translation: When they came before Rabah bar Avuh, he said to them, "In its place we learned: Rabbi Chanina Pelei, the weaver of Gargeshita, examined it, and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, in Aschera, quoted a verse."

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא הוא דחכים כולי עלמא לאו חכימי הכי
human_translation: It is Rabbi Ḥanina as he is wise, everyone is not so wise
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina is the one who is wise, all the world are not wise like him.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן חכמתא דרבי חנינא גרמא לי דלא אחזי דמא מטמינא מטהר מטהרנא מטמא אמר רבי אלעזר ענוותנותא דרבי חנינא גרמא לי דחזאי דמא ומה רבי חנינא דענותן הוא מחית נפשיה לספק וחזי אנא לא אחזי
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Ḥanina’s wisdom causes me not to see blood I would deem impure, he would deem pure, I would deem pure, he would deem impure. Rabbi Elazar says: Rabbi Ḥanina’s humility causes me to see blood, If Rabbi Ḥanina, who is humble, places himself into uncertainty and sees I, not see
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The wisdom of Rabbi Chanina caused me to not see blood; I see, I purify, I purify, I see. Rabbi Elazar said: The humility of Rabbi Chanina caused me to see blood. But Rabbi Chanina, his humility was to endanger himself for a doubt, whereas I do not see.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא טבעא דבבל גרמא לי דלא חזאי דמא דאמינא בטבעא לא ידענא בדמא ידענא
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: The nature of Babylonia causes me not to see blood as I say involving the nature I do not know; I know of blood?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: "The humidity of Babylonia caused me not to see blood, for I used to say: 'In humidity I do not know blood, in blood I know.'"

hebrew_text: למימרא דבטבעא תליא מלתא והא רבה הוא דידע בטבעא ולא ידע בדמא כל שכן קאמר ומה רבה דידע בטבעא לא חזא דמא ואנא אחזי
human_translation: Is this to say that matter is dependent on the nature But Rabba is who knew about the nature and he did not know of blood. said All the more so; if Rabba, who knew about the nature would not see blood, I, see
llm_translation: To say that the matter depends on nature, but Rabah knew about nature and did not know about blood, all the more so is what he is saying. And if Rabah, who knew about nature, did not see blood, then I see it.

hebrew_text: עולא אקלע לפומבדיתא אייתו לקמיה דמא ולא חזא אמר ומה רבי אלעזר דמרא דארעא דישראל הוה כי מקלע לאתרא דר' יהודה לא חזי דמא אנא אחזי
human_translation: Ulla happened to Pumbedita, they brought blood before him but he would not see he said: If Rabbi Elazar, who was the master of Eretz Yisrael when he would happen to the locale of Rabbi Yehuda, he would not see blood, shall I see blood
llm_translation: Ula came to Pumbedita, they brought before him a cup of water, and he did not see it. He said, "And if Rabbi Elazar the master of the land of Israel, when he reached the place of Rabbi Yehuda, did not see water, should I see it?"

hebrew_text: ואמאי קרו ליה מרא דארעא דישראל דההיא אתתא דאייתא דמא לקמיה דרבי אלעזר הוה יתיב רבי אמי קמיה ארחיה אמר לה האי דם חימוד הוא בתר דנפקה אטפל לה רבי אמי אמרה ליה בעלי היה בדרך וחמדתיו קרי עליה (תהלים כה, יד) סוד ה' ליראיו
human_translation: And why would they call the master of Eretz Yisrael involving a certain woman who brought blood before Rabbi Elazar Rabbi Ami was sitting before him. smelled said to This is blood of desire, After left Rabbi Ami caught up with her She said to him: My husband was on a journey, and I desired him. read about “The counsel of the Lord is with those who fear Him;
llm_translation: And why is he called "Master of the Land of Israel"? Because that woman who came bringing blood before Rabbi Eliezer, Rabbi Ami was sitting in front of him. He said to her, "This blood is precious." After she left, Rabbi Ami took hold of her. She said to him, "My husband was on the road, and I longed for him." (Psalms 25:14) "The secret of the Lord is for those who fear Him."

hebrew_text: אפרא הורמיז אמיה דשבור מלכא שדרה דמא לקמיה דרבא הוה יתיב רב עובדיה קמיה ארחיה אמר לה האי דם חימוד הוא אמרה ליה לבריה תא חזי כמה חכימי יהודאי א"ל דלמא כסומא בארובה
human_translation: Ifera Hurmiz, the mother of King Shapur, sent blood before Rava Rav Ovadya was sitting before smelled said to This is blood of desire. She said to her son: Come see how wise the Jews said to her: Perhaps like a blind man from a chimney,
llm_translation: Efra Horamiz, the mother of King Shapur, sent a cup of blood before Rava. Rav Ovadya was sitting before him. He said to her, "This is desirable blood." She said to him, "Come, my son, see how wise the Jews are." He said to her, "Perhaps it is blood from a leper."

hebrew_text: הדר שדרה ליה שתין מיני דמא וכולהו אמרינהו ההוא בתרא דם כנים הוה ולא ידע אסתייע מילתא ושדר לה סריקותא דמקטלא כלמי אמרה יהודאי בתווני דלבא יתביתו
human_translation: then sent sixty blood, and all of them told her That last was blood of lice, and did not know support matter sent her a comb for killing lice. She said Jews, you dwell in the chamber of hearts.
llm_translation: "The one who dwelled in that place for two years, various types of bloodshed, and all of them they said to him, that one in the last one was a blood of zealots, and he did not know the matter, and he sent to her the scalpels of the executioner. Yehudai said in the chambers of the heart, they shall be destroyed."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה מרישא הוה חזינא דמא כיון דאמרה לי אמיה דיצחק ברי האי טיפתא קמייתא לא מייתינן לה קמייהו דרבנן משום דזהימא לא חזינא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: At first I would see blood, when the mother of my son Yitzḥak, said to me this first drop I do not bring it before the Sages, because it is not pristine I no see
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Initially, I saw that when the mother of Yitzchak said to me, "This drop is in front of you," we did not bring it before the Rabbis because we did not see it as significant.

hebrew_text: בין טמאה לטהורה ודאי חזינא
human_translation: whether she is ritually impure or pure, I certainly see
llm_translation: Between impure and pure, certainly we see.

hebrew_text: ילתא אייתא דמא לקמיה דרבה בר בר חנה וטמי לה הדר אייתא לקמיה דרב יצחק בריה דרב יהודה ודכי לה
human_translation: Yalta, brought blood before Rabba bar bar Ḥana, and he deemed her ritually impure. She then brought before Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, and he deemed her pure.
llm_translation: A young child brought a cup of blood before Rabba bar bar Ḥana, and he rendered it impure. He then brought it before Rav Yitzḥak, the son of Rav Yehuda, and he declared it pure.

hebrew_text: והיכי עביד הכי והתניא חכם שטימא אין חברו רשאי לטהר אסר אין חבירו רשאי להתיר
human_translation: But how could act in this manner? But isn’t it taught a halakhic authority who deemed impure, another is not allowed to deem pure; deemed prohibited, another is not allowed to deem permitted?
llm_translation: And how does one do so? And it was taught in a Baraita: "A wise person who becomes impure, his colleague is not permitted to purify him; if he forbids, his colleague is not permitted to permit."

hebrew_text: מעיקרא טמויי הוה מטמי לה כיון דא"ל דכל יומא הוה מדכי לי כי האי גונא והאידנא הוא דחש בעיניה דכי לה
human_translation: initially deemed her impure, when said to him: Every day of this kind he deems me pure, and specifically now as he feels in his eye. deemed her pure.
llm_translation: From the outset, he was hidden, he would hide from her, since he said to her, "Every day he would speak to me like this, and now it is he who is silent in her eyes."

hebrew_text: ומי מהימני אין והתניא נאמנת אשה לומר כזה ראיתי ואבדתיו
human_translation: But deemed credible Yes; and it is taught A woman is deemed credible says: I saw like this but I lost it
llm_translation: And who is trustworthy? No. And it was taught: A woman is believed to say, "I saw such and such and lost it."

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו כזה טיהר איש פלוני חכם מהו
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before like this, so-and-so, the halakhic authority, deemed pure, what is
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "If such a one, Tihara, a man named so-and-so, a sage, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: תא שמע נאמנת אשה לומר כזה ראיתי ואבדתיו שאני התם דליתיה לקמה
human_translation: Come hear A woman is deemed credible says: I saw like this but I lost it. There is different, as is not before her,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A woman is believed to say, "I have seen such and such and lost it." The difference is that there is no one there to contradict her.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דילתא אייתא דמא לקמיה דרבה בר בר חנה וטמי לה לקמיה דרב יצחק בריה דרב יהודה ודכי לה והיכי עביד הכי והתניא חכם שטימא אין חבירו רשאי לטהר וכו'
human_translation: Come hear as Yalta brought blood before Rabba bar bar Ḥana, and he deemed her ritually impure; before Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, and he deemed her pure. And How could act in this manner? But isn’t it taught a halakhic authority who deemed impure, another is not allowed to deem pure?
llm_translation: Come and hear: A certain woman brought a bloodstain before Rabba bar bar Ḥana, and he declared it impure. She then brought it before Rav Yitzḥak, the son of Rav Yehuda, and he declared it pure. How did he act in this manner? And it was taught in a baraita: "If one sage declares an object impure, his colleague is not permitted to declare it pure..."

hebrew_text: ואמרינן טמויי הוה מטמי לה כיון דאמרה ליה דכל יומא מדכי לה כי האי גונא והאידנא הוא דחש בעיניה הדר דכי לה אלמא מהימנא לה
human_translation: And we say deemed her impure, when she said to him that every day of this kind he deems her pure, and specifically now as he feels in his eye. then deemed her pure. Evidently, we deem her credible.
llm_translation: And we say: She was impure, he would render her impure, once she said to him, "Every day you render me impure like this reed." And now, since he was silent in her eyes, he returned and rendered her impure. This implies that we trust her.

hebrew_text: רב יצחק בר יהודה אגמריה סמך
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, relied on his studies
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Yehuda said in the name of Agmirah: "He relied."

hebrew_text: רבי ראה דם בלילה וטימא ראה ביום וטיהר המתין שעה אחת חזר וטימא אמר אוי לי שמא טעיתי
human_translation: Rabbi saw blood at night and deemed impure. He saw in the day, and deemed pure. waited one hour deemed impure again. said: Woe is me! Perhaps I erred
llm_translation: Rabbi saw blood at night and became impure, saw during the day and became pure. He waited one hour, then became impure again. He said, "Woe is me, perhaps I made a mistake."

hebrew_text: שמא טעיתי ודאי טעה דתניא לא יאמר חכם אילו היה לח היה ודאי טמא
human_translation: Perhaps I erred? He certainly erred, as it is taught a halakhic authority may not say: If were moist it would certainly have been impure,
llm_translation: Perhaps I erred, but certainly one errs, as it was taught: A sage should not say, "If it were a moist substance, it would be impure," but rather, "Certainly it is impure."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אין לו לדיין אלא מה שעיניו רואות מעיקרא אחזקיה בטמא כיון דחזא לצפרא דאשתני אמר (ליה) ודאי טהור הוה ובלילה הוא דלא אתחזי שפיר כיון דחזא דהדר אשתני אמר האי טמא הוא ומפכח הוא דקא מפכח ואזיל
human_translation: Rather, said: A judge has only what his eyes see Initially, established the presumptive status as ritually impure, when he saw in the morning that changed, he said: It was definitely pure and only at night because it could not be seen well. when he saw that again changed, said: This is impure, and it is gradually becoming lighter
llm_translation: Rather, he said, the judge has only what his eyes see from the beginning. He initially held it to be impure. Once he saw the morning light, which is different, he said to him, "Indeed, it was pure, and it is at night that it does not appear well." Once he saw that it changed back, he said, "This is impure, and it is a bat that is flying and going."

hebrew_text: רבי בדיק לאור הנר רבי ישמעאל ברבי יוסף בדיק ביום המעונן ביני עמודי אמר רב אמי בר שמואל וכולן אין בודקין אותן אלא בין חמה לצל רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה בחמה ובצל ידו
human_translation: Rabbi would examine by candlelight. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosef, would examine between the pillars on a cloudy day, Rav Ami bar Shmuel says: And all these one examines only between sunlight and shade. Rav Naḥman Rabba bar Avuh says: in sun, and under the shadow of his hand,
llm_translation: Rabbi Badeek examined the light of the lamp; Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosef, examined on a cloudy day between the pillars. Rav Ami, son of Shmuel, said: "And all of them are examined only between the sun and the shade." Rav Nachman said: "Rabbah, son of Avuhah, with the sun and the shade, his hand."

hebrew_text: וכמזוג שני חלקים כו' תנא
human_translation: And like diluted two parts taught
llm_translation: "And like the mixing of two portions, etc." - It was taught:

hebrew_text: השרוני נידון ככרמלי חי ולא מזוג חדש ולא ישן
human_translation: the of the Sharon has the same status as undiluted Carmelite and not diluted new and not old
llm_translation: The Sharonite is judged like a Carmelite, alive and not mixed, new and not old.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יצחק בר אבודימי וכולן אין בודקין אותן אלא בכוס טבריא פשוט מאי טעמא אמר אביי של כל העולם כולו מחזיק לוג עושין אותו ממנה שני לוגין עושין אותו ממאתים כוס טבריא פשוט אפי' מחזיק שני לוגין עושין אותו ממנה ואיידי דקליש ידיע ביה טפי
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi says: And all one examines only with a simple Tiberian cup. What is the reason? Abaye says: a universal contain a log one fashions it from one hundred dinars, two log , one fashions it from two hundred dinars. a simple Tiberian cup, even contain two log , one fashions it from one hundred dinars. And since is weak, more noticeable.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi said, "And all of them, they only check them with a cup of Tveria. What is the reason?" Abaye said, "For the whole world holds a Log, they make it from one Log. They make it from two Logs. A simple cup of Tveria, even if it holds two Logs, they make it from one. And since it is more delicate, it is more recognizable."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כל היד
llm_translation: The honor upon you, all the hand.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המפלת חתיכה אם יש עמה דם טמאה ואם לאו טהורה ר' יהודה אומר בין כך ובין כך טמאה
human_translation: who discharges piece if there is blood with it, ritually impure And if not, she is pure, Rabbi Yehuda says: both this and that is impure
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who miscarries a piece, if there is blood with it, it is impure; and if not, it is pure. Rabbi Yehudah says: whether this way or that way, it is impure.

hebrew_text: המפלת כמין קליפה כמין שערה כמין עפר כמין יבחושין אדומים תטיל למים אם נמוחו טמאה ואם לאו טהורה
human_translation: who discharges similar to a shell, similar to a hair, similar to soil, similar to mosquitoes, red, she should cast into water If they dissolved, is impure and if not, she is pure.
llm_translation: The one who falls like a peel, like a hair, like dust, like red scales, shall cast into water. If they dissolve, it is impure; if not, it is pure.

hebrew_text: המפלת כמין דגים חגבים שקצים ורמשים אם יש עמהם דם טמאה ואם לאו טהורה
human_translation: who discharges similar to fish grasshoppers, repugnant creatures, or creeping animals, if there is blood with them, is impure And if not, she is pure.
llm_translation: The one who falls like the species of fish, locusts, detestable creatures, and creeping things, if there is with them blood impure, and if not, pure.

hebrew_text: המפלת מין בהמה חיה ועוף בין טמאין בין טהורין אם זכר תשב לזכר ואם נקבה תשב לנקבה
human_translation: who discharges a type of domesticated animal, undomesticated animal, or bird, whether a non-kosher a kosher if a male she observes for a male. And if a female, observes for a female.
llm_translation: The one who causes a mixture of species among domestic animals, wild animals, and birds, whether they are impure or pure, if it is a male, it shall sit for a male, and if it is a female, it shall sit for a female.

hebrew_text: ואם אין ידוע תשב לזכר ולנקבה דברי רבי מאיר וחכמים אומרים כל שאין בו מצורת אדם אינו ולד
human_translation: And if is unknown, she observes to a male and to a female. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Any that is not of human form is not an offspring
llm_translation: "And if it is not known, it shall sit for male and female. The words of Rabbi Meir, and the Sages say: Anything that does not have the form of a human being is not a viable offspring."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל לא טימא רבי יהודה אלא בחתיכה של ארבעת מיני דמים אבל של שאר מיני דמים טהורה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Rabbi Yehuda deemed impure, only in a piece of the four types of blood, But of other types of blood, is pure.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Rabbi Yehudah did not deem impure, except for a piece of the four types of blood, but if it is of other types of blood, it is pure.

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן אמר של ארבעת מיני דמים דברי הכל טמאה של שאר מיני דמים דברי הכל טהורה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says of the four types of blood, everyone, agrees is impure. of other types of blood, everyone agrees she is pure.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Regarding the four types of blood, everyone agrees that the blood of three is impure, and regarding the other types of blood, everyone agrees that it is pure.

hebrew_text: לא נחלקו אלא שהפילה ואינה יודעת מה הפילה רבי יהודה סבר זיל בתר רוב חתיכות ורוב חתיכות של (מיני) ארבעת מיני דמים הויין ורבנן סברי לא אמרינן רוב חתיכות של ארבעת מיני דמים
human_translation: They disagree only where discharged and she does not know what she discharged, Rabbi Yehuda holds: Follow the majority of pieces and the majority of pieces are of four types of blood. And the Rabbis hold: We do not say the majority of pieces of four types of blood.
llm_translation: They only disagreed that she miscarried and does not know what she miscarried. Rabbi Yehuda holds: Go after the majority of pieces, and the majority of pieces of the four types of blood are considered. And the Rabbis hold: We do not say the majority of pieces of the four types of blood.

hebrew_text: איני והא כי אתא רב הושעיא מנהרדעא אתא ואייתי מתניתא בידיה המפלת חתיכה אדומה שחורה ירוקה ולבנה אם יש עמה דם טמאה ואם לאו טהורה רבי יהודה אומר בין כך ובין כך טמאה קשיא לשמואל בחדא ולרבי יוחנן בתרתי
human_translation: Is that so? But when Rav Hoshaya came from Neharde’a, he came and brought a baraita with him who discharges a piece red, black, green, or white, if there is blood with it, is impure, and if not, she is pure. Rabbi Yehuda says: Both this and that is impure. a difficulty to Shmuel with regard to one and to Rabbi Yoḥanan with regard to two
llm_translation: I am not. But when Rav Hoshaya came from Nehardea, he came and brought a Mishnah in his hand: "A piece, red, black, green, and white, if there is blood with it, it is impure, and if not, it is pure." Rabbi Yehuda says: "Whether this or that, it is impure." This is difficult for Shmuel in one respect, and for Rabbi Yochanan in two.

hebrew_text: לשמואל בחדא דאמר שמואל לא טימא רבי יהודה אלא בחתיכה של ארבעת מיני דמים והא קתני ירוקה ולבנה ופליג רבי יהודה
human_translation: to Shmuel with regard to one as Shmuel said Rabbi Yehuda deemed impure only in a piece of the four types of blood, and teaches green or white, and disagrees
llm_translation: To Samuel in one place that Samuel said: Rabbi Yehuda did not render impure, except with a piece of the four types of blood. But it teaches both yellow and white, and Rabbi Yehuda disputes.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא כי פליג רבי יהודה אאדומה ושחורה ואירוקה ולבנה לא אלא ירוקה ולבנה למאן קתני לה
human_translation: And if you would say when Rabbi Yehuda disagrees with regard to a red or black but with regard to a green or white not But for whose does teach a green or white
llm_translation: And if you will say, when Rabbi Yehuda disputes regarding red, black, green, and white, is it not rather only green and white that he disputes? To whom is this taught?

hebrew_text: אילימא רבנן השתא אדומה ושחורה מטהרי רבנן ירוקה ולבנה מיבעיא אלא לאו לרבי יהודה ופליג
human_translation: If we say the Rabbis, Now a red or black the Rabbis deem pure, is necessary a green or white Rather, not to Rabbi Yehuda, but disagrees
llm_translation: If you say the Rabbis now, red and black are colors that purify, the Rabbis will ask: Green and white are colors that are needed? Rather, is it not a question for Rabbi Yehuda, and the Rabbis dispute.

hebrew_text: ותו לרבי יוחנן דאמר של ארבעת מיני דמים דברי הכל טמאה הא קתני אדומה ושחורה ופליגי רבנן
human_translation: And furthermore, to Rabbi Yoḥanan, as he said of the four types of blood everyone agrees is impure, teaches a red or black and the Rabbis disagree
llm_translation: And further, regarding Rabbi Yochanan who said concerning the four types of blood, everyone agrees that it is impure. However, it is taught: red and black, and the Rabbis disagree.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא כי פליגי רבנן אירוקה ולבנה אבל אאדומה ושחורה לא אלא אדומה ושחורה למאן קתני לה
human_translation: And if you would say when the Rabbis disagree with regard to a green or white but in a red or black not but for whose does teach a red or black
llm_translation: And if you will say, when the Rabbis dispute, it is regarding white and white, but red and black are not included, rather it is red and black, according to whom is this Mishnah taught?

hebrew_text: אילימא רבי יהודה השתא ירוקה ולבנה טמאה אדומה ושחורה מיבעיא אלא לאו רבנן ופליגי

human_translation: Is that so? But when Rav Hoshaya came from Neharde’a, he came and brought a baraita with him who discharges a piece red, or black, green, or white, if there is blood with it, is impure, and if not, she is pure. And Rabbi Yehuda says: both this and that is impure.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב יהודה באפשר לפתיחת הקבר בלא דם קמיפלגי ובפלוגתא דהני תנאי דתניא קשתה שנים ולשלישי הפילה ואינה יודעת מה הפילה הרי זו ספק לידה ספק זיבה מביאה קרבן ואינו נאכל
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yehuda says They disagree with regard to opening of the womb is possible without blood. llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yehudah said: In a case where it is possible to open the grave without bloodshed, the dispute arises. And in the dispute of these Tannaim, as it was taught: If a woman's labor pains lasted two days and then ceased on the third day, and it is not known what caused the cessation, this is a case of doubt regarding childbirth or doubt regarding menstrual bleeding, she brings a sacrifice which is not eaten.

hebrew_text: רבי יהושע אומר מביאה קרבן ונאכל לפי שאי אפשר לפתיחת הקבר בלא דם
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: brings an offering, and it is eaten. as opening of the womb is not possible without blood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "One brings a sacrifice and eats it, because it is impossible to open the grave without blood."

hebrew_text: ת"ר המפלת חתיכה סומכוס אומר משום רבי מאיר וכן היה רבי שמעון בן מנסיא אומר כדבריו קורעה אם יש דם בתוכה טמאה ואם לאו טהורה
human_translation: The Sages taught who discharges piece Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir, and likewise Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya would say in accordance with his statement: tear it If there is blood inside it, ritually impure, and if not, she is pure.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who miscarries a piece, Sumakos says in the name of Rabbi Meir, and similarly Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says in accordance with his words: If there is blood inside it, she is impure; and if not, she is pure.

hebrew_text: כרבנן ועדיפא מדרבנן כרבנן דאמרי אפשר לפתיחת הקבר בלא דם ועדיפא מדרבנן דאינהו סברי עמה אין בתוכה לא וסומכוס סבר אפילו בתוכה
human_translation: in accordance with the Rabbis but it is far-reaching, than that the Rabbis. It is in accordance with the Rabbis, as they say opening of the womb is possible without blood, But far-reaching than that the Rabbis, as they hold with yes, inside not and Sumakhos holds even inside

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך המפלת חתיכה ר' אחא אומר קורעה אם תוכה מאדים טמאה ואם לאו טהורה
human_translation: And it is taught another who discharges piece Rabbi Aḥa says: tears it if its interior looks red, is impure; and if not she is pure.
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: One who removes a piece, Rabbi Acha says: if its inside is red, it is impure; and if not, it is pure.

hebrew_text: כסומכוס ועדיפא מסומכוס
human_translation: in accordance with Sumakhos, but far-reaching than Sumakhos,

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך המפלת חתיכה רבי בנימין אומר קורעה אם יש בה עצם אמו טמאה לידה אמר רב חסדא ובחתיכה לבנה וכן כי אתא זוגא דמן חדייב אתא ואייתי מתניתא בידיה המפלת חתיכה לבנה קורעה אם יש בה עצם אמו טמאה לידה
human_translation: And it is taught another who discharges piece Rabbi Binyamin says tears it If it contains a bone, its mother is impure birth. Rav Ḥisda says: And in a white piece And likewise, when a pair came from Ḥadyab, they came and brought a baraita with them: who discharges a white piece tears it if it contains a bone, its mother is impure birth.
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: One who miscarries a piece, Rabbi Benjamin says tears it. If it contains the bone of its mother, she is unclean for childbirth. Rav Ḥisda said: And with a white piece as well. And similarly, when the pair of scholars from Ḥadaiyyav came, they came and brought a Baraita with them: One who miscarries a white piece tears it. If it contains the bone of its mother, she is unclean for childbirth.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי שמעון בן יוחי המפלת חתיכה קורעה אם יש בה דם אגור טמאה ואם לאו טהורה כסומכוס וקילא מכולהו
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: who discharges piece tears it If it contains accumulated blood, is impure; and if not, she is pure. in accordance with Sumakhos, but it is more lenient than all
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: "One who miscarries a piece, if there is blood in it, it is impure; and if not, it is pure, like a sycamore fig and a peeled barley grain."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי ירמיה מרבי זירא הרואה דם בשפופרת מהו (ויקרא טו:ז) בבשרה אמר רחמנא ולא בשפופרת או דלמא האי בבשרה מיבעי ליה שמטמאה מבפנים כבחוץ
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya asked Rabbi Zeira: who sees blood, in tube, what is in her flesh the Merciful One states and not through a tube. Or perhaps this “In her flesh,” necessary that becomes impure inside just as outside
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Yirmiyah from Rabbi Zeira: One who sees blood in a shard, what is the ruling? (Leviticus 15:7) "In its flesh" - the Merciful One said, and not in a shard. Or perhaps, this "in its flesh" is needed to teach that it renders impure from within as from without.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה בבשרה אמר רחמנא ולא בשפופרת דאי בבשרה מבעי ליה שמטמאה מבפנים כבחוץ א"כ נימא קרא (בבשר) מאי בבשרה שמע מינה תרתי
human_translation: said to The Merciful One states: “In her flesh,” and not through a tube. As, if “in her flesh” is necessary that becomes impure inside just as outside if so, let the verse say: In the flesh. What “In her flesh”? Conclude two from
llm_translation: He said to him, "With a knife." The Merciful One said, "And not with a reed, for if with a knife, it should become impure from within as from without. If so, let us say: the verse (in the flesh). What is 'in the flesh'? Learn from it two things."

hebrew_text: והא"ר יוחנן משום רבי שמעון בן יוחי המפלת חתיכה קורעה אם יש בה דם אגור טמאה ואם לאו טהורה
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: who discharges piece tears it if it contains accumulated blood, is impure, and if not, she is pure?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: "One who miscarries a piece, if there is blood in it, it is impure; and if not, it is pure."

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם דרכה של אשה לראות דם בחתיכה הכא אין דרכה של אשה לראות דם בשפופרת
human_translation: How can be compared? There, it is the manner of a woman to see blood inside a piece here, it is not the manner of a woman to see blood through a tube.
llm_translation: So now, there, the way of a woman is to see blood in a cloth, but here, the way of a woman is not to see blood in a cotton ball.

hebrew_text: לימא שפופרת תנאי היא דתניא המפלת חתיכה אף על פי שמלאה דם אם יש עמה דם טמאה ואם לאו טהורה רבי אליעזר אומר בבשרה ולא בשפיר ולא בחתיכה
human_translation: Shall we say a tube is tanna’im ? As it is taught who discharges piece even though is full of blood, if there is blood with it, is impure; and if not, she is pure. Rabbi Eliezer says: “in her flesh” and not in a gestational sac, nor in piece
llm_translation: Let us say: Shofparat is a Tanna, as it was taught in a Baraita: One who drops a piece, even if it is full of blood, if there is blood with it, it is impure; and if not, it is pure. Rabbi Eliezer says: In its flesh, not in its beauty, and not in the piece.

hebrew_text: ר' אליעזר היינו תנא קמא אימא שרבי אליעזר אומר בבשרה ולא בשפיר ולא בחתיכה
human_translation: Isn’t Rabbi Eliezer the first tanna ? say as Rabbi Eliezer says “in her flesh” and not in a gestational sac, nor in a piece
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, that is the first Tanna, say: "In Basrah and not in Sefir and not in Chatikha."

human_translation: And the Rabbis say: this is not menstrual blood, but rather the blood of piece the first tanna also deem pure? Rather, between is where cracked,
llm_translation: The Sages say: This is not menstrual blood, but rather blood of a wound. The first Tanna also maintains that they are pure and purify, but they disagree on the details.

hebrew_text: תנא קמא סבר בבשרה ולא בשפיר ולא בחתיכה והוא הדין לשפופרת והני מילי היכא דשיעא אבל פלי פלויי טמאה מאי טעמיה בבשרה קרינא ביה
human_translation: The first tanna holds “in her flesh” and not in a gestational sac, nor in a piece And the same is true with regard to a tube. But this statement where smooth, but cracked, impure. What is the reason for we read “in her flesh” with regard to it,
llm_translation: The first Tanna holds that it is considered in its flesh, but not in its beauty, and not in its piece, and the same applies to a shofar. And these matters apply where it is whole, but if it is split, it is impure. What is the reason? In its flesh we read the verse.

hebrew_text: ואתו רבנן למימר אף על גב דפלי פלויי אין זה דם נדה אלא דם חתיכה הא דם נדה ודאי טמא ואפילו בשפופרת נמי
human_translation: And the Rabbis come to say: Even though is cracked, this is not menstrual blood but rather the blood of piece that menstrual blood, is certainly impure, and even through a tube.
llm_translation: The sages came to say, even though it is separated into separate parts, this is not the blood of menstruation, rather it is the blood of a piece. The blood of menstruation is definitely impure, even in a small amount.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי בשפופרת כולי עלמא לא פליגי דטהורה
human_translation: Abaye says In a tube, everyone agrees that is pure,

human_translation: When they disagree, with regard to a piece Sage, holds it is the manner of a woman to see blood in a piece And Sage, holds it is not the manner of a woman to see blood in a piece
llm_translation: When they disputed regarding a cloth, Master A holds that the way of a woman is to see blood on a cloth, and Master B holds that the way of a woman is not to see blood on a cloth.

llm_translation: Rava said: "For the entire world, it is not the way of a woman to see blood in a piece."

hebrew_text: והכא באשה טהורה ומקור מקומו טמא קמיפלגי דר' אליעזר סבר אשה טהורה ודם טמא דהא אתי דרך מקור ורבנן סברי אשה טהורה ומקור מקומו טהור
human_translation: And here, they disagree to woman pure but the location of the source, is impure. As Rabbi Eliezer holds woman is pure, but the blood is impure, as it emerged through the source, And the Rabbis hold woman is pure, and the location of the source is pure.
llm_translation: And here, regarding a pure woman and the source of its place being impure, they dispute. Rabbi Eliezer holds that a woman is pure and the blood is impure, for it comes from a source. And the Rabbis hold that a woman is pure and the source of its place is pure.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבה מרב הונא הרואה קרי בקיסם מהו (ויקרא טו ) ממנו אמר רחמנא עד דנפיק מבשרו ולא בקיסם או דלמא האי ממנו עד שתצא טומאתו לחוץ ואפי' בקיסם נמי
human_translation: Rabba asked Rav Huna who sees semen with a sliver of wood, what is the Merciful One states: “From whom,” unless emerges from his flesh and not with a sliver of wood? Or perhaps this “From whom,” unless his impurity, emerges outside but even with a sliver of wood.
llm_translation: Rabah asked from Rav Huna: One who sees a seminal emission in a garment, what is the law? (Leviticus 15) "From it," the Merciful One said, "until it comes out from his flesh, and not in the garment." Or perhaps "from it" means until his impurity goes outside, and even in the garment as well.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה תיפוק ליה דהוא עצמו אינו מטמא אלא בחתימת פי האמה
human_translation: said to Derive that itself becomes impure only in a blockage of the tip of the penis.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Let him go out, for he himself does not render impure except through the sealing of the mouth of the cubit."

hebrew_text: למימרא דנוגע הוי אלא מעתה אל יסתור בזיבה
human_translation: is this to say that is touches if that is so, should not negate for discharge [ ziva ].
llm_translation: To say that it touches, it is not so, rather from now on, one should not hide in zavah.

hebrew_text: אלמה תניא (ויקרא טו, לב) זאת תורת הזב ואשר תצא ממנו שכבת זרע מה זיבה סותרת אף שכבת זרע נמי סותר

llm_translation: He said to him: Contradiction, that is the reason for contradicting, because it is impossible for her without the drops of blood of menstruation.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה תסתור כל שבעה אלמה תניא זאת תורת הזב וגו' מה זיבה סותרת אף שכבת זרע סותר

hebrew_text: אי מה זיבה סותרת כל ז' אף שכבת זרע נמי סותר כל ז' ת"ל (ויקרא טו, לב) לטמאה בה אין לך בה אלא מה שאמור בה סותרת יום אחד
human_translation: If just as ziva negates the entire seven so too, a seminal emission also negate the entire seven the verse states: “So that he is impure by it,” in you have only that is stated by it, negates one day
llm_translation: If a zavah invalidates all seven days, so too seminal emission invalidates all seven days. It is taught: "to defile her by it" - you have nothing in it except what is stated in it, which invalidates one day.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה גזירת הכתוב היא זיבה גמורה דלא ערבה בה שכבת זרע סותרת כל שבעה צחצוחי זיבה דערבה בה שכבת זרע לא סותרת אלא יום אחד
human_translation: said to It is a Torah edict purely ziva , when semen is not mixed in it, negates the entire seven bits of ziva in which semen is mixed negate only one day
llm_translation: He said to him: The decree of the Scripture is a complete emission of semen that did not mix with the seminal emission invalidates all seven clean days of zavah. If the seminal emission mixed with the seminal emission, it only invalidates one day.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה ר' יוסי ברבי חנינא מרבי אלעזר דם יבש מהו (ויקרא טו, כה) כי יזוב זוב דמה אמר רחמנא עד דמידב דייב ליה לח אין יבש לא או דלמא האי כי יזוב זוב דמה אורחא דמילתא היא ולעולם אפילו יבש נמי
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, asked Rabbi Elazar: dry blood, what is the Merciful One states: if has a flow of her blood that unless flows, wet, yes, dry not Or perhaps this “If has a flow of her blood,” is the normal manner but actually even dry
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, from Rabbi Elazar: What is the ruling regarding dry blood? (Leviticus 15:25) "When a discharge of blood is discharged." The Merciful One said until the blood flows, it is considered moist; once it dries, is it not considered dry? Or perhaps this "when a discharge of blood is discharged" is merely a common expression, and indeed even when it is dry it is still considered impure.

hebrew_text: א"ל תניתוה דם הנדה ובשר המת מטמאין לחים ויבשים אמר ליה לח ונעשה יבש לא קא מיבעיא לי כי מיבעיא לי יבש מעיקרא
human_translation: said to him: You learned The blood of a menstruating woman and the flesh of a corpse impart impurity wet or dry. said to him I do not raise the dilemma wet and dried, When I raise the dilemma, dry at the outset,
llm_translation: He said to him: "You taught that the blood of a menstruating woman and the flesh of a corpse transmit impurity when wet and when dry." He said to him: "When wet it becomes dry, it is not a question for me. When it is a question for me, it is regarding dryness from the outset."

hebrew_text: הא נמי תניתוה המפלת כמין קליפה כמין שערה כמין עפר כמין יבחושין אדומין תטיל למים
human_translation: You learned this as well, who discharges similar to a shell, similar to a hair, similar to soil, similar to mosquitoes, red, she should cast into water
llm_translation: This also it was taught: One who throws into a mikveh something like a peel, like a hair, like dust, like red lentils, it renders the water unfit.

hebrew_text: אם נמוחו טמאה אי הכי בלא נמוחו נמי אמר רבה כי לא נמוחו בריה בפני עצמה היא
human_translation: If they dissolved, is impure; If so, also in they do not dissolve Rabba says: where they do not dissolve, it is a distinct entity.
llm_translation: If it is inflated, it is impure. If not inflated, Rabbah also said: If it was not inflated, it is a separate entity.

hebrew_text: ומי איכא כי האי גוונא אין והתניא א"ר אלעזר בר' צדוק שני מעשים העלה אבא מטבעין ליבנה
human_translation: But are there cases like this? Yes and it is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: My father raised two incidents from Tivin to Yavne
llm_translation: And is there such a case that this color is not? And it was taught: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok said: Two deeds Abba brought coins to Yavneh.

hebrew_text: מעשה באשה שהיתה מפלת כמין קליפות אדומות ובאו ושאלו את אבא ואבא שאל לחכמים וחכמים שאלו לרופאים ואמרו להם אשה זו מכה יש לה בתוך מעיה שממנה מפלת כמין קליפות תטיל למים אם נמוחו טמאה
human_translation: an incident involving a woman who would discharge similar to red shells, and came and asked my father And my father asked the Sages, and the Sages asked the doctors And said to them: This woman has a wound in her womb from which she discharges similar to shells. should cast into water If they dissolved, is impure.
llm_translation: The incident of a woman who was suffering from a discharge resembling red peelings, and they came and asked Abba. Abba inquired of the sages, and the sages consulted the physicians. They said to them: "This woman, if she expels from within her a discharge resembling red peelings, she shall render water unclean."

hebrew_text: ושוב מעשה באשה שהיתה מפלת כמין שערות אדומות ובאה ושאלה את אבא ואבא שאל לחכמים וחכמים לרופאים ואמרו להם שומא יש לה בתוך מעיה שממנה מפלת כמין שערות אדומות תטיל למים אם נמוחו טמאה
human_translation: And again incident involving a woman who would discharge similar to red hairs, and she came and asked my father And my father asked the Sages, and the Sages asked the doctors, and said to them: has a mole in her womb from which she discharges similar to red hairs. should cast into water, if they dissolved, she is impure.
llm_translation: And again, there was a case involving a woman who had a discharge like red hairs. And she came and asked Abba, and Abba asked the sages, and the sages asked the physicians. And they said to them, "She has within her womb a discharge like red hairs; she should immerse in water. If they dissolve, she is impure."

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש ובפושרין תניא נמי הכי תטיל למים ובפושרין רשב"ג אומר ממעכתו ברוק על גבי הצפורן מאי בינייהו אמר רבינא מעוך על ידי הדחק איכא בינייהו
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: And with lukewarm [ uvefoshrin ] This is also taught should cast into water, and with lukewarm Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: mashes with saliva, on a fingernail What between Ravina says: between them is mashed by pressing
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish: "And in cases of Pesharim, it was also taught thus: One should immerse in water. And in cases of Pesharim, Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: From its socket onto the nail." What is the difference between them? Rabinah said: There is a difference in terms of pressure.

hebrew_text: התם תנן כמה היא שרייתן בפושרין מעת לעת הכא מאי מי בעינא מעת לעת או לא
human_translation: We learned there how long is its soaking in lukewarm for period. Here, what Do I need for period, or not?
llm_translation: There, we learned: How much is their remission in cases of default? Here, what is it? Do I need it from time to time or not?

hebrew_text: שרץ ונבלה דאקושי בעינן מעת לעת אבל דם דרכיך לא או דלמא לא שנא תיקו
human_translation: a creeping animal and an unslaughtered animal carcass, which are hard we require for period, but blood, which is soft not Or perhaps is no different, shall stand
llm_translation: Sheretz and nevelah, we require from time to time, but blood, your way is not, or perhaps not different, let it stand.

hebrew_text: המפלת כמין דגים וליפלוג נמי רבי יהודה בהא
human_translation: who discharges similar to fish But let Rabbi Yehuda disagree with regard to this as well,
llm_translation: The one who falls like a fish, and also Rabbi Yehuda falls in this.

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש במחלוקת שנויה ורבנן היא ורבי יוחנן אמר אפילו תימא רבי יהודה עד כאן לא קאמר רבי יהודה התם אלא גבי חתיכה דעביד דם דקריש והוי חתיכה אבל בריה לא הוי
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: subject to dispute and is the Rabbis. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: You even say Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yehuda says only there, in piece as blood is likely to dry and turn into a piece But not become a creature,
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish: "In a dispute that is repeated, it is the Rabbis' opinion, and Rabbi Yochanan said, even if you say it is Rabbi Yehuda's opinion, Rabbi Yehuda did not say this there, but only regarding a piece that one made into a thin piece of blood, and it is considered a piece, but regarding its offspring, it is not considered."

hebrew_text: ולהך לישנא דא"ר יוחנן באי אפשר לפתיחת הקבר בלא דם קמיפלגי לפלוג נמי ר' יהודה בהא
human_translation: But according to that version which Rabbi Yoḥanan says disagree with regard to opening of the womb is impossible without blood Rabbi Yehuda should disagree in this too,
llm_translation: And to this, in the teaching of Rabbi Yochanan, they say: It is impossible to open the grave without blood. They argue about this, and Rabbi Yehuda also argues in this matter.

hebrew_text: מאן דמתני הך לישנא מתני הכי רבי יוחנן וריש לקיש דאמרי תרוייהו במחלוקת שנויה ורבנן היא
human_translation: The one who teaches that version teaches like this: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say subject to a dispute and is the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The one who taught this teaching taught thus: Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish, both of them said: they taught in a dispute, and it is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: המפלת כמין בהמה [וכו']
human_translation: who discharges a type of domesticated animal,
llm_translation: The one who causes a miscarriage like an animal etc.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל מ"ט דר' מאיר הואיל ונאמרה בו יצירה כאדם
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir, since formation is stated with regard to just as man:
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir? Since it is said about him, "A formation like a man."

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה המפלת דמות תנין תהא אמו טמאה לידה הואיל ונאמר בו יצירה כאדם שנאמר (בראשית א, כא) ויברא אלהים את התנינים הגדולים
human_translation: If that is so, who discharges the form of a sea monster, its mother should be impure childbirth, since formation is stated with regard to just as man. As it is stated: “And God created the great sea monsters”
llm_translation: Rather now, the miscarriage of the likeness of a reptile, its mother shall be impure due to childbirth, since it is stated regarding it "a creature like a human" as it is stated (Genesis 1:21) "And God created the great sea creatures."

hebrew_text: אמרי דנין יצירה מיצירה ואין דנין בריאה מיצירה
human_translation: say One derives formation from formation but one does not derive creation from formation
llm_translation: Sages said: One judges creation from creation, and one does not judge creation from formation.

hebrew_text: מאי נפקא מינה הא תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל (ויקרא יד:לט) ושב הכהן (ויקרא יד, מד) ובא הכהן זו היא שיבה זו היא ביאה
human_translation: What difference is the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “And the priest shall return [ veshav ] “And the priest shall come [ uva ] This returning this coming
llm_translation: What is derived from this? This is what the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "And the priest shall return" (Leviticus 14:39), "and the priest shall come" (Leviticus 14:44). "And the priest shall come" - this is referring to sitting, "this is the coming."

hebrew_text: ועוד נגמר בריאה מבריאה דכתיב (בראשית א:כז) ויברא אלהים את האדם בצלמו
human_translation: And furthermore, creation derived from creation, as it is written: “And God created man in His own image”
llm_translation: And furthermore, the creation was completed from one creation to another, as it is written (Genesis 1:27), "And God created man in His image."

hebrew_text: אמרי ויברא לגופיה וייצר לאפנויי ודנין יצירה מיצירה
human_translation: say “And created to itself, “And formed to render it free, And one derives formation from formation
llm_translation: They said: "He created it for its own sake, and formed it for its purpose, and we judge the creation from one creation to another."

hebrew_text: אדרבה וייצר לגופיה ויברא לאפנויי ודנין בריאה מבריאה
human_translation: On the contrary, “And formed to itself, “And created to render it free; and one derives creation from creation
llm_translation: On the contrary, He formed it and created it, and judges each creation from its fellow creation.

hebrew_text: אלא וייצר מופנה משני צדדין מופנה גבי אדם ומופנה גבי בהמה ויברא גבי אדם מופנה גבי תנינים אינו מופנה
human_translation: Rather, “and…formed” free on both sides, it is free with regard to man and it is free with regard to animals. “and…created” is free with regard to man, it is not free with regard to sea monsters.
llm_translation: Rather, "And He formed it facing from both sides, facing towards man and facing towards beast, and He created it facing towards man, facing towards reptiles it is not facing."

hebrew_text: מאי מופנה גבי בהמה אילימא מדכתיב (בראשית א:כה) ויעש אלהים את חית הארץ וכתיב (בראשית ב ) ויצר [ה'] אלהים מן האדמה כל חית השדה גבי תנין נמי אפנויי מופנה דכתיב (בראשית א:כה) ואת כל רמש האדמה וכתיב (בראשית א:כא) ויברא אלהים את התנינים הגדולים
human_translation: What with regard to animals free? If we say that it is written: “And God made the animals of the earth and it is written: “And out of the ground the Lord God formed every animal of the field” with regard to sea monster as well, free, as it is written: and everything that creeps on the ground and it is written: “And God created the great sea monsters.”
llm_translation: What is the distinction regarding domestic animals? If you say it is because it is written (Genesis 1:25), "And God made the beast of the earth," and it is also written (Genesis 2:19), "And the Lord God formed from the ground every beast of the field," regarding reptiles as well, there is a distinction, as it is written (Genesis 1:25), "And every creeping thing of the earth," and it is written (Genesis 1:21), "And God created the great sea monsters."

hebrew_text: רמש דכתיב התם דיבשה הוא ומאי נפקא מינה בין מופנה מצד אחד למופנה משני צדדין
human_translation: creeping animal that is written there is of the land, But what difference is between free on one side and free on both sides?
llm_translation: The creeping thing, as it is written there, "it is dry." And what is derived from it? The difference between facing one side to facing from both sides.

hebrew_text: נפקא מינה דאמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל משום רבי ישמעאל כל גזרה שוה שאינה מופנה כל עיקר אין למדין הימנה מופנה מצד אחד לרבי ישמעאל למדין ואין מושיבין לרבנן למדין ומשיבין מופנה משני צדדין דברי הכל למדין ואין משיבין
human_translation: difference which Rav Yehuda said Shmuel says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, any verbal analogy that is not free at all, one cannot derive from it. free on one side, according to Rabbi Yishmael one can derive and one cannot refute According to the Rabbis, one can derive but one can refute free on both sides, everyone agrees one can derive and one cannot refute
llm_translation: Outcome from it that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: Any decree that is equal and not directed, we do not learn from it; if it is directed from one side, we learn from it, but we do not establish; if it is directed from both sides, everyone agrees we learn and we establish.

hebrew_text: ורבי ישמעאל מאי איכא בין מופנה מצד אחד למופנה משני צדדין נפקא מינה דהיכא דאיכא מופנה מצד אחד ומופנה משני צדדין שבקינן מופנה מצד אחד
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael, what is there between free on one side and free on both sides? difference that where there free on one side and free on both sides, we disregard free on one side,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael: What is the difference between one facing one direction and one facing two directions? The conclusion is that wherever there is one facing one direction and one facing two directions, we leave the one facing one direction.

hebrew_text: וילפינן מופנה משני צדדין ולהכי אפניה רחמנא לבהמה משני צדדין כי היכי דלא נגמר מן מופנה מצד אחד
human_translation: and derive free on both sides. And for this the Merciful One rendered animal free on both sides, so that one would not derive from free on one side.
llm_translation: We shall turn it away from both sides, and therefore the Merciful One turned the animal away from both sides, so that it would not be harmed from one side.

hebrew_text: רב אחא בריה דרבא מתני לה משמיה דרבי אלעזר לקולא כל גזרה שוה שאינה מופנה כל עיקר למדין ומשיבין מופנה מצד אחד לרבי ישמעאל למדין ואין משיבין לרבנן למדין ומשיבין מופנה משני צדדין דברי הכל למדין ואין משיבין
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, teaches in the name of Rabbi Elazar lenient any verbal analogy that is not free at all, one can derive but one can refute free on one side, according to Rabbi Yishmael one can derive and one cannot refute According to the Rabbis, one can derive but one can refute free on both sides, everyone agrees one can derive and one cannot refute
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rava, teaches in the name of Rabbi Elazar: Any decree that is equal and not directed specifically towards one aspect, we learn and respond. If it is directed towards one side, we learn for Rabbi Yishmael and do not respond. We learn for the Rabbis and respond. If it is directed from both sides, everyone agrees we learn but do not respond.

hebrew_text: ולרבנן מאי איכא בין מופנה מצד אחד לשאינה מופנה כל עיקר
human_translation: But according to the Rabbis, what is there between free on one side and that is not free at all?
llm_translation: And for the Rabbis, what is there? Between one that is turned and one that is not turned, there is no difference at all.

hebrew_text: נ"מ היכא דמשכחת לה מופנה מצד אחד ושאינה מופנה כל עיקר ולאו להאי אית ליה פירכא ולאו להאי אית ליה פירכא שבקינן שאינה מופנה כל עיקר וגמרינן ממופנה מצד אחד
human_translation: difference where you find free on one side and that is not free at all, and neither this one have refutation nor that one have refutation. we disregard that is not free at all, and we derive from free on one side.
llm_translation: The place where you find it turned to one side and not turned at all, and not to this one does it have an answer, and not to this one does it have an answer, for we leave it that it is not turned at all, and we conclude that it is turned to one side.

hebrew_text: והכא מאי פירכא איכא משום דאיכא למיפרך מה לאדם שכן מטמא מחיים
human_translation: And here, what refutation is there because it can be refuted What about man? in that become impure while he is alive,
llm_translation: And here, what is the refutation? There is, because there is room to refute: Just as a person can become impure from a living creature.

hebrew_text: וכן א"ר חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן היינו טעמא דר"מ הואיל ונאמרה בו יצירה כאדם
human_translation: And likewise, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is the reason of Rabbi Meir, because formation is stated with regard to just as man.
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: This is the reason of Rabbi Meir, since it is said about him, "He was created in the likeness of man."

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי אמי אלא מעתה המפלת דמות הר אמו טמאה לידה שנאמר (עמוס ד:יג) כי הנה יוצר הרים ובורא רוח אמר ליה הר מי קא מפלת אבן היא דקא מפלת ההוא גוש איקרי
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said to him: If that is so, who discharges the shape of a mountain, its mother impure childbirth, as it is stated “For He Who forms the mountains and creates the wind” said to him: Does she discharge a mountain? It is a stone that she discharges, that is called a clod,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Ami, rather from now on, the miscarriage of the likeness of a mountain is impure for childbirth, as it is stated (Amos 4:13), "For behold, He forms mountains and creates wind." He said to him, "Is a mountain experiencing a miscarriage?" It is the stone that is experiencing a miscarriage, that particular clod is called...

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה המפלת רוח תהא אמו טמאה לידה הואיל ונאמרה בו בריאה כאדם דכתיב (עמוס ד ) ובורא רוח וכי תימא לא מופנה מדהוה ליה למכתב יוצר הרים ורוח וכתיב ובורא רוח ש"מ לאפנויי
human_translation: If that is so, who discharges an amorphous form [ ruaḥ ], its mother should be impure childbirth, since creation is stated with regard to it, just as man, as it is written: “And creates the wind [ ruaḥ ].” And if you would say is not free, From that could have written: Who forms the mountains and the wind, and it is written: and creates the wind,” conclude from it to render it free
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, if a miscarriage of wind occurs, his mother is considered impure due to childbirth, since it was said about him, "a creature like a man" as it is written (Amos 4), "and He who forms the spirit." And if you say it is not turned from what is written, "He who forms the mountains and creates the wind," and it is written, "and He who forms the spirit," learn from this that it is not turned away.

hebrew_text: א"ל דנין דברי תורה מדברי תורה ואין דנין דברי תורה מדברי קבלה
human_translation: said to One derives matters Torah from matters Torah, but one does not derive matters Torah from the words of the tradition,
llm_translation: He said to him: We judge matters of Torah based on matters of Torah, and we do not judge matters of Torah based on matters of tradition.

hebrew_text: (אמר) רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן היינו טעמא דר"מ הואיל ועיניהם דומות כשל אדם
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is the reason of Rabbi Meir: Since the eyes of are similar to those of a human,
llm_translation: (אמר) רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן: "היינו טעמא דר"מ הואיל ועיניהם דומות כשל אדם" Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "This is the reason of Rabbi Meir, since their eyes are similar to those of a person."

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה המפלת דמות נחש תהא אמו טמאה לידה הואיל וגלגל עינו עגולה כשל אדם וכי תימא הכי נמי ליתני נחש
human_translation: If that is so, who discharges the form of a snake, its mother should be impure childbirth, since the pupil of is round, like of a human. And if you would say indeed, let teach a snake
llm_translation: Rather now, the miscarriage of the likeness of a snake, its mother shall be impure for childbirth, since its eye is round like a human's. And if you say so, let it also teach about a snake.

hebrew_text: אי תנא נחש הוה אמינא בנחש הוא דפליגי רבנן עליה דר"מ דלא כתיב ביה יצירה אבל בהמה וחיה לא פליגי דכתיבא ביה יצירה
human_translation: If taught a snake, I would say is in a snake that the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Meir as formation is not written with regard to But a domesticated animal or an undomesticated animal, they do not disagree as formation is written with regard to them.
llm_translation: If you say "snake," I would say it is a snake that the Rabbis argue about with Rabbi Meir, for it is not written about it "creation," but regarding a domestic animal and a wild animal, they do not argue, for it is written about them "creation."

hebrew_text: והא גבי מומין קתני לה את שגלגל עינו עגול כשל אדם לא קשיא הא באוכמא הא בציריא
human_translation: But with regard to blemishes it is taught whose pupil is round like of a human not difficult; this to pupil, that to socket.
llm_translation: And this, regarding blemishes, it teaches it: "If his eye is round, like a person's, it is not a difficulty - whether in the white of the eye or in the iris."

hebrew_text: רבי ינאי אמר היינו טעמא דר"מ הואיל ועיניהם הולכות לפניהם כשל אדם והרי עוף דאין עיניו הולכות לפניו וקאמר ר"מ דטמא אמר אביי בקריא וקיפופא ובשאר עופות לא
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: This is the reason of Rabbi Meir: because the eyes of are fixed in the front of like of a human, But a bird, whose eyes are not fixed in the front of and Rabbi Meir says that is impure. Abaye said: to little owl [ bekarya ] and great owl [ vekifofa ], but in other birds, not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: This is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion, since their eyes go before them like a person stumbling, and behold a bird, whose eyes do not go before it. And Rabbi Meir said that regarding impurity, Abaye said with regard to a raven and a bat, but not with regard to other birds.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי ר' חנינא בן (אנטיגנוס) אומר נראין דברי ר"מ בבהמה וחיה ודברי חכמים בעופות
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: The statement of Rabbi Meir seems in a domesticated animal or an undomesticated animal, and the statement of the Rabbis in birds.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: The Tanna Rabbi Chanina ben (Antigonos) says: The words of Rabbi Meir are evident in domesticated animals and wild beasts, and the words of the Sages are evident in birds.

hebrew_text: מאי עופות אילימא בקריא וקיפופא מ"ש בהמה וחיה דעיניהן הולכות לפניהן כשל אדם קריא וקיפופא נמי
human_translation: what birds If we say to little owl and great owl, what is the difference a domesticated animal or an undomesticated animal, that their eyes are fixed in the front of like of a human, a little owl or a great owl as well,
llm_translation: What are the birds? If you say in reading and in writing, what is the difference between a domestic animal and a wild animal? Their eyes go in front of them, like a person. Reading and writing as well.

hebrew_text: אלא פשיטא בשאר עופות מכלל דר"מ פליג בשאר עופות
human_translation: Rather, obvious to other birds. From the fact Rabbi Meir disagrees with regard to other birds
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious regarding other birds, from the general principle that Rabbi Meir disagrees regarding other birds.

hebrew_text: חסורי מיחסרא והכי קתני ר' חנינא בן אנטיגנוס אומר נראין דברי ר"מ בבהמה וחיה והוא הדין לקריא וקיפופא ודברי חכמים בשאר עופות שאף ר"מ לא נחלק עמהם אלא בקריא וקיפופא אבל בשאר עופות מודי להו
human_translation: is incomplete, and this it is teaching: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: The statement of Rabbi Meir seems in a domesticated animal or an undomesticated animal, and the same is true with regard to a little owl or a great owl. And the statement of the Rabbis with regard to other birds. that even Rabbi Meir disagrees with them only with regard to a little owl or a great owl, but he concedes to with regard to other birds.
llm_translation: Deficiencies of lineage, and thus it was taught: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says, The words of Rabbi Meir are evident in domesticated animals and wild beasts, and the same applies to a reading and a bird trap. And the words of the Sages regarding other birds, for even Rabbi Meir does not disagree with them except in a reading and a bird trap, but regarding other birds, he concedes to them.

hebrew_text: והתניא א"ר אלעזר בר' צדוק המפלת מין בהמה וחיה לדברי ר"מ ולד ולדברי חכמים אינו ולד ובעופות תיבדק
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: who discharges a type of domesticated animal or undomesticated animal, according to the statement of Rabbi Meir offspring, and according to the statement of the Rabbis, not offspring. In birds, it must be examined.
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: One who causes a crossbreed between an animal and a wild beast, according to the words of Rabbi Meir, it is considered a offspring, but according to the words of the Sages, it is not considered an offspring. And with regard to birds, it shall be examined.

hebrew_text: למאן תיבדק לאו לדברי ר"מ דאמר קריא וקיפופא אין שאר עופות לא
human_translation: According to whom must it be examined? not to the statement of Rabbi Meir, who said a little owl or a great owl, yes, other birds, not
llm_translation: To whom shall we examine? Not according to the words of Rabbi Meir, for he said: "Kriya and Kipufa, but not other birds."

hebrew_text: אמר רב אחא בריה דרב איקא לא תיבדק לרבנן דאמרי קריא וקיפופא אין שאר עופות לא
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: No, must be examined according to the Rabbis, as they say a little owl or a great owl, yes, other birds, not
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: Do not examine the Rabbis, for they say, "Kriya and Kipufa, but not other birds."

hebrew_text: ומ"ש קריא וקיפופא מבהמה וחיה הואיל ויש להן לסתות כאדם
human_translation: But What is the difference a little owl and a great owl a domesticated animal and an undomesticated animal Since have cheeks like a human,
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of "Keriya" and "Kifufa" from a domesticated animal and a wild animal, since they have the ability to conceal like a human.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי ירמיה מר' זירא לר"מ דאמר בהמה במעי אשה ולד מעליא הוא קבל בה אביה קידושין מהו למאי נפקא מינה לאיתסורי באחותה
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya asked Rabbi Zeira: According to Rabbi Meir, who said an animal in the womb of a woman is a full-fledged offspring, what is her father accepted betrothal for her, What difference is with regard to prohibited to her sister.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked from Rabbi Zeira to Rabbi Meir: "He said, 'An animal in a woman's womb, the offspring is considered her father's acquisition for the purpose of betrothal. What is the halakha regarding marrying her sister?"

hebrew_text: למימרא דחיי והאמר רב יהודה אמר רב לא אמרה ר"מ אלא הואיל ובמינו מתקיים אמר רב אחא בר יעקב עד כאן הביאו רבי ירמיה לר' זירא לידי גיחוך ולא גחיך
human_translation: Is this to say that can live? But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav says: Rabbi Meir said only since of its type live, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: Rabbi Yirmeya tried this hard to cause Rabbi Zeira to laugh, but he did not laugh.
llm_translation: To say that he is alive, but Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, Rabbi Meir did not say that, rather since in his kind it is sustained. Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Until here Rabbi Yirmeya brought it to Rabbi Zeira to the point of laughter, but he did not laugh.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב יהודה אמר רב לא אמרה רבי מאיר אלא הואיל ובמינו מתקיים אמר רב ירמיה מדפתי
human_translation: the itself. Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Rabbi Meir said only since of its type live. Rav Yirmeya of Difti says:
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Yehudah said Rav, Rabbi Meir did not say, rather since it is fulfilled in its kind, said Rav Yirmeya from Difti.

hebrew_text: אף אנן נמי תנינא המפלת כמין בהמה חיה ועוף (ולד מעליא הוא) דברי ר"מ וחכ"א עד שיהא בו מצורת אדם
human_translation: We, too, learn who discharged a fetus similar to of a domesticated animal, an undomesticated animal, or bird the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: unless that takes the form of a person;
llm_translation: We also learned: One who causes a miscarriage resembling a non-kosher animal, wild beast, or bird (it is a form of manslaughter) - these are the words of Rabbi Meir. But the sages say: until it has the form of a human.

hebrew_text: והמפלת סנדל או שליא או שפיר מרוקם והיוצא מחותך הבא אחריו בכור לנחלה ואינו בכור לכהן ואי ס"ד דחיי הבא אחריו בכור לנחלה מי הוי
human_translation: And who discharges a sandal fish, or an afterbirth or a gestational sac tissue developed or that emerged in pieces, that follows them is a firstborn with regard to inheritance but is not a firstborn with regard to a priest. And if it enters your mind that can survive, is the that follows it a firstborn with regard to inheritance?
llm_translation: And one who causes a sandal or a slipper or a woven kerchief to fall, and the one who comes after him is the firstborn for inheritance but not the firstborn for the priesthood, and if you will say, "Is it possible that the one who comes after him is the firstborn for inheritance?"

hebrew_text: אמר רבא לעולם דחיי ושאני התם דאמר קרא (דברים כח ) ראשית אונו מי שלבו דוה עליו יצא זה שאין לבו דוה עליו
human_translation: Rava said, Actually, that can survive; but it is different there, as the verse states the first fruits of his strength [ ono ]; over whose mourn. This excluded, as would not mourn over its
llm_translation: Rava said: Always live, and it is different there, as the verse says (Deuteronomy 28): "The beginning of his strength is his insolence, and the end is his downfall." This refers to one whose heart is not troubled over him.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רב אדא בר אהבה מאביי לרבי מאיר דאמר בהמה במעי אשה ולד מעליא הוא אדם במעי בהמה מאי למאי נפקא מיניה לאשתרויי באכילה
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava asked Abaye: According to Rabbi Meir, who said an animal in the womb of a woman is a full-fledged offspring, what a human in the womb of an animal? What is the difference with regard to permitting in consumption.
llm_translation: Requested by Rav Adda bar Ahava from Abaye to Rabbi Meir who said: An animal in the womb of a woman, and a human in the womb of an animal, what is the halacha regarding their permissibility for consumption.

hebrew_text: ותפשוט ליה מהא דר' יוחנן דא"ר יוחנן השוחט את הבהמה ומצא בה דמות יונה אסורה באכילה
human_translation: But resolve from that of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one who slaughters an animal and finds in it the form of a pigeon, is prohibited for consumption.
llm_translation: And they asked him from that which Rabbi Yochanan said, as Rabbi Yochanan said: One who slaughters an animal and finds in it the form of a dove, it is forbidden for consumption.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם לא פרסות איכא ולא פרסה איכא הכא נהי דפרסות ליכא פרסה מיהא איכא
human_translation: How can be compared? There, there are no hooves, and there is not a hoof here, although there are no hooves, there is at least a hoof,
llm_translation: So now there, there are no Persians and no Persians here, even though there are Persians, there are Persians.

hebrew_text: וחכ"א כל שאין בו כו' אמר רב ירמיה בר אבא אמר רב הכל מודים גופו תייש ופניו אדם אדם גופו אדם ופניו תייש ולא כלום
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Any that is not Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says Rav says: All concede whose body is a goat and whose face is a human, a human its body is a human and its face is a goat, it is nothing,
llm_translation: And the sages said: "Anyone who does not have the following qualities, etc." Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba said in the name of Rav: "Everyone agrees that if his body is modest, his face is human. If his body is human, his face is modest, and it is nothing."

hebrew_text: לא נחלקו אלא שפניו אדם ונברא בעין אחת כבהמה שרבי מאיר אומר מצורת אדם וחכ"א כל צורת אדם
human_translation: They disagree only where its face is a human, but it was created with one eye like an animal. As Rabbi Meir says of the form of a human And the Rabbis say the entire form of a human
llm_translation: They only disagreed regarding the face of a person and a creature created in one eye like an animal. Rabbi Meir says, "In the form of a person," and the sages say, "Every form of a person."

hebrew_text: אמר לו לרב ירמיה בר אבא והא איפכא תניא ר"מ אומר כל צורת וחכ"א מצורת אמר להו אי תניא תניא
human_translation: said to Rav Yirmeya bar Abba: But isn’t the opposite taught Rabbi Meir says any form and the Rabbis say of the form of said to If this is taught, it is taught,
llm_translation: He said to him, to Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba, "But isn't it reversed? It was taught: Rabbi Meir says, 'All forms and appearances are from the form.'" He said to them, "If it was taught, it was taught."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' ירמיה בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן מצח והגבינים והעינים והלסתות וגבות הזקן עד שיהו כולם כאחד רבא אמר חסא מצח והגבן והעין והלסת וגבת הזקן עד שיהו כולם כאחת
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: forehead, and the eyebrows, and the eyes, and the cheeks, and chin. unless all as one Rava Ḥasa says: forehead, and eyebrow, and eye, and cheek, and chin unless all as one
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba, said Rabbi Yochanan: forehead, cheeks, eyes, temples, and the back of the neck, until they are all as one. Rava said: forehead, cheekbone, eye, temple, and the back of the neck, until they are all as one.

hebrew_text: ולא פליגי הא כמ"ד כל צורת הא כמ"ד מצורת
human_translation: And do not disagree this like the one who says the entire form of that like the one who says of the form of
llm_translation: And they do not argue this. This one like the opinion of Rabbi Meir, that all forms, and this one like the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, from a form.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי צורת פנים שאמרו אפילו פרצוף אחד מן הפרצופין חוץ מן האוזן למימרא דמחד נמי סגי
human_translation: raises an objection the form of face, which said even one of the facial features, apart from the ear. that is to say that if one is also sufficient
llm_translation: The question was raised: The form of the face, as they said, even one feature of the features, except for the ear, is sufficient to say that one is recognizable.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי כי תניא ההיא לעכב תניא וכמ"ד כל צורת ואיבעית אימא לעולם כמ"ד מצורת ומאי אחד אחד אחד
human_translation: Abaye says: When that is taught, it is taught with regard to rendering indispensable And is in accordance with the one who says the entire form of And if you wish, say actually is in accordance with the one who says of the form of And what one one of each
llm_translation: Abbaye said: When it was taught, that the ruling is to delay, it was taught. And as it was taught: "And as it was taught," what is the meaning of "one, one, one"?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא נברא בעין אחת ובירך אחד מן הצד אמו טמאה באמצע אמו טהורה
human_translation: Rava says: was created with one eye or with one thigh, to the side its mother is impure. in the middle its mother is pure.
llm_translation: Rava said: Created in one eye and blessed from the side, his mother is impure in the beginning, his mother is pure in the middle.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ושטו נקוב אמו טמאה ושטו אטום אמו טהורה
human_translation: Rava says: its esophagus is punctured, its mother is impure. its esophagus is sealed, its mother is pure.
llm_translation: Rava said: "If the fetus is female, its mother is impure; if the fetus is male, its mother is pure."

hebrew_text: ת"ר המפלת גוף אטום אין אמו טמאה לידה ואיזהו גוף אטום רבי אומר כדי שינטל מן החי וימות
human_translation: The Sages taught who discharges a sealed body, its mother is not impure childbirth. And what is a sealed body? Rabbi says: when removed from a living die.
