llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who miscarries a complete fetus, its mother is not impure due to childbirth. And what is considered a complete fetus? Rabbi says: Sufficient that it could be removed from the living and survive.

hebrew_text: וכמה ינטל מן החי וימות רבי זכאי אומר
human_translation: And how much when removed from a living die, Rabbi Zakkai says:
llm_translation: And how much may one take from a living animal and it die? Rabbi Zechariah says:

hebrew_text: עד הארכובה רבי ינאי אומר עד לנקביו ר' יוחנן אומר משום רבי יוסי בן יהושע עד מקום טבורו
human_translation: Until the knee. Rabbi Yannai says: Until his orifices. Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Yehoshua: Until the location of his navel.
llm_translation: Until the arakuba, Rabbi Yannai says until his intestines; Rabbi Yochanan says in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Yehoshua until the place of his navel.

hebrew_text: בין רבי זכאי לרבי ינאי איכא בינייהו טרפה חיה מר סבר טרפה חיה ומר סבר טרפה אינה חיה
human_translation: between Rabbi Zakkai and Rabbi Yannai a tereifa can survive Sage, holds a tereifa can survive And Sage, holds a tereifa cannot survive
llm_translation: Between Rabbi Zekharyah and Rabbi Yannai there is a difference of opinion: one holds that a treifah is considered a living animal, and the other holds that a treifah is not considered a living animal.

hebrew_text: בין ר' ינאי לר' יוחנן איכא בינייהו דר"א דאמר רבי אלעזר ניטל ירך וחלל שלה נבלה
human_translation: between Rabbi Yannai and Rabbi Yoḥanan, of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: thigh, and its recess were removed an unslaughtered carcass;
llm_translation: Between Rabbi Yannai and Rabbi Yochanan there is a dispute regarding Rabbi Eliezer, for Rabbi Eliezer said: "One may remove the thigh and the hollow of its hip from a carcass."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא מחלוקת מלמטה למעלה אבל מלמעלה למטה אפי' כל דהו טהורה וכן אמר רב גידל אמר רבי יוחנן המפלת את שגולגלתו אטומה אמו טהורה
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: dispute from below above, but from above below, even any amount is pure. And likewise, Rav Giddel says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: who discharges whose skull is sealed, its mother is pure.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Disagreement from below to above, but from above to below, even anything pure. And so said Rav Giddel in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who drops his skullcap, his mother is pure.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב גידל אמר רבי יוחנן המפלת כמין אפקתא דדיקלא אמו טהורה
human_translation: And Rav Giddel says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: who discharges like of a palm tree branches out, its mother is pure.
llm_translation: And Rav Giddel said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who falls like the species of a date-palm, his mother is pure.

hebrew_text: איתמר המפלת מי שפניו מוסמסים רבי יוחנן אמר אמו טמאה ר"ל אמר אמו טהורה
human_translation: was stated who discharges whose face is mashed Rabbi Yoḥanan says its mother is impure, Reish Lakish says its mother is pure.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who falls, if his face is smeared. Rabbi Yochanan said: His mother is impure. R. Levi said: His mother is pure.

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר' יוחנן לריש לקיש המפלת יד חתוכה ורגל חתוכה אמו טמאה לידה ואין חוששין שמא מגוף אטום באתה ואם איתא ליתני שמא מגוף אטום או ממי שפניו מוסמסין
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish who discharges a shaped hand, or a shaped foot, its mother is impure childbirth, and we are not concerned perhaps it came from a sealed, body. And if it is so, let teach: perhaps from a sealed body or from one whose face is mashed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "One who has a severed hand and a severed foot, his mother is impure due to childbirth, and we are not concerned lest perhaps he came from a sealed body. And if you wish, I can say: Let him teach that we are concerned lest he came from a sealed body or from one whose face is disfigured."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפי בפניו מוסמסין כולי עלמא לא פליגי דטמאה כי פליגי בפניו טוחות ואיפכא איתמר רבי יוחנן אמר אמו טהורה וריש לקיש אמר אמו טמאה
human_translation: Rav Pappi says: In its face is mashed, everyone agrees that is impure. When they disagree, in its face is flat, and the opposite was stated: Rabbi Yoḥanan says its mother is pure, and Reish Lakish says its mother is impure.
llm_translation: Rav Pappi said: "In his presence, everyone agrees that they are mixed together; they do not disagree about impurity. When they disagree in his presence, they are arguing about grinding stones." And the statement was made: Rabbi Yochanan said, "His mother is pure," and Reish Lakish said, "His mother is impure."

hebrew_text: ולותביה ר"ל לרבי יוחנן מהא משום דשני ליה היינו גוף אטום היינו מי שפניו טוחות
human_translation: But let Reish Lakish raise an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan from this because Rabbi Yoḥanan responded to him a sealed body is one whose face is flat.
llm_translation: And it was taught to Rabbi Yochanan from there, because they repeat to him, that is an impervious body, that is one whose face is hollow.

hebrew_text: בני רבי חייא נפיק לקרייתא אתו לקמיה דאבוהון אמר להם כלום בא מעשה לידכם אמרו לו פנים טוחות בא לידינו וטימאנוה
human_translation: The sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya went out to the villages they came to their father, he said to them: any incident brought to you They said to him: a flat face was brought to us, and we deemed her impure
llm_translation: Sons of Rabbi Chiya went out to the village, they came before their father's presence. He said to them, "Did anything happen in your hands?" They said to him, "A face of plaster came into our hands, and we rendered it impure."

hebrew_text: אמר להם צאו וטהרו מה שטמאתם מאי דעתייכו לחומרא חומרא דאתיא לידי קולא היא דקיהביתו לה ימי טוהר
human_translation: said to them: Go out and deem pure that which you have deemed impure. What was your thinking stringently? is a stringency that leads to a leniency, as you have given days of purity
llm_translation: He said to them, "Go and purify what you have defiled." What is your opinion? A stringent measure that leads to leniency is the one that his days of purity are diminished.

hebrew_text: איתמר המפלת בריה שיש לה ב' גבים וב' שדראות אמר רב באשה אינו ולד בבהמה אסור באכילה ושמואל אמר באשה ולד בבהמה מותר באכילה
human_translation: It was stated: who discharges an entity that has two backs and two spines, Rav says in woman, is not an offspring, in animal, is prohibited for consumption. And Shmuel says: In a woman, an offspring, in an animal, permitted for consumption.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who miscarries a female fetus that has two backs and two rows of teeth. Rav said: In the case of a woman, it is not a viable offspring; in the case of an animal, it is forbidden for consumption. And Shmuel said: In the case of a woman, it is a viable offspring; in the case of an animal, it is permitted for consumption.

hebrew_text: במאי קמיפלגי בדרב חנין בר אבא דאמר רב חנין בר אבא השסועה בריה שיש לה ב' גבין וב' שדראות
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? concerning of Rav Ḥanin bar Abba, as Rav Ḥanin bar Abba said: hashesua entity that has two backs and two spines
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? In the opinion of Rav Hanin bar Abba, for Rav Hanin bar Abba said: "The sycamore tree, the daughter of which has two trunks and two rows."

hebrew_text: רב אמר בריה בעלמא ליתא וכי אגמריה רחמנא למשה במעי אמה אגמריה ושמואל אמר בריה בעלמא איתא וכי אגמריה רחמנא למשה בעלמא אגמריה אבל במעי אמה שריא
human_translation: Rav says there is no entity in the world, and when the Merciful One taught to Moses, he taught to in the womb of its mother And Shmuel says there is an entity in the world, and when the Merciful One taught to Moses, he taught to him in the world, but in the womb of its mother is permitted
llm_translation: Rav said: "In general, there is no extra space." And when did the Merciful One specify to Moses the measurement "in a cubit"? He specified it. And Shmuel said: "In general, there is extra space." And when did the Merciful One specify to Moses the measurement "in general"? He specified it. But in a cubit, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רב שימי בר חייא לרב רבי חנינא בן אנטיגנוס אומר כל שיש לו ב' גבין ושני שדראות פסול לעבודה אלמא דחיי (וקשיא לרב) א"ל שימי את ששדרתו עקומה
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya raised an objection to Rav Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: Any who has two backs and two spines is disqualified from service, Evidently, that can survive, and difficult for Rav. said to him: You are Shimi, to whose spine is crooked
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya raised an objection to Rav: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says, "Anyone who has two kidneys and two ureters is disqualified for the service." This implies that he is alive. Rav found this difficult. Rav said to him, "You, your ureter is bent."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי יש בעוברין שהן אסורין בן ארבעה לדקה בן שמנה לגסה הימנו ולמטה אסור יצא מי שיש לו שני גבין ושני שדראות
human_translation: raises an objection fetuses, there are those that are forbidden born fourth of small born eighth of large from this and earlier, forbidden. excludes one that has two backs and two spines.
llm_translation: The question was raised: There are fetuses that are prohibited to be slaughtered when they are four days old for a light offering, eight days old for a substantial offering. From above and below they are prohibited. One who has two kidneys and two thigh bones has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: מאי יצא לאו יצא מכלל עוברין שאפילו במעי אמן אסורין
human_translation: What excluded? not excluded from the category of fetuses, as forbidden even in the wombs of their mothers?
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "יצא"? It has come out of the general category of "עוברין," for even in the mother's womb they are prohibited.

hebrew_text: רב מתרץ לטעמיה ושמואל מתרץ לטעמיה רב מתרץ לטעמיה בן ארבעה לדקה בן ח' לגסה הימנו ולמטה אסור
human_translation: Rav explains according to his reasoning, and Shmuel explains according to his reasoning. Rav explains according to his reasoning, born fourth of small born eighth of large from this and earlier, forbidden.
llm_translation: Rav interprets according to his reasoning, and Shmuel interprets according to his reasoning. Rav interprets according to his reasoning: a child of four years old for a thin mezuzah, a child of eight years old for a thick mezuzah. From there and below is prohibited.

hebrew_text: במה דברים אמורים כשיצא לאויר העולם אבל במעי אמו שרי יצא מי שיש לו שני גבין ושני שדראות דאפילו במעי אמו נמי אסור
human_translation: In what is this statement said? where emerged into the airspace of the world; but in its mother’s womb it is permitted for excludes that has two backs and two spines, as even in the womb of its mother it is prohibited.
llm_translation: In what matters are these words said? When he has emerged into the open air of the world. But while in his mother's womb, it is permitted. One who has two testicles and two male organs, even while in his mother's womb, it is also prohibited.

hebrew_text: ושמואל מתרץ לטעמיה בן ארבעה לדקה בן שמנה לגסה הימנו ולמטה אסור במה דברים אמורים בשלא כלו לו חדשיו אבל כלו לו חדשיו מותר יצא מי שיש לו ב' גבין וב' שדראות דאע"ג דכלו לו חדשיו אם יצא לאויר העולם אסור במעי אמו שרי
human_translation: And Shmuel explains according to his reasoning, born fourth of small born eighth of large from this and earlier, forbidden. In what is this statement said? when months were not completed; but its months were completed, it is permitted excludes that has two backs and two spines, as even in its months were completed, if it emerged into the airspace of the world, it is forbidden, in the womb of its mother, it is permitted.
llm_translation: And Samuel resolves according to his reasoning: a child of four for lightness, a child of eight for corpulence, from him and below is prohibited. In what case are these words said? In a case where his months have not yet completed, but if his months have completed, he is permitted. One who has two cheeses and two barley loaves, even though his months have completed, if he goes out into the open air, he is prohibited; but in the waters of his mother, he is permitted.

hebrew_text: תני תנא קמיה דרב המפלת בריית גוף שאינו חתוך ובריית ראש שאינו חתוך יכול תהא אמו טמאה לידה ת"ל (ויקרא יב, ב) אשה כי תזריע וילדה זכר וגו' וביום השמיני ימול וגו'
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav: who discharges an entity a shapeless body, or an entity a shapeless head, might its mother should be impure childbirth. the verse states: “If a woman bears seed and gives birth to a male, And on the eighth day shall be circumcised”
llm_translation: A Sage taught before Rav: "Regarding a fetus with an intact body and a fetus with an intact head, one might have thought that its mother should be impure due to childbirth. It is stated: 'When a woman conceives and gives birth to a male...' (Leviticus 12:2) 'And on the eighth day he shall be circumcised...' (Leviticus 12:3)"

hebrew_text: מי שראוי לברית שמנה יצאו אלו שאינן ראויין לברית שמנה א"ל רב וסיים בה הכי ושיש לו שני גבין ושני שדראות
human_translation: that is fit for circumcision eighth excluding these where is not fit for circumcision eighth Rav said to And conclude like this: and that has two backs and two spines.
llm_translation: One who is fit for circumcision - eight days have passed. Those who are not fit for circumcision - eight days have not passed. Rav said to him and concluded with this: "And if he has two testicles and two hairs."

hebrew_text: רבי ירמיה בר אבא סבר למעבד עובדא כוותיה דשמואל אמר ליה רב הונא מאי דעתיך לחומרא חומרא דאתי לידי קולא הוא דקיהבת לה דמי טוהר עביד מיהא כותיה דרב דקיימא לן הלכתא כרב באיסורי בין לקולא בין לחומרא
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba thought to perform an action, in accordance with of Shmuel, Rav Huna said to him: What is your thinking? stringently? is a stringency that leads to a leniency, as you have given blood of purity. In any event, perform, in accordance with of Rav, as we maintain the halakha in accordance with Rav with regard to ritual matters, whether to a leniency or to a stringency.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba thought to perform an action like that of Shmuel. Rav Huna said to him, "What is your opinion? A stringency that leads to leniency is preferable, for the one who is stringent regarding purity is like the one who is lenient according to Rav, who establishes for us the halacha in matters of prohibition, whether leniently or stringently."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הרי אמרו אשה יולדת לתשעה ויולדת לשבעה בהמה גסה יולדת לתשעה יולדת לשבעה או לא ילדה
human_translation: Rava says: said a woman can give birth after nine or after seven a large domesticated animal gives birth after nine give birth after seven or not give birth
llm_translation: Rava said: Behold, they said, "A woman gives birth after nine months and gives birth after seven months. If a large animal gives birth after nine months, it gives birth after seven months. Did she give birth or not?"

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק ת"ש הימנו ולמטה אסור מאי לאו אגסה לא אדקה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Come hear from this and earlier, forbidden What, is it not to large No, to small
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Come and hear. From us and below is forbidden. What is it? Not a nut, not a walnut.

hebrew_text: האי מאי אי אמרת בשלמא אגסה אצטריך סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ובאשה חיי בבהמה נמי חיי קמ"ל דלא חיי
human_translation: What is this? Granted, if you say to large necessary enter your mind to say since in a woman survives, in animal also survives, teaches us that does not survive.
llm_translation: This, what? If you say, "Well, if it is a nut," you need to remove your thought. I would say, since with a woman, one is alive, with an animal also one is alive. This teaches that one is not alive.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת אדקה איתמר פשיטא בת תלתא ירחי מי קא חיי
human_translation: But if you say was stated with regard to small obvious Can it survive after three months
llm_translation: Rather, if you say it is sharp, it was stated - it is obvious, a three-year-old girl, who is sustaining?

hebrew_text: אצטריך סד"א כל בציר תרי ירחי חיי קמ"ל
human_translation: it is necessary enter your mind to say any two months less survives, teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary according to the opinion of the first Tanna, every in the harvest two months alive, this teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל המפלת דמות לילית אמו טמאה לידה ולד הוא אלא שיש לו כנפים תנ"ה א"ר יוסי מעשה בסימוני באחת שהפילה דמות לילית ובא מעשה לפני חכמים ואמרו ולד הוא אלא שיש לו כנפים
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: who discharges the form of a lilith, its mother is impure childbirth, it is offspring, only it has wings. This is also taught Rabbi Yosei said: An incident in Simoni involving a certain who discharged the form of a lilith, and incident was brought before the Sages; and they said it is offspring, only it has wings.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who miscarries a Lilith-like figure, its mother is impure due to childbirth, and it is a child, except that it has wings. It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei related an incident with a woman in Simoni who miscarried a Lilith-like figure, and the matter came before the sages. They said, "It is a child, except that it has wings."

hebrew_text: המפלת דמות נחש הורה חנינא בן אחיו של רבי יהושע אמו טמאה לידה הלך ר' יוסף וספר דברים לפני ר"ג שלח לו רבי יהושע הנהג בן אחיך ובא
human_translation: who discharged the form of a snake. Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Yehoshua’s brother, ruled its mother is impure childbirth. Rabbi Yosef went and told matter to Rabban Gamliel. sent to Rabbi Yehoshua: Take your nephew and come
llm_translation: The one who caused the likeness of a snake to fall, Hanina the son of the brother of Rabbi Yehoshua, his mother was impure after childbirth. Rabbi Yosef went and related matters before Rabbi Gamliel. Rabbi Yehoshua sent to him: "Behave, son of your brother," and he came.

hebrew_text: בהליכתן יצתה כלת (ר') חנינא לקראתו אמרה לו רבי המפלת כמין נחש מהו אמר לה אמו טהורה אמרה לו והלא משמך אמרה לי חמותי אמו טמאה ואמר לה מאיזה טעם הואיל וגלגל עינו עגול כשל אדם מתוך דבריה נזכר רבי יהושע שלח לו לרבן גמליאל מפי הורה חנינא
human_translation: While they were going Ḥanina’s daughter-in-law went out to greet said to him: My teacher, what is who discharges like a snake? said to her: Its mother is pure. She said to him: But my mother-in-law said to me in your name its mother is impure and said to her: For what reason because the pupil of is round like that of a human. Due to her statement, Rabbi Yehoshua remembered sent to Rabban Gamliel: Ḥanina issued the ruling based on my
llm_translation: As they were walking, the daughter-in-law of Rabbi Chanina went out to meet him. She said to him, "Rabbi, if a miscarriage is like a snake, what is its status?" He said to her, "His mother is pure." She said to him, "But isn't he named after you?" She said to me, "My mother-in-law is impure." He said to her, "For what reason? Since his eye is round, a person stumbled because of her words." Rabbi Yehoshua remembered this incident and sent a message to Rabban Gamliel from the mouth of the teacher Chanina.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ש"מ צורבא מרבנן דאמר מילתא לימא בה טעמא דכי מדכרו ליה מדכר
human_translation: Abaye said: Conclude from a Torah scholar [ tzurva merabbanan ] who says matter should say the reason so that when remind him he will remember
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "Learn from the great scholars who say a matter, let them say it with a reason, for when they remember, they remember."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המפלת שפיר מלא מים מלא דם מלא גנונים אינה חוששת לולד ואם היה מרוקם תשב לזכר ולנקבה המפלת סנדל או שליא תשב לזכר ולנקבה
human_translation: who discharges a gestational sac full of fluid, full of blood, full of colors not be concerned that an offspring. But if was tissue developed, observes to a male and to a female; who discharges a sandal and an afterbirth observes to a male and to a female.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who miscarries a fetus - if it is full of water, full of blood, or full of mucus, she is not concerned for the status of a birth, and if it was formed, it is determined for male and female. If the miscarriage is a sandal or placenta, it is determined for male and female.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בשלמא דם ומים לא כלום היא אלא גנונים ניחוש שמא ולד הוה ונימוח אמר אביי כמה יין חי שתת אמו של זה שנמוח עוברה בתוך מעיה
human_translation: Granted, blood or water is nothing, But colors, let us be concerned perhaps it was an offspring and liquefied. Abaye says How much undiluted wine, did the mother of this drink, that her embryo was liquefied in her womb?
llm_translation: Gemara: Granted, blood and water are nothing, but if one sees gnats, it is a sign of suspicion that perhaps a male child was born and was circumcised. Abaye said: How much wine did the mother of this one drink that the fetus inside her was circumcised.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר מלא תנן ואם איתא דאתמוחי אתמח מחסר חסר רב אדא בר אהבה אמר גוונים תנן ואם איתא דאתמוחי אתמח כולה בחד גוונא הוי קאי
human_translation: Rava says We learned full and if it is so, that liquefied, lacking Rav Adda bar Ahava says We learned colors, and if it is so, that liquefied, it would all be of one color.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Full we learned, and if it is so that it is necessary, it is necessary." Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "Colors we learned, and if it is so that it is necessary, it is all in one color."

hebrew_text: תניא אבא שאול אומר קובר מתים הייתי והייתי מסתכל בעצמות של מתים השותה יין חי עצמותיו שרופין מזוג עצמותיו סכויין כראוי עצמותיו משוחין וכל מי ששתייתו מרובה מאכילתו עצמותיו שרופין אכילתו מרובה משתייתו עצמותיו סכויין כראוי עצמותיו משוחין
human_translation: it is taught Abba Shaul says: I used to be a gravedigger, and I would observe the bones of corpses. the bones of one who drinks undiluted wine burnt, the bones of diluted are black, the bones of appropriate are fat, And the bones of anyone who drinks more than he eats burnt, the bones of eats more than he drinks are black, the bones of one who appropriate are fat.
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Shaul says, "I used to be a gravedigger, and I would gaze at the bones of the dead. One who drinks wine, his bones are scorched; one who mixes wine, his bones are covered; one who drinks excessively more than he eats, his bones are scorched; one who eats excessively more than he drinks, his bones are covered."

hebrew_text: תניא אבא שאול אומר ואיתימא רבי יוחנן קובר מתים הייתי פעם אחת רצתי אחר צבי ונכנסתי בקולית של מת ורצתי אחריו שלש פרסאות וצבי לא הגעתי וקולית לא כלתה כשחזרתי לאחורי אמרו לי של עוג מלך הבשן היתה
human_translation: It is taught Abba Shaul says and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan I used to be a gravedigger. Once I ran after a deer, and I entered the thighbone of a corpse; and I ran after three parasangs and I did not reach deer, thighbone did not end. When I came back they said to me: It was of Og, king of Bashan,
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Shaul says, and some say it was Rabbi Yochanan, "I once followed a deer and entered the voice of a dead person. I followed it for three parasangs, but did not reach the deer, and the voice did not cease. When I turned back, they told me it was the voice of Og, the King of Bashan."

hebrew_text: תניא אבא שאול אומר קובר מתים הייתי פעם אחת נפתחה מערה תחתי ועמדתי בגלגל עינו של מת עד חוטמי כשחזרתי לאחורי אמרו עין של אבשלום היתה
human_translation: It is taught Abba Shaul says: I used to be a gravedigger. Once cave opened up underneath and I standing in the eye socket of a corpse until my nose. When I came back they said to me: It was the eye of Absalom.
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Shaul says, "I was once burying the dead. Once a cave opened beneath me, and I stood at the eye socket of a corpse up to my nostrils. When I turned back, they said it was the eye of Absalom."

hebrew_text: ושמא תאמר אבא שאול ננס הוה אבא שאול ארוך בדורו הוה ורבי טרפון מגיע לכתפו ור' טרפון ארוך בדורו הוה ור"מ מגיע לכתפו רבי מאיר ארוך בדורו הוה ורבי מגיע לכתפו רבי ארוך בדורו הוה
human_translation: And lest you say Abba Shaul was a midget, Abba Shaul was the tallest in his generation. And Rabbi Tarfon reached his shoulder, and Rabbi Tarfon was the tallest in his generation. And Rabbi Meir reached the shoulder of Rabbi Meir was the tallest in his generation. And Rabbi reached the shoulder of Rabbi was the tallest in his generation.
llm_translation: And perhaps you will say, Abba Saul was a miracle-worker. Abba Saul was tall in his generation, and Rabbi Tarfon reached his shoulder. And Rabbi Tarfon was tall in his generation, and Rabbi Meir reached his shoulder. Rabbi Meir was tall in his generation, and Rabbi reached his shoulder.

hebrew_text: ורבי חייא מגיע לכתפו ורבי חייא ארוך בדורו הוה ורב מגיע לכתפו רב ארוך בדורו הוה ורב יהודה מגיע לכתפו ורב יהודה ארוך בדורו הוה ואדא דיילא מגיע לכתפו
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya reached the shoulder of and Rabbi Ḥiyya was the tallest in his generation. And Rav reached the shoulder of Rav was the tallest in his generation. And Rav Yehuda reached the shoulder of and Rav Yehuda was the tallest in his generation. And Adda the attendant [ dayyala ] reached the shoulder of
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya reaches his shoulder, and Rabbi Chiya was long in his generation. And Rav reaches his shoulder, Rav was long in his generation. And Rav Yehuda reaches his shoulder, and Rav Yehuda was long in his generation. And Ada Daila reaches his shoulder.

hebrew_text: פרשתבינא דפומבדיתא קאי ליה לאדא דיילא עד פלגיה וכולי עלמא קאי לפרשתבינא דפומבדיתא עד חרציה
human_translation: the governor [ parashtevina ] of Pumbedita would stand to Adda the attendant, half of his And everyone in the world would stand to the governor of Pumbedita, his loins [ ḥartzeih ].
llm_translation: The section of the inn of Pumbedita is situated for the master of the inn until half of it, and everyone is situated for the section of the inn of Pumbedita until its courtyard.

hebrew_text: שאלו לפני רבי המפלת שפיר מלא בשר מהו אמר להם לא שמעתי
human_translation: asked Rabbi who discharges a gestational sac full of flesh, what is said to them: I have not heard
llm_translation: They asked before Rabbi Hamaflet: "A fetus filled with flesh, what is it?" He said to them, "I have not heard."

hebrew_text: אמר לפניו ר' ישמעאל בר' יוסי כך אמר אבא מלא דם טמאה נדה מלא בשר טמאה לידה
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: This my father, said: full of blood, she is impure a menstruating woman. full of flesh, she is impure childbirth.
llm_translation: Said before Him Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei: Thus said Abba, "A womb full of impure blood, impure flesh is born."

hebrew_text: א"ל אילמלי דבר חדש אמרת לנו משום אביך שמענוך עכשיו
human_translation: said to him: If you had told us new statement in the name of your father, we would have listened to you, now
llm_translation: He said to him: "If you had told us something new in the name of your father, we would have listened to you now."

hebrew_text: מדהא קמייתא כיחידאה קאמר כסומכוס שאמר משום ר"מ הא נמי שמא כרבי יהושע אמרה ואין הלכה כר' יהושע
human_translation: From said this first clause in accordance with an individual in accordance with Sumakhos, who said in the name of Rabbi Meir this as well, perhaps said it in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. And halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: The first part is like an individual, as K'sumkos said in the name of Rabbi Meir. This also may be like Rabbi Yehoshua said, and the halacha is not like Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: דתניא המפלת שפיר שאינו מרוקם ר' יהושע אומר ולד וחכ"א אינו ולד
human_translation: As it is taught who discharges a gestational sac in which tissue did not develop, Rabbi Yehoshua says: an offspring, and the Rabbis say: It is not an offspring,
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: "One who miscarries a well-formed fetus, Rabbi Yehoshua says: it is considered a child, and the sages say: it is not considered a child."

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש בן לקיש משום ר' אושעיא מחלוקת בעכור אבל בצלול דברי הכל אינו ולד ור' יהושע בן לוי אמר בצלול מחלוקת
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: dispute in turbid, But in clear, everyone agrees is not an offspring. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: dispute in clear.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: There is a dispute regarding Akor, but regarding Tzalul, everyone agrees it is not a viable offspring. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Regarding Tzalul, there is a dispute.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו בצלול מחלוקת אבל בעכור דברי הכל ולד או דלמא בין בזה ובין בזה מחלוקת תיקו
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before dispute in clear, but in turbid, everyone agrees an offspring? Or perhaps dispute in this and in that shall stand
llm_translation: The question was asked before them: in the case of a clear liquid there is a dispute, but in the case of a turbid liquid, everyone agrees. Or perhaps there is a dispute both in this case and in that case. The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי את זו דרש ר' יהושע בן חנניא (בראשית ג, כא) ויעש ה' אלהים לאדם ולאשתו כתנות עור וילבישם מלמד שאין הקב"ה עושה עור לאדם אלא א"כ נוצר
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya, taught this “And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skins, and clothed them” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not make skin for a person unless he is created,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A contradiction was raised: This one opinion expounded, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Hananiah expounded (Genesis 3:21) "And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skin and clothed them," teaching that the Holy One, blessed be He, does not make garments of skin for a person unless he first creates the person.

hebrew_text: אלמא בעור תליא מילתא לא שנא עכור ול"ש צלול
human_translation: Evidently, the matter is dependent on skin, is no difference turbid, and is no difference clear.
llm_translation: The matter depends on the skin, not on the blind and the clear.

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא בצלול מחלוקת היינו דאיצטריך קרא אלא אי אמרת בעכור מחלוקת למה לי קרא סברא בעלמא הוא אלא שמע מינה בצלול מחלוקת שמע מינה
human_translation: Granted, if you say dispute in clear, that is was necessary a verse But if you say dispute in turbid, why do I a verse It is logical Rather, conclude from it dispute in clear. Conclude from it
llm_translation: If you say, "In a case where there is a clear dispute, that is where a verse is necessary." But if you say, "In a case where there is obscurity, why do I need a verse?" It is just a matter of logic. Rather, conclude from this: in a case of a clear dispute, conclude from this.

hebrew_text: וכן אמר ר"נ אמר רבה בר אבוה מחלוקת בעכור אבל בצלול דברי הכל אינו ולד
human_translation: And likewise, Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: dispute in turbid; but in clear, everyone agrees is not an offspring.
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh: Dispute in Akor, but in Tzalul, the words of everyone it is not.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבא לר"נ אלא אמרו סימן ולד בבהמה דקה טינוף בגסה שליא באשה שפיר ושליא
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman But said an indication of the offspring in a small animal murky discharge in a large an afterbirth, in a woman a gestational sac or an afterbirth.
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rabbah bar Nahmani: Rather, they said a sign of a male offspring in a small animal is a protruding upper lip, in a large animal a well-formed upper lip, and in a woman, it is praiseworthy if she has a well-formed upper lip.

hebrew_text: ואילו שפיר בבהמה לא פטר אי אמרת בשלמא בצלול מחלוקת משום הכי
human_translation: And yet a gestational sac in animal does not exempt Granted, if you say dispute in clear, due to that
llm_translation: And if it is a fine animal, he is not exempt. If you say in the case of a clear blemish, there is a dispute for this reason.

hebrew_text: אשה דרבי בה קרא פטר בה שפיר בבהמה דלא רבי קרא לא פטר בה שפיר
human_translation: With regard to a woman, as the verse: includes a gestational sac exempts in an animal, as the verse does not include a gestational sac does not exempt
llm_translation: A woman of Rabbi in her, he called, exempt in her, fine in an animal, for not Rabbi, he called, not exempt in her, fine.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת בעכור מחלוקת מכדי סברא הוא מאי שנא אשה ומאי שנא בהמה
human_translation: But if you say dispute in turbid, since is logic, what is different a woman, and what is different an animal?
llm_translation: Rather, if you say it is due to the issue of 'Achzor,' it is a matter of logic. What is the difference between a woman and an animal?

hebrew_text: מי סברת רבי יהושע מפשט פשיט ליה רבי יהושע ספוקי מספקא ליה ואזיל הכא לחומרא והכא לחומרא
human_translation: Do you hold it is obvious to Rabbi Yehoshua Rabbi Yehoshua is uncertain and here, stringently, and there stringently.
llm_translation: Who does Rabbi Yehoshua hold? He holds that when it is clear, it is clear to him. Rabbi Yehoshua is in doubt, he is in doubt, and he goes here for a lenient ruling and there for a lenient ruling.

hebrew_text: גבי אשה דממונא הוא ספק ממונא לקולא
human_translation: with regard to a woman which is a monetary matter, uncertainty monetary matters leniently.
llm_translation: Regarding a woman of Mamona, it is a doubt of Mamona to the voice.

hebrew_text: גבי בהמה דאיסורא הוא דאיכא לגבי גיזה ועבודה ספק איסורא לחומרא ה"נ גבי אשה ספק טומאה לחומרא
human_translation: with regard to an animal, which is a ritual matter, as there are involving, shearing and labor uncertainty ritual matters stringently. So too, with regard to a woman uncertainty impurity stringently,
llm_translation: Regarding an animal that is forbidden, there is a case of both shearing and labor, a doubtful prohibition for stringency. So too, regarding a woman, a doubtful impurity for stringency.

hebrew_text: ומי מספקא ליה והא קרא קאמר מדרבנן וקרא אסמכתא בעלמא הוא
human_translation: And is uncertain But doesn’t he cite a verse by rabbinic and the verse is a mere support
llm_translation: And who is in doubt about it? But the verse is saying from the Rabbis, and the verse is merely an asmakhta.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב חנינא בר שלמיא לרב הא רבי הא ר' ישמעאל בר' יוסי והא רבי אושעיא והא רבי יהושע בן לוי מר כמאן ס"ל
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina bar Shelamya said to Rav: This Rabbi this Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, And this Rabbi Oshaya, and this Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, In accordance with whose does the Master hold?
llm_translation: Rav Chanina bar Shalmiya said to Rav: "This is Rabbi, this is Rabbi Yishmael bar Yossi, and this is Rabbi Oshaya, and this is Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. From whom do they hold?"

hebrew_text: א"ל אני אומר אחד זה ואחד זה אינה חוששת
human_translation: said to I say both this and that not concerned
llm_translation: He said to him: I say, one this and one this is not concerned.

hebrew_text: ושמואל אמר אחד זה ואחד זה חוששת ואזדא שמואל לטעמיה דכי אתא רב דימי אמר מעולם לא דכו שפיר בנהרדעא לבר מההוא שפירא דאתא לקמיה דשמואל דמנח עליה חוט השערה מהאי גיסא וחזיא מהאי גיסא אמר אם איתא דולד הואי לא הוה זיג כולי האי
human_translation: And Shmuel says: both this and that concerned And Shmuel follows his reasoning as when Rav Dimi came said: In Neharde’a never deemed a gestational sac pure, except for a certain gestational sac that came before Shmuel, who placed a hair on this side and it was visible from that side. said, If it were so, that was an offspring it would not have been so transparent.
llm_translation: And Samuel said, one this and one this is concerned, and Samuel went according to his reasoning. When Rav Dimi came, he said, "They have never properly examined in Nehardea except for that examination that came before Samuel, where he placed a thread of a gate-hinge on this side and saw from that side." He said, "If it is a miscarriage, there would not have been any bleeding at all."

hebrew_text: ואם היה מרוקם וכו' תנו רבנן איזהו שפיר מרוקם אבא שאול אומר תחלת ברייתו מראשו ושתי עיניו כשתי טיפין של זבוב תני רבי חייא מרוחקין זה מזה שני חוטמין כשתי טיפים של זבוב
human_translation: But if was tissue developed, The Sages taught What is a gestational sac tissue developed? Abba Shaul says: The beginning of the formation of is from its head, and its two eyes like two drops, of a fly. Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: distant from each other. its two nostrils like two drops, of a fly.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And if it was embroidered, etc." The Rabbis taught: What is considered well-embroidered? Abba Saul says: Its beginning is from its head, and its two eyes are like two fly's wings. Rabbi Chiya teaches: They are distanced from each other like two nostrils of a fly.

hebrew_text: תני רבי חייא ומקורבין זה לזה ופיו מתוח כחוט השערה וגויתו כעדשה ואם היתה נקבה נדונה כשעורה לארכה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: And close to each other. And its mouth stretches like a strand of hair. And its body is like a lentil. And if it was female, discerned of barley along the length of
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: "And they are close to one another, and his mouth is stretched like a thread of a hair, and his body is like a lentil. And if she is a female, she is judged like a barleycorn for its length."

hebrew_text: וחתוך ידים ורגלים אין לו ועליו מפורש בקבלה (איוב י, י) הלא כחלב תתיכני וכגבינה תקפיאני עור ובשר תלבישני ועצמות וגידים תסוככני חיים וחסד עשית עמדי ופקודתך שמרה רוחי
human_translation: And it does not have the shape of arms and legs And it is said with regard to in tradition, “Have You not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese? You have clothed me with skin and flesh, and knit me together with bones and sinews. You have granted me life and favor, and Your providence has preserved my spirit”
llm_translation: "And cut hands and feet not to him and upon him explicit in tradition (Job 10:10) 'Have you not poured me out like milk and curdled me like cheese? You clothed me with skin and flesh, and knit me together with bones and sinews. You have granted me life and steadfast love, and your care has preserved my spirit.'"

hebrew_text: ואין בודקין אותו במים שהמים עזין
human_translation: And one does not examine it with water as water is strong,
llm_translation: And one does not examine it with water, for the water is strong.

hebrew_text: וטורדין אותו אלא בודקין אותו בשמן שהשמן רך ומצחצחו ואין רואין אלא בחמה
human_translation: and dissolves it. Rather, one examines it with oil, as oil is soft and cleans And one views only in the sun.
llm_translation: And they press him, rather they check him with oil, for the oil is soft and smooths him, and they only see with the sun.

hebrew_text: כיצד בודקין אותו כיצד בודקין אותו כדאמרינן אלא במה בודקין אותו לידע אם זכר הוא אם נקבה היא
human_translation: How does one examine How does one examine it as we said. Rather, In what does one examine it to ascertain whether it is male or it is female?
llm_translation: How do we examine him? How do we examine him? As we say, "Rather, how do we examine him to know if he is male or female."

hebrew_text: אבא שאול בר נש ואמרי לה אבא שאול בר רמש אומר מביא קיסם שראשו חלק ומנענע באותו מקום אם מסכסך בידוע שזכר הוא ואם לאו בידוע שנקבה היא
human_translation: Abba Shaul bar Nash, and some say Abba Shaul bar Remash, says: One brings a sliver of wood whose top is smooth, and he moves in that place, If is caught, it is known that is male, And if not it is known that it is female.
llm_translation: Abba Shaul the son of Nash, and some say Abba Shaul the son of Ramash, says: One who brings a bundle, its head is smooth, and shakes it in that place. If it becomes entangled, if it is known that it is male, and if not, it is known that it is female.

hebrew_text: א"ר נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה ל"ש אלא מלמטה למעלה אבל מן הצדדין אימא כותלי בית הרחם נינהו
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: They taught only from below to above; but from the sides, say the sides of the womb
llm_translation: Rabbi Nachman said, Rabbah bar Avuh said: Not from below to above, but from the sides, one might say they are the walls of the womb.

hebrew_text: א"ר אדא בר אהבה תנא אם היתה נקבה נדונה כשעורה סדוקה מתקיף לה ר"נ ודילמא חוט של ביצים נינהו אמר אביי השתא ביצים גופייהו לא ידיעי חוט של ביצים ידיע
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says: taught If it was female, discerned of a cracked barley Rav Naḥman objects to this: But perhaps it is the recess between the testes, Abaye said Now, the testes themselves are not discernible. the recess between the testes is discernible?
llm_translation: Rabbi Adda bar Ahava taught: If a woman was examined like a barley grain, Rabbi Nahman objects. But perhaps they are like egg threads. Abaye said: Now, eggs themselves are not known, but egg threads are known.

hebrew_text: א"ר עמרם תנא ב' ירכותיו כב' חוטין של זהורית וא"ר עמרם עלה כשל ערב ושני זרועותיו כב' חוטין של זהורית וא"ר עמרם עלה כשל שתי
human_translation: Rabbi Amram says it is taught its two thighs like two strings of crimson [ zehorit ]. And Rabbi Amram says with regard to like of the woof, And its two arms like two strings of crimson . And Rabbi Amram says with regard to like of the warp.
llm_translation: Rabbi Amram taught: His two thighs are like two threads of zahorit. And Rabbi Amram said: His calf ascended like the evening, and his two arms are like two threads of zahorit. And Rabbi Amram said: His calf ascended like the two.

hebrew_text: א"ל שמואל לרב יהודה שיננא לא תעביד עובדא עד שישעיר ומי אמר שמואל הכי והאמר שמואל אחת זו ואחת זו חוששת
human_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: Shinnana , do not perform an action, unless has grown hair. And did Shmuel say that? But doesn’t Shmuel say both this and that concerned
llm_translation: Samuel said to Rav Yehudah: "Shinena, do not perform a deed until you estimate." But did Samuel really say so? Didn't Samuel say: "One and the other are both suspect"?

hebrew_text: אמר רב אמי בר שמואל לדידי מפרשא לי מיניה דמר שמואל לחוש חוששת ימי טהרה לא יהבינן לה עד שישעיר
human_translation: Rav Ami bar Shmuel says: explained to me by Mar Shmuel: being concerned concerned, we do not give her days of purity unless has grown hair.
llm_translation: Rav Ami bar Shmuel said: According to my understanding of the statement of Mar Shmuel, "One should not give a woman her days of purity until he has warned her."

hebrew_text: למימרא דמספקא ליה לשמואל והא ההוא שפירא דאתאי לקמיה דמר שמואל אמר הא בר ארבעין וחד יומא וחשיב מיומא דאזלא לטבילה עד ההוא יומא ולא הוה אלא ארבעין יומין
human_translation: Is that to say that Shmuel is uncertain But a certain gestational sac that was brought before Mar Shmuel, said: This is forty-one days old. And calculated from the day that went to immersion until that day, and it was only forty days.
llm_translation: To say that he doubted Samuel, but that beautiful one who came before Master Samuel said, "This is forty and one day," and it is considered from the day he went to immerse until that day, and it was not but forty days.

hebrew_text: ואמר להו האי בנדה בעל כפתיה ואודי שאני שמואל דרב גובריה
human_translation: And he said to This engaged in intercourse with a menstruating woman. They bound and he confessed. Shmuel is different, as his strength, great.
llm_translation: And he said to them: "This menstruating woman, with her palm's breadth, and I testify that I am Shmuel, son of Rav Gavriah."

hebrew_text: המפלת סנדל וכו' ת"ר סנדל דומה לדג של ים מתחלתו ולד הוא אלא שנרצף רשב"ג אומר סנדל דומה ללשון של שור הגדול משום רבותינו העידו סנדל צריך צורת פנים
human_translation: who discharges a sandal The Sages taught A sandal a similar to fish of sea it is offspring from the outset, but it was mashed. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A sandal similar to the tongue of the large bull. testified in the name of our teachers a sandal requires the shape of a face.
llm_translation: The mishna teaches: "One who removes a sandal, etc." The Sages taught: A sandal is similar to a fish of the sea from its beginning, and it is a type of demon. Rather, it is stitched. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: A sandal is similar to the tongue of a large ox. Because our Rabbis testified: A sandal requires a form of a face.

hebrew_text: א"ר יהודה אמר שמואל הלכה סנדל צריך צורת פנים ... א"ר אדא א"ר יוסף א"ר יצחק סנדל צריך צורת פנים ואפי' מאחוריו משל לאדם שסטר את חבירו והחזיר פניו לאחוריו
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha a sandal requires the shape of a face Rav Adda says Rav Yosef says Rabbi Yitzḥak says: A sandal requires the shape of a face, but even on the back of its A parable to a person who slapped another and pushed his face back.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said, Shmuel said: The halacha is that a sandal requires a form of a face... Rabbi Adda said in the name of Rabbi Yosef who said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: A sandal requires a form of a face, even behind it. This can be compared to a person who turns his back on his friend and then turns his face to his back.

hebrew_text: בימי רבי ינאי בקשו לטהר את הסנדל שאין לו צורת פנים אמר להם ר' ינאי טיהרתם את הוולדות
human_translation: In the days of Rabbi Yannai, wished to deem pure a sandal that does not have the shape of a face. Rabbi Yannai said to them: You have deemed pure offspring.
llm_translation: In the days of Rabbi Yannai, they sought to purify the sandal that has no recognizable form. Rabbi Yannai said to them, "You have purified the fetuses."

hebrew_text: והתניא משום רבותינו העידו סנדל צריך צורת פנים אמר רב ביבי בר אביי אמר רבי יוחנן מעדותו של רבי נחוניא נשנית משנה זו אמר רבי זעירא זכה בה רב ביבי בשמעתיה דאנא והוא הוינא יתבינן קמיה דרבי יוחנן כי אמרה להא שמעתא וקדם איהו ואמר וזכה בה
human_translation: But isn’t it taught testified in the name of our teachers a sandal requires the shape of a face? Rav Beivai bar Abaye says Rabbi Yoḥanan says This mishna, is taught from the testimony of Rabbi Neḥunya. Rabbi Zeira says: Rav Beivai merited that his halakha , As he and I were sitting before Rabbi Yoḥanan when said this halakha , but said it first and merited it
llm_translation: And it was taught in the name of our Rabbis: Sandal requires the form of a face. Rav Bibi son of Abaye said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The testimony of Rabbi Nachunya was repeated in this Mishnah. Rabbi Zeira said: Rav Bibi merited with his understanding, for I was sitting before Rabbi Yochanan when he said this teaching, and he preceded me and said, "And he merited with it."

hebrew_text: למה הזכירו סנדל והלא אין סנדל שאין עמו ולד
human_translation: Why mention a sandal there is no a sandal that not offspring with it,
llm_translation: "Why did they mention a sandal when there is no sandal without its strap?"

hebrew_text: אי דאתילידא נקבה בהדיה ה"נ הכא במאי עסקינן דאתיליד זכר בהדיה
human_translation: If a female is born with indeed here we are dealing with where a male is born with it,
llm_translation: If a female is born together with it, so here, with what are we dealing that a male is born together with it.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא הואיל ואמר רב יצחק בר אמי אשה מזרעת תחילה יולדת זכר איש מזריע תחלה יולדת נקבה מדהא זכר הא נמי זכר
human_translation: lest you say since Rav Yitzḥak bar Ami says woman emits seed first she gives birth to a male man emits seed first she gives birth to a female, from that this is male, this is also male.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Since Rav Yitzchak bar Ami said, "A woman who conceives first gives birth to a male; a man who conceives first gives birth to a female." Because if it is a male, then it is also a male.

hebrew_text: קמ"ל אימא שניהם הזריעו בבת אחת האי זכר והאי נקבה
human_translation: teaches us say both emitted seed at the same time, this is male and that is female.
llm_translation: Learned from this, say both of them impregnated in one daughter, this male and this female.

hebrew_text: דבר אחר שאם תלד נקבה לפני שקיעת החמה וסנדל לאחר שקיעת החמה
human_translation: Alternatively, as, if gives birth to female before sunset and sandal after sunset,
llm_translation: Another explanation: If a female gives birth before sunset, it is a sign of prosperity; if a sandal is lost after sunset.

hebrew_text: מונה תחלת נדה לראשון ותחלת נדה לאחרון
human_translation: she counts the beginning of a menstruating woman from the first But the beginning of a menstruating woman from the last
llm_translation: Counts the beginning of menstruation for the first and the beginning of menstruation for the last.

hebrew_text: סנדל דתנן
human_translation: a sandal that we learned
llm_translation: Sandals as we have learned.

hebrew_text: גבי בכורות למאי הלכתא
human_translation: with regard to firstborns For what halakha
llm_translation: Regarding firstborn animals, what is the halacha?

hebrew_text: לבא אחריו בכור לנחלה ואין בכור לכהן
human_translation: for comes after it. a firstborn with regard to inheritance, but not a firstborn with regard to a priest.
llm_translation: To come after him, the firstborn for inheritance, and there is no firstborn for a priest.

hebrew_text: סנדל דתנן גבי כריתות למאי הלכתא
human_translation: a sandal that we learned in Karetot For what halakha
llm_translation: Sandal that we learned about in the tractate of Keritot, what is the halakha?

hebrew_text: שאם תלד ולד דרך דופן וסנדל דרך רחם דמייתא קרבן אסנדל
human_translation: that if gives birth to offspring by means of caesarean section, and a sandal through womb, in she brings an offering for sandal
llm_translation: If she gives birth to a male child, the size of a dove's egg, and a sandal, the size of a womb, is like a sin offering.

hebrew_text: ולרבי שמעון דאמר יוצא דרך דופן ולד מעליא הוא מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon, who said delivered by means of caesarean section is a full-fledged offspring, what is there to say?
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon who said: "One who goes out by way of the threshold is considered to be a superior son." What can be said?

hebrew_text: אמר רבי ירמיה שאם תלד ולד בהיותה עובדת כוכבים וסנדל לאחר שנתגיירה דמייתא קרבן אסנדל
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: that if gives birth to offspring while she is a gentile, and sandal after she converted that she brings an offering for the sandal
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah: If she gives birth to a child while she was still a worshipper of idols, and afterwards she converted, the offering is like a sandal.

hebrew_text: אמרוה רבנן קמיה דרב פפא ומי איתנהו להני שינויי והא תניא כשהן יוצאין אין יוצאין אלא כרוכין
human_translation: The Sages said before Rav Pappa, and And are these answers But isn’t it taught when exit they exit only wrapped
llm_translation: The sages said before Rav Papa, "And are they suitable for these changes? But it was taught: When they go out, they only go out rolled up."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא שמע מינה מכרך כריך ליה ולד לסנדל אפלגיה ומשלחיף ליה כלפי רישיה גבי בכורות כגון שיצאו דרך ראשיהם דסנדל קדים ונפיק גבי כריתות שיצאו דרך מרגלותיהם דולד קדים ונפיק
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Conclude from it offspring encounters the sandal at half its And pushes toward its head with regard to firstborns where exited with their heads as sandal emerges first. in Karetot where they emerged with their feet as offspring emerges first.
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: Learn from this, if one sells a sandal to another and a child falls from it, he is liable to pay for the firstborns, such as when they come out headfirst with the sandal facing east, and he is liable for the cuttings when they come out feet first with the sandal facing west.

hebrew_text: רב הונא בר תחליפא משמיה דרבא אמר אפילו תימא מצומצמין ואיפוך שמעתתא גבי בכורות שיצאו דרך מרגלותיהם ולד דאית ביה חיותא סריך ולא נפיק סנדל דלית ביה חיותא שריק ונפיק גבי כריתות שיצאו דרך ראשיהן ולד דאית ביה חיותא מדנפיק רישיה הויא לידה סנדל עד דנפיק רוביה
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Taḥlifa says in the name of Rava: You even say precisely and reverse halakha With regard to firstborns, where emerged with their feet offspring, which has life, hangs on and does not emerge sandal which does not have life, slides and emerges In Karetot , where came out with their heads offspring, which has life, once its head emerges it is a birth, sandal only when the majority of its emerges.
llm_translation: Rav Huna bar Taḥalifa in the name of Rava said: Even if you say they are contracted, and the opposite you heard regarding firstborn animals that were born through their hooves, and a fetus that has a living creature in it requires ritual slaughter, and if it did not come out with a sandal that does not have a living creature, it is valid. And it came out in the case of caesarean sections that were born through their heads, and a fetus that has a living creature, from when its head comes out, it is considered born until most of it comes out.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שליא בבית הבית טמא לא שהשליא ולד אלא שאין שליא בלא ולד
human_translation: an afterbirth in the house, the house is ritually impure, not that an afterbirth an offspring; rather, that there is no afterbirth without an offspring.
llm_translation: Mishnah: "Shelya in the house is impure, not because the shelya itself is a fetus, but because there is no shelya without a fetus."

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר נימוק הולד עד שלא יצא
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: the offspring disintegrated, before it emerged
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "The fetus is considered as the thigh until it emerges."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן שליא תחלתה דומה לחוט של ערב וסופה דומה כתורמוס וחלולה כחצוצרת ואין שליא פחותה מטפח רבי שמעון בן גמליאל אומר שליא דומה לקורקבן של תרנגולין שהדקין יוצאין ממנה
human_translation: The Sages taught the outset of afterbirth similar to a string of the woof, and end of similar to a lupine. And hollow like a trumpet, and there is no afterbirth less than a handbreadth. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: An afterbirth is similar to the craw of roosters, from which the small emerges.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: The beginning of the womb resembles the thread of a wild donkey, and its end resembles a bean, and its cavity is like a trumpet. And the womb is not less than a handbreadth. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: The womb resembles the membrane of a chicken's egg, from which the chicks come out.

hebrew_text: תניא רבי אושעיא זעירא דמן חבריא חמשה שיעורן טפח ואלו הן שליא שופר שדרה דופן סוכה והאזוב
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Oshaya, the youngest [ ze’eira ] of the company [ demin ḥavrayya ] five whose measure handbreadth, and these are they: An afterbirth, shofar spine the wall of a sukka , and the hyssop [ veha’ezov ].
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Oshaya the Small from the town of Ḥavriya said: Five measurements, each one a handbreadth, and these are they: the covering, the shofar, the door, the wall of a sukkah, and the hyssop.

hebrew_text: שליא הא דאמרן שופר דתניא כמה יהא שיעור שופר פירש רבי שמעון בן גמליאל כדי שיאחזנו בידו ויראה לכאן ולכאן טפח
human_translation: an afterbirth is that which we stated a shofar as it is taught How much is the measure of a shofar Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel explained: enough that when one holds it in his hand it can be seen on one side and on the other side, handbreadth.
llm_translation: Sheliya, this that we said regarding the shofar, as it is taught: How much should be the measurement of a shofar? Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel explained: Enough that one can grasp it in his hand and see here and there a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: שדרה מה היא דא"ר פרנך אמר רבי יוחנן שדרו של לולב צריך שיהא יוצא מן ההדס טפח דופן סוכה דתניא שתים כהלכתן שלישית אפילו טפח אזוב דתני רבי חייא אזוב טפח
human_translation: What is a spine as Rabbi Parnakh said Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The spine of a lulav must protrude handbreadth beyond the myrtle branch the wall of a sukka as it is taught two in the standard sense, and a third even handbreadth. hyssop that Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: hyssop handbreadth.
llm_translation: The text: "What is a shedra?" Rabbi Parnach said, Rabbi Yochanan said: The shedra of the lulav must extend a handbreadth from the myrtle branch of the sukkah. As it was taught: Two handbreadths according to their law, a third handbreadth even of myrtle. As Rabbi Chiya taught: A handbreadth of myrtle.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חנינא בר פפא דריש שילא איש כפר תמרתא תלת מתניתא ותרתי שמעתתא שיעורא טפח תרתי חדא היא אמר אביי אימא אמר רבי חייא אזוב טפח
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says Sheila of Kefar Temarta taught three baraitot , and two halakhot measure handbreadth two is one Abaye says: say Rabbi Ḥiyya says hyssop handbreadth,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: Drish Shila, a man from Kfar Temarta, taught three Mishnayot and two Halachot. The measurement of a Tefach is two thirds of one. Abaye said: I say, Rabbi Chiya said: "Azov is a Tefach."

hebrew_text: ותו ליכא והאיכא טפח על טפח על רום טפח מרובע מביא את הטומאה וחוצץ בפני הטומאה
human_translation: And are there no more But isn’t there A cubic handbreadth by handbreadth with a height of handbreadth transmits ritual impurity. And serves as a barrier before, ritual impurity
llm_translation: And there is no "and there is," but there is a handbreadth upon a handbreadth upon a height of a handbreadth square brings impurity and divides before the impurity.

hebrew_text: טפח קאמרינן טפח על טפח לא קאמרינן
human_translation: We said handbreadth; we did not say handbreadth by handbreadth.
llm_translation: A handbreadth we are saying, a handbreadth upon a handbreadth we are not saying.

hebrew_text: והא איכא אבן היוצא מן התנור טפח ומן הכירה שלש אצבעות חבור
human_translation: But isn’t there A stone that protrudes from the oven handbreadth, and from the stove three fingerbreadths a connection
llm_translation: And there is a stone that emerges from the oven a handbreadth, and from the stove three fingers joined.

hebrew_text: כי קאמרינן היכא דבציר מטפח לא חזי אבל הכא כ"ש דבציר מטפח יד תנור הוא
human_translation: When we said where less than handbreadth is unfit But here, all the more so that less than handbreadth is a handle of oven.
llm_translation: We say where in a vineyard, one does not see a handbreadth, but here all the more so, for in a vineyard, it is a handbreadth, it is the hand of an oven.

hebrew_text: והאיכא
human_translation: But aren’t there
llm_translation: And there is.

hebrew_text: תנורי בנות טפח דתניא תנור תחלתו ארבעה ושיריו ד' דברי רבי מאיר
human_translation: ovens with girls handbreadth? As it is taught oven its original, state four And its remains four the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Ovens of daughters a handbreadth. As it was taught in a Baraita: An oven, its beginning is four handbreadths and its remnants are four. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים במה דברים אמורים בגדול אבל בקטן תחלתו כל שהוא משתגמר מלאכתו ושיריו ברובו
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: In what is this statement said? in a large but with regard to a small its original state, any size Once its construction is completed, its remains include the majority of
llm_translation: The sages say: In what matters is it said regarding a great person, but in a small person, his beginning is entirely dependent on his completion, and his remnants are in his majority.

hebrew_text: וכמה כל שהוא אמר רבי ינאי טפח שכן עושין תנורי בנות טפח בפלוגתא לא קמיירי
human_translation: And how any size? Rabbi Yannai says: handbreadth, as fashion ovens for girls handbreadth is not speaking of dispute,
llm_translation: And how much is the measure? Rabbi Yannai said: a handbreadth. Thus they make ovens, a handbreadth in thickness, they do not stand before the court.

hebrew_text: השתא דאתית להכי הא נמי פלוגתא היא דקתני סיפא אמר ר' יהודה לא אמרו טפח אלא מן התנור ולכותל
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this this is also a dispute. As the latter clause teaches Rabbi Yehuda said: said handbreadth, only from the oven and toward the wall.
llm_translation: At this moment, since you have come to this, this is also a dispute, as the latter clause teaches: Rabbi Yehudah said: They did not say a handbreadth, but from the oven to the wall.

hebrew_text: והאיכא מסגרת טפח בדכתיבן לא קא מיירי והאיכא כפורת טפח בקדשים לא קמיירי
human_translation: But isn’t there frame handbreadth is not dealing with that are written But isn’t there the Ark Cover, handbreadth is not dealing with consecrated
llm_translation: And there is a border of one handbreadth, as it is written, they do not bring, and there is a cover of one handbreadth, in the holy things they do not bring.

hebrew_text: והאיכא דיה לקורה שהיא רחבה טפח בדרבנן לא קמיירי אלא בדכתיבן ולא מפרשי שיעורייהו
human_translation: But isn’t there it is enough for beam to be handbreadth wide? is not dealing with matters of rabbinic law. Rather, of that are written but whose measure is not explicit
llm_translation: And there is one who says regarding a beam that is one handbreadth wide, the Rabbis do not establish it except based on their tradition, and not based on their explanations of their measurements.

hebrew_text: יתיב רב יצחק בר שמואל בר מרתא קמיה דרב כהנא ויתיב וקאמר אמר רב יהודה אמר רב כל שלשה ימים הראשונים תולין את השליא בולד מכאן ואילך חוששין לולד אחר
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta sat before Rav Kahana, and he sat and said Rav Yehuda says Rav says: all of the first three days we attribute the afterbirth to offspring. From this forward, we are concerned that another offspring
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Yitzchak son of Shmuel son of Marta before Rav Kahana and sitting and saying said Rav Yehudah said Rav all three days the first hanging the placenta born from here and onwards concerned for another placenta.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ומי אמר רב הכי והאמר רב אין הולד מתעכב אחר חבירו כלום אישתיק אמר ליה דלמא כאן בנפל כאן בבן קיימא
human_translation: said to And did Rav say this? But didn’t Rav say an offspring does not remain at all after another was silent. said to him: Perhaps here, to a non-viable newborn, there, to a viable
llm_translation: He said to him, "Did Rav really say so?" But didn't Rav say, "A fetus does not delay after its fellow at all?" He remained silent. He said to him, "Perhaps here it is a miscarriage, and there it is a viable child."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה את אמרת לשמעתתיה דרב בפירוש אמר רב הכי הפילה נפל ואחר כך הפילה שליא כל שלשה ימים תולין את השליא בולד מכאן ואילך חוששין לולד אחר ילדה ואח"כ הפילה שליא אפילו מכאן ועד עשרה ימים אין חוששין לולד אחר
human_translation: said to him: you says of Rav’s halakha Rav said this explicitly: discharged a non-viable newborn and subsequently discharged an afterbirth, all of the first three days we attribute the afterbirth to offspring. From this forward, we are concerned that another offspring. gave birth and subsequently discharged an afterbirth, even from now until ten days we are not concerned that another offspring.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Did you say to hear the teaching of Rav in explanation?" Rav said: "So it fell, and afterwards the placenta fell. For three days, the placenta hangs from the fetus. From here on, we are concerned for another fetus if she gave birth, and afterwards the placenta fell. Even from here until ten days, we are not concerned for another fetus."

hebrew_text: שמואל ותלמידי דרב ורב יהודה הוו יתבי חליף ואזיל רב יוסף בריה דרב מנשיא מדויל לאפייהו באלי ואתי אמר אתי לן גברא דרמינן ליה בגילא דחטתא ומרמי ומדחי
human_translation: Shmuel, Rav’s students, and Rav Yehuda were sitting Rav Yosef, son of Rav Menashya of D’vil, was passing and walking toward them, he was hurrying and coming said A man is coming toward us whom one can knock with a straw of wheat, and he falls and stays down.
llm_translation: Samuel and the disciples of Rav and Rav Yehudah were sitting. Halif went and Rav Yosef, son of Rav Menashe from Dhu'il, came before them with a basket of wheat. He sifted, threw, and winnowed.

hebrew_text: אדהכי אתא אמר ליה שמואל מאי אמר רב בשליא א"ל הכי אמר רב אין תולין את השליא אלא בדבר של קיימא שיילינהו שמואל לכל תלמידי דרב ואמרי ליה הכי הדר חזייה לרב יהודה בישות
human_translation: In the meantime, arrived. Shmuel said to him: What did Rav say with regard to an afterbirth? said to him this is what Rav said: One attributes an afterbirth only to a viable item, Shmuel asked all of Rav’s students and they said to him so. then looked at Rav Yehuda harshly,
llm_translation: When he came, Shmuel said to him, "What did Rav say about Shelya?" He said to him, "Rav said thus: One may not hang the Shelya except in a permanent thing." Shmuel asked all the students of Rav, and some say he showed it to Rav Yehudah the Elder.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי יוסי בן שאול מרבי המפלת דמות עורב ושליא מהו אמר ליה אין תולין אלא בדבר שיש במינו שליא
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul asked Rabbi who discharges the form of a crow and an afterbirth, what is said to him: One attributes only to an item whose species has an afterbirth.
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul from Rabbi Hamaflet: Regarding the case of a crow and a jackdaw, what is the ruling? He said to him: We only hang objects in a place where there is its own kind, a jackdaw.

hebrew_text: קשורה בו מהו אמר ליה דבר שאינו שאלת איתיביה המפלת מין בהמה חיה ועוף ושליא עמהן בזמן שהשליא קשורה עמהן אין חוששין לולד אחר אין שליא קשורה עמהן חוששין לולד אחר הריני מטיל עליהן
human_translation: tied to what is said to him: You asked a matter that does not exist. raised an objection to who discharges a type of domesticated animal, undomesticated animal, or bird, and an afterbirth with them, when afterbirth is tied to them we are not concerned about another offspring. afterbirth is not tied to them, we are concerned that another offspring. I impose upon them
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kshurah bo, mah hu? Amar lei, davar she'eino sha'altah. Itaivei, hamaflet min behemah, chayah, v'of, v'shalya imahen. B'zman shehashalya kshurah imahen, ein choshshin luled achar. Ein shalya kshurah imahen, choshshin luled achar. Hareini metil aleihen." English translation: "Tied to it, what is it? He said to him, a matter that was not asked. He responded, one who miscarries from a domestic animal, wild animal, bird, and placenta with them. When the placenta is tied with them, we are not concerned for another fetus. If the placenta is not tied with them, we are concerned for another fetus. I hereby impose upon them."

hebrew_text: חומר שני ולדות שאני אומר שמא נמוח שפיר של שליא ונמוח שליא של שפיר תיובתא
human_translation: stringency of two offspring, as I say: Perhaps gestational sac of afterbirth, disintegrated, and afterbirth of gestational sac disintegrated. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Material of two and offspring that I say perhaps will be inflated beautifully of Sheli'a and will be inflated Sheli'a of beautifully the refutation.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר שילא אמר רב מתנה אמר שמואל מעשה ותלו את השליא בולד עד עשרה ימים ולא אמרו תולין אלא בשליא הבאה אחר הולד
human_translation: Rabba bar Sheila says Rav Mattana says Shmuel says: An incident attributed the afterbirth to an offspring up to ten days And said attributes only of an afterbirth that emerges after the offspring
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Shila said in the name of Rav Mattana, who said in the name of Shmuel: A case occurred where they hanged the placenta of a newborn for ten days, and they did not say "it is hanging," except for a placenta that came after the birth.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן מעשה ותלו את השליא בולד עד כ"ג ימים אמר ליה רב יוסף עד כ"ד אמרת לן
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: an incident attributed the afterbirth to an offspring up to twenty-three days Rav Yosef said to him You said to us up to twenty-four
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A case occurred where she hung the placenta of the fetus for twenty-three days. Rav Yosef said to him: You said to us until twenty-four.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אחא בריה דרב עוירא א"ר יצחק מעשה ונשתהה הולד אחר חבירו ל"ג יום א"ל רב יוסף ל"ד אמרת לן
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avira, says Rabbi Yitzḥak says: an incident and offspring remained thirty-three days after the other Rav Yosef said to him: You said to us thirty-four
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rav Avira, said: Rabbi Yitzchak said, "It happened that one fetus was delayed after its fellow by thirty days." Rav Yosef said to us, "You have said to us."

hebrew_text: הניחא למאן דאמר יולדת לתשעה יולדת למקוטעין משכחת לה אחד נגמרה צורתו לסוף שבעה ואחד נגמרה צורתו לתחלת תשעה אלא למ"ד יולדת לתשעה אינה יולדת למקוטעין מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says gives birth in ninth she can give birth prematurely You find the form of one was completed at the end of the seventh and the form of one was completed at the beginning of the ninth But according to the one who says gives birth in ninth cannot give birth prematurely, what is there to say?
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says a woman giving birth to nine months gives birth to a fully formed child after seven months, and one who gives birth to a child after nine months gives birth to a child with missing limbs. What can be said according to the one who says a woman giving birth to nine months does not give birth to a child with missing limbs?

hebrew_text: איפוך שמעתתא ל"ג לשליא כ"ג לולד
human_translation: reverse the statements: thirty-three with regard to an afterbirth twenty-three with regard to offspring
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "Opposite, the hearing to thirty for the basket, twenty-three for the fetus."

hebrew_text: א"ר אבין בר רב אדא אמר רב מנחם איש כפר שערים ואמרי לה בית שערים מעשה ונשתהה ולד אחד אחר חבירו ג' חדשים והרי הם יושבים לפנינו בבית המדרש ומאן נינהו יהודה וחזקיה בני רבי חייא
human_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Rav Adda says Rav Menaḥem of the village of She’arim, and some say Beit She’arim, says: An incident one offspring remained after the other three months, and are sitting before us in the study hall. And who are they? Yehuda and Ḥizkiyya, the sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Rav Adda said, Rav Menachem of Kfar Sha'arim said, and some say it was Beit Sha'arim: There was an incident where one man married the wife of his fellow after three months, and they were sitting before us in the study hall. Who were they? Yehudah and Chizkiyah, the sons of Rabbi Chiya.

hebrew_text: והא אמר מר אין אשה מתעברת וחוזרת ומתעברת אמר אביי טיפה אחת היתה ונתחלקה לשתים אחד נגמרה צורתו בתחלת ז' ואחד בסוף ט'
human_translation: But didn’t the Master say a woman cannot become pregnant and again become pregnant Abaye says: it was one drop and it split into two. The form of one was completed at the beginning of the seventh and one at the end of the ninth
llm_translation: And behold, the Master said: A woman does not conceive and then miscarry and conceive again. Abaye said: It was a single drop that divided into two. One completed its form in the beginning of the seventh month, and the other at the end of the ninth month.

hebrew_text: שליא בבית הבית טמא תנו רבנן שליא בבית הבית טמא לא שהשליא ולד אלא שאין שליא שאין ולד עמה דברי רבי מאיר רבי יוסי ורבי יהודה ורבי שמעון מטהרין
human_translation: an afterbirth in the house, the house is impure The Sages taught an afterbirth in the house, the house is impure. not that the an afterbirth an offspring; rather, that there is no afterbirth without an offspring, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon deem pure.
llm_translation: The upper chamber in the house is impure. The Sages taught: The upper chamber in the house is impure, not because the upper chamber itself gave birth, but rather because there is no upper chamber that does not have offspring with it. These are the words of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Shimon who declare it pure.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לרבי מאיר אי אתה מודה שאם הוציאוהו בספל לבית החיצון שהוא טהור אמר להן אבל ולמה לפי שאינו
human_translation: said to Rabbi Meir: Do you not concede that if removed to the outer room in a basin, that is pure? said to them Indeed, but why Because does not exist
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Meir: If you admit that if they took it out in a basket to the outer courtyard, it is pure, he said to them: But why? Because it is not.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו כשם שאינו בבית החיצון כך אינו בבית הפנימי אמר להן אינו דומה נמוק פעם אחת לנמוק ב' פעמים
human_translation: said to him: Just as does not exist to the outer room, so too, it does not exist in the inner room said to them: disintegrated once, is not comparable to disintegrated twice,
llm_translation: They said to him, just as he is not in the outer chamber, so he is not in the inner chamber. He said to them, "A blemish is not comparable once to a blemish twice."

hebrew_text: יתיב רב פפא אחורי דרב ביבי קמיה דרב המנונא ויתיב וקאמר מאי טעמא דרבי שמעון קסבר כל טומאה שנתערב בה ממין אחר בטלה
human_translation: Rav Pappa sat behind Rav Beivai before Rav Hamnuna, and he sat and said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon, He holds any ritual impurity with which was mixed of another type, is nullified
llm_translation: Rav Papa sat behind Rav Bibi before Rav Hamnuna, and he sat and said, "What is the reason that Rabbi Shimon holds that any impurity that becomes mixed with another species becomes nullified."

hebrew_text: אמר להו רב פפא היינו נמי טעמייהו דרבי יהודה ורבי יוסי אחיכו עליה מאי שנא פשיטא
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to This is also the reason of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei, laughed at him: What is different obvious
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Papa: This is also the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei, his brothers. What is the difference? It is obvious.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא אפילו כי הא מילתא לימא איניש ולא נשתוק קמיה רביה משום שנאמר (משלי ל, לב) אם נבלת בהתנשא ואם זמות יד לפה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said A person should say a matter even as this and one should not be silent in the presence of his teacher, because it is stated: “If you have done foolishly in lifting up yourself, or if you have planned devices [ zammota ], lay your hand over your mouth”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even if a matter one should say, a person should not remain silent before his teacher, as it is stated (Proverbs 30:32), "If you have been foolish in exalting yourself, or if you have devised evil, put your hand over your mouth."

hebrew_text: ואזדא רבי שמעון לטעמיה דתניא מלא תרוד רקב שנפל לתוכו עפר כל שהו טמא ורבי שמעון מטהר
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon follows his reasoning, as it is taught a ladleful [ melo tarvad ] of dust into which any amount of dirt fell, impure; and Rabbi Shimon deems pure.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon went according to his reasoning, as it is taught in a Baraita: "If a vessel is filled with rot, and dirt falls into it, any amount of dirt renders it impure, and Rabbi Shimon declares it pure."

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דרבי שמעון אמר רבה אשכחתינהו לרבנן דבי רב דיתבי וקאמרי אי אפשר שלא ירבו שתי פרידות עפר על פרידה אחת של רקב וחסיר ליה
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? Rabba said: I found the Sages of the study hall of Rav sitting and saying: it is impossible for not to be two grains of dirt more than one grain of dust And is insufficient
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's statement? Rabah said: I found the sages of the house of Rav sitting and saying, "It is impossible that two handfuls of dust will not increase upon one handful of decay, and diminish it."

hebrew_text: ואמינא להו אדרבה א"א שלא ירבו שתי פרידות רקב על
human_translation: And I said to them: On the contrary, it is impossible for not to be two grains of dust more than
llm_translation: And I said to them, on the contrary, it is impossible that two separate decays should not multiply upon...

hebrew_text: פרידה אחת עפר (ונפיל) ליה שיעורא
human_translation: one grain of dirt and the measure increases.
llm_translation: One cow's worth of dust (and it fell) to him a measure.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבה היינו טעמא דרבי שמעון סופו כתחלתו מה תחלתו נעשה לו דבר אחר גנגילון אף סופו נעשה לו דבר אחר גנגילון
human_translation: Rather, Rabba said this is the reason of Rabbi Shimon: its ultimate state is like its initial state Just as its initial state, another matter serves as a nullification [ gangilon ] of so too, ultimate state another matter serves as a nullification of
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbah said: This is the reason of Rabbi Shimon: Just as his beginning is transformed into something else, so too his end is transformed into something else.

hebrew_text: מאי היא דתניא איזהו מת שיש לו רקב ואיזהו מת שאין לו רקב נקבר ערום בארון של שיש או ע"ג רצפה של אבנים זהו מת שיש לו רקב
human_translation: What is As it is taught Which is a corpse that has dust, and which is a corpse that does not have dust? was buried naked in a marble coffin or on a stone floor, that is a corpse that has dust
llm_translation: What is it that is taught: Which corpse has decay and which corpse does not have decay? Buried naked in a marble coffin or on a stone floor - this is a corpse that has decay.

hebrew_text: ואיזהו מת שאין לו רקב נקבר בכסותו או בארון של עץ או ע"ג רצפה של לבנים זהו מת שאין לו רקב ולא אמרו רקב אלא למת בלבד למעוטי הרוג דלא
human_translation: And what is a corpse that does not have dust? was buried in its cloak, or in a wooden coffin, or on a brick floor, that is a corpse that does not have dust And said dust only with regard to died excluding one who was killed, whose is not
llm_translation: And which is a corpse that does not have decay, is buried in his garment or in a wooden coffin or on a stone floor, this is a corpse that does not have decay. And they did not say decay except for a corpse alone, to exclude one who was killed, for he does not.

hebrew_text: גופא מלא תרוד רקב שנפל לתוכו עפר כל שהוא טמא ור' שמעון מטהר מלא תרוד רקב שנתפזר בבית הבית טמא ורבי שמעון מטהר
human_translation: the itself, a ladleful of dust into which any amount of dirt fell, is impure; and Rabbi Shimon deems pure. a ladleful of dust that was scattered in the house, the house is impure. And Rabbi Shimon deems pure.
llm_translation: The body itself full of rot that fell into it dust any that is impure and Rabbi Shimon purifies the body itself full of rot that scattered in the house impure and Rabbi Shimon purifies.

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי אשמעינן קמייתא בההיא קאמרי רבנן משום דמכניף אבל נתפזר אימא מודו לו לרבי שמעון דאין מאהיל וחוזר ומאהיל
human_translation: And it is necessary As, if taught us the first in that the Rabbis say because concentrated but was scattered, say concede to Rabbi Shimon that that overlies and also overlies is not
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear the first part of what the Rabbis said, that they said it because he is being deceitful, but if he scattered the produce, say that Rabbi Shimon agrees that it does not become susceptible to ritual impurity and then becomes susceptible again.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן בהא בהא אמר רבי שמעון דאין מאהיל וחוזר ומאהיל אבל בהא אימא מודה להו לרבנן צריכא
human_translation: And if taught us with regard to this in this Rabbi Shimon says as overlies and also overlies is not But in that say concedes to the Rabbis necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear in this, in this, Rabbi Shimon said: "He does not feed and then feed again, but in this case, say he concedes to the Rabbis, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: תניא אידך מלא תרוד ועוד עפר בית הקברות טמא ורבי שמעון מטהר מאי טעמייהו דרבנן לפי שא"א למלא תרוד ועוד עפר בית הקברות שאין בו מלא תרוד רקב
