human_translation: is taught another a ladleful of dirt from a cemetery and more, is impure; and Rabbi Shimon deems pure. What is the reason of the Rabbis? as it is impossible for more than a ladleful of dirt from a cemetery not to contain a ladleful of dust
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: "If there is a full 'Tard' and furthermore dust in the cemetery, it is impure. But Rabbi Shimon declares it pure. What is the reason of the Rabbis? Because it is impossible to have a full 'Tard' and furthermore dust in the cemetery, as there is no 'Tard' except decay."

hebrew_text: השתא דאמרת טעמא דרבי שמעון משום סופו כתחלתו גבי שליא מאי טעמא אמר רבי יוחנן משום בטול ברוב נגעו בה
human_translation: Now that you say the reason that Rabbi Shimon that its ultimate state is like its initial state with regard to an afterbirth what is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan says: touched upon it, due to nullification by majority
llm_translation: At this time, when you said the reason of Rabbi Shimon is because its end is like its beginning regarding a shellfish, what is the reason? Rabbi Yochanan said because it is nullified by the majority of its touch.

hebrew_text: ואזדא רבי יוחנן לטעמיה דאמר רבי יוחנן רבי שמעון ור"א בן יעקב אמרו דבר אחד רבי שמעון הא דאמרן רבי אליעזר דתניא רבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר בהמה גסה ששפעה חררת דם הרי זו תקבר ופטורה מן הבכורה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov said the same thing, Rabbi Shimon that which we said, Rabbi Eliezer which is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: a large animal that expelled a mass of blood, that must be buried, and is exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan went according to his reasoning, as Rabbi Yochanan said, Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said one thing. Rabbi Shimon, as we said, Rabbi Eliezer said, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, "An animal that is large, whose blood has congealed, it shall be buried and exempt from the firstborn."

hebrew_text: ותני רבי חייא עלה אינה מטמאה לא במגע ולא במשא ומאחר שאינה מטמאה לא במגע ולא במשא אמאי תקבר כדי לפרסמה שהיא פטורה מן הבכורה
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches with regard to that does not impart ritual impurity, neither through contact nor through carrying But since does not impart impurity, neither through contact nor through carrying, why buried? in order to publicize that is exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya taught: A pregnant woman who ascends does not render impure through contact or carrying. And since she does not render impure through contact or carrying, why should she be buried? In order to publicize her exemption from the obligation of the firstborn.

hebrew_text: אלמא ולד מעליא הוא ואמאי תני רבי חייא אינה מטמאה לא במגע ולא במשא אמר רבי יוחנן משום בטול ברוב נגעו בה
human_translation: evidently is a full-fledged offspring. But why does Rabbi Ḥiyya teach it does not impart impurity, neither through contact nor through carrying? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: due to nullification in a majority touched upon it,
llm_translation: The son of a high priest is considered a high priest, and why did Rabbi Chiya teach that she does not render impure through contact or carrying? Rabbi Yochanan said it is due to the majority of his blemish being removed.

hebrew_text: א"ר אמי אמר רבי יוחנן ומודה רבי שמעון שאמו טמאה לידה
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And Rabbi Shimon concedes that its mother is impure childbirth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ami said, Rabbi Yochanan said, and Rabbi Shimon agrees that his mother is impure due to childbirth.

hebrew_text: אמר ההוא סבא לרבי אמי אסברא לך טעמא דרבי יוחנן דאמר קרא (ויקרא יב, ב) אשה כי תזריע וילדה זכר וגו' אפילו לא ילדה אלא כעין שהזריעה טמאה לידה
human_translation: A certain elder said to Rabbi Ami: I will explain to you the reason of Rabbi Yoḥanan. As the verse states: “If a woman bears seed and gives birth to a male, even gives birth to similar only to the seed that she bore, impure childbirth.
llm_translation: The elder said to Rabbi Ami: I will explain to you the reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan, who said: The verse states (Leviticus 12:2), "When a woman conceives and gives birth to a male child, etc." Even if she did not give birth, but only conceived, it is considered as if she gave birth in terms of the impurity of childbirth.

hebrew_text: ריש לקיש אמר שפיר שטרפוהו במימיו נעשה כמת שנתבלבלה צורתו
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: a gestational sac, that was mashed in its fluid it is rendered like a corpse that was deformed,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "It is good, they burned it in its own waters, its form became confused like a corpse."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי יוחנן לריש לקיש מת שנתבלבלה צורתו מנלן דטהור אילימא מהא דאמר רבי שבתאי אמר ר' יצחק מגדלאה ואמרי לה א"ר יצחק מגדלאה א"ר שבתאי מת שנשרף ושלדו קיימת טמא מעשה היה וטמאו לו פתחים גדולים
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Reish Lakish: From where do we that a corpse that was deformed is pure? If we say from that which Rabbi Shabbtai says Rabbi Yitzḥak from Migdal [ Migdala’a ] says, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak from Migdal says Rabbi Shabbtai says, a corpse that was burned but its form [ veshildo ] exists, is impure. There was an incident and deemed impure large openings
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said to Reish Lakish: "If a corpse became mixed up, how do we know that it is pure? If you say from what Rabbi Shabbatai said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak of Magdala, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak of Magdala in the name of Rabbi Shabbatai: A corpse that was burned, and its form remains, it is impure. This was a case, and they made for him large openings."

hebrew_text: וטהרו לו פתחים קטנים וקא דייקת מינה טעמא דשלדו קיימת הא לאו הכי טהור
human_translation: But they deemed pure small openings And you infer from the reason that the form of exists; but otherwise, pure.
llm_translation: And they declared for him small openings, and he was examining from it the taste of the fish, it stands, this is not so, pure.

hebrew_text: אדרבה דוק מינה להאי גיסא שלדו קיימת הוא דטהרו לו פתחים קטנים הא לאו הכי פתחים קטנים נמי טמאין דכל חד וחד חזי לאפוקי חד חד אבר
human_translation: On the contrary, infer from in manner: It is the form of exists that deemed pure small openings but otherwise, small openings are also impure, as each and every one is fit for taking out each limb one one.
llm_translation: On the contrary, infer from this case that the bone of this sinew is intact, for if small openings were made for him, are they not small openings? Small openings are also impure, for each and every one can be distinguished separately.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבינא לרב אשי ר' יוחנן דאמר כמאן כר' אליעזר דתנן אפר שרופין ר"א אומר שיעור' ברובע
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: In accordance with whose did Rabbi Yoḥanan say in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned the ashes of burned Rabbi Eliezer says its measure for quarter
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of whom? Like Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned in a Mishnah: Ashes that are burned - Rabbi Eliezer says the measurement is a quarter.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי מת שנשרף ושלדו קיימת אמר אביי כגון ששרפו על גבי קטבלא רבא אמר כגון ששרפו על גבי אפודרים רבינא אמר כגון דאיחרכי אחרוכי
human_translation: What are the circumstances a corpse that was burned but its form exists? Abaye says: where burned on top of leather spread [ katavla ], Rava says: where burned on top of a marble slate [ apoderim ]. Ravina says: where was charred
llm_translation: How is the case of a dead body that was burned, yet its bones remain? Abaye said: Such as when they burned it on a lime pit. Rava said: Such as when they burned it on planks. Ravina said: Such as when it becomes blackened.

hebrew_text: ת"ר המפלת יד חתוכה ורגל חתוכה אמו טמאה לידה ואין חוששין שמא מגוף אטום באו
human_translation: The Sages taught who discharges a shaped hand, or a shaped foot, its mother is impure childbirth, And we are not concerned perhaps they came from a sealed, body,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who has a severed hand or a severed foot, his mother is impure for childbirth, and we are not concerned that perhaps they came from a sealed body.

hebrew_text: רב חסדא ורבה בר רב הונא דאמרי תרוייהו אין נותנין לה ימי טוהר מ"ט אימא הרחיקה לידתה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna both say: we do not give her days of purity What is the reason? say her childbirth was distant,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna both say: We do not give her the days of purity. What is the reason? Say: She has distanced her childbirth.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב יוסף המפלת ואין ידוע מה הפילה תשב לזכר ולנקבה ואי ס"ד כל כהאי גוונא אימא הרחיקה לידתה לתני ולנדה
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises an objection who discharges and it is not known what she discharged, she shall observe to a male and to a female. And if it enters your mind any case like this say childbirth was distant, let teach and of a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: A question was raised by Rav Yosef: If a woman miscarries and it is not known what she miscarried, shall she sit for both a male and a female, and if you will say in such a case, say that she should distance her childbirth and her menstruation.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אי תנא לנדה הוה אמינא מביאה קרבן ואינו נאכל קמ"ל דנאכל
human_translation: Abaye says If taught of a menstruating woman, I would say she brings an offering but it is not eaten teaches us that is eaten.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: If a Tanna taught regarding a menstruating woman, I would say he brings a sacrifice and it is not eaten. This teaches us that it is eaten.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא הוציא עובר את ידו והחזירה אמו טמאה לידה שנאמר (בראשית לח, כח) ויהי בלדתה ויתן יד
human_translation: Rav Huna says: a fetus extended its hand out and returned it, its mother is impure as it is stated “And it happened when she gave birth that one put out a hand
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: "He brought out a limb, and then returned it, his mother is ritually impure due to childbirth, as it is stated (Genesis 38:28), 'And it came to pass, when she travailed, that one put out a hand.'"

hebrew_text: מתיב רב יהודה הוציא עובר את ידו אין אמו חוששת לכל דבר אמר רב נחמן לדידי מיפרשא לי מיניה דרב הונא לחוש חוששת ימי טוהר לא יהבינן לה עד דנפיק רוביה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda raises an objection a fetus extended its hand out its mother not be concerned with regard to any matter. Rav Naḥman says was explained to me by Rav Huna With regard to being concerned concerned, we do not give her days of purity until most of emerges.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yehudah raised a dilemma: If a fetus extends its hand, its mother is not concerned about anything. Rav Nachman said: According to me, I am explained from the statement of Rav Huna that she should be concerned; we do not give her the status of a woman who is pure until the majority of the fetus emerges.

hebrew_text: והא אין אמו חוששת לכל דבר קאמר אמר אביי אינה חוששת לכל דבר מדאורייתא אבל מדרבנן חוששת והא קרא קאמר מדרבנן וקרא אסמכתא בעלמא
human_translation: But doesn’t say its mother not be concerned with regard to any matter? Abaye says: not be concerned with regard to any matter by Torah law; but by rabbinic law concerned, But doesn’t cite a verse by rabbinic law, and the verse is mere support
llm_translation: And behold, his mother is not concerned about anything. This is what Abaye said: She is not concerned about anything from the Torah, but she is concerned about things from rabbinic law. But isn't the verse speaking about rabbinic law? And the verse is just a mere support.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המפלת טומטום ואנדרוגינוס תשב לזכר ולנקבה
human_translation: who discharges a tumtum , or a hermaphrodite [ ve’androginos ], shall observe to a male and to a female.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who is born with ambiguous genitalia or with both male and female characteristics shall be classified as both male and female.

hebrew_text: טומטום וזכר אנדרוגינוס וזכר תשב לזכר ולנקבה טומטום ונקבה אנדרוגינוס ונקבה תשב לנקבה בלבד
human_translation: a tumtum and a male, a hermaphrodite and a male, she observes to a male and to a female. a tumtum and a female, a hermaphrodite and a female, she shall observe for a female alone.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tumtum and zachar, androgynous and zachar, tashav to zachar and to nekevah, tumtum and nekevah, androgynous and nekevah, tashav to nekevah only."

hebrew_text: יצא מחותך או מסורס משיצא רובו הרי הוא כילוד יצא כדרכו עד שיצא רוב ראשו ואיזהו רוב ראשו משיצא פדחתו
human_translation: emerged in pieces, or reversed, when most of its emerge, is like born, emerged in usual manner, until most of its head emerges. And what is most of its head? from when its forehead emerges.
llm_translation: He went out cut or castrated, from when he goes out his majority, behold he is like a newborn. He goes out in his usual way until his majority of his head goes out, and what is considered the majority of his head? When his temple goes out.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ השתא טומטום לחודיה ואנדרוגינוס לחודיה אמר תשב לזכר ולנקבה טומטום וזכר אנדרוגינוס וזכר מיבעיא
human_translation: Now a tumtum alone, or a hermaphrodite alone, states she shall observe to a male and to a female, is it necessary a tumtum and a male, a hermaphrodite and a male,
llm_translation: Gemara: Now, a Tumtum by itself, and an Androgynos by itself, he said, "Sit for male and female, Tumtum, and male Androgynos, and male is needed."

hebrew_text: איצטריך מהו דתימ' הואיל וא"ר יצחק אשה מזרעת תחל' יולדת זכר איש מזריע תחלה יולדת נקבה אימא מדהאי זכר האי נמי זכר קמ"ל אימא שניהם הזריעו בבת אחת זו זכר וזה נקבה
human_translation: It was necessary lest you say since Rabbi Yitzḥak says woman emits seed first she gives birth to a male, man emits seed first she gives birth to a female, say since this is male, that is also male. teaches us say both emitted seed at the same time, this is male and that is female.
llm_translation: It is necessary, what is it? Say: Since Rabbi Yitzchak said, "A woman from whose seed the conception begins gives birth to a male; a man from whose seed the conception begins gives birth to a female." Say: From this teaching - if this one is male, this one is also male - it teaches us to say: Both of them impregnated her at the same time; this one is male and this one is female.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"נ אמר רב טומטום ואנדרוגינוס שראו לובן או אודם אין חייבין על ביאת מקדש ואין שורפין עליהם את התרומה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rav says: a tumtum and a hermaphrodite who saw a white or a red they are not liable for entering the Temple And one does not burn the teruma due to their
llm_translation: Said Rav Nahman, said Rav: A tumtum and an androgynous, if they are seen as white or red, are not obligated for the entry into the Temple, and one does not burn the terumah for them.

hebrew_text: ראו לובן ואודם כאחד אין חייבין על ביאת מקדש אבל שורפין עליהם את התרומה שנאמר (במדבר ה׳:ג׳ ) מזכר ועד נקבה
human_translation: saw white and red as one, they are not liable for entering the Temple, but one does burn teruma due to their that it is stated: “Both male and female
llm_translation: See white and red as one not liable on the entry of the Temple but burn upon them the heave offering as it is stated (Numbers 5:3) male and female.

hebrew_text: תשלחו זכר ודאי נקבה ודאית ולא טומטום ואנדרוגינוס .
human_translation: you shall send out, a definite male a definite female but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite.
llm_translation: You shall send a male for sure, and a female for sure, and not an androgynous or a tumtum.

hebrew_text: לימא מסייע ליה טומטום ואנדרוגינוס שראו לובן או אודם אין חייבין על ביאת מקדש ואין שורפין עליהם את התרומה ראו לובן ואודם כאחת אין חייבין על ביאת מקדש אבל שורפין עליהם את התרומה
human_translation: Let us say supports a tumtum and a hermaphrodite who saw white or red they are not liable for entering the Temple and one does not burn the teruma due to their saw white and red as one, they are not liable for entering the Temple, but one burns teruma due to their
llm_translation: Let us say: A hermaphrodite and an androgynous, if they appear white or red, they are not obligated for the Temple entry, and we do not burn the terumah for them. If they appear both white and red, they are not obligated for the Temple entry, but we burn the terumah for them.

hebrew_text: מ"ט לאו משום שנאמר (במדבר ה, ג) מזכר ועד נקבה תשלחו זכר ודאי נקבה ודאית ולא טומטום ואנדרוגינוס אמר עולא לא הא מני ר' אליעזר היא
human_translation: What is the reason not because it is stated “Both male and female you shall send out,” a definite male a definite female but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite? Ulla says: No, whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Why not? Because it is stated (Numbers 5:3), "male and female you shall send them out." Male - certainly; female - certainly; but not an androgynous or a tumtum. Androgynous said Ula: This is not in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: דתנן רבי אליעזר אומר השרץ (ויקרא ה, ב) ונעלם ממנו על העלם שרץ הוא חייב ואינו חייב על העלם מקדש
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: creeping animal, and it is hidden from him” if a lapse of awareness a creeping animal, liable but he is not liable for a lapse of awareness Temple
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says, "The creeping thing (Leviticus 5:2) 'and it be hidden from him' - regarding a hidden creeping thing, one is liable and not liable for a hidden creeping thing in the Temple."

hebrew_text: רבי עקיבא אומר ונעלם ממנו והוא טמא על העלם טומאה הוא חייב ואינו חייב על העלם מקדש
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says “And it is hidden from him, so that he is impure” for a lapse of awareness ritual impurity, liable but is not liable for a lapse of awareness Temple
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says, "And it is hidden from him, and he is impure, regarding hidden impurity he is liable, and he is not liable regarding the hidden Temple."

hebrew_text: ואמרינן מאי בינייהו ואמר חזקיה שרץ ונבלה איכא בינייהו דרבי אליעזר סבר בעינן עד דידע אי בשרץ איטמי אי בנבילה איטמי ור' עקיבא סבר לא בעינן
human_translation: And we say What between And Ḥizkiyya says: There is between them a creeping animal or the carcass of an unslaughtered animal. As Rabbi Eliezer holds we require that he know whether he contracted impurity from a creeping animal whether he contracted impurity from an unslaughtered animal carcass, And Rabbi Akiva holds we do not require
llm_translation: And we say, what is the difference between them? And Hezekiah said, there is a difference between a creeping thing and a carcass. There is a difference between them. Rabbi Eliezer holds that we require until one knows whether it is a creeping thing or a carcass. And Rabbi Akiva holds that we do not require.

hebrew_text: לאו אמר רבי אליעזר התם בעינן דידע אי בשרץ איטמי אי בנבלה איטמי הכא נמי בעינן דידע אי בלובן איטמי אי באודם איטמי
human_translation: Doesn’t Rabbi Eliezer say there, we require if he knew whether he contracted impurity from a creeping animal whether he contracted impurity from an unslaughtered animal carcass? Here, too, we require if he knew whether he became impure due to white whether he became impure due to red
llm_translation: Not said Rabbi Eliezer there we require that he knows whether it is a creeping thing impure or a carcass impure here too we require that he knows whether it is white impure or red impure

hebrew_text: אבל לרבי עקיבא דאמר משום טומאה מיחייב הכא נמי משום טומאה מיחייב
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Akiva, who said is obligated due to impurity here too, he is obligated due to impurity,
llm_translation: But according to Rabbi Akiva who said in the name of impurity is obligated here also because of impurity is obligated.

hebrew_text: ורב מאי שנא ביאת מקדש דלא דכתיב מזכר ועד נקבה תשלחו זכר ודאי נקבה ודאית ולא טומטום ואנדרוגינוס
human_translation: And Rav, what is different entering the Temple, which not that it is written: “Both male and female you shall send out,” a definite male a definite female but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite.
llm_translation: And Rav, what is the difference in the case of entering the Temple, for it is not as it is written, "From male to female you shall send them away"? Male is certainly male, and female is certainly female, and not an androgynous or a tumtum.

hebrew_text: אי הכי תרומה נמי לא נשרוף דכתיב (ויקרא טו, לג) והזב את זובו לזכר ולנקבה זכר ודאי נקבה ודאית ולא טומטום ואנדרוגינוס
human_translation: If so, we should not burn teruma as it is written and they who have an issue, whether a male or a female” a definite male a definite female, but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite.
llm_translation: If so, terumah also is not burned, as it is written (Leviticus 15:33), "And he shall burn his discharge for the male and for the female." Male is certainly male, female is certainly female, and not an androgynous or hermaphrodite.

hebrew_text: ההוא מבעי ליה לכדרבי יצחק דאמר רבי יצחק לזכר לרבות את המצורע למעינותיו ולנקבה לרבות את המצורעת למעינותיה
human_translation: That is necessary for of Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak said: “whether a male” to include a male leper with regard to the sources of his “or a female” to include a female with regard to the sources of her
llm_translation: That one asked according to Rabbi Yitzchak, for Rabbi Yitzchak said: "To the male, to include the metzora for his sources, and to the female, to include the metzoraet for her sources."

hebrew_text: האי נמי מבעי ליה במי שיש לו טהרה במקוה פרט לכלי חרס דברי רבי יוסי
human_translation: This is also necessary to one that has purity in a ritual bath; this excludes earthenware vessel, the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: This also requires in one who has purity in the mikveh, except for earthenware vessels, the words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אם כן נכתוב רחמנא אדם
human_translation: If so, let the Merciful One write: person
llm_translation: If so, let us write "a person," the Merciful One.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא אי כתב רחמנא אדם הוה אמינא כלי מתכות לא מכל טמא לנפש נפקא זכר ונקבה למה לי לכדרב
human_translation: And if you would say if the Merciful One had written: person I would say metal vessels not is derived from whatever is impure by the dead” why do I “Both male and female for of Rav.
llm_translation: And if you will say, if the Merciful One had written, I would have said: A metal vessel does not contract impurity for a soul. It emerges: male and female, why do I need it according to Rav.

hebrew_text: ואימא כוליה לכדרב הוא דאתא אם כן נכתוב זכר ונקבה מאי מזכר ועד נקבה עד כל דבר שיש לו טהרה במקוה
human_translation: But say the entire comes for Rav’s If so, let write: Male and female. What “Both male and female”? to any item that has purity by a ritual bath;
llm_translation: And say all according to Rav, he who came. If so, it should be written "male and female." What is "male" and "female"? From male to female, including anything that has purity in the mikveh.

hebrew_text: אי הכי כי איטמי בשאר טומאות לא לישלחו אמר קרא מזכר מטומאה הפורשת מן הזכר
human_translation: If so, when they become impure with other types of impurity, should not be sent out The verse states: “Both male,” to impurity that is emitted from the male
llm_translation: If so, when he becomes impure with other impurities, they should not send him. The verse says, "Male from impurity he shall separate."

hebrew_text: וכל היכא דכתיב מזכר עד נקבה למעוטי טומטום ואנדרוגינוס הוא דאתא והא גבי ערכין דכתיב (ויקרא כז ) הזכר
human_translation: And anywhere that “both male and female” is written comes to exclude a tumtum and a hermaphrodite? But isn’t with regard to valuations, as it is written: the male…
llm_translation: And wherever it is written "male" until "female" to exclude the androgynous and the tumtum. This is what came to be discussed. And regarding evaluations, where it is written (Leviticus 27) "the male."

hebrew_text: ותניא הזכר ולא טומטום ואנדרוגינוס יכול לא יהא בערך איש אבל יהא בערך אשה תלמוד לומר הזכר ואם נקבה זכר ודאי נקבה ודאית ולא טומטום ואנדרוגינוס
human_translation: And it is taught “the male”: But not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite. might shall not be according to the valuation of a man, but shall be according to the valuation of a woman, the verse states: “The male,” “And if she is a female,” a definite male a definite female, but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Male" and not "Androgynous," and an Androgynous can be neither considered a man nor a woman, but should be considered a woman. It is derived from the verse, "male" - and if it is female, it is certainly female, and not Androgynous.

hebrew_text: טעמא דכתיב הזכר ואם נקבה הא מזכר ונקבה לא ממעט ההוא מבעי ליה
human_translation: The reason that it is written: “The male…and if she is a female,” that Male and female, not excludes that necessary
llm_translation: The reason for it is as it is written: "male" - and if it is female, is it male? It is not less than that which is required.

hebrew_text: לחלק בין ערך איש לערך אשה
human_translation: to differentiate between the valuation of a man and the valuation of a woman.
llm_translation: To divide between the value of a man and the value of a woman.

hebrew_text: יצא מחותך או מסורס וכו' א"ר אלעזר אפילו הראש עמהן
human_translation: emerged in pieces, or reversed, Rabbi Elazar says: Even the head is among
llm_translation: He went out mutilated or emasculated, etc. Rabbi Elazar said: Even the head is with them.

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן אמר לא שנו אלא שאין הראש עמהן אבל הראש עמהן הראש פוטר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They taught only where the head is not among but the head is among them, the head exempts
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: They only taught that when the head is not with them, but if the head is with them, the head exempts.

hebrew_text: לימא בדשמואל קמיפלגי דאמר שמואל אין הראש פוטר בנפלים
human_translation: Shall we say disagree with regard to of Shmuel? As Shmuel said the head does not exempt in non-viable newborns,
llm_translation: Let us say according to Shmuel who disputes, for Shmuel said: "The head does not exempt in the case of miscarriage."

hebrew_text: בשלם דכולי עלמא לא פליגי כי פליגי במחותך דמר סבר בשלם הוא דקחשיב במחותך לא קחשיב ומר סבר במחותך נמי חשיב
human_translation: in a whole everyone, agrees When they disagree, in in pieces. As Sage, holds it is in a whole that is considered with regard to in pieces is not considered and Sage, holds in in pieces as well, is considered
llm_translation: In the matter of Shalem, everyone does not disagree, for they disagree in your striking. Master holds that in the matter of Shalem it is considered, in your striking it is not considered, and Master holds that in your striking it is also considered.

hebrew_text: לישנא אחרינא טעמא דיצא מחותך או מסורס הא כתקנו הראש פוטר תרוייהו לית להו דשמואל דאמר שמואל אין הראש פוטר בנפלים
human_translation: another version The reason that it emerged in pieces, or reversed, in its proper manner, the head exempts both do not hold of Shmuel, as Shmuel said the head does not exempt in non-viable newborns.
llm_translation: Another explanation: the reason for the one who emerges from a caesarean section or a eunuch is that the head exempts them both. They do not have the opinion of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: the head does not exempt in the case of stillborn infants.

hebrew_text: איכא דמתני לה להא שמעתתא באפי נפשה א"ר אלעזר אין הראש כרוב אברים ורבי יוחנן אמר הראש כרוב אברים וקמיפלגי בדשמואל
human_translation: There are those who teach this halakha by itself, Rabbi Elazar says: the head is not like most of the limbs; and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the head is like most of the limbs. And they disagree with regard to of Shmuel;
llm_translation: There are those who taught this teaching in the presence of themselves. Rabbi Elazar said, "The head is not like the majority of limbs," and Rabbi Yochanan said, "The head is like the majority of limbs," and they argue in the opinion of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: תנן יצא מחותך או מסורס משיצא רובו הרי הוא כילוד מדקאמר מסורס מכלל דמחותך כתקנו וקאמר משיצא רובו הרי זה כילוד קשיא לרבי יוחנן
human_translation: We learned emerged in pieces or reversed, when most of its emerge, is like born. From the fact that states: Or reversed, by inference that in pieces in its proper manner, and states when most of its emerge is like born. difficult for Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: We learned: If one goes out castrated or emasculated, when his majority goes out, he is like a newborn. From the fact that it says "emasculated," does it imply that "castrated" is included? And it says, "when his majority goes out," this one is like a newborn. This is difficult for Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: אמר לך רבי יוחנן אימא יצא מחותך ומסורס
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you: Say emerged in pieces and reversed,
llm_translation: Said to you Rabbi Yochanan: Say, "He has gone out from your midst and is castrated."

hebrew_text: והא או קתני הכי קאמר יצא מחותך או שלם וזה וזה מסורס משיצא רובו הרי זה כילוד
human_translation: But doesn’t teach or this is saying: emerged in pieces or whole, and this and that reversed, when most of its emerge, is like born.
llm_translation: And this, or it teaches thus: if it came out cut or whole, and this and this is castrated, when its majority comes out, it is considered as a birth.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא כתנאי יצא מחותך או מסורס משיצא רובו הרי הוא כילוד רבי יוסי אומר משיצא כתקנו מאי קאמר
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: parallel to tanna’im , emerged in pieces or reversed, when most of its emerge is like born. Rabbi Yosei says: when it emerges in its proper manner. What is saying?
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: According to the Tannaim, if it came out cut or castrated, once its majority has emerged, it is considered a viable birth. Rabbi Yosei says: Once it emerges as its original form, what is he saying?

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא הכי קאמר יצא מחותך ומסורס משיצא רובו הרי הוא כילוד הא כתקנו הראש פוטר רבי יוסי אומר משיצא רובו כתקנו
human_translation: Rav Pappa says this is saying: emerged in pieces or reversed, when most of its emerge is like born; but in its proper manner, the head exempts Rabbi Yosei says: when most of its emerge, in its proper manner,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said thus: If it emerged cut and castrated, once its majority emerged, it is considered a newborn. This is as the head was fixed, Rabbi Yossi exempts. Rabbi Yossi says: Once its majority emerged, it is considered a newborn.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב זביד מכלל דבמסורס רובו נמי לא פוטר הא קי"ל דרובו ככולו
human_translation: Rav Zevid objects to by inference in where reversed, even most of its it does not exempt we maintain that the majority of like all
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Zevid: From the principle that in a case of a muzzled animal, its majority also does not exempt, but it is considered that its majority is like its entirety.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב זביד הכי קאמר יצא מחותך ומסורס משיצא רובו הרי זה כילוד הא כתקנו הראש פוטר רבי יוסי אומר משיצא כתקנו לחיים
human_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid says this is saying: emerged in pieces and reversed, when most of its emerge is like born; but in its proper manner the head exempts Rabbi Yosei says: when it emerges in its proper manner alive;
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said thus: If it emerged cut and castrated, once its majority has emerged, it is considered a viable birth. As the head emerges, Rabbi Yossi exempts the mother. Rabbi Yossi says: Once its head has emerged, it is destined for life.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי יצא מחותך (או) מסורס משיצא רובו הרי זה כילוד הא כתקנו הראש פוטר ר' יוסי אומר משיצא כתקנו לחיים
human_translation: This is also taught emerged in pieces reversed, when most of its emerge is like born; but in its proper manner, the head exempts Rabbi Yosei says: where it emerges in its proper manner alive.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Also thus, he is exempt if he went out castrated or emasculated, once his majority has emerged. This is like a newborn. As the head was formed, Rabbi Yossi exempts. Rabbi Yossi says: once his majority has emerged, he is exempt for life.

hebrew_text: ואיזהו כתקנו לחיים משיצא רוב ראשו ואיזהו רוב ראשו ר' יוסי אומר משיצאו צדעיו אבא חנן משום ר' יהושע אומר משיצא פדחתו וי"א משיראו קרני ראשו
human_translation: And what is in its proper manner alive When most of its head emerges. And what is most of its head Rabbi Yosei says: When its temples emerge. Abba Ḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: When its forehead emerges. And some say: When the corners of its head, are visible.
llm_translation: And which is the majority of his head for life? From when his majority of his head has emerged. And which is the majority of his head? Rabbi Yosei says: from when his sides have emerged. Abba Hanan in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua says: from when his forehead has emerged. And some say: from when his head's horns have emerged.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המפלת ואין ידוע מהו תשב לזכר ולנקבה אין ידוע אם ולד היה אם לאו תשב לזכר ולנקבה ולנדה
human_translation: who discharges and it is not known what is shall observe to a male and to a female. it is unknown whether it was offspring whether not she shall observe for a male and for a female; and for a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who miscarries, and it is not known whether it was male or female, if it was a fetus, whether or not, it is considered as both male and female and as a niddah.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ א"ר יהושע בן לוי עברה נהר והפילה מביאה קרבן ונאכל הלך אחר רוב נשים ורוב נשים ולד מעליא ילדן
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: passed across a river and she discharged she brings offering And is eaten follow the majority of women, and most women give birth to full-fledged offspring.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi crossed a river, and a woman fell into the river. He brought a sacrifice for atonement, and afterwards he ate. He followed the majority opinion of women, and the majority opinion of women is that the offspring is from the upper part of the body.

hebrew_text: תנן אין ידוע אם ולד היה תשב לזכר ולנקבה ולנדה אמאי תשב לנדה לימא הלך אחר רוב נשים ורוב נשים ולד מעליא ילדן
human_translation: We learned it is unknown whether was offspring she shall observe for a male and for a female; and for a menstruating woman. why must observe a menstruating woman? Let us say follow the majority of women, and the majority of women give birth to full-fledged offspring.
llm_translation: We have learned: If it is not known whether a child was born as a male, female, or a niddah, why did he sit for niddah? Let him say, "Follow the majority of women, and most women give birth to males."

hebrew_text: מתני' בשלא הוחזקה עוברה וכי קאמר ריב"ל כשהוחזקה עוברה
human_translation: the mishna to where had not been presumed pregnant and when Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says where had been presumed pregnant
llm_translation: Mishnah: "B'She'lo Hochzekah Uvrah, v'Chi Ka'amar Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, K'she'Hochzekah Uvrah."

hebrew_text: ת"ש בהמה שיצאה מלאה ובאה ריקנית הבא אחריו בכור מספק
human_translation: Come hear animal which went full, and came empty, that comes after it a firstborn uncertain
llm_translation: Come and hear: An animal that went out full and came back empty, if a firstborn comes after it, it is in doubt.

hebrew_text: ואמאי הלך אחר רוב בהמות ורוב בהמות ולד מעליא ילדן והאי פשוט הוא
human_translation: But why follow the majority of animals, and the majority of animals give birth to full-fledged offspring. And this is a regular
llm_translation: And why did he go after the majority of animals, and the majority of animals gave birth to a high offspring, and this is simple.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא משום דאיכא למימר רוב בהמות יולדות דבר הפוטר מבכורה ומעוטן יולדות דבר שאינו פוטר מבכורה וכל היולדות מטנפות וזו הואיל ולא טנפה אתרע לה רובא
human_translation: Ravina says because it can be said the majority of animals give birth to an item that exempts from firstborn but a minority of give birth to an item that does not exempt from firstborn And all that give birth discharge turbid liquids and since this did not discharge turbid liquids the majority is undermined.
llm_translation: Ravina said in the name of, because there is to say, most animals give birth to something that exempts from the firstborn, and a minority give birth to something that does not exempt from the firstborn, and all those that give birth are tithed, and since she did not tithe, the majority will be rejected.

hebrew_text: אי כל היולדות מטנפות הא מדלא מטנפה בכור מעליא הוא אלא אימא רוב יולדות מטנפות וזו הואיל ולא טנפה אתרע לה רובא
human_translation: If all that give birth discharge turbid liquids from that this did not discharge turbid liquids is a proper firstborn, Rather, say The majority of give birth discharge turbid liquids and since this did not discharge turbid liquids, the majority is undermined.
llm_translation: If all the women who give birth are impure, then if she did not give birth to a firstborn, she is of higher status. Rather say, most women who give birth are impure, and since she did not give birth, the majority will exempt her.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין אמר מתיב רבי יוסי ברבי חנינא טועה ולא ידענא מאי תיובתא מאי היא דתניא
human_translation: When Ravin came he said: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, raises an objection a forgetful woman; but I do not know what the objection is. what is it? As it is taught
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: "He is mistaken, and we do not know what is the refutation." What is the refutation? As it was taught:

hebrew_text: אשה שיצתה מלאה ובאה ריקנית והביאה לפנינו שלשה שבועין טהורין ועשרה שבועות אחד טמא ואחד טהור
human_translation: A woman left full, and came empty, and she spent three weeks in our presence pure, and ten weeks one impure and one pure
llm_translation: A woman who emitted a full discharge and came before us empty, and she brought before us three weeks pure and ten weeks one impure and one pure.

hebrew_text: משמשת לאור שלשים וחמש ומטבילין אותה תשעים וחמש טבילות דברי ב"ש וב"ה אומרים שלשים וחמש רבי יוסי בר' יהודה אומר דיה לטבילה שתהא באחרונה
human_translation: may engage in intercourse on the eve of the thirty-fifth And we require her to immerse ninety-five immersions. the statement of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel say thirty-five Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: it is sufficient for the immersion to be at the end
llm_translation: Serving for light thirty and five, and immerse it ninety and five, the words of Beit Shammai, and Beit Hillel say thirty and five. Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda says, the immersion should be in the end.

hebrew_text: בשלמא שבוע ראשון לא משמשת אימר יולדת זכר היא שבוע שני אימר יולדת נקבה היא
human_translation: Granted first week may not engage in intercourse say she is a woman who gave birth to a male second week say she is a woman who gave birth to a female,
llm_translation: In peace, the first week she does not serve, say, "She gives birth to a male." It is the second week, say, "She gives birth to a female."

hebrew_text: שבוע שלישי אימר יולדת נקבה בזוב היא
human_translation: third week, say she is a woman who gave birth to a female as a zava ,
llm_translation: Third week, it says: "A female who gives birth is in a state of zav."

hebrew_text: אלא שבוע רביעי אע"ג דקא חזיא דם תשמש דהא דם טהור הוא לאו משום דלא אזלינן בתר רובא
human_translation: But fourth week, even though sees blood let her engage in intercourse as it is pure blood. not due to that we do not follow the majority,
llm_translation: Rather, the fourth week, even though it appears that the blood is useful, because the blood is pure, it is not due to the fact that we do not follow the majority.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי לא ידענא מאי תיובתא אימר הרחיקה לידתה
human_translation: Rather, what I do not know what the objection is? say her birth was distant,
llm_translation: Rather, what do I not know? What is the refutation? Say, "She has distanced her childbirth."

hebrew_text: הך שבוע חמישי דטהור הוא תשמש
human_translation: this fifth week, when is pure, let her engage in intercourse
llm_translation: This fifth week is pure, it shall serve.

hebrew_text: הך שבוע רביעי כל יומא ויומא מספקין בסוף לידה ובתחלת נדה ועשרין ותמניא גופיה אימר תחלת נדה היא ובעיא למיתב שבעה לנדתה
human_translation: this fourth week, we are uncertain each and every day as the end of childbirth, and that the beginning of a menstruating woman. And twenty-eighth itself, say it is the beginning of a menstruating woman, and she is required to observe seven for her menstruation,
llm_translation: This fourth week, every day they inquire at the end of childbirth and at the beginning of menstruation, and twenty-eight days themselves, it is said, "It is the beginning of menstruation," and it is necessary to add seven for her menstruation.

hebrew_text: בעשרים וחד תשמש
human_translation: let engage in intercourse on twenty-first
llm_translation: On the twenty-first it shall serve.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון היא דאמר אסור לעשות כן שמא תבא לידי ספק לאורתא תשמש כשראתה בערב
human_translation: is Rabbi Shimon, who said it is prohibited to do so, lest she come to uncertainty. let her engage in intercourse that night, when saw in the evening,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon is the one who said: It is forbidden to do so, lest it lead to a doubt in the matter of using the light. It should be used when it is still daylight.

hebrew_text: ומטבילין אותה תשעים וחמש טבילות שבוע קמא מטבילין אותה בלילותא אימר יולדת זכר היא
human_translation: And we require to immerse ninety-five immersions. the first week she to immerse at night, say she is a woman who gave birth to a male.
llm_translation: And we immerse it ninety-five immersions. The first week we immerse it at night. It was said: "If she gives birth to a male."

hebrew_text: שבוע שני מטבילין אותה בלילותא אימר יולדת נקבה היא ביממא אימר יולדת זכר בזוב היא
human_translation: second week, she to immerse at night, say she is a woman who gave birth to a female, in the daytime, say she is a woman who gave birth to a male as a zava .
llm_translation: Second week, they immerse her at night. If she gives birth to a female during the day, they say she is a female birth. If she gives birth to a male during a discharge, she is a male birth.

hebrew_text: שבוע שלישי מטבילין לה ביממא אימר יולדת נקבה בזוב היא
human_translation: third week, she to immerse in the daytime, say she is a woman who gave birth to a female as a zava ,
llm_translation: "Third week immerse in her during the day, say: 'A female who gives birth is in a state of zavah.'"

hebrew_text: בלילותא ב"ש לטעמייהו דאמרי טבולת יום ארוך בעי טבילה
human_translation: on night Beit Shammai to their reasoning, as they say a woman who immersed that long day requires immersion
llm_translation: In the nights, Beit Shammai according to their reasons said: immersion of a long day requires immersion.

hebrew_text: מכדי ימי טהרה כמה הוו שתין ושיתא דל שבוע ג' דאטבלינן לה פשו להו שתין נכי חדא שתין נכי חדא ותלתין וה' תשעין וד' הויין תשעין וחמש מאי עבידתייהו
human_translation: Now how many days of purity are there, sixty-six Remove third week, when we require to immerse sixty less one are left. sixty-less-one and thirty-five are ninety-four ninety-five what is their purpose?
llm_translation: From when the days of purity, how many were they? Six and six of the week, three we immerse for them, they become six, one is clean, one is clean, and thirty and five, ninety-five were they, and four, what do they do?

hebrew_text: אמר רב ירמיה מדפתי כגון שבאת לפנינו בין השמשות דיהבינן לה טבילה יתירתא
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya of Difti says: where came before us, during twilight, that we give her another immersion,
llm_translation: Rav Yirmiya said: From the city of Difti, such as when she came before us between the suns, we give her an extra immersion.

hebrew_text: ולב"ה דאמרי טבולת יום ארוך לא בעי טבילה ל"ה מאי עבידתייהו
human_translation: And according to Beit Hillel, who say a woman who immersed that long day, does not require immersion thirty-five what is their purpose?
llm_translation: And in the study hall they said: "A tevul yom whose day is prolonged does not require immersion." What is the reason for this?

hebrew_text: עשרים ותמניא כדאמרן הך שבוע ה' מטבלינן כל ליליא וליליא אימר סוף נדה היא
human_translation: Twenty-eight as we said this fifth week we require to immerse each and every night, say it is the end of a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: Twenty-eight, as we said, this week we immerse every night and night, saying "it is the end of the menstrual impurity."

hebrew_text: י' שבועין למה לי בתמניא ופלגא סגי
human_translation: Why do I ten weeks eight and a half are sufficient.
llm_translation: Ten weeks, why do I need them in eight and a half?

hebrew_text: איידי דתנא פלגא דשבוע מסיק ליה ואיידי דתנא שבוע טמא תנא נמי שבוע טהור
human_translation: since teach half a week, it completes And since teaches week impure, it also taught week pure,
llm_translation: Due to the fact that one Tanna teaches about a divided oath, he concludes it, and due to the fact that another Tanna teaches about an impure oath, he also teaches about a pure oath.

hebrew_text: והאיכא טבילת זבה
human_translation: But isn’t there the immersion due to a zava ?
llm_translation: And there is immersion of a woman with a discharge.

hebrew_text: דלפני תשמיש קחשיב דלאחר תשמיש לא קחשיב
human_translation: count that before intercourse do not count that after intercourse
llm_translation: Before usage, it is considered significant; after usage, it is not considered significant.

hebrew_text: ולב"ש דחשיב דלאחר תשמיש ניחשוב נמי טבילת זבה בלידה קמיירי בזיבה לא קמיירי
human_translation: But according to Beit Shammai, who count that after intercourse let them also count immersions due to a zava . deal with childbirth; not deal with ziva .
llm_translation: And according to Beit Shammai, who deems that after intercourse one is considered impure, they also consider the immersion of a woman after childbirth as being before her menstruation, but not before her menstruation.

hebrew_text: והאיכא יולדת בזוב יולדת בזוב קחשיב זיבה גרידתא לא קחשיב
human_translation: But there are a woman who gave birth as a zava . count a woman who gave birth as a zava . do not count ziva alone.
llm_translation: And there is a woman who gives birth in a state of zov, she gives birth in a state of zov. The discharge of nidah is considered, the discharge of gidita is not considered.

hebrew_text: שבועתא קמא דאתיא לקמן ליטבלה ביומא דילמא כל יומא ויומא שלימו לה ספורים דידה
human_translation: the first week after she came before us, let immerse during the daytime as perhaps each and every day her counting are completed,
llm_translation: The first oath that will come later to immerse on the day, perhaps every day and every day they will complete the counting for her.

hebrew_text: הא מני ר"ע היא דאמר בעינן ספורים בפנינו
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Akiva, who said we require counted in our presence,
llm_translation: This is the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, as he said, "We require witnesses before us."

hebrew_text: סוף שבוע קמא ליטבלה חד בשבוע לא קמיירי
human_translation: let her immerse the end of the first week, is not dealing with once a week.
llm_translation: The first weekend, one should immerse once a week, they do not say.

hebrew_text: יומא קמא דאתיא לקמן ליטבלה דילמא שומרת יום כנגד יום היא בזבה גדולה קמיירי בזבה קטנה לא קמיירי
human_translation: Let immerse the first day that she came before us, as perhaps she is a woman who observes day for a day is dealing with a greater zava it is not dealing with a lesser zava .
llm_translation: First day that comes to be below to immerse perhaps she guards day against day she is in large zavah she is not in small zavah

hebrew_text: ש"מ תלת ש"מ ר"ע היא דאמר בעינן ספורים בפנינו
human_translation: Conclude from it three Conclude from it is Rabbi Akiva, who said we require counted in our presence.
llm_translation: There are three that Rabbi Akiva said we require to count before us.

hebrew_text: וש"מ ר"ש היא דאמר אבל אמרו חכמים אסור לעשות כן שמא תבא לידי ספק
human_translation: And conclude from it is Rabbi Shimon, who says but the Sages said it is prohibited to do so, lest she come to uncertainty,
llm_translation: And there, learn from it, Rabbi Shimon, that he said, "However, the sages said it is forbidden to do so, lest it lead to uncertainty."

hebrew_text: וש"מ טבילה בזמנה מצוה ורבי יוסי בר' יהודה אומר דיה לטבילה באחרונה ולא אמרינן טבילה בזמנה מצוה
human_translation: And conclude from it immersion at its proper time is a mitzva, But Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: It is sufficient for the immersion to be at the end, and we do not say immersion at its proper time is a mitzva
llm_translation: And there, learn from there: immersion in its proper time is a mitzvah. And Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: it is preferable for immersion to be done at the end, and we do not say immersion in its proper time is a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המפלת ליום מ' אינה חוששת לולד ליום מ"א תשב לזכר ולנקבה ולנדה
human_translation: who discharges on the fortieth day not be concerned that an offspring on the forty-first day she shall observe for a male and for a female; and for a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who miscarries on Monday is not concerned for a male or female fetus or for a discharge.

hebrew_text: רבי ישמעאל אומר יום מ"א תשב לזכר ולנדה יום פ"א תשב לזכר ולנקבה ולנדה שהזכר נגמר למ"א והנקבה לפ"א וחכ"א אחד בריית הזכר ואחד בריית הנקבה זה וזה מ"א
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: forty-first day observes for a male; and for a menstruating woman. eighty-first day observes to a male and to a female, and of a menstruating woman, as the male concludes on forty-first and the female on eighty-first And the Rabbis say: both the formation of the male and the formation of the female, this and that forty-first
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: On the 41st day, she shall sit for a male and for a menstruating woman. On the 81st day, she shall sit for a male and for a female and for a menstruating woman, because the male is completed by the 41st day, and the female by the 81st day. And the sages say: one creation of the male and one creation of the female, this and this on the 41st day.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ למה הוזכר זכר
human_translation: Why a male mentioned
llm_translation: Gemara: Why was "male" mentioned?

hebrew_text: אי לימי טומאה הא קתני נקבה ואי לימי טהרה
human_translation: If to the days of impurity doesn’t teach a female? And if to the days of purity
llm_translation: If it is during days of impurity, this is what it teaches: female. And if it is during days of purity.

hebrew_text: הא קתני נדה
human_translation: doesn’t teach a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: This is what was taught in the Mishnah: "Ha katani niddah."

hebrew_text: שאם תראה יום ל"ד ותחזור ותראה יום מ' ואחד תהא מקולקלת עד מ"ח
human_translation: that if she sees thirty-fourth day and again sees forty-first day, shall be ruined, until forty-eighth
llm_translation: If you see the 34th day and then see the 41st day, it should be considered spoiled until the 48th day.

hebrew_text: וכן לענין נקבה שאם תראה יום ע"ד ותחזור ותראה יום פ"א תהא מקולקלת עד פ"ח
human_translation: And similarly, with regard to a female, that if she sees seventy-fourth day and again sees eighty-first day, shall be ruined until eighty-eighth
llm_translation: And so too regarding a female, if she sees on day 11 and then sees on day 81, she shall be considered as having a disrupted menstrual cycle until day 88.

hebrew_text: רבי ישמעאל אומר יום מ"א תשב לזכר ולנדה כו' תניא רבי ישמעאל אומר טימא וטיהר בזכר וטימא וטיהר בנקבה
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: forty-first day observes to a male, and of a menstruating woman, It is taught Rabbi Yishmael says, In a male, deems impure and deems pure and with regard to a female, deems impure and deems pure
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: On the first day of a baby's birth, sit in impurity for a male and for a menstruating woman, etc. It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yishmael says: Become impure and become pure for a male, and become impure and become pure for a female.

hebrew_text: מה כשטימא וטיהר בזכר יצירתו כיוצא בו אף כשטימא וטיהר בנקבה יצירתה כיוצא בה אמרו לו אין למדין יצירה מטומאה
human_translation: just as when deems impure and deems pure in a male, its is parallel to the formation of so too, when deems impure and deems pure in a female, its is parallel to the formation of said to One cannot derive formation from impurity
llm_translation: What when he became impure and became pure in a male, his creation like him, so too when he became impure and became pure in a female, her creation like her. They said to him: We do not learn creation from impurity.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לר' ישמעאל מעשה בקליאופטרא מלכת אלכסנדרוס שנתחייבו שפחותיה הריגה למלכות ובדקן ומצאן זה וזה למ"א אמר להן אני מביא לכם ראייה מן התורה ואתם מביאין לי ראייה מן השוטים
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yishmael an incident involving Cleopatra, Queen of Alexandria. Since her maidservants were sentenced to death by the government, she experimented on them and found this and that on the forty-first said to them I bring you proof from the Torah, and you bring me proof from the fools?
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Yishmael: There was an incident with Cleopatra, the queen of Alexandria, where her maidservants were found guilty of plotting against the kingdom. They were examined, and both this one and that one were found guilty. Rabbi Yishmael said to them: "I will bring you proof from the Torah, and you bring me proof from fools."

hebrew_text: מאי ראיה מן התורה אילימא טימא וטיהר בזכר וטימא וטיהר בנקבה כו' הא קאמרי ליה אין דנין יצירה מטומאה
human_translation: What proof from the Torah If we say in a male, deems impure and deems pure and in a female, deems impure and deems pure didn’t say to him one cannot derive formation from impurity
llm_translation: What is the proof from the Torah? If you say that it is impure and becomes pure in a male, and impure and becomes pure in a female, etc., they say to him: We do not judge creation based on impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר קרא תלד הוסיף לה הכתוב לידה אחרת בנקבה
human_translation: the verse states: she gives birth The verse adds another childbirth with regard to a female,
llm_translation: The verse said: "She bore again, and she bore a daughter."

hebrew_text: ומאי ראיה מן השוטים אימר נקבה קדים ואיעבור ארבעין יומין קמי זכר
human_translation: And what a proof from the fools? say a female became pregnant first, forty days before a male
llm_translation: And what is the proof from the fools? Say, "A female precedes and I will pass forty days before a male."

hebrew_text: ורבנן סמא דנפצא אשקינהו ור' ישמעאל איכא גופא דלא מקבל סמא
human_translation: And the Rabbis gave a purgative medicine to drink And Rabbi Yishmael there are bodies that are not affected by medicine,
llm_translation: And the Rabbis said: "Sama the blind scattered them." And Rabbi Yishmael said: "There is a body that does not accept Sama."

hebrew_text: אמר להם ר' ישמעאל מעשה בקלפטרא מלכת יוונית שנתחייבו שפחותיה הריגה למלכות ובדקן ומצאן זכר לארבעים ואחד ונקבה לפ"א אמרו לו אין מביאין ראיה מן השוטים
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said to an incident involving Cleopatra, the Greek queen, as her maidservants were sentenced to death by the government, and she experimented on them and found a male on the forty-first and a female on the eighty-first said to him: One does not bring proof from the fools.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi Yishmael: There was an incident in Cleopatra, the Greek queen, where her maidservants were found guilty of plotting against the kingdom, and they examined them and found forty-one males and one female. They said to him: We do not bring proof from fools.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא הך דנקבה אייתרה ארבעין יומין והדר איעבר
human_translation: What is the reason this who a female waited forty days, and then became pregnant
llm_translation: What is the reason that a female animal is impregnated for forty days and then miscarries?

hebrew_text: ורבי ישמעאל לשומר מסרינהו ורבנן אין אפוטרופוס לעריות אימא שומר גופיה בא עליה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael transferred them to a steward, And the Rabbis there is no steward [ apotropos ] for sexual intercourse, say warden himself engaged in intercourse with
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael said to the guardian, "We hand it over to you," and the Rabbis say, "There is no guardian for matters of forbidden relationships." Say, rather, the guardian himself engaged in it.

hebrew_text: ודילמא אי קרעוהו להך דנקבה בארבעין וחד הוה משתכחא כזכר אמר אביי בסימניהון שוין
human_translation: But Perhaps if of this female would have been torn on the forty-first would have been found just as a male Abaye says where the indications of were identical.
llm_translation: And perhaps if that one (the animal) was torn by that female in forty days, and one (part) was found like a male. Abaye said: In their signs they are equal.

hebrew_text: וחכ"א אחד בריית זכר ואחד בריית נקבה וכו' חכמים היינו ת"ק
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Both the formation of the male and the formation of the female the Rabbis is the first tanna .
llm_translation: And the sages of the Mishnah say: "One case of a male fetus and one case of a female fetus, etc."

hebrew_text: וכי תימא למסתמא רישא כרבנן ויחיד ורבים הלכה כרבים פשיטא
human_translation: And if you would say to the unattributed the first clause in accordance with the Rabbis, and an individual and many halakha in accordance with many, obvious
llm_translation: And if you were to say that the beginning is according to the Rabbis, and the individual and the many, the halacha follows the many - it is obvious.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא מסתברא טעמא דרבי ישמעאל דקמסייע ליה קראי קמ"ל
human_translation: Lest you say from the explanation of Rabbi Yishmael stands to reason, as the verses support it, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning for one to say that the reason of Rabbi Yishmael is logical, as the verses support him? The verse teaches us.

hebrew_text: דרש רבי שמלאי למה הולד דומה במעי אמו לפנקס שמקופל ומונח ידיו על שתי צדעיו שתי אציליו על ב' ארכובותיו וב' עקביו על ב' עגבותיו וראשו מונח לו בין ברכיו ופיו סתום וטבורו פתוח ואוכל ממה שאמו אוכלת ושותה ממה שאמו שותה ואינו מוציא רעי שמא יהרוג את אמו וכיון שיצא לאויר העולם נפתח הסתום ונסתם הפתוח שאלמלא כן אינו יכול לחיות אפילו שעה אחת
human_translation: Rabbi Samlai taught: To what is a fetus in its mother’s womb comparable? To a folded notebook [ lefinkas ]. And it rests with its hands on its two sides its two arms [ atzilav ] on its two knees, and its two heels on its two buttocks, and its head rests between its knees, and its mouth is closed, and its umbilicus is open. And it eats from what its mother eats, and it drinks from what its mother drinks, and it does not emit excrement lest it kill its mother. But once it emerges into the airspace of the world, the closed opens, and the open closes, as otherwise it cannot live even one hour.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shemlai expounded: Why is the fetus in its mother's womb likened to a folded notebook, with its hands placed on its two sides, its two elbows on its two thighs, its two heels on its two buttocks, and its head positioned between its knees, its mouth closed, and its navel open, consuming what its mother consumes and drinking what its mother drinks, and not emitting waste lest it kill its mother? And once it emerges into the air of the world, the closed is opened and the open is closed, for if not, it cannot survive even for one hour.

hebrew_text: ונר דלוק לו על ראשו וצופה ומביט מסוף העולם ועד סופו שנאמר (איוב כט, ג) בהלו נרו עלי ראשי לאורו אלך חשך ואל תתמה שהרי אדם ישן כאן ורואה חלום באספמיא
human_translation: And a candle is lit for it above its head, and it gazes from one end of the world to the other, as it is stated: “When His lamp shined above my head, and by His light I walked through darkness” And do not wonder as a person can sleep here, and see a dream in Spain [ beAspamya ].
llm_translation: "And a candle is lit for him on his head, and he gazes and looks from one end of the world to the other, as it is stated (Job 29:3), 'When His lamp shone over my head, by His light I walked through darkness.' And do not be amazed, for behold, a person sleeps here and sees a dream in Aspamia."

hebrew_text: ואין לך ימים שאדם שרוי בטובה יותר מאותן הימים שנאמר (איוב כט, ב) מי יתנני כירחי קדם כימי אלוה ישמרני ואיזהו ימים שיש בהם ירחים ואין בהם שנים הוי אומר אלו ירחי לידה
human_translation: And there are no days when a person is in a more blissful state than those days as it is stated “If only I were as in the months of old, as in the days when God watched over me” And Which are days that have months but do not have years? You must say these are months of gestation.
llm_translation: And there are no days that a person is bound in goodness more than those days, as it is stated (Job 29:2), "Oh that I were as in the months of old, as in the days when God watched over me." And which days are those that have months in them but not years? You would say these are the months of pregnancy.

hebrew_text: ומלמדין אותו כל התורה כולה שנאמר (משלי ד ד) ויורני ויאמר לי יתמך דברי לבך שמור מצותי וחיה ואומר (איוב כט, ד) בסוד אלוה עלי אהלי
human_translation: And is taught the entire Torah as it is stated: “And He taught me and said to me: Let your heart hold fast My words; keep My commandments, and live” And it states: when the converse of God was upon my tent”
llm_translation: And they teach him the entire Torah as it is stated (Proverbs 4:4), "And He taught me and said to me, 'Let your heart hold fast my words; keep my commandments and live.'" And it says (Job 29:4), "As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tent."

hebrew_text: מאי ואומר וכי תימא נביא הוא דקאמר ת"ש בסוד אלוה עלי אהלי
human_translation: What is And it states: And if you would say it is a prophet who is saying come hear “When the converse of God was upon my tent.”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and he said"? And if you say it is a prophet who is speaking, come and hear: "In the secret of God, I will dwell."

hebrew_text: וכיון שבא לאויר העולם בא מלאך וסטרו על פיו ומשכחו כל התורה כולה שנאמר (בראשית ד, ז) לפתח חטאת רובץ
human_translation: And once emerges into the airspace of the world, an angel comes and slaps it on its mouth, causing it to forget the entire Torah, as it is stated: “Sin crouches at the entrance”
llm_translation: And once he came into the world, an angel came and slapped him on his mouth, causing him to forget all the Torah, as it is said (Genesis 4:7), "At the door sin crouches."

hebrew_text: ואינו יוצא משם עד שמשביעין אותו שנאמר (ישעיהו מה, כג) כי לי תכרע כל ברך תשבע כל לשון כי לי תכרע כל ברך זה יום המיתה שנאמר (תהלים כב, ל) לפניו יכרעו כל יורדי עפר תשבע כל לשון זה יום הלידה שנאמר (תהלים כד, ד) נקי כפים ובר לבב אשר לא נשא לשוא נפשו ולא נשבע למרמה
human_translation: And does not leave until administer an oath to it, as it is stated: “That to Me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear” “That to Me every knee shall bow”; this is the day of death, as it is stated: “All those who go down to the dust shall kneel before Him” “Every tongue shall swear”; this is the day of birth, as it is stated “He who has clean hands, and a pure heart, who has not taken My name in vain, and has not sworn deceitfully”
llm_translation: And he does not depart from there until they satisfy him, as it is stated (Isaiah 45:23), "By Myself I have sworn, a word has gone forth from My mouth in righteousness and shall not return, that to Me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear allegiance." "By Myself I have sworn, a word has gone forth from My mouth in righteousness and shall not return," this is the day of death, as it is stated (Psalms 22:30), "Before Him shall bow all who go down to the dust; and he who cannot keep his soul alive." "Every tongue shall swear allegiance," this is the day of birth, as it is stated (Psalms 24:4), "He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who has not taken My name in vain and has not sworn deceitfully."

hebrew_text: ומה היא השבועה שמשביעין אותו תהי צדיק ואל תהי רשע ואפילו כל העולם כולו אומרים לך צדיק אתה היה בעיניך כרשע והוי יודע שהקב"ה טהור ומשרתיו טהורים ונשמה שנתן בך טהורה היא אם אתה משמרה בטהרה מוטב ואם לאו הריני נוטלה ממך
human_translation: And what is the oath that administer to Be righteous and do not be wicked. And even the entire world says to you: You are righteous, consider yourself wicked. And know that the Holy One, Blessed be He, is pure, and His ministers are pure, and the soul that He gave you is pure. If you preserve it in purity, well, but if not I, shall take it from you.
llm_translation: And what is the oath that they administer to him? "Be righteous and do not be wicked, and even if the whole world tells you that you are righteous, be in your own eyes as wicked, and know that the Holy One, blessed be He, is pure, and His servants are pure, and the soul that He has placed within you is pure. If you keep it pure, well and good; but if not, then I will take it from you."

hebrew_text: תנא דבי ר' ישמעאל משל לכהן שמסר תרומה לעם הארץ ואמר לו אם אתה משמרה בטהרה מוטב ואם לאו הריני שורפה לפניך
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught a parable: to a priest who gave teruma , to one who is unreliable with regard to ritual impurity [ am ha’aretz ], And said to him: If you keep it in ritual purity, well, but if not I shall burn it before you.
llm_translation: Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: A parable to a priest who entrusted terumah to an am ha'aretz and said to him, "If you guard it in purity, it is good; but if not, behold, I will burn it before you."

hebrew_text: א"ר אלעזר
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said:
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar

hebrew_text: מאי קרא (תהלים עא, ו) ממעי אמי אתה גוזי מאי משמע דהאי גוזי לישנא דאשתבועי הוא דכתיב (ירמיהו ז, כט) גזי נזרך והשליכי
human_translation: What is the verse You are He Who took me out [ gozi ] of my mother’s womb” From where may be inferred that this “ Gozi ,” is a term of administering an oath? As it is written: “Cut off [ gozi ] your hair and cast it away”
llm_translation: What is the verse (Psalms 31:6) "From the womb of my mother, You are my deliverer" coming to teach us? That this deliverance refers to the sleep of a person, as it is written (Jeremiah 7:29) "Shave off your hair and cast it away."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי אלעזר למה ולד דומה במעי אמו לאגוז מונח בספל של מים אדם נותן אצבעו עליו שוקע לכאן ולכאן
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: To what is a fetus in its mother’s womb comparable? to a nut placed in a basin of water, a person puts his finger on top of it sinks in this direction or in that direction.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: "Why is the fetus likened to a nut in its mother's womb? Just as a nut placed in a jug of water, a person places his finger on it, it sinks this way and that."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן שלשה חדשים הראשונים ולד דר במדור התחתון אמצעיים ולד דר במדור האמצעי אחרונים ולד דר במדור העליון וכיון שהגיע זמנו לצאת מתהפך ויוצא וזהו חבלי אשה
human_translation: The Sages taught the first three months fetus resides in the lower compartment middle fetus resides in the middle compartment; last fetus resides in the upper compartment. And once its time to emerge arrives, it turns upside down and emerges; and this is labor pains.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The first three months, the fetus is in the lower chamber, the middle three months, the fetus is in the middle chamber, the last three months, the fetus is in the upper chamber. And once its time to emerge arrives, it turns over and comes out, and this is the process of childbirth.

hebrew_text: והיינו דתנן חבלי של נקבה מרובין משל זכר
human_translation: And this is that which we learned The labor pains experienced by a female are greater than experienced by a male.
llm_translation: And this is what we learned in a Mishnah: the birth pangs of a female exceed those of a male.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי אלעזר מאי קרא (תהלים קלט, טו) אשר עשיתי בסתר רקמתי בתחתיות ארץ דרתי לא נאמר אלא רקמתי
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: What is the verse “When I was made in secret, and I was woven together in the lowest parts of the earth” is not stated: I resided but rather: “I was woven together
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: What is the verse? (Psalms 139:15) "My frame was not hidden from You, when I was made in secret, intricately wrought in the lowest parts of the earth." It is not said "intricately wrought," but rather "wrought."

hebrew_text: מאי שנא חבלי נקבה מרובין משל זכר זה בא כדרך תשמישו וזה בא כדרך תשמישו זו הופכת פניה וזה אין הופך פניו
human_translation: What is different the labor pains experienced by a female, are greater than those experienced by a male? This emerges in the manner in which it engages in intercourse. And that emerges in the manner in which it engages in intercourse, that turns its face around but this does not turn its face around
llm_translation: What is the difference between the female ropes that are more numerous than the male ropes? This one comes in the manner of its use, and this one comes in the manner of its use. This one turns its face, and this one does not turn its face.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן שלשה חדשים הראשונים תשמיש קשה לאשה וגם קשה לולד אמצעיים קשה לאשה ויפה לולד אחרונים יפה לאשה ויפה לולד שמתוך כך נמצא הולד מלובן ומזורז
human_translation: The Sages taught the first three months sexual intercourse is difficult for the woman and is also difficult for the offspring. middle difficult for the woman but is beneficial for the offspring. last beneficial for the woman and beneficial for the offspring; as a result of it the offspring is found to be strong and fair skinned.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The first three months are difficult for a woman in terms of marital relations, and also difficult for the fetus. The middle months are difficult for a woman, but beneficial for the fetus. The final months are beneficial for a woman and beneficial for the fetus, as a result of which the fetus emerges white and vigorous.

hebrew_text: תנא המשמש מטתו ליום תשעים כאילו שופך דמים מנא ידע אלא אמר אביי משמש והולך (תהלים קטז, ו) ושומר פתאים ה'
human_translation: taught one who engages in intercourse on the ninetieth day it is as though he spills blood. How does one know Rather, Abaye says: One should go ahead and engage in intercourse and “The Lord preserves the simple”
llm_translation: It was taught: One who serves his bed for ninety days is as though he sheds blood. From where do we know this? Rather, Abaye said: He serves and departs (Psalms 116:6) "And He watches over the simple-hearted, the Lord."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן שלשה שותפין יש באדם הקב"ה ואביו ואמו אביו מזריע הלובן שממנו עצמות וגידים וצפרנים ומוח שבראשו ולובן שבעין אמו מזרעת אודם שממנו עור ובשר ושערות ושחור שבעין והקב"ה נותן בו רוח ונשמה וקלסתר פנים וראיית העין ושמיעת האוזן ודבור פה והלוך רגלים ובינה והשכל
human_translation: The Sages taught: There are three partners in a person: The Holy One, Blessed be He, and his father, and his mother. His father emits the white seed, from which bones, sinews, nails, brain that is in its head, and white of the eye. His mother emits red seed, from which skin, flesh, hair, and black of the eye. And the Holy One, Blessed be He, inserts into him a spirit, a soul, countenance [ ukelaster ], eyesight, hearing of the ear, speech the mouth, walking the legs, understanding, and wisdom.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There are three partners in a person - the Holy One, blessed be He, and his father and his mother. His father contributes the white, from which come bones, sinews, nails, and the brain in his head, and the white of the eyes. His mother contributes the red, from which come skin, flesh, hair, and the black of the eyes. And the Holy One, blessed be He, gives in him spirit, soul, the ability to blush, the sight of the eye, the hearing of the ear, speech, walking, understanding, and intelligence.

hebrew_text: וכיון שהגיע זמנו להפטר מן העולם הקב"ה נוטל חלקו וחלק אביו ואמו מניח לפניהם אמר רב פפא היינו דאמרי אינשי פוץ מלחא ושדי בשרא לכלבא
human_translation: And when time to depart from the world arrives, the Holy One, Blessed be He, retrieves His part, and He leaves the part of father and mother before them. Rav Pappa said: This that people say: Remove the salt and toss the meat to a dog,
llm_translation: And once his time arrived to depart from the world, the Holy One, blessed be He, takes his portion, and the portion of his father and mother He leaves before them. Rav Papa said: This is what people say, "He has put salt and meat in front of a dog."

hebrew_text: דרש רב חיננא בר פפא מאי דכתיב (איוב ט, י) עושה גדולות עד אין חקר ונפלאות עד אין מספר בא וראה שלא כמדת הקב"ה מדת בשר ודם מדת בשר ודם נותן חפץ בחמת צרורה ופיה למעלה ספק משתמר ספק אין משתמר ואילו הקב"ה צר העובר במעי אשה פתוחה ופיה למטה ומשתמר
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa taught: What which is written: “Who does great deeds beyond comprehension, wondrous deeds without number” Come and see that the attribute of flesh and blood is unlike the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He. The attribute of flesh and blood puts an article in a flask, tied and its opening upward, it is uncertain whether is preserved and it is uncertain whether it is not preserved But the Holy One, Blessed be He, forms the fetus in a woman’s open womb, and its opening downward, and is preserved.
llm_translation: Rav Chinana bar Pappa expounded: What is the meaning of what is written (Job 9:10), "He does great things beyond comprehension, and wonders without number"? Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood is that one places a desired object in a heated crucible, and there is doubt whether it will be preserved or not. But the Holy One, blessed be He, formed the fetus in the womb of a woman, whose womb is open at the top and closed at the bottom, and it is preserved.

hebrew_text: דבר אחר אדם נותן חפציו לכף מאזנים כל זמן שמכביד יורד למטה ואילו הקב"ה כל זמן שמכביד הולד עולה למעלה
human_translation: Another matter a person places his articles on a scale the heavier is, it descends. But the Holy One, Blessed be He, the heavier the offspring gets, it ascends upward
llm_translation: Another explanation: A person places his possessions on the scales; as long as he adds weight, it descends below. Whereas the Holy One, blessed be He, as long as He adds the offspring, it ascends above.

hebrew_text: דרש רבי יוסי הגלילי מאי דכתיב (תהילים קל״ט:י״ד ) אודך (ה') על כי נוראות נפליתי נפלאים מעשיך ונפשי יודעת מאד בא וראה שלא כמדת הקב"ה מדת בשר ודם מדת בשר ודם אדם נותן זרעונים בערוגה כל אחת ואחת עולה במינו ואילו הקב"ה צר העובר במעי אשה וכולם עולין למין אחד
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili taught: What which is written: “I will give thanks to You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; wonderful are Your works, and that my soul knows very well” Come and see that the attribute of flesh and blood is unlike the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He. The attribute of flesh and blood a person plants seeds in garden bed, each and every one emerges according to its species. But the Holy One, Blessed be He, forms the fetus in a woman’s womb, and all of emerge as one
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean expounded: What is the meaning of what is written (Psalms 139:14), "I will praise You, for I am awesomely, wondrously made; Your works are wondrous, and my soul knows it very well"? Come and see that the attribute of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the attribute of flesh and blood. The attribute of flesh and blood is that a person produces offspring in a garden, and each one ascends according to its kind. But the Holy One, blessed be He, forms the embryo in the womb of a woman, and all of them ascend as one kind.

hebrew_text: דבר אחר צבע נותן סמנין ליורה כולן עולין לצבע אחד ואילו הקב"ה צר העובר במעי אשה כל אחת ואחת עולה למינו
human_translation: Alternatively, a dyer puts herbs in a cauldron [ leyora ], they all emerge as one color whereas the Holy One, Blessed be He, forms the fetus in a woman’s womb, each and every one emerges as its own type.
llm_translation: Another explanation: A dye gives signs to the teacher, all of them ascend for one dye. Whereas the Holy One, blessed be He, fashions the fetus in the womb of a woman, each and every one ascends according to its kind.

hebrew_text: דרש רב יוסף מאי דכתיב (ישעיהו יב, א) אודך ה' כי אנפת בי ישוב אפך ותנחמני במה הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: Rav Yosef taught: What which is written: I will give thanks to You, Lord, for You were angry with me; Your anger is turned away, and You comfort me” With regard to what is the verse speaking?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef expounded: What is the meaning of what is written (Isaiah 12:1), "I will praise You, O Lord, for You were angry with me; Your anger has turned away, and You have comforted me"? What is the Scripture speaking about?

hebrew_text: בשני בני אדם שיצאו לסחורה ישב לו קוץ לאחד מהן התחיל מחרף ומגדף לימים שמע שטבעה ספינתו של חבירו בים התחיל מודה ומשבח לכך נאמר ישוב אפך ותנחמני
human_translation: to two people who left on a business A thorn penetrated of one of them, He started blaspheming and cursing After a period of time, he heard that the ship of the other had sunk in the sea, started thanking and praising Therefore, it is stated “Your anger is turned away, and You comfort me.”
llm_translation: In two men who went to trade, a thorn sat for one of them. He began to curse and revile. Afterward, he heard that his friend's ship had sunk at sea. He began to confess and praise. Therefore it is said, "Turn back Your anger and comfort me."

hebrew_text: והיינו דאמר רבי אלעזר מאי דכתיב (תהלים עב, יח) עושה נפלאות (גדולות) לבדו וברוך שם כבודו לעולם אפילו בעל הנס אינו מכיר בנסו
human_translation: And this is that which Rabbi Elazar said: What which is written: Who does wondrous things alone; and blessed be His glorious name forever” even the one for whom the miracle was performed does not recognize the miracle him.
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: What is the meaning of what is written (Psalms 72:18), "He alone does wonders (great things), and blessed be His glorious name forever; and may the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen, and Amen."

hebrew_text: דריש רבי חנינא בר פפא מאי דכתיב (תהלים קלט, ג) ארחי ורבעי זרית וכל דרכי הסכנת מלמד שלא נוצר אדם מן כל הטפה אלא מן הברור שבה תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל משל לאדם שזורה בבית הגרנות נוטל את האוכל ומניח את הפסולת
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa taught: What which is written: “You measure [ zerita ] my going about [ orḥi ] and my lying down [ riv’i ], and are acquainted with all my ways” teaches that a person is not created from the entire drop but from its clear The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught a parable: to a person who winnows in the granary; he takes the food and leaves the waste.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa expounded: What is the meaning of the verse (Psalms 139:3), "You sift my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways"? This teaches that a person is not formed from any drop except from the clear one within it. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: A parable to a person who is sifting in the granary, he takes the food and leaves the refuse.
