hebrew_text: כדרבי אבהו דרבי אבהו רמי כתיב (שמואל ב כב, מ) ותזרני חיל וכתיב (תהלים יח, לג) האל המאזרני חיל אמר דוד לפני הקב"ה רבש"ע זיריתני וזרזתני
human_translation: in accordance with of Rabbi Abbahu, as Rabbi Abbahu raises a contradiction: It is written “For You have girded me [ vatazreni ] with strength for battle” and it is written “Who girds me [ hame’azreni ] with strength” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, You selected me [ zeiritani ], and You have girded me [ zeraztani ] with strength.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Abbahu, Rabbi Abbahu raises a contradiction: It is written (2 Samuel 22:40), "You have girded me with strength," and it is written (Psalms 18:33), "The God who girds me with strength." David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, You have girded me and strengthened me.

hebrew_text: דרש רבי אבהו מאי דכתיב (במדבר כג, י) מי מנה עפר יעקב ומספר את רובע ישראל מלמד שהקב"ה יושב וסופר את רביעיותיהם של ישראל מתי תבא טיפה שהצדיק נוצר הימנה
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu taught: What which is written “Who has counted the dust of Jacob, or numbered the stock [ rova ] of Israel” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, sits and counts the times that the Jewish people engage in intercourse [ revi’iyyoteihem ], when the drop from which the righteous person will be created will arrive.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu expounded: What is the meaning of what is written (Numbers 23:10), "Who can count the dust of Jacob or number the fourth part of Israel"? This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, sits and counts the quarters of Israel. "When will the time come that the righteous will sprout forth from it?"

hebrew_text: ועל דבר זה נסמית עינו של בלעם הרשע אמר מי שהוא טהור וקדוש ומשרתיו טהורים וקדושים יציץ בדבר זה מיד נסמית עינו דכתיב (במדבר כד, ג) נאם הגבר שתום העין
human_translation: And due to this matter the eye of wicked Balaam went blind. He said: Should who is pure and holy, and whose ministers are pure and holy, peek at this matter? Immediately his eye was blinded as it is written: “The saying of the man whose eye is shut”
llm_translation: And regarding this matter, the evil eye of Balaam was blinded. He said, "He who is pure and holy, and His servants are pure and holy, will look favorably upon this matter." Immediately his evil eye was blinded, as it is written (Numbers 24:3), "The word of the man with the closed eye."

hebrew_text: והיינו דאמר רבי יוחנן מאי דכתיב (בראשית ל, טז) וישכב עמה בלילה הוא מלמד שהקב"ה סייע באותו מעשה שנאמר (בראשית מט, יד) יששכר חמור גרם חמור גרם לו ליששכר
human_translation: And this is which Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What which is written, “And he lay with her that night” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, contributed to that act. as it is stated: “Issachar is a large-boned [ garem ] donkey” donkey causing [ garam ] Issachar.
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the meaning of what is written (Genesis 30:16), "And he lay with her that night"? It teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, assisted in that act, as it is said (Genesis 49:14), "Issachar is a strong-boned donkey, lying down between the sheepfolds."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק אמר רבי אמי אשה מזרעת תחילה יולדת זכר איש מזריע תחילה יולדת נקבה שנאמר (ויקרא יג, כט) אשה כי תזריע וילדה זכר
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says Rabbi Ami says: woman emits seed first, she gives birth to a male, man emits seed first, she gives birth to a female, as it is stated: “If a woman bears seed and gives birth to a male”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Ami: A woman who conceives first gives birth to a male, while a man who emits seed first gives birth to a female, as it is stated (Leviticus 13:29): "If a woman conceives and gives birth to a male."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן בראשונה היו אומרים אשה מזרעת תחילה יולדת זכר איש מזריע תחלה יולדת נקבה ולא פירשו חכמים את הדבר עד שבא רבי צדוק ופירשו (בראשית מו, טו) אלה בני לאה אשר ילדה ליעקב בפדן ארם ואת דינה בתו תלה הזכרים בנקבות ונקבות בזכרים
human_translation: The Sages taught: At first, would say woman emits seed first she gives birth to a male, man emits seed first, she gives birth to a female. But the Sages did not explain matter until Rabbi Tzadok came and explained it “These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Paddan Aram, with his daughter Dinah” attributes the males to the females, and the females to the males,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Initially they used to say, a woman who emits seed first gives birth to a male, a man who emits seed first gives birth to a female. And the Sages did not explain the matter until Rabbi Zadok came and explained it (Genesis 46:15), "These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Paddan-aram, and Dinah his daughter; all the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty-three."

hebrew_text: (דברי הימים א ח, מ) ויהיו בני אולם אנשים גבורי חיל דורכי קשת ומרבים בנים ובני בנים וכי בידו של אדם להרבות בנים ובני בנים אלא מתוך
human_translation: “And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons and sons’ sons” Is it in a person’s power to have many sons and sons’ sons? Rather, because
llm_translation: The words of Chronicles I 8:40 "And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons and grandsons, one hundred and fifty. All these are of the sons of Benjamin."

hebrew_text: שמשהין עצמן בבטן כדי שיזריעו נשותיהן תחלה שיהו בניהם זכרים מעלה עליהן הכתוב כאילו הם מרבים בנים ובני בנים והיינו דאמר רב קטינא יכולני לעשות כל בני זכרים אמר רבא הרוצה לעשות כל בניו זכרים יבעול וישנה
human_translation: they delay in abdomen, so that their wives will emit seed first, that their children will be male, the verse ascribes them as though they have many sons and sons’ sons. And this is which Rav Ketina said: I could have made all of my children males, Rava says One who wishes to make all of his children males should engage in intercourse and repeat
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "They make themselves warm in the womb so that their wives conceive first, so that their children will be males. The verse regards them as if they are multiplying sons and grandsons. This is what Rav Katina said: One could make all his children males. Rava said: One who wants all his children to be males should marry and sleep."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יצחק אמר רבי אמי אין אשה מתעברת אלא סמוך לוסתה שנאמר (תהלים נא, ז) הן בעון חוללתי
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says Rabbi Ami says: A woman becomes pregnant only close to the onset of her cycle, as it is stated: “Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Ami: A woman only becomes pregnant close to her menstruation, as it is stated (Psalms 51:7), "Behold, in iniquity I was conceived."

hebrew_text: ורבי יוחנן אמר סמוך לטבילה שנאמר (תהלים נא, ז) ובחטא יחמתני אמי
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: near immersion as it is stated “And in sin [ uvḥet ] did my mother conceive me”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Near immersion, as it is stated (Psalms 51:7), "And in sin, my mother conceived me."

hebrew_text: מאי משמע דהאי חטא לישנא דדכויי הוא דכתיב (ויקרא יד, מט) וחטא את הבית ומתרגמינן וידכי ית ביתא ואי בעית אימא מהכא (תהלים נא, ט) תחטאני באזוב ואטהר
human_translation: From where may be inferred that this term “ ḥet ” is to purity? As it is written “ Veḥittei the house” and we translate And he shall purify the house. And if you wish, say from here: “Purge me [ teḥatte’eni ] with hyssop, and I shall be pure”
llm_translation: What is implied by this sin of leprosy that it is written (Leviticus 14:49) "and he sins against the house," and we translate it as "and he defiles the house." And if you wish, say it from here (Psalms 51:9) "purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יצחק אמר רבי אמי כיון שבא זכר בעולם בא שלום בעולם שנאמר (ישעיהו טז, א) שלחו כר מושל ארץ זכר זה כר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says Rabbi Ami says: When a male comes into the world, peace comes to the world, as it is stated: “Send the lambs [ khar ] for the ruler of the land” male [ zakhar ] This is a kar [ zeh kar ].
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said, Rabbi Ami said: Once a male enters the world, peace enters the world, as it is stated (Isaiah 16:1), "Send a ram, O ruler of the land, from Sela across the desert, to the mount of the daughter of Zion."

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' יצחק דבי רבי אמי בא זכר בעולם בא ככרו בידו זכר זה כר דכתיב (מלכים ב ו, כג) ויכרה להם כירה גדולה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak from the school of Rabbi Ami says: When a male comes into the world, his loaf comes into his possession. male [ zakhar ] This is a kar [ zeh kar ], as it is written: “And he prepared great provision [ kera ] for them”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak of the house of Rabbi Ami said: A male comes into the world with his male organ in his hand. This male is a pitcher, as it is written (2 Kings 6:23): "And he prepared for them a great pitcher."

hebrew_text: נקבה אין עמה כלום נקבה נקייה באה עד דאמרה מזוני לא יהבי לה דכתיב (בראשית ל, כח) נקבה שכרך עלי ואתנה
human_translation: when a female comes into the world, nothing, with her. female [ nekeva ] She comes clean [ nekiya ba’a ], until she says: sustenance, do not give her, as it is written “Appoint me [ nokva ] your wages, and I will give it”
llm_translation: Female nothing with her female clean came until said sustenance not given to her as it is written (Genesis 30:28) female your wages upon me and I will give.

hebrew_text: שאלו תלמידיו את רבי שמעון בן יוחי מפני מה אמרה תורה יולדת מביאה קרבן אמר להן בשעה שכורעת לילד קופצת ונשבעת שלא תזקק לבעלה לפיכך אמרה תורה תביא קרבן
human_translation: The students of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai asked him: For what does the Torah say a woman after childbirth brings an offering? He said to them: At the time that crouches to give birth, she impulsively takes an oath that she will not engage in intercourse with her husband Therefore, the Torah says she must bring an offering
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Why did the Torah say, "A woman who gives birth brings a sacrifice"? He said to them: At the moment she kneels to give birth, she jumps and swears that she will not have relations with her husband. Therefore, the Torah said, "She shall bring a sacrifice."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב יוסף והא מזידה היא ובחרטה תליא מילתא ועוד קרבן שבועה בעי איתויי
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this But isn’t an intentional violator And the matter depends on regret And furthermore, she required to bring an offering, an oath,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to her: But it is intentional, and the matter depends on regret, and furthermore, a Korban Shevuah is required.

hebrew_text: ומפני מה אמרה תורה זכר לשבעה ונקבה לארבעה עשר זכר שהכל שמחים בו מתחרטת לשבעה נקבה שהכל עצבים בה מתחרטת לארבעה עשר
human_translation: And For what does the Torah say a male for seven but a female for fourteen a male, over which everyone is happy, she regrets seven a female, over which everyone is unhappy, she regrets fourteen
llm_translation: And because of what did the Torah say, "male for seven and female for fourteen"? Male, for everyone is happy with it, she regrets for seven. Female, for everyone is sad with her, she regrets for fourteen.

hebrew_text: ומפני מה אמרה תורה מילה לשמונה שלא יהו כולם שמחים ואביו ואמו עצבים
human_translation: And For what does the Torah say circumcision on the eighth so that will not be everyone happy but the father and mother of are unhappy,
llm_translation: And because of what did the Torah say "circumcision" for eight, that not all of them should be happy and his father and mother sad.

hebrew_text: תניא היה ר"מ אומר מפני מה אמרה תורה נדה לשבעה מפני שרגיל בה וקץ בה אמרה תורה תהא טמאה שבעה ימים כדי שתהא חביבה על בעלה כשעת כניסתה לחופה
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: For what does the Torah say a menstruating woman for seven because accustomed to her, and repulsed by her. the Torah says shall be ritually impure seven days, so that she will be dear to her husband as the time when she entered the wedding canopy
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir used to say, "Why did the Torah say 'menstruation' to seven days? Because he is accustomed to her and ends with her." The Torah said, "She shall be unclean for seven days," so that she will be dear to her husband, like the time of her entry into the bridal chamber.

hebrew_text: שאלו תלמידיו את רבי דוסתאי ברבי ינאי מפני מה איש מחזר על אשה ואין אשה מחזרת על איש משל לאדם שאבד לו אבידה מי מחזר על מי בעל אבידה מחזיר על אבידתו
human_translation: The students of Rabbi Dostai, son of Rabbi Yannai, asked him: For what a man pursues a woman but a woman does not pursue a man? a parable of a person who lost an item. Who searches for what? the owner of the lost item searches for his item;
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Dostai son of Rabbi Yannai: Why does a man search for a woman, but a woman does not search for a man? It can be compared to a person who lost an object - who searches for whom? The owner of the lost object searches for his lost object.

hebrew_text: ומפני מה איש פניו למטה ואשה פניה למעלה כלפי האיש זה ממקום שנברא וזו ממקום שנבראת
human_translation: And For what a man facing down, and a woman facing up toward the man? This the place from which he was created, and that the place from which she was created,
llm_translation: And because of what is it that a man turns his face downward and a woman turns her face upward towards the man? This one is from the place he was created, and this one is from the place she was created.

hebrew_text: ומפני מה האיש מקבל פיוס ואין אשה מקבלת פיוס זה ממקום שנברא וזו ממקום שנבראת
human_translation: And For what a man accept appeasement, but a woman not accept appeasement? because this the place from which he was created, and that the place from which she was created,
llm_translation: And for what reason does the man accept appeasement, while the woman does not accept appeasement? This one is from the place of the created man, and this one is from the place of the created woman.

hebrew_text: מפני מה אשה קולה ערב ואין איש קולו ערב זה ממקום שנברא וזו ממקום שנבראת שנאמר (שיר השירים ב ) כי קולך ערב ומראך נאוה
human_translation: For what is a woman’s voice pleasant, but a man’s voice is not pleasant? This the place from which he was created, and that the place from which she was created, that it is stated “For sweet is your voice, and your countenance is beautiful”
llm_translation: Because why woman her voice sweet and not man his voice sweet this from place created and this from place created as it is said (Song of Songs 2:14) "For your voice is sweet and your appearance is lovely."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך המפלת חתיכה
llm_translation: We will return to you, O fallen piece.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בנות כותים נדות מעריסתן והכותים מטמאים משכב תחתון כעליון מפני שהן בועלי נדות
human_translation: girls menstruating women from their cradle. And the Samaritan impart ritual impurity lower bedding like the upper due to that engage in intercourse with menstruating women.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The daughters of the Kutim are menstrually impure from their cradle, and the Kutim render the lower bed like the upper one, because they engage in sexual relations with menstrually impure women.

hebrew_text: והן יושבות על כל דם ודם
human_translation: And observe for each and every blood,
llm_translation: And they sit on all blood and blood.

hebrew_text: ואין חייבין עליהן על ביאת מקדש ואין שורפין עליהם את התרומה מפני שטומאתן ספק
human_translation: But those is not liable for entering the Temple nor does one burn teruma those because their impurity uncertain.
llm_translation: And not obligated upon them for the entrance of the Temple, and not burn upon them the terumah because their impurity is doubtful.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ה"ד אי דקא חזיין אפילו דידן נמי ואי דלא קחזיין דידהו נמי לא
human_translation: What are the circumstances If who see even our own, also And if who do not see their also not
llm_translation: Gemara: Here it is: if they see, even ours also, and if they do not see, theirs also not.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא בריה דרב אחא בר רב הונא אמר רב ששת הכא במאי עסקינן בסתמא דכיון דאיכא מיעוטא דחזיין חיישינן ומאן תנא דחייש למיעוטא
human_translation: Rava, son of Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna, says Rav Sheshet says: Here we are dealing with an unspecified Since there is a minority who see we are concerned And who taught that one must be concerned for the minority?
llm_translation: Rava, son of Rav Acha, son of Rav Huna, said: Rav Sheshet said, "Here, what are we dealing with? We are dealing with a case of a general principle, for once there is a minority, we are concerned. And who is the Tanna who is concerned for a minority?"

hebrew_text: ר"מ היא דתניא קטן וקטנה לא חולצין ולא מיבמין דברי ר"מ
human_translation: It is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught A minor boy and a minor girl may not perform the ritual through which a yavam frees a yevama of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ], nor may they enter into levirate marriage. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir is the one who taught: "A minor boy and a minor girl do not perform chalitzah or yibum." These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לר"מ יפה אמרת שאין חולצין איש כתוב בפרשה ומקשינן אשה לאיש ומה טעם אין מיבמין
human_translation: said to Rabbi Meir: You have aptly stated that they may not perform ḥalitza , “man” is written in the passage and we compare a woman to a man, But what is the reason they may not enter into levirate marriage?
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Meir: "You have said well that one does not perform 'ḥalizah' with a man written in the Torah, and we ask: a woman to a man, and what is the reason that we do not perform 'levirate marriage'?"

hebrew_text: אמר להן קטן שמא ימצא סריס קטנה שמא תמצא אילונית ונמצאו פוגעין בערוה שלא במקום מצוה
human_translation: said to them: A minor boy lest, he be found a sexually underdeveloped man, a minor girl lest, she be found a sexually underdeveloped woman. And they will be found infringing upon forbidden sexual intercourse where no mitzva applies,
llm_translation: He said to them: A minor, lest he find a minor eunuch, lest he find a heathen woman, and they will come into contact with forbidden relationships not in a place of commandment.

hebrew_text: ורבנן זיל בתר רובא דקטנים ורוב קטנים לאו סריסים נינהו זיל בתר רובא דקטנות ורוב קטנות לאו אילונית נינהו
human_translation: And the Rabbis follows the majority of minor boys, and most minor boys are not sexually underdeveloped men; follows the majority of and most are not sexually underdeveloped women.
llm_translation: The Sages: Go after the majority of minors, and the majority of minors are not eunuchs. Go after the majority of minor females, and the majority of minor females are not barren.

hebrew_text: אימר דשמעת ליה לר"מ מיעוטא דשכיח אבל מיעוטא דלא שכיח מי שמעת ליה
human_translation: say that you heard that Rabbi Meir a common minority, But did you hear him an uncommon minority,
llm_translation: Said (אימר) that you heard (דשמעת) to Rabbi Meir (לר"מ), a limitation (מיעוטא) of common occurrence (דשכיח) but a limitation (מיעוטא) of not common occurrence (דלא שכיח), who heard (מי שמעת) to him.

hebrew_text: הא נמי מיעוטא דשכיח הוא דתניא א"ר יוסי מעשה בעין בול והטבילוה קודם לאמה ואמר רבי מעשה בבית שערים והטבילוה קודם לאמה וא"ר יוסף מעשה בפומבדיתא והטבילוה קודם לאמה
human_translation: This is also a common minority. As it is taught Rabbi Yosei said: an incident in Ein Bul they immersed before her mother. And Rabbi said: an incident in Beit She’arim they immersed before her mother. And Rav Yosef said: an incident in Pumbedita they immersed before her mother.
llm_translation: This too is a case of a common occurrence, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei related an incident in Ein Bul, where they immersed it before its cubit, and Rabbi said: An incident occurred in Beit Sha'arim, where they immersed it before its cubit. And Rabbi Yosef related an incident in Pumbedita, where they immersed it before its cubit.

hebrew_text: בשלמא דר' יוסי ודרבי משום תרומת א"י אלא דרב יוסף למה לי והא אמר שמואל אין תרומת חו"ל אסורה אלא במי שטומאה יוצאה מגופו והני מילי באכילה אבל בנגיעה לא
human_translation: Granted, by Rabbi Yosei and by Rabbi due to the teruma of Eretz Yisrael, But by Rav Yosef, why do I But doesn’t Shmuel say: teruma of outside of Eretz Yisrael is prohibited only to one whose impurity an emission from his body, And this statement with regard to eating but with regard to touching no
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Meir due to the terumah of Eretz Yisrael. But as for Rav Yosef, why do I need it? Didn't Shmuel say that terumah of outside the Land is prohibited, except in the case of one whose impurity departs from his body? And these matters apply to consumption, but not to contact.

hebrew_text: אמר מר זוטרא לא נצרכה אלא לסוכה שמן של תרומה דתניא (ויקרא כב, טו) ולא יחללו את קדשי בני ישראל אשר ירימו לה' לרבות את הסך ואת השותה
human_translation: Mar Zutra says: was necessary only for smearing oil of teruma As it is taught “And they shall not desecrate the sacred items of the children of Israel, which they set apart for the Lord” to include one who smears and one who drinks.
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: It was necessary only for a sukkah made from terumah oil, as it is taught (Leviticus 22:15), "And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the Lord." This includes the anointing and the drinking.

hebrew_text: שותה למה לי קרא שתיה בכלל אכילה אלא לרבות את הסך כשותה ואיבעית אימא מהכא (תהלים קט, יח) ותבא כמים בקרבו וכשמן בעצמותיו
human_translation: Why do I a verse drinks drinking included eating? Rather, to include one who smears, like one who drinks. And if you wish, say from here: “And it came into his innards like water, and like oil into his bones”
llm_translation: "He drinks - why do I need a verse? Drinking is included in eating. Rather, to include the case of one who drinks a potion. And if you wish, say: from here (Psalms 109:18) 'And it came like water within him, and like oil into his bones.'"

hebrew_text: אי הכי דידן נמי
human_translation: If so, our as well.
llm_translation: If so, ours too.

hebrew_text: אנן דדרשינן אשה ואשה וכי חזיין מפרשי להו לא גזרו בהו רבנן אינהו דלא דרשי אשה ואשה וכי חזיין לא מפרשי להו גזרו בהו רבנן

llm_translation: We who expound, "a woman and a woman," and when they see the commentators explaining to them, the Rabbis did not decree upon them. They who do not expound, "a woman and a woman," and when they see, they do not explain to them, the Rabbis decreed upon them.

llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Elma, when Rabbi read 'a daughter of one day,' Rabbi and they raised a contradiction: 'A woman' - I only have a woman who is a minor, three years and one day for intercourse. From where do we derive this? The verse states, 'and a woman.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הלכתא נינהו ואסמכינהו רבנן אקראי הי קרא והי הלכתא אילימא בת יום אחד הלכתא בת שלש שנים ויום אחד קרא קרא סתמא כתיב
human_translation: Rava said: These are halakhot and the Sages supported them with verses. Which a verse and which a halakha If we say a one-day-old a halakha aged three years and one day a verse, the verse is written an unspecified
llm_translation: Rava said: They are a Halacha, and the Rabbis relied upon it. It is a verse, "Akarai" - it is a verse, and it is a Halacha. If you say it was written on one day, the Halacha was established after three years and one day, and the verse was written generally.

hebrew_text: אלא בת ג' שנים ויום אחד הלכתא בת יום אחד קרא ומאחר דהלכתא קרא ל"ל
human_translation: Rather, aged three years and one day a halakha a one-day-old a verse. And now that a halakha why do I a verse?
llm_translation: Rather, with regard to a three-year-old daughter, and one day, the halacha is in accordance with one day. Scripture states, and since the halacha is in accordance with one day, it is derived.

human_translation: to exclude a man from red

human_translation: But that which is taught “woman” I have only woman. From where that a ten-day-old ziva ? The verse states: “And a woman.” Why do I Let one derive from a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: And this that was taught in a Baraita: "A woman, I only have a woman who is the daughter of ten days for zivah, from where do we derive this? The Torah states, 'And a woman, why do I need it? To complete the count of niddah.'"

hebrew_text: צריכא דאי כתב רחמנא בנדה הוה אמינא נדה משום דכי חזאי חד יומא בעיא למיתב ז' אבל זבה דאי חזאי חד יומא בשומרת יום כנגד יום סגי לה אימא לא צריכא

llm_translation: The matter is needed, for if the Merciful One had written "niddah," I would have said "niddah" because when she sees one day, she needs to count seven. But regarding "zavah," if she sees one day, with a day of guarding corresponding to it, it is enough. I would say it is not needed.

hebrew_text: וליכתוב רחמנא בזבה ולא בעי בנדה ואנא ידענא דאין זבה בלא נדה אין ה"נ ואלא קרא למה לי למעוטי איש מאודם
human_translation: And let the Merciful One write in a zava , and not required in menstruating woman, and I would know that cannot a zava without a menstruating woman, Yes, it is indeed so; Rather, why do I verse: to exclude a man from red
llm_translation: And to write "merciful" in the case of a zavah, and not in the case of a niddah, but I know that a zavah without a niddah does not exist, so why does the verse need to exclude a very red man?

hebrew_text: הא מיעטתיה חדא זימנא חד למעוטי משכבת זרע וחד למעוטי מדם
human_translation: But excluded this another occasion, One to exclude from semen, and one serves to exclude from blood
llm_translation: This is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "הא מיעטתיה חדא זימנא חד למעוטי משכבת זרע וחד למעוטי מדם" English translation: "This I have limited one time to exclude seminal emission and one time to exclude blood."

hebrew_text: וכן לענין זכרים דתניא (ויקרא טו, ב) איש איש מה ת"ל איש איש לרבות תינוק בן יום אחד שהוא מטמא בזיבה דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: And so with regard to males, As it is taught any man What the verse states “any man”? to include a one-day-old baby, that he is susceptible to impurity of ziva . the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And similarly regarding males, as it was taught (Leviticus 15:2), "A man, a man" - what is the teaching of "a man, a man"? To include an infant of one day old who can render impure through a seminal emission, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי ישמעאל בנו של ר' יוחנן בן ברוקה אומר אין צריך הרי הוא אומר (ויקרא טו, לג) לזכר ולנקבה לזכר כל שהוא זכר בין שהוא גדול בין שהוא קטן ולנקבה כל שהיא נקבה בין גדולה בין קטנה א"כ מה ת"ל איש איש דברה תורה כלשון בני אדם
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: is not necessary, as states: whether it be a male or a female” “Whether it be a male” anyone who is a male, whether he is an adult whether he is a minor; “or a female” anyone who is a female, whether an adult whether a minor. If so, what the verse states “any man”? The Torah spoke in the language of people,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka, says: "It is not necessary." For behold, it says (Leviticus 15:33), "For male and for female." For male, any that is male, whether he is adult or minor, and for female, any that is female, whether she is adult or minor. If so, why does the Torah state, "a man, a man"? The Torah speaks in the language of people.

hebrew_text: אלמא כי מרבי קרא בן יום אחד מרבי ורמינהו איש אין לי אלא איש בן תשע שנים ויום אחד מנין ת"ל (ויקרא טו ) ואיש
human_translation: Apparently, when the verse includes includes a one-day-old. But raise a contradiction “man” I have only a man From where aged nine years and one day The verse states: “And a man.”
llm_translation: It is evident that when Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi expounded upon the verse "a man," he derived it from the fact that the Torah specifically mentions "a man" who is nine years old and one day. How do we know this? The Torah states (Leviticus 15), "and a man."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הלכתא נינהו ואסמכינהו רבנן אקראי הי הלכתא והי קרא אילימא בן יום אחד הלכתא ובן ט' שנים ויום אחד קרא קרא סתמא כתיב
human_translation: Rava said: These are halakhot and the Sages supported them with verses. Which is a halakha and which is a verse? If we say a one-day-old a halakha and aged nine years and one day a verse, the verse is written an unspecified
llm_translation: Rava said: They are a Halacha, and the Rabbis supported it with a verse. It is a verse from the Torah, and it is a verse. If you say that a one-day-old child is a Halacha, and a child of nine years and one day is a verse, then a verse is written without specification.

hebrew_text: אלא בן ט' שנים ויום אחד הלכתא ובן יום א' קרא וכי מאחר דהלכתא היא קרא למה לי למעוטי אשה מלובן
human_translation: Rather, aged nine years and one day a halakha and a one-day-old a verse. And now that is a halakha why do I a verse? to exclude a woman from a white
llm_translation: Rather, if a boy is nine years and one day old, he is obligated in the law, and if a boy is one day old, he is obligated in reading the Torah. And since the law is derived from the verse, why is the verse needed? To exclude a woman from wearing white garments.

hebrew_text: למה לי למכתב בזכרים ולמה לי למכתב בנקבות
human_translation: Why do I to write with regard to males, and why do I to write with regard to females?
llm_translation: For what to me for writing in males and for what to me for writing in females.

hebrew_text: צריכי דאי כתב רחמנא בזכרים משום דמטמאו בראיות כבימים אבל נקבות דלא מטמאו בראיות כבימים אימא לא
human_translation: are necessary. As, if the Merciful One had written concerning males, because as they are rendered impure through sightings like through days. But females, who are not rendered impure through sightings as through days, say not
llm_translation: Required, for if the Merciful One wrote "males" it is because they become impure through emissions like days, but females who do not become impure through emissions like days, I would say no.

hebrew_text: ואי כתב רחמנא בנקבות משום דקמטמו באונס אבל זכרים דלא מטמאו באונס אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written with regard to females, because they are rendered impure due to circumstances beyond control. But males, who are not rendered impure due to circumstances beyond control, say not necessary.
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One wrote the laws of impurity due to females, it is because they are compelled to engage in relations by force. But males, who are not compelled to engage in relations by force, one might say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: הכותים מטמאין משכב תחתון כעליון מאי משכב תחתון כעליון אילימא דאי איכא י' מצעות ויתיב עלייהו מטמו להו פשיטא דהא דרס להו
human_translation: And the Samaritan impart ritual impurity lower bedding like upper What lower bedding like upper If we say that if there are ten mattresses and sat upon them, rendered impure, obvious, since he presses them
llm_translation: The Kutim render impure the lower bed like the upper bed. What is the lower bed like the upper bed? If there are ten mattresses and he sits on them, they become impure. It is obvious that he presses down on them.

hebrew_text: אלא שיהא תחתונו של בועל נדה כעליונו של זב מה עליונו של זב אינו מטמא אלא אוכלין ומשקין אף תחתונו של בועל נדה אינו מטמא אלא אוכלין ומשקין
human_translation: Rather, that beneath engages in intercourse with a menstruating woman is like above a zav , just as upper of a zav imparts impurity only food and drink so too, beneath engages in intercourse with a menstruating woman imparts ritual impurity only food and drink.
llm_translation: Rather, that the lower part of one who has intercourse with a menstruating woman should be like the upper part of a man with a genital discharge. Just as the upper part of a man with a genital discharge only renders food and drink susceptible to impurity, so too the lower part of one who has intercourse with a menstruating woman only renders food and drink susceptible to impurity.

hebrew_text: עליונו של זב מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא טו, י) וכל הנוגע בכל אשר יהיה תחתיו יטמא מאי תחתיו

llm_translation: The discharge of a male afflicted with a genital issue, how do we know its impurity? As it is written (Leviticus 15:10), "And whoever touches anything that was under him shall be impure." What does "under him" mean?

hebrew_text: מתני׳ דם עובדת כוכבים ודם טהרה של מצורעת ב"ש מטהרים ובית הלל אומרים כרוקה וכמימי רגליה
human_translation: blood of gentile woman and blood by leper of purity Beit Shammai deem ritually pure, and Beit Hillel say: like her saliva and her urine,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The blood of an idolatrous sacrifice and the blood of a woman's purification offering - Beit Shammai declare them pure, and Beit Hillel say they are like saliva and like the waters of her feet.

hebrew_text: דם היולדת שלא טבלה ב"ש אומרים כרוקה וכמימי רגליה וב"ה אומרים מטמא לח ויבש
human_translation: the blood of a woman who gave birth who did not immerse Beit Shammai say: like her saliva and her urine, And Beit Hillel say: imparts impurity moist or dry.
llm_translation: The blood of a woman who gave birth without immersing in a mikveh, Beit Shammai says it is like saliva and like the waters of her feet, and Beit Hillel says it is impure whether it is wet or dry.

hebrew_text: ומודים ביולדת בזוב שהיא מטמאה לח ויבש
human_translation: And concede in a woman who gives birth as a zava , that she imparts impurity moist or dry.
llm_translation: And they agree regarding a woman in childbirth with regard to a seminal emission, that she renders others impure through contact and carrying.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ולית להו לב"ש (ויקרא טו, ב) דבר אל בני ישראל ואמרת אליהם איש איש כי יהיה זב בני ישראל מטמאין בזיבה ואין העובדי כוכבים מטמאין בזיבה אבל גזרו עליהן שיהו כזבין לכל דבריהם
human_translation: And do Beit Shammai not accept “Speak to the children of Israel and say to them, when any man has an issue [ zav ] the children of Israel become impure through ziva and gentiles do not become impure through ziva , but decreed concerning them that they shall be like zavin in all their matters
llm_translation: Gemara: And Beit Shammai do not have a source to support their opinion (Leviticus 15:2), "Speak to the children of Israel and say to them: When any man has a discharge from his body, his discharge is unclean." The children of Israel become impure through a discharge, but idolaters do not become impure through a discharge. However, it was decreed upon them that they should be considered like those who are impure in all their matters.

hebrew_text: אמרי לך ב"ש (ההוא בזכרים איתמר דאי בנקבות) היכי לעביד ליטמא לח ויבש עשיתו כשל תורה ליטמי לח ולא ליטמי יבש חלקת בשל תורה
human_translation: Beit Shammai say to you this was stated with regard to males, As, if with regard to females, how should one act Should impart impurity moist or dry? you have rendered it like by Torah should impart impurity moist and it should not impart impurity dry. you differentiated with regard to that Torah
llm_translation: They said to you, Beit Shammai: (Regarding that case of a male, it was stated that if it is in females,) how can one make it ritually impure with moist and dry? You have made it a stumbling block for the Torah to become ritually impure with moist and not to become ritually impure with dry, a division in the Torah.

hebrew_text: אי הכי רוקה ומימי רגליה נמי כיון דעבדינן היכרא בדמה מידע ידיע דרוקה ומימי רגליה דרבנן
human_translation: If so, the saliva and urine of also Since we implement a conspicuous marker with regard to the blood of will know that her saliva and her urine by rabbinic
llm_translation: If so, spitting and the waters of her feet also, since we establish recognition by her blood, it is known that recognition of spitting and the waters of her feet is Rabbinic.

hebrew_text: ולעביד היכרא ברוקה ומימי רגליה ולטמויי לדמה רוקה ומימי רגליה דשכיחי גזרו בהו רבנן דמה דלא שכיחא לא גזרו ביה רבנן
human_translation: And let them implement a conspicuous marker with regard to the saliva and urine of and let them deem her blood impure her saliva and her urine, which are common, the Sages decreed they her blood, which is not common, the Sages did not decree it
llm_translation: To make recognition in a pool and from the waters of her feet, and to immerse for the sake of comparison to the waters of her feet, since they are common, the Rabbis decreed regarding them. But something that is not common, the Rabbis did not decree regarding it.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא זובו טמא אפילו לב"ש קריו טהור אפילו לב"ה
human_translation: Rava says: The ziva of ritually impure, even according to Beit Shammai, the semen of pure, even according to Beit Hillel,
llm_translation: Rava said: His zov renders him impure, even according to Beit Shammai his reading is pure, even according to Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: זובו טמא אפילו לב"ש דהא איכא למעבד היכרא בקריו
human_translation: The ziva of impure, even according to Beit Shammai, as it is to implement a conspicuous marker with his semen,
llm_translation: His emission is impure even according to Beit Shammai, for there is a way to recognize it in his discharge.

hebrew_text: קריו טהור אפי' לב"ה עבוד ביה רבנן היכרא כי היכי דלא לשרוף עליה תרומה וקדשים
human_translation: the semen of ritually pure, even according to Beit Hillel. the Sages implement a conspicuous marker with regard to it in order that they will not to burn teruma and consecrated that
llm_translation: Its reading is pure even for the Holy Temple service, the Rabbis recognized it, so that it should not be burned with it Trumah and holy items.

hebrew_text: ולעביד היכרא בזובו ולטמויי לקריו זובו דלא תלי במעשה גזרו ביה רבנן קריו דתלי במעשה לא גזרו ביה רבנן
human_translation: And let implement a conspicuous marker with regard to the ziva of and let them deem his semen impure. his ziva , which is not dependent on an action the Sages decreed it his semen, which is dependent on an action the Sages did not decree it
llm_translation: To make recognition in his zov and to conceal for his keri, his zov which does not depend on an action, the Rabbis decreed upon it; his keri which depends on an action, the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: לימא מסייע ליה עובדת כוכבים שפלטה שכבת זרע מישראל טמאה ובת ישראל שפלטה שכבת זרע מן העובד כוכבי' טהורה מאי לאו טהורה גמורה לא טהורה מדאורייתא טמאה מדרבנן
human_translation: Let us say supports a gentile woman who discharged semen from a Jew impure, And a Jewish woman who discharged semen from a gentile, pure. What, is it not entirely pure, No, pure by Torah law impure by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him, a worshipper of stars, if she emitted semen, a daughter of Israel, is impure, and a daughter of Israel, if she emitted semen from a worshipper of stars, is pure. What, is she not completely pure? Not completely pure from the Torah, impure from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: ת"ש נמצאת אומר שכבת זרע של ישראל טמאה בכל מקום
human_translation: Come hear You are found say the semen of a Jew is impure wherever
llm_translation: Come and hear: It was found that he says the emission of semen of an Israelite is impure in every place.

hebrew_text: ואפי' במעי עובדת כוכבים ושל עובד כוכבים טהור' בכל מקום ואפי' במעי ישראלית חוץ ממי רגלים שבה
human_translation: even in the womb of a gentile woman. And of a gentile is ritually pure wherever even in the womb of a Jewish woman, except for urine that with it.
llm_translation: And even in the womb of a non-Jewess and of a Jewess, the fetus is pure in every place, and even in the womb of a Jewess, except for the amniotic fluid within it.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא ה"נ טהור' מדאוריית' אבל טמאה מדרבנן אטו מי רגליה מדאורייתא מי מטמאו אלא ש"מ טהורה אפילו מדרבנן ש"מ
human_translation: And if you would say as well, ritually pure by Torah law but impure by rabbinic is that to say her urine, ritually impure by Torah law? Rather, conclude from pure even by rabbinic law. conclude from it
llm_translation: And if you will say, "So too, pure from the Torah, but impure from the Rabbis, does that mean that her legs are impure from the Torah? Rather, learn from this that she is pure even from the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: אמר מר שכבת זרע של ישראל טמאה בכ"מ אפי' במעי עובדת כוכבים תפשוט דבעי רב פפא דבעי רב פפא שכבת זרע של ישראל במעי עובדת כוכבים מהו
human_translation: The Master said The semen of a Jew is impure wherever even in the womb of a gentile woman. Let one resolve that Rav Pappa raises. As Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: What is semen of a Jew in the womb of a gentile woman?
llm_translation: Master said: The emission of seed of an Israelite is impure in a cavity of the body, even in the womb of a non-Jew. Rav Pappa asked: Does Rav Pappa require that the emission of seed of an Israelite in the womb of a non-Jew be impure?

hebrew_text: בתוך ג' לא קמיבעיא ליה לרב פפא כי קמיבעיא ליה לאחר ג' מאי
human_translation: does not raise his dilemma within three when raises his dilemma three after What
llm_translation: Within three days it was not asked to Rav Papa. When it was asked to him after three days, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: ישראל דדייגי במצות חביל גופייהו ומסריח עובדי כוכבים דלא דייגי במצות לא חביל גופייהו ולא מסריח או דילמא כיון דאכלי שקצים ורמשים חביל גופייהו ומסריח תיקו
human_translation: Jewish are concerned about mitzvot, their bodies are hot and becomes foul gentile are not concerned about mitzvot their bodies are not hot and does not become foul Or perhaps, since eat repugnant creatures and creeping animals, their bodies are hot and becomes foul shall stand
llm_translation: Israel, who fish in the commandments, their bodies are healthy, and they stink. Idolaters who do not fish in the commandments, neither are their bodies healthy nor do they stink. Or perhaps, since they eat abominations and creeping things, their bodies are healthy and they do not stink. Let it stand.

hebrew_text: דם טהרה של מצורעת ב"ש כו' מאי טעמא דב"ה אמר ר' יצחק לזכר לרבות מצורע למעינותיו ולנקבה לרבות מצורעת למעינותיה
human_translation: blood by leper of purity Beit Shammai What is the reasoning of Beit Hillel, Rabbi Yitzḥak says: “Whether it be a male” to include the sources of a male leper, “or a female” to include the sources of a female leper,
llm_translation: Blood of purification of a woman with tzara'at, Beit Shammai, etc. What is the reason of Beit Hillel? Rabbi Yitzchak said: "To include the male for his private parts, and the female to include the female for her private parts."

hebrew_text: מאי מעינותיה אילימא שאר מעינותיה מזכר נפקא אלא לדמה לטמא דם טהרה שלה
human_translation: What sources If we say the rest of her sources, derived from a male Rather, to her blood, to render impure blood her purity.
llm_translation: What are its springs? If you say that its other springs are male, it emerges that it is similar to the impure blood of her purity.

hebrew_text: וב"ש נקבה מזכר לא אתיא דאיכא למיפרך מה לזכר שכן טעון פריעה ופרימה ואסור בתשמיש המטה תאמר בנקבה דלא
human_translation: And Beit Shammai, a female cannot be derived from a male as can be refuted What about a male in that he is required to let his hair grow and rend his garments, and he is prohibited to sexual intercourse. you say, of a female to not
llm_translation: And Beit Shammai: A female from a male does not come, for there is to distinguish between them - just as for a male, it requires circumcision and immersion, and is prohibited in marital relations, so too for a female, it is not.

hebrew_text: וב"ה לכתוב רחמנא בנקבה ולא בעי זכר ואנא אמינא ומה נקבה שאינה טעונה פריעה ופרימה ואינה אסורה בתשמיש המטה רבי רחמנא מעינותיה זכר לא כ"ש
human_translation: And Beit Hillel let the Merciful One write with regard to a female And no need a male I will say And what, a female who is not required to let her hair grow and rend her garments, and is not prohibited to sexual intercourse, the Merciful One includes her sources a male not all the more so
llm_translation: "And in the academy of Hillel it is written: 'The Merciful One desires the offering from a female, and not from a male.' And I say: 'But what about a female who does not require adornment and preparation, and is not prohibited in marital relations?' Rabbi Rahmana, from his actions, desires a male, needless to say."

hebrew_text: אם אינו ענין לזכר תנהו ענין לנקבה ואם אינו ענין למעינותיה תנהו ענין לדמה לטמא דם טהרה שלה
human_translation: if is not matter of a male apply it matter of a female And if it is not matter of her sources apply it matter of her blood, to render impure blood of her purity.
llm_translation: If it is not relevant to the male, attribute it to the female. And if it is not relevant to its species, attribute it to a similar impure blood of purity.

hebrew_text: וב"ש זכר מנקבה לא אתיא דאיכא למיפרך מה לנקבה שכן מטמאה מאונס תאמר בזכר דלא
human_translation: And Beit Shammai a male cannot be derived from a female as can be refuted What about a female? in that she is rendered impure due to circumstances beyond control. you say of a male, whom not
llm_translation: And Beit Shammai say: "Remember a male from a female does not come," for there is room to refute: "Just as with a female, who thus renders others impure through rape, you would say the same with a male, who does not render others impure."

hebrew_text: וב"ה קיימי במצורע ופרכי מילי דזב וב"ש שום טומאה פרכי
human_translation: And Beit Hillel standing with a leper, and refute matters to a zav ? And Beit Shammai? they refute name of impurity
llm_translation: And in the study hall, they were discussing matters of a leper and issues of a seminal emission, and Beit Shammai says: any impurity issues are matters of a seminal emission.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא אמרי לך ב"ש האי לזכר מיבעי ליה לזכר כל שהוא זכר (האי) בין גדול בין קטן ובית הלל נפקא להו מזאת תורת הזב בין גדול בין קטן
human_translation: And if you wish, say Beit Shammai say to you: That “whether it be a male” is necessary to “whether it be a male” anyone who is a male, whether an adult or a minor, And Beit Hillel They derive from “This is the law of the zav , whether an adult or whether a minor.
llm_translation: If you ask, say: Beit Shammai say, "This requirement is for a male, it must be for a male, any male, whether adult or minor." And Beit Hillel deduced from this verse regarding the laws of a zav, whether adult or minor.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף כי פשיט רבי שמעון בן לקיש בזב בעי הכי ראייה ראשונה של זב קטן מהו שתטמא במגע (ויקרא טו, לב) זאת תורת הזב ואשר תצא ממנו שכבת זרע אמר רחמנא
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: When Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish taught of a zav , he raised this dilemma: first sighting of a zav minor, what is as to it imparts impurity through contact? the Merciful One states: “This is the law of the zav , and of him from whom the flow of seed goes out”
llm_translation: Said Rav Yosef: When Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish stated explicitly, in the case of a Zav, he asked thus: The initial proof for a minor Zav, what is the law if he becomes impure through contact? (Leviticus 15:32) "This is the law of the Zav, and of him that hath an issue, and of the man who lieth with his seed." The Merciful One said...

hebrew_text: כל ששכבת זרע שלו מטמא ראייה ראשונה שלו מטמאה והאי כיון דשכבת זרע שלו לא מטמאה ראייה ראשונה נמי לא תטמא או דילמא כיון דאילו איהו חזי תרתי מצטרפא מטמיא
human_translation: any whose semen imparts impurity, his first sighting imparts impurity. And this since his semen does not impart impurity, his first sighting does not impart impurity either. Or perhaps, since if sees two combines render him impure
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "kol she'shachvat zera'o shelo metamei re'iyah rishonah shelo metame'ah veha'i ki'yevun de'shachvat zera'o lo metame'ah re'iyah rishonah nami lo titma o dilma ki'yevun de'ilu ihu chazi tartei mitztarefa metamya." English translation: "All that his semen lies, his initial sight is impure, and this, since his semen does not impurify his initial sight, also does not impurify, or perhaps, since he sees two, it combines and impurifies."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ת"ש זאת תורת הזב בין גדול בין קטן מה גדול ראייה ראשונה שלו מטמא אף קטן ראייה ראשונה נמי מטמא
human_translation: Rava says: Come hear “This is the law of the zav ,” whether an adult whether a minor. just as an adult his first sighting imparts impurity, so too, a minor, first sighting imparts impurity as well.
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear: This is the law of the one with a discharge, whether an adult or a minor. Just as an adult's initial sighting renders him impure, so too a minor's initial sighting renders him impure.

hebrew_text: בעי רב יוסף ראייה ראשונה של מצורע מהו שתטמא במשא מקום זיבה מעין הוא ומטמא או דילמא לאו מעין הוא
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises a dilemma: first sighting of a leper, what is as to it imparts impurity through carrying? place of ziva is a source, and imparts impurity Or perhaps is not a source,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef inquired: The initial sighting of a metzora, what is the law if he becomes impure through carrying in a place of zavah? Is it similar and imparts impurity, or perhaps it is not similar?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ת"ש (ויקרא טו, ב) זובו טמא הוא לימד על הזוב שהוא טמא במאי אילימא בזב גרידא
human_translation: Rava says: Come hear his issue [ zovo ] is unclean” teaches with regard to the zov that it is impure, To what If we say to just a zav
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear. "His discharge is unclean" (Leviticus 15:2) - this teaches about the discharge that it is unclean. With what? If you say with a seminal emission...

hebrew_text: לאחרים גורם טומאה לעצמו לא כל שכן אלא פשיטא בזב מצורע
human_translation: causes impurity for others, not all the more so itself Rather, obvious to a zav a leper.
llm_translation: To others causes impurity for himself not all the more rather obvious in a zav a metzora.

hebrew_text: ומדאיצטריך קרא לרבויי בראייה שניה שמע מינה מקום זיבה לאו מעין הוא
human_translation: And From a verse was necessary to include a second sighting conclude from it place of ziva is not a source.
llm_translation: And from where do we require a verse for the amplification of the matter in the second case? Learn from it that a place of zivah is not like a ma'ayan.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב יהודה מדסקרתא לרבא ממאי דילמא לעולם אימא לך בזב גרידא ודקאמרת לאחרים גורם טומאה לעצמו לא כל שכן שעיר המשתלח יוכיח שגורם טומאה לאחרים והוא עצמו טהור
human_translation: Rav Yehuda of Diskarta said to Rava: From where Actually, perhaps I will say to you to just a zav . And that that you said: causes impurity for others, not all the more so itself scapegoat will prove as it causes impurity to others, and itself is pure,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah of Diskarta to Rava: From what? Perhaps I should say to you, "With regard to a Zav, a clod of earth," and you said to others, "He causes impurity to himself, all the more so the scapegoat should prove that it causes impurity to others, yet it itself is pure."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מאי תבעי ליה והא הוא דאמר זאת תורת הזב בין גדול בין קטן וכיון דנפקא ליה מהתם אייתר ליה לזכר לרבות מצורע למעינותיו נקבה לרבות מצורעת למעינותיה
human_translation: Abaye said: What he raises a dilemma? But it was he who said “This is the law of the zav ” whether an adult whether a minor. And since he derives from there, remains for him “Whether it be a male” to include a male leper to his sources a female” to include a female leper to her sources
llm_translation: Abbaye said: What does he require of it? But he who said, "This is the Torah of the one with a discharge, whether great or small," and once he deduced from there, he brought it to include a male for the sake of a leper with his male organs, and a female to include a female for the sake of a leper with her female organs.

hebrew_text: ואקשיה רחמנא מצורע לזב גמור מה זב גמור מטמא במשא אף ראייה ראשונה של מצורע מטמא במשא
human_translation: And the Merciful One compares a leper to a full-fledged zav : Just as a full-fledged zav imparts impurity through carrying, so too, first sighting of a leper imparts impurity through carrying.
llm_translation: And the Merciful One juxtaposed a complete zav to a complete metzora; just as a complete zav renders impure through carrying, so too the initial sighting of a metzora renders impure through carrying.

hebrew_text: א"ר הונא ראייה ראשונה של זב מטמאה באונס שנאמר (ויקרא טו, לב) זאת תורת הזב ואשר תצא ממנו שכבת זרע מה שכבת זרע מטמא באונס אף ראייה ראשונה של זב מטמאה באונס
human_translation: Rav Huna says: first sighting of a zav imparts ritual impurity due to circumstances beyond control, as it is stated: “This is the law of the zav , and of him from whom the flow of seed goes out” Just as semen imparts impurity due to circumstances beyond control, so too, first sighting of a zav imparts impurity due to circumstances beyond control.
llm_translation: Rabbi Huna said: The initial sighting of a Zav renders impure due to coercion, as it is stated (Leviticus 15:32), "This is the law of the Zav, and that which issues from him is seminal emission." Just as seminal emission renders impure due to coercion, so too the initial sighting of a Zav renders impure due to coercion.

hebrew_text: תא שמע ראה ראייה ראשונה בודקין אותו מאי לאו לטומאה לא לקרבן
human_translation: Come hear saw a first sighting one examines him What, is it not to ritual impurity, No, to an offering
llm_translation: Come and hear, see the first sighting, we examine it. What is it? Not for impurity, not for sacrifice.

hebrew_text: ת"ש בשניה בודקין אותו למאי אילימא לקרבן אבל לטומאה לא אקרי כאן מבשרו ולא מחמת אונסו אלא לאו לטומאה ומדסיפא לטומאה רישא נמי לטומאה
human_translation: Come hear When the second one examines him For what If we say to an offering but not to ritual impurity, read here out of his flesh” not due to circumstances beyond his control. Rather, is it not to ritual impurity? And from that the latter clause for impurity, the first clause also for impurity.
llm_translation: Come and hear: In the second clause, they examine it for what? If you say for the purpose of a sacrifice, but not for impurity, it is not called here from its flesh, and not from the cause of its compulsion, rather, is it not for impurity? And the latter part is also for impurity, and the beginning part is also for impurity.

hebrew_text: מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is.
llm_translation: From the house of Irya, this is as it was said, and this is as it was said.

hebrew_text: תא שמע רבי אליעזר אומר אף בשלישי בודקין אותו מפני הקרבן מכלל דתנא קמא מפני הטומאה קאמר
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Eliezer says: Even the third one examines him, because of the offering. by inference that the first is saying for ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Even on the third day, they examine it because of the sacrifice." Is it not inferred from the first Tanna that he is saying they examine it because of impurity?

hebrew_text: לא דכולי עלמא לקרבן והכא באתים קא מיפלגי רבנן לא דרשי אתים ורבי אליעזר דריש אתים
human_translation: No, everyone agrees to an offering. And here they disagree with regard to “ et ” The Rabbis do not interpret “ et ,” and Rabbi Eliezer interprets “ et .”
llm_translation: Not everyone regarding the offering, and here they dispute the Rabbis, not interpret "offerings," and Rabbi Eliezer interprets "offerings."

hebrew_text: רבנן לא דרשי אתים הזב חדא זובו תרתי לזכר בשלישי אקשיה רחמנא לנקבה
human_translation: The Rabbis do not interpret “ et .” “ Hazav ” one “ zovo ” two “Whether it be a male,” for the third the Merciful One compares to a female,
llm_translation: The sages did not expound: "A man who has a discharge, one discharge, two discharges, for a male, on the third day, the Merciful One decreed it for a female."

hebrew_text: ורבי אליעזר דריש אתים הזב חדא את תרתי זובו תלת ברביעי אקשיה רחמנא לנקבה
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer interprets “ et .” “ Hazav ” one “ et ” two “ zovo ” three for the fourth the Merciful One compares to a female,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer expounded: "A woman who emits two discharges, one discharge and two discharges on the fourth day, the Merciful One has equated them to a female."

hebrew_text: תא שמע רבי יצחק אומר והלא זב בכלל בעל קרי היה ולמה יצא להקל עליו ולהחמיר עליו להקל עליו שאין מטמא באונס ולהחמיר עליו
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yitzḥak says: But wasn’t a zav included in one who experienced a seminal emission? Why, was he taken out to be lenient with him and to be stringent with him to be lenient with him, as he is not rendered impure through due to circumstances beyond control, And to be stringent with him,
llm_translation: Come and hear! Rabbi Yitzchak says, "But isn't a Zav included in the category of a Baal Keri? And why did the Torah go out of its way to be lenient regarding him and then stringent regarding him? To be lenient regarding him because he does not become impure through an accident, and to be stringent regarding him..."

hebrew_text: שהוא עושה משכב ומושב
human_translation: as he renders bedding and seat
llm_translation: He who makes a bed and a seat.

hebrew_text: אימת אילימא בראייה שניה היכא הוה בכלל בעל קרי אלא פשיטא בראייה ראשונה וקתני להקל עליו שאינו מטמא באונס
human_translation: When If we say to second sighting where was included in one who experienced a seminal emission? Rather, obvious to first sighting. And teaches: to be lenient with him, as is not rendered impure through due to circumstances beyond control.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When is this? If we say it is in the second sighting, where was it included in the category of Ba'al Keri? Rather, it is obvious that it is in the first sighting, and it teaches to be lenient with him that he does not become impure due to circumstances beyond his control.

hebrew_text: ותסברא להחמיר עליו שהוא עושה משכב ומושב בראייה ראשונה בר משכב ומושב הוא
human_translation: And how can you understand to to be stringent with him, as he renders bedding and seat With the first sighting is fit bedding or seat?
llm_translation: And she thought to be stringent upon him, for he is making a bed and seat in the first sight, bar of bed and seat he is.

hebrew_text: אלא הכי קאמר רבי יצחק אומר והלא זב בכלל בעל קרי היה בראייה ראשונה ולמה יצא בראייה שנייה להקל עליו ולהחמיר עליו להקל עליו שאינו מטמא באונס ולהחמיר עליו שהוא עושה משכב ומושב
human_translation: Rather, this he is saying: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: But wasn’t a zav with first sighting included one who experienced a seminal emission? Why, was he taken out with regard to second sighting? to be lenient with him and to be stringent with him. to be lenient with him, as he is not rendered impure due to circumstances beyond control. And to be stringent with him, as he renders bedding and seat
llm_translation: Thus said Rabbi Yitzchak: A Zav is indeed included in the category of a Baal Keri in the first instance. And why did he come out in the second instance? To be lenient towards him and to be stringent towards him. To be lenient towards him so that he does not become impure due to circumstances beyond his control, and to be stringent towards him because he engages in marital relations.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא זוב דומה למי בצק של שעורים זוב בא מבשר המת שכבת זרע בא מבשר החי זוב דיהה ודומה ללובן ביצה המוזרת שכבת זרע קשורה ודומה ללובן ביצה שאינה מוזרת
human_translation: Rav Huna says: ziva is similar to water of barley dough. ziva comes from dead flesh, semen comes from living flesh, ziva is runny, and is similar to the white of a unfertilized egg. semen is viscous, and is similar to the white of an egg that is not unfertilized,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A male seminal emission is similar to water mixed with barley dough. A seminal emission that comes from a dead body is like the flesh of the dead. Seminal emission that comes from living flesh is like the flesh of the living. Female seminal emission is similar to the white of a foreign egg, the semen is tied. And it is similar to the white of an egg that is not foreign.

hebrew_text: דם היולדת שלא טבלה וכו'
human_translation: the blood of a woman who gave birth did not immerse
llm_translation: The blood of a birthing woman who did not immerse, etc.

hebrew_text: תניא אמרו להן בית הלל לבית שמאי אי אתם מודים בנדה שלא טבלה וראתה דם שהיא טמאה אמרו להם בית שמאי לא אם אמרתם בנדה שאפילו טבלה וראתה טמאה תאמרו ביולדת שאם טבלה וראתה שהיא טהורה
human_translation: is taught Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: Do you not concede with regard to a menstruating woman who did not immerse and saw blood, that she is impure Beit Shammai said to them: No, if you say with regard to a menstruating woman, that even she immersed and saw impure. Will you say with regard to a woman who gave birth, that if she immersed and saw she is pure?
llm_translation: It was taught: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai, "Do you agree regarding a menstruating woman who did not immerse and saw blood, that she is impure?" Beit Shammai said to them, "No. If you say regarding a menstruating woman that even if she immersed and saw blood she is impure, then should you say regarding a woman who gave birth that if she immersed and saw blood she is pure?"

hebrew_text: אמרו להם יולדת בזוב תוכיח שאם טבלה וראתה לאחר ימי ספירה טהורה לא טבלה וראתה טמאה
human_translation: said to a woman who gives birth as a zava will prove that if she immersed and saw after days of counting pure, she did not immerse and she saw impure.
llm_translation: They said to her: A woman who gave birth to a child with a discharge shall prove, if she immersed and saw after the days of counting, she is pure; if she did not immerse and saw, she is impure.

hebrew_text: אמרו להם הוא הדין והיא התשובה
human_translation: said to them: The same is true and is the refutation,
llm_translation: They said to them: "He is the judgment, and she is the response."

hebrew_text: למימרא דפליגי והתנן ומודים ביולדת בזוב שהיא מטמאה לח ויבש

llm_translation: To say that they argue? But we learned: "And they agree regarding a woman who gave birth in a state of Zavah, that she renders objects unclean through touch and carrying."

hebrew_text: והתניא יולדת בזוב שספרה ולא טבלה וראתה הלכו בית שמאי לשיטתן וב"ה לשיטתן
human_translation: And it is taught a woman who gives birth as a zava , who counted but did not immerse, and saw Beit Shammai follow their opinion and Beit Hillel follow their opinion.
