human_translation: And if you wish, say to continuously discharges But teaches counted
llm_translation: And if you wish, say "in a shofet," but doesn't it teach "seferah"?

hebrew_text: הכא ביולדת נקבה בזוב עסקינן דשבוע קמא פסקה שבוע בתרא לא פסקה וקסבר ימי לידתה שאין רואה בהן עולין לה לספירת זיבתה
human_translation: Here we are dealing with a woman who gave birth to a female as a zava , where first week ceased, latter week did not cease, And holds: The days of her birth, in which she does not see count for her toward the counting of her ziva .
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with a female who gave birth with regard to a case of zavah. The first week she ceased bleeding, the second week she did not cease. And he holds the opinion that the days of her childbirth do not count towards the counting of her zivah.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי אמר לן רב שמן מסכרא אקלע מר זוטרא לאתרין ודרש הילכתא כוותיה דרב לחומרא והלכתא כוותיה דלוי לחומרא
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Rav Shemen from Sikhra said to us: Mar Zutra happened to our locale, and he taught the halakha is in accordance with of Rav as a stringency, and the halakha is in accordance with of Levi as a stringency.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Rav Shemen from Maskara came to the town of Zutra and expounded the halakha in accordance with the stringency of Rav and the halakha in accordance with the stringency of Levi.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר הלכתא כוותיה דרב בין לקולא בין לחומרא דריש מרימר הלכתא כוותיה דרב בין לקולא בין לחומרא והלכתא כוותיה דרב בין לקולא בין לחומרא
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The halakha in accordance with of Rav, whether as a leniency or as a stringency. Mareimar taught: The halakha in accordance with of Rav, whether as a leniency or as a stringency. And the halakha in accordance with of Rav, whether as a leniency or as a stringency.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The halacha follows the opinion of Rav, whether for leniency or for stringency. Reish Lakish said: The halacha follows the opinion of Rav, whether for leniency or for stringency. And the halacha follows the opinion of Rav, whether for leniency or for stringency.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המקשה נדה קשתה שלשה ימים בתוך י"א יום ושפתה מעת לעת וילדה הרי זו יולדת בזוב דברי רבי אליעזר
human_translation: who experiences pains, , a menstruating woman. she experienced pains three days within the eleven days , and she rested for period, i.e., , and gave birth, , this is one who gives birth as a zava . the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who experiences difficulty in menstruation, her period lasts for three days within an interval of eleven days, and her bleeding is intermittent, if she gives birth, she is considered to be giving birth with a discharge. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: רבי יהושע אומר לילה ויום כלילי שבת ויומו ששפתה מן הצער ולא מן הדם
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: a night and day, like Shabbat evening and its day. where she rested from the pain but not from the blood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "The night and day of the Sabbath are like a complete entity, its speech is from sorrow and not from blood."

hebrew_text: כמה היא קישויה ר' מאיר אומר אפילו ארבעים וחמשים יום רבי יהודה אומר דיה חדשה ר' יוסי ור' שמעון אומרים אין קישוי יותר משתי שבתות
human_translation: How long is her pains, Rabbi Meir says: Even forty or fifty days Rabbi Yehuda says: sufficient month her Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: pains not more than two weeks
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "How long is the period of recognition? Rabbi Meir says: Even forty or fifty days. Rabbi Yehuda says: A new moon. Rabbi Yosi and Rabbi Shimon say: Recognition does not exceed two Sabbaths."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אטו כל המקשה נדה היא
human_translation: Is this to say that any who experiences pains is a menstruating woman?
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it so that anyone who challenges is a niddah?

hebrew_text: אמר רב נדה ליומא ושמואל אמר חיישינן שמא תשפה
human_translation: Rav said: a menstruating woman for day, And Shmuel said: we are concerned lest she rest
llm_translation: Rav Niddah said to Yoma, and Shmuel said: "We are concerned that she might smear."

hebrew_text: ור' יצחק אמר המקשה אינה כלום והקתני המקשה נדה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: who experiences pains is nothing, But isn’t it taught who experiences pains a menstruating woman?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: "The one who challenges, it is nothing." And the Tanna taught: "The one who challenges is a menstruant."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא בימי נדה נדה בימי זיבה טהורה והתניא המקשה בימי נדה נדה בימי זיבה טהורה
human_translation: Rava said: during the days of menstruation, a menstruating woman; during the days of ziva , pure. And it is taught who experiences pains during the days of menstruation during the days of ziva , pure.
llm_translation: Rava said: "In the days of menstruation, she is menstruating; in the days of zavah, she is pure." And it was taught: "One who experiences difficulty during the days of menstruation, she is menstruating; in the days of zavah, she is pure."

hebrew_text: כיצד קשתה יום אחד ושפתה שנים או שקשתה שנים ושפתה יום אחד או ששפתה וקשתה וחזרה ושפתה הרי זו יולדת בזוב
human_translation: How she experienced pains one day and rested two or she experienced pains two and rested one day, or she rested and she experienced pains and again rested this is one who gives birth as a zava ,
llm_translation: How is it if her bow is one day and her lip is two, or if her bow is two and her lip is one day, or if her lip is and her bow is and she returns and her lip is, behold, this is a birthing of zov.

hebrew_text: אבל שפתה יום אחד וקשתה שנים או ששפתה שנים וקשתה יום אחד או שקשתה ושפתה וחזרה וקשתה אין זו יולדת בזוב כללו של דבר קושי סמוך ללידה אין זו יולדת בזוב שופי סמוך ללידה הרי זו יולדת בזוב
human_translation: But rested one day and experienced pains two or she rested two and experienced pains one day; or she experienced pains and rested and again experienced pains this is not one who gives birth as a zava , the principle of the matter: pains adjacent to birth, this is not one who gives birth as a zava ; resting adjacent to birth, this is one who gives birth as a zava .
llm_translation: But her lip one day and her bow two or but her lip two and her bow one or but her bow and her lip and she returned and her bow, this is not a birthing of zov altogether, for a difficult question near birth, this is not a birthing of zov, a clear question near birth, behold, this is a birthing of zov.

hebrew_text: חנניא בן אחי ר' יהושע אומר כל שחל קישויה בשלישי שלה אפילו כל היום כולו בשופי אין זו יולדת בזוב
human_translation: Ḥananya, son of Rabbi Yehoshua’s brother, says: any where her pains occur on her third day, Even of resting the entire day, this is not one who gives birth as a zava ,
llm_translation: Hananiah son of Ahijah, son of Rabbi Joshua, says: "Any woman whose discharge occurs on the third day of her menstrual cycle, even if it lasts the entire day, it is not considered menstrual bleeding."

hebrew_text: כללו של דבר לאתויי מאי לאתויי דחנניא
human_translation: the principle of the matter to add what? to add of Ḥananya,
llm_translation: The principle of a matter - to bring what does it bring? What does it bring, Chananya?

hebrew_text: מה"מ דת"ר דמה דמה מחמת עצמה ולא מחמת ולד
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught “her blood” her blood due to herself but not due to child.
llm_translation: The statement of the Sages: "What is similar is similar due to itself, and not due to its offspring."

hebrew_text: אתה אומר מחמת ולד או אינו אלא מחמת אונס כשהוא אומר (ויקרא טו, כה) ואשה כי יזוב זוב דמה הרי אונס אמור הא מה אני מקיים דמה דמה מחמת עצמה ולא מחמת ולד
human_translation: Do you say due to child? Or only due to circumstances beyond control? When states: “And if a woman has an issue of her blood,” circumstances beyond control is stated how do I realize “her blood”? her blood due to herself but not due to child.
llm_translation: You say, due to childbirth or is it rather due to coercion, as it says (Leviticus 15:25), "And a woman who has a discharge of blood," behold, coercion is mentioned. Now, how do I fulfill "of blood"? Blood due to itself and not due to childbirth.

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לטהר את הולד ולטמא באונס מטהר אני בולד שיש טהרה אחריו ומטמא אני באונס שאין טהרה אחריו
human_translation: But what did you see to deem pure the child, and to deem impure due to circumstances beyond control? I deem pure due to the child, as there is purity after it, and I deem impure due to circumstances beyond control, as there is no purity after it.
llm_translation: And what did you see to purify the newborn and to render impure due to coercion? I declare the newborn pure, for there is purity after him, and I render impure due to coercion, for there is no purity after him.

hebrew_text: אדרבה מטהר אני באונס שכן אונס בזב טהור השתא מיהא באשה קיימינן ואונס באשה לא אשכחן
human_translation: On the contrary, I deem pure in circumstances beyond control, as to circumstances beyond control of zav is pure. Now, in any event, we are dealing with a woman, and in a woman we do not find circumstances beyond control
llm_translation: On the contrary, I maintain that one is purified due to coercion, for coercion renders a zav pure. Now, we are dealing with a woman, and coercion with a woman is not found.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא מאי דעתיך לטהורי באונס ולטמויי בולד אין לך אונס גדול מזה
human_translation: And if you wish, say What is your opinion, that deem pure in circumstances beyond control, and deem impure due to the child? you have no greater circumstances beyond control than this,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: What is your opinion regarding those who are ritually pure due to coercion, and those who are ritually impure due to childbirth? There is no greater coercion than this.

hebrew_text: אי הכי נדה נמי נימא זובה זובה מחמת עצמה ולא מחמת ולד
human_translation: If so a menstruating woman as well, let us say “her issue” her issue due to herself but not due to child.
llm_translation: If so, when discussing Niddah, it should also be said that it is Zavah; Zavah is impure due to itself, and not due to offspring.

hebrew_text: אתה אומר ולד או אינו אלא אונס כשהוא אומר (ויקרא טו, יט) ואשה כי תהיה זבה הרי אונס אמור הא מה אני מקיים זובה זובה מחמת עצמה ולא מחמת ולד
human_translation: Do you say child? Or only circumstances beyond control? When states: “And a woman if she has an issue,” circumstances beyond control is stated. how do I realize “her issue”? her issue due to herself but not due to child.
llm_translation: You say: Is it a childbirth or is it only coercion when it says (Leviticus 15:19) "And if a woman has a discharge," behold, coercion is mentioned. How do I fulfill "discharge" discharge for its own sake and not for childbirth.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ל אמר קרא תשב יש לך ישיבה אחרת שהיא כזו ואיזו זו זו קושי בימי זיבה ואימא זו קושי בימי נדה
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: verse states “She shall observe you have another observance that is like this one, And which this This pains during days of ziva . But say this pains during the days of menstruation,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Levi, said the verse: "You shall sit." Do you have another sitting that is like this? And which is this? This is a difficulty in the days of zivah. And say, this is a difficulty in the days of niddah.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אבוה דשמואל אמר קרא (ויקרא יב, ה) וטמאה שבועים כנדתה ולא כזיבתה מכלל דזיבתה טהור ואיזו זו זו קושי בימי זיבה
human_translation: Rather, Shmuel’s father said verse states: “And she shall be impure two weeks, as in her menstruation” and not: As in her ziva . By inference, that her ziva pure. And which this? This pains during days of ziva .
llm_translation: Rather, said Avuha the son of Shmuel, said the verse (Leviticus 12:5), "And she shall be unclean for seven days, as in the days of her menstrual impurity." And not like her impurity. From which it is inferred that her impurity is pure. And which impurity is this? This is the difficulty in the days of her impurity.

hebrew_text: והשתא דכתיב וטמאה שבועים כנדתה דמה למה לי אי לאו דמה הוה אמינא כנדתה ולא כזיבתה ואפילו בשופי קמ"ל
human_translation: And now that it is written: “And she shall be impure two weeks as in her menstruation,” why do I “her blood” If not “her blood,” I would say as in her menstruation, and not as in her ziva , and even in resting teaches us
llm_translation: And now, as it is written, "And she shall be unclean two weeks, as in her menstruation" - what is the comparison for? If not for that of her menstruation, I would say it is like her menstruation and not like her zivah. Even in the case of a doubtful emission, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: שילא בר אבינא עבד עובדא כוותיה דרב כי קא נח נפשיה דרב א"ל לרב אסי זיל צנעיה ואי לא ציית גרייה הוא סבר גדייה א"ל
human_translation: Sheila bar Avina ruled case in accordance with of Rav. when Rav was dying, he said to Rav Asi: Go hide And if he does not listen drag him [ garyei ] thought said to him gadyei ,
llm_translation: Shila bar Avina did a deed like the deed of Rav when he was in distress. Rav said to Rav Asi: "Go hide yourself, and if not, your bones will be scattered." He thought that he was referring to his goats.

hebrew_text: בתר דנח נפשיה דרב א"ל הדר בך דהדר ביה רב א"ל אם איתא דהדר ביה לדידי הוה אמר לי לא ציית גדייה א"ל ולא מסתפי מר מדליקתא
human_translation: After Rav died, said to him: Retract your as Rav retracted his said to If it is so, that he retracted his he would have told me, did not listen excommunicated him, said to But is the Master not afraid of the fire,
llm_translation: After the death of Nahum, the soul of Rav returned. He said to himself, "Return to your place." Rav said to him, "If it is so that you are returning for my sake, tell me." He said to me, "I did not obey." Rav said to him, "And did the Master not doubt from the lamp?"

hebrew_text: א"ל אנא איסי בן יהודה דהוא איסי בן גור אריה דהוא איסי בן גמליאל דהוא איסי בן מהללאל אסיתא דנחשא דלא שליט ביה רקבא א"ל ואנא שילא בר אבינא בוכנא דפרזלא דמתבר אסיתא דנחשא
human_translation: said to him, I am Isi ben Yehuda, who is Isi ben Gur Arye, who is Isi ben Gamliel, who is Isi ben Mahalalel, a copper mortar [ asita ], over which rot has no power, said to And I am Sheila bar Avina, an iron pestle [ bukhna ], which smashes a copper mortar,
llm_translation: He said to him: I am Issi son of Judah, who is Issi son of Gur Aryeh, who is Issi son of Gamliel, who is Issi son of Mahalalel. A piece of copper that is not affected by rust was brought before him. He said to him: And I, Sheilah son of Avina, a blacksmith's son, brought before him a piece of copper.

hebrew_text: חלש רב אסי עיילוה בחמימי אפקוה מקרירי עיילוה בקרירי אפקוה מחמימי נח נפשיה דרב אסי
human_translation: Rav Asi fell ill he entered the heat he exited cold, he entered into cold, he exited the heat Rav Asi died.
llm_translation: Weak, Rav Asi went up with hot water, he brought down with cold water. He went up with cold water, he brought down with hot water. Rav Asi's soul rested.

hebrew_text: אזל שילא אמר לדביתהו צבית לי זוודתא דלא ליזיל ולימא ליה לרב מילי עילואי צביתה ליה זוודתא נח נפשיה דשילא חזו דפרחא אסא מהאי פוריא להאי פוריא אמרי ש"מ עבדו רבנן פייסא
human_translation: Sheila went said to his wife: Prepare for me provisions [ zevadata ], that will not go and tell Rav matters about me, prepared for him provisions, Sheila passed away. saw that myrtle flying from this bier to that bier. They said: Conclude from it the Sages, have made peace
llm_translation: Shila went, he said to his household, "Prepare for me a bundle that will not go bad." And he said to Rav, "Words of the upper ones, prepare for him a bundle." The bundle of Shila went and they saw that the flower was preserved from this village to that village. They said, "Learn from this, the Rabbis have done well."

hebrew_text: בעי רבא קושי מהו שתסתור בזיבה
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: what is pains? negate with regard to ziva ?
llm_translation: Rava inquired: What is the law regarding one who experiences a discharge of semen?

hebrew_text: דבר המטמא סותר והאי נמי מטמא כימי נדה הוא או דילמא דבר הגורם סותר והאי לאו גורם הוא
human_translation: substance that imparts impurity negate this imparts impurity like the days of menstruation, Or perhaps a substance that causes negates and this is not causes
llm_translation: The thing that causes impurity contradicts, and this one also causes impurity like the days of menstruation, or perhaps the thing that is caused contradicts, and this one is not a cause.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי אונס בזיבה יוכיח שאינו גורם וסותר
human_translation: Abaye said to of ziva circumstances beyond control will prove as does not cause and it negates
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: "Forced intercourse in the case of a seminal emission proves that it is not the cause and does not contradict."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה לאיי האי נמי גורם הוא דתנן ראה ראייה ראשונה בודקין אותו שניה בודקין אותו שלישית אין בודקין אותו
human_translation: said to him: not so [ la’ei ], this is also causes as we learned saw a first sighting one examines him second one examines him. third one does not examine him,
llm_translation: He said to him to Ayye, this also is a cause, as we learned: If one saw a first sighting, they examine him; a second sighting, they examine him; a third sighting, they do not examine him.

hebrew_text: ולרבי אליעזר דאמר אף בשלישי' בודקין אותו ה"נ כיון דלא גרים לא סתר אמר ליה לרבי אליעזר ה"נ
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Eliezer, who said: Even the third one examines him, indeed since does not cause it does not negate said to According to Rabbi Eliezer, indeed
llm_translation: And to Rabbi Eliezer who said, "Even on the third day they check it." So too, since they did not convert, he said to him, "So too."

hebrew_text: ת"ש רבי אליעזר אומר אף בשלישית בודקין אותו ברביעית אין בודקין אותו מאי לאו לסתירה
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Eliezer says: Even the third one examines him the fourth one does not examine him. What, is it not for negating
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Eliezer says, even in the third generation they examine him; in the fourth generation they do not examine him. What is it done for? Not for contradiction.

hebrew_text: לא לטמויה לההיא טיפה במשא
human_translation: No, to render impure that drop through carrying.
llm_translation: Not for its impurity that drop in the carrying

hebrew_text: ת"ש בשלישית רבי אליעזר אומר בודקין אותו ברביעית אין בודקין אותו לקרבן אמרתי ולא לסתירה
human_translation: Come hear With regard to the third Rabbi Eliezer says one examines him, the fourth one does not examine him. I said, to an offering, and not to negating
llm_translation: Come and hear: In the third case, Rabbi Eliezer says, we examine it in the fourth case. We do not examine it for the offering. I said, not for contradiction.

hebrew_text: אלא לר"א תפשוט דדבר שאינו גורם סותר לרבנן מאי
human_translation: Rather, according to Rabbi Eliezer, resolve that a substance that does not cause negates what according to the Rabbis?
llm_translation: Rather, according to Rabbi Eliezer, it is evident that a matter that does not cause contradiction to the Rabbis, what is it.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דתני אבוה דרבי אבין מה גרם לו זובו שבעה לפיכך סותר שבעה מה גרם לו קריו יום אחד לפיכך סותר יום אחד
human_translation: Come hear that the father of Rabbi Avin teaches What his ziva cause for him? seven Therefore, negate seven what his seminal emission cause for him? one day Therefore, negate one day
llm_translation: Come and hear: as it was taught in the house of Rabbi Avin, what caused his zav to last seven days, therefore he nullifies seven. What caused his seminal emission to be on one day, therefore he nullifies one day.

hebrew_text: מאי שבעה אילימא דמטמא שבעה האי מה זובו טמא שבעה מבעי ליה אלא לאו דבר הגורם סותר דבר שאינו גורם אינו סותר ש"מ
human_translation: What seven If we say that renders him impure seven should have Just as his ziva seven Rather, is it not A substance that causes negates a substance that does not cause does not negate conclude from it
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "seven"? If you say that it refers to something that causes impurity for seven days, this is not so, for his zov (bodily discharge) renders him impure for seven days. Rather, it must be referring to something that causes impurity but is not the direct cause of impurity. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי נקטינן אין קושי סותר בזיבה ואי משכחת תנא דאמר סותר ההוא ר"א היא
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition pains does not negate of ziva , And if you a find tanna who said negate that is Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: We have learned, a difficulty does not contradict in the case of zavah, and if you find a Tanna who says, "it contradicts," that is R. Eliezer.

hebrew_text: תניא רבי מרינוס אומר אין לידה סותרת בזיבה איבעיא להו מהו שתעלה אביי אמר אינה סותרת ואינה עולה רבא אמר אינה סותרת ועולה
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Marinus says: birth does not negate of ziva . a dilemma was raised before What is may be counted Abaye says: does not negate but it does not count Rava says: does not negate and counts
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Marinus says, "Childbirth does not nullify Zivah." The question was asked: What is the ruling? Abaye said, "It does not nullify and it does not elevate." Rava said, "It does not nullify but it does elevate."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מנא אמינא לה דתניא (ויקרא טו, כח) ואחר תטהר אחר אחר לכולן שלא תהא טומאה מפסקת ביניהם

hebrew_text: לידי חלול שבת ברביעי ותו לא אימא מרביעי ואילך

hebrew_text: אמר מר זוטרא מאי טעמייהו דחסידים הראשונים דכתיב (רות ד׳:י״ג ) ויתן [ה'] לה הריון הריון בגימטריא מאתן ושבעים וחד הוו

llm_translation: Master Zutra said: What is the reason of the early pious individuals? As it is written (Ruth 4:13), "And the Lord gave her conception." Conception in gematria is equivalent to ninety-one.

hebrew_text: אמר מר זוטרא אפי' למ"ד יולדת לתשעה אינה יולדת למקוטעים יולדת לשבעה יולדת למקוטעים שנאמר (שמואל א א, כ) ויהי לתקופות הימים ותהר חנה ותלד בן מיעוט תקופות שנים מיעוט ימים שנים
human_translation: Mar Zutra says: Even according to the one who said, who gives birth at nine does not give birth after an incomplete who gives birth at seven months can give birth after an incomplete As it is stated “And it came to pass, when the seasons of the days had come, that Hannah conceived, and bore a son” The minimal “seasons” two, the minimal “days” is two.
llm_translation: The Master Zutra said: Even according to the opinion that a woman gives birth after nine months, she does not give birth to premature infants; she gives birth after seven months. She gives birth to premature infants, as it is stated (1 Samuel 1:20), "And it came to pass in the course of time, that Hannah conceived, and bore a son, and called his name Samuel, saying, 'Because I have asked him of the Lord.'"

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ור"ש אומרים אין קושי יותר מב' שבתות אמר שמואל מאי טעמייהו דרבנן דכתיב (ויקרא יב, ה) וטמאה שבועים כנדתה כנדתה ולא כזיבתה מכלל דזיבתה טהורה וכמה שבועים
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: pains not more than two weeks Shmuel said: What is the reasoning of the Rabbis, As it is written “And she shall be impure two weeks, as in her menstruation” as in her menstruation but not as in her ziva . By inference, that her ziva is pure, And how two weeks.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yossi and Rabbi Shimon say: There is no greater difficulty than two Shabbats. Shmuel said: What is the reason of the Rabbis? As it is written (Leviticus 12:5), "And she shall be unclean two weeks as in her separation, and she shall not touch anything holy." From here we infer that her zivah is pure, and how many weeks.

hebrew_text: ת"ר יש מקשה עשרים וחמשה יום ואין זיבה עולה בהן כיצד שנים בלא עת ושבעה נדה וב' שלאחר נדה וארבעה עשר שהולד מטהר
human_translation: the Sages taught: There is experiences pains twenty-five days and ziva is not included in them. How two not at the time and seven menstruation, and two that after menstruation. And fourteen which the a child renders pure
llm_translation: The Sages taught: There are twenty-five days that are difficult, and menstruation does not occur during them. How so? Two without a fixed time, seven of menstruation, two after menstruation, and fourteen when the woman gives birth and becomes purified.

hebrew_text: ואי אפשר שתתקשה עשרים וששה יום בלא ולד ולא תהא יולדת בזוב

llm_translation: And if impossible that will be difficult twenty and six days without and offspring and not will be a woman giving birth in a state of flux.

human_translation: without a child, on three is also sufficient Rav Sheshet said say in a case where there is a child, Rava said to But teaches: Without a child.
llm_translation: Without a child, three is also sufficient. Rav Sheshet said: Say in a place where there is a child. Rava said to him: But the Mishnah teaches without a child.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא הכי קאמר אי אפשר שתתקשה עשרים וששה יום במקום שיש ולד ולא תהא יולדת בזוב ובמקום שאין ולד אלא נפל בתלתא נמי הויא זבה מ"ט אין קושי לנפלים
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this is saying: It is impossible for to experience pains twenty-six days in a case where there is a child, she will not be who gives birth as a zava . And in a case where there is no child but a non-viable newborn, with three she also becomes a zava . What is the reason? pains not to non-viable newborns.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is what he is saying - it is impossible for twenty-six days in a place where there is a fetus, and she does not give birth with a discharge of blood. And in a place where there is no fetus, even if she miscarries after three days, she is also considered a woman with a discharge of blood. What is the reason? There is no difficulty for those who miscarry.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המקשה בתוך שמונים של נקבה כל דמים שהיא רואה טהורין עד שיצא הולד ורבי אליעזר מטמא
human_translation: who experiences pains within eighty of a female, all blood that she sees is ritually pure, until the child emerges And Rabbi Eliezer deems ritually impure
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who experiences difficulty within the first eighty days of a female's pregnancy, all blood that she sees is considered pure until the fetus emerges, and Rabbi Eliezer deems it impure.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לרבי אליעזר ומה במקום שהחמיר בדם השופי היקל בדם הקושי מקום שהיקל בדם השופי אינו דין שנקל בדם הקושי

llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Eliezer: In a place where he was stringent regarding the blood that spurts, he was lenient regarding the blood that congeals; in a place where he was lenient regarding the blood that spurts, it is not the law that he is lenient regarding the blood that congeals.

human_translation: said to them: it is sufficient for the emerges from inference to be like source. Concerning what was lenient with regard to Concerning the impurity of ziva . But she ritually impure the impurity of a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: He said to them: Sufficient is it for her to come from the judgment to be like a judge. From what was she made lighter regarding the impurity of zavah, but impure with the impurity of niddah.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן תשב לרבות המקשה בתוך שמונים של נקבה שכל דמים שהיא רואה טהורין עד שיצא הולד ור"א מטמא
human_translation: the Sages taught “She shall observe” to include who experiences pains within eighty of a female, that all blood that she sees is ritually pure. until the child emerges And Rabbi Eliezer deems ritually impure

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לר"א ומה במקום שהחמיר בשופי שלפני הולד היקל בשופי שלאחר הולד מקום שהיקל בקושי שלפני הולד אינו דין שנקל בקושי שלאחר הולד
human_translation: said to Rabbi Eliezer: And what, in an instance where was stringent with regard to resting before the child, was lenient with regard to resting after the child, an instance where was lenient with regard to pains before the child, is it not right that we will be lenient with regard to pains after the child?
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Eliezer: "And what about a case where one was stringent with the knife before the birth and was lenient with the knife after the birth? In a situation where one was lenient with the knife before the birth, it is not the same as being lenient with the knife after the birth."

hebrew_text: אמר להם דיו לבא מן הדין להיות כנדון ממה היקל עליה מטומאת זיבה אבל מטמאה טומאת נדה

llm_translation: They said to him: "Behold, we respond to you with different language. Just as in a place where he was stringent with the forepart of the fetus, he was lenient with the hindpart, it is difficult with him. In a place where he was lenient with the hindpart of the fetus, it is not the law that it is easy with him."

hebrew_text: אמר להם אפילו אתם משיבין כל היום כולו דיו לבא מן הדין להיות כנדון ממה היקל עליה מטומאת זיבה אבל מטמאה טומאת נדה

hebrew_text: אמר רבא בהא זכינהו ר"א לרבנן לאו אמריתו דמה דמה מחמת עצמה ולא מחמת ולד ה"נ (ויקרא יב, ז) וטהרה ממקור דמיה דמיה מחמת עצמה ולא מחמת ולד
human_translation: Rava said: With this Rabbi Eliezer triumphed over the Rabbis: Didn’t you say “her blood” her blood due to herself but not due to child. So too, “And she shall be purified from the fountain of her blood” her blood due to herself but not due to child.
llm_translation: Rava said: In this case, Rabbi Eliezer acquired merit for the Rabbis. Did they not say, "Similar to similar, due to its own nature and not due to the nature of the offspring"? So too, "And she shall be purified from the source of her blood, similar to similar, due to its own nature and not due to the nature of the offspring."

hebrew_text: אימא בימי נדה נדה בימי זיבה טהורה אמר קרא תשב ישיבה אחת לכולן

llm_translation: Say, during the days of menstruation, she is impure; during the days of abnormal uterine bleeding, she is pure. The verse says, "She shall sit in her impurity." This applies to all of them.

human_translation: all eleven days has the presumptive status of ritual purity,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Every eleven days with the presumption of purity.

human_translation: the time of her cycle arrived, and she did not examine that is ritually impure, Rabbi Meir says: was in hiding and the time of her cycle arrived and she did not examine that is pure, because fear drives away blood.
llm_translation: The time of her period arrived and she did not check, behold she is impure. Rabbi Meir says: If she was in hiding and the time of her period arrived and she did not check, behold she is pure because fear expels the blood.

hebrew_text: אבל ימי הזב והזבה ושומרת יום כנגד יום הרי אלו בחזקת טומאה
human_translation: But days of the zav and the zava , and observes day for a day these have a presumptive status of ritual impurity,
llm_translation: But the days of the zav and zavah and the woman with a discharge, day for day, these are in the presumption of impurity.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ למאי הלכתא אמר רב יהודה לומר שאינה צריכה בדיקה והא מדקתני סיפא ישבה ולא בדקה מכלל דלכתחלה בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: With regard to what halakha Rav Yehuda says: to say that she does not require an examination But from that the latter clause teaches: she sat and did not examine it can be inferred that she requires examination ab initio .
llm_translation: Gemara: For what halacha? Rav Yehudah said: To say that it does not require inspection. But isn't it taught in the latter clause: she sat and did not inspect? This implies that initially inspection is required.

hebrew_text: סיפא אתאן לימי נדה וה"ק כל י"א בחזקת טהרה ולא בעיא בדיקה אבל בימי נדתה בעיא בדיקה ישבה ולא בדקה שגגה נאנסה הזידה ולא בדקה טהורה
human_translation: the latter clause we arrive at days of menstruation, And this is saying: all eleven days has the presumptive status of ritual purity and she does not require examination. But during the days of her menstruation she requires examination. she sat and did not examine unwittingly circumstances beyond her control, intentionally and did not examine ritually pure.
llm_translation: The latter clause: They came to the days of her menstruation, and it was asked: "All eleven days are in a presumption of purity, and do not require an examination. However, during the days of her menstruation, an examination is required. If she sat and did not examine, whether it was accidental, coerced, intentional, or if she examined and found herself pure."

hebrew_text: רב חסדא אמר לא צריכא אלא לר"מ דאמר אשה שאין לה וסת אסורה לשמש ה"מ בימי נדתה אבל בימי זיבתה בחזקת טהרה קיימא

llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: It is necessary only according to Rabbi Meir, who said: A woman who does not have a covering is forbidden to engage in marital relations. This is what he said: During her menstrual period, but during her zivah period, when she is presumed to be ritually pure, the law stands.

hebrew_text: א"ה אמאי א"ר מאיר יוציא ולא יחזיר עולמית דלמא אתיא לקלקולא בימי נדה
human_translation: If so, why did Rabbi Meir say must divorce and he may never take back, lest lead to failure during the days of menstruation,

hebrew_text: הא מדקתני סיפא הגיע שעת וסתה ולא בדקה מכלל דבאשה שיש לה וסת עסקינן חסורי מחסרא והכי קתני כל י"א בחזקת טהרה ושריא לבעלה ובימי נדה אסורה
human_translation: from that the latter clause teaches: the time of her cycle arrived and she did not examine it can be inferred that we are dealing with a woman who has cycle. is incomplete and this it is teaching: all eleven has the presumptive status of ritual purity and she is permitted to her husband, but during the days of menstruation she is prohibited
llm_translation: This is the Mishnah: If the end was reached and she did not check, is it to be inferred that we are dealing with a woman who has a fixed menstrual cycle? We are dealing with a woman who is lacking in her cycle. And thus it teaches: All eleven days are presumed to be in a state of purity and permissible to her husband, but during her menstrual days she is forbidden.

hebrew_text: בד"א באשה שאין לה וסת אבל יש לה וסת מותרת וצריכה בדיקה ישבה ולא בדקה שגגה נאנסה הזידה ולא בדקה טהורה הגיע שעת וסתה ולא בדקה טמאה

llm_translation: In a case of a woman who does not have a veset, but she has a veset, she is permitted, and she requires examination. If she sat and did not examine, if it was accidental, if it was intentional, if she did not examine, if her veset time arrived, and she did not examine, if she was pure, if she was impure.

hebrew_text: הא מדסיפא ר"מ רישא לאו ר"מ כולה ר"מ היא וה"ק אם לא היתה במחבא והגיע שעת וסתה ולא בדקה טמאה שר"מ אומר אם היתה במחבא והגיע שעת וסתה ולא בדקה טהורה שחרדה מסלקת את הדמים
human_translation: from the last clause Rabbi Meir, the first clause not Rabbi Meir. the entire is Rabbi Meir, and this is saying: If she was not in hiding and the time of her cycle arrived and she did not examine impure, as Rabbi Meir says: was in hiding and the time of her cycle arrived and she did not examine pure, as fear drives away blood.
llm_translation: This is from the first part of the statement of Rabbi Meir: "Rabbi Meir is not entirely Rabbi Meir." And this is the source: "If it was not in the hiding place and the time of her period arrived, and she did not check if she was impure, Rabbi Meir says: If it was in the hiding place and the time of her period arrived, and she did not check if she was pure, she is removing the blood."

hebrew_text: רבא אמר לומר שאינה מטמאה מעת לעת
human_translation: Rava says to say that she does not impart impurity for period
llm_translation: Rava said to say, "It does not render impure from time to time."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי הנדה והזבה והשומרת יום כנגד יום והיולדת כולן מטמאות מעת לעת תיובתא
human_translation: raises an objection a menstruating woman, and a zava , and a woman who observes a day for a day, and a woman who gave birth, they all impart impurity for period. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A contradiction was raised: A menstruating woman, a woman with an abnormal uterine bleeding, and a woman observing the days of her menstrual impurity, all of them render impure from time to time. This is a refutation.

hebrew_text: רב הונא בר חייא אמר שמואל לומר שאינה קובעת לה וסת בתוך ימי זיבתה אמר רב יוסף לא שמיע לי הא שמעתתא

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי את אמרת ניהלן ואהא אמרת לן היתה למודה להיות רואה יום ט"ו (יום) ושינתה ליום כ' זה וזה אסורין לשמש שינתה פעמים ליום כ' זה וזה אסורין

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל ל"ש אלא ט"ו לטבילתה שהן כ"ב לראייתה

hebrew_text: ושינתה ליום כ"ז דכי הדרי ואתו עשרין ותרתי קיימא לה בתוך ימי זיבתה וקתני זה וזה אסורין אלמא דחיישינן לה

llm_translation: And when this that Rabbi Zeira said in the name of R. Chiya bar Ashi said Rav, a woman who descended to immerse from impurity to purity, and blood was discharged from her during the descent, she is impure in the ascent but pure in the descent.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי ירמיה לר' זירא בירידה אמאי טמאה טומאה בלועה היא א"ל זיל שייליה לרבי אבין דאסברית ניהליה וכרכיש לי ברישיה בי מדרשא
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira, on descent why impure? is impurity encapsulated said to Go ask Rabbi Avin, as I explained to him and he nodded [ vekharkish ] his head to me the study hall,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said to Rabbi Zeira: "Regarding a descent, why is it impure? It is impure due to absorption." Rabbi Zeira said to him: "Go ask Rabbi Avin, for he explained it to me and engraved it in my head in the study hall."

hebrew_text: אזל שייליה א"ל עשאוה כנבלת עוף טהור שמטמאה בגדים בבית הבליעה מי דמי
human_translation: went asked said to rendered like the unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird, which imparts impurity to garments in throat, Are comparable?
llm_translation: He went and asked him, he said to him, "They made it like the carcass of a pure bird that renders garments unclean in the house of swallowing, what is the comparison?"

hebrew_text: התם אין לה טומאה בחוץ הכא כי נפיק לבראי ליטמי הכא נמי כשיצא לחוץ
human_translation: There, does not have impurity outside, here, let it become impure when it emerges outside here too, where emerged outside
llm_translation: There, there is no impurity outside; here, when he goes out to the open air, he also becomes impure.

hebrew_text: אי יצא לחוץ מאי למימרא מהו דתימא מגו דמהני טבילה לדם דאיכא גואי תהני נמי להאי קמ"ל
human_translation: If emerged outside what of stating lest you say: Since immersion is effective for blood that is inside let it also be effective for this teaches us
llm_translation: If one went outside, what is the implication to say? What might you say, that immersion for blood that has a source is effective, so too it is effective for this. This teaches.

hebrew_text: שמעתין איפריק אלא יולדת אי בימי נדה נדה אי בימי זיבה זיבה
human_translation: We have resolved our halakha , but a woman after childbirth. If in days of menstruation, a menstruating woman, if days of ziva , ziva ,
llm_translation: I have heard: If she gives birth, whether during her menstrual period or during her zavah period.

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן בלידה יבשתא לידה יבשתא מאי מטמא בפנים כבחוץ איכא
human_translation: Here we are dealing with a dry birth, a dry birth, what is there becomes impure inside as outside
llm_translation: Here, what are we dealing with? Regarding a dry birth. A dry birth, what does it render impure? Inside like outside, there is.

hebrew_text: כגון שהוציא ולד ראשו חוץ לפרוזדור וכדרב אושעיא דאמר רב אושעיא גזרה שמא יוציא הולד ראשו חוץ לפרוזדור
human_translation: where offspring put his head out of the corridor, And in accordance with of Rav Oshaya, as Rav Oshaya said: decree lest the offspring puts his head out of the corridor
llm_translation: For example, if a child's head emerged outside the doorway, like Rav Oshaya said, for Rav Oshaya said: it is a decree lest the child's head be born outside the doorway.

hebrew_text: וכי ההוא דאתא לקמיה דרבא אמר ליה מהו לממהל בשבתא אמר ליה שפיר דמי בתר דנפק אמר רבא ס"ד דההוא גברא לא ידע דשרי לממהל בשבתא אזל בתריה אמר ליה אימא לי איזי גופא דעובדא היכי הוה
human_translation: And similar to a certain who came before Rava said to him: What is with regard to may circumcise on Shabbat? said to him: well After left, Rava said enter your mind that that man did not know that permitted to circumcise on Shabbat, went after him said to him: Say to me, my friend [ izi ], how did the incident itself happen?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And when that one came before Rava, he said to him, "What about leading an animal on Shabbat?" He said to him, "It is permissible after it has gone out." Rava said, "I think that man did not know that it is permitted to lead an animal on Shabbat." He went after him and said to him, "Tell me, how was the incident of the deed itself?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה שמעית ולד דצויץ אפניא דמעלי שבתא ולא אתיליד עד שבתא אמר ליה האי הוציא ראשו חוץ לפרוזדור הוא והוי מילה שלא בזמנה וכל מילה שלא בזמנה אין מחללין עליה את השבת
human_translation: said to I heard child making a noise at nightfall on Shabbat eve, but it was not born until Shabbat. said to him: This is put his head out of the corridor, And is a circumcision not at its time, and any circumcision not at its time, one does not desecrate Shabbat for its
llm_translation: He said to him, "I heard that a child born through a Caesarean section on Shabbat does not become viable until Shabbat." He said to him, "This one who protruded his head outside the womb is considered born and it is a circumcision not in its proper time, and any circumcision not in its proper time does not override the Sabbath."

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו אותו מקום של אשה בלוע הוי או בית הסתרים הוי
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before that place in a woman, Is encapsulated, or is it a concealed part
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "Is that place of a woman considered swallowed or is it considered a private domain?"

hebrew_text: למאי נפקא מינה כגון שתחבה לה חבירתה כזית נבלה באותו מקום אי אמרת בלוע הוי טומאה בלועה לא מטמאה ואי אמרת בית הסתרים הוי נהי דבמגע לא מטמיא במשא מיהא מטמיא
human_translation: What is the difference where another inserted an olive-bulk of an animal carcass, into that place. If you say it is encapsulated, an encapsulated impurity does not impart impurity. But if you say it is a concealed part although does not become impure by contact, she at least becomes impure by carrying
llm_translation: Regarding what is the practical difference? For example, if her companion concealed for her an olive-sized portion of a carcass in that place. If you say it is swallowed, it is impure; a swallowed impurity does not render impure. And if you say it is in a hidden place, it is indeed so that through contact it does not render impure, but through carrying it does render impure.

hebrew_text: אביי אמר בלוע הוי רבא אמר בית הסתרים הוי אמר רבא מנא אמינא לה דתניא אלא מפני שטומאת בית הסתרים היא
human_translation: Abaye said: It is encapsulated. Rava said: It is a concealed part Rava said: From where do I say As it is taught Rather,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "Swallowed." Rava said: "Bathroom." Rava said: "From where do I say this? Because it is taught in a Baraita: Rather, it is due to the impurity of a bathroom."

hebrew_text: וטומאת בית הסתרים לא מטמאה אלא שגזרת הכתוב היא
human_translation: because is impurity a concealed part and impurity a concealed part does not render impure. But it is a Torah edict
llm_translation: And the impurity of a hidden chamber does not render impure except that it is a decree of the Scripture.

hebrew_text: ואביי חדא ועוד קאמר חדא דטומאה בלועה היא ועוד אפילו אם תמצי לומר טומאת בית הסתרים היא אינה מטמאה אלא שגזרת הכתוב היא
human_translation: And Abaye, states one and another: One that is an encapsulated impurity, and another even if you were to say is a concealed part does not render impure, but it is a Torah edict
llm_translation: And Abaye said one thing, and furthermore he said one thing: "Impurity that is swallowed is it." And furthermore, even if you were to say that it is the impurity of a concealed room, it does not render impure except that it is a decree of the Scripture.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מקום נבלת עוף טהור בלוע הוי או בית הסתרים הוי
human_translation: dilemma was raised before place an unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird Is encapsulated, or is it a concealed part
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "Is the place of a carcass of a pure bird swallowed whole considered a concealed place or not?"

hebrew_text: למאי נפקא מינה כגון שתחב לו חבירו כזית נבלה לתוך פיו אי אמרת בלוע הוי טומאה בלועה לא מטמיא (אלא אי) אמרת בית הסתרים הוי נהי נמי דבמגע לא מטמא במשא מיהא מטמא
human_translation: What is the difference? where another inserted an olive-bulk of an animal carcass into his mouth. If you say is encapsulated, an encapsulated impurity does not impart impurity. you say it is a concealed part although indeed does not become impure by contact, he at least becomes impure by carrying
llm_translation: Regarding what is the practical difference? For example, if his fellow placed an olive-sized piece of carrion into his mouth. If you say swallowing causes impurity, swallowing does not cause impurity (rather) if you say (it is) in a concealed place, it is (acceptable). Indeed, (it is) also (acceptable) that in contact (with the carrion) it does not cause impurity, but in carrying (it) it causes impurity.

hebrew_text: אביי אמר בלוע הוי ורבא אמר בית הסתרים הוי אמר אביי מנא אמינא לה דתניא יכול תהא נבלת בהמה מטמאה בגדים אבית הבליעה ת"ל (ויקרא כב, ח) נבלה וטרפה לא יאכל לטמאה בה
human_translation: Abaye said: It is encapsulated, and Rava said: It is a concealed part Abaye said: From where do I say As it is taught might an animal carcass should impart impurity to garments in throat, the verse states: “That which dies of itself, or is torn of animals, he shall not eat to render himself impure through it”
llm_translation: Abbaye said "swallowed" it is, and Rava said "hidden chamber" it is. Abbaye said, "From where do I say this? As it is taught: One might have thought that the carcass of an animal can render garments unclean; therefore, the Torah teaches (Leviticus 22:8), 'A carcass or torn animal shall not be eaten to become unclean by it.'"

hebrew_text: מי שאין לה טומאה אלא אכילתה יצתה זו שטמאה קודם שיאכלנה
human_translation: that which has impurity only its consumption, excludes this as it is impure, before one eats it,
llm_translation: One who does not have impurity except through its consumption, this one became impure before consuming it.

hebrew_text: ותיתי בק"ו מנבלת עוף טהור ומה נבלת עוף טהור שאין לה טומאה בחוץ יש לה טומאה בפנים זו שיש לה טומאה בחוץ אינו דין שיש לה טומאה בפנים
human_translation: And let it be derived by an a fortiori from an unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird, If an unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird, as it does not have impurity outside it has impurity inside this as it does have impurity outside is it not right that it have impurity inside
llm_translation: I will place a question: Regarding the carcass of a pure bird. And what is the carcass of a pure bird? That it does not have impurity on the outside, it does have impurity on the inside. This one that has impurity on the outside, it is not the same that it has impurity on the inside.

hebrew_text: אמר קרא בה בה ולא באחרת
human_translation: the verse states: through it,” through it, and not through another,
llm_translation: Said the verse: "In her, in her, and not in another."

hebrew_text: אם כן מה תלמוד לומר (ויקרא יא ) והאוכל
human_translation: If so, what the verse states “And he who eats
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud say (Leviticus 11) "and the one who eats..."

hebrew_text: ליתן שיעור לנוגע ולנושא כאוכל מה אוכל בכזית אף נוגע ונושא בכזית
human_translation: to provide a measure to one who touches and to one who carries like eats. Just as eats an olive-bulk, so too, touches or carries an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: To give a measure to the one who touches and the one who carries, as one who eats, what can one eat in an olive's bulk, so too the one who touches and carries in an olive's bulk.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא שרץ בקומטו טהור נבלה בקומטו טמא
human_translation: Rava says: creeping animal in the folds [ bekometo ] of ritually pure. an animal carcass in the folds of impure.
llm_translation: Rava said: A creeping creature in its primary form is pure; a carcass in its primary form is impure.

hebrew_text: שרץ בקומטו טהור שרץ בנגיעה הוא דמטמא ובית הסתרים לאו בר מגע הוא נבלה בקומטו טמא נהי דבמגע לא מטמא במשא מיהא מטמא
human_translation: creeping animal in the folds of ritually pure, it is through contact that a creeping animal imparts impurity, and a concealed part is not susceptible to contact. an animal carcass in the folds of impure, although it does not impart impurity through contact, it at least imparts impurity by carrying,
llm_translation: A creeping thing in its primary state is pure; a creeping thing in its touch is impure. And a concealed place, is it not by way of touch? A carcass in its primary state is impure. Granted, in touch it does not render impure, but in carrying it does render impure.

hebrew_text: שרץ בקומטו והכניסו לאויר התנור טמא פשיטא מהו דתימא תוכו אמר רחמנא
human_translation: a creeping animal in the folds of and he brought into the airspace of an oven, impure, obvious? Lest you say the Merciful One states whose interior
llm_translation: Swarming creature in its lump and he brought it into the air of the oven - impure. It is obvious. What might you have thought? Its interior, the Merciful One said.

hebrew_text: ולא תוך תוכו קמ"ל
human_translation: and not the interior of its interior, teaches us
llm_translation: And not within its midst, teaches.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ל קנה בקומטו של זב והסיט בו את הטהור טהור קנה בקומטו של טהור והסיט בו את הזב טמא
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: a pole in the folds of a zav , and he moved a ritually pure with it, pure, pole in the folds of one who is pure, and he moved the zav with it, impure,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Levi: One who acquires with the spit of a Zav, and he sprinkles with it on a pure person, the pure person remains pure. One who acquires with the spit of a pure person, and he sprinkles with it on a Zav, the Zav remains impure.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דאמר קרא (ויקרא טו, יא) וכל אשר יגע בו הזב וידיו לא שטף במים זהו הסיטו של זב שלא מצינו לו טומאה בכל התורה כולה
human_translation: What is the reason As the verse states: “And whoever a zav touches, without having rinsed his hands in water, This is the movement of a zav , as we have not found an impurity to it in the entire Torah.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the verse says (Leviticus 15:11), "And whoever the one with a discharge touches, and his hands did not rinse in water," this is the leaning of a zav, for we did not find impurity for him in the entire Torah.

hebrew_text: ואפקיה רחמנא בלשון נגיעה למימרא דהיסט ונגיעה כידיו מה התם מאבראי אף הכא מאבראי
human_translation: And the Merciful One expresses by the language of touch, to say that moving and touch are like his hands: Just as there, external so too here, external
llm_translation: And the Merciful One concluded in the language of touching to say that a "hest" and touching are like his hands. Just as there in the case of the altar, it is from the limbs, so too here it is from the limbs.

hebrew_text: אבל הזב ובעל קרי אינן מטמאין וכו' זב דכתיב (ויקרא טו, ב) כי יהיה זב מבשרו עד שיצא זובו מבשרו בעל קרי דכתיב (ויקרא טו, טז) ואיש כי תצא ממנו שכבת זרע
human_translation: But the zav and one who experiences a seminal emission do not become ritually impure a zav , as it is written: “When has an issue out of his flesh” until his issue emerges out of his flesh. one who experiences a seminal emission, that it is written: “And if the flow of seed goes out from a man”
llm_translation: Mourner, Zav, and Ba'al Keri do not transmit uncleanness, etc. Zav, as it is written (Leviticus 15:2), "When there will be a discharge from his flesh until his discharge ceases from his flesh." Ba'al Keri, as it is written (Leviticus 15:16), "And if a man has an emission of semen."

hebrew_text: היה אוכל בתרומה והרגיש וכו' אוחז והתניא ר"א אומר כל האוחז באמה ומשתין כאילו מביא מבול לעולם
human_translation: was partaking of teruma and sensed hold But isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who holds penis and urinates as though he is bringing a deluge to the world,
llm_translation: He was eating terumah and felt the need to relieve himself etc., he should hold it in. And it was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Anyone who holds his private member and urinates, it is as though he brings a flood upon the world."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי במטלית עבה רבא אמר אפילו תימא במטלית רכה כיון דעקר עקר ואביי חייש דילמא אתי לאוסופי ורבא לאוסופי לא חייש
human_translation: Abaye said, with a coarse cloth. Rava said: You even say with a soft cloth, once has been uprooted uprooted, And Abaye concerned perhaps come to increase But Rava is not concerned come to increase
llm_translation: Abbaye said: with a thick cloth. Rava said: even if you say with a soft cloth, as long as it is uprooted. And Abbaye is concerned lest it may come to be added, and Rava is not concerned lest it may come to be added.

hebrew_text: והתניא למה זה דומה לנותן אצבע בעין שכל זמן שאצבע בעין מדמעת וחוזרת ומדמעת
human_translation: Isn’t it taught To what is this comparable? to places a finger in eye, that as long as finger in the eye, will tear and continue to tear.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: To what is this matter similar? To one who puts a finger in his eye; as long as the finger is in the eye, it tears, and then it tears again.

hebrew_text: ורבא כל אחמומי והדר אחמומי בשעתא לא שכיח
human_translation: Rava any a heating and then heating at the time uncommon.
llm_translation: And Rava, all "Achmumei" and then "Achmumei" in the hour not common.

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל כל שכבת זרע שאין כל גופו מרגיש בה אינה מטמאה מ"ט שכבת זרע אמר רחמנא בראויה להזריע
human_translation: Shmuel says: Any semen that is not felt by one’s entire body does not render impure. What is the reason? The Merciful One states: “The flow of seed” that is fit to fertilize,
llm_translation: Said Shmuel: Any emission of semen that his entire body does not feel in it, it does not render impure. What is the reason? The emission of semen, the Merciful One said, is fitting for impregnation.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי היה מהרהר בלילה ועמד ומצא בשרו חם טמא תרגמא רב הונא במשמש מטתו בחלומו דאי אפשר לשמש בלא הרגשה
human_translation: raises an objection was having thoughts at night and he arose and found his flesh warm, he is ritually impure, Rav Huna interpreted to engaged in intercourse in his dream. Since it is impossible to engage in intercourse without sensation,
llm_translation: The question was raised: If one was contemplating at night and then stood up and found his flesh warm, impure. Rav Huna interpreted this as referring to one who had a seminal emission in his dream, for it is impossible to have an emission without sensation.

hebrew_text: לישנא אחרינא אמר שמואל כל שכבת זרע שאינו יורה כחץ אינה מטמאה מאי איכא בין האי לישנא להאי לישנא איכא בינייהו נעקרה בהרגשה ויצאה שלא בהרגשה
human_translation: another version Shmuel says: Any semen that is not shot like an arrow does not render impure. What is there between this version and that version between them was uprooted by a sensation, but it emerged without a sensation.
llm_translation: Another version said: Shmuel said, "Any emission of semen that does not shoot out like an arrow does not render a woman ritually impure." What is the practical difference between this version and the other version? The difference between them is when it is dislodged with intention or without intention.

hebrew_text: מילתא דפשיטא ליה לשמואל מיבעיא ליה לרבא דבעי רבא נעקרה בהרגשה ויצתה שלא בהרגשה מהו
human_translation: matter, which obvious to Shmuel, is raised as a dilemma by Rava. As Rava raises a dilemma: was uprooted by a sensation but it emerged without a sensation, what is
llm_translation: The matter that Shmuel ruled upon is needed by Rava. Rava asks: If it was uprooted intentionally, and it emerged unintentionally, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: ת"ש בעל קרי שטבל ולא הטיל מים לכשיטיל מים טמא שאני התם דרובה בהרגשה נפק
human_translation: Come hear one who experienced a seminal emission, who immersed but did not urinate when he urinates impure, There it is different, as the majority emerged by a sensation,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A Ba'al Keri who immersed but did not pour water, when he pours water it is impure. It is different there because most of it comes out with sensation.

hebrew_text: לישנא אחרינא אמרי לה אמר שמואל כל שכבת זרע שאינו יורה כחץ אינה מזרעת אזרועי הוא דלא מזרעא הא טמויי מטמיא שנאמר (דברים כג, יא) כי יהיה בך איש אשר לא יהיה טהור מקרה אפילו קרי בעולם
human_translation: Some say another version Shmuel says: Any semen that is not shot like an arrow cannot fertilize, It cannot fertilize, but it does render ritually impure, as it is stated: “If there be among you any man who is not ritually pure by reason of that which happened to him even mere semen
llm_translation: Another teaching they said in the name of Shmuel: Any emission of semen that does not shoot forth like an arrow does not cause impregnation, for it is like the spittle of the arm that does not cause impurity, as it is hidden. It causes impurity, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 23:11), "For there shall be among you a man who is not clean by reason of that which chances by night."

hebrew_text: בעי רבא עובד כוכבים שהרהר וירד וטבל מהו
human_translation: Rava raises dilemma: a gentile who had thoughts, and he descended and immersed what is
llm_translation: Rava inquired: A Gentile who had thoughts of conversion, descended and immersed - what is the ruling?

Perhaps we learn it from the verse, 'Any man who emits a discharge' (Leviticus 15:2), and we derive it through a fortiori reasoning, and the ruling is in accordance with both the lenient and stringent opinions.

hebrew_text: שיילינהו לתנאי איכא דתני כרב פפא ואיכא דתני כרב הונא בריה דרב נתן

hebrew_text: צריכי דאי כתב רחמנא וזרע אין לה משום דמעיקרא חד גופא והשתא תרי גופי אבל הכא דמעיקרא חד גופא והשתא חד גופא אימא תיכול כתב רחמנא כנעוריה
human_translation: are necessary. As, if the Merciful One had written “And has no child,” due to that at the outset, one body, and now two bodies, But here, when at the outset one body and now one body, say she should partake the Merciful One writes: “As in her youth.”
llm_translation: The text reads: "It is necessary, for if the Merciful One had written 'and she does not have offspring,' it would not be due to the fact that originally there was one body and now there are two bodies. But here, since originally there was one body and now there is one body, one might say that the Merciful One could have written 'like her youth.'"

hebrew_text: ואי כתב רחמנא כנעוריה משום דמעיקרא גופה סריקא והשתא גופה מליא אבל הכא דמעיקרא גופה סריקא והשתא גופה סריקא אימא תיכול צריכא
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “As in her youth,” due to that at the outset an empty body and now a full body, But here, where at the outset an empty body and now an empty body, say she should partake necessary.
llm_translation: "And if the Merciful One wrote it like its youth, because initially its body was empty, and now its body is full, but here, since initially its body was empty, and now its body is empty, say it may be necessary."

hebrew_text: קראי אתרוץ אלא מתניתין מאי אריא בן יום אחד אפי' עובר נמי אמר רב ששת הב"ע בכהן שיש לו שתי נשים אחת גרושה ואחת שאינה גרושה ויש לו בנים משאינה גרושה ויש לו בן יום אחד מן הגרושה
human_translation: verses resolved, but the mishna What specifically one day old, even a fetus? Rav Sheshet said: Here we are dealing with a priest who has two wives: One a divorcée, and one who is not a divorcée. And he has sons from who is not a divorcée, and he has one day old from the a divorcée.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Keraei atrutz ela mitnatin mai Arya ben yom echad afilu over nami amar Rav Sheshet haba'ah b'kohen sheyesh lo shtei nashim achat gerusha ve'achat she'einah gerusha ve'yesh lo banim mishe'einah gerusha ve'yesh lo ben yom echad min hagerusha." English translation: "The verses I will run, rather, the Mishnah: What is the case of Arya ben Yom Echad? Even if he is a fetus, Rav Sheshet said: In the case of a priest who has two wives, one divorced and one not divorced, and he has children from the one who is not divorced, and he has a one-day-old son from the divorced wife."

hebrew_text: דפוסל בעבדי אביו מלאכול בתרומה ולאפוקי מדר' יוסי דאמר עובר נמי פוסל קמ"ל בן יום אחד אין עובר לא
human_translation: that disqualifies his father’s slaves from partaking of teruma And to exclude of Rabbi Yosei, who said a fetus also disqualifies teaches us a one-day-old yes, a fetus not.
llm_translation: Disqualifies in slaves of his father to eat of the heave-offering and to exempt from the statement of Rabbi Yosei who said also a fetus disqualifies. This teaches us: one day old does not disqualify.

hebrew_text: נוחל ומנחיל נוחל ממאן מאביו ומנחיל למאן לאחיו מאביו אי בעי מאבוה לירתי ואי בעי מיניה לירתי
human_translation: inherits and he bequeaths. From whom does he inherit? from his father. And to whom does he bequeath? to his paternal brother, if wants, let him inherit from his father, and if he wants, let him inherit from
llm_translation: Inherit and bequeath, inherit from whom? From his father. And bequeath to whom? To his brothers from his father. If he wants, he can inherit from his father, and if he wants, he can inherit from him.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת נוחל בנכסי האם להנחיל לאחיו מן האב ודוקא בן יום אחד אבל עובר לא מ"ט דהוא מיית ברישא ואין הבן יורש את אמו
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: inherits his mother’s property to bequeath to a paternal half-brother. And specifically one day old but a fetus, not What is the reason that died first, and a son does not inherit from his mother
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: An heir inherits from the mother to bequeath to his brothers from the father, specifically if he is a one-day-old son. But if he is a fetus, what is the reason? Because he comes first, and a son does not inherit his mother.

hebrew_text: בקבר להנחיל לאחיו מן האב
human_translation: in the grave, in order to bequeath to his paternal half-brother.
llm_translation: In the grave to inherit to his brothers from the father.

hebrew_text: איני והא הוה עובדא ופרכס עד תלת פרכוסי אמר מר בריה דרב אשי מידי דהוה אזנב הלטאה דמפרכסת
human_translation: Is that so, But wasn’t there an incident and made up to three spasmodic motions Mar, son of Rav Ashi, said: just as it is with the tail of the lizard, which twitches
llm_translation: I am not convinced, but there was an incident, and the distance was until three parsaot. Mar, son of Rav Ashi, said: It was due to something that was the tail of a weasel of the Parakset.

hebrew_text: מר בריה דרב יוסף משמיה דרבא אמר לומר שממעט בחלק בכורה ואמר מר בריה דרב יוסף משמיה דרבא בן שנולד אחר מיתת האב אינו ממעט בחלק בכורה מאי טעמא (דברים כא, טו) וילדו לו בעינן
human_translation: Mar, son of Rav Yosef, said in the name of Rava: to say that reduces the portion of the firstborn. And Mar, son of Rav Yosef, said in the name of Rava: A son who was born after his father’s death does not reduce the portion of the firstborn. What is the reason We require and they bore him children”
llm_translation: Master, son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava, said: To say that one diminishes the portion of the firstborn. And Master, son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava, said: A son born after the father's death does not diminish the portion of the firstborn. What is the reason? "And he shall acknowledge the son of the hated as the firstborn" (Deuteronomy 21:15).

hebrew_text: בסורא מתנו הכי בפומבדיתא מתנו הכי אמר מר בריה דרב יוסף משמיה דרבא בכור שנולד לאחר מיתת אביו אינו נוטל פי שנים מאי טעמא (דברים כ״א:י״ז ) יכיר בעינן והא ליכא
human_translation: In Sura they taught that in Pumbedita they taught this Mar, son of Rav Yosef, said in the name of Rava: A firstborn who was born after his father’s death does not receive a double What is the reason We require he shall acknowledge and is not
llm_translation: In Sura they taught thus: In Pumbedita they taught thus: Said Mar, son of Rav Yosef in the name of Rava: A firstborn born after the death of his father does not receive a double portion. What is the reason? "He must acknowledge" (Deuteronomy 21:17) - we require acknowledgment, and here it is not present.

hebrew_text: והלכתא ככל הני לישני דמר בריה דרב יוסף משמיה דרבא
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with all these versions of Mar, son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava,
llm_translation: And the halacha is according to all those earlier ones, the disciples of Mar the son of Rav Yosef in the name of Rava.

hebrew_text: וההורגו חייב דכתיב (ויקרא כד, יז) ואיש כי יכה כל נפש מ"מ
human_translation: And one who kills liable as it is written: “And he who smites any man mortally in any case,
llm_translation: And the one who kills him is liable, as it is written (Leviticus 24:17), "And if a man strikes any soul..."

hebrew_text: והרי הוא לאביו ולאמו ולכל קרוביו כחתן שלם למאי הלכתא אמר רב פפא לענין אבלות
human_translation: And his to his father and to his mother and to all his relatives like a full-fledged groom. With regard to what halakha Rav Pappa said: With regard to mourning.
llm_translation: And behold, he is to his father and to his mother and to all his relatives like a complete bridegroom. What is the halakha? Rav Papa said regarding mourning.

hebrew_text: כמאן דלא כרשב"ג דאמר כל ששהה שלשים יום באדם אינו נפל הא לא שהה ספק הוי הכא במאי עסקינן דקים ליה שכלו לו חדשיו
human_translation: In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: With regard to humans, any that remained thirty days is not a non-viable newborn. he did not remain he is uncertain Here we are dealing with where one is certain that its months were completed,
llm_translation: Like one who is not like Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: "Any person who delays thirty days is not considered to have fallen." Here, since he did not delay, what are we dealing with? We are dealing with a case where his mind was made up for him.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בת שלש שנים ויום אחד מתקדשת בביאה ואם בא עליה יבם קנאה וחייבין עליה משום אשת איש
human_translation: A girl three years and one day old, is betrothed through intercourse, And if yavam engages in intercourse with her, he acquires her and is liable for her due to a married woman.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A girl of three years and one day becomes betrothed through intercourse, and if her brother-in-law engages in intercourse with her, he is liable for the punishment of a married woman.

hebrew_text: ומטמאה את בועלה לטמא משכב תחתון כעליון
human_translation: And she imparts impurity to one who engages in intercourse with her renders impure bedding beneath like the upper
llm_translation: And she defiles her husband to defile the lower bed as the upper.

hebrew_text: נשאת לכהן תאכל בתרומה בא עליה אחד מן הפסולין פסלה מן הכהונה בא עליה אחד מכל העריות האמורות בתורה מומתין עליה והיא פטורה
human_translation: she marries a priest, she may partake of teruma , one who are unfit engaged in intercourse with her, he disqualifies her from the priesthood, one of all those with whom relations are forbidden, stated in the Torah, engaged in intercourse with her, they are executed for her, and she is exempt,
llm_translation: She married a Kohen, she may eat from the Terumah. If one of the disqualifications came upon her, he disqualifies her from the priesthood. If one of all the forbidden relationships mentioned in the Torah came upon her, they are put to death on her, and she is exempt.

hebrew_text: פחות מכן כנותן אצבע בעין
human_translation: less than that like placing a finger into the eye.
llm_translation: Less than this is like putting a finger in the eye.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר בת ג' שנים מתקדשת בביאה דברי רבי מאיר וחכ"א בת ג' שנים ויום אחד מאי בינייהו אמרי דבי רבי ינאי ערב ראש השנה איכא בינייהו
human_translation: The Sages taught A girl three years is betrothed through intercourse; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: three years and one day old. What between of the school of Rabbi Yannai said: between the eve of the first day of year
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: A girl of three years can be betrothed through intercourse, according to Rabbi Meir, while the Sages say: A girl of three years and one day. What is the practical difference between them? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: The eve of Rosh Hashanah is the point of contention between them.

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן אמר ל' יום בשנה חשובין שנה איכא בינייהו
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: between thirty days in a year are considered a year.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: "Thirty days in a year are considered a full year."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי בת ג' שנים ואפי' בת שתי שנים ויום אחד מתקדשת בביאה דברי רבי מאיר וחכמים אומרים בת שלשה שנים ויום אחד
human_translation: raises an objection three years old, and even two years and one day old, is betrothed through intercourse; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: three years and one day old.
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: A girl of three years old, and even a girl of two years old and one day, becomes betrothed through intercourse - this is the view of Rabbi Meir. But the Sages say: A girl of three years old and one day.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לר' יוחנן כי היכי דאיכא תנא דקאמר יום אחד בשנה חשוב שנה הכי נמי איכא תנא דאמר ל' יום בשנה חשובין שנה
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, just as there is a tanna who says one day in a year is considered a year, so too, there is a tanna who says thirty days in a year are considered a year.
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Yochanan, for how is it that there is a Tanna who says, "one day in a year is considered a year"? So too, there is a Tanna who says, "thirty days in a year are considered a year."

hebrew_text: אלא לר' ינאי קשיא קשיא
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yannai, difficult, difficult
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yannai it is difficult, difficult.

hebrew_text: פחות מכאן כנותן אצבע בעין איבעיא להו הני בתולין מיזל אזלי ואתו או דלמא אתצודי הוא דלא מתצדי עד לאחר ג'
human_translation: less than that like placing a finger into the eye. A dilemma was raised before this hymen, disappear and come or perhaps it is not removed at all until after three?
llm_translation: Less than this is like putting a finger in the eye. The question was asked: Do these virgins go out and come back, or perhaps they are captured and do not return until after three months?

hebrew_text: למאי נפקא מינה כגון שבעל בתוך ג' ומצא דם ובעל לאחר שלש ולא מצא דם אי אמרת מיזל אזלי ואתו שהות הוא דלא הויא להו
human_translation: What difference is where engaged in intercourse within three and found blood and engaged in intercourse after three, but he did not find blood. If you say disappears and comes there was not enough time for it
llm_translation: Regarding what is the practical difference? For example, if one had relations within three days after her period and found blood, and then had relations after three days and did not find blood. If you say that the blood goes back and comes out, it is possible that it is not theirs.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת אתצודי הוא דלא מתצדי עד לאחר ג' הא אחר בא עליה מאי
human_translation: But if you say is not removed until after three, this another engaged in intercourse with her What,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say "Atzudei" is not "Mitzdei" until after three, then another one came upon it, what is it?

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב חייא בריה דרב איקא ומאן לימא לן דמכה שבתוך ג' אינה חוזרת לאלתר שמא חוזרת לאלתר והא אחר בא עליה
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Ika, objects to this But who will say to us that a wound that within three years is not restored immediately? Perhaps it is restored immediately, and this another engaged in intercourse with her
llm_translation: Rav Chiya, son of Rav Ika, objects to her: Who will say to us that a blow within three days does not immediately return? Perhaps it does immediately return, and another one comes upon it.

hebrew_text: אלא נפקא מינה כגון שבעל בתוך ג' ומצא דם ובעל לאחר ג' ומצא דם אי אמרת מיזל אזלי ואתו האי דם בתולין הוא אלא אי אמרת אתצודי הוא דלא מתצדי אלא עד לאחר ג' האי דם נדה הוא מאי
human_translation: Rather, difference where engaged in intercourse within three and found blood, and engaged in intercourse after three, and found blood. If you say disappears and comes this is blood the hymen, But if you say is not removed until after three, this is menstrual blood, What,
llm_translation: Rather, the conclusion is: for example, if one had relations within three days and found blood, and then had relations after three days and found blood. If you say that the blood goes back and comes forth, this blood is virgin blood. Rather, if you say that it is hunted blood, it is not hunted. Rather, until after three days, this blood is menstrual blood. What is the law?

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא ת"ש פחות מכאן כנותן אצבע בעין למה לי למתני כנותן אצבע בעין לתני פחות מכאן ולא כלום מאי לאו הא קמ"ל מה עין מדמעת וחוזרת ומדמעת אף בתולין מיזל אזלי ואתי
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Come hear less than that like placing a finger into the eye. Why do I to teach: Like placing a finger into the eye? Let teach less than that nothing. What, is it not this teaches us, Just as an eye tear and tear again, so too hymen disappears and comes
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: Come and hear! Less than this is like putting a finger in the eye. Why do I need it? To teach: Less than this. And not nothing. What, is it not so? This teaches: Just as the eye sheds tears and returns, so too do virgins go out and come in.

hebrew_text: ת"ר מעשה ביוסטני בתו של אסוירוס בן אנטנינוס שבאת לפני רבי אמרה לו רבי אשה בכמה ניסת אמר לה בת ג' שנים ויום אחד
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident involving Yusteni, the daughter of Asveirus, son of Antoninus, who came before Rabbi She said to him: My teacher, at what a woman marry, said to her: three years and one day old.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: There was an incident involving Justini, the daughter of Asyros, the son of Antoninus, who came before Rabbi. She said to him, "Rabbi, at what age is a woman considered to have undergone three years and one day?" He said to her, "At the age of three years and one day."

hebrew_text: ובכמה מתעברת אמר לה בת י"ב שנה ויום אחד אמרה לו אני נשאתי בשש וילדתי בשבע אוי לשלש שנים שאבדתי בבית אבא
human_translation: And at what she become pregnant? said to her: twelve years and one day old. She said to him: I married when six, and gave birth when seven. Woe for three years, as I wasted in my father’s house
llm_translation: And in how many months does she conceive? He said to her: In twelve months and one day. She said to him: I conceived in six months and gave birth in seven. Woe to three years that I lost in my father's house.

hebrew_text: ומי מעברה והתני רב ביבי קמיה דרב נחמן ג' נשים משמשות במוך קטנה מעוברת ומניקה
human_translation: And can become pregnant? But didn’t Rav Beivai teach before Rav Naḥman: Three women engage in intercourse using cloth, a minor; a pregnant woman; and a nursing woman.
llm_translation: And who is the one who crosses over? And it was taught: Rav Bevai stood before Rav Nachman, three women serve in a small, pregnant, and nursing household.

hebrew_text: קטנה שמא תתעבר ותמות מעוברת שמא תעשה עוברה סנדל מניקה שמא תגמול את בנה וימות
human_translation: A minor, lest she become pregnant and die a pregnant woman, lest her fetus become a sandal a nursing woman, lest she weans her son and he dies.
llm_translation: Ketana, lest she miscarry and die. Me'uberet, lest she cause a miscarriage. Sandal minika, lest she wean her son and he die.

hebrew_text: ואיזוהי קטנה מבת י"א שנה ויום אחד ועד י"ב שנה ויום אחד פחות מכאן או יתר על כן משמשת והולכת דברי ר"מ
human_translation: And who is a minor? from the age of eleven years and one day until twelve years and one day. younger than that or older than that, she may go ahead and engage in intercourse the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And which is the minor age of a daughter from eleven years and one day until twelve years and one day, whether less than this or more than this, she serves and goes out - the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וחכ"א אחת זו ואחת זו משמשת כדרכה והולכת ומן השמים ירחמו שנאמר (תהלים קטז, ו) שומר פתאים ה'
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Both this and that may go ahead and engage in intercourse in her usual manner, and Heaven will have mercy as it is stated: “The Lord preserves the simple”
llm_translation: And the sages of the Talmudic academies said: "One this and one that serves its purpose and goes, and may mercy come from heaven, as it is said (Psalms 116:6), 'The Lord preserves the simple.'"

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא (יחזקאל כג, כ) אשר בשר חמורים בשרם ואיבעית אימא (תהלים קמד, ח) אשר פיהם דבר שוא וימינם ימין שקר
human_translation: If you wish, say “Their flesh is the flesh of donkeys” And if you wish, say “Whose mouth speaks falsehood, and their right hand is a right hand of lying”
llm_translation: If you will say (Ezekiel 23:20) "whose flesh is the flesh of donkeys, and whose issue is like the issue of horses," and if you will say (Psalms 144:8) "whose mouths speak falsehood, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood."

hebrew_text: ת"ר מעשה באשה אחת שבאת לפני ר"ע אמרה לו ר' נבעלתי בתוך שלש שנים מה אני לכהונה אמר לה כשרה את לכהונה
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident involving a certain woman who came before Rabbi Akiva said to him: My teacher, I engaged in intercourse within three years what my into the priesthood? said to her: You are fit into the priesthood.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: There was an incident involving a certain woman who came before Rabbi Akiva. She said to him, "Rabbi, I have been married for less than three years. What is my status regarding priesthood?" He said to her, "You are fit for priesthood."

hebrew_text: אמרה לו רבי אמשול לך משל למה הדבר דומה לתינוק שטמנו לו אצבעו בדבש פעם ראשונה ושניה גוער בה שלישית מצצה אמר לה אם כן פסולה את לכהונה
human_translation: She said to him: My teacher, I will tell you a parable; to what is this matter comparable? to a baby whose finger dipped in honey. first time and second he moans at third sucks said to her: If so, you are disqualified into the priesthood.
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi, "I will tell you a parable. To what is the matter comparable? To a baby whom they hid his finger in honey. The first time and the second time he licks it, the third time he bites it. He said to her, 'If so, you are disqualified for the priesthood.'"

hebrew_text: ראה התלמידים מסתכלים זה בזה אמר להם למה הדבר קשה בעיניכם [אמרו ליה] כשם שכל התורה הלכה למשה מסיני כך פחותה מבת שלש שנים כשרה לכהונה הלכה למשה מסיני ואף רבי עקיבא לא אמרה אלא לחדד בה את התלמידים
human_translation: saw students looking at each other, He said to them: Why is this matter difficult in your eyes? They said to him: Just as the entire Torah is a halakha to Moses from Sinai, so too less than three years old, fit into the priesthood, a halakha to Moses from Sinai, And even Rabbi Akiva did not say only to sharpen students with
llm_translation: The students saw each other, he said to them, "Why is the matter difficult in your eyes?"
