They said to him, "Just as all the Torah was given to Moses at Sinai, so too a girl less than three years old is fit for the priesthood, the halakha was given to Moses at Sinai, and even Rabbi Akiva only said it to sharpen the students."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בן תשע שנים ויום אחד שבא על יבמתו קנאה ואין נותן גט עד שיגדיל
human_translation: nine years and one day old, who engaged in intercourse with his yevama , he acquires her but he cannot give a bill of divorce, until he reaches majority.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A boy of nine years and one day who cohabited with his yevamah, he is subject to the laws of kinship jealousy, and one does not give a bill of divorce until he reaches maturity.

hebrew_text: ומטמא בנדה לטמא משכב תחתון כעליון
human_translation: And he becomes ritually impure with a menstruating woman to renders impure bedding beneath like the upper
llm_translation: And he becomes impure with menstrual impurity to render impure the lower bed as the upper.

hebrew_text: ופוסל ואינו מאכיל בתרומה ופוסל את הבהמה מע"ג המזבח ונסקלת על ידו ואם בא על אחת מכל העריות האמורות בתורה מומתין על ידו והוא פטור
human_translation: And he disqualifies but he does not enable to partake of teruma . And he disqualifies the animal from upon the altar, and is stoned due to his And if he engaged in intercourse with one of all those with whom relations are forbidden, stated in the Torah, they are executed due to him, but he is exempt,
llm_translation: And disqualifies and does not feed with terumah and disqualifies the animal from being offered on the altar and he is stoned because of it. And if he engages in relations with any of the forbidden relationships mentioned in the Torah, they are put to death because of him, and he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ולכשיגדיל בגט סגי לה והתניא עשו ביאת בן ט' כמאמר בגדול
human_translation: And when he reaches majority, is a bill of divorce enough to her But isn’t it taught rendered the intercourse of nine old like levirate betrothal by an adult man,
llm_translation: Gemara: And when he grows up in the divorce document, it is sufficient for her. And it was taught: They made the coming of the son of nine like the statement "in greatness."

hebrew_text: מה מאמר בגדול צריך גט למאמרו וחליצה לזיקתו אף ביאת בן ט' צריך גט למאמרו וחליצה לזיקתו
human_translation: Just as a levirate betrothal by an adult man, must a bill of divorce to his levirate betrothal and ḥalitza to his bond, so too the intercourse of nine old, must a bill of divorce for his levirate betrothal and ḥalitza to his bond.
llm_translation: What is the statement regarding a prominent person? He requires a divorce for his statement and a redemption for his wound. Even the arrival of a nine-year-old son requires a divorce for his statement and a redemption for his wound.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הכי קאמר
human_translation: Rav said this is saying:
llm_translation: Rav said: This is what he is saying.

hebrew_text: לכשיגדיל יבעול ויתן גט
human_translation: When he reaches majority he may engage in intercourse with her, and he give her a bill of divorce
llm_translation: When he reaches the age of majority, he shall marry and give a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בת אחת עשרה שנה ויום א' נדריה נבדקין בת שתים עשרה שנה ויום א' נדריה קיימין ובודקין כל שתים עשרה
human_translation: eleven years and one day old, her vows are examined twelve years and one day old her vows are in effect. And one examines the entire twelfth
llm_translation: Mishnah: A girl of eleven years and one day, her vows are examined. A girl of twelve years and one day, her vows are upheld and examined every twelve years.

hebrew_text: בן שתים עשרה שנה ויום אחד נדריו נבדקין בן י"ג שנה ויום אחד נדריו קיימין ובודקין כל שלש עשרה
human_translation: twelve years and one day old, his vows are examined thirteen years and one day old his vows are in effect. And one examines the entire thirteenth
llm_translation: Son of twelve years and one day, his vows are examined. Son of thirteen years and one day, his vows are upheld and examined every thirteen years.

hebrew_text: קודם לזמן הזה אע"פ שאמרו יודעין אנו לשם מי נדרנו לשם מי הקדשנו אין נדריהם נדר ואין הקדשן הקדש לאחר הזמן הזה אע"פ שאמרו אין אנו יודעין לשם מי נדרנו לשם מי הקדשנו נדרן נדר והקדשן הקדש
human_translation: Prior to that time, even if they said: We know in Whose name we vowed in Whose name we consecrated, their vow is not vow and their consecration is not consecration. After that time, even if they said: We do not know in Whose name we vowed in Whose name we consecrated, their vow is vow and their consecration is consecration.
llm_translation: Before the time of this, even though they said, "We know for whose sake we made a vow, for whose sake we consecrated," their vows are vows, and their consecrations are consecrations. After the time of this, even though they said, "We do not know for whose sake we made a vow, for whose sake we consecrated," their vow is a vow, and their consecration is consecration.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ וכיון דתנא בת אחת עשרה שנה ויום א' נדריה נבדקין בת י"ב שנה ויום א' נדריה קיימין למה לי סד"א בודקין לעולם קמ"ל
human_translation: But since teaches: eleven years and one day old her vows are examined, why do I twelve years and one day old her vows are in effect? enter your mind to say one examines forever, teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: Since the Mishnah teaches that the vow of a girl who is eleven years and one day old is examined, and the vow of a girl who is twelve years and one day old is upheld, why does the Mishnah need to state this? To teach us that we always examine vows, as the Mishnah concludes.

hebrew_text: וכיון דתני בת י"ב שנה ויום אחד נדריה קיימין בודקין כל שתים עשרה למה לי סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ואמר מר ל' יום בשנה חשובים שנה היכא דבדקנא ל' ולא ידעה להפלות אימא תו לא ליבדוק קמ"ל
human_translation: And since teaches: twelve years and one day old her vows are in effect, why do I One examines the entire twelfth enter your mind to say: Since the Master says thirty days in a year are considered a year, where we examine her thirty and she did not know to utter properly, say one should examine no further teaches us
llm_translation: And since it taught: "When a girl of twelve years and one day makes vows, they are upheld," we examine every twelve. Why do I need it? I might say, since the Master said, "Thirty days in a year are considered a year," where we examine thirty and she does not know to annul, say, let her not examine. It teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: ולתני הני תרתי בבי בת י"ב שנה ויום א' נדריה קיימין ובודקין כל י"ב בת אחת עשרה ויום א' נדריה נבדקין למה לי
human_translation: And let teach these two clauses: twelve years and one day old her vows are in effect, and one examines the entire twelfth why do I eleven years and one day old, her vows are examined?
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: "These two women in the house of Bat Yod-Bet are twelve years old, and on the first day of their twelfth year their vows are upheld, and they are examined every twelfth year on the eleventh day. Why are their vows examined for me?"

hebrew_text: איצטריך סד"א סתמא בשתים עשרה בעיא בדיקה באחת עשרה לא בעיא בדיקה והיכא דחזינן לה דחריפא טפי מיבדקה באחת עשרה קמ"ל
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say: an ordinary requires examination in twelfth in eleventh does not require examination. But where we discern about her that she a very sharp she should be examined in eleventh teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary. The Tanna of the school of Rabbi Akiva requires examination in twelve cases, in eleven cases it does not require examination. And where we see that it is more stringent, it requires examination in eleven cases. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: קודם הזמן הזה ואחר הזמן הזה למה לי סד"א הנ"מ היכא דלא קאמרי אינהו אבל היכא דקאמרי אינהו נסמוך עלייהו קמ"ל
human_translation: Why do I prior to that time and after that time enter your mind to say: These matters where they do not say: But where they do say we rely on their teaches us
llm_translation: Before this time and after this time, why do I need it? The School of Rabbi Ishmael and the School of Rabbi Nehemiah: where they do not say, they do not say; but where they do say, they rely on them. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: ת"ר אלו דברי רבי ר"ש בן אלעזר אומר דברים האמורים בתינוקת בתינוק אמורים דברים האמורים בתנוק בתנוקת אמורים
human_translation: the Sages taught This the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says matter stated with regard to a girl is stated with regard to a boy, matter stated with regard to a boy is stated with regard to a girl,
llm_translation: These are the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar: Matters spoken in the presence of a young girl are spoken in the presence of a young girl; matters spoken in the presence of a young boy are spoken in the presence of a young boy.

hebrew_text: א"ר חסדא מ"ט דרבי דכתיב (בראשית ב׳:כ״ב ) ויבן ה' [אלהים] את הצלע מלמד שנתן הקב"ה בינה יתירה באשה יותר מבאיש
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: What is the reason of Rabbi As it is written, “And the rib, the Lord God He made [ vayyiven ] teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, granted a woman a greater understanding [ bina ] than of a men.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥisda: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi, as it is written (Genesis 2:22), "And the Lord God built the rib"? This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, endowed a woman with more understanding than a man.

hebrew_text: ואידך ההוא מבעי ליה לכדריש לקיש דאמר ריש לקיש משום ר"ש בן מנסיא ויבן ה' [אלהים] את הצלע אשר לקח מן האדם לאשה ויביאה אל האדם מלמד שקלעה הקב"ה לחוה והביאה אצל אדם הראשון שכן בכרכי הים קורין לקלעיתא בנייתא
human_translation: And the other He requires that for that which Reish Lakish as Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya “And the rib, which the Lord God had taken from the man, He made a woman, and brought her to the man.” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, braided Eve, and brought her to Adam the first As in the cities overseas [ bikhrakei hayyam ] they call braiding building [ benayita ].
llm_translation: And the other one, that which Rish Lakish requires, for Rish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya, "And the Lord God built the rib that He had taken from the man into a woman and brought her to the man." This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, braided Eve's hair and brought her to Adam, who dwelt on the shores of the sea, calling her "constructed braid."

hebrew_text: ור"ש בן אלעזר מ"ט אמר רב שמואל בר רב יצחק מתוך שהתינוק מצוי בבית רבו נכנסת בו ערמומית תחלה
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, what is the reason Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: Since a boy frequents his teacher’s house, cleverness enters his first.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, what is his reason? Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said: Since the infant is found in the house of his teacher, the immoral woman initially enters him.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו תוך זמן כלפני זמן או כלאחר זמן
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before during time, like before time or as after time?
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "Within the time, before the time, or after the time?"

hebrew_text: למאי הלכתא אי לנדרים לאו כלפני זמן דמיא ולאו כלאחר זמן דמיא
human_translation: With regard to what halakha If with regard to vows, is not considered as before time, but is not considered as after time
llm_translation: Regarding what halakha? If for vows, is it not similar to before the time and not similar to after the time?

hebrew_text: אלא לעונשין מאי רב ור' חנינא דאמרי תרווייהו תוך זמן כלפני זמן ר' יוחנן ור' יהושע בן לוי דאמרי תרווייהו תוך זמן כלאחר זמן
human_translation: Rather, with regard to punishments, What, Rav and Rabbi Ḥanina both say: during time as before time, Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi both say: during time as after time,
llm_translation: Rather, regarding punishments, what is the difference between Rav and Rabbi Chanina? Both of them said within time, before time. Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi both said within time, after time.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק וסימניך (רות ד, ז) וזאת לפנים בישראל
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: And your mnemonic, “Now this [ vezot ] was the custom in former times in Israel”
llm_translation: Said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: And your mnemonic is (Ruth 4:7) "And this is done in Israel."

hebrew_text: מתיב רב המנונא אחר זמן הזה אע"פ שאמרו אין אנו יודעים לשם מי נדרנו לשם מי הקדשנו נדריהם נדר והקדשן הקדש הא תוך זמן כלפני זמן
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raises an objection After that time, even if they say: We do not know in Whose name we vowed in Whose name we consecrated, their vow is vow and their consecration is consecration. during time, as before time,
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna raised an objection: After this time, even though they said we do not know for whose sake we made a vow, for whose sake we sanctified, their vows are vows, and their sanctifications are sanctifications. Is it not within the time, like before the time.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא אימא רישא קודם הזמן הזה אע"פ שאמרו יודעים אנו לשם מי נדרנו לשם מי הקדשנו אין נדריהם נדר ואין הקדשן הקדש הא תוך זמן כלאחר זמן
human_translation: Rava said to Say the former clause Prior to that time, even if they said: We know in Whose name we vowed in Whose name we consecrated, their vow is not vow and their consecration is not consecration. during time, as after time.
llm_translation: Rava said to him: Say the first part before this time, even though they said, "We know for whose sake we made a vow, for whose sake we consecrated." Their vows are vows, and their consecrations are consecrations. But within the time, not after the time.

hebrew_text: ולא היא רבא קטעי הוא סבר רב המנונא ממשנה יתירה קדייק ואדדייק מסיפא לידוק מרישא
human_translation: And is not so, Rava erred. He thought Rav Hamnuna inferred from the superfluous mishna, And rather than inferring from the latter clause let him infer from the former clause
llm_translation: And not it is Rava cutting he thinks Rav Hamnuna from Mishnah extra precise and exact from the end to the beginning.

hebrew_text: ולא היא רב המנונא מגופא דמתניתין קא דייק הא לאחר זמן היכי דמי אי דלא אייתי שתי שערות קטן הוא אלא לאו דאייתי שתי שערות
human_translation: But it is not so; Rav Hamnuna inferred from the the mishna itself, that After time, what are the circumstances? If where has not developed two hairs, he is a minor. Rather, is it not where has developed two hairs,
llm_translation: And it is not Rav Hamnuna himself from the Mishnah itself who is precise, for after some time, what is the case? If he does not bring two hairs, is he a minor? Rather, it is not that he brings two hairs.

hebrew_text: וטעמא דלאחר זמן הוא דגמר' לה למילתיה הא תוך זמן כלפני זמן
human_translation: and the reason that his matter, was completed for him after time? during time, as before time,
llm_translation: And the reason that it is after a time is because he has decided for himself regarding his matter, this is like within time before time.

hebrew_text: ועוד מתיב רבי זירא (במדבר ו ) איש כי יפליא לנדור נדר מה ת"ל איש לרבות בן י"ג שנה ויום אחד שאע"פ שאינו יודע להפליא נדריו קיימין
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Zeira raises an objection When man shall clearly utter a vow” What the verse states “man,” to include thirteen years and one day old, that even if he does not know to utter clearly his vows are in effect.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Zeira raises an objection: "A man who makes a special vow" (Numbers 6:2). What is the teaching when it says "a man"? To include a thirteen-year-old boy, even though he does not know how to make special vows, his vows are valid.

hebrew_text: ה"ד אי דלא אייתי שתי שערות קטן הוא אלא לאו דאייתי שתי שערות וטעמא דבן י"ג ויום אחד הוא דהוה ליה איש הא תוך זמן כלפני זמן תיובתא
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If where has not developed two hairs, he is a minor, Rather, is it not where has developed two hairs? And the reason that he is a man is that he is thirteen years and one day old, but during time, as before time. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: This is the case: if he did not bring two hairs, he is a minor. Rather, if he brought two hairs, and the reason is that he is thirteen years old and one day, for he had become a man. But within a time period, the refutation is.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"נ כתנאי בן ט' שנים שהביא ב' שערות שומא מבן ט' ועד י"ב שנה ויום אחד שומא רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אומר סימן בן י"ג שנה ויום אחד דברי הכל סימן
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said subject to tanna’im , a nine-year-old who developed two hairs a mole. From nine of age until twelve years and one day, a mole. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: a sign thirteen years and one day old all agree a sign
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Nechemiah: Like the Tanna, a boy of nine years who brought two pubic hairs of black color from the age of nine until twelve years and one day, it is a sign. Rabbi Yossi, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A sign is a boy of thirteen years and one day. These are the words of all, a sign.

hebrew_text: הא גופא קשיא אמרת מבן ט' ועד י"ב שנה ויום אחד שומא הא י"ג שנה גופא סימן והדר תני בן י"ג שנה ויום אחד סימן הא י"ג שנה גופא שומא
human_translation: This itself difficult, you said from nine of age until twelve years and one day a mole, the thirteenth year itself, a sign And then teaches thirteen years and one day old a sign the thirteenth year itself, a mole.
llm_translation: This itself is difficult: You said from the age of nine until twelve years and one day, Shoma. This is thirteen years itself, a sign. And then he taught: at the age of thirteen years and one day, a sign. This is thirteen years itself, Shoma.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו תנאי היא דמר סבר תוך זמן כלאחר זמן ומר סבר תוך זמן כלפני זמן
human_translation: What, is it not is tanna’im , as Sage, holds during time as after time, and Sage, holds during time as before time?
llm_translation: What is the disagreement? Mar holds "within time" like "after time," and Mar holds "within time" like "before time."

hebrew_text: לא דכ"ע תוך זמן כלפני זמן ואידי ואידי בתינוקת ורישא רבי וסיפא ר"ש בן אלעזר
human_translation: No, everyone, during time as before time, and this and that to a young girl. And the first clause Rabbi and the last clause Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar,
llm_translation: Not as such. Within time, like before time. And both, and both, in infancy. The beginning, Rabbi. And the end, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא הא והא בתינוק ורישא ר"ש בן אלעזר וסיפא רבי
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that with a young boy, and the first clause Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar and the last clause Rabbi
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this in the case of a child, the first part according to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and the latter part according to Rabbi.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא הא והא רבי הא בתינוק הא בתינוקת ואב"א הא והא ר"ש בן אלעזר הא בתינוק הא בתינוקת
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that Rabbi this to a young boy, that to a young girl. And if you wish, say this and that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, that to a young boy, this to a young girl.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: this and this, Rabbi, this is a male child, this is a female child, and Abba, this and this, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, this is a male child, this is a female child.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אומר סימן א"ר כרוספדאי בריה דרבי שבתאי והוא שעודן בו
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says a sign Rabbi Keruspedai, son of Rabbi Shabbtai, says: And is when are still upon him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosi, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A sign - Rabbi Karuspedai, son of Rabbi Shevatai. And this is while he is still in it.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי בן ט' שנים ויום אחד שהביא ב' שערות שומא מבן ט' ועד י"ב שנה ויום אחד ועודן בו שומא ר' יוסי בר' יהודה אומר סימן
human_translation: this is also taught nine years and one day old who developed two hairs, a mole. from nine of age until twelve years and one day, and are still upon him, a mole. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: a sign
llm_translation: It was also taught: Similarly, if a boy is nine years and one day old and he brought two pubic hairs from the age of nine until twelve years and one day, and there is still hair in it, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says it is a sign.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הילכתא תוך זמן כלפני זמן רב שמואל בר זוטרא מתני לה לשמעתא דרבא בהאי לישנא אמר רבא קטנה כל י"ב שנה ממאנת והולכת מכאן ואילך אינה ממאנת ואינה חולצת
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha during time as before time, Rav Shmuel bar Zutra teaches this halakha of Rava in this formulation: Rava says: a minor girl entire twelfth year she continuous perform refusal with regard to From that forward, she may no perform refusal, and she may not perform ḥalitza
llm_translation: Rava said: The halacha is within the time, like before the time. Rav Shmuel bar Zutra taught it for the sake of Rava's reputation in this matter. Rava said: A minor girl, at the age of twelve years, may refuse and depart from here onwards, she may not refuse and she may not be divorced.

hebrew_text: הא גופא קשיא אמרת אינה ממאנת אלמא גדולה היא אי גדולה היא תחלוץ
human_translation: This itself difficult: You said she may not perform refusal. Evidently, she is an adult woman. if she is an adult woman, let her perform ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: This itself difficult said not refuses therefore great she if great she will remove

hebrew_text: וכי תימא מספקא ליה ומי מספקא ליה והאמר רבא קטנה שהגיעה לכלל שנותיה אינה צריכה בדיקה חזקה הביאה סימנין
human_translation: And if you would say is uncertain is uncertain But doesn’t Rava say: A minor girl who reached her full age does not require examination a presumption she has developed signs
llm_translation: And if you say, "Perhaps he is in doubt," but is he in doubt? For Rava said: A minor who has reached the age of puberty does not require a thorough examination; if she brings signs.

hebrew_text: ה"מ בסתמא אבל הכא דבדקו ולא אשכחו לא
human_translation: this statement, in an ordinary But here where they examined and did not find not
llm_translation: These are the words: "In a case of doubt." But here, since they examined and did not find, no.

hebrew_text: אי הכי תמאן חוששין שמא נשרו
human_translation: If so, she should perform refusal. We are concerned perhaps they fell out.
llm_translation: If so, they are concerned lest they were torn.

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד חוששין אלא למ"ד אין חוששין מאי איכא למימר דאיתמר רב פפא אמר אין חוששין שמא נשרו רב פפי אמר חוששין הני מילי לענין חליצה אבל לענין מיאון חוששין
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says we are concerned But according to the one who says we are not concerned what is there to say? As it was stated Rav Pappa says: We are not concerned perhaps fell out; Rav Pappi says: We are concerned this statement with regard to ḥalitza , but with regard to refusal we are concerned
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says we are cautious, but according to the one who says we are not cautious, what can be said? For it was stated, Rav Pappa said, we are not cautious lest they become entangled. Rav Pappi said, we are cautious. These matters are regarding halitzah, but regarding refusal, we are cautious.

hebrew_text: מכלל דמ"ד חוששין חולצת והא חוששין בעלמא קאמר
human_translation: By inference, does the one who says we are concerned performs ḥalitza ? But he says we are merely concerned
llm_translation: From the principle that "mem-dalet" (abbreviation for "mishum dechashash") we are concerned about a garment, and yet we are concerned in general.

hebrew_text: אלא לעולם דלא בדקה ולענין חליצה חיישינן וכי קאמר רבא חזקה למיאון אבל לחליצה בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: Rather, actually where one did not examine and with regard to ḥalitza we are concerned And when Rava said a presumption to refusal, but with regard to ḥalitza she requires examination.
llm_translation: Rather, indeed not examined, and regarding halitzah we are concerned. Is Rava saying that a presumption for refusal? But for halitzah, examination is necessary.

hebrew_text: אמר רב דימי מנהרדעא הלכתא חוששין שמא נשרו
human_translation: Rav Dimi of Neharde’a said: The halakha we are concerned perhaps fell out.
llm_translation: Rav Dimi from Nehardea said: The halacha is that we are concerned lest they were removed.

hebrew_text: והני מילי היכא דקדשה בתוך זמן ובעל לאחר זמן דאיכא ספיקא דאורייתא אבל מעיקרא לא
human_translation: And this statement where betrothed her during time, and engaged in intercourse after time, where there is an uncertainty Torah law, But at the outset, no
llm_translation: And these matters are applicable where sanctification occurred within the time limit and the husband died after the time limit, for there is a doubt of a violation of a law of the Torah, but initially not.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא הקדיש ואכל לוקה
human_translation: Rav Huna says: consecrated and ate he is flogged,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: "He sanctified and ate a locust."

hebrew_text: שנאמר (במדבר ו׳:ב׳ ) איש כי יפליא לנדור (במדבר ל, ג) ולא יחל דברו כל שישנו בהפלאה ישנו בבל יחל וכל שאינו בהפלאה אינו בבל יחל
human_translation: As it is stated: “When a man shall clearly utter a vow” And “He shall not profane his word” any who is in explicitness is in “He shall not profane and anyone who is not in explicitness is not in “He shall not profane
llm_translation: As it is stated (Numbers 6:2), "When a man makes a special vow" (Numbers 30:3), and his word shall not be void; whoever is in a state of wonderment is subject to voiding, and whoever is not in a state of wonderment is not subject to voiding.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב הונא בר יהודה (לרבא) לסיועי לרב הונא
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda raises an objection in support of Rav Huna:
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Judah raised an objection (to Rava) for the assistance of Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: לפי שמצינו שהשוה הכתוב הקטן כגדול לזדון שבועה ולאיסר ולבל יחל יכול יהא חייב על הקדשו קרבן
human_translation: Since we find that the verse equates a minor, to an adult with regard to an intentional an oath and with regard to prohibition, and with regard to he shall not profane might should be liable an offering for his consecrated
llm_translation: According to that which we have found, that the Scripture equates the small to the large for the purpose of intentional false oath and for prohibition and for not profaning, one might think that he should be liable for his consecrated animal as a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (במדבר ל, ב) זה הדבר
human_translation: the verse states “This is the matter
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Talmudic text: ת"ל (במדבר ל, ב) זה הדבר" Translation: "It is taught (Numbers 30:2), 'This is the matter.'"

hebrew_text: קתני מיהת לאיסר ולבל יחל חייב אימא לאיסור בל יחל
human_translation: In any event, teaches with regard to prohibition and with regard to he shall not profane liable say with regard to the prohibition he shall not profane
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "For a negative commandment and for a positive commandment that one should not violate, one is liable." I would say, for a negative commandment and for a positive commandment that one should not violate.

hebrew_text: איסור בל יחל מה נפשך אי מופלא סמוך לאיש דאורייתא מילקא נמי לילקי ואי מופלא סמוך לאיש לאו דאורייתא איסור נמי ליכא לאותן המוזהרים עליו
human_translation: the prohibition he shall not profane Whichever way you If a discriminating on the brink of adulthood by Torah law, he should be flogged too, And if a discriminating on the brink of adulthood not by Torah law, there is no prohibition either. to those who are warned to him
llm_translation: Prohibition not shall desecrate what soul yours if wonder close to man of Torah milk also shall milk and if wonder close to man not of Torah prohibition also not exists for those warned upon him

hebrew_text: שמע מינה קטן אוכל נבלות ב"ד מצווין עליו להפרישו הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שהקדיש הוא ואכלו אחרים
human_translation: conclude from a minor eats animal carcasses the court is commanded to prevent him Here we are dealing with where consecrated and others ate
llm_translation: Listen from it, infer: a minor eats carcasses, the court commands to separate him. Here, what are we dealing with? Such as he consecrated and others ate.

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד הקדיש הוא ואכלו אחרים לוקין אלא למ"ד אין לוקין מאי איכא למימר דאיתמר הקדיש הוא ואכלו אחרים רב כהנא אמר אין לוקין רבי יוחנן ור"ל דאמרי תרוויהו לוקין
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said consecrated and others ate they are flogged. But according to the one who said they are not flogged, what can be said? As it was stated consecrated and others ate Rav Kahana says they are not flogged; Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say they are flogged.
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the opinion of the one who says "Hakdish Hu" and others eat - they are liable to lashes. Rather, according to the one who says "Ein Lokin," what can be said? That it was stated "Hakdish Hu" and others ate. Rav Kahana said: they are not liable to lashes. Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish, both said: they are liable to lashes.

hebrew_text: מדרבנן וקרא אסמכתא בעלמא
human_translation: by rabbinic law. And verse a mere support
llm_translation: From the Rabbis and a verse is merely a support.

hebrew_text: גופא הקדיש ואכלו אחרים רב כהנא אמר אין לוקין רבי יוחנן ור"ל דאמרי תרוייהו לוקין במאי קמיפלגי מר סבר מופלא סמוך לאיש דאורייתא ומר סבר מופלא סמוך לאיש מדרבנן
human_translation: the itself, consecrated and others ate Rav Kahana says they are not flogged; Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say they are flogged. With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds a discriminating on the brink of adulthood by Torah law, and Sage, holds a discriminating on the brink of adulthood by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: The actual case: one sanctified and others ate. Rav Kahana said: they are not lashed. Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish, both say: they are lashed. What is the point of their dispute? One holds that a wonder close to a Torah scholar, and one holds that a wonder close to a rabbinic scholar.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב ירמיה יתומה שנדרה בעלה מפר לה אי אמרת בשלמא מופלא סמוך לאיש דרבנן אתו נשואין דרבנן ומבטלי נדרא דרבנן אלא אי אמרת דאורייתא אתו נשואין דרבנן ומבטלי נדרא דאורייתא
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya raises an objection an orphan who vowed, her husband may nullify her Granted, if you say a discriminating on the brink of adulthood by rabbinic law, marriage by rabbinic law comes and negates a vow by rabbinic law. But if you say by Torah law, marriage by rabbinic law come and negate a vow by Torah law?
llm_translation: Challenged Rav Yirmiyah: A widow who vowed, her husband annuls it for her. If you say, it is understandable near a Rabbinic scholar, Rabbinic marriages come and annul her Rabbinic vow. But if you say it is from the Torah, Rabbinic marriages come and annul her Torah vow.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל בעלה מפר לה ממה נפשך אי דרבנן דרבנן הוא אי דאורייתא קטן אוכל נבלות הוא ואין ב"ד מצווין עליו להפרישו
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Her husband may nullify her whichever you If by rabbinic law, is by rabbinic law. if by Torah law, is a minor may eat animal carcasses and the court is not commanded to prevent him
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "Her husband annuls her vows, from what is your soul? If he is a rabbinic scholar, he is a rabbinic scholar; if he is a minor according to the Torah, he eats carcasses, and the court is not commanded to separate him."

hebrew_text: והא כי גדלה אכלה בהפרה קמייתא
human_translation: But when she grows she will eat on the initial nullification
llm_translation: And the word "when" is "grew" and "ate" in the cow.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר ליואי בעלה מפר לה כל שעה ושעה והוא שבעל
human_translation: Rabba bar Livai said her husband nullifies her each and every moment, And is where engaged in intercourse
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Levi said: Her husband invalidates her every hour, and he is the one who invalidates.

hebrew_text: והא אין בעל מפר בקודמין כדרב פינחס משמיה דרבא דאמר רב פנחס משמיה דרבא כל הנודרת על דעת בעלה היא נודרת
human_translation: But a husband cannot nullify preceded in accordance with of Rav Pineḥas in the name of Rava, as Rav Pineḥas said in the name of Rava: Any who takes a vow, on her husband’s consent she takes the vow.
llm_translation: And behold, a Baal Mafar does not have precedence, as Rav Pinchas in the name of Rava said: Rav Pinchas in the name of Rava said, "Any vow made with the knowledge of her husband, it is a vow."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ת"ש קטן שלא הביא ב' שערות רבי יהודה אומר אין תרומתו תרומה רבי יוסי אומר עד שלא בא לעונת נדרים אין תרומתו תרומה משבא לעונת נדרים תרומתו תרומה
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear a minor who has not grown two hairs, Rabbi Yehuda says: His teruma is not teruma . Rabbi Yosei says: Until he has reached the age of vows, his teruma is not teruma , once he has reached the age of vows, his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: Abaye said: Come and hear: A minor who has not yet brought two pubic hairs. Rabbi Yehuda says: His terumah is not terumah. Rabbi Yosei says: Until he reaches the age of vows, his terumah is not terumah. Once he reaches the age of vows, his terumah is terumah.

hebrew_text: סברוה קסבר ר' יוסי תרומה בזמן הזה דאורייתא אי אמרת בשלמא מופלא סמוך לאיש דאורייתא אתי גברא דאורייתא ומתקן טבלא דאורייתא אלא אי אמרת דרבנן אתי גברא דרבנן ומתקן טבלא דאורייתא לא קסבר רבי יוסי תרומה בזמן הזה דרבנן
human_translation: assumed Rabbi Yosei holds teruma in the present by Torah law. Granted, if you say a discriminating on the brink of adulthood by Torah law, a man by Torah law can come and prepare untithed produce [ tivla ] by Torah law. But if you say by rabbinic law, a man by rabbinic law come and prepare untithed produce, by Torah law? No, Rabbi Yosei holds teruma in the present by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: He holds as he holds, Rabbi Yosei: Terumah in our time, biblical law. If you say, well, it is a wonder near a man of biblical law, a man of biblical law comes and fixes a biblical immersion. But if you say, rabbinic, a man of rabbinic law comes and fixes a biblical immersion, Rabbi Yosei does not hold: Terumah in our time, rabbinic law.

hebrew_text: וסבר ר' יוסי תרומה בזמן הזה דרבנן והתניא בסדר עולם (דברים ל, ה) אשר ירשו אבותיך וירשתה
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yosei hold teruma in the present by rabbinic law? But isn’t it taught in Seder Olam : that your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it”
llm_translation: And R. Yosei holds: Terumah nowadays is Rabbinic, and it was taught in the order of the world (Deuteronomy 30:5) "which your fathers shall inherit it, and you shall inherit it."

hebrew_text: ירושה ראשונה ושניה יש להן שלישית אין להן
human_translation: a first possession and they had a second they not have a third
llm_translation: Inheritance first and second have a third do not have

hebrew_text: וא"ר יוחנן מאן תנא סדר עולם ר' יוסי
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Who taught Seder Olam ? Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Who is the Tanna of the Order of the World? Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי תני לה ולא סבר לה ה"נ מסתברא דתניא עיסה שנדמעה או שנתחמצה בשאור של תרומה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei taught but he does not maintain its So too, it is reasonable as it is taught dough that became mixed or which was leavened with leaven of teruma ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei taught it and did not think about it. This is reasonable, as it was taught: Dough that became leavened or soured in the leaven of terumah.

hebrew_text: חייבת בחלה ואינה נפסלת בטבול יום דברי ר"מ ור' יהודה ר' יוסי ור"ש פוטרין מן החלה
human_translation: subject to the obligation ḥalla , And it is not rendered unfit by one who immersed that day the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon deem exempt from the ḥalla ,
llm_translation: Obligated in challah and not disqualified by immersion of the day - the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon exempt from challah.

hebrew_text: סברוה מאן דאמר תרומה דאורייתא חלה דאורייתא מאן דאמר תרומה דרבנן חלה דרבנן אי אמרת בשלמא קסבר רבי יוסי חלה בזמן הזה דרבנן אתי דמוע דרבנן ומפקע חלה דרבנן
human_translation: assumed the one who said teruma by Torah law ḥalla by Torah law, the one who said teruma by rabbinic law ḥalla by rabbinic law. granted, if you say Rabbi Yosei holds ḥalla in the present by rabbinic law, a mixture by rabbinic law comes and abrogates ḥalla , by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: The one who said Terumah is from the Torah, Challah is from the Torah. The one who said Terumah is from the Rabbis, Challah is from the Rabbis. If you say, according to Rabbi Yosei who holds that Challah nowadays is from the Rabbis, it comes out that the Rabbis come and nullify the Rabbinic Challah.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת חלה דאורייתא אתי דמוע דרבנן ומפקע חלה דאורייתא
human_translation: But if you say ḥalla by Torah law, a mixture by rabbinic law come and abrogate ḥalla by Torah law?
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that challah is a biblical requirement, then the Rabbis come and nullify the biblical challah.

hebrew_text: ודלמא קסבר רבי יוסי תרומה בזמן הזה דאורייתא וחלה דרבנן
human_translation: But perhaps Rabbi Yosei maintains teruma in the present by Torah law and ḥalla by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: And perhaps Rabbi Yosei holds that Terumah nowadays is of biblical origin, while Challah is of rabbinic origin.

hebrew_text: וכדאהדר רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע דאמר רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע אשכחתינהו לרבנן דבי רב דיתבי וקאמרי אפילו למ"ד תרומה בזמן הזה דרבנן חלה דאורייתא
human_translation: And as Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, responded As Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: I found the Sages of the study hall of Rav sitting and saying: Even according to the one who said teruma in the present by rabbinic law, ḥalla by Torah law.
llm_translation: And when Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, returned, for Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said, "I found them, the sages of the house of Rav, sitting and saying, 'Even according to the opinion that terumah nowadays is Rabbinically mandated, challah is from the Torah.'"

hebrew_text: שהרי שבע שכבשו ושבע שחלקו נתחייבו בחלה ולא נתחייבו במעשר
human_translation: that seven that conquered and seven that they divided they were obligated to ḥalla but they were not obligated to tithe.
llm_translation: For behold, seven who conquered and seven who divided are obligated in challah and not obligated in tithing.

hebrew_text: ואמינא להו אנא אפילו למ"ד תרומה בזמן הזה דאורייתא חלה דרבנן דתניא אי בבואכם יכול משנכנסו לה שנים ושלשה מרגלים ת"ל בבואכם בביאת כולכם אמרתי ולא בביאת מקצתכם
human_translation: And I said to them: even according to the one who said teruma in the present by Torah law, ḥalla by rabbinic law, as it is taught If “when you come” might from that two or three spies entered the verse states: “When you come,” I said when all of you come, and not when some of you come.
llm_translation: "And I said to them, even according to the opinion that Terumah nowadays is from the Torah, Challah is Rabbinic, as it was taught: 'If upon your coming in, you could think that when two or three spies enter, it is stated 'upon your coming in,' meaning with all of you I said, and not with the coming in of some of you.'"

hebrew_text: וכי אסקינהו עזרא לא כולהו סלוק
human_translation: And when Ezra brought not all of them ascended.
llm_translation: And when Ezra encountered them, not all of them departed.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ משל משלו חכמים באשה פגה בוחל וצמל פגה עודה תנוקת בוחל אלו ימי נעוריה
human_translation: The Sages stated a parable in a woman: An unripe fig, a ripening fig, and a ripe fig. An unripe fig she is still a child a ripening fig the days of her young womanhood,
llm_translation: Mishnah: A parable, the sages compared a woman to a fig tree. When a fig tree is unripe, it is called "bochel," and when it is ripe, it is called "tzemel." "Bochel" refers to her youthful days.

hebrew_text: בזו ובזו אמרו אביה זכאי במציאתה ובמעשה ידיה ובהפרת נדריה צמל כיון שבגרה שוב אין לאביה רשות בה
human_translation: during this and during that said her father is entitled to she finds and to her earnings, and to nullification of her vows. A ripe fig Once she has reached her majority, her father no longer has authority over her.
llm_translation: With this and with this they said: Her father is righteous in her finding, in her handiwork, and in the annulment of her vows. Once she reaches maturity, her father no longer has authority over her.

hebrew_text: איזהו סימנין ר' יוסי הגלילי אומר משיעלה הקמט תחת הדד ר"ע אומר משיטו הדדים בן עזאי אומר משישחיר הפיטומת רבי יוסי אומר כדי שיהא נותן ידו על העוקץ והוא שוקע ושוהא לחזור
human_translation: What are the signs Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: from when grows a fold below the breast. Rabbi Akiva says: from when the breasts sag Ben Azzai says: from when the areola darkens. Rabbi Yosei says: a size where places his hand on the nipple and it depresses and slows to return.
llm_translation: Which are the signs? Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: when the fold beneath the breast rises. Rabbi Akiva says: when the nipples become erect. Ben Azzai says: when the areola darkens. Rabbi Yosi says: enough that he places his hand on the thorn and it sinks and returns.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ פגה עודה תנוקת כדכתיב (שיר השירים ב׳:י״ג ) התאנה חנטה פגיה בוחל אלו ימי הנעורים כדתנן התאנים משיבחלו ואמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רב משילבין ראשיהן
human_translation: an unripe fig [ paga ] is still a child. as it is written: “The fig tree puts forth her green fruits [ fageha ]” a ripening fig [ boḥal ] the days of her young womanhood. as we learned the figs from when they begin to ripen [ misheyyibaḥalu ]; and Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rav says from when the heads whiten.
llm_translation: Gemara: Pagah Odah Tanukat, Kad'kativ (Shir HaShirim 2:13) "HaTe'enah Chanatah Pagiyah." Buchal, Elu Yemei HaNe'urim, Kad'Tanan HaTe'enim Meshibchalu. Va'amar Rabbah Bar Bar Chanah, Amar Rav: Meshilbin Roshayhen.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא מהכא (זכריה יא, ח) ותקצר נפשי בהם וגם נפשם בחלה בי צמל כמ"ד יצתה מלאה
human_translation: And if you wish, say from here: “For My soul became impatient of them, and their soul also grew in disgust [ baḥala ] toward Me” a ripe fig [ tzemel ], as one would say: has come forth complete [ yatzeta mele’a ].
llm_translation: And if you wish, say from here (Zechariah 11:8), "And my soul was impatient with them, and their soul also abhorred me." As much as it was full, it went forth.

hebrew_text: ואיזהו סימנים ר' יוסי הגלילי אומר משיעלה הקמט אמר שמואל לא משיעלה הקמט ממש אלא כדי שתחזיר ידיה לאחוריה ונראית כמי שיעלה הקמט תחת הדד
human_translation: And what are the signs Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: from when grows a fold Shmuel says: not literally from when grows fold Rather, so that stretch her hand behind her it would appear as though grown a fold below the breast.
llm_translation: And which are the signs? Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: When the wrinkle ascends. Shmuel said: Not that the wrinkle ascends literally, but rather so that she may return her hands behind her, and she appears as one in whom the wrinkle ascends beneath the breast.

hebrew_text: שמואל בדק באמתיה ויהב לה ד' זוזי דמי בושתה שמואל לטעמיה דאמר שמואל (ויקרא כה, מו) לעולם בהם תעבודו לעבודה נתתים ולא לבושה
human_translation: Shmuel examined in his maidservant, and gave her four dinars payment for her humiliation. Shmuel to his reasoning, as Shmuel said “You may enslave them forever” I gave them for service but not for humiliation.
llm_translation: Shmuel examined her truthfully and he gave her four zuzim, the value of her embarrassment. Shmuel according to his reasoning said (Leviticus 25:46), "You shall work with them forever as laborers, but not as slaves."

hebrew_text: שמואל מייחד להן רב נחמן מחליף להן רב ששת מסר להן לערבי ואמר להן אזדהרו מישראל
human_translation: Shmuel designate for Rav Naḥman exchange Rav Sheshet handed to an Arab, and said to them: take care with a Jew.
llm_translation: Shmuel designates for them Rav Nachman substitutes for them Rav Sheshet hands over to them to the evening and says to them be cautious from Israel.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי אומר כו' מאי עוקץ אמר שמואל עוקצו של דד
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: What oketz ? Shmuel said: the protrusion [ oketz ] of the breast,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says, etc. What is "oketz"? Shmuel said: "The thorn of the breast."

hebrew_text: ת"ר אלו הן סימני בגרות ר"א בר' צדוק אומר משיתקשקשו הדדין ר' יוחנן בן ברוקה אומר משיכסיף ראש החוטם משיכסיף אזקונה לה אלא א"ר אשי משיפציל ראש החוטם ר' יוסי אומר משתקיף העטרה ר"ש אומר משנתמעך
human_translation: The Sages taught What are the signs of maturity? Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: From when the breasts knock against each other, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: From when the head of the nipple darkens. From when it darkens? One renders her old, Rather, Rav Ashi said: From when the head of the protrusion splits. Rabbi Yosei says: From when the nipple is surrounded by a circle. Rabbi Shimon says: From when a softening
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: These are the signs of maturity. Rabbi Eliezer says: When the breasts become firm. Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: When the hair of the nostrils becomes thick. Rabbi Ashi says: When the head of the nostril becomes wide. Rabbi Yossi says: When the crown rises. Rabbi Shimon says: When the hair falls out.

hebrew_text: הכף
human_translation: the protuberance above the womb,
llm_translation: The palm.

hebrew_text: וכן היה רבי שמעון (בן יוחי) אומר שלשה סימנין נתנו חכמים באשה מלמטה וכנגדן מלמעלה פגה מלמעלה בידוע שלא הביאה שתי שערות בוחל מלמעלה בידוע שהביאה שתי שערות צמל מלמעלה בידוע שנתמעך הכף
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon would likewise say: The Sages provided three signs in a woman below, and corresponding above. an unripe fig above, it is known that she has not grown two hairs; a ripening fig above, it is known that she has grown two hairs; a ripe fig above, it is known that the protuberance has softened.
llm_translation: And so Rabbi Shimon (ben Yochai) would say: Three signs the sages have given in a woman from below, and corresponding to them from above: if the pubic hair is from above, it is known that she did not bring two hairs; if the hair is from above, it is known that she brought two hairs; if the womb is from above, it is known that the palm has been smeared.

hebrew_text: מאי כף אמר רב הונא מקום תפוח יש למעלה מאותו מקום כיון שמגדלת מתמעך והולך שאלו את רבי הלכה כדברי מי שלח להו כדברי כולן להחמיר
human_translation: What protuberance? Rav Huna says: There is a swollen place above that place, when grows it increasingly softens. asked Rabbi in accordance with whose statement is the halakha ? He sent them is stringent in accordance with all of their statements,
llm_translation: What is "kaf"? Rav Huna said: There is a place of a "tappuach" (apple) above that place, once it grows, it bends and goes. They asked Rabbi about the halacha, he sent them according to the words of the one who sent them, according to the words of all of them to be stringent.

hebrew_text: רב פפא ורב חיננא בריה דרב איקא חד מתני אהא וחד מתני אחצר צורית דתנן איזוהי חצר צורית שחייבת במעשר ר"ש אומר חצר הצורית שהכלים נשמרים בתוכה
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rav Ika, One teaches with regard to this and one teaches with regard to a Tyrian courtyard, as we learned What is a Tyrian courtyard, which required to be tithed? Rabbi Shimon says: A Tyrian courtyard inside of which vessels are safe.
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Chinana, son of Rav Ika, one teaches "Aha" and one teaches "Achatzor Tzurit" as we learned in a Mishnah: What is a "Chatzer Tzurit" that obligates tithing? Rabbi Shimon says, "A courtyard of Tzurit where the vessels are kept inside it."

hebrew_text: מאי חצר הצורית אמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן שכן בצור מושיבין שומר על פתח החצר ר"ע אומר כל שאחד פותח ואחד נועל פטורה
human_translation: What a Tyrian courtyard? Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: as in Tyre place a watchman at the entrance of the courtyard Rabbi Akiva says: any where one opens and one locks exempt
llm_translation: What is a "Chatzer HaTzurit"? Rabbah bar bar Chanah said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: In Tzur they seat a guard at the entrance of the courtyard. Rabbi Akiva says: If one opens and another closes, it is exempt.

hebrew_text: ר' נחמיה אומר כל שאין אדם בוש לאכול בתוכה חייבת רבי יוסי אומר כל שנכנסים לה ואין אומרים לו מה אתה מבקש פטורה
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: Any which a person is not ashamed to eat inside it, obligated Rabbi Yosei says: Any that can enter it, and do not say to him: What do you want exempt
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says: "Anyone who is not ashamed to eat within it is liable." Rabbi Yossi says: "Anyone who enters it and they do not say to him, 'What are you seeking?' is exempt."

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר שתי חצרות זו לפנים מזו הפנימית חייבת והחיצונה פטורה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: two courtyards, one within the other, the inner obligated but the outer exempt
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "Two courtyards, one in front of the other, the inner one is liable, and the outer one is exempt."

hebrew_text: שאלו את רבי הלכה כדברי מי אמר להו הלכה כדברי כולן להחמיר
human_translation: asked Rabbi In accordance with whose statement is the halakha ? He said to them: The halakha is stringent in accordance with all of statements.
llm_translation: They asked Rabbi the halacha according to whose words? He said to them, the halacha is according to the words of all to be stringent.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בת עשרים שנה שלא הביאה שתי שערות תביא ראיה שהיא בת עשרים שנה והיא איילונית לא חולצת ולא מתיבמת
human_translation: twenty years old who did not grow two hairs shall bring proof that she is twenty years old, and she a sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit ], she neither performs ḥalitza nor does she enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: Mishnah: A woman of twenty years who has not brought forth two pubic hairs shall bring proof that she is twenty years old. And if she is a virgin, she neither performs halitzah nor undergoes levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: בן עשרים שנה שלא הביא שתי שערות יביאו ראיה שהוא בן עשרים שנה והוא סריס לא חולץ ולא מיבם אלו דברי בית הלל בית שמאי אומרים זה וזה בן שמונה עשרה
human_translation: twenty years old who did not grow two hairs, they shall bring proof that he is twenty years old and he a sexually underdeveloped man [ saris ], he neither performs ḥalitza nor enters into levirate marriage This is the statement of Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai say: this and that eighteen years old,
llm_translation: A man of twenty years who has not brought forth two hairs, they shall bring proof that he is twenty years old, and he, being a eunuch, neither performs chalitzah nor yibum. These are the words of Beit Hillel; Beit Shammai say: both this one and that one are of eighteen years.

hebrew_text: ר' אליעזר אומר הזכר כדברי בית הלל והנקבה כדברי בית שמאי שהאשה ממהרת לבא לפני האיש
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: the male in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel, and the female in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai, that the woman is quick to reach before the man
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The male according to the words of Beit Hillel, and the female according to the words of Beit Shammai, for a woman hastens to come before the man.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ורמינהי אחד לי בן תשע שנים ויום אחד ואחד לי בן עשרים שלא הביא שתי שערות
human_translation: And raises a contradiction nine years and one day old, and twenty years old who has not grown two hairs, are one and the same to me
llm_translation: Gemara: And they raised a contradiction: "One who is for me is a son of nine years and one day, and one who is for me is a son of twenty years who has not brought two pubic hairs."

hebrew_text: אמר רב שמואל בר רב יצחק אמר רב והוא שנולדו בו סימני סריס אמר רבא דיקא נמי דקתני והוא סריס ש"מ
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak says Rav says And this where he developed signs of a sexually underdeveloped man Rava said: is also precise, as it teaches: And he is a sexually underdeveloped man, Conclude from it
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said in the name of Rav, and this is if signs of a eunuch were born in him. Rava said: It is also correct as it was taught: "And he is a eunuch" - learn from this.

hebrew_text: וכי לא נולדו לו סימני סריס עד כמה תני ר' חייא עד רוב שנותיו
human_translation: And where he does not develop the signs of a sexually underdeveloped man, until what Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: Until most of his years
llm_translation: And if signs of a eunuch were not born to him, until how many years? Rabbi Chiya taught: Until most of his years.

hebrew_text: כי אתו לקמיה דרבי חייא אי כחיש אמר להו אבריוה אי בריא אמר להו אכחשוה דהני סימנים זימנין דאתו מחמת כחישותא זימנין דאתו מחמת בריאותא
human_translation: When would come before Rabbi Ḥiyya if thin, he say to them: Go fatten him If fat, say to them: Go make him thin. As these signs sometimes come due to thinness sometimes they come due to fatness.
llm_translation: When they came before Rabbi Chiya, if he appeared weak, he would say to them, "Strengthen him." If he appeared healthy, he would say to them, "Weaken him," for sometimes these symptoms come from weakness, and sometimes they come from health.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הלכתא בכולי פרקא מעת לעת ועולא אמר דתנן תנן ודלא תנן לא תנן
human_translation: Rav said: The halakha in entire chapter from time until time And Ulla said: where we learned we learned and where we did not learn we did not learn
llm_translation: Rav said: The halacha follows in every chapter from time to time. And Ula said: For we have learned what we have learned, and what we have not learned, we have not learned.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לעולא היינו דקתני הכא יום אחד והכא לא קתני אלא לרב ליתני
human_translation: Granted, according to Ulla, this that teaches there, one day; and here, does not teach But according to Rav, let teach
llm_translation: In accordance with Ula, this is what is taught here: one day. And here it does not teach except for Rav to teach.

hebrew_text: ועוד תני רבי יוסי בן כיפר אומר משום רבי אליעזר שנת עשרים שיצאו ממנה שלשים יום הרי היא כשנת עשרים לכל דבריה וכן הורה רבי בלוד שנת שמנה עשרה שיצאו ממנה שלשים יום הרי היא כשנת שמנה עשרה לכל דבריה
human_translation: And furthermore, it is taught Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer The twentieth year, of which thirty days have passed, is like the twentieth year in all regards; and Rabbi similarly issued ruling in Lod, the eighteenth year of which thirty days have passed is like the eighteenth year in all regards.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yosei ben Kipper teaches in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: If twenty years have passed, and thirty days have elapsed from it, it is considered as if it were twenty years in all its matters. Similarly, Rabbi taught in Lod: If eighteen years have passed, and thirty days have elapsed from it, it is considered as if it were eighteen years in all its matters.

hebrew_text: בשלמא דרבי ודרבי יוסי בן כיפר לא קשיא הא כבית שמאי הא כבית הילל אלא לרב קשיא
human_translation: Granted, not difficult that Rabbi Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar this in accordance with Beit Shammai that in accordance with Beit Hillel. But according to Rav, a difficulty.
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi and Rabbi Yossi ben Kipper, it is not difficult, this is like Beit Shammai and this is like Beit Hillel, rather, for Rav it is difficult.

hebrew_text: תנאי היא דתניא שנה האמורה בקדשים שנה האמורה בבתי ערי חומה שתי שנים שבשדה אחוזה
human_translation: is tanna’im , As it is taught year stated with regard to sacrificial year stated with regard to houses of walled cities, two years with regard to an ancestral field,
llm_translation: It is a Tannaitic teaching as it was taught: "Year" mentioned in regards to consecrated items, "year" mentioned in regards to walled cities, two years in the field of an inherited estate.

hebrew_text: שש שנים שבעבד עברי וכן שבבן ושבבת כולן מעת לעת
human_translation: six years with regard to a Hebrew slave and similarly of a son and of a daughter, all of from time until time
llm_translation: Six years a Hebrew slave, and similarly with a son and a daughter, all of them from time to time.

hebrew_text: שנה האמורה בקדשים מנא לן אמר רב אחא בר יעקב אמר קרא (ויקרא יב, ו) כבש בן שנתו שנתו שלו ולא שנה של מנין עולם
human_translation: From where do we year stated with regard to sacrificial Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said the verse states: “A lamb in its first year” a year its and not a year of the universal count,
llm_translation: The matter of the year mentioned in regards to consecrated items, how do we derive it? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said, Scripture says (Leviticus 12:6), "A lamb in its first year." Its year is its own, not a year from the counting of the world.

hebrew_text: שנה האמורה בבתי ערי חומה מנלן אמר קרא (ויקרא כה, כט) עד תום שנת ממכרו ממכרו שלו ולא שנת של מנין עולם שתי שנים שבשדה אחוזה מנלן אמר קרא (ויקרא כה ) במספר
human_translation: From where do we year stated with regard to houses of walled cities The verse states: within a whole year after it is sold, of its sale, and not the year of the universal count. From where do we two years with regard to an ancestral field The verse states: according to the number
llm_translation: The specified year in walled cities - from where do we derive it? The verse says (Leviticus 25:29), "Until the completion of the year of his sale, it shall be for him." And not the year of the counting of the world. How do we know that in the field of an ancestral possession, it is two years? The verse says (Leviticus 25:29), "According to the number."

hebrew_text: שני תבואות ימכר לך פעמים שאתה מוכר שלשה תבואות בשתי שנים
human_translation: of years of the crops he shall sell to you” sometimes you sell three crops in two years.
llm_translation: Two produce will be sold to you twice, when you sell three produce in two years.

hebrew_text: שש שנה שבעבד עברי מנלן אמר קרא (שמות כא, ב) שש שנים יעבוד ובשביעית ובשביעית נמי יעבוד
human_translation: From where do we six years with regard to a Hebrew slave the verse states: “Six years he shall work, and in the seventh “and in the seventh” he shall also work
llm_translation: Six years a Hebrew slave - from where do we derive this? The verse states (Exodus 21:2), "Six years he shall work, and in the seventh year he shall go free."

hebrew_text: שבבן ושבבת למאי הלכתא אמר רב גידל אמר רב לענין ערכין ורב יוסף אמר לפרקין דיוצא דופן
human_translation: of a son and of a daughter With regard to what halakha Rav Giddel says Rav says: With regard to valuations, And Rav Yosef says: with regard to our chapter Yotze Dofen ,
llm_translation: In the case of a son and a daughter, what is the halakha? Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: regarding appraisals. And Rav Yosef said: for the partition of the wall.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי מי פליגת א"ל לא הוא אמר חדא ואנא אמינא חדא ולא פליגינן
human_translation: Abaye said to Do you disagree said to No, he said one and I said one but we do not disagree.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Abaye, do they disagree?" He said to him, "No, he said one thing, and I said one thing, and we do not disagree."

hebrew_text: והכי נמי מסתברא דאי ס"ד פליגי מאן דאמר לערכין לא אמר ליוצא דופן והאמר רב הלכתא בכולה פרקין מעת לעת
human_translation: And this, too, stands to reason, as if it enters your mind disagree the one who said for valuations not say for Yotze Dofen . But doesn’t Rav say, the halakha in entire chapter from time until time
llm_translation: And so too it is logical, for if you say they argue, who says "to evaluate" does not say "to remove," and Rav said the halacha in all chapters from time to time.

hebrew_text: אלא למ"ד לערכין מ"ט לא אמר ליוצא דופן דומיא דהנך מה הנך דכתיבן אף הני נמי דכתיבן
human_translation: But according to the one who said for valuations, what is the reason he does not say for Yotze Dofen ? similar to those Just as those are written so too these where are written
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who holds that the valuation is from the twenty-ninth, he did not say to the seller, "Your produce is similar to those, as it is written about them, so too about these it is written."

hebrew_text: ואידך האי שבבן ושבבת שבזכר ושבנקבה מבעי ליה
human_translation: And the other this Of a son and of a daughter, should have Of the male and of the female,
llm_translation: And the other opinion is this: "Shavben" and "Shavbat" - whether male or female, he requires.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יצחק בר נחמני א"ר אלעזר הלכה כר' יוסי בן כיפר שאמר משום ר' אליעזר א"ר זירא אזכה ואיסק ואגמר לשמעתא מפומיה דמרא
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Elazar says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar, who said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer, Rabbi Zeira said: I merit to ascend and I learn halakha from the mouth of its Master,
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: The halacha follows Rabbi Yosi ben Kipper, who said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: "I will merit, I will be successful, and I will conclude the teaching from the mouth of the Master."

hebrew_text: כי סליק אשכחיה לר' אלעזר אמר ליה אמרת הלכה כרבי יוסי בן כיפר אמר ליה מסתברא אמרי מדכוליה פירקין תני יום אחד והכא לא קתני שמע מינה מסתברא כותיה:
human_translation: when ascended he found Rabbi Elazar said to him: Did you say halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar? said to him: I said stands to reason From that the entire chapter teaches: one day, but here, it does not teach conclude from it stands to reason in accordance with the opinion of
llm_translation: When he went up and found Rabbi Elazar, he said to him, "You said the halacha is like Rabbi Yosi ben Kipper." He replied, "It makes sense, as they all explained it as one day. But here it does not teach 'Hear from it.' It is logical to establish it according to his opinion."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך יוצא דופן
llm_translation: The return upon you, Yotzei Dofen.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בא סימן התחתון עד שלא בא העליון או חולצת או מתיבמת
human_translation: the lower sign appeared before the upper appeared, she either performs the ritual through which a yavam frees a yevama of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ] or enters into levirate marriage
llm_translation: Mishnah: Ba siman hatachton ad she'lo ba ha'elyon o choltzet o mitzayemet.

hebrew_text: בא העליון עד שלא בא התחתון אף על פי שאי אפשר ר' מאיר אומר לא חולצת ולא מתיבמת
human_translation: the upper appeared before the lower appeared, although that impossible, Rabbi Meir says: she neither performs ḥalitza nor does she enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: The Supreme One came before the Lower One, even though it is impossible. Rabbi Meir says: she neither performs ḥaliẓah nor undergoes levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: וחכ"א או חולצת או מתיבמת מפני שאמרו אפשר לתחתון לבא עד שלא בא העליון אבל אי אפשר לעליון לבא עד שלא בא התחתון
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: she either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage due to that said: possible for the lower to appear before the upper appears; but impossible for the upper to appear before the lower appears.
llm_translation: And the sages of blessed memory said: A wife of a deceased brother or a levirate bondwoman, because they said, it is possible for the lower one to come before the upper one, but it is not possible for the upper one to come before the lower one.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אע"פ שאי אפשר והלא בא בא לר' מאיר אע"פ שאי אפשר לרבנן
human_translation: Although that impossible. But did appear did appear, according to Rabbi Meir, Although that impossible, to the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Gemara: Even though it is impossible, didn't it come to Rabbi Meir? Even though it is impossible for the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: ולתני בא העליון ר"מ אומר לא חולצת ולא מתיבמת וחכ"א או חולצת או מתיבמת ואנא ידענא משום דאי אפשר הוא
human_translation: But teach: the upper appeared, Rabbi Meir says: She neither performs ḥalitza nor does she enter into levirate marriage and the Rabbis say: She either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage And I would know due to that it is impossible
llm_translation: And to teach: Came the Supreme, Rabbi Meir says: Not performs chalitzah and not performs levirate marriage. And the sages say: Either performs chalitzah or performs levirate marriage. And I know this because it is impossible.

hebrew_text: אי לא תנא אע"פ שאי אפשר הוה אמינא רוב נשים תחתון אתי ברישא ומיעוט עליון אתי ברישא ורבי מאיר לטעמיה דחייש למיעוטא ורבנן לטעמייהו דלא חיישי למיעוטא
human_translation: If had not taught: Although that impossible, I would say most women the lower appears first, but a minority of women, the upper appears first. And Rabbi Meir, to his reasoning, that one must be concerned for the minority. And the Rabbis reasoning that one need not be concerned for the minority,
llm_translation: If not for the fact that it was taught, even though it is impossible, I would say: the majority of women come first, and the minority of men come first. And Rabbi Meir, according to his reasoning, is concerned for the minority, and the Rabbis, according to their reasoning, are not concerned for the minority.

hebrew_text: והני מילי בסתמא אבל היכא דבדקן ולא אשכחן אימר מודו ליה רבנן לר"מ דעליון קדים
human_translation: And this statement, in an ordinary But where we examined and did not find say the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir that upper before
llm_translation: And these matters in general, but where they examined and did not find, the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir that the uppermost matter takes precedence.

hebrew_text: קמ"ל דאי אפשר ודאי אתי ומנתר הוא דנתר
human_translation: teaches us that impossible certainly appeared, but fell out.
llm_translation: It teaches us that if it is possible, it will definitely come and be untangled, for it will be untangled.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לר"מ היינו דכתיב (יחזקאל טז, ז) שדים נכונו ושערך צמח אלא לרבנן איפכא מבעי ליה ה"ק כיון ששדים נכונו בידוע ששערך צמח
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, that which is written your breasts were fashioned, and your hair was grown” But according to the Rabbis, should have reverse, this is saying: Since your breasts were fashioned, it is known that your hair was grown.
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Meir, this is what is written (Ezekiel 16:7): "Your breasts were formed and your hair grew." But according to the Rabbis, the question arises: What is the meaning of this? Once the breasts are formed, it is known that the hair will grow.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לר"מ היינו דכתיב (יחזקאל כג, כא) בעשות ממצרים דדיך למען שדי נעוריך אלא לרבנן איפכא מבעי ליה
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, that which is written: “When they from Egypt bruised your breasts for the sprouting forth of your young womanhood” But according to the Rabbis, should have reverse.
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Meir, this is as it is written (Ezekiel 23:21), "Thus you longed for the lewdness of your youth, when the Egyptians handled your bosom and pressed your young breasts." But according to the Rabbis, the opposite is required.

hebrew_text: ה"ק כיון שבאו דדיך בידוע שבאו נעוריך ואיבעית אימא מאי שדי כולה בדדי כתיב וה"ק הקב"ה לישראל
human_translation: this is saying: Since your breasts appeared, it is known that your young womanhood, have appeared. if you wish, say What The sprouting forth of [ shedei ] entire is written to the breasts, And this the Holy One, Blessed be He, is saying to the Jewish people:
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: When your breasts have come, it is known that your youth has come. And if you wish, say: What is the meaning of "Shaddai"? It is written in its entirety "Almighty." And the Gemara asks: The Holy One, blessed be He, to Israel.

hebrew_text: איכרפו דדיך לא הדרת בך אישתדו דדיך נמי לא הדרת בך
human_translation: your breasts began to develop, you did not reform your breasts grew fully, you also did not reform
llm_translation: Your breasts are like two fawns, twins of a gazelle, that feed among the lilies.

hebrew_text: דכולי עלמא מיהא אתחתון סמכינן מנלן אמר רב יהודה אמר רב וכן תנא דבי ר' ישמעאל אמר קרא (במדבר ה, ו) איש או אשה כי יעשו מכל חטאות האדם השוה הכתוב אשה לאיש לכל עונשין שבתורה מה איש בסימן אחד אף אשה בסימן אחד
human_translation: In any event, everyone, we rely on the lower From where do we Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and likewise the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: The verse states: “A man or woman, when they commit any of the sins of men” The Torah rendered a woman equal to a man with regard to all punishments of the Torah. Just as a man on one sign, so too, a woman on one sign,
llm_translation: All the world, we learn from below. From where? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and similarly it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: The verse says (Numbers 5:6), "If a man or a woman commits any sin that people commit." The Scripture equates a woman to a man in all the punishments in the Torah. Just as a man is punished with one sign, so too a woman is punished with one sign.

hebrew_text: ואימא או האי או האי כאיש מה איש תחתון ולא עליון אף אשה תחתון ולא עליון
human_translation: But say either this, or that, like a man: Just as a man lower and not upper so too, a woman lower and not upper
llm_translation: And say, either this or this, like a man. Just as a man is below and not above, so too a woman is below and not above.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי א"ר אליעזר בר' צדוק כך היו מפרשין ביבנה ואמרו כיון שבא תחתון שוב אין משגיחין על עליון
human_translation: this is also taught Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: This how would explain it in Yavne. They said: Once lower appeared, we no longer concern ourselves with upper
llm_translation: It was also taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: This is how they would explain in Yavneh, and they said: Once the lower ones arrived, they no longer pay attention to the upper ones.

hebrew_text: תניא רשב"ג אומר בנות כרכים תחתון ממהר לבא מפני שרגילות במרחצאות בנות כפרים עליון ממהר לבא מפני שטוחנות ברחים
human_translation: is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: women cities, lower appears quickly because they frequent the bathhouses, women villages, upper appears quickly because they grind with mills,
llm_translation: It is taught: Reshbag says, "The daughters of cities are quicker to menstruate because they are accustomed to the public baths, while the daughters of villages are quicker to menstruate because they grind in the millstones."

hebrew_text: ר"ש בן אלעזר אומר בנות עשירים צד ימין ממהר לבא שנישוף באפקריסותן בנות עניים צד שמאל ממהר לבא מפני ששואבות כדי מים עליהן ואיבעית אימא מפני שנושאין אחיהן על גססיהן
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: the daughters of the wealthy, right side arrives quickly as rubs against their upper body cloaks, the daughters of the poor, left side arrives quickly because they draw jugs of water on And if you wish, say because they carry their brothers on their sides.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: The daughters of the wealthy are to the right, hastening to marry, as they are disdainful of their wealth. The daughters of the poor are to the left, hastening to marry, because they are thirsty like water. And if you wish, you can say it is because they carry their brothers on their shoulders.

hebrew_text: ת"ר צד שמאל קודם לצד ימין רבי חנינא בן אחי ר' יהושע אומר מעולם לא קדם צד שמאל לצד ימין חוץ מאחת שהיתה בשכונתי שקדם צד שמאל לצד ימין וחזר לאיתנו
human_translation: The Sages taught left side before right side. Rabbi Ḥanina, son of the brother of Rabbi Yehoshua, says: never left side before right side, except for one who was in my neighborhood, as left side before right side, and returned to its normal condition
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "The left side precedes the right side." Rabbi Chanina, the son of the brother of Rabbi Yehoshua, says: "Never has the left side preceded the right side, except for one case that occurred in my neighborhood, where the left side preceded the right side and then returned to its place."

hebrew_text: ת"ר כל הנבדקות נבדקות על פי נשים וכן היה רבי אליעזר מוסר לאשתו ורבי ישמעאל מוסר לאמו
human_translation: The Sages taught All are examined are examined based on women. And likewise, Rabbi Eliezer give to his wife and Rabbi Yishmael give to his mother
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: All cases of examination are examined by women, and so too Rabbi Eliezer would give his wife for examination, and Rabbi Yishmael would give his mother for examination.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר לפני הפרק ולאחר הפרק נשים בודקות אותן תוך הפרק אין נשים בודקות אותן שאין משיאין ספקות על פי נשים ר"ש אומר אף תוך הפרק נשים בודקות אותן ונאמנת אשה להחמיר אבל לא להקל
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Before the age and after the age women may examine them during the time women may not examine them. that one does not resolve uncertainty based on women. Rabbi Shimon says: Even during the time women may examine them. And a woman is deemed credible, to be stringent but not to be lenient.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says, "Before the chapter and after the chapter, women inspect them. Within the chapter, women do not inspect them, for we do not marry doubtful cases based on the testimony of women." Rabbi Shimon says, "Even within the chapter, women inspect them, and a woman is believed to be stringent but not lenient."

hebrew_text: כיצד גדולה היא שלא תמאן קטנה היא שלא תחלוץ
human_translation: How so, a female who reached majority, that she does not perform refusal. a minor, that she does not perform ḥalitza .
llm_translation: How great is it that the older one does not refuse, and the younger one does not push away.

hebrew_text: אבל אין נאמנת לומר קטנה היא שתמאן וגדולה היא שתחלוץ
human_translation: But not deemed credible to say is a minor girl that she performs refusal. And is a female who reached majority to that she performs ḥalitza .
llm_translation: But not reliable to say minor she refused and major she consented.

hebrew_text: אמר מר רבי יהודה אומר לפני הפרק ולאחר הפרק נשים בודקות אותן בשלמא לפני הפרק בעי בדיקה דאי משתכחי לאחר הפרק שומא נינהו
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Yehuda says: Before the age and after the age women may examine them. Granted, before the age a requirement examination, that if find after the age are mole,
llm_translation: The Master said: Rabbi Yehuda says, "Before the chapter and after the chapter, women inspect them." Granted, before the chapter requires inspection, for if they are forgotten after the chapter, they are a blemish.

hebrew_text: אלא לאחר הפרק למה לי בדיקה והאמר רבא קטנה שהגיעה לכלל שנותיה אינה צריכה בדיקה חזקה הביאה סימנין כי אמר רבא חזקה למיאון אבל לחליצה בעיא בדיקה
human_translation: But why do I an examination after the age Didn’t Rava say: A minor girl who reached her full years, does not require an examination, a presumption she has developed signs When Rava said presumption, to refusal. But with regard to ḥalitza , requires an examination
llm_translation: Rather, after the chapter, why do I need examination? And Rava said: A young girl who has reached the age of maturity does not require examination. If she brought signs, for Rava said: For rejection, signs are sufficient. But for halitzah, examination is needed.

hebrew_text: תוך הפרק אין נשים בודקות אותן קסבר תוך הפרק כלאחר הפרק (דמי)
human_translation: during the time women may not examine them. holds during time after the age
llm_translation: Within the chapter, women do not examine them. He holds: within the chapter is like after the chapter (similar).

hebrew_text: ולאחר הפרק דאיכא חזקה דרבא סמכינן אנשים ובדקי תוך הפרק דליכא חזקה דרבא לא סמכינן אנשים ולא בדקי נשים
human_translation: But after the age when there is the presumption of Rava may rely on women and examine During age, when there is no presumption of Rava may not rely on women, and women may not examine
llm_translation: And after the chapter, there is a strong assertion of Rava, we rely on men and examine within the chapter, if there is no strong assertion of Rava, we do not rely on men and do not examine women.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר אף תוך הפרק נשים בודקות אותן קסבר תוך הפרק כלפני הפרק ובעיא בדיקה דאי משתכחי לאחר הפרק שומא נינהו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says even during age, women may examine holds during age like before the age, And requires an examination that if find after the age, are mole,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even within the chapter, women examine them. He holds that within the chapter is like before the chapter, and the examination is necessary, for if they are forgotten after the chapter, they are considered a blemish.

hebrew_text: ונאמנת אשה להחמיר אבל לא להקל האי מאן קתני לה איבעית אימא רבי יהודה ואתוך הפרק
human_translation: And a woman is deemed credible to be stringent but not to be lenient. Who taught this If you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda, and during age
llm_translation: And a woman is believed to be stringent, but not lenient. Who is the one who taught this? If you wish, say it is Rabbi Yehuda, and if not, it is in the chapter.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא רבי שמעון ולאחר הפרק ולית ליה חזקה דרבא
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Shimon, after the age And does not the presumption of Rava
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rabbi Shimon, and after the chapter, Rava does not have a strong claim.

hebrew_text: מפני שאמרו אפשר כו' הא תו למה לי הא תנא ליה רישא
human_translation: due to that said: possible Why do I this additional It was taught in the first clause
llm_translation: Because they said, "It is possible," etc. This one, why do I need it? This one teaches him the beginning.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא משום דקא בעי למסתמה כרבנן פשיטא יחיד ורבים הלכה כרבים
human_translation: And if you would say because wants an unattributed in accordance with the Rabbis, obvious, an individual and a majority halakha in accordance with the majority.
llm_translation: And if you say, because it requires to be ambiguous, like the Rabbis, it is obvious - individual and many, the halacha is according to the many.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא מסתברא טעמא דר"מ דקא מסייע ליה קראי קמ"ל ואיבעית אימא משום דקא בעי למתני כיוצא בו
human_translation: lest you say that the rationale for Rabbi Meir is reasonable. as the verses support it: teaches us And if you wish, say because wants to teach similar to
llm_translation: What is the reason one might say that the opinion of Rabbi Meir is logical? Because the verses support him. The Mishnah teaches us otherwise, and if you wish, you can say it is because he needs to teach a similar case.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כיוצא בו כל כלי חרס שהוא מכניס מוציא ויש שמוציא ואינו מכניס
human_translation: Similar to Any earthenware vessel that enables entry enables exit And there are that enable exit but do not enable entry
llm_translation: Mishnah: Similarly, with regard to any earthenware vessel that is capable of receiving impurity, it renders impure and there are some that render impure but do not become impure.

hebrew_text: כל אבר שיש בו צפורן יש בו עצם ויש שיש בו עצם ואין בו צפורן
human_translation: in any limb where there is a nail, there is a bone in it And there are in which there is a bone but there is not a nail in it.
llm_translation: Every limb that has a nail has a bone, and there are some that have a bone but do not have a nail.

hebrew_text: כל המטמא מדרס מטמא טמא מת ויש שמטמא טמא מת ואינו מטמא מדרס
