human_translation: any that becomes ritually impure treading, becomes ritually impure impurity imparted by a corpse. And there are that become ritually impure impurity imparted by a corpse but do not become ritually impure treading.
llm_translation: All who make impure from a dais, make impure impure from a corpse, and there are those who make impure impure from a corpse and do not make impure from a dais.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מכניס פסול למי חטאת ופסול משום גסטרא מוציא כשר למי חטאת ופסול משום גסטרא
human_translation: enter unfit to water of purification. And disqualified as a shard [ gastera ] that enables exit fit for water of purification, but disqualified as a shard
llm_translation: Gemara: He enters disqualified into the waters of the sin-offering, and he is disqualified due to a gut feeling. He brings forth valid into the waters of the sin-offering, and he is disqualified due to a gut feeling.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אסי שונין כלי חרס שיעורו בכונס משקה ולא אמרו מוציא משקה אלא לענין גסטרא בלבד מאי טעמא אמר מר זוטרא בריה דרב נחמן לפי שאין אומרים הבא גסטרא לגסטרא
human_translation: Rav Asi says they teach an earthenware vessel, its measure to enable liquid to enter And they said which enables exit liquids only with regard to a shard. What is the reason Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said: because do not say: Bring shard to a shard;
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: One may rinse earthenware vessels whose capacity is a kav in a large jug, and they did not say that one may remove the liquid, except with regard to a gutter only. What is the reason? Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, said: Because one does not say, "Bring a gutter to a gutter."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן כיצד בודקין כלי חרס לידע אם ניקב בכונס משקה אם לאו יביא עריבה מלאה מים ונותן קדרה לתוכה אם כנסה בידוע שכונס משקה ואם לאו בידוע שמוציא משקה
human_translation: the Sages taught How does one test earthenware vessel to know if it was pierced that enables liquid to enter or not? One brings a tub filled with water and places pot into it. If enters it is known that that enables liquid to enter. And if not it is known that that enables exit liquids.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: How do we inspect an earthenware vessel to determine if it has a hole that renders it susceptible to becoming ritually impure from liquid inside it or not? One should bring a full handful of water and place it inside the vessel. If the water remains, it is known that the vessel is sealed, indicating that it does not have a hole through which liquid can escape. But if the water leaks out, it is known that the vessel is porous, indicating that it has a hole through which liquid can escape.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר כופף אזני קדרה לתוכה ומציף עליה מים ואם כונס בידוע שכונס משקה ואם לאו בידוע שמוציא משקה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says handles of the pot and turns it over, in and covers water. If enters it is known that that enables liquid to enter, and if not it is known that that enables exit liquids.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One who bends the ear of a pot inward and pours water over it, if it is known that he is collecting the water, it is considered as if he is extracting a liquid; if it is not known, it is considered as if he is not extracting a liquid.

hebrew_text: או שופתה על גבי האור אם האור מעמידה בידוע שמוציא משקה ואם לאו בידוע שמכניס משקה
human_translation: Or places on the fire. If the fire holds it is known that enables exit liquids. And if not it is known that enables liquid to enter.
llm_translation: Or she slaughters it on top of the light, if the light supports it, it is known that it emits liquid, and if not, it is known that it introduces liquid.

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי אומר אף לא שופתה על גבי האור מפני שהאור מעמידה אלא שופתה על גבי הרמץ אם רמץ מעמידה בידוע שמוציא משקה ואם לאו בידוע שכונס משקה היה טורד טיפה אחר טיפה בידוע שכונס משקה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: One should not place on the fire. the fire prevents Rather, one places on hot ash. If the hot ash holds it is known that enables exit liquids. But if not it is known that enables liquid to enter. drips drop after drop, it is known that enables liquid to enter.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yossi says: Even if not a shofetah on the top of the light because the light supports her, rather a shofetah on the top of the remetz. If the remetz supports her, it is known that he extracts liquid. And if not it is known that he gathers liquid. He was pressing drop after drop. It is known that he gathers liquid.

hebrew_text: מאי איכא בין ת"ק לר' יהודה אמר עולא כינוס על ידי הדחק איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What is there between the first tanna , of Rabbi Yehuda, Ulla said: between enters with difficulty,
llm_translation: What is the difference between the Tanna Kamma and Rabbi Yehuda? Ulla said: A gathering due to necessity is the difference between them.

hebrew_text: כל אבר שיש בו צפורן וכו' יש בו צפורן מטמא במגע ובמשא ובאהל יש בו עצם ואין בו צפורן מטמא במגע ובמשא ואינו מטמא באהל
human_translation: In any limb where there is a nail, in which there is a nail transmits impurity contact, movement, and in a tent, there is a bone in but there is no nail, transmits impurity contact and movement but not transmit impurity in a tent
llm_translation: Every limb that has a nail, etc., has a nail, it renders impure through contact, and through carrying, and through a tent; it has a bone and does not have a nail, it renders impure through contact and through carrying, but it does not render impure through a tent.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא דבר זה רבינו הגדול אמרו המקום יהיה בעזרו אצבע יתרה שיש בו עצם ואין בו צפורן מטמא במגע ובמשא ואינו מטמא באהל
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: The matter was stated by our great rabbi, may the Omnipresent to his assistance. An extra finger in which there is a bone but there is no nail transmits impurity contact and movement but not transmit impurity in a tent.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: This matter, our great Rabbi said: "The place shall be in his aid, an extra finger that has a bone but does not have a nail, it imparts impurity through touch and carrying, but does not impart impurity in a tent."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן וכשאינה נספרת על גב היד
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And where cannot be counted along the back of the hand,
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said, "And when it is not counted on the back of the hand."

hebrew_text: כל המטמא מדרס וכו' כל דחזי למדרס מטמא טמא מת
human_translation: any becomes ritually impure treading any item that is fit to treading become ritually impure impurity imparted by a corpse.
llm_translation: All who make impure a dais, etc. All who sees a dais makes impure impure from a corpse.

hebrew_text: ויש שמטמא טמא מת ואין מטמא מדרס לאתויי מאי לאתויי סאה ותרקב
human_translation: And there are that become ritually impure impurity imparted by a corpse but do not become ritually impure treading. What is added to add a se’a or a half- se’a [ vetarkav ].
llm_translation: And there are those who render impure from contact with a corpse, but do not render impure through trampling. What is the purpose of not rendering impure through trampling? To include a se'ah and a tarkav.

hebrew_text: דתניא (ויקרא טו, ו) והיושב על הכלי יכול כפה סאה וישב עליה או תרקב וישב עליו יהא טמא
human_translation: As it is taught “And he who sits on object might turned over a se’a and sat on it, or a half- se’a and sat on it, should be impure
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 15:6): "And he who sits on the vessel" - I might think that if he sits on a se'ah, and sits on it, or on a tarkav, and sits on it, he shall be impure.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא טו, ו) אשר ישב עליו הזב מי שמיוחד לישיבה יצא זה שאומרים לו עמוד ונעשה מלאכתנו
human_translation: the verse states: whereon the zav sits” that is designated for sitting, excluding such which we say to Stand up and do our work,
llm_translation: The verse states (Leviticus 15:6), "Upon whom the discharge is, he who is designated for sitting, he has fulfilled this, the one they say to him, 'Stand, and our work will be done.'"

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הראוי לדון דיני נפשות ראוי לדון דיני ממונות ויש שראוי לדון דיני ממונות ואינו ראוי לדון דיני נפשות
human_translation: Any who is fit to adjudicate capital law is fit to adjudicate monetary law, and there are who are fit to adjudicate monetary law but are unfit to adjudicate capital law.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Anyone fit to be judged in matters of life and death is fit to be judged in monetary matters, and there are those fit to be judged in monetary matters but not fit to be judged in matters of life and death.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יהודה לאתויי ממזר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: to add a mamzer .
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said to bring a case of a mamzer.

hebrew_text: תנינא חדא זימנא הכל כשרין לדון דיני ממונות ואין הכל כשרין לדון דיני נפשות והוינן בה לאתויי מאי ואמר רב יהודה לאתויי ממזר חדא לאתויי גר וחדא לאתויי ממזר
human_translation: We learned another occasion, All are fit to judge monetary law, but not all are fit to judge capital law. And we discussed it, what is added And Rav Yehuda said to add a mamzer . One to add a convert, and one to add a mamzer .
llm_translation: We have learned one time, everyone is fit to judge monetary cases, but not everyone is fit to judge capital cases. And we were discussing to bring what? And Rav Yehudah said to bring a mamzer, one to bring a convert, and one to bring a mamzer.

hebrew_text: וצריכי דאי אשמעינן גר משום דראוי לבא בקהל אבל ממזר דאין ראוי לבא בקהל אימא לא
human_translation: And are necessary. As, if taught us a convert because fit to enter into the congregation, But a mamzer , who is unfit to enter into the congregation, say he not
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to say a convert is disqualified from marrying a Jewish woman because he is fit to enter the congregation, but a mamzer, who is not fit to enter the congregation, I would say no.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן ממזר משום דקאתי מטפה כשרה אבל גר דקאתי מטפה פסולה אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And if taught us a mamzer because he comes from a fit drop But a convert, who comes from an unfit drop, say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say that a mamzer is disqualified because he comes from a valid drop, but a convert who comes from a valid drop is disqualified, I would say it is unnecessary.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הכשר לדון כשר להעיד ויש שכשר להעיד ואינו כשר לדון
human_translation: Any who is fit to adjudicate is fit to testify and there are who are fit to testify but are not fit to adjudicate.
llm_translation: Mishnah: All qualified to judge are qualified to testify, and there are some who are qualified to testify but are not qualified to judge.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ לאתויי מאי א"ר יוחנן לאתויי סומא באחת מעיניו ומני
human_translation: What is added Rabbi Yoḥanan said: to add one who is blind in one of his eyes. And whose
llm_translation: Gemara: To include what? Said Rabbi Yochanan: To include a blind person in one of his eyes. And from where?

hebrew_text: רבי מאיר היא דתניא היה רבי מאיר אומר מה ת"ל (דברים כא, ה) על פיהם יהיה כל ריב וכל נגע וכי מה ענין ריבים אצל נגעים מקיש ריבים לנגעים מה נגעים ביום דכתיב (ויקרא יג, יד) וביום הראות בו אף ריבים ביום
human_translation: It is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What the verse states: “According to their word shall every dispute and every leprous mark be” What do disputes have to do with leprous marks? juxtaposes disputes to leprous marks, just as leprous marks in the daytime, as it is written “And on the day when appears in him so too, disputes in the daytime.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir is the one who taught: Rabbi Meir used to say, "What is the teaching for? (Deuteronomy 21:5) 'According to their mouth, every dispute and every wound.' And what is the connection between disputes and wounds? He compares disputes to wounds. Just as wounds are visible during the day, as it is written (Leviticus 13:14), 'And on the day when it is shown,' so too disputes are visible during the day."

hebrew_text: ומה נגעים שלא בסומא דכתיב (ויקרא יג, יב) לכל מראה עיני הכהן אף ריבים שלא בסומא ומקיש נגעים לריבים מה ריבים שלא בקרובים אף נגעים שלא בקרובים
human_translation: And just as leprous marks not by blind as it is written: “As far as appears to the priest” so too, disputes are not by blind judges, And juxtaposes leprous marks to disputes just as disputes may not by relatives so too, leprous marks may not by a relative
llm_translation: "And what about negaim that are not in a blind person, as it is written (Leviticus 13:12), 'to all appearance of the eyes of the kohen,' so too, ribim that are not in a blind person, and he juxtaposes negaim to ribim. Just as ribim that are not in relatives, so too, negaim that are not in relatives."

hebrew_text: אי מה ריבים בשלשה אף נגעים בשלשה ודין הוא ממונו בשלשה גופו לא כ"ש ת"ל (ויקרא יג, ב) והובא אל אהרן הכהן או אל אחד מבניו הכהנים הא למדת שאפילו כהן אחד רואה את הנגעים
human_translation: If just as disputes by three so too, leprous marks by three And this a logical inference: one’s money by three all the more so not himself, the verse states: “And he shall be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons, the priests” You learned that even one priest may view leprous marks.
llm_translation: Disputes in three, so too afflictions in three, and a monetary case in three, certainly not his body, needless to say. It is stated (Leviticus 13:2), "And he shall be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons, the priests." From here we learn that even one priest sees the afflictions.

hebrew_text: ההוא סמיא דהוה בשבבותיה דרבי יוחנן דהוה קדיין דינא ולא קאמר ליה ולא מידי היכי עביד הכי והאמר רבי יוחנן הלכה כסתם משנה
human_translation: a certain blind person who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yoḥanan who would render judgments, and did not say anything to him. How could do this? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say halakha in accordance with an unattributed mishna?
llm_translation: That blind man who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yochanan, who was judging a case, and he did not say anything to him, and he did not do anything. How did he act thus? But Rabbi Yochanan said, "The halacha is like the anonymous Mishnah."

hebrew_text: ותנן כל הכשר לדון כשר להעיד ויש כשר להעיד ואין כשר לדון ואמרינן לאתויי מאי ואמר רבי יוחנן לאתויי סומא באחת מעיניו
human_translation: And we learned Any who is fit to adjudicate is fit to testify and there are fit to testify but not fit to adjudicate. And we said: What is added and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: to add one who is blind in one of his eyes,
llm_translation: And we learned: Any valid witness is fit to testify, but there are those fit to testify who are not fit to judge. And we say this to include what? And Rabbi Yochanan said this to include a blind person in one of his eyes.

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן סתמא אחרינא אשכח דתנן דיני ממונות דנין ביום וגומרין בלילה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan found another unattributed mishna As we learned monetary law, judges during the daytime, and concludes at night.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: "Stamah, another opinion, I found that we learned in a Mishnah - monetary cases are judged by day and concluded by night."

hebrew_text: ומאי אולמיה דהאי סתמא מהאי סתמא איבעית אימא סתמא דרבים עדיף ואיבעית אימא משום דקתני לה גבי הלכתא דדיני
human_translation: And what the strength of that unattributed than this unattributed If you wish, say an unattributed of many preferable, And if you wish, say because teaches this in the context of the halakhot of judges.
llm_translation: And what is the difference between this anonymous Mishnah and that anonymous Mishnah? If you wish, say that a public anonymous Mishnah is preferable, and if you wish, say it is because it teaches regarding matters of law.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל שחייב במעשרות מטמא טומאת אוכלין ויש שמטמא טומאת אוכלין ואינו חייב במעשרות
human_translation: Any which obligated to tithes becomes impure with the ritual impurity of food; and there is that becomes impure with the ritual impurity of food but which one is not obligated to tithes.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Anyone obligated in tithes imparts impurity of food, and there are those who impart impurity of food but are not obligated in tithes.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ לאתויי מאי לאתויי בשר ודגים וביצים
human_translation: What is added to add meat, fish, and eggs.
llm_translation: Gemara: To include what? To include meat, fish, and eggs.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל שחייב בפאה חייב במעשרות ויש שחייב במעשרות ואינו חייב בפאה
human_translation: any which obligated to produce in the corner of the field given to the poor [ pe’a ], obligated to tithes and there is which obligated to tithes but which one is not obligated to pe’a .
llm_translation: Mishnah: Anyone who is obligated in Pe'ah is obligated in tithes, and there are those who are obligated in tithes but not in Pe'ah.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ לאתויי מאי לאתויי תאנה וירק שאינו חייב בפאה דתנן כלל אמרו בפאה כל שהוא אוכל ונשמר וגידולו מן הארץ ולקיטתו כאחד ומכניסו לקיום חייב בפאה
human_translation: What is added to add figs and vegetables, which not obligated to pe’a , As we learned stated a principle with regard to pe’a : anything that is food, and is protected, and grows from the earth, and is gathered as one, and brings in for preservation, is obligated to pe’a .
llm_translation: Gemara: To include what? To include figs and vegetables that are not obligated in Pe'ah. As we learned in a Mishnah: In general, they said regarding Pe'ah, anything that is edible, preserved, grown from the ground, gathered together as one, and brought into existence, is obligated in Pe'ah.

hebrew_text: אוכל למעוטי ספיחי סטים וקוצה ונשמר למעוטי הפקר וגידולו מן הארץ למעוטי כמהים ופטריות ולקיטתו כאחד למעוטי תאנה ומכניסו לקיום למעוטי ירק
human_translation: Anything that is food, to exclude sefiḥin , of woad [ setim ] and safflower [ vekotza ]. And is protected, to exclude ownerless And grows from the earth, to exclude truffles and mushrooms, And is gathered as one, to exclude fig And one brings in for preservation, to exclude vegetables,
llm_translation: "Eating to exclude sappichin, stems, and thorns, and to exclude hefker and its growth from the earth, to exclude kumiyim and mushrooms, and its gathering as one, to exclude figs, and bringing it in for sustenance, to exclude vegetables."

hebrew_text: ואילו גבי מעשר תנן כל שהוא אוכל ונשמר וגידולו מן הארץ חייב במעשרות ואילו לקיטתו כאחד ומכניסו לקיום לא קתני
human_translation: And yet of tithe, we learned Anything that is food, and is protected, and grows from the earth is obligated in tithes. And whereas are not taught Gathered as one, and that one brings in for preservation.
llm_translation: And as for regarding tithing, we learned: anything that is edible and preservable, and its growth is from the earth, is obligated in tithes. But as for its gathering, if it is done all at once and brought into storage, it is not taught.

hebrew_text: אם היו בהם שומים ובצלין חייבין דתנן מלבנות בצלים שבין הירק ר' יוסי אומר פאה מכל אחת ואחת וחכ"א מאחת על הכל
human_translation: if contained garlic and onions, obligated As we learned garden beds of onions that are between the vegetables, Rabbi Yosei says pe’a from each and every one And the Rabbis say from one for all
llm_translation: If there were garlic and onions in them, one is liable, as we learned in a Mishnah: for whitening onions among vegetables. Rabbi Yosei says: "Pe'ah from each one separately," and the sages say: "One for all."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן עולשין שזרען מתחילה לבהמה ונמלך עליהן לאדם
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: endives that were initially planted to animals, and reconsidered their for human
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: Rabbi Yoḥanan said, "Oleshin, whose seed initially belongs to an animal and is then transferred to a human."

hebrew_text: צריכות מחשבה לכשיתלשו קסבר מחשבת חבור לא שמה מחשבה
human_translation: they require intent once they are detached holds intent attached is not considered intent.
llm_translation: Requires thought when they will untie. He holds: thought of connection not placed thought.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אף אנן נמי תנינא י"ג דברים נאמרו בנבלת עוף טהור וזה אחד מהן צריכה מחשבה ואינה צריכה הכשר אלמא מחשבת חיים לא שמה מחשבה הכא נמי מחשבת חבור לא שמה מחשבה
human_translation: Rava said: We learn as well: Thirteen matters were stated with regard to the carcass of a kosher bird, and this is one of them: requires intention but it does not require rendered susceptible Evidently, intent alive is not considered intent. Here too, intent attached is not considered intent.
llm_translation: Rava said: We also learned: Thirteen matters were stated regarding the carcass of a clean bird, and this is one of them - it requires intent but does not require proper preparation. This indicates that intent for life is not effective, and here too, intent for connection is not effective.

hebrew_text: רבי זירא אמר הכא בגוזל שנפל מן הרום עסקינן דלא הוה קמן דלחשוב עליה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: here we are dealing with a young bird that fell from a height, where was not before us so that intent that it
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said here regarding a fledgling that fell from on high we are dealing with a case where it was not considered.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי תרנגולת שביבנה מאי איכא למימר א"ל תרנגול ברא הוה
human_translation: Abaye said to What is there to say chicken in Yavne? said to was a wild chicken,
llm_translation: He said to him, "Abaye, what can be said about the rooster in Yavne?" He said to him, "It was a created rooster."

hebrew_text: אחיכו עליה תרנגול ברא עוף טמא הוא ועוף טמא מי קמטמא אמר להו אביי גברא רבה אמר מילתא לא תחיכו עליה בתרנגולת שמרדה ומאי ברא דאיבראי ממרה
human_translation: laughed at A wild chicken is a non-kosher bird, and does a non-kosher bird impart impurity? Abaye said to them: A great man has stated a matter; do not laugh at him. to a chicken that rebelled And what a wild [ bara ] that was created [ de’ivrai ] from that rebelled.
llm_translation: The brothers of him on it a rooster created bird impure he and bird impure who can make impure said to them Abaye man great said matter not wait on it in the rooster that rebelled and what in the created that it crossed bitter

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר תרנגולתא דאגמא הואי רב פפא לטעמיה דאמר רב פפא תרנגול דאגמא אסור תרנגולתא דאגמא שריא
human_translation: Rav Pappa stated It was a marsh [ de’agma ] hen. Rav Pappa to his reasoning as Rav Pappa said: the marsh rooster is prohibited, the marsh hen is permitted.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "A hen of the marsh is Rav Papa's reasoning, for Rav Papa said: A hen of the marsh is forbidden, a hen of the marsh is permitted."

hebrew_text: וסימניך עמוני ולא עמונית דרש מרימר תרנגולתא דאגמא אסירא חזיוה רבנן דדרסה ואכלה והיינו גירותא
human_translation: And your mnemonic An Ammonite but not an Ammonite woman. Mareimar taught: The marsh hen is prohibited, the Sages saw that it mauled and ate And this is geiruta ,
llm_translation: And your sign is Ammoni and not Ammonit. Marimar expounded: "A rooster from the marsh is prohibited." The sages saw it pecking and eating, and that is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: ת"ר גוזל שנפל לגת וחשב עליו להעלותו לכותי טמא לכלב טהור ר' יוחנן בן נורי אומר אף לכלב טמא
human_translation: the Sages taught A young bird that fell into a winepress where intended to draw it up for a Samaritan ritually impure, for a dog ritually pure. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: Even for a dog impure,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one stole an animal that fell into a winepress and he intended to lift it up from there, whether it is a ritually impure Kutite who is considered like a dog or a ritually pure dog, Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says it is permissible even for a ritually impure dog.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן בן נורי ק"ו אם מטמא טומאה חמורה שלא במחשבה לא יטמא טומאה קלה שלא במחשבה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says a fortiori If transmits severe impurity, without thought, not transmit a lenient impurity without thought?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri taught: "If one becomes impure with a severe impurity unintentionally, they shall not become impure with a light impurity unintentionally."

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לא אם אמרת בטומאה חמורה שכן אינה יורדת לכך תאמר בטומאה קלה שכן יורדת לכך
human_translation: said to No, If you said with regard to severe impurity, that does not assume with that Shall you say with regard to lenient impurity, which does assume with that
llm_translation: They said to him, "No, if you say impurity is severe, it does not descend; therefore, say impurity is light, for it descends."

hebrew_text: אמר להן תרנגולת שביבנה תוכיח שיורדת לכך וטמאוה שלא במחשבה אמרו לו משם ראיה כותים היו שם וחשבו עליה לאכילה
human_translation: said to chicken in Yavne can prove that does assume with that and declared it impure without intent. said to proof from there? there were Samaritans there, and intended that it be eaten
llm_translation: He said to them: "A hen from Yavneh will prove that it descends for this reason, and its impurity is not intentional." They said to him: "From there is proof - the Kutim were there and they intended to eat it."

hebrew_text: במאי עסקינן אילימא בכרכים למה לה מחשבה והתנן נבלת בהמה טהורה בכל מקום ונבלת עוף טהור והחלב בכרכים אין צריכין לא מחשבה ולא הכשר
human_translation: What are we dealing with? If we say with cities, why does it intent? But didn’t we learn An unslaughtered carcass of a kosher animal in any location, and the carcass of a kosher bird or the fat in cities [ bakerakim ], require neither intent nor susceptible
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say with regard to intestines, why is there intent? But we learned: Regarding the carcass of a kosher animal found anywhere, and the carcass of a kosher bird, and the fat found in intestines, they do not require intent nor do they need to be declared fit.

hebrew_text: אלא בכפרים ומי איכא למ"ד דלא בעיא מחשבה והתנן נבלת בהמה טמאה בכל מקום ונבלת עוף טהור בכפרים צריכה מחשבה ואינה צריכה הכשר
human_translation: Rather, to villages, But Is there anyone who said that intent is not required Didn’t we learn A carcass of a non-kosher animal in any location, and an unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird in the villages require intent but they do not require susceptible
llm_translation: Rather, in villages. And is there anyone who says that intent is not necessary? But we learned: The carcass of an impure animal is impure everywhere, and the carcass of a pure bird in villages requires intent, and does not require ritual slaughter.

hebrew_text: א"ר זעירא בר חנינא לעולם בכרך וגתו מאסתו ועשאתו ככפר
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira bar Ḥanina says: Actually, in a city, and winepress rendered it disgusting and rendered it like a village,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira bar Hanina said: Always in a circle, and his winepress you shall despise, and you shall make it like atonement.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן בן נורי קל וחומר אם מטמאה טומאה חמורה שלא במחשבה לא תטמא טומאה קלה שלא במחשבה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says an a fortiori If transmits severe impurity without thought, not transmit lenient impurity without thought?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri: A fortiori, if it can impart severe impurity unintentionally, it cannot impart light impurity unintentionally.

human_translation: said to No, If you said with regard to severe ritual impurity, that does not assume with that

human_translation: What does not assume with that Rava said this is what said to No, if you said

human_translation: in severe impurity, which does not render similar to it, shall you say in lenient impurity, which does render similar to it?
llm_translation: In impurity severe, so it is not does like in it. You will say in impurity light, does like in it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי כל דכן הוא ומה טומאה חמורה דקילא דאינה עושה כיוצא בה מטמאה שלא במחשבה טומאה קלה דחמירא דעושה כיוצא בה אינו דין שמטמאה שלא במחשבה
human_translation: Abaye said to all the more so If severe impurity, which is lenient that it does not render similar to it, imparts impurity without thought, lenient impurity, which is severe that it renders similar to it, isn’t it logical that it impart impurity without thought?
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "Anyone who is thus, and what is the severe impurity of a kilai garment that does not render similar to it impure unintentionally, the light impurity of a strict one that renders similar to it does not render impure unintentionally."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב ששת הכי קאמר לא אם אמרת בטומאה חמורה שכן אינה צריכה הכשר תאמר בטומאה קלה שצריכה הכשר
human_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said this are saying: No, if you said with regard to severe impurity, as it does not require susceptible shall you say with regard to lenient impurity, where does require susceptible
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said thus: No, if you say in severe impurity, for it is not necessary, say in light impurity, for it is necessary.

hebrew_text: ומי צריכה הכשר והתנן שלשה דברים נאמרו בנבלת עוף טהור צריכה מחשבה ואינה מטמאה אלא בבית הבליעה ואינה צריכה הכשר
human_translation: And does require susceptible But didn’t we learn Three matters were stated with regard to the carcass of a kosher bird: requires intent and it transmits impurity only in the throat; and it does not require susceptible
llm_translation: And is it necessary to have qualification? But we learned: Three things were stated regarding the carcass of a pure bird - it requires intent, and it does not render impure except in the throat, and it does not require qualification.

hebrew_text: נהי דהכשר שרץ לא בעיא הכשר מים בעיא
human_translation: Although it does not require with a creeping animal susceptible it does require water susceptible
llm_translation: It is true that regarding the permissibility of a creeping creature, it does not require the permissibility of water.

hebrew_text: מאי שנא הכשר שרץ דלא בעיא כדתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל הכשר מים נמי לא תבעי כדתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל
human_translation: What is different susceptible a creeping animal that it does not require in accordance with that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught. also not require water susceptible in accordance with that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught.
llm_translation: What is the difference between the ritual fitness of a creeping thing that does not require immersion, as taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, and the fitness of water that also does not require immersion, as taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael?

hebrew_text: דתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל (ויקרא יא, לז) על כל זרע זרוע אשר יזרע
human_translation: As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught upon any sowing seed that is to be sown,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Leviticus 11:37) "Upon all seeds of sowing that is sown."

hebrew_text: מה זרעים שאין סופן לטמא טומאה חמורה צריכין הכשר אף כל שאין סופן לטמא טומאה חמורה צריכין הכשר יצתה נבלת עוף טהור שסופה לטמא טומאה חמורה שאין צריך הכשר
human_translation: just as seeds, which will never transmit impurity severe require susceptible so too, all that will never transmit severe impurity require susceptible excludes the carcass of a kosher bird, which will ultimately transmit impurity severe it does not require susceptible
llm_translation: Seeds that their end is not to become impure with severe impurity require validation, even all that their end is not to become impure with severe impurity require validation. If a carcass of a pure bird emerged, whose end is to become impure with severe impurity, does not require validation.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא ואיתימא רב פפא שום טומאה חמורה בעולם שום טומאה קלה בעולם
human_translation: Rather, Rava said, and some say Rav Pappa in general name of severe impurity name of lenient impurity in general
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said, and some say Rav Papa, "Any severe impurity in the world, any light impurity in the world."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ומודה רבי יוחנן לענין מעשר דמחשבת חיבור שמה מחשבה אמר רבא מנא אמינא לה דתנן הסיאה והאזוב והקורנית שבחצר אם היו נשמרין חייבין
human_translation: Rava says: And Rabbi Yoḥanan concedes with regard to tithe, that intent attached is considered intent. Rava said: From where do I say this as we learned Savory, hyssop [ veha’ezov ], and thyme [ vehakoranit ], in a courtyard, if they were protected obligated
llm_translation: Rava said, and Rabbi Yochanan agrees regarding the matter of tithing with intent: thought constitutes an act. Rava said: From where do I say this? As we learned in a Mishnah: the sycamore fig, the hyssop, and the caper bush in the courtyard, if they were guarded, one is liable.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימא דזרעינהו מתחלה לאדם צריכא למימר אלא לאו דזרעינהו מתחלה לבהמה וקתני אם היו נשמרין חייבין
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say where one initially planted them for human need to be said Rather, not where one initially planted them to an animal, teaches: If they were protected obligated
llm_translation: How so? If you say that when they were sown initially for a person, it is necessary to say, rather, is it not when they were sown initially for an animal? And it teaches: If they were guarded, they are liable.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי הכא בחצר שעלו מאיליהן עסקינן וסתמא לאדם קיימי והכי קאמר אם החצר משמרת פירותיה חייבין ואם לאו פטורין
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Here we are dealing with a courtyard where grew by themselves, and unspecified, intended for human And this is saying: If the courtyard protects its produce, are obligated and if not, they are exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Here we are dealing with a courtyard where they ascended from their own property, and the Mishnah is speaking in general terms, and it is assumed that people are standing there. And this is what it means: If the courtyard guards its fruits, they are liable; and if not, they are exempt.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב אשי כל שחייבין במעשרות מטמאין טומאת אוכלין ואם איתא הא איכא הני דקחייבין במעשר ואין מטמאין טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises objection Any which obligated to tithes becomes impure with the ritual impurity of food. But if it is so, there are these which obligated to tithe, but which do not become impure with the ritual impurity of food.
llm_translation: Challenged Rav Ashi: All who are obligated in tithes impart impurity of food. But if so, there are these who are obligated in tithes and do not impart impurity of food.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הכי קאמר כל מין שחייב במעשר מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: Rava said this is saying: Any type which obligated to tithe becomes impure with the ritual impurity of food.
llm_translation: Rava said: This is what he is saying: Any species that is obligated in tithing imparts ritual impurity of food.

hebrew_text: ה"נ מסתברא מדקתני סיפא כל שחייב בראשית הגז חייב במתנות ויש שחייב במתנות ואין חייב בראשית הגז
human_translation: this too stands to reason, from that the latter clause teaches any which obligated to the first shearing obligated to gifts And there are which obligated to gifts but not obligated to the first shearing.
llm_translation: So it is logical, as it is taught in the latter clause: anyone who is obligated in the first shearing is obligated in gifts, and there are those who are obligated in gifts but are not obligated in the first shearing.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא האיכא טרפה דחייבת בראשית הגז ואינה חייבת במתנות
human_translation: And if it is so, But there is an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], which obligated to the first shearing, but one is not obligated to gifts
llm_translation: And if it is so that there is a treifah, it is liable for the first of shearing and is not liable for gifts.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא הא מני רבי שמעון היא דתנן ר"ש פוטר את הטרפה מראשית הגז
human_translation: Ravina said, whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, as we learned Rabbi Shimon exempts the a tereifa from the first shearing.
llm_translation: Ravina said: This is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon exempts the treifah from the beginning of shearing.

hebrew_text: אמר רב שימי בר אשי תא שמע המפקיר את כרמו והשכים בבקר ובצרו חייב בפרט ובעוללות ובשכחה ובפאה ופטור מן המעשר
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Come hear one who declares his vineyard ownerless, and who arose the morning and picked grapes obligated in individual fallen [ peret ], and in incompletely formed clusters [ uve’olelot ], and in forgotten and in pe’a . And he is exempt from the tithe
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Come and hear. One who declares his vineyard ownerless and then goes early in the morning and prunes it is liable for theft, specifically for gleanings, forgotten sheaves, corners of the field, and exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: והא אנן תנן כל שחייב בפאה חייב במעשרות אלא לאו שמע מינה מין קתני שמע מינה
human_translation: But didn’t we learn any which obligated to pe’a , obligated to tithes? Rather, not conclude from is teaching type conclude from
llm_translation: And behold, we have learned: Anyone who is obligated in Pe'ah is obligated in tithes. But is it not so? Learn from here: a kind of teaching, learn from here.

hebrew_text: תנן התם מודים חכמים לר' עקיבא בזורע שבת או חרדל בשנים ושלשה מקומות שנותן פאה מכל אחד ואחד
human_translation: we learned elsewhere the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Akiva in one who sows dill or mustard in two or three locations that he leaves pe’a for each and every one
llm_translation: We have learned there: The Sages concede to Rabbi Akiva regarding one who sows on Shabbat or mustard in two or three places, that he must give the corner of each and every one.

hebrew_text: והא שבת דמיחייב בפאה ומיחייב במעשר דתנן כל שחייב בפאה חייב במעשר
human_translation: But dill, which obligated to pe’a , be obligated to tithe, As we learned any which obligated to pe’a , obligated to tithe.
llm_translation: And the matter of Shabbat, it is obligated in Pe'ah and obligated in Ma'aser, as we learned in a Mishnah: Anyone who is obligated in Pe'ah is obligated in Ma'aser.

hebrew_text: ומדחייב במעשר מטמא טומאת אוכלין אלמא כל מילי דעביד לטעמא מטמא טומאת אוכלין דהאי שבת לטעמא עבידא
human_translation: And from obligated to tithe, becomes impure with the ritual impurity of food. Apparently, any item that is prepared to taste becomes impure with the ritual impurity of food, as this dill is prepared to taste
llm_translation: And liable in tithe, imparts impurity of food. Therefore, all matters that it does for a reason imparts impurity of food, for this Sabbath, it does for a reason.

hebrew_text: ורמינהי הקושט והחימום וראשי בשמים והתיאה והחלתית והפלפלים וחלת חריע נקחין בכסף מעשר ואין מטמאין טומאת אוכלין דברי רבי עקיבא
human_translation: And raises a contradiction costus, amomum, chief spices, root of crowfoot, asafoetida, peppers, and a cake of safflower, may be bought with tithe money, But they do not become impure with the ritual impurity of food. the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: the kushtet, the chimum, the heads of garlic, the taya, the chaltit, the peppers, and the wild garlic - we may purchase with silver of the tithe, and they do not impart ritual impurity of food. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יוחנן בן נורי אם נקחין בכסף מעשר מפני מה אין מטמאין טומאת אוכלין ואם אינן מטמאין אף הם לא ילקחו בכסף מעשר
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said to If they may be bought with tithe money, for what they not becoming impure with the ritual impurity of food? And if they do not become impure they should also not be bought with tithe money.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said to him: If we take with money tithe, why are they not defiled with the defilement of food? And if they are not defiled, they also should not be taken with money tithe.

hebrew_text: וא"ר יוחנן בן נורי נמנו וגמרו שאין נקחין בכסף מעשר ואין מטמאין טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said They counted and they concluded that may not be bought with tithe money, and not become impure impurity of food.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: They counted and concluded that tithes are not acquired with money, and food impurity does not impart impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא כי תניא ההיא בשבת העשויה לכמך
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says When that is taught, to dill that is prepared for a spice dish [ likhmakh ],
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: For it was taught in a Baraita: That which is prepared on Shabbat is fit for consumption.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי אמריתה לשמעתי' קמיה דרב כהנא (אמר) לא תימא בשבת העשויה לכמך הא סתמא לקדרה אלא סתם שבת לכמך עשויה דתנן השבת משנתנה טעם בקדרה אין בה משום תרומה ואינה מטמאה טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: I said this halakha of before Rav Kahana, Do not say where dill for a spice dish undesignated in a pot Rather, undesignated dill prepared for a spice dish. As we learned dill, once it imparted flavor in a pot is no subject to teruma , and it can no become impure with the ritual impurity of food.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: It was said in the presence of Rav Kahana, do not say on Shabbat that which is prepared for a kumkum. Rather, say that a regular pot is prepared for a kumkum, as we learned in a Mishnah: Shabbat, when it is given a taste in a pot, does not have the status of terumah, and it does not impart ritual impurity of food.

hebrew_text: הא עד שלא נתנה טעם בקדרה יש בה משום תרומה ומטמאה טומאת אוכלין ואי ס"ד סתמא לקדרה כי לא נתנה נמי סתמא לקדרה אלא לאו ש"מ סתמא לכמך עשויה ש"מ
human_translation: until imparted flavor in a pot is subject to teruma , and it can become impure with the ritual impurity of food. And if enters your mind undesignated in a pot even when not place undesignated in a pot Rather, not conclude from undesignated prepared for a spice dish? Learn from
llm_translation: This, until not placed taste in pot, there is in it because of terumah and it defiles defilement of foods. And if you say perhaps, anonymous to pot when not placed also anonymous to pot, rather no, learn anonymous to like it made, learn.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל שחייב בראשית הגז חייב במתנות ויש שחייב במתנות ואינו חייב בראשית הגז
human_translation: any which one is obligated to the first shearing is obligated to gifts And there are which one is obligated to gifts but he is not obligated to the first shearing.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Anyone who is obligated in the first of shearing is obligated in gifts, and there are those who are obligated in gifts but not obligated in the first of shearing.

hebrew_text: כל שיש לו ביעור יש לו שביעית ויש שיש לו שביעית ואין לו ביעור
human_translation: all to which there eradication there is Sabbatical- it, And there for which there is Sabbatical- but for there is no eradication
llm_translation: All who has in removal has in Sabbatical year and there are those who has in Sabbatical year and does not have in removal.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ כגון עלה הלוף שוטה והדנדנה יש שיש לו שביעית ואין לו ביעור עיקר הלוף שוטה ועיקר הדנדנה
human_translation: such as the wild arum leaf and the ceterach, there is for which there is Sabbatical- but there is no eradication root of the wild arum and the root of the ceterach.
llm_translation: Gemara: For example, the "Luf," "Shotah," and "Dandana." There are those that have the seventh year (Shvi'it) and do not have the obligation of removal (Bi'ur). The essence of the "Luf" is "Shotah," and the essence of the "Dandana."

hebrew_text: דכתיב (ויקרא כה, ז) ולבהמתך ולחיה אשר בארצך תהיה כל תבואתה לאכול כל זמן שחיה אוכלת מן השדה אתה מאכיל לבהמתך בבית כלה לחיה מן השדה כלה לבהמתך שבבית והני לא כלו להו
human_translation: that it is written “And for the cattle and the beasts that are in your land, all its produce may be eaten” As long as the undomesticated animals eat from the field, you may feed to your domesticated animal in the house, has ceased for the undomesticated animals in the field, you must cease to your domesticated animal in the house. And these, have not ceased for undomesticated animals
llm_translation: As it is written (Leviticus 25:7), "And for your cattle and for the beasts that are in your land, all its produce shall be to eat." As long as the beast is eating from the field, you feed your cattle in the house, and the beasts from the field are for your cattle in the house, and these do not finish for them.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל שיש לו קשקשת יש לו סנפיר ויש שיש לו סנפיר ואין לו קשקשת כל שיש לו קרנים יש לו טלפים ויש שיש לו טלפים ואין לו קרנים
human_translation: Any that has scales has fins; and there are that have fins but do not have scales. Any that has horns has hooves; and there are that have hooves but do not have horns.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Anyone who has a kaskeset has a sanpir, and there are those who have a sanpir but do not have a kaskeset. Anyone who has horns has talfim, and there are those who have talfim but do not have horns.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ כל שיש לו קשקשת דג טהור יש שיש לו סנפיר ואין לו קשקשת דג טמא מכדי אנן אקשקשת סמכינן סנפיר דכתב רחמנא למה לי
human_translation: any that has scales a kosher fish. there are that have fins but do not have scales. a non-kosher fish. Since we rely upon scales, why do I fins that the Merciful One writes
llm_translation: Gemara: Anyone who has a scale of a pure fish, he has a sapphire. And if he does not have a scale of an impure fish, since we have a sapphire, we rely on the sapphire, as the Merciful One wrote, "Why do I need scales?"

hebrew_text: אי לא כתב רחמנא סנפיר הוה אמינא מאי קשקשת דכתיב סנפיר ואפילו דג טמא כתב רחמנא סנפיר וקשקשת
human_translation: If the Merciful One not written fins I would say: What kaskeset , that is written fins. And even a non-kosher fish, the Merciful One writes fins and scales.
llm_translation: If the Merciful One had not written "snapper," I would have said, "What is the meaning of 'kaskeset' that is written 'snapper'? Even an impure fish, the Merciful One wrote 'snapper' and 'kaskeset.'"

hebrew_text: והשתא דכתב רחמנא סנפיר וקשקשת מנלן דקשקשת לבושא הוא דכתיב (שמואל א יז, ה) ושריון קשקשים הוא לבוש
human_translation: But now that the Merciful One wrote fins and kaskeset , from where do we kaskeset clothing, as it is written “And he was clad with a coat of mail [ kaskasim ]”
llm_translation: And now, when the Merciful One wrote "sanfir" and "keshet," from where do we know that "keshet" refers to clothing? It is as it is written (1 Samuel 17:5), "And he had a coat of mail."

hebrew_text: ולכתוב רחמנא קשקשת ולא בעי סנפיר א"ר אבהו וכן תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל (ישעיהו מב, כא) יגדיל תורה ויאדיר
human_translation: But Let the Merciful One write “scales” and no need “fins.” Rabbi Abbahu says, and likewise the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, to make Torah great and glorious”
llm_translation: To write "Rachmana kashkashat" and not require a "sanpir," Rabbi Abahu said, and so too the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Isaiah 42:21) "He will magnify the Torah and make it glorious."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הטעון ברכה לאחריו טעון ברכה לפניו ויש שטעון ברכה לפניו ואין טעון ברכה לאחריו
human_translation: Anything that requires a blessing after it requires a blessing beforehand. And there exist that require a blessing before but not require a blessing thereafter.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Anyone who requires a blessing after eating requires a blessing before eating, and there are those who require a blessing before eating and do not require a blessing after eating.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ לאתויי מאי לאתויי ירק ולרבי יצחק דמברך אירק לאתויי מאי לאתויי מיא
human_translation: What add? to add vegetables, And according to Rabbi Yitzḥak, who recites a blessing on vegetables what add? to add water,
llm_translation: Gemara: To include what? To include vegetables. And according to Rabbi Yitzchak who blesses on vegetables, to include what? To include water.

hebrew_text: ולרב פפא דמברך אמיא לאתויי מאי לאתויי מצות ולבני מערבא דמברכי בתר דסליקו תפילייהו אשר קדשנו במצותיו וצונו לשמור חוקיו לאתויי מאי לאתויי
human_translation: And according to Rav Pappa, who one recites a blessing on water what to add? to add mitzvot. And according to residents of the West, who recite blessing after they remove their phylacteries: Who sanctified us with His mitzvot and commanded us to keep His laws, what come to add? to add
llm_translation: To Rav Papa who blesses, said: "Amen" to bring what? To bring what? Mitzvot. And to the inhabitants of the west who bless after they have concluded their prayers, "Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to observe His statutes," to bring what? To bring what?

hebrew_text: ריחני
human_translation: spices.
llm_translation: ריחני My translation: Rihani

hebrew_text: מתני׳ תינוקת שהביאה שתי שערות או חולצת או מתיבמת וחייבת בכל מצות האמורות בתורה
human_translation: A young girl who grew two hairs she either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage And obligated to all the mitzvot stated in the Torah
llm_translation: Mishnah: A minor who brought two hairs or a garment or a yevamah, and she is obligated in all the commandments mentioned in the Torah.

hebrew_text: וכן תינוק שהביא שתי שערות חייב בכל מצות האמורות בתורה וראוי להיות בן סורר ומורה משיביא שתי שערות עד שיקיף זקן
human_translation: And likewise, a young boy who grew two hairs obligated to all the mitzvot stated in the Torah. And he is fit to be a stubborn and rebellious son from when he grows two hairs until beard will form a circle.
llm_translation: And so, a child who brought forth two hairs is obligated in all the commandments mentioned in the Torah and is fitting to be a rebellious son until he brings forth two hairs until he grows a beard.

hebrew_text: התחתון ולא העליון אלא שדברו חכמים בלשון נקיה
human_translation: the lower, and not to the upper, But that the Sages spoke euphemistically.
llm_translation: The lower one and not the upper one, except that the sages spoke in a clean language.

hebrew_text: תינוקת שהביאה שתי שערות אינה יכולה למאן רבי יהודה אומר עד שירבה השחור
human_translation: A young girl who grew two hairs can no perform refusal Rabbi Yehuda says: until that the black will be preponderant
llm_translation: Infant that brought two hairs not able to. Who Rabbi Yehuda says until will increase the black.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ וכיון דתנן חייבת בכל מצות האמורות בתורה או חולצת או מתיבמת למה לי
human_translation: But since we learned obligated to all the mitzvot stated in the Torah, why do I She either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Gemara: And since we learned that she is obligated in all the commandments mentioned in the Torah, why does she need chalitzah or yibum?

hebrew_text: לאפוקי מדרבי יוסי דאמר איש כתוב בפרשה אבל אשה בין גדולה ובין קטנה קמ"ל דאי אייתי שתי שערות אין אי לא לא מאי טעמא אשה כאיש
human_translation: to exclude of Rabbi Yosei, who said: Man, is written in the passage But woman, whether an adult or whether a minor, teaches us that if grew two hairs, yes, if not not What is the reason woman like man,
llm_translation: To exclude the opinion of Rabbi Yosei who said: "A man is obligated to write a Torah scroll in a separate portion, but a woman, whether she is an adult or a minor," the Mishnah teaches us the following: if one brings two hairs, the obligation is fulfilled; if not, it is not fulfilled. What is the reason? A woman is like a man.

hebrew_text: וכיון דתנא וכן התינוק שהביא ב' שערות חייב בכל המצות האמורות בתורה ל"ל
human_translation: And since we learned And likewise, a young boy who grew two hairs why do I obligated to all the mitzvot stated in the Torah?
llm_translation: And since it was taught: "And similarly, a child who grows two hairs is obligated in all the commandments mentioned in the Torah."

hebrew_text: וכי תימא משום דקבעי למתני וראוי להיות בן סורר ומורה תנינא חדא זימנא אימתי הוא בן סורר ומורה משיביא שתי שערות ועד שיקיף זקן התחתון ולא העליון אלא שדברו חכמים בלשון נקיה
human_translation: And if you would say because wanted to teach And he is fit to be a stubborn and rebellious son, we learned halakha another occasion When a stubborn and rebellious son? From when he grows two hairs until beard will form a circle. the lower, and not to the upper, but that the Sages spoke euphemistically.
llm_translation: And if you will say, because it is necessary to teach and fitting to be a rebellious son, we have learned in one place: When is he considered a rebellious son? When he brings two hairs until the lower elder and not the upper one, except that the Sages spoke in a clean language.

hebrew_text: אין ה"נ אלא איידי דפריש מילי דתינוקת קמפרש נמי מילי דתינוק
human_translation: Yes, is indeed so, But since specified matter of a young girl, also specified matter of a young boy.
llm_translation: There is no "hn" except as an indication that the words of infants are distinct; similarly, the words of infants are also distinct.

hebrew_text: תינוקת שהביאה כו' א"ר אבהו א"ר אלעזר הלכה כרבי יהודה
human_translation: A young girl who grew Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Elazar says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Infant that brought etc. Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Elazar halacha follows Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: ומודה רבי יהודה שאם נבעלה לאחר שהביאה שתי שערות שוב אינה יכולה למאן
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda concedes that if she engaged in intercourse after she grew two hairs, can no longer perform refusal.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda concedes that if she had intercourse after bringing two hairs, she cannot return to whom.

hebrew_text: חברוהי דרב כהנא סבור למעבד עובדא כרבי יהודה ואע"ג דנבעלה
human_translation: Rav Kahana’s colleagues thought to perform an action in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda and even though she engaged in intercourse
llm_translation: The colleagues of Rav Kahana thought to act in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, even though it is a matter of dispute.

hebrew_text: אמר להו רב כהנא לא כך היה מעשה בבתו של רבי ישמעאל שבאת לבית המדרש למאן ובנה מורכב לה על כתפה ואותו היום הוזכרו דבריו של רבי ישמעאל בבית המדרש ובכתה בכייה גדולה בבית המדרש
human_translation: Rav Kahana said to Didn’t the incident involving Rabbi Yishmael’s daughter, in that manner? As she came to the study hall to refuse and her son was riding on her shoulders. And on that day, Rabbi Yishmael’s statement, was mentioned in the study hall. And she cried a great weeping in the study hall,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Kahana: Not so was the incident with the daughter of Rabbi Yishmael, who came to the study hall for what purpose? And a beam fell upon her shoulder, and that day the words of Rabbi Yishmael were mentioned in the study hall, and she wept with great weeping in the study hall.

hebrew_text: אמרו דבר שאמר אותו צדיק יכשל בו זרעו
human_translation: said: a matter that that righteous said, his offspring would stumble upon it?
llm_translation: They said: A matter that a righteous person said, his seed will stumble in it.

hebrew_text: דאמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל משום רבי ישמעאל (במדבר ה, יג) והיא לא נתפשה אסורה הא נתפשה מותרת ויש לך אחרת שאע"פ שלא נתפשה מותרת ואיזו זו שקדושיה קדושי טעות שאע"פ שבנה מורכב על כתפה ממאנת והולכת לה
human_translation: As Rav Yehuda said Shmuel says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: “And neither was she taken” she is prohibited was taken she is permitted And there is another where, even though she was not taken permitted. And which is this? whose betrothal a mistaken betrothal, as, even if her son is riding on her shoulders she may perform refusal and go her.
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Yishmael (Numbers 5:13) "And she was not caught," forbidden. If she was caught, permitted. And you have another case, even though she was not caught, permitted. And which is it? One whose sanctity is sanctity in error, even though her son is hanging on her shoulder, she refuses and goes away.

hebrew_text: ונמנו וגמרו עד מתי הבת ממאנת עד שתביא שתי שערות פרוש ולא עבוד עובדא
human_translation: And counted and concluded: Until when may girl perform refusal? Until grows two hairs. retracted did not perform an action
llm_translation: And they counted and concluded until when the daughter refuses until she grows two pubic hairs separated and not a matter of practice.

hebrew_text: רבי יצחק ותלמידי דרבי חנינא עבוד עובדא כרבי יהודה ואע"ג דנבעלה אזל רב שמן בר אבא אמרה קמיה דר' יוחנן אזל רבי יוחנן אמרה קמיה דרבי יהודה נשיאה שדר בלשא ואפקוה
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak and the disciples of Rabbi Ḥanina performed an action in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda and even though she engaged in intercourse Rav Shemen bar Abba went stated before Rabbi Yoḥanan, Rabbi Yoḥanan went stated it before Rabbi Yehuda Nesia. sent a constable [ ballasha ] and removed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak and the disciples of Rabbi Chanina performed a deed like Rabbi Yehuda, and even though it was done, Rav Shemen bar Abba went before Rabbi Yochanan. Rabbi Yochanan went before Rabbi Yehuda, who sent him a greeting and he accepted it.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא אמר מר עוקבא לא שירבה השחור ממש אלא כדי שיהיו שתי שערות שוכבות ונראות כמי שירבה השחור על הלבן רבא אמר שתי שערות המקיפות משפה לשפה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says Mar Ukva says: not that black literally be preponderant Rather, there must be two hairs lying down, so that it appears as though the black greater than the white Rava says: two hairs that surround from end to end.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said, Mar Ukva said: The black did not actually increase, but rather so that two hairs lie and appear as though the black increased on the white. Rava said: Two hairs that encircle from edge to edge.

hebrew_text: א"ר חלבו אמר רב הונא שתי שערות שאמרו צריך שיהא בעיקרן גומות רב מלכיו אמר רב אדא בר אהבה גומות אע"פ שאין שערות
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo says Rav Huna says: two hairs that said must have follicles at their roots. Rav Malkiyyu says Rav Adda bar Ahava follicles even if there are no hairs
llm_translation: Rabbi Chalbo said, Rav Huna said: Two hairs that they said require that they be primarily plucked out. Rav Melakhiyo said, Rav Adda bar Ahava: Plucked out, even though there are no hairs.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חנינא בריה דרב איקא שפוד שפחות וגומות רב מלכיו בלורית אפר מקלה וגבינה רב מלכיא
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rav Ika, says: a skewer, maidservants, and follicles Rav Malkiyyu. forelock [ belorit ], burnt ashes, and cheese Rav Malkiyya.
llm_translation: Rav Chanina, son of Rav Ika, said: "A spit, maidservants, and bundles of reeds are more severe than a king of Loria, ashes, a stick, and cheese."

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר מתני' ומתניתא רב מלכיא שמעתתא רב מלכיו וסימנא מתניתא מלכתא
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: a mishna or a baraita Rav Malkiyya, halakhot Rav Malkiyyu. And a mnemonic The mishna is a queen [ malketa ],
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Mishnah and Baraita, Rav Melakhiya heard, Rav Melakhiyo, and a sign is Baraita, Malkata.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו שפחות
human_translation: What is between between them maidservants.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them - "sh'f'chot" (maidservants).

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי אמר לי מר זוטרא קשה בה רבי חנינא מסורא לא לישתמיט תנא ואשמועי' גומות אי אשמועינן גומות ה"א עד שיהו שתי שערות בשתי גומות קמ"ל דאפילו שתי שערות בגומא אחת
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Mar Zutra told me Rabbi Ḥanina of Sura difficulty: let tanna not evade but teach us follicles If taught us follicles, I would say until there are two hairs in two follicles. teaches us that even two hairs in one follicle
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, Master Zutra told me: Difficult in it Rabbi Chanina of Sura not to throw away a Tanna and I heard: Gomot if we hear Gomot, how so? Until there are two hairs in two Gomot. This teaches us that even two hairs in one Goma.

hebrew_text: ומי איכא כה"ג והכתיב (איוב ט, יז) אשר בשערה ישופני והרבה פצעי חנם ואמר רבא איוב בסערה חירף בסערה השיבוהו בסערה חירף אמר לפניו רבש"ע שמא רוח סערה עברה לפניך ונתחלפה לך בין איוב לאויב בסערה השיבוהו (איוב לח ) ויען ה' את
human_translation: And is there a case like this, But isn’t it written: “He crushes me with a tempest, and multiplies my wounds without cause” and Rava said Job blasphemed with a tempest, with a tempest he was answered. He blasphemed with a tempest, said before Master of the Universe, perhaps a tempest passed before You and You confused Iyyov, with oyev , With a tempest he was answered, “Then the Lord answered
llm_translation: And is there such a thing as a "holy and great" person? But it is written (Job 9:17), "He bruises me with a tempest and multiplies my wounds without cause." And Rava said: Job blasphemed in a tempest, he blasphemed in a tempest, he answered him in a tempest. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, perhaps a stormy wind passed before You and confused You between Job and the adversary in a tempest. He answered him (Job 38:1), "Then the Lord answered Job."

hebrew_text: איוב מן הסערה ויאמר אליו שוטה שבעולם הרבה נימין בראתי בראשו של אדם ולכל נימא ונימא בראתי לו גומא בפני עצמה שלא יהיו שתים יונקות מגומא אחת שאלמלא שתים יונקות מגומא אחת מכחיש מאור עיניו של אדם גומא בגומא לא נתחלף לי איוב באויב נתחלף לי
human_translation: Job out of the tempest, and said” to him: imbecile in the world! I have created many hairs on a person’s head, and for each and every hair I created distinct follicle, so that two hairs should not draw from one follicle. As, were two to draw from one follicle, weaken a man’s vision. I did not confuse one follicle with another, would I confuse Iyyov with oyev ?
llm_translation: Job from the storm and said to him, "Fool, in the world many hairs I created on the head of a person, and for each hair I created its own follicle separately so that two sucklings should not come from one follicle. For if two sucklings were to come from one follicle, one would deny the light of the eye of a person. Hair by hair did not change for me, Job in enmity changed for me."

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא בגופא הא ברישא
human_translation: not difficult; that in body, this on head.
llm_translation: Not difficult. This one in itself, this one at the beginning.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל שתי שערות שאמרו אפילו אחת על הכף ואחת על הביצים
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: two hairs that said even if one on the spoon- and one on the testicles.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Two hairs that they said, even one on the palm and one on the testicles.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי שתי שערות שאמרו אפילו אחת בגבה ואחת בכריסה אחת ע"ג קשרי אצבעותיה של יד ואחת ע"ג קשרי אצבעותיה של רגל דברי ר' שמעון בן יהודה איש כפר עכו שאמר משום רבי שמעון ורבנן אמר רב חסדא עד שיהו ב' שערות במקום אחד
human_translation: that is also taught two hairs that said even one on back, and one on her lower abdomen. one on the finger joints of her hand and one on the toe joints of her foot. the statement of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, of the village of Akko, who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon. And the Rabbis Rav Ḥisda says: unless two hairs are in one place.
llm_translation: It was also taught: Two hairs, as they said, even one on the back and one on the bald spot, one on the joints of the fingers of the hand and one on the joints of the toes of the foot. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, a man of Kefar Akko, who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon, and the Rabbis say: Rav Chisda said, until there are two hairs in one place.

hebrew_text: ת"ר עד מתי הבת ממאנת עד שתביא שתי שערות דברי רבי מאיר ר' יהודה אומר עד שירבה השחור רבי יוסי אומר עד שתקיף העטרה בן שלקות אומר עד שתכלכל
human_translation: the Sages taught Until when can a young girl perform refusal? Until she grows two hairs; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: until black is greater Rabbi Yosei says: Until the nipple is surrounded Ben Shelakot says: Until filled with hair.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Until when does the daughter refuse? Until she grows two hairs. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until her pubic hair increases. Rabbi Yosei says: Until the crown becomes firm. Ben Shelakut says: Until she matures.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי שמעון מצאני חנינא בן חכינאי בצידן ואמר כשאתה מגיע אצל ר"ע אמור לו עד מתי הבת ממאנת אם יאמר לך עד שתביא שתי שערות אמור לו והלא בן שלקות העיד במעמד כולכם ביבנה עד שתכלכל ולא אמרתם לו דבר
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon said: Ḥanina ben Ḥakhinai found me in Tzaidan and said When you reach Rabbi Akiva, say to him: Until when can a young girl perform refusal? If he says to you until she grows two hairs, say to him: But didn’t ben Shelakot testify in the presence of all of you in Yavne until is filled with hair [ shetekhalkel ], and you did not say anything to him,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon said: Chanina ben Chakinai found me in Sidon, and he said, "When you arrive at Rabbi Akiva's place, say to him, 'Until when does the daughter refuse?' If he says to you, 'Until you bring two hairs,' say to him, 'But didn't the son of Shalukot testify in the presence of all of you in Yavneh, 'Until you provide sustenance,' and you did not say anything to him."

hebrew_text: כשבאתי אצל רבי עקיבא אמר לי כלכול זה איני יודע מהו בן שלקות איני מכיר עד מתי הבת ממאנת עד שתביא ב' שערות
human_translation: When I reached Rabbi Akiva, he said to me: I do not know what this filling with hair [ kilkul ] is, I don’t know ben Shelakot, until when can a young girl perform refusal, until she grows two hairs.
llm_translation: When I came to Rabbi Akiva, he said to me, "I do not know what 'Ben Shelakut' is, I am not familiar with it. Until when does a daughter refuse to marry until she brings two hairs."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שתי שערות האמורות בפרה ובנגעים והאמורות בכל מקום כדי לכוף ראשן לעיקרן דברי רבי ישמעאל ר"א אומר כדי לקרוץ בציפורן ר' עקיבא אומר כדי שיהו ניטלות בזוג
human_translation: two hairs that are mentioned with regard to heifer; and with regard to leprous marks, and that are mentioned in every place, enough to bend the top to their roots. the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Eliezer says: enough to cut with a fingernail. Rabbi Akiva says: enough to be cut with a pair [ bezug ]
llm_translation: Mishnah: Two hairs that are mentioned in the cow and in the afflictions, and that are mentioned anywhere, in order to establish their root. These are the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Eliezer says: in order to pluck with their root. Rabbi Akiva says: in order that they be removed in pairs.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב חסדא אמר מר עוקבא הלכה כדברי כולן להחמיר
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says Mar Ukva says halakha in accordance with the statements of all of them to be stringent.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Ḥisda said, Mar Ukva said: The halakha follows the words of all to be stringent.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרואה כתם הרי זו מקולקלת
human_translation: who sees stain that is distorted.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who sees a blemish, behold, she is disqualified.

hebrew_text: א"ל מכלל דכתמים צריכין הפסקת טהרה א"ל אין והא זימנין סגיאין בעא מינך ולא אמרת ולא מידי דלמא אגב שיטפך אתיא לך א"ל אין אגב שיטפאי אתיא לי
human_translation: said to by inference, that stains require transition purity? said to Yes, But many occasions I asked you and you did not say anything to me. Perhaps in the course came to you? said to him: Yes, in the course came to me.
llm_translation: He said to him: From the inference that inkwells require a separation of purity. He said to him: No. But sometimes they are large. He asked of you, and you did not say anything. Perhaps due to the washing, it comes to you. He said to him: No, due to my washing it comes to me.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרואה יום י"א בין השמשות תחלת נדה וסוף נדה תחלת זיבה וסוף זיבה
human_translation: who sees twilight eleventh day the beginning of menstruation and the end of menstruation. the beginning of the flow of ziva and the end of the flow of ziva .
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who sees the eleventh day between the sunsets, it marks the beginning of menstruation and the end of menstruation, the beginning of abnormal uterine bleeding and the end of abnormal uterine bleeding.

hebrew_text: יום ארבעים לזכר ויום שמונים לנקבה בין השמשות לכולן הרי אלו טועות

llm_translation: Day forty for male and day eighty for female between sunsets for all of them these are mistaken.

human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: Instead of remedy of the misguided, come and remedy the competent
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: Until you fix the fools, come and fix the wise.

llm_translation: Gemara: The beginning of Niddah and the end of Niddah, the beginning of Niddah and the end of Zavah, it is.

llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: This is what he is saying - one who sees the eleventh day between the sunsets, it is the beginning of menstruation and the end of zivah.

llm_translation: As it was taught: one day impure and one day pure, serving the eighth day and its night.

llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Since the eleventh day of the month does not require the observance of the tenth day, nevertheless, the tenth day requires observance."

hebrew_text: שלשה ימים טמאין ושלשה ימים טהורין משמשת שני ימים ושוב אינה משמשת לעולם

hebrew_text: אמר רב אדא בר יצחק זאת אומרת ימי נדתה שאין רואה בהן עולין לספירת זיבתה דאיבעיא להו

llm_translation: The days of childbirth that she does not see in them, what is the ruling if they coincide with her menstrual counting.

llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: Come and hear: She saw two and miscarried on the third, and she does not know what she miscarried.

hebrew_text: הרי זו ספק זיבה ספק לידה
human_translation: it is uncertain she ziva or birth.
llm_translation: Behold, this is a doubt of zivah, a doubt of childbirth.

hebrew_text: מביאה קרבן ואינו נאכל וימי לידתה שאין רואה בהן עולין לה לספירת זיבתה

llm_translation: Bringing an offering and it is not eaten, and the days of her childbirth that she does not see in them, she brings for her counting of her menstrual impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא שאני התם כיון דאיכא למימר יולדת זכר היא וכל הני שבעה יתירי דקיהבינן לה סלקי לה לספירת זיבתה
human_translation: Rav Pappa says is different there, since it can be said she is a woman who gave birth to a male, and all of these additional seven that we give her are reckoned in the counting of her ziva .
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is different there, since there is to say, "She gives birth to a male," and all those additional seven that we require for her, go out for her for the counting of her menstrual impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע לרב פפא ביולדת זכר איכא לספוקי ביולדת נקבה ליכא לספוקי אלא לאו שמע מינה עולין שמע מינה
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: there uncertainty that a woman who gave birth to a male, there no uncertainty that a woman who gave birth to a female? Rather, isn’t it conclude from are reckoned conclude from
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Papa: "In the case of a birth of a male, there is room for doubt; in the case of a birth of a female, there is no room for doubt. Rather, conclude from this: 'Olim' - conclude from this."

hebrew_text: תשעה ימים טמאין ותשעה ימים טהורין משמשת שמונה ימים מתוך שמונה עשר
