llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba: If one is sitting on the edge of a vessel and is spitting inside the vessel, and blood is found inside the vessel, if it is possible that after the spitting the water came onto the edge of the vessel, it is necessary to investigate.

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל ואמרי לה אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל הלכה כר' יוסי וכן אורי ליה רבי אבא לקלא הלכה כרבי יוסי

Rabbi Yosei says: whether in this case or in that case, she is considered hanging. Rabbi Shimon says: whether in this case or in that case, she is not considered hanging.

human_translation: lent her garment to a gentile woman or to a menstruating woman, attributes to
llm_translation: Mishnah: If one lends a garment to a gentile woman or to a menstruating woman, she may wear it.

hebrew_text: ישבו על ספסל של אבן או על האיצטבא של מרחץ רבי נחמיה מטהר שהיה רבי נחמיה אומר כל דבר שאינו מקבל טומאה אינו מקבל כתמים
human_translation: they sat on a stone bench or on the bench [ ha’itzteva ] of a bathhouse, Rabbi Neḥemya deems ritually pure, as Rabbi Neḥemya would say: Any item that is not susceptible to ritual impurity is not susceptible to stains.
llm_translation: They sat on a stone bench or on the marble bench of the bathhouse. Rabbi Nechemiah declares them pure, for Rabbi Nechemiah says: Anything that does not accept impurity does not accept stains.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב בנכרית
human_translation: Rav says: with regard to a gentile woman
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav said in Aramaic

hebrew_text: הרואה
human_translation: who is seeing
llm_translation: The one who sees

hebrew_text: ממאי דומיא דנדה מה נדה דקחזיא אף נכרית דקא חזיא
human_translation: From where similar to a menstruating woman: Just as a menstruating woman who sees, so too, gentile woman who sees
llm_translation: From what is it similar to the case of a menstruant woman? Just as a menstruant woman is seen, so too a non-Jewish woman is seen.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת כי ניים ושכיב רב אמרה להא שמעתא דתניא תולה בנכרית רבי מאיר אומר בנכרית הראויה לראות ואפילו ר"מ לא קאמר אלא בראויה לראות אבל רואה לא איצטריך
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: I say when Rav was dozing or sleeping he said that halakha , As it is taught she attributes to the gentile woman. Rabbi Meir says: to a gentile woman who is fit to see And even Rabbi Meir says only that fit to see but it is not necessary seeing
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: When one is dozing off and lying down, Rav said: The teaching was heard that Rabbi Meir holds: One may hang a bed from a non-Jewish woman. Rabbi Meir says: From a non-Jewish woman who is fit to be seen. And even Rabbi Meir only said this regarding one who is fit to be seen, but if one is already seeing her, it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ותסברא ר"מ לחומרא רבי מאיר לקולא
human_translation: Rava said And you understand Rabbi Meir to be stringent? Rabbi Meir to be lenient.
llm_translation: Rava said, and it is logical, Rabbi Meir ruled stringently, while Rabbi Yehuda ruled leniently.

hebrew_text: דתניא אינה תולה בנכרית רבי מאיר אומר תולה ואלא קשיא הך תריץ הכי והיא שרואה ר' מאיר אומר בראויה לראות ואף ע"פ שאינה רואה
human_translation: As it is taught may not attribute to gentile woman. Rabbi Meir says she may attribute But if so, difficult. answer like this: she sees, Rabbi Meir says that she is fit to see and even though she has not seen
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: "She does not hang by a non-Jewish woman." Rabbi Meir says: "She hangs." But rather, this is difficult: this opinion and she sees. Rabbi Meir says: "When it is fitting to see, even though she does not see."

hebrew_text: ת"ר תולה בשומרת יום כנגד יום בשני שלה
human_translation: The Sages taught may attribute to a woman who observes day for day on her second
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One hangs the Shomera on the day corresponding to the day of her second period.

hebrew_text: ובסופרת שבעה שלא טבלה לפיכך היא מתוקנת וחברתה מקולקלת דברי רשב"ג רבי אומר אינה תולה לפיכך שתיהן מקולקלות
human_translation: And to a woman counting seven who did not immerse Therefore, is fixed, and the other is ruined the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rabbi says: She may not attribute Therefore, both are ruined,
llm_translation: In the sopheret, seven, that did not immerse, therefore it is valid, and its companion is invalid. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel. Rabbi says: It does not depend on immersion, therefore both are invalid.

hebrew_text: ושוין שתולה בשומרת יום כנגד יום בראשון שלה
human_translation: And agree that may attribute to a woman observes a day for a day on her first
llm_translation: And equal is one who plants in a Shomeres Yom, corresponding to her first day.

hebrew_text: וביושבת על דם טוהר ובבתולה שדמיה טהורין
human_translation: And in who is observing of blood of purity. And to a virgin as her blood is pure,
llm_translation: And in a case where she is sitting on blood, purity, and in the case of a virgin whose blood is pure.

hebrew_text: לפיכך דרשב"ג למה לי משום דרבי
human_translation: Why do I Therefore, by Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? because by Rabbi
llm_translation: Therefore, Rabban Gamliel inquired: Why do I need it because of Rabbi?

hebrew_text: לפיכך דרבי למה לי מהו דתימא ההיא דאשתכח כתם גבה תתקלקל אידך לא תתקלקל קמשמע לן
human_translation: why do I Therefore, of Rabbi lest you say who has stain found with her ruined, the other not be ruined, teaches us
llm_translation: Therefore, why does Rabbi need it? What is it that you might say, that if she finds a stain, her stature will be impaired, and if not, her stature will not be impaired? It comes to teach us.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא טמא וטהור שהלכו בשני שבילין אחד טהור ואחד טמא באנו למחלוקת רבי ורשב"ג
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: ritually impure and pure, who walked on two paths, one pure and one impure we have arrived at the dispute Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: "Impure and pure who walked on two paths, one pure and one impure, we came to the dispute of Rabbi and Resh Lakish."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אדא עד כאן לא קאמר רבי התם אלא דתרוייהו כי הדדי נינהו הכא מאי נפקא לן מינה
human_translation: Rav Adda objects to this Rabbi states only there, therefore both are like each other, here, what difference
llm_translation: Rav Adda objects to her: Until here, Rabbi did not say that, rather, both of them are like each other. What is the practical difference for us here?

hebrew_text: ורב חסדא סוף סוף איהי טבילה בעיא
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda ultimately she requires immersion
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda ultimately said: "Immersion is required."

hebrew_text: איתמר א"ר יוסי בר' חנינא טמא וטהור ואפילו טהור ותלוי שהלכו בשני שבילין אחד טמא ואחד טהור תולה טמא בתלוי וטהור בטהור לדברי הכל
human_translation: It was stated Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: ritually impure and pure, or even pure and uncertainty, who walked on two paths, one impure and one pure, attribute the impure by uncertainty, and pure by ritually pure. everyone agrees
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yosei, son of Hanina, said: Impure and pure, and even if pure and dependent, that they went on two paths, one impure and one pure, one hangs impure on the dependent and pure on the pure, according to everyone.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה ר' יוחנן מרבי יהודה בר ליואי מהו לתלות כתם בכתם אליבא דרבי לא תבעי לך
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yehuda bar Livai: What is with regard to attributing stain to stain? I am not raising dilemma to you according to of Rabbi
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Yochanan from Rabbi Yehuda bar Lavi: What is the ruling regarding hanging a warp thread on a warp thread according to Rabbi? You do not need to ask.

hebrew_text: השתא ומה התם דקא חזיא מגופה אמרת אינה תולה הכא דמעלמא קא אתי לא כל שכן
human_translation: Now, and if there, where she sees from her body, you said may not attribute here, where came from external not all the more so
llm_translation: Now, what is the difference between there, where it is seen from its own body, you said it is not hanging, and here, where it comes from the world, certainly not.

hebrew_text: כי תבעי לך אליבא דרשב"ג התם הוא דקא חזיא מגופה תליא הכא דמעלמא קאתי לא תליא או דלמא לא שנא
human_translation: when I raise dilemma to you, in accordance with of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. it is there, where she sees from her body, may attribute here, where came from external not attribute Or perhaps it is no different,
llm_translation: When you want to ask according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel, there it is dependent on itself, but here, where it comes from the hidden, it may not be dependent. Or perhaps it is not different.

hebrew_text: א"ל אין תולין מה טעם לפי שאין תולין
human_translation: said to may not attribute What is the reason because may not attribute
llm_translation: He said to him: "We do not hang. What is the reason? Because we do not hang."

hebrew_text: איתיביה אין תולין כתם בכתם השאילה חלוקה לנכרית או ליושבת על הכתם הרי זו תולה בה
human_translation: raised an objection to may not attribute stain to stain. she loaned her garment to a gentile woman or to observing due to stain, she may attribute
llm_translation: He raised an objection: One may not hang wool on wool. If one lent a garment to a non-Jewish woman or to a Jewish woman who is sitting on the wool, she may hang it on it.

hebrew_text: הא גופה קשיא רישא אמרת אין תולין סיפא אמרת תולין הא לא קשיא הא רבי והא רשב"ג
human_translation: This itself difficult. the first clause you said may not attribute the latter clause you said may attribute This not difficult. This Rabbi and that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: This is difficult. In the beginning you said we do not hang the lulav, in the end you said we do hang. This is not difficult: here it refers to Rabbi, and here it refers to Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי הא והא רבי הא בראשון שלה הא בשני שלה
human_translation: There are who say this and that Rabbi this on first on her second
llm_translation: There are those who say this and this: Rabbi this in its first, and this in its second.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר הא והא רשב"ג ולא קשיא
human_translation: Rav Ashi said this and that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and it not difficult.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "This and this is according to Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel, and it is not difficult."

hebrew_text: כאן למפרע כאן להבא
human_translation: Here, retroactively There, with regard to the future.
llm_translation: Here for retribution, here for the future.

hebrew_text: מכל מקום קשיא אמר רבינא לא קשיא הכי קאמר השאילה חלוקה לנכרית בעלת כתם הרי זו תולה בה
human_translation: in any case a difficulty Ravina said: not difficult, this is saying she loaned her garment to a gentile woman, who had seen stain, may attribute to
llm_translation: Nevertheless, difficult. Said Ravina: Not difficult. This is what he is saying: If one lends a garment to a non-Jewish woman who is a Baalat K'tem, she may wear it.

hebrew_text: והא או ליושבת על הכתם קתני הכי קאמר או ליושבת על דם טוהר בעלת כתם תולה בה
human_translation: But teaches: Or to observing due to stain, this is saying: or to who is observing of blood of purity, a woman who saw stain, she may attribute
llm_translation: And this, or for a woman sitting on the stain, it teaches thus: "Or for a woman sitting on menstrual blood, a woman with a stain is dependent upon it."

hebrew_text: שלש שלבשו כו' שהיה ר' נחמיה כו' אמר רב מתנה מ"ט דר' נחמיה דכתיב (ישעיהו ג, כו) ונקתה לארץ תשב כיון שישבה לארץ נקתה
human_translation: three who wore as Rabbi Neḥemya would Rav Mattana says: What is the reason of Rabbi Neḥemya? As it is written: and clean she shall sit upon the ground” once she sits on the ground, she shall be clean,
llm_translation: Three who wore etc. that Rabbi Nechemiah etc. said Rav Mattana what is the reason of Rabbi Nechemiah as it is written (Isaiah 3:26) "And she shall sit desolate upon the ground." Once she sat upon the ground, she became desolate.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא אמר רבי חנינא מטהר היה רבי נחמיה אפילו באחורי כלי חרס פשיטא
human_translation: Rav Huna says Rabbi Ḥanina says: Rabbi Neḥemya would deem her ritually pure even on the exterior earthenware vessel. obvious?
llm_translation: Said Rav Huna, said Rabbi Chanina: Rabbi Nechemia would purify, even behind a clay vessel - obvious.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא ליגזור גבו אטו תוכו קמ"ל
human_translation: lest you say: Let decree the exterior due to the interior, teaches us
llm_translation: What is it that you might say, to decree upon its back but not its inside? This teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מטהר היה ר' נחמיה במטלניות שאין בהן שלש על שלש דלא חזיין לא לעניים ולא לעשירים
human_translation: Abaye says: Rabbi Neḥemya would deem her ritually pure on small rags that do not have three by three as are suitable neither for the poor nor for the wealthy.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Rabbi Nechemiah was lenient in matters of matleniot that do not have a three by three measurement, as they are not visible neither to the poor nor to the rich.

hebrew_text: דרש רב חייא בר רב מתנה משמיה דרב הלכה כר' נחמיה אמר ליה רב נחמן אבא תני מעשה בא לפני חכמים וטמאום ואת אמרת הלכה כרבי נחמיה
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Rav Mattana taught in the name of Rav: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya. Rav Naḥman said Father teaches An incident came before the Sages, and deemed ritually impure, And you say halakha in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya?
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Rav Matna expounded in the name of Rav: The halacha follows Rabbi Nechemia. Rav Nachman said to him: "My father, teach the incident that came before the sages, and they ruled it impure, yet you say the halacha follows Rabbi Nechemia."

hebrew_text: מאי היא דתניא שתי נשים שהיו טוחנות ברחיים של יד ונמצא דם תחת הפנימית שתיהן טמאות תחת החיצונה החיצונה טמאה והפנימית טהורה בינתים שתיהן טמאות
human_translation: What is As it is taught two women who were grinding with a hand mill and blood was found beneath the inside, they are both ritually impure. beneath the outside, the outside is impure and the inside is pure. between them, they are both impure.
llm_translation: What is it that is taught: Two women who were grinding with hand mills and blood was found beneath the inner one, both of them are impure. Beneath the outer one, the outer one is impure and the inner one is pure. In between, both of them are impure.

hebrew_text: היה מעשה ונמצא דם על שפתה של אמבטי ועל עלה של זית בשעה שמסיקות את התנור ובא מעשה לפני חכמים וטמאום
human_translation: There was an incident and blood was found on the edge of a bathtub, and on an olive leaf at the time that were kindling the oven. And the incident came before the Sages and deemed ritually impure.
llm_translation: There was an incident, and blood was found on the lip of the bathhouse and on the leaf of an olive tree at the time when they were sealing the oven, and the incident came before the sages, and they deemed them impure.

hebrew_text: תנאי היא דתניא ר' יעקב מטמא ורבי נחמיה מטהר והורו חכמים כרבי נחמיה
human_translation: It is tanna’im As it is taught Rabbi Ya’akov deems her impure, but Rabbi Neḥemya deems her pure. And the Sages ruled in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya.
llm_translation: It is a dispute as it was taught: Rabbi Yaakov declares impure, and Rabbi Nechemiah declares pure, and the sages ruled in accordance with Rabbi Nechemiah.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שלש נשים שהיו ישנות במטה אחת ונמצא דם תחת אחת מהן כולן טמאות בדקה אחת מהן ונמצאת טמאה היא טמאה ושתיהן טהורות ותולות זו בזו ואם לא היו ראוין לראות רואין אותן כאילו הן ראויות
human_translation: three women who were sleeping in one bed and blood was discovered beneath one of them, all of them are ritually impure. one of them examined and discovered that she was impure she is impure and the two are pure. And they attribute to each other, And if were not fit to see one considers them as though they were fit,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Three women who were sleeping in one bed, and blood was found beneath one of them, all of them are impure. If one of them is found impure, she is impure, and both of them are pure and dependent on each other. And if they were not fit to see, they are seen as if they were fit.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יהודה אמר רב והוא שבדקה עצמה בשיעור וסת
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: when she examined herself within period of time menstruation.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and this is when she examined herself with a measurement and found.

hebrew_text: סבר לה כבר פדא דאמר כל שבעלה בחטאת טהרותיה טמאות
human_translation: holds in accordance with bar Padda, who said: any whose husband to a sin offering pure items are ritually impure.
llm_translation: He thought to her already redeemed, as he said, "All that her husband is with the sin offering, her purities are impure."

hebrew_text: בעלה באשם תלוי טהרותיה תלויות בעלה פטור טהרותיה טהורות
human_translation: whose husband to a provisional guilt offering pure items suspended, whose husband exempt pure items pure.
llm_translation: Her husband is liable, her purities are suspended, his purities are suspended, her husband is exempt, her purities are pure.

hebrew_text: ורבי אושעיא אמר אפילו בעלה בחטאת טהרותיה תלויות
human_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya says: Even her husband to a sin offering, pure items suspended,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya said, "Even if her husband is involved in the sin offering, her purity is dependent on it."

hebrew_text: בשלמא התם אימר שמש עכביה לדם [אבל] הכא אם איתא דהוי דם מאן עכביה
human_translation: Granted, there, say organ prevented the blood But here, if it is so that there was blood what prevented
llm_translation: In truth, there it is said: "The sun shall be turned into darkness" but here, if it is so, who causes the darkness?

hebrew_text: א"ר ירמיה משל דר' אושעיא למה הדבר דומה לילד וזקן שהיו מהלכין בדרך כל זמן שהיו בדרך ילד שוהא לבא נכנסו לעיר ילד ממהר לבא ואמר אביי משל דר' אושעיא למה הדבר דומה לאדם שנותן אצבע בעין כל זמן שאצבע בעין דמעה שוהא לבא נטל האצבע דמעה ממהרת לבא
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says a parable of Rabbi Oshaya: To what is this matter comparable? To a child and an old man who are walking along the road. As long as they are on the road, child delays his arrival, they enter the city, child hastens his arrival, And Abaye says a parable of Rabbi Oshaya: To what is this matter comparable? To a man who puts finger in eye. As long as finger is in eye, tears delay their arrival he removed his finger tears hasten their arrival.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: A parable of Rabbi Oshaya. What is the matter similar to? To a child and an elder who were walking on the road. The entire time they were on the road, the child was equal to the elder. They entered a city, the child hurried to enter. Abaye said: A parable of Rabbi Oshaya. What is the matter similar to? To a person who puts a finger in the eye. The entire time the finger is in the eye, tears are equal to the elder. He removed the finger, the tears quickly entered.

hebrew_text: ותולות זו בזו ת"ר כיצד תולות זו בזו עוברה ושאינה עוברה תולה עוברה בשאינה עוברה
human_translation: And they attribute to each other, the Sages taught How do they attribute one another? pregnant and is not pregnant, pregnant may attribute to the who is not pregnant.
llm_translation: "And bundles with each other. The Sages taught: How are bundles with each other? If it is pregnant and if it is not pregnant, it suspends the pregnant one with the one that is not pregnant."

hebrew_text: מניקה ושאינה מניקה תולה מניקה בשאינה מניקה זקנה ושאינה זקנה תולה זקנה בשאינה זקנה בתולה ושאינה בתולה תולה בתולה בשאינה בתולה
human_translation: nursing is not nursing, the nursing may attribute to the who is not nursing. old and is not old, old may attribute to who is not old. a virgin, and is not a virgin, virgin may attribute to who is not a virgin.
llm_translation: Nursing and one who is not nursing, hanging nursing in one who is not nursing, elderly and one who is not elderly, hanging elderly in one who is not elderly, virgin and one who is not a virgin, hanging virgin in one who is not a virgin.

hebrew_text: היו שתיהן עוברות שתיהן מניקות שתיהן זקנות שתיהן בתולות זו היא ששנינו לא היו ראויות לראות רואין
human_translation: If both are pregnant, both are nursing, both are old, both are virgins, this as we learned were not fit to see one considers
llm_translation: They both pregnant, they both nursing, they both old, they both virgins, this is what we taught: they were not fitting to see, they see.

hebrew_text: כאילו הן ראויות
human_translation: as though they were fit,
llm_translation: As if they are fitting

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שלש נשים שהיו ישנות במטה אחת ונמצא דם תחת האמצעית כולן טמאות תחת הפנימית שתים הפנימיות טמאות והחיצונה טהורה תחת החיצונה שתים החיצונות טמאות והפנימית טהורה
human_translation: three women who were sleeping in one bed and blood was discovered beneath the middle all of them are ritually impure. beneath the inside, the two innermost are ritually impure and the outside is ritually pure. beneath the outside, the two outermost are ritually impure and the inside is ritually pure.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Three women who were sleeping in one bed, and blood was found beneath the middle one, all of them are impure. Beneath the inner one, the two inner ones are impure and the outer one is pure. Beneath the outer one, the two outer ones are impure and the inner one is pure.

hebrew_text: אימתי בזמן שעברו דרך מרגלות המטה אבל אם עברו דרך עליה כולן טמאות בדקה אחת מהן ונמצאת טהורה היא טהורה ושתים טמאות בדקו שתים ומצאו טהורות הן טהורות ושלישית טמאה שלשתן ומצאו טהורות כולן טמאות
human_translation: When when they passed via the foot of the bed; but if they passed via over all of them are ritually impure. one of them examined and she was found ritually pure, she is pure and two are impure. two of them examined and found ritually pure, they are pure and third is impure. three of them examined and found ritually pure, all of them are ritually impure,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When did they become impure? When they passed over the width of the bed, but if they passed over the length, all of them are impure. If one of them checked and found herself pure, she is pure. If two of them checked and found themselves pure, they are pure. If the third checked and found herself impure, all of them are impure.

hebrew_text: למה הדבר דומה לגל טמא שנתערב בין שני גלים טהורים ובדקו אחת מהן ומצאו טהור הוא טהור ושנים טמאים שנים ומצאו טהורין הם טהורין ושלישי טמא
human_translation: To what is matter comparable? to a ritually impure pile where was intermingled with two ritually pure piles, and they examined one of them and found it pure. That is pure and two are impure. two and found ritually pure, they are ritually pure and third is impure.
llm_translation: The matter is comparable to a contaminated mound that became mixed between two pure mounds, and they examined one of them and found it to be pure, it is pure, and two are impure, they are impure, and the third is impure.

hebrew_text: שלשתן ומצאו טהורין כולן טמאים דברי ר"מ שר"מ אומר כל דבר שהוא בחזקת טומאה לעולם הוא בטומאתו עד שיודע לך טומאה היכן היא
human_translation: three of them and found ritually pure, all of them are impure; the statement of Rabbi Meir, as Rabbi Meir would say: any item that has presumptive status of ritual impurity, it forever in its ritual impurity, until it becomes known to you where ritual impurity is.
llm_translation: The three and found them pure, all of them are impure. These are the words of Rabbi Meir; Rabbi Meir says: Anything that is in a state of impurity is always in its impurity until it is known to you where the impurity is.

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים בודק עד שמגיע לסלע או לבתולה
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: searching until he reaches bedrock or virgin soil,
llm_translation: And the sages say: One examines until reaching the rock or the virgin.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי שנא רישא דלא מפליג ומאי שנא סיפא דקמפליג אמר רבי אמי במשולבות
human_translation: What is different in the first clause, which did not distinguish and what is different in the latter clause, which does distinguish Rabbi Ami said where intertwined,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is different about the first part that it does not argue, and what is different about the latter part that it does argue? Rabbi Ami said: In mixed matters.

hebrew_text: בדקה אחת [וכו'] למה ליה למתני למה זה דומה
human_translation: one of them examined Why does to teach: To what is matter comparable?
llm_translation: One chamber etc. Why did the Mishnah teach "what is this similar to"

hebrew_text: הכי קאמר להו ר' מאיר לרבנן מ"ש בדם דלא פליגיתו ומ"ש בגל דפליגיתו
human_translation: this Rabbi Meir is saying to the Rabbis: What is different with regard to blood, where you do not disagree and what is different with regard to the pile where you disagree
llm_translation: So said Rabbi Meir to the Rabbis: "What is the difference between blood, in which you did not disagree, and a clot, in which you did disagree?"

hebrew_text: ורבנן בשלמא התם אימא עורב נטלה אלא הכא האי דם מהיכא אתא
human_translation: And the Rabbis Granted, there, say a raven took But here, from where did this blood come?
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, granted there it is understandable to say "a raven took it," but here, from where did this blood come?

hebrew_text: תניא אמר ר"מ מעשה בשקמה של כפר סבא שהיו מחזיקין בה טומאה ובדקו ולא מצאו לימים נשבה בו הרוח ועקרתו ונמצא גולגולת של מת תחובה לו בעיקרו אמרו לו משם ראיה אימר לא בדקו כל צרכו
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir said an incident involving a sycamore in Kefar Sava, with regard to which they had a presumption of ritual impurity, And they examined and did not find Some days the wind blew at it and uprooted and they found a skull from a corpse stuck in its roots. said to a proof from there? say they did not examine as much as was necessary.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir said, there was an incident in the fig tree of the village of Seba, which was suspected of being impure. They examined it and did not find anything. After some days, a spirit entered it, uprooted it, and they found a skull of a corpse buried in its roots. They said to him Rabbi Meir from there is proof. He said to them: No, they did not examine it thoroughly.

hebrew_text: תניא א"ר יוסי מעשה במערה של שיחין שהיו מחזיקין בה טומאה ובדקו עד שהגיעו לקרקע שהיתה חלקה כצפורן ולא מצאו לימים נכנסו בה פועלים מפני הגשמים ונתזו בקרדומותיהן ומצאו מכתשת מלאה עצמות אמרו לו משם ראיה אימר לא בדקו כל צרכו
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei said an incident involving a cave in Shiḥin with regard to which they had a presumption of ritual impurity And they examined until they reached ground that was as smooth as a fingernail, and they did not find Some days workers entered because the rain. And they dug with their shovels and found a mortar full of bones. said to a proof from there? say they did not examine as much as was necessary.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei related a story about the Cave of Shiḥin, where they were holding onto impurity. They searched until they reached the ground, which was as hard as a rock, and they did not find anything. After some days, workers entered it because of the rains, and they dug in its crevices and found a full mortar full of bones. They said to him: "From here is proof." He said to them: "They did not thoroughly examine all its needs."

hebrew_text: תניא אבא שאול אומר מעשה בסלע בית חורון שהיו מחזיקין בה טומאה ולא יכלו חכמים לבדוק מפני שהיתה מרובה והיה שם זקן אחד ורבי יהושע בן חנניא שמו אמר להן הביאו לי סדינים הביאו לו סדינים ושראן במים ופרסן עליהם מקום טהרה יבש מקום טומאה לח ובדקו ומצאו בור גדול מלא עצמות
human_translation: It is taught Abba Shaul says an incident involving bedrock in Beit Ḥoron, with regard to which they had a presumption of ritual impurity And the Sages were unable to examine because was too large. And there was one old man there, and his name was Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya. He said to them: Bring me sheets. They brought him sheets and he soaked them in water and spread them over place of ritual purity dry, place of ritual impurity moist. And they examined and found a large pit filled with bones.
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Saul says, there was an incident in Sela of Beit Horon where they suspected it of being impure, and the sages could not examine it because it was vast. There was an elder there, and his name was Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah. He said to them, "Bring me sheets." They brought him sheets, and he soaked them in water, spread them out, a dry place indicating purity, a damp place indicating impurity. They examined it and found a large pit full of bones.

hebrew_text: תנא הוא הבור שמילא ישמעאל בן נתניה חללים דכתיב (ירמיהו מא, ט) והבור אשר השליך שם ישמעאל את כל פגרי אנשים אשר הכה ביד גדליה
human_translation: taught: That the pit that Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, filled with corpses, as it is written: “Now the pit where Ishmael cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had slain by the side of Gedaliah
llm_translation: It was taught: The pit that Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled with corpses, as it is written (Jeremiah 41:9), "Now the pit into which Ishmael had thrown all the dead bodies of the men whom he had struck down."

hebrew_text: וכי גדליה הרגן והלא ישמעאל הרגן אלא מתוך שהיה לו לחוש לעצת יוחנן בן קרח ולא חש מעלה עליו הכתוב כאילו הרגן
human_translation: And did Gedaliah kill them? But didn’t Ishmael kill them? Rather, since should have been concerned on the advice of Johanan, son of Kareah, but was not concerned the verse ascribes him as though he killed them.
llm_translation: And when Gedaliah killed them, but wasn't it Ishmael who killed them? Rather, because he should have taken heed of the advice of Yochanan ben Kareah and did not, the Scripture considers it as if he killed them.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא האי לישנא בישא אע"פ דלקבולי לא מבעי מיחש ליה מבעי
human_translation: Rava said: this malicious speech, even though one should not accept one is required to be concerned
llm_translation: Rava said: This matter is dependent on the will of the husband, even though it does not require acceptance, he must pay attention to it.

hebrew_text: הנהו בני גלילא דנפק עלייהו קלא דקטול נפשא אתו לקמיה דרבי טרפון אמרו ליה לטמרינן מר אמר להו היכי נעביד אי לא אטמרינכו חזו יתייכו אטמרינכו הא אמור רבנן האי לישנא בישא אע"ג דלקבולי לא מבעי מיחש ליה מבעי זילו אתון טמרו נפשייכו
human_translation: these people of the Galilee about whom a rumor emerged that they had killed someone. They came before Rabbi Tarfon said to him: Will the Master hide us? said to them: What should we do? If I do not hide you, will see you I do hide you, didn’t the Rabbis say: this malicious speech, even though one should not accept one is required to be concerned you go hide yourselves.
llm_translation: These are the men of Galilee who went up with the voice of a rooster. They came before Rabbi Tarfon. They said to him, "Master, should we be concerned?" He said to them, "What should we do? If you do not concern yourselves, others will come and concern themselves. This is what the sages have said: 'This matter is a matter of concern, even though it is not obligatory to accept it as such. Go and concern yourselves.'"

hebrew_text: (במדבר כא, לד) ויאמר ה' אל משה אל תירא מכדי סיחון ועוג אחי הוו דאמר מר סיחון ועוג בני אחיה בר שמחזאי הוו מאי שנא מעוג דקמסתפי ומאי שנא מסיחון דלא קמסתפי
human_translation: “And the Lord said to Moses: Do not fear Now, Sihon and Og were brothers, as the Master said: Sihon and Og were sons of Ahijah, son of Shamhazai. what different from Og, that afraid and what is different from Sihon, that no afraid
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Numbers 21:34) "And the Lord said to Moses, 'Do not fear them, for I have delivered Sihon and Og into your hand.'" The Master said: Sihon and Og were brothers, sons of Ahiah the son of Shemhazai. What is the difference between Og, who was hidden, and Sihon, who was not hidden?

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן אר"ש בן יוחי מתשובתו של אותו צדיק אתה יודע מה היה בלבו אמר שמא תעמוד לו זכות של אברהם אבינו
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: From the answer to that righteous you know what was in his heart, said Perhaps the merit of our forefather Abraham will stand for
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai said, "From the repentance of that righteous one, you know what was in his heart. He said, 'Perhaps the merit of our forefather Abraham will stand for him.'"

hebrew_text: שנאמר (בראשית יד, יג) ויבא הפליט ויגד לאברם העברי ואמר רבי יוחנן זה עוג שפלט מדור המבול
human_translation: As it is stated: “And there came one that was saved, and told Abram the Hebrew, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said is Og, who was saved from the generation of the flood.
llm_translation: It is stated (Genesis 14:13), "And the fugitive came and told Avram the Hebrew." And Rabbi Yochanan said: This is Og who escaped from the generation of the Flood.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן בגד שאבד בו כתם מעביר עליו שבעה סממנין ומבטלו רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר
human_translation: The Sages taught a garment in which stain was lost, one applies to it, seven substances and nullifies Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says:
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A garment in which a stain was lost, one passes over it seven times and nullifies it. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says:

hebrew_text: בודקו שכונות שכונות
human_translation: He examines it section by section,
llm_translation: Inspecting neighborhoods, neighborhoods.

hebrew_text: אבדה בו שכבת זרע חדש בודקו במחט שחוק בודקו בחמה תנא אין שכונה פחותה משלש אצבעות
human_translation: in which a seminal emission, was lost, new, one examines it by a needle worn out, one examines it by the sun, taught section not less than three fingerbreadths
llm_translation: Lost in it a seminal emission new, examine it with a needle laughter, examine it with the sun. A Tanna taught: The minimum size of a dwelling is less than three fingers.

hebrew_text: ת"ר בגד שאבד בו כלאים הרי זה לא ימכרנו לעובד כוכבים ולא יעשנו מרדעת לחמור אבל עושה ממנו תכריכין למת אמר רב יוסף זאת אומרת מצות בטלות לעתיד לבא
human_translation: The Sages taught a garment in which diverse kinds, was lost, one may not sell it to a gentile and one may not fashion it a saddlecloth for a donkey. But one may fashion it a shroud for a corpse, Rav Yosef said: That is to say mitzvot will be nullified in the future.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A garment in which kilayim has been lost, behold, this one shall not sell it to a non-Jew, and shall not make it into a saddlecloth for a donkey. But one may make shrouds from it for a deceased. Rav Yosef said: This means that the mitzvot will be nullified in the future to come.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי ואי תימא רב דימי והא א"ר מני א"ר ינאי לא שנו אלא לספדו אבל לקוברו אסור א"ל לאו איתמר עלה א"ר יוחנן אפילו לקוברו
human_translation: Abaye said to and some say Rav Dimi But didn’t Rabbi Mani say Rabbi Yannai said: They taught only to eulogize him, but it is prohibited to bury him said to him: Wasn’t it stated with regard to that Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even to bury him
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him, and if you will say it was Rav Dimi, but didn't Rabbi Meni say in the name of Rabbi Yannai: They only taught regarding eulogizing him, but regarding burying him, it is prohibited. He said to him: Was it not stated in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even regarding burying him.

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן לטעמיה דא"ר יוחנן מאי דכתיב (תהלים פח, ו) במתים חפשי כיון שמת אדם נעשה חפשי מן המצות
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan to his reasoning as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What which is written: “Set apart [ ḥofshi ] among the dead, Once a person dies, he becomes free [ ḥofshi ] from the mitzvot.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan according to his reasoning said: What is the meaning of what is written (Psalms 88:6), "Among the dead, free"? Once a person dies, he becomes free from the commandments.

hebrew_text: אמר רפרם בר פפא אמר רב חסדא בגד שאבד בו כלאים צובעו ומותר א"ל רבא לרפרם בר פפא מנא ליה לסבא הא
human_translation: Rafram bar Pappa says Rav Ḥisda says: a garment in which diverse kinds was lost, one may dye it, and it is permitted Rava said to Rafram bar Pappa: From where does the Elder, this
llm_translation: Rafhram son of Papa said, Rav Ḥisda said: A garment in which kilayim were lost, one may dye it and it is permitted. Rava said to Rafhram son of Papa: From where does the elder derive this?

hebrew_text: א"ל מתני' היא דתנן בודק עד שמגיע לסלע ואי ליכא אימר עורב נטלה הכי נמי עמרא וכיתנא בהדדי לא סליק להו צבעא וכיון דלא ידיע אימר מנתר נתר
human_translation: said to him: It is the mishna, as we learned: searching until he reaches bedrock. And if is not say a raven took it. So too wool and flax, do not absorb in the same And since he does not know say that has fallen out,
llm_translation: He said to him: It is as we learned in a Mishnah: One examines the wall until reaching the rock. And if there is none, one says, "A raven took it." So too, if there is no rock, one says, "An owl took it." And when they did not agree with each other, the dye did not come up for them. And since it is not known, one says, "It is untied."

hebrew_text: אמר רב אחא בריה דרב ייבא משמיה דמר זוטרא האי מאן דרמי חוטא דכיתנא בגלימיה דעמרא ונתקיה ולא ידע אי נתיק אי לא נתיק שפיר דמי
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yeiva, said in the name of Mar Zutra: one who put a thread of flax in a cloak of wool and it fell out, but he does not know whether it fell out or did not fall out, permitted
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rav Yeiva, said in the name of Mar Zutra: One who tears a thread from his garment in anger and does not know whether it tore completely or not, it is considered as if it did tear.

hebrew_text: מ"ט מדאורייתא שעטנז כתיב עד שיהיה שוע טווי ונוז ורבנן הוא דגזרו ביה וכיון דלא ידע אי נתקיה שרי
human_translation: What is the reason By Torah law, is written: “Diverse kinds [ sha’atnez ]” unless is smooth [ shua ], spun [ tavui ] and woven [ nuz ]. And it is the Sages who decreed And since he does not know if it fell out permitted,
llm_translation: Reasoning from the Torah: "Shatnez" is written, until it is twisted warp and woof. And the Rabbis, it is they who decreed upon it. And once it is not known if it was removed, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אשי אימר או שוע או טווי או נוז והלכתא כמר זוטרא מדאפקינהו רחמנא בחדא לישנא
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this say either combed, or spun, or woven. And the halakha in accordance with Mar Zutra, from that the Merciful One expresses in one word,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi objects: Say "O Shua" or "Tavvi" or "Nuz," and the halakha is like Mar Zutra, as the Merciful One has established it in one place.

hebrew_text: ת"ר בגד צבוע מטמא משום כתם רבי נתן בר יוסף אומר אינו מטמא משום כתם שלא תקנו בגדי צבעונין לאשה אלא להקל על כתמיהן
human_translation: The Sages taught A colored garment renders impure due to stains Rabbi Natan bar Yosef says: she is not impure due to stain, as enacted women colored garments, only to be lenient with regard to their stains,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A dyed garment imparts ritual impurity due to a stain. Rabbi Natan bar Yosef says: It does not impart impurity due to a stain, as colored garments were not instituted for women except to lighten their stains.

hebrew_text: תקנו מאי תקנינהו אלא שלא הותרו בגדי צבעונין לאשה אלא להקל על כתמיהן הותרו מכלל דאסירי
human_translation: enacted? What was their enactment? Rather, that permitted colored garments to women only to be lenient with regard to her stains. permitted by inference they were prohibited.
llm_translation: They enacted, what did they enact? Rather, that colored garments were not permitted for a woman except to lighten their stains, they were permitted, from the general rule of prohibition.

hebrew_text: אין דתנן בפולמוס של אספסינוס גזרו על עטרות חתנים ועל האירוס בקשו לגזור על בגדי צבעונין אמרי הא עדיפא כדי להקל על כתמיהן
human_translation: Yes, as we learned In the war [ bapulmus ] of Vespasian they decreed upon the crowns of bridegrooms, and upon the drum [ ha’irus ], They sought to decree with regard to colored garments, they said: This is preferable, in order to be lenient with regard to their stains,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah in the tractate of Pesachim: They decreed regarding the crowns of grooms and the betrothed, they sought to decree regarding colored garments. They said: Is this not preferable in order to lighten their stains.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שבעה סמנין מעבירין על הכתם רוק תפל ומי גריסין ומי רגלים ונתר ובורית
human_translation: seven substances one applies to the stain Tasteless saliva, and liquid from split beans, and urine, and natron, and borit ,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Seven substances remove a stain: saliva, mud, water of crushed grain, urine, and a pit.

hebrew_text: קמוניא ואשלג
human_translation: Cimolian earth [ kamonya ], and potash [ eshlag ].
llm_translation: Kamunya and Ashlag.

hebrew_text: הטבילו ועשה על גביו טהרות העביר עליו שבעה סמנין ולא עבר הרי זה צבע הטהרות טהורות ואינו צריך להטביל עבר או שדיהה הרי זה כתם והטהרות טמאות וצריך להטביל
human_translation: one immersed and handled ritually pure items with applied seven substances to and it did not disappear, that is a dye, and the ritually pure items are pure, and he need not immerse disappeared or if it faded, that is stain, and the ritually pure items are impure, and he must immerse
llm_translation: He immersed and performed purification rites upon himself, he passed over him seven times, and did not pass over, this one has dyed the purifications pure and does not need to immerse. If he passed over or skipped, this one has stained, and the purifications are impure, and he needs to immerse.

hebrew_text: איזהו רוק תפל כל שלא טעם כלום מי גריסין לעיסת גריסין של פול חלוקת נפש מי רגלים שהחמיצו
human_translation: What is tasteless saliva? any who tasted nothing Liquid from split beans the chewing of split beans divided naturally, urine that fermented
llm_translation: Which is the saliva that nullifies? Any that did not taste anything. Like the crumbs for the dough of split peas. The division of the soul. Like feet that have become sour.

hebrew_text: וצריך לכסכס שלש פעמים לכל אחד ואחד העבירן שלא כסדרן או שהעביר שבעה סמנין כאחת לא עשה ולא כלום
human_translation: And one must rub each and every one three times one applied them not in their order, or if one applied seven substances simultaneously, he has done nothing.
llm_translation: And one must rinse three times for each one who passed them not in their proper order or who passed seven signs at once did not fulfill anything.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנא נתר אלכסנדרית ולא נתר אנטפטרית
human_translation: taught Alexandrian natron, and not natron from Anpantrin,
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: If one made a vow in the Alexandrian language, it is valid; but if in the Antipatran language, it is not valid.

hebrew_text: בורית אמר רב יהודה זה אהלא והתניא הבורית והאהל אלא מאי בורית כבריתא
human_translation: borit Rav Yehuda says: This ice plant. But isn’t it taught Borit and ice plant, Rather, what is borit ? Sulfur.
llm_translation: Borit said Rav Yehudah: This is Ahala. And it was taught: The Borit and the Ahala. Rather, what is Borit? Like a covenant.

hebrew_text: ורמינהי הוסיפו עליהן הלביצין והלעונין הבורית והאהל ואי בורית כבריתא מי אית ליה שביעית והתנן זה הכלל כל שיש לו עיקר יש לו שביעית וכל שאין לו עיקר אין לו שביעית אלא מאי בורית אהלא והתניא הבורית והאהל תרי גווני אהלא
human_translation: And raises a contradiction They added to ornithogalum, and wormwood, borit , and ice plant. And if it would enter your mind sulfur, is there sulfur of the Sabbatical Year? But didn’t we learn this is the principle: Anything that has a root is the Sabbatical Year, and that does not have a root is not the Sabbatical Year? Rather, what borit ? ice plant. But isn’t it taught borit and ice plant? two types ice plant,
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: The Levites and the priests added to them the Levites and the singers, the pit and the tent. And if the pit is like a covenant, does it have the seventh year? But we learned: This is the principle: Anything that has a foundation has the seventh year, and anything that does not have a foundation does not have the seventh year. But what is the pit? The tent. And it was taught: The pit and the tent are two types of tents.

hebrew_text: קמוניא אמר רב יהודה שלוף דוץ ואשלג אמר שמואל שאלתינהו לנחותי ימא ואמרו אשלגא שמיה ומשתכח ביני נקבי מרגניתא ומפקי לה ברמצא דפרזלא
human_translation: Cimolian earth Rav Yehuda said: Pull out, stick in. And eshlag Shmuel said: I asked the seafarers and they told me it is called ashlega , and can be found in the shell of the pearl, and is removed with an iron skewer.
llm_translation: Kamunya said, Rav Yehudah Shaluf Dutz, and Ashlag said, Shmuel, "I asked them to descend to the sea, and they said, 'Ashlaga is its name,' and it is found between the crevices of the pearl and emerges with an iron hammer."

hebrew_text: הטבילו ועשה [כו'] תנו רבנן העביר עליו שבעה סמנין ולא עבר צפון ועבר טהרותיו טמאות
human_translation: one immersed and handled The Sages taught one applied these seven substances to and it did not disappear, soap [ tzafon ] and it disappeared, ritually pure are impure.
llm_translation: They immersed and did so. The Rabbis taught: He passed over him seven signs and did not pass over, if north, and his purities became impurities.

hebrew_text: צפון צבע נמי מעבר אלא העביר עליו ששה סמנין ולא עבר העביר עליו צפון ועבר טהרותיו טמאות שאם העביר שביעי מתחילה שמא עבר
human_translation: soap causes dye to disappear as well; Rather, one applied six of the substances to it and did not disappear, applied soap to and it disappeared, ritually pure are impure. that if he had applied seven initially, perhaps disappeared,
llm_translation: North color also from the other side but passed over him six signs and did not pass passed over him north and passed his purities impurities for if passed seventh from the beginning perhaps passed

hebrew_text: תניא אידך העביר עליו שבעה סמנין ולא עבר שנאן ועבר טהרותיו טהורות
human_translation: It is taught another one applied seven substances to and it did not disappear, repeated and disappeared, ritually pure ritually pure.
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: He passed over him seven signs, and he did not pass. They are passed, and his purities are pure.

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא לא שנו אלא הטהרות שנעשו בין תכבוסת ראשונה לשניה אבל טהרות שנעשו אחר תכבוסת שניה טהרותיו טמאות שהרי הקפיד עליו ועבר
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: They taught only the ritually pure that were handled between first washing and the second But pure that were handled after second washing, pure impure, as he was particular about it, and disappeared,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: They only taught this ruling regarding purifications that were done between the first pressing and the second pressing. But purifications that were done after the second pressing, his purifications are impure, for he was meticulous about it and transgressed.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי אבא לרב אשי מידי בקפידא תליא מילתא
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi, Does matter depend on particular
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: "The matter depends on precision."

hebrew_text: א"ל אין דתניא רבי חייא אומר דם הנדה ודאי מעביר עליו ז' סמנין ומבטלו
human_translation: said to him: Yes, As it is taught Rabbi Ḥiyya says: blood certainly from a menstruating woman may apply seven substances to it and nullify it
llm_translation: He said to him: "It is not as it was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Chiya says: The blood of nidah certainly nullifies it with seven signs and annuls it."

hebrew_text: ואמאי הא דם נדה הוא אלמא בקפידא תליא מילתא ה"נ בקפידא תליא מילתא
human_translation: But why it blood from a menstruating woman Evidently, matter depends upon is particular So too matter depends upon is particular
llm_translation: And why is it that the blood of menstruation is impure? This proves that the matter depends on precision. So too, the matter depends on precision.

hebrew_text: תנן התם חרסין שנשתמש בהן זב שבלעו משקין ונפלו לאויר התנור והוסק התנור התנור טמא שסוף משקה לצאת
human_translation: We learned there pottery, that a man who experiences a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ] has used that has absorbed liquids and fell into the air of an oven, and the oven was heated, the oven is impure, as liquid will eventually emerge
llm_translation: We learned there: earthenware vessels that a zav used, if they absorbed liquids and fell into the oven, and the oven was heated, the oven is impure because the end of the liquid is to exit.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ל לא שנו אלא משקין קלים אבל משקין חמורין טמא אע"פ שלא הוסק התנור רבי יוחנן אמר אחד משקין קלין ואחד משקין חמורין אם הוסק התנור אין אי לא לא
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: They taught only liquids lesser But liquids greater impure even though the oven was not heated. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: both liquids lesser and liquids greater if the oven was heated, yes, if not not
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Eliezer: They only taught this regarding light beverages, but regarding heavy beverages, they are impure even if the oven was not heated. Rabbi Yochanan said: Whether light beverages or heavy beverages, if the oven was heated, yes; if not, no.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבי יוחנן לריש לקיש הטבילו ועשה על גביו טהרות והעביר עליו ז' סמנין ולא עבר הרי זה צבע וטהרותיו טהורות ואין צריך להטביל
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish one immersed and handled ritually pure items with applied seven substances to and it did not disappear, that is a dye, and the ritually pure items are ritually pure, and he need not immerse
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: If one immersed himself and performed purifications upon himself, and then passed over him seven reeds, and he did not transgress, behold, this is a dye, and his purifications remain pure, and there is no need to immerse.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה הנח לכתמים דרבנן
human_translation: said to Leave stains, by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: He said to him, "Leave it for the sages."

hebrew_text: והתני רבי חייא דם הנדה ודאי מעביר עליו ז' סמנין ומבטלו
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach: blood certainly from a menstruating woman may apply seven substances to it and nullify
llm_translation: And it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: The blood of menstruation, certainly, if seven signs pass over it, it nullifies it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי לא שנה רבי חייא מנא ליה
human_translation: said to Rabbi did not teach from where Rabbi Ḥiyya
llm_translation: Rabbi said to him: Rabbi Chiya did not repeat it to him.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבי יוחנן לריש לקיש רביעית דם שנבלע בבית הבית טמא ואמרי לה הבית טהור ולא פליגי הא בכלים דמעיקרא הא בכלים דבסוף
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish a quarter of blood that was absorbed in a house, the house is ritually impure And some say the house is ritually pure. And do not disagree, this in vessels that at the outset, this in vessels that at the end,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: The fourth degree of blood that was swallowed in the house is impure. And some say: The house is pure. And they do not disagree; this one case is regarding vessels initially, and this one case is regarding vessels ultimately.

hebrew_text: נבלעה בכסות אם מתכבסת ויוצא ממנה רביעית דם טמאה ואם לאו טהורה
human_translation: was absorbed in a garment, If is washed and a quarter of blood emerges from it, it is ritually impure But if not, it is pure,
llm_translation: Swallowed in a garment, if it is rinsed and a quarter-log of impure blood emerges from it, it is impure; if not, it is pure.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא מקולי רביעיות שנו כאן שאני דם תבוסה דרבנן
human_translation: Rav Kahana said They taught here from the leniencies of a quarter- is different, the blood of submission by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: From the voice of the fourth cup they taught here, it is different because it is the blood of trampling of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר"ל לרבי יוחנן כל הבלוע שאינו יכול לצאת טהור הא יכול לצאת טמא ואף ע"ג דלא נפיק
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan Any that is absorbed that is unable to emerge is pure. it is able to emerge it is impure, and even though it has not emerged.
llm_translation: His student raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: "Any swallowed item that cannot exit is pure. Can it exit and still be impure, even though it has not exited?"

hebrew_text: א"ר פפא כל היכא דאין יכול לצאת ולא הקפיד עליו דברי הכל טהור יכול לצאת והקפיד עליו דברי הכל טמא
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Anywhere that is unable to emerge and is not particular about it, everyone, agrees is pure. is able to emerge and is particular about it everyone agrees is impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Papa said: Wherever one is unable to leave, and he did not pay attention to him, everyone's words are pure; he is able to leave, and he paid attention to him, everyone's words are impure.

hebrew_text: כי פליגי דיכול לצאת ולא הקפיד עליו מר סבר כיון דיכול לצאת אף על גב דלא הקפיד עליו ומר סבר אע"ג דיכול לצאת
human_translation: They disagree when is able to emerge and is not particular about it. Sage, holds since is able to emerge, even though is not particular about it, And Sage, holds even though is able to emerge,
llm_translation: When they disputed, he was able to leave and the master did not object. One opinion holds that since he was able to leave, even though the master did not object, and the other opinion holds that even though he was able to leave.

hebrew_text: אם הקפיד עליו אין אי לא לא
human_translation: if he is particular yes, if not, not
llm_translation: If he insisted on it, yes; if not, no.

hebrew_text: איזהו רוק תפל תנא כל שלא טעם כלום מבערב סבר רב פפא קמיה דרבא למימר כמאן דאמר לא טעם מידי באורתא אמר ליה רבא מי קתני בערב מבערב קתני לאפוקי היכא דקדים ואכיל
human_translation: What is tasteless saliva? taught Any where had not tasted anything since the evening. Rav Pappa, before Rava, thought to say: is in accordance with one who said he did not eat anything night Rava said to him: Is it taught: in the evening, teaches: since the evening, to exclude where he early and ate,
llm_translation: Which is the saliva that nullifies? It was taught: Any saliva that did not taste anything from the evening. Rav Papa thought before Rava to say: According to whom is it considered as having not tasted anything? Rava said to him: Does Rava teach "from the evening"? He teaches to exclude where it is mixed and eaten.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן איזהו רוק תפל כל שעבר עליו חצות לילה ובשינה למימרא דבשינה תליא מילתא והתנן ישן כל היום אין זה רוק תפל ניעור כל הלילה הרי זה רוק תפל התם במתנמנם
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What is tasteless saliva? Any where he passed the middle of the night and in sleep. to say that the matter depends on sleep? But didn’t we learn he slept the entire day, that is not tasteless saliva; he was awake the entire night, that is tasteless saliva? there, where was dozing
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is a deep sleep? Anyone who passes midnight in his sleep. And with regard to sleep, the matter depends on sleep. And we learned in a Mishnah: One who sleeps all day, this is not a deep sleep; one who is awake all night, this is a deep sleep. There, it is referring to dozing.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי מתנמנם אמר רב אשי נים ולא נים תיר ולא תיר דקרו ליה ועני ולא ידע לאהדורי סברא וכי מדכרו ליה מדכר
human_translation: What are the circumstances dozing? Rav Ashi said: asleep and not asleep, awake and not awake. If someone calls him he answers, and he is he does not know to provide reasoning, but when people remind him he remembers
llm_translation: How is it possible to be half asleep? Rav Ashi said: "Dozing, yet not dozing; awake, yet not awake." They called to him, but he was in a state of confusion and did not know how to respond. He thought to himself, "When they call to him, does he remember?"

hebrew_text: תנא השכים ושנה פרקו אין זה רוק תפל ועד כמה אמר רב יהודה בר שילא אמר רב אשי אמר רבי אלעזר כל שיצא רוב דבורו של שלש שעות
human_translation: taught rose and learned his chapter that not tasteless saliva, And how much Rav Yehuda bar Sheila says Rav Ashi says Rabbi Elazar says: Any where he uttered most of his speech in three hours.
llm_translation: The Mishna teaches: One who wakes up early and studies his chapter, this is not like one who spits out his prayer. Until when? Rav Yehuda bar Sheila said in the name of Rav Ashi, who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: As long as he finishes the majority of his study within three hours.

hebrew_text: מי גריסין לעיסת גריסין של פול וכו' לימא מסייע ליה לריש לקיש דאמר ר"ל רוק תפל צריך שיהא עם כל אחד ואחד דלמא הבלא דפומא מעלי
human_translation: Liquid from split beans the chewing of split beans Let us say supports of Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish said: Tasteless saliva must be with each and every one perhaps the heat of his mouth helps
llm_translation: Who grinds the flour for the flour of beans, etc.? Let us say it supports Reish Lakish, for Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Levi: "Spittle mixed with flour requires that it be with each and every one, for perhaps the vapor of the mouth rises."

hebrew_text: מתניתין דלא כרבי יהודה דתניא ר' יהודה אומר מי גריסין רותח ועובר שיתן לתוכו מלח
human_translation: the mishna is not in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda. As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: The liquid from split beans boiling, and before [ over ] one puts salt into
llm_translation: Mishnaic teaching: Not like Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "If pickles are boiling and a pregnant woman craves them, one should put salt into them."

hebrew_text: מאי משמע דהאי עובר לישנא דאקדומי הוא אמר ר"נ בר יצחק דאמר קרא (שמואל ב יח, כג) וירץ אחימעץ דרך הככר ויעבור את הכושי אביי אמר מהכא (בראשית לג, ג) והוא עבר לפניהם ואיבעית אימא מהכא (מיכה ג ) ויעבור מלכם לפניהם וה' בראשם
human_translation: From where may be inferred that over is a formulation of priority? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said that the verse states: “And Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran [ vayya’avor ] the Cushite” Abaye said: from here: “And he passed [ avar ] before them” And if you wish, say from here: “And their king passed [ vayya’avor ] before them and the Lord at their head”
llm_translation: What is implied by this, that this one passed to the front? R. Nahman bar Yitzhak said: Scripture says (2 Samuel 18:23), "And Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and passed the Cushite." Abaye said: From here (Genesis 33:3), "And he passed before them." And if you wish, say from here (Micah 2:13), "And the Lord at their head."

hebrew_text: מי רגלים שהחמיצו תנא כמה חימוצן שלשה ימים
human_translation: urine that fermented. taught how fermented? three days.
llm_translation: Who feet that soured, a Tanna: how much their souring? three days.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן כל שיעורי חכמים בכתמים צריך שיעור לשיעורן דילד או דזקן דאיש או דאשה מכוסים או מגולים בימות החמה או בימות הגשמים
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All the measures of the Sages with regard to stains require a measure for their measure. of a young or of an old of a man or of a woman? covered or uncovered? from the summer or from the rainy season?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: All measurements of the Sages, whether for liquids or for dry measures, require a measurement corresponding to their own measurement, whether for a young man or an old man, whether for a man or a woman, whether covered or uncovered, whether in sunny days or in rainy days.

hebrew_text: וצריך לכסכס שלש פעמים בעי רבי ירמיה אמטויי ואתויי חד או דלמא אמטויי ואתויי תרתי מאי תיקו
human_translation: And one must rub three times. Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma going and coming one or perhaps going and coming two What shall stand
llm_translation: And one must rinse three times. Rabbi Yirmeya asked: Is it necessary to rinse three times consecutively, or perhaps one should rinse twice? What is the resolution?

hebrew_text: העבירן שלא כסדרן ת"ר הקדים שניים לראשונים תני חדא שניים עלו לו ראשונים לא עלו לו ותניא אידך ראשונים עלו לו שניים לא עלו לו
human_translation: one applied them not in their order, The Sages taught second before the first is taught one second count for him, first do not count for him. And it is taught another first count for him, second do not count for him.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one presented them out of order. The first two preceded the first ones, one taught: one did not ascend for him, and it was taught in another place: the first ones ascended for him, the second ones did not ascend for him.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אידי ואידי שניים עלו לו ולא ראשונים ומאי ראשונים ראשונים לכסדרן ושניים להעברתן
human_translation: Abaye said this and that second count for him, and not first. And what First? first according to the order second in their application.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "Both Idi and Idi ascended, but not the first ones. And what are the first ones? The first ones for their order, and the two for their transfer."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל אשה שיש לה וסת דיה שעתה ואלו הן הוסתות מפהקת ומעטשת וחוששת בפי כריסה ובשפולי מעיה ושופעת וכמין צמרמורות אוחזין אותה וכן כיוצא בהן וכל שקבעה לה שלשה פעמים הרי זה וסת
human_translation: any woman who has cycle her time is sufficient, And these are the cycles she yawns [ mefaheket ], or she sneezes, or she senses near her stomach or in her lower abdomen, or she secretes or a type of shuddering [ tzemarmorot ] overtakes her. And likewise of the like. And any who establishes for herself three times that is cycle.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Any woman who has a veset (menstrual cycle) at a specific time, and these are the signs: she is pale, nauseous, and dizzy; she bites her lips, and her eyebrows are knit; she swells and has spasms like locusts, they hold her. And similarly with others like them. And any woman who has established for herself three times, behold, this is a veset.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנינא חדא זימנא כל אשה שיש לה וסת דיה שעתה התם בוסתות דיומי הכא בוסתות דגופא
human_translation: We learned another occasion any woman who has cycle, her time is sufficient, There, to cycle of days; here, to cycle based on a physical
llm_translation: Gemara: We have learned in a Baraita: One time, any woman who has a veset (menstrual cycle) - there, it is the "bustot" of her days; here, it is the "bustot" of her body.

hebrew_text: כדקתני אלו הן וסתות היתה מפהקת מעטשת וחוששת בפי כריסה ובשפולי מעיה ושופעת
human_translation: As it teaches These are the cycles she yawns, she sneezes, or she senses near her stomach or in her lower abdomen, or she secretes
llm_translation: As it was taught: These are the signs of a woman who is menstruating - she is pale, her face is sunken, and she is anxious in her mouth, her thighs are rubbed together, and she is bloated.

hebrew_text: שופעת הא שפעה ואזלא אמר עולא בריה דרב עלאי
human_translation: she secretes But she is continuously discharging Ulla, son of Rav Ilai, said:
llm_translation: Overflowing with abundance, and then it went away. Ula, son of Rav Elai, said.

hebrew_text: בשופעת דם טמא מתוך דם טהור
human_translation: where she discharges ritually impure blood in the midst of ritually pure blood.
llm_translation: In the abundance of impure blood from within pure blood.

hebrew_text: וכמין צמרמורות וכו' וכן כיוצא בהן לאתויי מאי אמר רבה בר עולא לאתויי אשה שראשה כבד עליה ואבריה כבדים עליה ורותתת וגוסה
human_translation: Or a type of shuddering and likewise of the like. What is added Rabba bar Ulla said: to include a woman whose head is heavy upon her or her limbs are heavy upon her, or she trembles or belches
llm_translation: "And like types of locusts, etc." "And similarly, what are they meant to include?" Rabbah bar Ulla said: "They are meant to include a woman whose head is heavy upon her, and her limbs are heavy upon her, and she is weak and emaciated."

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא בר חייא אמר שמואל הרי אמרו לימים שנים לוסתות אחת למה שלא מנו חכמים שלשה
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya says Shmuel says: said, with regard to days, two with regard to cycle once. for those which the Sages did not include three
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chiya said, Shmuel said: They said for days two lashes, one why sages not counted three.

hebrew_text: למה שלא מנו חכמים לאתויי מאי אמר רב יוסף לאתויי ראשה כבד עליה ואבריה כבדין עליה ורותתת וגוסה א"ל אביי מאי קא משמע לן מתני' היא דהא פרשה רבה בר עולא אלא אמר אביי לאתויי אכלה שום וראתה ואכלה בצלים וראתה כססה פלפלים וראתה
human_translation: For those which the Sages did not include, what to add? Rav Yosef says: to add her head is heavy upon her, or her limbs are heavy upon her, or she trembles or belches Abaye said What is teaching us? it is the mishna, as Rabba bar Ulla explained Rather, Abaye said: to add she ate garlic and saw or ate onions and saw chewed pepper and saw
llm_translation: The sages did not count the following: What did Rav Yosef say? To count its head is heavy upon it, and its limbs are heavy upon it, and it is restless and moves. Abaye said to him: What is he implying to us from the Mishnah? For it is taught in a Baraita: This is what Rav Aha bar Ulla expounded. Rather, Abaye said: To count if it ate garlic and saw, if it ate onions and saw, if it ate leeks and saw.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף לא שמיע לי הא שמעתא
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I did not hear this tradition
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: I have not heard this teaching.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי את אמריתה ניהלן ואהא אמריתה ניהלן היתה למודה להיות רואה יום חמשה עשר ושינתה ליום עשרים זה וזה אסורין שלש פעמים ליום עשרים הותר יום חמשה עשר וקבעה לה יום עשרים שאין אשה קובעת לה וסת עד שתקבענה שלש פעמים
human_translation: Abaye, said to him: You told us and with regard to this you told to us, was accustomed to see fifteenth day and she deviated on twentieth day, this and that prohibited on twentieth day three times, it becomes permitted fifteenth day, and she established the twentieth day for herself as a woman establishes cycle only after she establishes it three times.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: If you said she is menstruating, and she indeed is menstruating, she should be considered as seeing for fifteen days and as impure for twenty days. Both this and that are forbidden three times on the twentieth day. On the fifteenth day, she is permitted, and she establishes for herself the twentieth day, for a woman does not establish a fixed period until she establishes it three times.

hebrew_text: ואמרת לן עלה אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל זו דברי ר"ג בר רבי שאמר משום רשב"ג אבל חכמים אומרים ראתה אינה צריכה לא לשנות ולא לשלש
human_translation: And you, said to us with regard to this Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: This is the statement of Rabban Gamliel bar Rabbi who said in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. But the Rabbis say: she saw does not need to repeat or to repeat a third
llm_translation: And you said to us, "Go up," said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: This is the statement of Rabbi Yehudah bar Rabbi who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel. But the sages say: "If she was seen, she does not need to change nor to divorce."

hebrew_text: ואמרינן לך לשנות אמרת לן לשלש מיבעיא ואמרת לן לשנות בוסתות לשלש בימים
human_translation: And we said to you: you said to us to repeat is it necessary to repeat a third And you said to us to repeat to cycle to repeat a third to days.
llm_translation: And we say to you to change, you said to us to three, what is the need? And you said to us to change the linen garments to three days.

hebrew_text: ונימא זו דברי רשב"ג הא קמ"ל שמואל דר"ג ברבי כרשב"ג סבירא ליה
human_translation: But Let him say this is the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, this Shmuel teaches us: That Rabban Gamliel, son of Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: And it was said: This is the statement of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel. This teaches us the opinion of Shmuel, that Rabbi Yehudah HaNasi agrees with Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ היתה למודה להיות רואה בתחלת הוסתות כל הטהרות שעשתה בתוך הוסתות טמאות בסוף הוסתות כל הטהרות שעשתה בתוך הוסתות טהורות
human_translation: was accustomed to see at the beginning of the fixed all the ritually pure items that she handled within the fixed are ritually impure. at the end of the fixed all the ritually pure items that she handled within the fixed are pure.
llm_translation: Mishnah: If she was accustomed to seeing at the beginning of her menstrual periods all the purities she performed within the menstrual periods are impure; at the end of her menstrual periods all the purities she performed within the menstrual periods are pure.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי אומר אף ימים ושעות וסתות היתה למודה להיות רואה עם הנץ החמה אינה אסורה אלא עם הנץ החמה רבי יהודה אומר כל היום שלה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even days and hours cycle: was accustomed to see at sunrise, prohibited her only at sunrise; Rabbi Yehuda says: the entire day is hers
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even days, hours, and moments she was accustomed to see with the rising of the sun. It is not prohibited except with the rising of the sun. Rabbi Yehuda says: The entire day belongs to her.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנא כיצד א"ר יוסי ימים ושעות וסתות היתה למודה להיות רואה מיום עשרים ליום עשרים ומשש שעות לשש שעות הגיע יום עשרים ולא ראתה אסורה לשמש כל שש שעות ראשונות דברי רבי יהודה ורבי יוסי מתיר עד שש שעות וחוששת בשש שעות
human_translation: taught In what case did Rabbi Yosei say days and hours cycle? was accustomed to see on the twentieth day on the twentieth day, and in the sixth hour in the sixth hour twentieth day arrives and she does not see it is prohibited for her to engage the entirety of the first six hours this is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei deems permitted until the sixth hour and concerned during the sixth hour.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: How so? Rabbi Yosei said: Days, hours, and intercalations she was accustomed to see from the twentieth day to the twentieth day, and from six hours to six hours. The twentieth day arrived, and she did not see, she is forbidden to engage in marital relations for the entire first six hours. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Yosei permits until six hours and is concerned during the six hours.

hebrew_text: עברו שש שעות ולא ראתה אסורה לשמש כל היום כולו דברי ר' יהודה ורבי יוסי מתיר מן המנחה ולמעלה
human_translation: the sixth hour passed and she did not see it is prohibited for her to engage the entirety of the day; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Yosei deems permitted from minḥa onward,
llm_translation: Passed six hours and did not see, forbidden to engage in marital relations the entire day. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Yossi permits from the afternoon and onwards.

hebrew_text: היתה למודה והתניא רבי יהודה אומר כל הלילה שלה
human_translation: was accustomed to see But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: The entire night is hers?
llm_translation: She was a teacher, and it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "Her entire night."

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא דרגילה לראות בתחלת יממא והא דרגילה לראות בסוף ליליא
human_translation: not difficult. Here, where she is accustomed to see at the beginning of the day, And there, where she is accustomed to see at the end of the night,
llm_translation: It is not difficult. This one who is accustomed to see at the beginning of the day, and this one who is accustomed to see at the end of the night.

hebrew_text: תני חדא רבי יהודה אוסרה לפני וסתה ומתירה לאחר וסתה ותניא אידך אוסרה לאחר וסתה ומתירה לפני וסתה
human_translation: is taught one Rabbi Yehuda deems prohibited for her before her cycle, but deems permitted for her after her cycle And it is taught another deems prohibited for her after her cycle but deems permitted for her before her cycle.
llm_translation: It was taught: One opinion is that Rabbi Yehuda prohibits a woman before her menstrual period and permits her after her menstrual period. And it was taught in another source: She is prohibited after her menstrual period and permitted before her menstrual period.

hebrew_text: ולא קשיא הא דרגילה למחזי בסוף ליליא הא דרגילה למחזי בתחלת יממא
human_translation: And not difficult; here, where she is accustomed to see at the end of the night. there, where she is accustomed to see at the beginning of the day.
llm_translation: And not difficult. This one who is accustomed to be seen at the end of the night, and this one who is accustomed to be seen at the beginning of the day.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הלכה כרבי יהודה ומי אמר רבא הכי והתניא (ויקרא טו, לא) והזרתם את בני ישראל מטומאתם מכאן א"ר ירמיה אזהרה לבני ישראל שיפרשו מנשותיהן סמוך לוסתן
human_translation: Rava said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And did Rava say this? But isn’t it taught “You shall separate the children of Israel from their impurity” From here, Rabbi Yirmeya said a warning to the children of Israel that they should separate from their wives close to their cycles.
llm_translation: Rava said: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda. But did Rava really say so? Wasn't it taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 15:31), "And you shall separate the children of Israel from their impurity"? From here, Rabbi Yirmeya said: This is a warning to the children of Israel that they should separate from their wives close to their menstruation.

hebrew_text: וכמה אמר רבא עונה מאי לאו עונה אחריתי לא אותה עונה
human_translation: And how Rava says: One period, What, is it not an additional period, No, that period.
llm_translation: And how much did Rava say "Onah"? What, is it not "Onah" after it, not that "Onah."

hebrew_text: ותרתי למה לי צריכא דאי אשמועינן הא הוה אמינא ה"מ לטהרות אבל לבעלה לא קמ"ל
human_translation: And why do I two necessary, because if taught us this, I would say this statement to pure but with regard to her husband, not teaches us
llm_translation: And I have a question: Why do I need this? For if we were to hear, I would say, "This is so for purifications, but not for her husband." This teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: ואי מההיא הוה אמינא סמוך לוסתה עונה אחריתי קמ"ל אותה עונה
human_translation: And if that I would say close to her cycle an additional period, teaches us that period.
llm_translation: And if from that, I would say, "near to her period she is impure," it teaches us that she is impure.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ היתה למודה להיות רואה יום ט"ו ושינתה להיות רואה ליום כ' זה וזה אסורין שינתה פעמים ליום כ' זה וזה אסורין
human_translation: was accustomed to see fifteenth day and she deviated to see on twentieth day, this and that prohibited she deviated twice, this and that prohibited
llm_translation: Mishnah: If she was accustomed to seeing her menstrual period on the fifteenth day of the month and it changed to seeing it on the twentieth day, both times are forbidden. If it changed back twice to seeing it on the twentieth day, both times are forbidden.

hebrew_text: שינתה ג' פעמים ליום כ' הותר ט"ו וקבעה לה יום כ' שאין אשה קובעת לה וסת עד שתקבענה ג' פעמים ואינה מטהרת מן הוסת עד שתעקר ממנה ג' פעמים
human_translation: she deviated to see on twentieth day three times, it becomes permitted fifteenth, and she established the twentieth day for herself as a woman establishes cycle only after she establishes it three times. And is purified from the cycle, only when she has been displaced from three times.
llm_translation: She changed three times a day twenty-four hours and established for her a day twenty-four, as a woman does not establish for herself a veset until she establishes it three times, and she does not become purified from the veset until she uproots it three times.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ איתמר ראתה יום חמשה עשר לחדש זה ויום ט"ז לחדש זה ויום שבעה עשר לחדש זה רב אמר קבעה לה וסת לדילוג ושמואל אמר עד שתשלש בדילוג
human_translation: It was stated: saw fifteenth of this month, and sixteenth of month that, and seventeenth of month that, Rav says: She has determined her cycle by skipping, And Shmuel says: until she skips three times.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: She saw on the fifteenth day of this month, and on the sixteenth day of this month, and on the seventeenth day of this month. Rav said: If she established a fixed time for herself, she may immerse for the sake of skipping the additional days of waiting. And Shmuel said: She must wait until she completes three additional days of waiting.

hebrew_text: נימא רב ושמואל בפלוגתא דרבי ורשב"ג קמיפלגי דתניא ניסת לראשון ומת לשני ומת לשלישי לא תנשא דברי רבי רשב"ג אומר לג' תנשא לד' לא תנשא
human_translation: Shall we say Rav and Shmuel disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? As it is taught was married to first and he died, to a second and he died, she may not marry a third the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She may marry a third she may not marry a fourth
llm_translation: Nimai Rav and Shmuel in the dispute of Rabbi and Reshbagh, they argue. As it was taught in a Baraita: "If she was married to the first one and he died, and she was married to the second one and he died, and she was married to the third one, she should not marry." The words of Rabbi Reshbagh. Reshbagh says: "She may marry three, but not four."

hebrew_text: לא דכ"ע כרשב"ג והכא בהא קמיפלגי רב סבר חמשה עשר ממנינא ושמואל סבר כיון דלאו בדילוג חזיתיה לאו ממנינא הוא
human_translation: No, everyone agrees in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and here they disagree with regard to this Rav holds fifteenth of the number, And Shmuel holds since she did not see skipping, it is not the number,
llm_translation: Not like R. Shimon ben Gamliel, and here they argue: Rav holds we count fifteen, and Shmuel holds since it is not in a leap year, it is not counted.

hebrew_text: איתיביה היתה למודה להיות רואה יום ט"ו ושינתה ליום ששה עשר זה וזה אסורין שינתה ליום שבעה עשר הותר ששה עשר ונאסר חמשה עשר ושבעה עשר
human_translation: raised an objection to was accustomed to see fifteenth day and deviated on the sixteenth day this and that prohibited deviated on the seventeenth day the sixteenth permitted, and the fifteenth and seventeenth are prohibited.
llm_translation: His interlocutor raised an objection to him: If she was accustomed to seeing on the fifteenth day and she changed it to the sixteenth day, both this and that are prohibited. If she changed it to the seventeenth day, the sixteenth day is permitted and the fifteenth and seventeenth days are prohibited.

hebrew_text: שינתה ליום שמונה עשר הותרו כולן ואין אסור אלא משמונה עשר ואילך קשיא לרב אמר לך רב למודה שאני
human_translation: deviated on eighteenth day all are permitted. And prohibited only from eighteenth and onward, difficult for Rav, Rav said to you was accustomed it is different.
llm_translation: She changed it to the eighteenth day - they are all permitted, and it is only prohibited from the eighteenth day and onwards. This is difficult for Rav. Rav said to you: Rav concedes that it is different.

hebrew_text: ודקארי לה מאי קארי לה למודה אצטריכא ליה מהו דתימא כיון דלמודה ועקרתיה בתרי זימני עקרה ליה קמ"ל
human_translation: And he who asked [ udeka’arei ] it, why did he ask it? It was necessary was accustomed lest you say since she was accustomed and displaced with two times she displaces it. teaches us
