llm_translation: And it is called to it, what is it called to it? For the teaching needs it. What is the concern lest one say, since the teaching and its principle were uprooted twice, it is uprooted for him. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי ראתה יום עשרים ואחד בחדש זה יום עשרים ושנים בחדש זה יום עשרים ושלשה בחדש זה קבעה לה וסת סירגה ליום עשרים וארבעה לא קבעה לה וסת תיובתא דשמואל
human_translation: raises an objection saw twenty-first day of this month, twenty-second day of that month, twenty-third day of that month, she established a fixed varied on twenty-fourth day she has not established a fixed a conclusive refutation of Shmuel,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A contradiction was raised: If she saw on the twenty-first day of this month, this is the twenty-second day of the month. If she saw on the twenty-second day of this month, this is the twenty-third day of the month. She established for herself a fixed period for the twenty-fourth day, she did not establish for herself a fixed period. This is the dispute of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: אמר לך שמואל הכא במאי עסקינן כגון דרגילה למחזי ביום עשרים ושינתה ליום עשרים ואחד דיקא נמי דשבקינן ליום עשרים ונקט ליום עשרים ואחד ש"מ
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: Here, we are dealing with where was accustomed to see on twentieth day and she deviated on the twenty-first day is also precise, as leave twentieth day and take twenty-first day Learn from this
llm_translation: Samuel said to you: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if she is accustomed to being seen on the twentieth day and she changed it to the twenty-first day. It is also precise that we leave it for the twentieth day and she took it for the twenty-first day. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: שאין האשה קובעת לה וסת עד שתקבענה וכו' א"ר פפא לא אמרן אלא למקבעה אבל למיחש לה בחדא זימנא חיישא
human_translation: As a woman establishes a fixed cycle only after she establishes it Rav Pappa says, We said only with regard to establishing but with regard to concerned after one time she must be concerned
llm_translation: The woman does not establish her vow until she establishes it, etc. Rabbi Papa said: We only said this regarding establishing it, but to suspect her with one time, we are concerned.

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל תנינא היתה למודה להיות רואה יום חמשה עשר ושינתה ליום עשרים זה וזה אסורין
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learn was accustomed to see fifteenth day and she deviated to see on twentieth day, this and that prohibited
llm_translation: What is the reason that we learned that if she was accustomed to seeing on the fifteenth day and she changed to the twentieth day, both this and that are forbidden.

hebrew_text: אי מהתם ה"א ה"מ היכא דקיימא בתוך ימי נדתה אבל היכא דלא קיימא בתוך ימי נדתה אימא לא קמ"ל
human_translation: If from there, I would say this statement where she is standing in her days menstruation, But where she is not standing in her days menstruation, I would say not teaches us
llm_translation: If from there "א" "ה" "מ" where it is within her days of menstruation, but where it is not within her days of menstruation, say not.

hebrew_text: ואינה מטהרת מן הוסת וכו' א"ר פפא לא אמרן אלא דקבעתיה תלתא זימני דצריכי תלתא זימני למעקריה אבל תרי זימני בחדא זימנא מיעקר
human_translation: And is purified from the cycle, only Rav Pappa says, We said only that she established three times. that three times are necessary to displace But two times, it is displaced by one time
llm_translation: "And it does not purify from 'husat,' etc." Rabbi Papa said: I only said that if you established it three times, it requires three times to uproot it, but if you established it twice, it is uprooted in one time."

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל תנינא אין האשה קובעת לה וסת עד שתקבענה שלש פעמים מהו דתימא חדא לחד תרי לתרתי ותלתא לתלתא קא משמע לן
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learn A woman establishes cycle only after she establishes it three times. lest you say one for one two for two and three for three teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reason that we taught: "A woman does not establish her 'sotah' status until she establishes it three times"? Lest you say, one to one, two to two, and three to three, it teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: תניא כותיה דרב פפא היתה למודה להיות רואה יום עשרים ושינתה ליום שלשים זה וזה אסורין הגיע יום עשרים ולא ראתה מותרת לשמש עד יום שלשים וחוששת ליום שלשים
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rav Pappa: was accustomed to see twentieth day and she deviated on thirtieth day, this and that prohibited twentieth day arrived, and she did not see it is permitted for her to engage until thirtieth day and she concerned on thirtieth day.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Papa: She was accustomed to seeing on the twentieth day, and she changed to the thirtieth day, both this and that are forbidden. If the twentieth day arrived and she did not see, she is permitted to engage in marital relations until the thirtieth day, and she is concerned for the thirtieth day.

hebrew_text: הגיע יום שלשים וראתה הגיע יום עשרים ולא ראתה והגיע יום שלשים ולא ראתה והגיע יום עשרים וראתה הותר יום שלשים
human_translation: thirtieth day arrived and she saw twentieth day arrived and she did not see and thirtieth day arrived and she did not see and twentieth day arrived and she saw thirtieth day becomes permitted,
llm_translation: The day arrived thirty and she saw, the day arrived twenty and did not see, and the day arrived thirty and did not see, and the day arrived twenty and she saw, the thirtieth day is permitted.

hebrew_text: ונאסר יום עשרים מפני שאורח בזמנו בא
human_translation: And prohibited twentieth day, because manner comes at its time.
llm_translation: And it is prohibited on the twentieth day because the traveler arrives in his time.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נשים בבתוליהם כגפנים יש גפן שיינה אדום ויש גפן שיינה שחור ויש גפן שיינה מרובה ויש גפן שיינה מועט ר' יהודה אומר כל גפן יש בה יין ושאין בה יין ה"ז דורקטי
human_translation: Women, with regard to their hymens are like grapevines: There is a vine that wine is red, and there is a vine that wine is black; and there is a vine that wine in abundance, and there is a vine that a meager wine. Rabbi Yehuda says: In every vine, there are wine, but which there are no wine, this is a dry vine [ durkati ].
llm_translation: Mishnah: Women in their virginity are like grapevines. There is a grapevine whose wine is red, and there is a grapevine whose wine is black, and there is a grapevine whose wine is abundant, and there is a grapevine whose wine is scarce. Rabbi Yehudah says: Every grapevine contains wine, and one that does not contain wine—this is like a thornbush.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנא דור קטוע תני רבי חייא כשם שהשאור יפה לעיסה כך דמים יפין לאשה תנא משום ר"מ כל אשה שדמיה מרובין בניה מרובין
human_translation: truncated generation [ dor katua ]. Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: Just as leaven is good for dough, so too, blood is good for a woman. taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: Any woman whose blood is plentiful, her children are plentiful.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Chiya taught: Just as leaven is good for dough, so too, blood is beautiful for a woman. It was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: Any woman whose blood is abundant, her children are abundant.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך האשה
llm_translation: We will return to you, woman.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ תינוקת שלא הגיע זמנה לראות וניסת ב"ש אומרים נותנין לה ארבעה לילות בית הלל אומרים עד שתחיה המכה
human_translation: a young girl whose time to see has not arrived, and she married Beit Shammai say: give her four nights And Beit Hillel say: until the wound heals.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A baby girl who has not reached the age to see, and Beit Shammai says: we give her four nights, Beit Hillel says: until the wound heals.

hebrew_text: הגיע זמנה לראות וניסת ב"ש אומרים נותנין לה לילה הראשון וב"ה אומרים עד מוצאי שבת ארבע לילות
human_translation: whose time to see has arrived and she married Beit Shammai say: give her the first night And Beit Hillel say: until the conclusion of Shabbat, four nights,
llm_translation: The time has come to see, and Beit Shammai says, "One gives her the first night," and Beit Hillel says, "Until the end of the four nights after Shabbat."

hebrew_text: ראתה ועודה בבית אביה ב"ש אומרים נותנין לה בעילת מצוה וב"ה אומרים כל הלילה כולה:
human_translation: saw she was still in her father’s house, Beit Shammai say: give her relations a mitzva, And Beit Hillel say: throughout the entire night
llm_translation: Saw and still in her father's house, Beit Shammai say, "They give her with marital relations of commandment," and Beit Hillel say, "The entire night in its entirety."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק ואפילו ראתה ממאי מדקא מפליג בסיפא בין ראתה בין בשלא ראתה מכלל דרישא לא שנא הכי ולא שנא הכי
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: And even she has seen From where from that distinguishes in the latter clause between seen and not seen By inference, the first clause is no different this and is no different that
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, and even if she saw from what does he argue in the latter clause whether she saw or whether she did not see? Infer from the former clause not so and not so.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי ב"ה אומרים עד שתחיה המכה בין ראתה בין לא ראתה
human_translation: This is also taught Beit Hillel say: until the wound heals, whether she has seen whether she has not seen
llm_translation: It is also taught in a Baraita: The sages of the House of Hillel say: "Until the one who struck, whether she saw or did not see, shall live."

hebrew_text: עד שתחיה המכה עד כמה אמר רב יהודה אמר רב כל זמן שנוחרת כי אמריתה קמיה דשמואל אמר לי נחירה זו איני יודע מה היא אלא כל זמן שהרוק מצוי בתוך הפה מחמת תשמיש
human_translation: until the wound heals. Until when Rav Yehuda says Rav says: All the time that she is noḥeret . When said this before Shmuel, he said to me: This noḥeret , I do not know what it is, Rather, all the time that the saliva is in mouth due to sexual intercourse,
llm_translation: Until the wound heals, how far? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: As long as it is suppurating. For when I said before Shmuel, he told me, "I do not know what is 'suppuration,' but as long as the saliva is found within the mouth due to use."

hebrew_text: נחירה דקאמר רב היכי דמי אמר רב שמואל בר רב יצחק לדידי מפרשא לי מיניה דרב עומדת ורואה יושבת ואינה רואה בידוע שלא חיתה המכה על גבי קרקע ורואה על גבי כרים וכסתות ואינה רואה בידוע שלא חיתה המכה על גבי כולם ורואה ע"ג כולם ואינה רואה בידוע שחיתה המכה
human_translation: noḥeret that Rav says; what is it like? Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: It was explained to me by Rav stands and sees sits and does not see it is known that the wound has not healed, on the ground and sees on cushions and blankets and does not see it is known that the wound has not healed on all of them, and sees on all of them and does not see it is known that the wound has healed,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Nachira d'amar Rav, heich d'mi?" Amar Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak, "Lididi mifarsha li minei d'Rav, omedet v'ro'ah, yoshevet v'einah ro'ah, b'yadua shelo chitah ha'makkeh al gabei karka, v'ro'ah al gabei karim v'kisutos, v'einah ro'ah b'yadua shelo chitah ha'makkeh al gabei kulam, v'ro'ah al kulam, v'einah ro'ah b'yadua sh'chitah ha'makkeh." English translation: "A question that Rav posed, what is the case?" Rav Shmuel, son of Rav Yitzchak, said, "According to my understanding from Rav, if a person is standing and sees, or sitting and does not see, it is known that the blow did not hit on the ground, and sees on pillows and cushions, and does not see, it is known that the blow did not hit on all of them, and sees on all of them, and does not see, it is known that the blow hit."

hebrew_text: הגיע זמנה וכו' איתמר שימשה בימים רב אמר לא הפסידה לילות ולוי אמר הפסידה לילות
human_translation: whose time has arrived, It was stated she engaged in intercourse during the daytime, Rav says: She has not lost nights, Levi says: She has lost nights,
llm_translation: The time arrived, etc. It was stated: "She served during the days." Rav said: "She did not lose nights." Levi said: "She lost nights."

hebrew_text: רב אמר לא הפסידה לילות עד מוצאי שבת תנן ולוי אמר הפסידה לילות מאי ארבע לילות דקתני ארבעה עונות
human_translation: Rav says she has not lost nights, we learned until the conclusion of Shabbat, And Levi says: She has lost nights, what Four nights, that is taught four periods,
llm_translation: Rav said did not lose nights until Motzaei Shabbat we learned, and Levi said lost nights what four nights? as it teaches four sins.

hebrew_text: ולרב למה לי למיתנא ארבע לילות אורח ארעא קמ"ל דדרכה דביאה בלילות וללוי ליתני ארבע לילות עד מוצאי שבת למה לי הא קמ"ל דשרי למבעל לכתחלה בשבת
human_translation: And according to Rav, why do I to teach: Four nights? teaches us proper conduct, as it is proper that intercourse at night. And according to Levi, let teach Four nights. Why do I Until the conclusion of Shabbat? this teaches us that it is permitted to engage in intercourse for the first on Shabbat.
llm_translation: And for Rav, why do I need to teach four nights? The way of the land teaches that the act of intercourse is at night. And for Levi, why does he teach four nights until the end of Shabbat? Why do I need this? It teaches that it is permitted for the husband initially on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: כדשמואל דאמר שמואל פרצה דחוקה מותר ליכנס בה בשבת ואע"פ שמשיר צרורות
human_translation: in accordance with of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: It is permitted to enter into a narrow opening on Shabbat, and even though causes pebbles to fall
llm_translation: As Shmuel said, Shmuel said: A breached wall that is narrow, one may enter it on Shabbat, even though it has bundles of straw.

hebrew_text: איתמר בעל ולא מצא דם וחזר ובעל ומצא דם רבי חנינא אמר טמאה ורבי אסי אמר טהורה
human_translation: was stated engaged in intercourse and did not find blood, and went back and engaged in intercourse and found blood, Rabbi Ḥanina says: ritually impure, And Rabbi Asi says: She is ritually pure,
llm_translation: It was stated: If one had intercourse and did not find blood, and then had intercourse again and found blood, Rabbi Chanina said: She is impure, and Rabbi Asi said: She is pure.

hebrew_text: ר' חנינא אמר טמאה דאם איתא דהוה דם בתולים מעיקרא הוי אתי ורבי אסי אמר טהורה דילמא אתרמי ליה כדשמואל דאמר שמואל יכולני לבעול כמה בעילות בלא דם ואידך שאני שמואל דרב גובריה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: She is ritually impure, as if it is so that it is blood virginity, it would have come at the outset, And Rabbi Asi said: She is ritually pure, perhaps it happened for him like Shmuel As Shmuel said: I can engage in intercourse several times without blood. And the other Shmuel is different, as his strength great.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: impure, for if it were the blood of a virgin initially it would come. And Rabbi Assi said: pure, perhaps she conceived like Shmuel, for Shmuel said: I am able to have intercourse many times without blood. And the other opinion is based on the fact that Shmuel was a strong man.

hebrew_text: אמר רב בוגרת נותנין לה לילה הראשון וה"מ שלא ראתה אבל ראתה אין לה אלא בעילת מצוה ותו לא
human_translation: Rav says: give a grown woman, the first night, And this statement if she did not see But she saw she has only the relations a mitzva, and nothing more.
llm_translation: Rav Bograt said: "One gives her the first night, and the sages said: if she has not seen, she only has the mitzvah of conjugal duty, and nothing more."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי מעשה ונתן לה רבי ארבע לילות מתוך י"ב חדש ה"ד אילימא דיהיב לה כולהו בימי קטנות
human_translation: raises an objection an incident and Rabbi gave her four nights within twelve months What are the circumstances If we say that gave her all of in days a minor,
llm_translation: The question was raised: A case was brought before Rabbi where he gave her four nights from the twelve months. How so? If you say that he gave her all of them during the days of her minor status.

hebrew_text: עד שתחיה המכה תנן
human_translation: we learned until the wound heals.
llm_translation: Until the one who strikes revives, we have learned.

hebrew_text: אלא דיהיב לה כולהו בימי נערות נערות י"ב חדש מי איכא והא אמר שמואל אין בין נערות לבגרות אלא ו' חדשים בלבד וכי תימא בציר מהכי הוא דליכא הא טפי איכא הא בלבד קאמר
human_translation: Rather, that he gave her all days a young woman. Are there twelve months a young woman? But didn’t Shmuel say: The difference between a young woman and a grown woman is only six months? And if you would say less than that there is no there is more as said: Only,
llm_translation: Rather, that he gave her all of them in her youthful days. "Youthful days" - twelve months, is there really such a thing? But didn't Shmuel say: There is no difference between youth and maturity except for six months only? And if you were to say: From the time of harvest, is it so that there is not more? There is more, he is only saying this much.

hebrew_text: אלא דיהיב לה שתים בימי קטנות ושתים בימי נערות הא בעא מיניה רב חיננא בר שלמיא מרב הגיע זמנה לראות תחת בעלה מהו
human_translation: Rather, that gave her two during days as a minor, and two during days as a young woman. Rav Ḥinnana bar Shelamya asked Rav: her time to see arrived under her husband, what is
llm_translation: Rather, that he gave her two during her minor days and two during her adolescent days. This, Rav Ḥanina bar Shelamya asked of Rav Haga, "When her time has come to see beneath her husband, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה כל בעילות שאתה בועל אינן אלא אחת והשאר משלימין לד' לילות
human_translation: said to him: All the acts of intercourse that you engage in are only one and the remainder, complete four nights.
llm_translation: He said to him, "All cohabitations that you engage in are only one, and the rest complete for four nights."

hebrew_text: אלא דיהיב לה אחת בימי קטנות ושתים בימי נערות ואחת בימי בגרות אי אמרת בשלמא בוגרת בעלמא יהבינן לה טפי כי היכי דאהני קטנות בימי נערות למבצר לה חדא אהני נמי נערות לבגרות למבצר לה חדא
human_translation: Rather, that he gave her one during her days as a minor, and two during her days as a young woman, and one during her days as a grown woman. Granted, if you say we generally give a grown woman more Just as a minor have the effect to deduct one for days as a young woman, a young woman have the effect to deduct one for a grown woman,
llm_translation: Rather, that he gave her one during her childhood years, and two during her adolescent years, and one during her adulthood. If you say, in truth, during adulthood in general we should give her more, so that she may benefit during her childhood, during her adolescent years to fortify her, and also during her adulthood to fortify her.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת בוגרת דעלמא לא יהבינן לה טפי לא ליתב לה אלא בעילת מצוה ותו לא
human_translation: But if you say we generally do not give a grown woman more should given her only relations a mitzva, and nothing more,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that a woman is married to the world, we should not give her too much attention, but rather for the sake of the mitzvah of marital relations, and nothing more.

hebrew_text: לעולם דיהיב לה אחת בימי קטנות וג' בימי נערות מי סברת כל תלתא ירחי חדא עונה כל תרי ירחי חדא עונה
human_translation: Actually, that gave her one during her days as a minor and three during her days as a young woman. do you maintain every three months one period every two months one period,
llm_translation: Forever, he should give her one in her childhood days and three in her adolescent days. What is the opinion? Does everyone think that every three months is one season? Every two months is one season.

hebrew_text: מנימין סקסנאה הוה שקיל ואזיל לאתריה דשמואל סבר למעבד עובדא כוותיה דרב אפילו ראתה אמר לא פליג רב בין ראתה בין לא ראתה
human_translation: Minyamin Saksana was coming and walking to the place of Shmuel. He thought would perform an action in accordance of Rav, even seen said Rav does not distinguish between has seen and has not seen
llm_translation: From the right side of the sycamore tree, he took and went to the place of Shmuel. He thought to do the matter like the opinion of Rav, even if she saw, he said, Rav does not differentiate whether she saw or did not see.

hebrew_text: קדים שכיב באורחא קרי שמואל עליה דרב (משלי יב, כא) לא יאונה לצדיק כל און
human_translation: Before he passed away on the road, Shmuel recited about Rav: “No mishap shall befall the righteous”
llm_translation: "Kadim shakiv be'orcha kari Shmuel alai d'Rav (Mishlei 12:21) lo ya'unah l'tzadik kol avon."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חיננא בר שלמיא משמיה דרב כיון שנתקו שניו של אדם נתמעטו מזונותיו שנאמר (עמוס ד ) גם (אנכי נתתי לך) נקיון שנים בכל עריכם וחוסר לחם בכל מקומותיכם
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Shelamya said in the name of Rav: Once a person’s teeth fall out his food diminshes as it is stated: “And I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and lack of bread in all your places”
llm_translation: Rav Chinana bar Shalmiya said in the name of Rav: Once a person's teeth fall out, his sustenance diminishes, as it is stated (Amos 4): "I also gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and lack of bread in all your places."

hebrew_text: ראתה ועודה תנו רבנן ראתה ועודה בבית אביה בית הלל אומרים כל הלילה שלה ונותנין לה עונה שלמה וכמה עונה שלמה פירש רבן שמעון בן גמליאל לילה וחצי יום
human_translation: saw she was still The Sages taught saw she was still in her father’s house, Beit Hillel say: All the night is hers, and give her complete period And how long is a complete period Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel explained night and half day.
llm_translation: Saw and still she. The Sages taught: Saw and still she in her father's house. Beit Hillel say: Her entire night, and they give her a complete garment. And how much is a complete garment? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel explained: A night and half a day.

hebrew_text: ומי בעינן כולי האי ורמינהי הרי שהיו גתיו ובית בדיו טמאות ובקש לעשותן בטהרה כיצד הוא עושה הדפין והלולבין והעדשין מדיחן
human_translation: But do we require all this And raises a contradiction whose winepresses or olive presses were impure and he wished to prepare in ritual purity, how does he act? rinse the planks and the palm branches and the troughs,
llm_translation: And do we require all this? And raise a contradiction: Behold, if his winepresses and olive presses were impure, and he sought to make them pure, how does he do it? He rinses the winepresses, olive presses, and lentils.

hebrew_text: העקלים של נצרים ושל בצבוץ מנגבן של שיפא ושל גמי מיישנן וכמה מיישנן י"ב חדש רשב"ג אומר מניחן מגת לגת ומבד לבד
human_translation: clean the baskets of palm leaves or of hemp [ bitzbutz ], or leave them dormant of bast [ shifa ] or of reeds, And how long leave them dormant? twelve months. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He can lay them aside from wine-pressing to wine-pressing or from olive-pressing to olive-pressing
llm_translation: The stalks of Nazirites and of cotton from the south, of wool and of reeds, we steep them. And how long do we steep them? Twelve months. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: We place them from vat to vat and from pool to pool.

hebrew_text: היינו ת"ק איכא בינייהו חרפי ואפלי
human_translation: is the first tanna , between them early and late
llm_translation: This is the Talmudic text: "היינו ת"ק איכא בינייהו חרפי ואפלי" English translation: "This is the Tannaic source, there is between them disputes and obscurities."

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי אומר הרוצה לטהר מיד מגעילן ברותחין או חולטן במי זיתים רשב"ג אומר משום ר' יוסי מניחן תחת הצינור שמימיו מקלחין או במעיין שמימיו רודפין וכמה עונה כדרך שאמרו ביין נסך כך אמרו בטהרות
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: One who wishes to purify immediately, purges them in boiling water or scalds them in olive water. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yosei: One sets them under a pipe whose water flows or in a spring with rapid waters. And how much a period In the way that stated with regard to wine a libation so too stated with regard to matters of ritual purity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: One who wishes to purify vessels immediately, he should immerse them in boiling water or rinse them with olive water. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yosei: He should place them under the pipe where the water flows, or in a spring where the water flows continuously. And how long should he leave them? As they said regarding wine libation, so they said regarding purifications.

hebrew_text: כלפי לייא בטהרות קיימינן אלא כדרך שאמרו בטהרות כך אמרו ביין נסך
human_translation: Isn’t it the opposite [ kelapei layya ]? We are dealing with matters of purity Rather, In the way that stated with regard to matters of ritual purity, so too stated in wine a libation
llm_translation: We are established in matters of purity according to the opinion of Eliyah, except just as they said regarding matters of purity, so too they said regarding libations.

hebrew_text: וכמה עונה א"ר חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן או יום או לילה ר' חנה שאונא ואמרי לה רבי חנה בר שאונא אמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן חצי יום וחצי לילה
human_translation: And how long is period Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Either day or night. Rabbi Ḥana She’ona, and some say Rabbi Ḥana bar She’ona, say Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Half a day and half a night.
llm_translation: And how long is a season? Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: either a day or a night. Rabbi Chana bar Shauna said, and some say it was Rabbi Chana bar Shauna who said in the name of Rabba bar bar Chana: Rabbi Yochanan said: half a day and half a night.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב שמואל בר רב יצחק ולא פליגי הא בתקופ' ניסן ותשרי הא בתקופת תמוז וטבת
human_translation: And Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: And do not disagree. this with regard to season of Nisan or Tishrei, that with regard to season of Tammuz, or Tevet,
llm_translation: And Rav Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said, and they do not argue this regarding the equinox of Nisan and Tishrei, but rather regarding the equinox of Tammuz and Tevet.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי אימא גבי נדה חצי יום וחצי לילה והא לילה וחצי יום קאמר אלא אי לילה דניסן ותשרי אי חצי יום וחצי לילה דטבת ותמוז
human_translation: Here too, say with regard to a menstruating woman half a day and half a night. But said a night and half a day. Rather, Either a night during Nisan or Tishrei, or half a day and half a night during Tevet or Tammuz,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Here too, say regarding menstruation, half a day and half a night. But is it not night and half a day? Rather, if it is the night of Nisan and Tishrei, or if it is half a day and half a night of Tevet and Tammuz.

hebrew_text: ואב"א שאני כתובה דמגבי בה טפי עד דחתמי
human_translation: And if you wish, say is different, marriage contract, as who delay for a lengthy until they sign it.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: "It is different with a marriage contract, for one can write more in it until it is sealed."

hebrew_text: רב ושמואל דאמרי תרוייהו הלכה בועל בעילת מצוה ופורש
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel both say halakha engages in relations a mitzva, and separates
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel both say: the halacha is that one may engage in marital relations for the sake of a mitzvah and then separate.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב חסדא מעשה ונתן לה רבי ד' לילות מתוך י"ב חדש
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raises an objection an incident and Rabbi gave her four nights within twelve months
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection: A case occurred, and Rabbi gave her four nights from within twelve months.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא הדורי אפירכא למה לי אותיב ממתני' הוא סבר מעשה רב
human_translation: Rava said to Why do I to search for a refutation raise a difficulty from the mishna, holds incident a Sage
llm_translation: Rava said to him: "Why do I need the sign of the horned owl? Sit and learn from the Mishnah. He thought it was the incident of Rav."

hebrew_text: מ"מ לרב ושמואל קשיא אינהו דעבדו כרבותינו דתניא רבותינו חזרו ונמנו בועל בעילת מצוה ופורש
human_translation: In any case, difficult for Rav and Shmuel. they acted in accordance with our Sages, as it is taught Our Sages returned and were counted engages in relations a mitzva, and separates
llm_translation: From a comparison between Rav and Shmuel, it is difficult. They are the ones who did like our Rabbis, as it was taught: Our Rabbis reconsidered and counted one who has intercourse with a woman for the sake of a mitzvah and then separates.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא כי הוו בה ר' יוחנן ור"ל בתינוקת לא הוו מסקי מינה אלא כדמסיק תעלא מבי כרבא ומסיימי בה הכי בועל בעילת מצוה ופורש
human_translation: Ulla said: When we were of a young girl Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish, they brought up from it only of that the fox brings up from a plowed field, And they concluded this engages in relations a mitzva, and separates
llm_translation: Ula said: When Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish were together in the house of study, they did not depart from it except as one who departs from the house of Rava, and they concluded with this: One engages in marital relations for the sake of a mitzvah and then separates.

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' אבא לרב אשי אלא מעתה בעל נפש לא יגמור ביאתו א"ל א"כ לבו נוקפו ופורש
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi, If that is so, a pious person not complete his intercourse, said to him if so, his heart will strike him and he will separate
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: Rather now, a baal nefesh should not complete his intercourse. He said to him: If so, his heart will be pierced and he will become separated.

hebrew_text: ת"ר וכולן שהיו שופעות דם ובאות מתוך ד' לילות לאחר ד' לילות מתוך הלילה לאחר הלילה כולן צריכות לבדוק את עצמן
human_translation: The Sages taught And all of them, if they were discharging blood continually, from four nights after four nights, from that night after that night, all of them must examine themselves,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: And all of them that were experiencing a flow of blood, and it came from within four nights after four nights, from within the night after the night, all of them must examine themselves.

hebrew_text: ובכולן ר"מ מחמיר כדברי ב"ש
human_translation: And with regard to all of Rabbi Meir is stringent in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: And in all of them, Rabbi Meir is stringent, in accordance with the words of Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: ושאר ראיות שבין ב"ש וב"ה הלך אחר מראה דמים
human_translation: But other seeing which between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel, follows the appearance of the blood.
llm_translation: And the rest of the proofs between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel, we follow the appearance of blood.

hebrew_text: שהיה ר"מ אומר מראה דמים משונים הן זה מזה כיצד דם נדה אדום דם בתולים אינו אדום דם נדה זיהום דם בתולים אינו זיהום דם נדה בא מן המקור דם בתולים בא מן הצדדין
human_translation: As Rabbi Meir would say: The appearances of blood differ from one another. How so? blood of a menstruating woman is red, blood a virgin, is not red. blood of a menstruating woman is cloudy; blood a virgin is not cloudy. blood of a menstruating woman comes from the uterus; blood a virgin comes from the sides
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rabbi Meir used to say: Different in appearance are they from one another. How so? The blood of menstruation is red; the blood of virginity is not red. The blood of menstruation is impure; the blood of virginity is not impure. The blood of menstruation comes from the source; the blood of virginity comes from the sides."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק בר רבי יוסי אמר רבי יוחנן זו דברי ר' מאיר אבל חכמים אומרים כל מראה דמים אחת הן
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Rabbi Yosei says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir. But the Rabbis say all appearances of blood are one,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzhak son of Rabbi Yosei said Rabbi Yochanan: This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, but the sages say: All appearances of blood are one.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן הרואה דם מחמת תשמיש משמשת פעם ראשונה ושניה ושלישית מכאן ואילך לא תשמש עד שתתגרש
human_translation: The Sages taught who sees blood due to sexual intercourse may engage in intercourse first time second and third From this forward, she may not engage in intercourse until she is divorced
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sees blood due to sexual intercourse, she serves her husband the first, second, and third time. From here onward, she shall not serve until she is divorced.

hebrew_text: ותנשא לאחר
human_translation: and is married to another
llm_translation: And she was married to another.

hebrew_text: ניסת לאחר וראתה דם מחמת תשמיש משמשת פעם ראשונה ושניה ושלישית מכאן ואילך לא תשמש עד שתתגרש ותנשא לאחר ניסת לאחר וראתה דם מחמת תשמיש משמשת פעם ראשונה ושניה ושלישית מכאן ואילך לא תשמש עד שתבדוק עצמה
human_translation: she married another and saw blood due to sexual intercourse, she may engage in intercourse first time second and third From this forward she may not engage in intercourse until she is divorced and is married to another she married another and saw blood due to sexual intercourse, she may engage in intercourse first time second and third From this forward she may not engage in intercourse until she examines herself.
llm_translation: She experienced bleeding after intercourse for the first, second, and third time. From here on, she should not engage in intercourse until she divorces and marries another. If she experienced bleeding after intercourse for the first, second, and third time, from here on she should not engage in intercourse until she examines herself.

hebrew_text: כיצד בודקת את עצמה מביאה שפופרת ובתוכה מכחול ומוך מונח על ראשו אם נמצא דם על ראש המוך בידוע שמן המקור הוא בא לא נמצא דם על ראשו בידוע שמן הצדדין הוא בא
human_translation: How she examine herself? She brings a tube, inside of which brush and cloth is placed on the tip If blood is found on the top of the cloth, it is known that comes from the uterus blood is not found on the top it is known that comes from the sides
llm_translation: How does she check herself? She brings a rag, and within it, sand and dust placed on his head. If blood is found on the head of the dust, it is known that it is from the source. If blood is not found on his head, it is known that it is from the sides.

hebrew_text: ואם יש לה מכה באותו מקום תולה במכתה ואם יש לה וסת תולה בוסתה
human_translation: And if she has a wound in that place, she attributes to her wound, And if she has a cycle, she attributes to her cycle,
llm_translation: And if she has a wound in that place, she hangs by her wound, and if she has a growth, she hangs by her growth.

hebrew_text: ואם היה דם מכתה משונה מדם ראייתה אינה תולה ונאמנת אשה לומר מכה יש לי במקור שממנה דם יוצא דברי רבי
human_translation: And if the blood of her wound differed from the blood that she sees she may not attribute And a woman is deemed credible to say: I have a wound in uterus, from where blood is emerging. the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: And if the blood of her wound is different from the blood of her sighting, she is not suspended, and a woman is believed to say, "I have a wound from which blood is coming out." This is the statement of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רשב"ג אומר דם מכה הבא מן המקור טמא ורבותינו העידו על דם המכה הבא מן המקור שהוא טהור
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Blood of a wound that comes from the uterus is ritually impure But our Sages testified with regard to blood of a wound that comes from the uterus, that it is ritually pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: "The blood of a wound that comes from the source is impure." And our Rabbis testified regarding the blood of a wound that comes from the source, that it is pure.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר עולא מקור מקומו טמא איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What is between Ulla said: between them is place of uterus is impure,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Ula said: The source, its place is impure, that is the difference between them.

hebrew_text: שפופרת אפגורי מפגרא לה אמר שמואל בשפופרת של אבר ופיה רצוף לתוכה
human_translation: a tube, scratch her Shmuel said: to a tube of lead, and the mouth, is folded inward
llm_translation: Shofarot Apugori m'Pigra la, amar Shmuel b'Shofarot shel Eiver u'Peh ratzuf l'tokha.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ריש לקיש לרבי יוחנן ותבדוק עצמה בביאה שלישית של בעל הראשון אמר ליה לפי שאין כל האצבעות שוות
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: But let her examine herself after the third intercourse with her first husband, said to him: because not all fingers, are equal.
llm_translation: Rish Lakish said to Rabbi Yochanan, "And she shall be examined in the third stage of the first husband." He said to him, "Because not all fingers are equal."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ותבדוק עצמה בביאה ראשונה של בעל שלישי לפי שאין כל הכחות שוות
human_translation: said to But let her examine herself after the first intercourse with her third husband. because not all forces are equal.
llm_translation: He said to him, "And examine herself in the first intercourse of a trichiliac husband, for not all strengths are equal."

hebrew_text: ההיא דאתאי לקמיה דרבי אמר ליה לאבדן זיל בעתה אזל בעתה ונפל ממנה חררת דם אמר רבי נתרפאה זאת
human_translation: a certain who came before Rabbi said to Abdon, Go frighten went frightened her, and a mass blood fell from her Rabbi said: This cured.
llm_translation: That which came before Rabbi, he said to him, "Go at her time, go at her time, and a drop of blood fell from her." Rabbi said, "This one is healed."

hebrew_text: ההיא אתתא דאתאי לקמיה דמר שמואל אמר ליה לרב דימי בר יוסף זיל בעתה אזל בעתה ולא נפל ממנה ולא מידי אמר שמואל זו ממלאה ונופצת היא וכל הממלאה ונופצת אין לה תקנה
human_translation: a certain who came before Shmuel. said to Rav Dimi bar Yosef: Go frighten went frightened her, but nothing fell from her at all. Shmuel said: This is filled which falls And any is filled that falls has no cure.
llm_translation: That woman who came before Mar Samuel, he said to Rav Dimi bar Yosef, "Go, at this time she went, at this time, and nothing fell from her, and nothing." Samuel said, "This is a full and bursting one, and all that is full and bursting has no remedy."

hebrew_text: ההיא דאתאי לקמיה דרבי יוחנן דכל אימת דהות סלקא מטבילת מצוה הות קחזיא דמא א"ל שמא דימת עיריך עלתה ביך לכי והבעלי לו ע"ג הנהר
human_translation: a certain who came before Rabbi Yoḥanan that every time she emerged from immersion mitzva she would see blood said to her: Perhaps the gossip in your city, has reached you, Go and engage in intercourse with on the bank of the river,
llm_translation: That which came before Rabbi Yochanan, whenever she would come up from immersing in a ritual bath, she would see a drop of blood. He said to her, "Perhaps your city's blood has risen in you. Go and bring a sacrifice for the river."

hebrew_text: איכא דאמר אמר לה תגלי לחברותיך כי היכי דתהוו עליך להך גיסא נתהוו עלך להך גיסא ואיכא דאמר אמר לה גלי לחברותיך כי היכי דלבעו עליך רחמים דתניא (ויקרא יג, מה) וטמא טמא יקרא צריך להודיע צערו לרבים ורבים מבקשים עליו רחמים
human_translation: Some say said to her: Reveal to your friends, so that who were you on this side, will be you on that side, And some say said to her: Reveal to your friends, in order that they will pray for mercy for you, as it is taught and will cry: Impure, impure” must announce his pain to the masses, and the masses will pray for mercy on his
llm_translation: There are some who say, he said to her, "Reveal to your companions, so that they will be upon you for that side, they will be upon you for that side." And there are some who say, he said to her, "Reveal to your companions, so that they will seek mercy for you, as it is taught (Leviticus 13:45), 'And the one with tzara'at shall call out, unclean, unclean,' he must make his suffering known to the public, and many will seek mercy for him."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף הוה עובדא בפומבדיתא ואתסי
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: There was incident in Pumbedita and she was cured.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: There was an incident in Pumbedita, and it happened as follows:

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף אמר רב יהודה אמר רב התקין רבי בשדות ראתה יום אחד תשב ששה והוא
human_translation: Rav Yosef says Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Rabbi decreed in the fields, she saw one day, she must sit six and that
llm_translation: Said Rav Yosef, said Rav Yehudah, said Rav: Rabbi established in the fields, "One day you shall sit for six, and it is."

hebrew_text: שנים תשב ששה והן שלשה תשב שבעה נקיים
human_translation: two she must sit six and those three she must sit seven clean
llm_translation: Two sit, six, and they are three; two sit, seven, acquitted.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' זירא בנות ישראל החמירו על עצמן שאפילו רואות טפת דם כחרדל יושבות עליה שבעה נקיים
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: Jewish women were stringent with themselves that even if they see a drop of blood of a mustard sit seven clean for it.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: The daughters of Israel have been stringent upon themselves, that even if they see a drop of blood the size of a mustard seed, they sit upon it for seven clean days.

hebrew_text: אדבריה רבא לרב שמואל ודרש קשתה שני ימים ולשלישי הפילה תשב שבעה נקיים קסבר אין קשוי לנפלים ואי אפשר לפתיחת הקבר בלא דם
human_translation: Rava authorized Rav Shmuel, and he taught: labor pains two days, and on the third she miscarried, she must sit seven clean holds labor pains not to miscarriages. And it is impossible for the womb to open without blood
llm_translation: Rava spoke to Rav Shmuel and expounded: "Her bow remained steady, her arms were made firm by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob" (Genesis 49:24). He holds that there is no difficulty for the fallen, and it is impossible to open the grave without blood.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב פפא לרבא מאי אריא קשתה שני ימים אפילו משהו בעלמא דהא א"ר זירא בנות ישראל החמירו על עצמן שאפילו רואות טפת דם כחרדל יושבות עליה שבעה נקיים
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: what specifically labor pains two days? Even merely any amount as Rabbi Zeira says: The Jewish women were stringent with themselves that even if they see a drop of blood of a mustard sits seven clean for it.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava: What is the meaning of "A lioness, she crouches; in the midst of lions, she raises her cubs"? (Genesis 49:9) Even a small amount in the world. For Rav Zeira said: The daughters of Israel were stringent upon themselves, that even if they see a drop of blood the size of a mustard seed, they sit for seven clean days.

hebrew_text: א"ל אמינא לך איסורא ואת אמרת מנהגא היכא דאחמור אחמור היכא דלא אחמור לא אחמור
human_translation: said to I speak to you a prohibition, and you speak to me a custom, Where were stringent, they were stringent, Where they were not stringent, they were not stringent.
llm_translation: He said to him, "I say to you, 'Isura,' and you say, 'Minhag.' Where it is strict, it is strict; where it is not strict, it is not strict."

hebrew_text: (תבעוה נתר בחמין לטבול קמטים ע"ג נמל סי') אמר רבא תבעוה לינשא ונתפייסה צריכה שתשב שבעה נקיים
human_translation: a mnemonic One who proposed to her; natron; with hot to immerse; folds; on top of; a port. Rava says: one who proposed marriage to and she accepted it, she must wait seven clean
llm_translation: He demanded a heifer in hot water to dip bundles of reeds on top of an ant mound. Rava said: If he demanded it to marry, and she consented, she must wait seven clean days.

hebrew_text: רבינא איעסק ליה לבריה בי רב חנינא א"ל סבר ליה מר למכתב כתובה לארבעה יום א"ל אין כי מטא לארבעה נטר עד ארבעה אחרינא איעכב שבעה יומי בתר ההוא יומא
human_translation: Ravina arranged for his son the family of Rav Ḥanina, said to Does the Master hold to write the marriage contract in four days, said: Yes. When fourth arrived, he waited until another fourth he delayed seven days after that day
llm_translation: Ravina was dealing with his son in the house of Rav Chanina. He said to him, "The master thought to write a document for four days." He said to him, "No, when it comes to four, watch until four more." He was delayed for seven days after that day.

hebrew_text: א"ל מאי האי א"ל לא סבר לה מר להא דרבא דאמר רבא תבעוה לינשא ונתפייסה צריכה לישב שבעה נקיים א"ל אימר דאמר רבא בגדולה דקחזיא דמא אבל בקטנה דלא חזיא דמא מי אמר
human_translation: said to What is this? said to Doesn’t the Master hold in accordance with this of Rava, as Rava said: one who proposed marriage to and she accepted it, she must wait seven clean said to say that Rava said with regard to an adult woman, who has seen blood. But did say with regard to a minor girl, who has not seen blood?
llm_translation: He said to him, "What is this?" He said to him, "The master does not agree with that of Rava, for Rava said: If a woman demands to marry, and she is appeased, she needs to sit for seven clean days." He said to him, "Say what Rava said in the case of a grown woman, where the blood is visible, but in the case of a young girl where the blood is not visible, did he say this?"

hebrew_text: א"ל בפירוש אמר רבא ל"ש גדולה לא שנא קטנה גדולה טעמא מאי משום דמחמדא קטנה נמי מחמדא
human_translation: said to Rava said explicitly no difference an adult woman no difference a minor girl. What is the reason an adult woman because she desires A minor girl also desires
llm_translation: He said to him explicitly, Rava said: "Not different is great, not different is small. The reason? What is it? Because beloved is small, beloved is great."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אשה
human_translation: Rava says: A woman
llm_translation: Rava said: A woman.

hebrew_text: לא תחוף לא בנתר ולא בחול בנתר משום דמקטף ובחול משום דמסריך
human_translation: may not wash with natron or with sand. with natron because pulls out And with sand, because it sticks
llm_translation: Do not sweep neither with a winnowing shovel nor with a regular shovel; with a winnowing shovel because it picks up, and with a regular shovel because it smooths.

hebrew_text: ואמר אמימר משמיה דרבא אשה לא תחוף אלא בחמין אבל לא בצונן ואפילו בחמי חמה צונן מאי טעמא לא משום דקרירי ומשרו מזייא
human_translation: And Ameimar said in the name of Rava: A woman washes only with hot but not with cold But even with hot sun. What is the reason not cold Because it is cold and hair to harden,
llm_translation: And said Amimar in the name of Rava: A woman should only smear oil with warm water, but not with cold water. And even with the heat of the sun, not with cold. What is the reason? Not because it is cold and causes baldness.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא לעולם ילמד אדם בתוך ביתו שתהא אשה מדיחה בית קמטיה במים מיתיבי בית הקמטים ובית הסתרים אינן צריכין לביאת מים
human_translation: And Rava says: A man should always teach in his house that a woman should rinse any place with creases, in water raises an objection Places with creases and concealed part do not require immersion in water.
llm_translation: And Rava said: A person should always teach within his home that a woman should rinse the creases of her house with water. It was raised: The house of creases and the house of hidden places do not require water to be brought.

hebrew_text: נהי דביאת מים לא בעינן מקום הראוי לביאת מים בעינן כדר' זירא דא"ר זירא כל הראוי לבילה אין בילה מעכבת בו ושאין ראוי לבילה בילה מעכבת בו
human_translation: Granted that they do not require immersion in water, we require a place that is suitable for immersion in water. in accordance with of Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira says: any suitable for mingling mingling is not indispensable for it, But any not suitable for mingling, mingling is indispensable for it,
llm_translation: We do not require a place suitable for bringing water, we require as Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rabbi Zeira: Anything suitable for soaking, soaking does not impede it, and anything not suitable for soaking, soaking impedes it.

hebrew_text: אמר רבין בר רב אדא אמר רבי יצחק מעשה בשפחתו של רבי שטבלה ועלתה ונמצא לה עצם חוצץ בין שיניה והצריכה רבי טבילה אחרת
human_translation: Ravin bar Rav Adda says Rabbi Yitzḥak says: an incident involving a maidservant of Rabbi who immersed and she ascended and a bone was found interposed between her teeth, and Rabbi required her another immersion.
llm_translation: Rabin bar Rav Adda said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: There was an incident with the maidservant of Rabbi, she immersed and emerged, and a bone was found lodged between her teeth, and Rabbi required her to undergo another immersion.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא טבלה ועלתה ונמצא עליה דבר חוצץ אם סמוך לחפיפה טבלה אינה צריכה לחוף ולטבול ואם לאו צריכה לחוף ולטבול
human_translation: And Rava says: immersed and ascended and found on her an item that interposes If she immersed soon washing she does not need to wash and immerse But if not she must wash and immerse
llm_translation: And Rava said: If a vessel was immersed and then something was found on it that obstructs, if it is adjacent to the rim, the vessel does not require scraping and immersion. But if not, it requires scraping and immersion.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אם באותו יום שחפפה טבלה אינה צריכה לחוף ולטבול ואם לאו צריכה לחוף ולטבול
human_translation: There are who state If she immersed on the same day that she washed she does not need to wash and to immerse But if not she must wash and immerse
llm_translation: There are those who say: If on that day she immersed, she does not need to rinse and immerse, but if not, she needs to rinse and immerse.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו למסמך לחפיפה טבילה למיחף ביממא ולמטבל בליליא
human_translation: What between between them with regard to washing close to immersion. with regard to washing during the day and immersing at night
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them for leaning, immersion for a doubtful case, immersion to join in the day, and immersion to join at night.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אשה לא תעמוד על גבי כלי חרס ותטבול סבר רב כהנא למימר טעמא מאי משום גזירת מרחצאות הא על גבי סילתא שפיר דמי
human_translation: Rava says: A woman may not stand on top of earthenware utensils and immerse. Rav Kahana thought to say: What is the reason because a decree bathhouses, permitted on top of a plank of wood
llm_translation: Rava said: A woman should not stand on top of a clay vessel and immerse. Rav Kahana thought to say: What is the reason? Is it because of the decree of baths? But on top of a rock is fine.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב חנן מנהרדעא התם טעמא מאי משום דבעית סילתא נמי בעיתא
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan from Neharde’a said to there, what is the reason because she afraid she also afraid a plank of wood,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Hanan of Nehardea: There, the reason is what? Because you need flour, you also need salt.

hebrew_text: אמר רב שמואל בר רב יצחק אשה לא תטבול
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: A woman may not immerse
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said: A woman should not immerse.

hebrew_text: בנמל אע"ג דהשתא ליכא אימר ברדיוני נפל
human_translation: in a port [ banamal ], Even though now, there is no say while she walked fell
llm_translation: In the ant, even though now there is no leader, the drop fell.

hebrew_text: אבוה דשמואל עבד לבנתיה מקוואות ביומי ניסן ומפצי ביומי תשרי
human_translation: Shmuel’s father prepared ritual baths for his daughters in the days of Nisan, and mats in the days of Tishrei.
llm_translation: Father of Shmuel would build mikvaot for his daughters in the days of Nisan and dismantle them in the days of Tishrei.

hebrew_text: אמר רב גידל אמר רב נתנה תבשיל לבנה וטבלה ועלתה לא עלתה לה טבילה אף על גב דהשתא ליכא אימר ברדיוני נפל
human_translation: Rav Giddel says Rav says: gave a cooked to her son, and immersed and ascended immersion is ineffective for her. even though now, there is no say as she walked fell
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said, Rav Natan said: If a dish was cooked, whitened, and ascended, but did not ascend for it immersion, even though now there is no saying "it fell into a radiony,"

hebrew_text: אמר רמי בר אבא הני רבדי דכוסילתא עד תלתא יומי לא חייצי מכאן ואילך חייצי
human_translation: Rami bar Abba said: these bloodletting incisions [ ravdei dekhusilta ], until three days not interpose From this forward they interpose,
llm_translation: Rami bar Abba said: These raday of Kusilta do not live for three days. From here and onwards, they live.

hebrew_text: אמר מר עוקבא לפלוף שבעין לח אינו חוצץ יבש חוצץ אימתי נקרא יבש משעה שמתחיל לירק
human_translation: Mar Ukva said: mucus that is in the eye, moist, it does not interpose dry it interposes. When is it called dry? from the time that it begins to turn yellow.
llm_translation: Said Mar Ukva to P'luf: "Seven eye-fulls of liquid do not constitute a barrier. A dry barrier, when is it called dry? From the moment it begins to crust."

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל כחול שבתוך העין אינו חוצץ ושעל גבי העין חוצץ אם היו עיניה פורחות אפי' על גבי העין אינו חוצץ
human_translation: Shmuel says: Eye shadow that is in the eye does not interpose But that is on the eye interposes. if eyes were blinking, even that is on the eye does not interpose,
llm_translation: Said Shmuel: "The white of the eye is not a barrier when inside the eye, but is a barrier when on the surface of the eye. Even if the eyes are blooming, it is not a barrier even on the surface of the eye."

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן פתחה עיניה ביותר או עצמה עיניה ביותר לא עלתה לה טבילה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: opened her eyes very or closed her eyes very immersion is ineffective for her.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: If she opened her eyes excessively or closed her eyes excessively, immersion is not effective for her.

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש האשה לא תטבול אלא דרך גדילתה כדתנן האיש נראה כעודר ומוסק זיתים אשה נראת כאורגת וכמניקה את בנה
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: A woman may immerse only in the manner that she grows, As we learned a man appear like hoeing, and harvesting olives, a woman appear like weaving, and like nursing her son.
llm_translation: Rabbi Reish Lakish said: "A woman should immerse only in the manner of her weaving, as we have learned: A man appears like a plower and a gatherer of olives, while a woman appears like a weaver and one who nurses her child."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר רב הונא נימא אחת קשורה חוצצת
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says: A single hair tied interposes
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: "Nayma is one that is tied and severs."

hebrew_text: שלש אינן חוצצות שתים איני יודע ור' יוחנן אמר אנו אין לנו אלא אחת
human_translation: Three do not interpose, two I do not know And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: We have only one
llm_translation: Three not are they partitions. Two not I know. And Rabbi Yochanan said, "We have only one."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יצחק דבר תורה רובו המקפיד עליו חוצץ רובו ואינו מקפיד עליו אינו חוצץ וגזרו על רובו שאינו מקפיד משום רובו המקפיד וגזרו על מיעוטו המקפיד משום רובו המקפיד
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: By Torah law, the majority of his he is particular it interposes majority of his but he is not particular about it does not interpose. But issued a decree the majority his which he is not particular, due to the majority his which he is particular. And the minority his particular, due to the majority his particular.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak: A matter of Torah, its majority one who insists upon it, it divides its majority, and one who does not insist upon it, it does not divide. And they decreed regarding its majority that one who does not insist because of its majority, and they decreed regarding its minority that one who insists because of its majority.

hebrew_text: ולגזור נמי על מיעוטו שאינו מקפיד משום מיעוטו המקפיד היא גופה גזרה ואנן ניקום ונגזור גזרה לגזרה
human_translation: But let them also issue a decree the minority his which he is not particular, due to the minority his particular. is itself decree, and will we arise and issue a decree to decree?
llm_translation: And also to decree upon its minority that does not care because of its minority, the one who cares, her decree is a decree, and we will take revenge and decree a decree upon a decree.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נדה בזמנה אינה טובלת אלא בלילה ושלא בזמנה טובלת בין ביום בין בלילה רבי יוחנן אמר בין בזמנה בין שלא בזמנה אינה טובלת אלא בלילה משום סרך בתה
human_translation: Rav says: A menstruating woman at her time, may immerse only at night, But not at her time, may immerse either during the day or at night. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Whether at her time or not at her time, may immerse only at night. because her daughter follow
llm_translation: Rav said: A woman in her menstrual impurity immerses only at night during her designated time, and if not during her designated time, she immerses whether by day or by night. Rabbi Yochanan said: Whether during her designated time or not during her designated time, she immerses only at night due to the concern for her daughter's reputation.

hebrew_text: ואף רב הדר ביה דאמר רבי חייא בר אשי אמר רב נדה בין בזמנה בין שלא בזמנה אינה טובלת אלא בלילה משום סרך בתה
human_translation: And even Rav retracted As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: A menstruating woman whether at her time whether not at her time, may immerse only at night, because her daughter follow
llm_translation: And Rav Hadrin inquired of him, for Rabbi Chiya bar Ashi said in the name of Rav: A menstruating woman, whether it is her designated time or not, may only immerse at night due to the issue of her daughter.

hebrew_text: אתקין רב אידי בנרש למטבל ביומא דתמניא משום אריותא רב אחא בר יעקב בפפוניא משום גנבי
human_translation: Rav Idi decreed in Neresh that may immerse on the eighth day due to the lions Rav Aḥa bar Yaakov in Pappunya due to thieves
llm_translation: Rav Idi established in the town of Nersha to immerse on the day of the 8th day because of lions. Rav Acha bar Yaakov in Pappunya because of thieves.

hebrew_text: רב יהודה בפומבדיתא משום צנה רבא במחוזא משום אבולאי
human_translation: Rav Yehuda in Pumbedita due to cold Rava in Meḥoza due to gatekeepers [ abula’ei ],
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah in Pumbedita on account of Tsena, Rava in Mahoza on account of Avulai.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב פפא לרבא ולאביי מכדי האידנא כולהו ספק זבות שוינהו רבנן ליטבלינהו ביממא דשביעאה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava and to Abaye: Since nowadays the Sages have given an uncertain zava , may they immerse on the seventh day
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava and Abaye: Since today all of them are doubtful cases of zavot, the Rabbis have instructed to immerse them on the seventh day.

hebrew_text: משום דרבי שמעון דתניא (ויקרא טו, כח) אחר תטהר אחר אחר לכולן שלא תהא טומאה מפסקת ביניהן ר' שמעון אומר אחר תטהר אחר מעשה תטהר
human_translation: due to of Rabbi Shimon. As it is taught and after that she shall be pure” after after all of the that there are no impurity separating between Rabbi Shimon says “And after that she shall be pure” after the action she shall be pure.
llm_translation: Because Rabbi Shimon taught (Leviticus 15:28), "Afterward you shall purify," "after" for all of them, so that impurity shall not separate between them. Rabbi Shimon says, "After you shall purify," "after" means the act of purification.

hebrew_text: אבל אמרו חכמים אסור לעשות כן שמא תבא לידי ספק
human_translation: But the Sages said: It is prohibited to do so, lest she come to uncertainty.
llm_translation: But the sages said, it is forbidden to do so, lest it lead to doubt.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא אשה חופפת באחד בשבת וטובלת בשלישי בשבת שכן אשה חופפת בערב שבת וטובלת במוצאי שבת
human_translation: Rav Huna says: A woman may wash on the first of the week, and immerse on the third of the week, that a woman washes on the eve of Shabbat, but immerse the conclusion of Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A woman may clap with one hand on Shabbat and immerse on the third day of Shabbat, for a woman claps on Erev Shabbat and immerses on Motza'ei Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אשה חופפת באחד בשבת וטובלת ברביעי בשבת שכן אשה חופפת בערב שבת וטובלת במוצאי יו"ט שחל להיות אחר השבת
human_translation: a woman may wash on the first of the week, and immerse on the fourth of the week, that a woman washes on the eve of Shabbat, but immerse the conclusion of the Festival that occurs after Shabbat,
llm_translation: A woman wraps in one cloth on Shabbat and immerses on the fourth day of Shabbat, for so a woman wraps on Erev Shabbat and immerses on the night after Yom Tov that falls after Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אשה חופפת באחד בשבת וטובלת בחמישי בשבת שכן אשה חופפת בערב שבת וטובלת במוצאי שני ימים טובים של ראש השנה שחל להיות אחר השבת
human_translation: a woman may wash on the first of the week, and immerse on the fifth of the week, that a woman washes on the eve of Shabbat, but immerse the conclusion of two days of Rosh HaShana that occurs after Shabbat,
llm_translation: A woman wraps herself in one garment on Shabbat and immerses on Thursday on Shabbat, for so a woman wraps herself on Erev Shabbat and immerses on the night following the two good days of Rosh Hashanah that fall after Shabbat.

hebrew_text: ורב חסדא אמר כולהו אמרינן שכן לא אמרינן היכא דאפשר אפשר היכא דלא אפשר לא אפשר
human_translation: But Rav Ḥisda said: We say all of these we do not say that Where it is possible it is possible, where it is not possible it is impossible,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: We say all of them, that is, we do not say where it is possible, it is possible, and where it is not possible, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: ורב יימר אמר אפילו שכן נמי אמרינן לבר מאשה חופפת באחד בשבת וטובלת בחמישי בשבת דלמוצאי שני ימים טובים של ראש השנה שלאחר השבת ליתא דאפשר דחופפת בלילה וטובלת בלילה
human_translation: And Rav Yeimar said: We even say that apart from a woman who washes on the first of the week, and immerses on the fifth of the week, from the conclusion of two days of Rosh HaShana that is after Shabbat is not as it is possible to wash at night and immerse that night,
llm_translation: And Rav Yeymar said, even so, we also say to a son of a woman, she slaps him on Shabbat and immerses on Thursday on Shabbat, perhaps she will find two good days of Rosh Hashanah after Shabbat, it is not possible that she slaps at night and immerses at night.

hebrew_text: דרש מרימר הלכתא כרב חסדא וכדמתרץ רב יימר
human_translation: Mareimar taught: The halakha is in accordance with Rav Ḥisda, And in accordance with which Rav Yeimar explains
llm_translation: Marimar expounded: The halakha is in accordance with Rav Ḥisda, and as Rav Yeimar interpreted.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו אשה מהו שתחוף בלילה ותטבול בלילה מר זוטרא אוסר ורב חיננא מסורא שרי
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is a woman may wash at night and immerse on night? Mar Zutra deems it prohibited And Rav Ḥinnana from Sura deems it permitted
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: What is the ruling if a woman immerses at night and then immerses again at night? Mar Zutra prohibits it, and Rav Chinana of Sura permits it.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אדא [לרב חיננא מסורא] לאו הכי הוה עובדא בדביתהו דאבא מרי ריש גלותא דאיקוט אזל ר"נ בר יצחק לפיוסה ואמרה ליה מאי איתיה השתא
human_translation: Rav Adda said to Rav Ḥinnana from Sura: Was not an incident this involving the wife of Abba Mari, the Exilarch, who quarreled Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak went to appease her and she said to him: What is there now?
llm_translation: Rav Adda said to Rav Chinana of Sura: Is it not so that an incident occurred in the house of the Exilarch Abba the Master of the Exile, that a certain person went to Rava bar Yitzchak to appease her, and she said to him, "What is the matter now?"

hebrew_text: תסגי אייתי למחר וידע מאי קאמרה ליה אמר דודי חסרת טשטקי חסרת עבדי חסרת
human_translation: it is sufficient if you come tomorrow And knew what she was saying to him. said Are you lacking kettles [ dudei ] Are you lacking buckets [ tashtekei ] Are you lacking servants,
llm_translation: "Tasgei aiti l'machar v'yada mai kamarah lei. Amar dodi chasart tishtakei chasart avdei chasart."

hebrew_text: דרש רבא אשה חופפת בערב שבת וטובלת במוצאי שבת אמר ליה רב פפא לרבא והא שלח רבין באגרתיה אשה לא תחוף בערב שבת ותטבול במוצאי שבת
human_translation: Rava taught: A woman may wash on the eve of Shabbat and immerse at the conclusion of Shabbat. Rav Pappa said to Rava: But didn’t Ravin send in his letter: A woman may not wash on the eve of Shabbat and immerse at the conclusion of Shabbat?
llm_translation: Rava expounded: A woman may clap on Erev Shabbat and immerse on Motzaei Shabbat. Rav Pappa said to Rava: But didn't Ravin send in his letter, "A woman should not clap on Erev Shabbat and immerse on Motzaei Shabbat"?

hebrew_text: ותמה על עצמך היאך חופפת ביום וטובלת בלילה הא בעינן תכף לחפיפה טבילה וליכא
human_translation: And be astounded with yourself: How wash during the day and immerse at night? Don’t we require immersion immediately washing And not
llm_translation: And he wondered about himself, how he wraps during the day and immerses at night. Do we require immediate immersion after wrapping, and there isn't?

hebrew_text: הדר אוקי רבא אמורא עליה ודרש דברים שאמרתי לפניכם טעות הן בידי ברם כך אמרו משמיה דרבי יוחנן אשה לא תחוף בערב שבת ותטבול במוצאי שבת ותמה על עצמך היאך חופפת ביום וטובלת בלילה הא בעינן סמוך לחפיפה טבילה וליכא
human_translation: Rava then appointed an interpreter before him and taught: The statement I said to you was a mistake of mine. But this said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A woman may not wash on the eve of Shabbat and immerse after the conclusion of Shabbat. And be astounded with yourself. How wash during the day and immerse at night? Don’t we require: immersion immediately washing And not
llm_translation: Rava, an Amora, returned and said: "The words that I said before you are mistaken in my hands, but nevertheless, so they said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A woman should not wash herself on Friday evening and immerse on Saturday night. And wonder upon yourself, how do you wash during the day and immerse at night? We require that immersion be close to washing, and here it is not so."

hebrew_text: והלכתא אשה חופפת ביום וטובלת בלילה והלכתא אשה לא תחוף אלא בלילה (אלא) קשיא הלכתא אהלכתא
human_translation: And the halakha a woman may wash during the day and immerse at night. And the halakha a woman may wash only at night. difficult, halakha the halakha .
llm_translation: The halakha is that a woman immerses during the day and immerses at night, and the halakha is that a woman should only immerse at night. This is a difficulty in the halakha.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא דאפשר הא דלא אפשר
human_translation: not difficult. This where it is possible, That where it is not possible,
llm_translation: It is not difficult. This one that is possible, and this one that is not possible.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נדה שבדקה עצמה יום שביעי שחרית ומצאה טהורה ובין השמשות לא הפרישה ולאחר ימים בדקה ומצאה טמאה הרי היא בחזקת טהורה
human_translation: a menstruating woman who examined herself seventh day the morning and found she is ritually pure but twilight did not transition and after days she examined found she is ritually impure, the presumptive status of that ritual purity
llm_translation: Mishnah: A woman who examined herself on the seventh day in the morning and found herself pure, and did not separate during the twilight, and after several days she examined herself and found herself impure, she remains in the presumption of purity.

hebrew_text: בדקה עצמה ביום שביעי שחרית ומצאה טמאה ובין השמשות לא הפרישה ולאחר זמן בדקה ומצאה טהורה הרי זו בחזקת טמאה
human_translation: she examined herself on seventh day the morning and found she is ritually impure, and twilight did not transition and after days she examined found she is ritually pure, the presumptive status of that ritual impurity
llm_translation: She checked herself on the seventh day in the morning and found herself impure, and between the sunsets she did not separate. And after some time she checked and found herself pure, behold, she is in the presumption of impurity.

hebrew_text: ומטמאה מעת לעת ומפקידה לפקידה ואם יש לה וסת דיה שעתה
human_translation: But she transmits ritual impurity for period and from examination to examination, And if she has cycle, her time is sufficient,
llm_translation: And she becomes impure from time to time, and she deposits from deposit to deposit, and if she has a "Veset" her time is fixed.

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה אומר כל שלא הפרישה בטהרה מן המנחה ולמעלה הרי זו בחזקת טמאה וחכמים אומרים אפילו בשנים לנדתה בדקה ומצאה טהורה ובין השמשות לא הפרישה ולאחר זמן בדקה ומצאה טמאה הרי זו בחזקת טהורה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda says: any who did not transition from minḥa onward, the presumptive status of that ritual impurity. And the Rabbis say: Even on the second of her menstruation she performed the examination and found she is ritually pure, and did not transition during twilight, and after days she examined and found she is ritually impure, the presumptive status of that ritual purity
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehudah says: Anyone who did not separate in purity from the Mincha offering and above, she is in the presumption of impurity. And the Sages say: Even if she checked twice for her menstruation and found herself pure, and she did not separate between the sunsets, and later she checked and found herself impure, she is in the presumption of purity.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ איתמר רב אמר זבה ודאי ולוי אמר זבה ספק
human_translation: was stated Rav says: a definite zava . And Levi says: an uncertain zava .
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: Rav said Zavah is definite, and Levi said Zavah is uncertain.

hebrew_text: אהייא אילימא ארישא הרי זו בחזקת טהורה קתני
human_translation: To which If we say to the first clause, teaches: The presumptive status of that woman ritual purity.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Ahiya ilima, ilaima arisha, hrei zu b'chezkat tahorah katani."

hebrew_text: אלא אסיפא בשלמא ספק זבה אמרינן אלא זבה ודאי נמי הרי בדקה ומצאה טהורה
human_translation: Rather, to the latter clause granted we say an uncertain zava . But even a definite zava ? she examined and found she is ritually pure.
llm_translation: Rather, the conclusion is as follows: Regarding a doubtful case of a woman with a discharge, we say she is indeed a woman with a discharge. If, however, she checked and found herself to be pure, then she is indeed pure.

hebrew_text: אלא כי איתמר דרב ולוי שמעתא באפי נפשה איתמר נדה שבדקה עצמה ביום השביעי שחרית ומצאה טמאה ובין השמשות לא הפרישה ולאחר ימים בדקה ומצאה טמאה רב אמר זבה ודאי ולוי אמר זבה ספק
human_translation: Rather, when of Rav and Levi was stated, was stated a distinct halakha a menstruating woman who examined herself on the seventh day the morning and found ritually impure, and twilight did not transition and after days she examined and found she is ritually impure, Rav says: a definite zava . And Levi says: an uncertain zava .
llm_translation: Rather, when it was stated: Rav and Levi heard a teaching with a heavy soul. It was stated: A menstruating woman who examined herself on the seventh day in the morning and found herself impure, and did not separate during the twilight periods. And after some days she examined herself and found herself impure. Rav said: She is definitely a zavah, and Levi said: She is a doubtful zavah.

hebrew_text: רב אמר זבה ודאי כיון דמעיקרא נמצאת טמאה ועכשיו נמצאת טמאה טמאה ודאי ולוי אמר ספק זבה אימר פסקה ביני וביני
human_translation: Rav says: a definite zava , since from the outset she found ritually impure, and now she found ritually impure. definitely impure. And Levi says: an uncertain zava , say she stopped in between
llm_translation: Rav said: A woman with a definite status of zavah, since initially she was found impure, and now she is found impure, she is definitely impure. And Levi said: In the case of a doubtful zavah, one should say, "Let there be a separation between me and you."

hebrew_text: וכן תנא לוי במתניתא אחר הימים בין בדקה ומצאה טהורה בין בדקה ומצאה טמאה הרי זו ספק זבה
human_translation: And Levi taught similarly in a baraita : after days whether she examined and found ritually pure whether she examined and found ritually impure, she is an uncertain zava .
llm_translation: And so taught Levi in a baraita: "After the days, whether he examined her and found her pure, or he examined her and found her impure, this is a doubtful case of a zavah."

hebrew_text: ומטמאה מעת לעת לימא תהוי תיובתא דרבא דאמר רבא לומר שאין האשה מטמאה מעת לעת בתוך ימי זיבתה
human_translation: But she transmits ritual impurity for period. Let us say that it is a conclusive refutation of Rava, as Rava said, to say that a woman does not transmit ritual impurity for period during her days of ziva .
llm_translation: And she becomes impure from time to time, let us say the refutation of Rava, for Rava said to say that a woman does not become impure from time to time within her days of ziva.

hebrew_text: ולאו אותביניה לרבא חדא זימנא הכי קאמרינן לימא תהוי תיובתא דרבא נמי מהא
human_translation: But didn’t a conclusive refutation of Rava one time, this is we are saying: Let us say that is a conclusive refutation of Rava from this as well.
llm_translation: And not did understand to Rava one time thus we are saying let be refutation of Rava also from this

hebrew_text: אמר לך רבא כי קתני מטמאה מעת לעת אריש פרקין קאי אראתה ועודה בבית אביה
human_translation: Rava said to you when teaches: She transmits ritual impurity for period, referring to the beginning of our chapter. of saw she was still in her father’s house.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: When it teaches that she becomes impure from time to time, the beginning of the chapter stands, "I saw her, and she was still in her father's house."

hebrew_text: סד"א כיון דמפסקי להו ימים טהורין כתחלת נדתה דמיא ולא תטמא מעת לעת קמ"ל
human_translation: enter your mind to say since interrupted days ritually pure, considered like the beginning of her menstruation, and she does not transmit ritual impurity for period. teaches us
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "S'da, since they have separated for them pure days like the beginning of her menstrual impurity, it is similar, and she shall not become impure from time to time. This teaches us."

hebrew_text: אם יש לה וסת נימא תהוי תיובתא דרב הונא בר חייא אמר שמואל דאמר רב הונא בר חייא אמר שמואל לומר שאין האשה קובעת לה וסת בימי זיבתה
human_translation: if she has a fixed cycle Shall we say is a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya, Shmuel says? As Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya says Shmuel says, to say that a woman does not establish a fixed cycle during her days of ziva .
llm_translation: If she has a veset, say the refutation of Rav Huna bar Chiya. Shmuel said, for Rav Huna bar Chiya said in the name of Shmuel, to say that a woman does not establish a veset during her zivah days.

hebrew_text: אמר לך רב הונא בר חייא כי אמרינן אין אשה קובעת לה וסת בימי זיבתה דלא בעיא תלתא זימני למיעקר דאמרינן דמיה מסולקין וכיון דדמיה מסולקין דיה שעתה
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya said to you: When we say a woman does not establish cycle during her days of ziva , that not require three times to uproot As we say her blood is removed And since her blood is removed, is sufficient for her hour
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chiya said to you: When we say a woman does not establish a fixed time for her menstrual impurity, it is not necessary for her to check three times during her zivah days, for we say that her blood is removed. And since her blood is removed, she is now clean.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר תניא אמרו לו לר' יהודה אלמלי ידיה מונחות בעיניה כל בין השמשות יפה אתה אומר
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: is taught said to Rabbi Yehuda: had hands placed in her eyes, the entire twilight you say is fine.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It was taught in a Baraita: They said to Rabbi Yehuda, "If her hands are resting in her eyes, every sunset is beautiful in her eyes."

hebrew_text: עכשיו אימר עם סלוק ידיה ראתה מה לי הפרישה בטהרה בז' מן המנחה ולמעלה מה לי הפרישה בטהרה בראשון
human_translation: now say when she removed her hand she saw what to me transition to ritual purity on the seventh from minḥa onward, what to me transition to ritual purity on the first
llm_translation: Now, say: with the removal of her hand, she saw - what is the significance of separation in purity from the seventh hour and onwards? And what is the significance of separation in purity from the first hour?

hebrew_text: בראשון מי איכא למאן דאמר
human_translation: on the first Is there one who said
llm_translation: In the first case, who is there to agree with the one who said...

hebrew_text: אין והתניא אמר רבי שאלתי את רבי יוסי ור' שמעון כשהיו מהלכים בדרך נדה שבדקה עצמה יום ז' שחרית ומצאה טהורה ובין השמשות לא הפרישה ולאחר הימים בדקה ומצאה טמאה מהו
human_translation: Yes, as it is taught Rabbi says: I asked Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon when they were walking on the road: a menstruating woman who examined herself seventh day the morning and found ritually pure, but at twilight not transition and after days she examined and found ritually impure, what is
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, v'hateina amar Rabbi. Sha'alti et Rabbi Yossi v'Rabbi Shimon k'shehayu m'halechim b'derech niddah shebadakah atzma yom zayin shacharit u'matz'ah tahorah u'bein hashemashot lo hafri'sha v'lachar hayamim bad'kah u'matz'ah tamei, mah hu." English translation: "There is, and it was taught: Rabbi said, I asked Rabbi Yossi and Rabbi Shimon when they were walking on the road, a woman who checked herself on the seventh day in the morning and found herself pure, and between the sunsets she did not separate. And after some days she checked and found herself impure, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: אמרו לו הרי זו בחזקת טהרה ששי חמישי רביעי שלישי שני מאי א"ל לא שנא
human_translation: said to him: She has a presumptive status of ritual purity sixth fifth fourth third second what said to him: is no different.
llm_translation: They said to him: "This one is in the presumption of purity. Sixth, fifth, fourth, third, second. What did he say to them? Not different."

hebrew_text: בראשון לא שאלתי וטעיתי שלא שאלתי אטו כולהו לאו בחזקת טומאה קיימי וכיון דפסק פסק ראשון נמי כיון דפסק פסק
human_translation: I did not ask on the first and I erred that I did not ask Is that to say all she was not standing with a presumptive of ritual impurity? And once stopped, stopped, first too, once stopped, stopped,
llm_translation: In the first instance I did not inquire and erred, for I did not inquire. Are all of them not considered in a state of impurity? And once the first ruling was decided, the first ruling is also considered decided.

hebrew_text: ומעיקרא מאי סבר הואיל והוחזק מעין פתוח
human_translation: And initially, what hold? since she has a presumptive status spring, is open,
llm_translation: And from the outset, what does he hold? Since it was established as an open wound.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הזב והזבה שבדקו עצמן ביום ראשון ומצאו טהור וביום השביעי ומצאו טהור ושאר ימים שבינתיים לא בדקו רבי אליעזר אומר הרי הן בחזקת טהרה ר' יהושע אומר אין להם אלא יום ראשון ויום שביעי בלבד ר' עקיבא אומר אין להם אלא יום ז' בלבד
human_translation: a zav and a zava , who examined themselves on first day and found ritually pure, and on the seventh day and found ritually pure, and on the rest of the intervening days they did not examine Rabbi Eliezer says: The presumptive status of ritual purity. Rabbi Yehoshua says: have only the first day and the seventh day, Rabbi Akiva says: have only seventh day,
