llm_translation: Mishnah: The male zav and the female zavah who examined themselves on the first day and found themselves pure, and on the seventh day and found themselves pure, and the days in between they did not examine. Rabbi Eliezer says: Behold, they are in a presumption of purity. Rabbi Yehoshua says: They only have the obligation to examine on the first day and the seventh day. Rabbi Akiva says: They only have the obligation to examine on the seventh day alone.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תניא אמר לו רבי אליעזר לר' יהושע לדבריך אתה מונה בסירוגין והתורה אמרה (ויקרא טו, כח) אחר תטהר אחר אחר לכולן שלא תהא טומאה מפסקת ביניהן
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Eliezer said to Rabbi Yehoshua: According to your statement, you are counting at intervals, and the Torah states: and after that she shall be pure” after after all of the that there are no days of impurity separating between
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer said to Rabbi Yehoshua, "According to your words, you are counting with 'sirugin,' yet the Torah said, 'Afterward, you shall purify' (Leviticus 15:28), 'after' for all of them, so that impurity should not separate between them."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע ואתה אי אתה מודה בזב שראה קרי ובנזיר שהילך סככות ופרעות שמונה בסירוגין והתורה אמרה (במדבר ו, יב) והימים הראשונים יפלו
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: And you do you not concede with regard to a zav who experienced a seminal emission and with regard to a nazirite who walked overhanging boughs and protrusions that count at intervals, And the Torah states “But the former days shall be void,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him, "And you, do you not admit regarding a Zav who saw a seminal emission, and a Nazirite who walked under a canopy, and a woman who had eight miscarriages, with regard to the Torah stating (Numbers 5:12), 'And the earlier days shall fall'?"

hebrew_text: ורבי אליעזר בשלמא התם (ויקרא טו, לב) לטמאה בה אמר רחמנא שאינה סותרת אלא יומה ואי משום איחלופי זב בבעל קרי לא מיחלף
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer Granted, there the Merciful One states: so that he is thereby impure” that overturns only that day. And if due to confuse ziva not be confused with one who experienced a seminal emission.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, granted there (Leviticus 15:32) "to defile her with it," the Merciful One said that it does not contradict except her day, and if due to the interchange of a zav and a baal keri, he does not interchange.

hebrew_text: נזיר שהילך על גבי סככות ופרעות נמי מדאורייתא אהל מעליא בעינן ורבנן הוא דגזור ורבנן בדאורייתא לא מיחלף
human_translation: a nazirite who walked under overhanging boughs and protrusions also by Torah law we require a full-fledged tent and the Sages who decreed And by rabbinic law will not be confused by Torah law.
llm_translation: Nazarite that walked on top of Sukkot and Parot also from the Torah tent high we require and sages it is that decreed and sages in the Torah not exchange

hebrew_text: אבל הכא אי חיישינן דלמא חזאי בספק אתי לאיחלופי בודאי
human_translation: But here, if we are concerned perhaps she saw uncertain, come to confuse with certain
llm_translation: But here, if we are concerned that perhaps he will see a doubt, he may come to exchange it for certainty.

hebrew_text: תני ר' יוסי ור' שמעון אמרי נראין דברי רבי אליעזר מדברי רבי יהושע ודברי רבי עקיבא מדברי כולן אבל הלכה כרבי אליעזר
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: The statement of Rabbi Eliezer appears than the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua, and the statement of Rabbi Akiva than the statement of all of them. But halakha in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon said, "The words of Rabbi Eliezer appear similar to the words of Rabbi Joshua, and the words of Rabbi Akiva appear similar to the words of all of them, but the halacha follows Rabbi Eliezer."

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו הזב והזבה שבדקו עצמן יום ראשון ויום שמיני ומצאו טהור ושאר הימים לא בדקו
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a zav and a zava who examined themselves first day and eighth day and found pure, but not examine the remainder of the days,
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: A male zav and a female zavah, if they examined themselves on the first day and the eighth day and found themselves to be pure, but did not examine themselves on the other days.

hebrew_text: לרבי אליעזר מהו תחלתן וסופן בעינן והכא תחלתן איכא סופן ליכא או דילמא תחלתן אף על גב שאין סופן
human_translation: according to Rabbi Eliezer, what is Do we require the first and last of and here there is first there is no last Or perhaps first of even though there is no last
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer, what is their beginning and end we require, and here their beginning there is, their end there is not, or perhaps their beginning even though their end is not.

hebrew_text: אמר רב היא היא תחלתן אע"פ שאין סופן ורבי חנינא אמר תחלתן וסופן בעינן הכא תחלתן איכא סופן ליכא
human_translation: Rav said: This is that first of even though there is no last of And Rabbi Ḥanina said: We require the first and last of here there is first there is no last
llm_translation: Rav said: "It is it, it is their beginning, even though there is no end." And Rabbi Chanina said: "We require their beginning and their end." Here, their beginning exists, their end does not exist.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי ושוין בזב ובזבה שבדקו עצמן יום ראשון ויום שמיני ומצאו טהור שאין להם אלא שמיני בלבד מאן שוין לאו רבי אליעזר ורבי יהושע
human_translation: raises an objection And agree with regard to a zav and a zava who examined themselves first day and eighth day and found ritually pure, that they have only eighth Who agree not Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua?
llm_translation: The question was raised: And they are equal in the case of a male and a female afflicted with a discharge, who examined themselves on the first day and the eighth day and found themselves to be pure. They have only the eighth day as a day of purity. Who is the one who made them equal? Is it not Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Joshua.

hebrew_text: לא ר' יהושע ור' עקיבא
human_translation: No, Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Not Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת אמר רב ירמיה בר אבא אמר רב נדה שהפרישה בטהרה בשלישי שלה סופרתו למנין שבעה נקיים
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says Rav says: A menstruating woman who transition to ritual purity on her third counts of the number of seven clean
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba said, Rav Nidah who separated in purity on her third day, her count for the seven clean days.

human_translation: Why does a menstruating woman counting? Rather, say A zava who transition ritual purity on her third counts of the number of seven clean
llm_translation: Niddah, why is it called "Sapirah"? Rather say, a Zavah who separated in purity on her third day, her count is for the seven clean days.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב ששת לרב ירמיה בר אבא רב ככותאי אמרה לשמעתיה דאמרי יום שפוסקת בו סופרתו למנין ז'
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to Rav Yirmeya bar Abba: Rav say his halakha in accordance with the Samaritans, who say the day on which ceases counts toward number seven
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said to Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba: Rav Kakutai said in the name of those who say, "The day on which his scribe stops counting for the tally of the 27th."

hebrew_text: כי קאמר רב לבר משלישי בר משלישי פשיטא לא צריכא כגון דלא בדקה עד שביעי

human_translation: And teaching us There, at the beginning even though there is no end And here he teaches us end of even though there is no beginning of

human_translation: that lest you say we say at the beginning even though there is no end of as we establish in their presumptive status. But not end of even though there is no beginning of teaches us
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "their beginning," even though their end is not? It is because we say that they established them as permanent, but their end, even though their beginning is not, it does not teach us.

hebrew_text: איני והא כי אתא רבין אמר מתיב ר' יוסי ברבי חנינא טועה
human_translation: Is that so? But when Ravin came he said: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, raised an objection forgetful,
llm_translation: I am not. But when Ravin came, Rabbi Yossi, son of Rabbi Chanina, objected.

hebrew_text: ולא ידענא מאי תיובתיה דקי"ל שבוע קמא דאתיא לקמן בלילותא מטבלינן לה ביממא לא מטבלינן לה

llm_translation: We do not know what is the refutation of the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi that the first oath that will come in the future, we immerse it during the day; we do not immerse it at night.

hebrew_text: ואי ס"ד לא בעינן ספורין לפנינו ביממא נמי נטבלינה דילמא יולדת זכר בזוב היא ועבדה לה ספורין אלא לאו שמע מינה בעינן ספורין בפנינו
human_translation: And if it enters your mind we do not require counted before us, let us immerse also the daytime, perhaps she gave birth to a male during of ziva , and performed her counting Rather, not conclude from we require counted before us,
llm_translation: And if you will say we do not require the count before us by day, we also immerse them, lest she give birth to a male during her zavah, and she will need the count. Rather, it is not so; conclude from this that we require the count before us.

hebrew_text: ולאו מי אוקימנא כר"ע דאמר בעינן ספורין לפנינו
human_translation: But didn’t we interpret in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said we require counted before us?
llm_translation: And is it not established according to Rabbi Akiva who said, "We require witnesses before us"?

hebrew_text: ומנא תימרא דלרבנן לא בעינן ספורין לפנינו דתנן טועה שאמרה יום אחד טמא ראיתי מטבילין אותה ט' טבילות
human_translation: And from where do you say that according to the Rabbis we do not require counted before us? as we learned forgetful who said: I saw one day of impurity, her to immerse nine immersions.
llm_translation: And from where do we derive the opinion of the Rabbis that we do not require counting before us? For we learned: If a woman erred and said, "I saw one impure day," we immerse her nine immersions.

hebrew_text: ז' לנדה ותרי לזיבה בין השמשות טמא ראיתי מטבילין אותה י"א טבילות
human_translation: seven for menstruation, And two from ziva , I saw at twilight impure, her immerse eleven immersions.
llm_translation: Seven for menstruation and two for abnormal uterine bleeding, between the sunsets, impure, I saw them immerse her, eleven immersions.

hebrew_text: י"א מאי עבידתייהו אמר רב ירמיה מדפתי כגון שבאת לפנינו בין השמשות
human_translation: eleven what is their purpose? Rav Yirmeya of Difti said: where she came before us at twilight
llm_translation: "Eleven, what are they doing?" Rav Yirmeya said: "They are like one who comes before us between the suns."

hebrew_text: והויין תמני לנדה ותלת לזיבה
human_translation: eight from menstruation, and three from ziva .
llm_translation: And be eight for menstruation and three for abnormal uterine bleeding.

hebrew_text: לא ראיתי כל עיקר מטבילין אותה ט"ו טבילות אמר רבא האי דינא דלא דינא דייני בגלחי דאית ליה תורא לירעי חד יומא דלית ליה תורא לירעי תרי יומי
human_translation: I have not seen any at all, her to immerse fifteen immersions. Rava said, This halakha not halakha . they judge in Galaḥi. who has ox, he must shepherd one day, who does not have an ox must shepherd two days.
llm_translation: I have not seen any essential requirement for immersing it the vessel in a mikveh except for fifteen immersions. Rava said: This law is similar to the law of judges in Galilee, that if he has a Torah scroll to lend to one judge for a day, and he does not have a Torah scroll to lend to two judges for two days.

hebrew_text: אתרמי להו יתמא בר ארמלתא יהבי ליה תורי אזל נכסינהו אמר להו דאית ליה תורא לשקול חד משכא דלית ליה תורא לשקול תרי משכי אמרי ליה מאי האי דקאמרת אמר להו סוף דינא כתחלת דינא תחלת דינא לאו מאן דלית ליה עדיף סוף דינא נמי מאן דלית ליה עדיף
human_translation: There was an orphan the son of a widow [ armelata ], gave him their oxen went and slaughtered He said has an ox should take one skin, who does not have an ox should take two skins. said to What is this that you are saying, He said to them: The end of the law is like the beginning of the law: Isn’t the beginning of the law who has no is preferred, the end of the law, who has no is preferred
llm_translation: The Gemara: They imposed upon him a fine of one hundred dinars. They gave him to the son of Aramelta a Torah scroll. He went and pawned it. He said to them, "If he has a Torah, let him take one security. If he does not have a Torah, let him take two securities." They said to him, "What is this that you are saying?" He said to them, "The end of the judgment is like the beginning of the judgment. Just as the beginning of the judgment, whoever does not have a Torah is preferable, so too the end of the judgment, whoever does not have a Torah is preferable."

hebrew_text: הכא נמי ומה היכא דאמרה ראיתי סגי לה אי בתשע טבילות אי בי"א טבילות היכא דקאמרה איהי לא ראיתי בעיא חמש עשרה טבילות
human_translation: Here too And if where she says: I saw it is sufficient for her either nine immersions or eleven immersions, where she says: I did not see she requires fifteen immersions?
llm_translation: Here too, and where is it that she said, "I have seen enough for her"? If with nine immersions, if with eleven immersions. Where she said, "I have not seen enough," she requires fifteen immersions.

hebrew_text: אלא אימא הכי ראיתי ואיני יודע כמה ראיתי אי בימי נדה ראיתי או בימי זיבה ראיתי מטבילין אותה ט"ו טבילות אתאי קמן ביממא יהבינן לה שב לנדה
human_translation: Rather, say this I saw but I do not know how many I saw whether I saw during the days of menstruation or I saw during the days of ziva , her to immerse fifteen immersions. she comes before us during the daytime, we give her seven of menstruation.
llm_translation: Rather say thus: I saw, and I do not know how much I saw. Did I see during my menstrual period or during my abnormal uterine bleeding? We immerse her fifteen immersions. It was taught in front of us: during the day we give her a break for her menstrual period.

hebrew_text: ותמני לזיבה אתאי קמן בלילותא יהבינן לה תמני לנדה ושב לזיבה
human_translation: And eight from ziva , she comes before us at night, we give her eight from her menstruation, and seven from ziva .
llm_translation: And T'mani for Zivah came before us at night, we gave her eight for Niddah, and she returned to Zivah.

hebrew_text: זיבה תמני בעיא אלא אידי ואידי שב לנדה ותמני לזיבה
human_translation: ziva , requires eight Rather, this and that seven from menstruation, and eight from ziva .
llm_translation: Zivah tamni ba'aya ela idi ve'idi shav le'nidah ve'tamni le'zivah.

hebrew_text: בלילותא תמני לנדה בעי
human_translation: at night requires eight from menstruation.
llm_translation: In the nights, eight for a menstruating woman required.

hebrew_text: זיבה דפסיקא ליה דלא שנא כי אתיא קמן ביממא לא שנא כי אתיא קמן בליליא חשיב לה נדה דלא פסיקא ליה דכי אתיא קמן בלילותא בעי תמני ביממא לא קבעי תמני לא קחשיב לה
human_translation: ziva , which a distinct as there is no difference whether she comes before us during the day there is no difference whether she comes before us at night, counts menstruation, which cannot a distinct as when she comes before us at night she requires eight during the day not require eight did not count
llm_translation: The emission that interrupted him, it is not different when it comes during the day or when it comes during the night. It is considered like the impurity of a menstruating woman, as it did not interrupt him, for when it comes during the nights, it requires eight days, and when it comes during the days, it does not require eight days.

hebrew_text: ואי ס"ד ספורין לפנינו בעינן כל הני טבילות למה לי תספור ז' והדר תטבול אלא לאו שמע מינה רבנן היא דאמרי לא בעינן ספורין לפנינו
human_translation: And if it enters your mind we require counting before us, why do I all of these immersions? She count seven and afterward immerse. Rather, not conclude from this is the Rabbis, who say we do not require counting before us?
llm_translation: And if you will say, "We need to count before us all these immersions, why do I need to count seven and then immerse again?" Rather, it is not so. The Rabbis said, "We do not need to count before us."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרב יוסף לרב אשי לאו תרוצי קמתרצינן לה תריץ ואימא הכי ספרתי ואיני יודעת כמה ספרתי אם בימי נדה ספרתי ואם בימי זיבה ספרתי מטבילין אותה ט"ו טבילות
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi, didn’t you resolve resolve and say this: I counted but I do not know how many I counted, whether I counted during the days of menstruation or whether I counted during the days of ziva , her to immerse fifteen immersions.
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: "Do not be pleased, we are pleased with it." Let her count and say thus: "I have counted, and I do not know how much I have counted. If I counted during my menstrual period, I have counted, and if I counted during my zavah period, I have counted. They immerse her with fifteen immersions."

hebrew_text: ספרתי ואיני יודעת כמה ספרתי חד יומא מיהא אי אפשר דלא ספרה חסרה לה טבילה
human_translation: I counted but I do not know how many I counted, it is impossible that she did not count at least one day. she is lacking immersion,
llm_translation: I counted, and I do not know how many I counted. One day, in any case, it is impossible that she did not count one less for immersion.

hebrew_text: אלא אימא איני יודעת אם ספרתי אם לא ספרתי
human_translation: Rather, say I do not know if I counted or I did not count
llm_translation: Rather say, "I do not know if I counted or did not count."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הזב והזבה והנדה והיולדת והמצורע שמתו מטמאין במשא עד שימוק הבשר עובד כוכבים שמת טהור מלטמא
human_translation: a zav , and a zava , and a menstruating woman, and a woman after childbirth, and a leper, who died, transmit ritual impurity by carrying until the flesh decays. a gentile who died, ritually pure from transmitting impurity.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The zav, zavah, niddah, yoledet, and metzora, if they died, they render objects impure through carrying them until the flesh decays. A non-Jew, if he dies, is pure from impurity.

hebrew_text: בית שמאי אומרים כל הנשים מתות נדות וב"ה אומרים אין נדה אלא שמתה נדה
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: all women die menstruating women And Beit Hillel say: Only who died a menstruating woman a menstruating woman
llm_translation: Beit Shammai say: "All women are considered impure due to menstruation." And Beit Hillel say: "Only a woman who has died is considered impure due to menstruation."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי במשא אילימא במשא ממש אטו כל מת מי לא מטמא במשא
human_translation: What By carrying? If we say literally by carrying, Is that to say every corpse does not impart ritual impurity by carrying?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is meant by "in a burden"? If you say "in a burden" literally, then does not every dead body not render impure in a burden.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי במשא באבן מסמא
human_translation: Rather, what By carrying [ bemassa ]? through a very heavy stone [ even mesama ].
llm_translation: Rather, what is meant by "in a load, in a stone of blindness"?

hebrew_text: דכתיב (דניאל ו, יח) והיתית אבן חדא ושומת על פום גובא
human_translation: as it is written: “And a stone was brought and placed [ vesumat ] upon the mouth of the den;
llm_translation: As it is written (Daniel 2:45), "And as you saw a stone was cut out of the mountain."

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא אמר רב גזרה שמא יתעלפה
human_translation: What is the reason Rav said: a decree perhaps faint
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav said: A decree lest she become tempted.

hebrew_text: תנא משום ר' אליעזר אמרו עד שיבקע כריסו
human_translation: taught said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: until the belly bursts.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: They said, "Until his belly bursts."

hebrew_text: עובד כוכבים שמת [כו'] תניא אמר רבי מפני מה אמרו עובד כוכבים שמת טהור מלטמא במשא לפי שאין טומאתו מחיים מדברי תורה אלא מדברי סופרים
human_translation: a gentile who died, It is taught Rabbi said: For what did say a gentile who died is ritually pure from transmitting impurity by carrying? Because his impurity when alive is not by Torah law, but by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Idolater who died is it was taught Rabbi said why did they say idolater who died pure from impurity in a tent because his impurity is not from the living according to the words of the Torah but from the words of the Scribes.

hebrew_text: ת"ר שנים עשר דברים שאלו אנשי אלכסנדריא את רבי יהושע בן חיננא ג' דברי חכמה ג' דברי הגדה ג' דברי בורות ג' דברי דרך ארץ
human_translation: The Sages taught: The people of Alexandria asked twelve matters of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥinnana. Three matters of wisdom, three matters of aggada , three matters of ignorance, three matters of behavior.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Twelve matters the people of Alexandria asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: Three matters of wisdom, three matters of aggadah, three matters of halacha, and three matters of proper conduct.

hebrew_text: ג' דברי חכמה הזב והזבה והנדה והיולדת והמצורע שמתו עד מתי מטמאין במשא אמר להן עד שימוק הבשר
human_translation: Three matters of wisdom: a zav and a zava and a menstruating woman and a woman after childbirth and the leper, who died: Until when do they transmit ritual impurity by carrying? said to them: Until the flesh decays.
llm_translation: Three words of wisdom: the male zav, the female zavah, the menstruating woman, the woman who has given birth, and the metzora whose dead until when do they continue to render impure through carrying? He said to them, "Until the flesh decays."

hebrew_text: בת משולחת מה היא לכהן
human_translation: daughter sent away What her, with regard to a priest?
llm_translation: Daughter of a messenger what is she to a priest

hebrew_text: מי אמרינן קל וחומר ומה אלמנה לכ"ג שאין איסורה שוה בכל בנה פגום זו שאיסורה שוה בכל אינו דין שבנה פגום או דילמא מה לאלמנה לכהן גדול שהיא עצמה מתחללת
human_translation: Do we say an a fortiori And if a widow to a High Priest, whose prohibition does not apply to all, her son is flawed, this whose prohibition applies equally to all is it not right that her son flawed Or perhaps What about a widow married to a High Priest? that she herself is disqualified
llm_translation: We say a fortiori argument: Just as a widow to a commoner, whose prohibition is not equal in all her children, this one with a blemish, whose prohibition is equal in all, is not considered a blemished offspring. Or perhaps, what applies to a widow does not apply to a high priest, who himself is disqualified.

hebrew_text: אמר להן
human_translation: said to them:
llm_translation: He said to them

hebrew_text: היא תועבה ואין בניה תועבין
human_translation: she, is an abomination, but her children are not abominations.
llm_translation: She is an abomination, and her children are abominable.

hebrew_text: שני מצורעין שנתערבו קרבנותיהן זה בזה וקרב קרבנו של אחד מהן ומת אחד מהן השני מה תהא עליו
human_translation: Two lepers Their offerings became intermingled with each other, and the offering of one of them was sacrificed, and one of them died. What shall be with the second
llm_translation: Two metzora'im whose sacrifices became mixed with each other, and one of them offered his sacrifice and then died, what is the ruling regarding the other?

hebrew_text: אמר להן כותב נכסיו לאחרים והוי עני ומביא חטאת העוף הבא על הספק
human_translation: said to them: write his possessions to others, and he is destitute. And brings a bird sin offering, brought in uncertainty.
llm_translation: He said to them, "He writes his possessions to others and becomes poor, and brings a sin-offering of a bird that comes upon doubt."

hebrew_text: והאיכא אשם אמר שמואל כשקרב אשמו
human_translation: But there is guilt offering Shmuel says: where his guilt offering sacrificed,
llm_translation: And there is a guilt-offering, Shmuel said, "When his guilt-offering is brought near."

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת גברא רבה כשמואל לימא כי האי מילתא כמאן אי כר' יהודה דאמר אשם קבעה וכיון דקבעה לה אשם בעשירות לא מצי מייתי חטאת בדלות
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: a great man like Shmuel would say a statement like this? In accordance with whose If it is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who says guilt offering has fixed And once he fixed his guilt offering while he was wealthy, he may not bring sin offering when he is destitute.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, a great man like Shmuel should say: With regard to this matter, whose opinion should we follow? If we follow the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda who said that a guilt-offering is established, and once it is established as a guilt-offering in wealth, one cannot bring a sin-offering for poverty.

hebrew_text: דתנן מצורע שהביא קרבן עני והעשיר או עשיר והעני הכל הולך אחר חטאת דברי ר' שמעון
human_translation: As we learned a leper who brought an offering of a destitute person and he became wealthy, or a wealthy person and he became destitute, everything follows after sin offering; the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: A metzora who brought a poor person's offering and the rich person's offering, or the rich person's offering and the poor person's offering, in all cases, it follows the sin offering. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה אומר הכל הולך אחר אשם רבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר הכל הולך אחר צפורים
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda says: Everything, follows after guilt offering Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Everything follows after birds,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda says, "Everything follows the guilt-offering." Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, "Everything follows the birds."

hebrew_text: ואי כרבי שמעון דאמר חטאת קבעה אע"ג דלא קרב אשם ניתי אחר דהא שמעינן ליה לרבי שמעון דאמר לייתי ולתני
human_translation: And if in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said sin offering fixed Even if the guilt offering had not been sacrificed let him bring another As we have heard that Rabbi Shimon said: Let him bring and stipulate
llm_translation: And if you say like Rabbi Shimon who said a sin-offering is established even though he did not bring a guilt-offering, I come after to hear for Rabbi Shimon who said to bring and to teach.

hebrew_text: דתניא אמר ר"ש למחרת מביא אשמו ולוגו עמו ומעמידו בשער נקנור ומתנה עליו ואומר אם מצורע הוא הרי אשמו ולוגו עמו ואם לאו אשם זה יהא שלמי נדבה
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says, The following day, brings his guilt offering and his log with it, and stands him at the Gate of Nicanor, and stipulates with regard to and says: If this a leper, this is his guilt offering and his log with it. And if not, this a guilt offering shall be a voluntary peace offering,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon said, "On the next day, he brings his guilt-offering and his log of oil with him, and he stands at the Gate of Nicanor, and he waves it, and he says, 'If he is a leper, here is his guilt-offering and his log of oil with him; but if not, let this be an offering of voluntary giving.'"

hebrew_text: ואותו אשם טעון
human_translation: And that guilt offering requires
llm_translation: And that guilt offering requires.

hebrew_text: שחיטתו בצפון וטעון מתנת בהונות וסמיכה ונסכים ותנופה וחזה ושוק ונאכל לזכרי כהונה ליום ולילה
human_translation: its slaughter in the north and requires placement thumb and big toe and placing hands and libations and waving of the breast and thigh, And it is eaten by males of the priesthood for day and night,
llm_translation: Its slaughter in the north and requires the gifts of the priests and leaning of hands and libations and waving and breast and thigh and it is eaten by the male priests for a day and a night.

hebrew_text: ולא הודו לו חכמים לר' שמעון מפני שמביא קדשים לבית הפסול
human_translation: But the Rabbis did not concede to Rabbi Shimon, because brings sacrificial to a situation the disqualification,
llm_translation: And did not acknowledge to him the sages to Rabbi Shimon because he brings holy items to the disqualified house.

hebrew_text: שמואל סבר לה כרבי שמעון בחדא ופליג עליה בחדא
human_translation: Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to one but he disagrees with him with regard to one
llm_translation: Shmuel holds like Rabbi Shimon in one aspect, and disagrees with him in one aspect.

hebrew_text: שלשה דברי אגדה כתוב אחד אומר (יחזקאל יח, לב) כי לא אחפוץ במות המת וכתוב אחד אומר (שמואל א ב, כה) כי חפץ ה' להמיתם כאן בעושין תשובה כאן בשאין עושין תשובה
human_translation: three matters of aggada One verse states: “For I have no pleasure in the death of him that dies, And one verse states, because the Lord desired to kill them” Here, where repent, there, where do not repent.
llm_translation: Three matters of Aggadah, one verse says (Ezekiel 18:32) "For I do not desire the death of the one who dies," and one verse says (1 Samuel 2:25) "But the Lord desired to kill them." Here, with those who repent, and here, with those who do not repent.

hebrew_text: כתוב אחד אומר (דברים י ) כי לא ישא פנים ולא יקח שוחד וכתוב אחד אומר (במדבר ו, כו) ישא ה' פניו אליך כאן קודם גזר דין כאן לאחר גזר דין
human_translation: One verse states: “For Who shows no favor nor takes graft” and one verse states: “The Lord shall show favor to you Here, before sentence there, after sentence
llm_translation: The text states: "One verse says (Deuteronomy 10): 'For the Lord your God is God of gods, and Lord of lords, the great God, mighty, and awesome, who does not show favoritism nor take bribes.' And another verse says (Numbers 6:26): 'The Lord lift up His countenance upon you.' Here, before judgment is decreed; here, after judgment is decreed."

hebrew_text: כתוב אחד אומר (תהלים קלב, יג) כי בחר ה' בציון וכתוב אחד אומר (ירמיהו לב, לא) כי על אפי ועל חמתי היתה העיר הזאת למן היום אשר בנו אותה עד היום הזה כאן קודם שנשא שלמה את בת פרעה כאן לאחר שנשא שלמה את בת פרעה
human_translation: One verse states: “For the Lord has chosen Zion; and one verse states: “For this city has been to Me a provocation of My anger and of My fury from the day that they built it until this day, Here, before Solomon married Pharaoh’s daughter there, after Solomon married Pharaoh’s daughter.
llm_translation: One verse says (Psalms 132:13) "For the Lord has chosen Zion," and another verse says (Jeremiah 32:31) "For this city has been to Me a cause of My anger and My wrath from the day that they built it until this day." Here, before Solomon married the daughter of Pharaoh, and here, after Solomon married the daughter of Pharaoh.

hebrew_text: שלשה דברי בורות אשתו של לוט מהו שתטמא אמר להם מת מטמא ואין נציב מלח מטמא
human_translation: three matters of ignorance What is the wife of Lot, she transmits ritual impurity said to them: A corpse transmits ritual impurity, but a pillar of salt, does not impart ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Three things regarding the pit of Lot's wife: What is the law if it becomes impure? He said to them: A dead person renders impure, but a pillar of salt does not render impure.

hebrew_text: בן שונמית מהו שיטמא אמר להן מת מטמא ואין חי מטמא
human_translation: What is the son of the Shunammite he transmits ritual impurity said to them: A corpse transmits ritual impurity, but a living does not transmit ritual impurity,
llm_translation: Son of Shunamit, what is the law regarding becoming impure? He said to them: A dead person imparts impurity, but a living person does not impart impurity.

hebrew_text: מתים לעתיד לבא צריכין הזאה שלישי ושביעי או אין צריכין אמר להן לכשיחיו נחכם להן איכא דאמרי לכשיבא משה רבינו עמהם
human_translation: the dead in the future, require sprinkling third and seventh or they not require said to them: When they come to life, we will be clever for them There are who say When Moses our teacher comes with them,
llm_translation: The dead in the future to come need purification on the third and seventh day, or do they not need? He said to them: "When they will be resurrected, a Sage will instruct them." Some say: "When Moses our teacher will come with them."

hebrew_text: שלשה דברי דרך ארץ מה יעשה אדם ויחכם אמר להן ירבה בישיבה וימעט בסחורה אמרו הרבה עשו כן ולא הועיל להם אלא יבקשו רחמים ממי שהחכמה שלו שנאמר (משלי ב, ו) כי ה' יתן חכמה מפיו דעת ותבונה
human_translation: three matters of behavior: What a person do to become wise? said to them: increase sitting and minimize in merchandise. said Many have done so, and did not help them Rather, they should pray for mercy from the One to Whom wisdom belongs, as it is stated: “For the Lord gives wisdom; out of His mouth comes knowledge and discernment”
llm_translation: Three things of the way of the world, what should a person do to become wise? He said to them: Increase in sitting and decrease in business. They said: Many have done so and it did not benefit them. Rather, they should seek mercy from the One to whom wisdom belongs, as it is stated (Proverbs 2:6): "For the Lord gives wisdom; from His mouth come knowledge and understanding."

hebrew_text: תני ר' חייא משל למלך בשר ודם שעשה סעודה לעבדיו ומשגר לאוהביו ממה שלפניו
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches a parable of a flesh-and-blood king who prepared a feast for his servants. but he sends of that is before him to those he loves.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Chiya gave a parable of a king of flesh and blood who made a feast for his servants and sent portions to his beloved ones from what was before him.

human_translation: what is teaching us that this, without that, does not suffice.
llm_translation: What is the teaching that it comes to tell us? That without this, it is not sufficient.

hebrew_text: מה יעשה אדם ויתעשר אמר להן ירבה בסחורה וישא ויתן באמונה אמרו לו הרבה עשו כן ולא הועילו אלא יבקש רחמים ממי שהעושר שלו שנאמר (חגי ב, ח) לי הכסף ולי הזהב
human_translation: What a person do to become wealthy? said to them: increase merchandise and conduct his business faithfully. said Many have done so, and did not help them Rather, they should pray for mercy from the One to Whom wealth belongs, as it is stated: “Mine is the silver, and Mine the gold,
llm_translation: "What should a person do to become wealthy?" He said to them, "Let him increase in trade and engage in it faithfully." They said to him, "Many have done so and it did not benefit them. Rather, let him seek mercy from the One to whom wealth belongs, as it is stated (Haggai 2:8), 'Mine is the silver and Mine is the gold.'"

human_translation: What a person do to have male children? said to them: marry a woman who is fit for him
llm_translation: What should a person do to have male children? He should marry a suitable woman.

human_translation: and sanctify himself at the time of sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: And he sanctified himself at the time of marital relations.

llm_translation: They said many did so and did not benefit, rather one should seek mercy from the One whose children they are, as it is stated (Psalms 127:3), "Behold, children are a heritage of the Lord, the fruit of the womb is a reward."

hebrew_text: מאי שכר פרי הבטן א"ר חמא ברבי חנינא בשכר שמשהין עצמן בבטן כדי שתזריע אשתו תחילה נותן לו הקב"ה שכר פרי הבטן
human_translation: What “The fruit of the womb is a reward” Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: In reward for withholding their in their belly in order their wives to emit seed first, the Holy One, Blessed be He, gives him the reward of the fruit of the womb,
llm_translation: What is the reward for the fruit of the womb? Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: As a reward for those who make themselves small in the womb so that his wife conceives first, the Holy One, blessed be He, gives him the reward of the fruit of the womb.

hebrew_text: בית שמאי אומרים [וכו'] מאי טעמייהו דבית שמאי אי נימא משום דכתיב (אסתר ד, ד) ותתחלחל המלכה ואמר רב מלמד שפרסה נדה הכא נמי אגב ביעתותא דמלאכא דמותא חזיא והאנן תנן שחרדה מסלקת את הדמים הא לא קשיא פחדא צמית ביעתותא מרפיא
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: What is the reason of Beit Shammai? If we say due to which is written: “Then the queen was exceedingly distressed [ vatitḥalḥal ]” And Rav said: teaches that she began to menstruate Here too, due to the fear of the Angel of Death she sees didn’t we learn that trepidation eliminates blood? This not difficult. Anxiety contracts fear relaxes
llm_translation: House of Shammai says etc. What is their reasoning? House of Shammai, if we say because it is written (Esther 4:4) "And Queen Esther was distressed," and Rav said: This teaches that she experienced menstrual impurity, here too, due to the fear of the angel of death, she saw blood. And we learned: Fear removes the blood. This is not difficult: Fear in the case of the angel of death is harmful, fear in other situations is beneficial.

hebrew_text: אלא הא דתנן ב"ש אומרים כל האנשים מתים זבין וב"ה אומרים אין זב אלא מי שמת זב
human_translation: But that which we learned Beit Shammai say: all men die zavim ; and Beit Hillel say: Only who died a zav a zav .
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: Beit Shammai say, "All men are considered zavim," and Beit Hillel say, "A person is not considered a zav unless he has emitted semen."

human_translation: I will apply here out of his flesh” but not due to circumstances beyond his control.
llm_translation: I will read here from his flesh and not from the compulsion.

hebrew_text: אלא טעמא דב"ש כדתניא בראשונה היו מטבילין כלים על גבי נדות מתות והיו נדות חיות מתביישות התקינו שיהו מטבילין על גבי כל הנשים מפני כבודן של נדות חיות
human_translation: Rather, the reason of Beit Shammai as it is taught At first they would immerse utensils by died menstruating, And the living menstruating women were embarrassed, instituted that one must immerse by all women, due to the honor of living menstruating women.
llm_translation: Rather, the reason of Beit Shammai, as it was taught: Initially, they would immerse vessels on the top of impure menstruating women and corpses, and the menstruating women who were alive would feel embarrassed. They instituted that one should immerse on the top of all women, out of respect for the dignity of menstruating women.

hebrew_text: בראשונה היו מטבילין על גבי זבין מתין והיו זבין חיין מתביישין התקינו שיהו מטבילין על גבי כל האנשים מפני כבודן של זבין חיים
human_translation: at first they would immerse zavin , who died, And the living zavin were embarrassed. instituted that one must immerse by all due to the honor of the living zavin .
llm_translation: In the beginning, they would immerse upon the backs of slaughtered animals, and the live animals would be embarrassed. They established that they should immerse upon the backs of all men, out of respect for the live animals.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האשה שמתה ויצאה ממנה רביעית דם מטמאה משום כתם ומטמאה באהל
human_translation: a woman who died, and a quarter of blood emerged from her transmits ritual impurity due to spot And it transmits impurity in a tent,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The woman who died and emitted from her a fourth of blood, she defiles due to a discharge, and she defiles in a tent.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר אינה מטמאה משום כתם מפני שנעקר משמתה ומודה רבי יהודה ביושבת על משבר ומתה ויצאה ממנה רביעית דם שהיא מטמאה משום כתם אמר רבי יוסי לפיכך אינה מטמאה באהל
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: does not transmit impurity due to spot because that was displaced after she died. And Rabbi Yehuda concedes in sitting on the travailing chair [ mashber ] and she died, and a quarter of blood emerged from her that transmits ritual impurity due to spot Rabbi Yosei said: For that does not transmit impurity in a tent,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: It does not render impure due to a stain, because it was uprooted from its source. And Rabbi Yehudah concedes regarding a woman sitting on a stool and dying, and a quarter log of blood came out of her, which renders impure due to a stain. Rabbi Yosei said: Therefore, it does not render impure in a tent.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מכלל דתנא קמא סבר אף על גב דנעקר דם משמתה מטמאה משום כתם
human_translation: By inference that the first tanna holds even though the blood was displaced after she died, it renders ritually impure due to spot.
llm_translation: Gemara: From the inference that the first Tanna holds that even though the blood has been uprooted from its source, it still imparts impurity due to a blemish.

hebrew_text: אמר (רבי) זעירי מקור מקומו טמא איכא בינייהו
human_translation: Rabbi Ze’eiri said: between place of source, is impure,
llm_translation: Said (Rabbi) Zeiri: "The source, its place is impure, there is a distinction between them."

hebrew_text: ומודה רבי יהודה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda concedes
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda concedes.

hebrew_text: מכלל דתנא קמא סבר באהל נמי מטמא אמר רב יהודה דם תבוסה איכא בינייהו
human_translation: By inference, that the first tanna , holds also transmits impurity in a tent. Rav Yehuda said: between blood of submission
llm_translation: From the inference of the first Tanna, he also holds that a tent can impart impurity. Rav Yehudah said: There is a distinction between them - the blood of a crushed insect.

hebrew_text: דתניא איזהו דם תבוסה פירש ר"א ברבי יהודה הרוג שיצא ממנו דם בין בחייו בין במותו ספק בחייו יצא ספק במותו יצא ספק בחייו ובמותו זהו דם תבוסה
human_translation: As it is taught What is blood of submission, Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yehuda, explained: killed, from whom blood emerged, while he was alive and after his death, uncertain emerged while he was alive uncertain it emerged after his death, uncertain while he was alive and after his death. That is blood of submission.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: What is considered "blood of trampling"? Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yehuda, explained: One who was fatally wounded, from whom blood emerged, whether in his lifetime or after his death, if there is doubt whether the blood emerged during his lifetime, he is considered to have emerged during his lifetime; if there is doubt whether the blood emerged after his death, he is considered to have emerged after his death. If there is doubt whether the blood emerged both during his lifetime and after his death, this is considered "blood of trampling."

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים ברה"י ספקו טמא ברה"ר ספקו טהור
human_translation: And the Rabbis say in a private domain uncertainty ritually impure, in a public domain uncertainty ritually pure.
llm_translation: And the sages say: "Regarding a Bar Hey, if there is doubt whether it is impure in a public domain, there is doubt whether it is pure."

hebrew_text: אלא איזהו דם תבוסה הרוג שיצא הימנו רביעית דם בחייו ובמותו ועדיין לא פסק ספק רובו בחייו ומיעוטו במותו ספק מיעוטו בחייו ורובו במותו זהו דם תבוסה
human_translation: Rather, what is blood of submission? killed from whom a quarter blood emerged while he was alive and after his death and has still not stopped uncertain the majority while he was alive and the minority after his death, uncertain the minority while he was alive and the majority after his death. That is blood of submission.
llm_translation: Rather, which is the blood of trampling? One who was fatally wounded, and a quarter of his blood exited from him, both in his life and in his death, and the doubt has not yet been resolved: whether the majority of it was in his life and the minority in his death, or the minority in his life and the majority in his death - this is the blood of trampling.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר הרוג שיצא ממנו רביעית דם והיה מוטל במטה ודמו מטפטף לגומא טמא מפני שהטפה של מיתה מעורבת בו וחכמים מטהרין מפני
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: killed from whom a quarter blood emerged, and he was lying in a bed and his blood was dripping into a hole is ritually impure, because the drop of death is mixed with it. And the Rabbis deem it ritually pure, because
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: If one who was killed had a quarter-log of blood emerge from him, and he was lying on a bed, and his blood was dripping to the ground, he is impure because the drip of death is mixed in with it. But the Sages declare him pure.

hebrew_text: שראשון ראשון נפסק שפיר קאמרי ליה רבנן לר' יהודה ר' יהודה לטעמיה דאמר אין דם מבטל דם
human_translation: first first separated The Rabbis are saying well to Rabbi Yehuda; Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he said: Blood does not nullify blood.
llm_translation: The first, the first, it was properly stated. The sages said to Rabbi Yehuda, "Rabbi Yehuda, according to your reasoning, for he said, 'One blood does not nullify another blood.'"

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר צלוב על העץ שדמו שותת לארץ ונמצא תחתיו רביעית דם טמא רבי יהודה מטהר שאני אומר טפה של מיתה עומדת לו על גב העץ
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: crucified on wood, whose blood runs to the earth, and a quarter of blood is found underneath him, ritually impure. Rabbi Yehuda deems ritually pure. As I say the drop of death remains on the wood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: If one crucifies on a tree and its blood drips to the ground, and a quarter-log of impure blood is found beneath it, Rabbi Yehuda declares it impure, for I say, a drop of death stands on top of the tree.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה נימא איהו לנפשיה שאני אומר טפה של מיתה עומדת על גב המטה שאני במטה דמחלחלה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, let him say to himself As I say the drop of death remains on the bed. of the bed is different, as seeps
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said: He himself said: I say, a drop of death stands on the bed, for I am on a bed that is shaking.

human_translation: Initially would say, who is observing of the blood of purity, she would pour water to the Paschal offering.
llm_translation: Mishnah: In the first Temple, they used to say, "The one who sits on blood was pure, the cave was filled with water for the Passover."

llm_translation: They returned to say: "Behold, she is like the touch of a ritually impure person to consecrated items," according to the words of Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai say: "Even like the impurity of a dead person."

llm_translation: Gemara: Ma'arah ein noge'et, lo elma cholim she'na'asu al tehorat hakodesh kekodesh damo.

llm_translation: Say the latter part: they returned to say, "Behold, it is like the touch of impurity of a corpse to holy items." For holy items, there is no reversion to common items, but for common items, there is. Thus, common items that were made in the manner of holy items are not considered like holy items.

hebrew_text: מתני' מני אבא שאול היא דתניא אבא שאול אומר טבול יום תחילה לקדש לטמא שנים ולפסול אחד
human_translation: Whose the mishna? It is Abba Shaul, as it is taught Abba Shaul says: one who immersed that day first- with regard to sacrificial that renders two impure, and disqualifies one
llm_translation: Mishnah: From where do we derive the ruling of Abba Shaul? As it was taught in a baraita: Abba Shaul says, "One who is a tevul yom initially sanctifies terumah to render two impure and disqualify one."

hebrew_text: ואם נפל מרוקה דתנן משקה טבול יום (משקין היוצאין ממנו) כמשקין הנוגע בהם ואלו ואלו אינן מטמאין חוץ ממשקה הזב שהוא אב הטומאה
human_translation: And if from her saliva as we learned liquids from one who immersed himself that day is like liquids that he touches. And these and those, do not transmit ritual impurity. except for liquids from a zav , who is a primary source of ritual impurity.
llm_translation: And if it fell from a ledge, as we learned: liquid that is of the status of a Tevul Yom (liquids that emerge from it) are like liquids that one touches, and both these and those do not render impure except for the liquid of a zav, which is the father of impurity.

hebrew_text: בית שמאי מאי בינייהו אמר רב קטינא טבול יום ארוך איכא בינייהו
human_translation: Beit Shammai What is between them, Rav Ketina said: between them one who immersed that day, a long
llm_translation: Beit Shammai, what is the difference between them? Rav Katina said: There is a long day of immersion between them.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרואה יום אחד עשר וטבלה לערב ומשמשה
human_translation: who sees eleventh day, she immersed evening, and engaged in intercourse
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who sees the eleventh day and immerses towards evening and uses it.

hebrew_text: ב"ש אומר מטמאין משכב ומושב וחייבין בקרבן
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: transmit impurity lying or sitting, And liable
llm_translation: Beit Shammai says: "They become impure through lying and sitting, and are obligated in a sacrifice."

hebrew_text: וב"ה אומרים פטורים מן הקרבן
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: they are exempt from the offering.
llm_translation: And the sages of the School of Hillel say: exempt from the offering.

hebrew_text: טבלה ביום של אחריו ושמשה את ביתה ואח"כ ראתה ב"ש אומרים מטמאין משכב ומושב ופטורין מן הקרבן
human_translation: immersed on the day following and she engaged in intercourse with her house, and then saw Beit Shammai say: They transmit impurity lying or sitting And they are exempt from the offering,
llm_translation: A table on the day after it, and he served her house, and afterwards Beit Shammai say: they defile through lying and sitting, and exempt from the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: וב"ה אומרים ה"ז גרגרן ומודים ברואה בתוך י"א יום וטבלה לערב ושמשה שמטמאין משכב ומושב וחייבין בקרבן
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: That is a glutton, And concede in sees in the midst of the eleven-day and she immersed in the evening and engaged in intercourse that they transmit impurity lying or sitting. And liable to offering
llm_translation: And the sages say: This is the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer. And they agree with him that a woman who sees blood within eleven days and immerses in the evening and waits until sunset, she renders impure both through lying and sitting, and she is obligated to bring a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: טבלה ביום של אחריו ושמשה ה"ז תרבות רעה ומגען ובעילתן תלויין
human_translation: immersed on the day following and engaged in intercourse that is wayward conduct, And they came into contact and their intercourse is contingent
llm_translation: Table on day of its after and its sun this increase evil and plague and their intercourse dependent

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר ושוין בטובלת לילה לזבה שאינה טבילה ושוין ברואה בתוך י"א יום וטבלה לערב ושמשה שמטמאה משכב ומושב וחייבין בקרבן
human_translation: The Sages taught And agree with regard to immersed night to zava , that it is not immersion. And agree with regard to who sees in the midst of eleven days but immersed in the evening and engaged in intercourse that she transmits impurity lying or sitting and are liable to offering.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: And they are equal in the case of a woman who immersed at night for a Zavah who is not required to immerse, and they are equal in the case of a woman who saw blood within eleven days and immersed in the evening, and the sun set, rendering her impure for lying and sitting, and they are obligated to bring a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: לא נחלקו אלא ביום י"א יום שב"ש אומרים מטמאין משכב ומושב וחייבין בקרבן ובית הלל פוטרין מקרבן
human_translation: They disagree only in eleventh day As Beit Shammai say: They transmit impurity lying or sitting and are liable to offering, and Beit Hillel deem exempt from offering.
llm_translation: They only disagreed on the eleventh day. The School of Shammai says: One becomes impure through lying and sitting, and is obligated in the offering. But the School of Hillel exempts from the offering.

hebrew_text: אמרו להן ב"ש לב"ה מ"ש יום י"א מיום תוך י"א אם שיוה לו לטומאה לא ישוה לו לקרבן
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: What the difference eleventh day day in the midst of eleven If you equate with regard to ritual impurity, not equate it with regard to an offering?
llm_translation: They said to Beit Shammai to Beit Hillel: "From the eleventh day onward, if it was fitting for impurity, it is not fitting for sacrifice."

hebrew_text: אמרו להן ב"ה לב"ש לא אם אמרת בתוך י"א יום שכן יום שלאחריו מצטרף עמו לזיבה תאמרו ביום י"א שאין יום שלאחריו שנצטרף עמו לזיבה
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: No, if you say in the midst of the eleven days, because the following day combines with it of ziva . Will you say with regard to eleventh day, when the following day does not combine with it of ziva ?
llm_translation: They said to Beit Hillel in the House of Study, "No, if you say within eleven days, that day and the day after it join together for the impurity of zav." You shall say on the eleventh day that there is no day after it that joins together for the impurity of zav.

hebrew_text: אמרו להם בית שמאי השוו מדותיכם אם שיוה לו לטומאה ישוה לו לקרבן ואם לא שיוה לו לקרבן לא ישוה לו לטומאה
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to Apply your method equally. If you equate with regard to ritual impurity, equate with regard to an offering. And if do not equate with regard to an offering, do not equate with regard to ritual impurity
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Shammai, "Equalize your measures: if it is fitting for him to become impure, make it fitting for him to bring a sacrifice; and if not fitting for him to bring a sacrifice, do not make it fitting for him to become impure."

hebrew_text: אמרו להם ב"ה אם הביאנוהו לידי טומאה להחמיר לא נביאהו לידי קרבן להקל
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to if we have brought to ritual impurity, to be stringent, we will not bring to an offering, to be lenient.
llm_translation: They said to them in the Beit Hamikdash, "If he brought it into a state of impurity, we do not bring it to the status of a sacrifice to be stringent; we bring it to the status of a sacrifice to be lenient."

hebrew_text: ועוד מדבריכם אתם נושכין שאתם אומרין טבלה יום שלאחריו ושמשה ואח"כ ראתה מטמא משכב ומושב ופטורה מן הקרבן אף אתם השוו מדותיכם אם שיוה לו לטומאה ישוה לו לקרבן
human_translation: And furthermore, from your statement you are refuted, as you say she immersed on the following day and engaged in intercourse, and afterward she saw she transmits impurity lying or sitting, but she is exempt from the offering. You too apply your method equally. If you equate with regard to ritual impurity, equate with regard to an offering.
llm_translation: And furthermore, from your words you are biting, for you say, "A table, a day after it, and then it saw, it becomes impure for lying and sitting, and exempt from the sacrifice." Also, you should compare your measures; if it is fitting for impurity, make it fitting for the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: ואם לא שיוה לו לקרבן לא ישוה לו לטומאה אלא להחמיר ולא להקל הכא נמי להחמיר ולא להקל
human_translation: And if you do not equate with regard to an offering, do not equate with regard to ritual impurity Rather, to be stringent, but not to be lenient. here too, to be stringent but not to be lenient.
llm_translation: And if not similar to him for offering not similar to him for impurity rather to be stringent and not to be lenient here also to be stringent and not to be lenient.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא משכבה ומושבה שבשני ב"ש מטמאין אע"פ שטבלה אע"פ שלא ראתה מאי טעמא כיון דאילו חזיא מטמאה השתא נמי מטמיא
human_translation: Rav Huna says, her lying or sitting, on the second Beit Shammai render impure even though she has immersed even though she did not see What is the reason? Since if she would see she render ritually impure now too she renders ritually impure
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The lying and sitting of Beit Shammai are impure, even though she immersed, even though she did not see. What is the reason? Since if she were to see, she would become impure, now too she imparts impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף מאי קמ"ל תנינא טבלה יום שלאחריו ושמשה את ביתה ואח"כ ראתה ב"ש אומרים מטמאה משכבות ומושבות ופטורה מן הקרבן
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is teaching us? We learn immersed on the day following and she engaged in intercourse with her house and then saw Beit Shammai say: They transmit impurity lying or sitting And they are exempt from the offering.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is the teaching that we learn from the Mishnah? A woman who immersed on the day following her menstrual period, and then had relations with her husband, and afterwards Beit Shammai say: She is impure regarding lying and sitting, but exempt from bringing a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא ראתה שאני
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: she saw is different,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: "Re'ata she'ani."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף וכי ראתה מאי הוי ראייה דנדה היא
human_translation: Rav Yosef said, And if she saw what of it? is a sighting of a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "And did she see? What is the proof that she is a niddah?"

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי לרב יוסף רב כהנא הכי קא קשיא ליה בשלמא היכא דראתה גזרינן ראייה דנדה אטו ראייה דזבה אלא היכא דלא ראתה מאי נגזר בה
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: This is what difficult for Rav Kahana: Granted, where she saw we decree a sighting of a menstruating woman due to a sighting of a zava . But where she did not see what decree upon her?
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Yosef: Rav Kahana thus posed a difficulty to him: Where we establish that she saw, we decree impurity due to the sighting of menstrual blood. But where she did not see, what is decreed upon her?

hebrew_text: ועוד תנן הרואה ראייה אחת של זוב ב"ש אומרים כשומרת יום כנגד יום ובה"א כבעל קרי
human_translation: And furthermore, we learned sees one sighting of ziva Beit Shammai say: like a woman who observes day for a day And Beit Hillel say: like who experiences a seminal emission,
llm_translation: And furthermore, we learned in a Mishnah: "One who sees one sighting of zov, Beit Shammai say: 'She should count one day as corresponding to one day,' and Beit Hillel say: 'Like a baal keri.'"

hebrew_text: ותניא המסיט את הראייה ב"ש אומרים תולין וב"ה מטהרין
human_translation: And it is taught moves the seen Beit Shammai say: contingent And Beit Hillel deem pure.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: "One who pushes off the evidence." Beit Shammai say: "We suspend," and Beit Hillel say: "We purify."

hebrew_text: משכבות ומושבות שבין ראייה ראשונה לראייה שנייה ב"ש תולין וב"ה מטהרין
human_translation: lying or sitting between the first sighting and the second sighting, Beit Shammai contingent and Beit Hillel deem pure.
llm_translation: Beds and seats between the first sighting and the second sighting, Beit Shammai say they are suspended, and Beit Hillel say they purify.

hebrew_text: וקתני רישא הרואה ראייה אחת של זוב ב"ש אומרים כשומרת יום כנגד יום אלמא שומרת יום כנגד יום לב"ש תולין
human_translation: is taught in the first clause sees one sighting of ziva , Beit Shammai say: like a woman who observes day for a day Apparently, according to Beit Shammai a woman who observes day for a day contingent
llm_translation: And it was taught in the beginning: One who sees one sighting of zov, Beit Shammai say: "She should observe one day corresponding to one day." It follows that she observes one day corresponding to one day. Beit Hillel suspend.

hebrew_text: לא תימא שומרת יום כנגד יום אלא אימא כבועל שומרת יום כנגד יום
human_translation: Do not say a woman who observes day for a day. Rather, say like one who engages in intercourse with a woman who observes day for a day
llm_translation: Do not say "Shomeret Yom" (observing one day) against another day, rather say "K'boel Shomeret Yom" (like one who has relations with a woman) against a day.

hebrew_text: מאי שנא איהו דלא מטמא משכב ומושב ומאי שנא איהי דמטמיא ליה
human_translation: What is different him, that he does not transmit impurity lying or sitting, and what is different her, that she transmit impurity to
llm_translation: What is the difference? That he does not become impure through lying and sitting, and what is the difference? That she makes him impure.

hebrew_text: איהו דלא שכיחי ביה דמים לא גזור ביה רבנן איהי דשכיחי בה דמים גזור בה רבנן
human_translation: him, as he does not frequently blood, the Sages did not issue a decree him her, as she does frequently blood, the Sages did issue a decree
llm_translation: He who is not common in it blood not decree in it sages she who is common in it blood decree in it sages

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא משכב ומושב דמטמיא ליה ומאי שנא בועל דלא מטמיא ליה
human_translation: And what is different lying or sitting, that she transmits impurity to them, and what is different one who engages in intercourse that she does not render him impure?
llm_translation: And what is the difference between lying down and sitting that makes him impure, and what is the difference with regard to intercourse that does not make him impure.

hebrew_text: משכב ומושב דשכיח מטמיא ליה בועל דלא שכיח לא מטמיא
human_translation: lying or sitting, she renders them ritually impure because she frequently one who engages in intercourse which is not frequent, not render him ritually impure.
llm_translation: Bed and seat, if common, make impure through contact; a husband, if not common, does not make impure.

hebrew_text: תנן טבלה יום שלאחריו ושמשה הרי זו תרבות רעה
human_translation: We learned immersed the day following and engaged in intercourse that is wayward conduct,
llm_translation: We have learned: a table that was immersed in a mikveh on the day following its immersion, and the sun that set - this is a bad practice.

hebrew_text: מגען ובעילתן תלויין מאי לאו דברי הכל היא
human_translation: they came into contact and their intercourse is contingent What, is it not all, agree
llm_translation: Touching and insertion are dependent - what, is it not the words of everyone?

hebrew_text: לא ב"ה היא דתניא אמר להם רבי יהודה לב"ה וכי לזו אתם קורין תרבות רעה והלא לא נתכוון זה אלא לבעול את הנדה נדה ס"ד
human_translation: No, this is Beit Hillel. As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said to Beit Hillel: Do you call this wayward conduct? But he intended only to engage in intercourse with a menstruating woman. enter your mind a menstruating woman?
llm_translation: It is not in the House of Study, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said to the House of Study, "And is this what you call a bad custom? Did he not intend only to have relations with the menstruant?" Menstruant, so it seems.

hebrew_text: אלא אימא לבעול את הזבה זבה ס"ד אלא אימא לבעול שומרת יום כנגד יום
human_translation: Rather, say to engage in intercourse with a zava . enter your mind a zava ? Rather, say to engage in intercourse with a woman who observes day for a day
llm_translation: Rather say, "To have relations with the menstruating woman is a severe prohibition." Rather say, "To have relations with the woman observing the days of her menstrual cycle corresponding to the days of her previous cycle."

hebrew_text: איתמר עשירי רבי יוחנן אמר עשירי כתשיעי מה תשיעי בעי שימור אף עשירי בעי שימור
human_translation: It was stated tenth Rav Yoḥanan says: tenth like ninth, just as ninth requires observance so too does tenth require observance
llm_translation: It was stated: On the ninth day of the month - Rabbi Yochanan said: On the ninth day of the month - just as the ninth day requires preservation, so too the tenth day requires preservation.

hebrew_text: ר"ל אמר עשירי כאחד עשר מה אחד עשר לא בעי שימור אף עשירי לא בעי שימור
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: tenth like eleventh Just as eleventh does not require observance so too tenth does not require observance
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: "The tenth is like the eleventh. Just as the eleventh does not require preservation, so too the tenth does not require preservation."

hebrew_text: איכא דמתני לה אהא אמר לו רבי אלעזר בן עזריה לר"ע אפי' אתה מרבה בשמן [בשמן] כל היום כולו איני שומע לך אלא חצי לוג שמן לתודה ורביעית יין לנזיר ואחד עשר יום שבין נדה לנדה הלכה למשה מסיני
human_translation: There are who teach with regard to this Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said to Rabbi Akiva: Even you amplify “in oil,” “in oil,” for the entire day, I not listen to you Rather, one-half of a log oil for thanks offering, and one-quarter wine for a nazirite, and eleven days that are between menstruation and menstruation a halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: There are some who teach it: "Ahah said to him, Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said to Rabbi Akiva, 'Even if you increase with oil all day long, I do not listen to you except for half a log of oil for the thanksgiving offering, a quarter of a log of wine for the Nazirite, and eleven days between one menstruation and another, the halakha is according to the tradition from Sinai.'"

hebrew_text: מאי הלכה ר' יוחנן אמר הלכה י"א ר"ל אומר הלכות אחד עשר
human_translation: What halakha Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha eleventh Reish Lakish says: halakhot eleventh.
llm_translation: What is the Halacha? Rabbi Yochanan said: The Halacha follows Rabbi Yehudah the Prince. Rabbi Levi says: The Halachot are eleven.

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר הלכה אחד עשר אחד עשר הוא דלא בעי שימור הא לאחריני עביד שימור ור"ל אמר הלכות אחד עשר לא אחד עשר בעי שימור ולא שימור לעשירי הוי
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says halakha eleventh. It is eleventh that does not require observance but for the other perform observance. And Reish Lakish says: halakhot eleventh. eleventh does not require observance, and it does not observance for the tenth
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha is eleven, eleven, that it does not require guarding. This is not like others, for others require guarding. And Rabbi Levi said: The halachot of eleven, eleven, require guarding, and not guarding for the rich.

hebrew_text: הני הלכות נינהו הני קראי נינהו דתניא יכול הרואה ג' ימים בתחילת נדה רצופים תהא זבה
human_translation: these halakhot these are verses. As it is taught might one who sees three consecutive days at the beginning of menstruation will be a zava
llm_translation: These are the laws, these are the verses. As it was taught: One might have thought that if a woman sees three consecutive days at the beginning of her menstrual period, she should be considered a zavah.

hebrew_text: ומה אני מקיים (ויקרא טו, יט) אשה כי תהיה זבה דם יהיה זובה ברואה יום אחד (אבל הרואה ג' ימים בתחילה תהיה זבה) תלמוד לומר
human_translation: And how do I realize if a woman has a flow, and her flow on her flesh be blood, to who sees one day. The verse states:
llm_translation: "And how do I fulfill (Leviticus 15:19) 'When a woman has a discharge, and the discharge in her flesh is blood, she shall be in her impurity for seven days; and whoever touches her shall be unclean until the evening.' (But if she sees for three days initially, she shall be in her impurity.) The Torah teaches to say:"

hebrew_text: (ויקרא טו, כה) בלא עת נדתה (על נדתה) סמוך לנדתה
human_translation: not in the time of her menstruation, close to menstruation,
llm_translation: "And he shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness during her menstrual impurity." (Leviticus 18:19)

hebrew_text: ואין לי אלא סמוך לנדתה מופלג לנדתה יום אחד מנין ת"ל (ויקרא טו, כה) או כי תזוב
human_translation: And I have only close to menstruation. From where one day separated from menstruation The verse states: “Or if she has a discharge
llm_translation: And I have only adjacent to her menstruation, separate to her menstruation one day, from where do I derive? The Torah teaches (Leviticus 15:25) "or if she has a discharge."

hebrew_text: אין לי אלא יום אחד מנין לרבות מופלג שנים שלשה ארבעה חמשה ששה ושבעה שמונה תשעה עשרה מנין
human_translation: I have only one day From where to include two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten separated from From where
llm_translation: I have only one day, how do I include others? Two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten - how do I include them?

hebrew_text: אמרת מה מצינו ברביעי שראוי לספירה וראוי לזיבה אף אני אביא העשירי שראוי לספירה וראוי לזיבה
human_translation: You say Just as we find on fourth that is fit for counting, and is fit for ziva , so too I will bring the tenth as is fit for counting and fit for ziva
llm_translation: You said, "What have we found regarding the fourth day that is fit for counting for purity and fit for discharge of impurity? I too will bring the tenth day that is fit for counting for purity and fit for discharge of impurity."

hebrew_text: ומנין לרבות אחד עשר ת"ל בלא עת נדתה יכול שאני מרבה אף שנים עשר אמרת לאו
human_translation: And from where to include eleventh The verse states: “Not in the time of her menstruation” might that I include even twelfth You say: No,
llm_translation: And from where do we derive to include eleven? The verse teaches "without her appointed time of separation." I might have thought to increase even to twelve. You said, "No."

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות אחד עשר ולהוציא שנים עשר מרבה אני אחד עשר שראוי לספירת או כי תזוב ומוציא אני י"ב שאין ראוי לספירת או כי תזוב
human_translation: And what did you see to include eleventh and to exclude twelfth I include eleventh as it is fit for counting “Or if she has a discharge and I exclude twelfth as it is not fit for counting “Or if she has a discharge
llm_translation: And what did you see to include eleven and to exclude twelve? I include eleven that are fit for counting or for a discharge, and I exclude twelve that are not fit for counting or for a discharge.

hebrew_text: אלמא קראי נינהו לר"ע קראי לר' אלעזר בן עזריה הלכתא
human_translation: Evidently, are verses According to Rabbi Akiva verses. According to Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya a halakha
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma karai ninhu l'Rabbi Akiva, karai l'Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah halakhta."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב שמעיה לר' אבא אימא ביממא תהוי זבה בליליא תהוי נדה א"ל עלך אמר קרא (ויקרא טו, כה) על נדתה סמוך לנדתה סמוך לנדתה אימת הוי בליליא וקא קרי לה זבה
human_translation: Rav Shemaya said to Rabbi Abba: say during the daytime she shall be a zava , at night she shall be a menstruating woman, said to him: With regard to your claim, the verse states: “Beyond the time of her menstruation” close to her menstruation. When is close to her menstruation? At night. And the calls her a zava .
llm_translation: Rav Shemaya said to Rabbi Abba: Say, during the day she is a Zavah, during the night she is a Niddah. He said to him: Upon you the verse says (Leviticus 15:25), "Upon her impurity, next to her impurity." Next to her impurity, when will it be at night, and the verse calls her a Zavah.

hebrew_text: תנא דבי אליהו כל השונה הלכות בכל יום מובטח לו שהוא בן העולם הבא שנאמר (חבקוק ג, ו) הליכות עולם לו אל תקרי הליכות אלא הלכות
human_translation: The school of Elijah taught: Anyone who studies halakhot every day is guaranteed that he is destined for the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “His ways [ halikhot ] are eternal” Do not read halikhot ; rather, halakhot .
llm_translation: Mishnaic teaching of the school of Elijah: Anyone who reviews halakhot every day is assured that he is a son of the World to Come, as it is stated (Habakkuk 3:6), "Eternal ways are his." Do not read it as "ways" (halikhot), but as "halakhot."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך תינוקת וסליקא לה מסכת נדה
llm_translation: The child returns to you, and the basket goes up with her from Tractate Niddah.
